title: Gilmore Sparks Colonels
description: DALLAS, Nov. 30 (AP) Artis Gilmore scored 32 points and hauled in 20 rebounds to lead the Kentucky Colonels to a 107102 victory over the Dallas Chaparrals tonight.

title: Paul Brown Shuns Past, Adopts New Enterprise
description: When Paul Brown coached in Cleveland, the Browns' rivalry with the Giants took its place among the great rivalries of historythe Montagues and the Capulets, Sherlock Holmes and Professor Moriarty, Popeye and Brutus, for example.

title: Business Briefs
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 30 (UPI)Four of the world's leading copperproducing nations neared agreement today on plans to create a special commission to defend their sales against aggression of multilateral corporations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WOLFSON ENTERS NOCONTEST PLEA
description: The sixyear case against Louis E. Wolfson, the financier, ended in Federal Court here yesterday when he changed his plea to nocontest on the charge of filing a false corporation financial statement.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 41 Become Firemen, First in 2 Years

title: PRESIDENT MEETS WITH JOINT CHIEFS ON TRUCE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Joint Chiefs of Staff reviewed the Southeast Asian situation with President Nixon today and told him, according to a wellplaced Administration official, that they supported the terms of the projected settlement in Indochina now being negotiated with North Vietnam and being urged on South Vietnam.

title: HUMPHREY IS NAMED FOR REFORM PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota has been nominated to head a Democratic party commission on selection of VicePresidential candidates.

title: Eubie Blake Rides Crest of Ragtime Revival at 89
description: Eubie Blake wrote the Charleston Rag in 1899, which means that he has had plenty of time to practice it prior to his solo concert at Alice Tully Hall at 8 P.M. on Sunday.

title: CUBA WOULD RESUME AIRLIFT OF REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)State Department officials said today that the airlift of refugees from Cuba to the United States will be resumed in the near future. He said the development had no significance in moves toward closer United StatesCuban relations.

title: Vanderbilt Five's Rally Downs Louisville, 6657
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 30 (UPI)Vanderbilt used its savvy and poise tonight to pull away from Louisville for a 6657 victory behind the 22point scoring of Terry Compton and the floor generaliship of Jan Van Breda Kolff.

title: Film: Eat the Document
description: Bob Dylan's career has taken so many twists and turns that Eat The Document, a 54minute film composed from footage made during Dylan's 1966 European tour, looks like a rock document left behind from some Pleistocene age of Pop. Not that the Dylan of today is all that different from the Dylan of 1966, when the poet of paranoia first shocked audiences with his new electric sound.

title: Connecticut Voids Victory Of Bristol Teachers Union
description: BRISTOL, Conn., Nov. 30 (UPI)  The Bristol Federation of Teachers has won a collective bargaining election, but state officials said they will not recognize it.

title: Goodyear Chairman Leaves Alcoa Board
description: Russell DeYoung, the chairman of the Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company, announced last night that he had resigned from the board of directors of the Aluminum Company of America.

title: OFFSHORE OIL FIND REPORTED BY SHELL
description: The Shell Oil Company announced yesterday that it had made an oil discovery in an area obtained in the Sept. 12 offshore Louisiana sale. The company said it was the first announced discovery from the sale.

title: Actress Cites Police Effort
description: Maureen Stapleton, star of The Secret Affairs of Mildred Wild, presented a plaque yesterday to the Police Department's Midtown Precinct North, 308 West 54th Street, in appreciation of its continuing efforts to upgrade the environment in which so many Equity members work and live.

title: Rail TonMileage Climbed By 10.9% for Last Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The association of American Railroads reported freight traffic on United States railroads last week was an estimated 13.9 billion tonmiles, 10.9 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Rail loadings in the same week totaled 459,183 cars, 12.4 per cent above last year.

title: 4 U.S. Aides and a Realty Man Indicted for Bribery in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30  Four employes of the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, including the acting deputy chief of its appraisal section here, were indicted today for taking bribes to inflate house appraisals.

title: Without Trains, No People, No Money
description: MERRICK, L. I., Nov. 30Abe Eisenberg stared down the counter of his empty candy store across the street from the deserted Long Island Rail Road station at 7:30 this morning and shook his head.

title: The Terms Amount to Surrender
description: HOUSTON  President Nixon has described the ceasefire terms, first reported by Hanoi radio on Oct. 25 and discussed by Mr. Kissinger at a press conference the following day, as peace with honor and not peace with surrender and as ushering in what he has called a generation of peace.

title: ELLSBERG JURORS FACE BIAS INQUIRY
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 30 After four months away from the courtroom, the jurors in the Pentagon papers trial will be questioned tomorrow about biases they may have developed since they were sworn on July 26.

title: Peace Corps Finally Posts First Triumph
description: Peace Corps of the Hobeau Farm is a steady going, modest moneyearner who had gathered together $49,966 this season without winning a race. Yesterday, Allen Jerkens, who trains for the Hobeau Farm, sent Peace Corps into the feature event at Aqueduct as the weaker half of an entry, whose main factor was Bill Boland.

title: Securities Industry Group Asks Merger of Exchanges
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 30 The Securities Industry Association proposed today that serious consideration be given to the merger of the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange, the nation's two largest securities markets.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: STEAMBOAT SPRINGS, Colo., Nov. 30 (UPI)Billy Kidd, the only American male in history to win a world championship in Alpine skiing, announced his retirement from racing today.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmospere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Coach Changes Schools
description: FLORENCE, Ala., Nov. 30 (AP)Mickey Andrews who guided Livingston, Ala., University to a 2372 record and a National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics national football title during his threeyear tenure, was named today head football coach and athletic director at Florence State University. He replaces Durrell Mock, who resigned after his team had a 29 wonlost record this year.

title: FILION REGISTERS FREEHOLD TRIPLE Fails in Westbury Night Bid Victory Total at 558
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 30Herve Filion, who brought home three winners at Freehold Raceway in the afternoon, owned a worldrecord singleseason total of 558 firsts as he went postward with Crain Hanover in tonight's feature mile trot at rainsoaked Roosevelt Raceway. The FrenchCanadian star wound up next to last with his 6yearold gelding in a $9,250 event, won in 2:08 15 by Trevor Hanover.

title: PEACE BID SHAKEN, ISRAEL WARNS U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 30Israel warned today that if the General Assembly adopted a resolution on the Middle East favoring the Arab nations, the result could be the destruction of the only agreed basis for United Nations peacemaking.

title: Prices on Amex and Counter Gain in Active Trading
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market rose yesterday in active trading.

title: Kuhn Broke Promise, Torre Says at Talks
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 30Joe Torre of the St. Louis Cardinals said today that Commissioner Bowie Kuhn had broken an agreement by disclosing details of the owners' offer to the players in their labor talks.

title: Damaged Ship Quits Alaska
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Nov. 30 (AP)The damaged Coast Guard Jarvis was under way from Alaska's Aleutian Islands today to Honolulu to undergo permanent repairs after striking a reef 15 days ago.

title: Bhutto Asks More Talks
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Friday, Dec. 1 (AP)President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto said yesterday that he wanted to continue reconciliation talks with India, but he swore revenge on those who accused Pakistan of weakness.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Admitting it had erred, the committee on interest and dividends rescinded today a ruling published yesterday that would have let corporations increase their dividend payouts in 1973 by more than the guideline increment of 4 per cent.

title: No U.S. Deaths Reported In Last Week in Indochina
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 1 (AP)The United States command reported yesterday that no American servicemen were killed in Indochina last week in either combat or accidents.

title: CRUSADERS LOSE TO NATIONALS, 32
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 30 (UPI)The Ottawa Nationals scored a 32 upset over the East Divisionleading Cleveland Crusaders tonight in a World Hockey Association game. The Nationals got their second victory in 48 hours as they outhustled and outhit a listless Cleveland club.

title: Curling Anyone?
description: New Jersey Sports

title: BOYCOTTERS CHEER ANKER ATA SCHOOL
description: Deputy Chancellor Irving Anker yesterday told an assembly of hundreds of parents who are boycotting schools in East Harlem that he would take their demands to Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner and the central Board of Education to see if additional funds could be found to restore budget cuts in the district.

title: Neilson's Injury Leaves Rangers' Defense Limping
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 30Jim Neilson entered the room on crutches, looking grim but not grievous.

title: BEAME QUESTIONS EDUCATION PARLEY
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame refused yesterday to pay $13,350 in bills for 200 people who attended an educational weekend conference in Tarrytown, N. Y., sponsored by the Community School Board of District 9 in the Bronx.

title: At Fashion Contest, Postmen Show They Know Their Stitches
description: Henry Ridges Jr. is a postman. Starting at 6 A.M., he delivers the mail, working out of the Times Square Post Office. Emanuel Braxton is a postal clerk. He sorts the mail at the Grand Central postal station.

title: An Opera and Its Source
description: It is not often that one can hear an opera and the play on which it is based in a doublebill performance, but the Cubiculo is providing that opportunity this week with its presentation of Francis Poulenc's La Voix Humaine and the Jean Cocteau play of the same name, which provided the text for the opera.

title: NEIL H. M'ELROY, EXDEFENSE AIR
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 30 (AP)Neil H. McElroy, Secretary of Defense during the Eisenhower Administration and former chairman of the board and president of the Procter & Gamble Company, died tonight of cancer. He was 63 years old.

title: Phillies Acquire Tovar And Send Lis to Twins
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 30 (UPI) Cesar Tovar, a peppery 150pounder who once played all nine positions in a single game for the Minnesota Twins, was dealt by them to the Philadelphia Phillies tonight, for an outfielder, Joe Lis, and two pitchers, Ken Sanders and Ken Reynolds.

title: Ford Fund Assays Its School Grants
description: A study of 25 educational experiments on which the Ford Foundation spent $30million has found that the size of the grant seemed to have little to do with ultimate success and that the program director was the most critical factor in success or failure.

title: KERES MOVES AHEAD IN CHESS MATCHES
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 30 (AP)Paul Keres, a Soviet grandmaster, stood in first place today prior to ninthround action in Church's international chess tournament here.

title: Clorox Sets Kingsford Deal
description: The Clorox Company yesterday agreed in principle to acquire the Kingsford Company, of Louisville, Ky., a maker of charcoal briquets and a nursing home operator. One Clorox common share would be exchanged for each 2.25 shares of Kingsford common.

title: Three in Wales Die in Fall
description: SWANSEA, Wales, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Three men fell 80 feet to their deaths near here today when a gantry on which they were working partially collapsed. The accident happened at Esso's oil refinery at Milford Haven.

title: British Said to Reject Truce
description: BELFAST, Nov. 30 (UPI)A senior officer of the militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army said today that his men bad decided to use rockets against British Army posts after the British Government had ignored a ceasefire offer.

title: Gottlieb's Vital Images Shown at Marlborough
description: This may well be my last show, said Adolph Gottlieb who is having his first New York exhibition in five years at the Marlborough Gallery, 41 East 57th Street. One of the founders of the New York School that made abstract expressionism an international style, the 69yearold artist suffered a stroke last year and was left semiparalyzed and confined to a wheelchair.

title: George Mitchell Says He'd Seek Party Post
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 30 (AP)George J. Mitchell, a lawyer here, said tonight that he would actively seek the post of National Democratic Chairman if a vacancy occurs.

title: Allied Chemical to Expand
description: The Allied Chemical Corporation announced yesterday plans to double sodaash production to 2.2million tons a year at Green River, Wyo. The multimilliondollar expansion is scheduled for completion by early 1975.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: To troll, my Webster's says, is to roll, to wander, to drag about, to ramble; to wheel, to bowl, to trundle; to send about; to circulate as a vessel in drinking; to celebrate in song; to allure, entice, and, the province of this column, to fish by drawing the hook along or through the water as behind a boat.

title: Inflation Spurs Bank Rate Rise By France and West Germany
description: PARIS, Nov. 30 (Reuters)France and West Germany both announced today fresh increases in their discount rates making the French rate the highest in Europeas the fight against mounting inflation continued.

title: PeepShow King and 5 Others Are Seized as Bribers
description: The city's outgoing Commissioner of Investigation, Robert K. Ruskin, announced yesterday the arrest on bribery charges of a leading peepshow entrepreneur who has been linked by the police to organized crime.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 30 (AP)The Amateur Athletic Union announced tonight the names of 10 nominees for the Sullivan Award.

title: Part of the Piper Ransom Passed in Minnesota Banks
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 30 (UPI) Part of the $1million ransom paid for the release of Mrs. H. C. Piper Jr. last July was exchanged at banks in Minneapolis, Owatonna and Rochester, Minn., this week, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said today.

title: LATE BRUIN RUSH TOPS SABRES, 54
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)Johnny Bucyk and Don Marcotte scored goals in the last five minutes tonight to give the Boston Bruins a 54 victory over the Buffalo Sabres in a National Hockey League game.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 30 (UPI)The fire that killed four persons in a downtown building here yesterday could have been stopped if a water sprinkler system had been installed in the, building, the head of a Presidential commission on fire prevention said today.

title: Salvation Army's Citation Given to T. J. Watson Jr.
description: The Salvation Army Association of New York yesterday presented its 1972 Citation of Merit to Thomas J. Watson Jr., chairman of the executive committee of the board of directors of the International Business Machines Corporation, for his demonstrated belief that public service is not only a duty of an enlightened executive but a civic contribution essential to the health of private enterprise.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: British Petroleum Net Off in Quarter
News of Skiing
description: Mike Erickson, executive director of the United States Ski Association, has moved into the struggle to have more Federal land opened for recreational skiing. Skiing is attracting more enthusiasts each year, maintains Erickson, but the quality of our sport keeps decreasing. Why? Because facilities are becoming just too crowded.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 31Game Loss Streak Ends
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss., Nov. 30 (AP)  Towering Royce Woolever led the University of Southern Mississippi to its first victory in 32 games as the Golden Eagles downed Spring Hill 11182, tonight. Woolever, a 6foot10inch junior college transfer, had 25 points and 15 rebounds. The Golden Eagles lost their last six games two seasons ago, 24 in a row last season and their season opener this year.

title: KENNETH DURANT, TASS HEAD IN U.S.
description: JAMAICA, Vt., Nov. 30Kenneth Durant, the first correspondent in the United States for Tass, the Soviet press agency, and the manager of its American bureau from 1923 to 1944, died of a heart attack last night at his home here. He was 83 years old.

title: Gross Product in Canada Rose Slightly in Quarter
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 30 (Canadian Press)  The gross national product for the third quarter of this year rose slightly to an annual rate of $102.7billion from $102billion in the second quarter, Statistics Canada reported today.

title: Buses From L.I. to City
description: Following is a list of bus services available to Nassau and Suffolk County commuters to subway stops in Queens:

title: BIG BOARD SCANS OPPENHEIMER & CO.
description: The New York Stock Exchange was reported yesterday to be looking into the trading of shares of American Medical International, Inc., and the role of Oppenheimer & Co., a brokerage firm, in the sharp decline of the stock.

title: Rosner Says He Was Trapped Into Paying for GrandJury Minutes
description: Prosecution testimony was disputed repeatedly yesterday by Edmund A. Rosner, a lawyer, at his bribery trial on charges that he obtained secret documents from the criminal files of the United States Attorney's office.

title: Oilers Rally to Tie Jets
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 30 (UPI)The Alberta Oilers erased a threegoal deficit and battled the Winnipeg Jets to a 33 overtime tie tonight before a standingroom crowd of 5,200.

title: Strike Hurts Some Businesses; HotelRoom Reservations Rise
description: Small shops, restaurants, newsstands and banks in or near the Long Island Rail Road concourse, as well as elsewhere in Penn Station were adversely affected yesterday as a result of the railroad's shutdown.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  President Nixon's decision to keep William Rogers as Secretary of State in the second term seems to suggest that Dr. Henry Kissinger will remain in the White House as assistant to the President for national security affairs, but this is not, a settled question.

title: A U.N. UNIVERSITY GAINS IN KEY VOTE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 30  A, resolution calling for the establishment of a United Nations university, network of postgraduate research and training schools scattered around the world, was approved today by the General Assembly's Economy Committee.

title: Slayer of a Policeman Gets Prison Term Up to Life
description: Samuel Johnson, convicted on Oct. 25 of the murder of a New York City patrolman two years ago, was sentenced yesterday in the Bronx by State Supreme Court Justice Francis J. Bloustein to 25 years to life in prison.

title: Thieu Said to Draw Plans For a PostTruce Cabinet
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 30Political figures inside and outside the Government say that President Nguyen Van Thieu is forging plans for major changes in his Cabinet, based on the conviction that a ceasefire will come to Vietnam soon.

title: Dance: 4 by Paul Taylor
description: The Paul Taylor Dance Company's current engagement at the Brooklyn Academy of Music is marked by remarkably good programing. There is a balance of the old and new, the light and dark and of good with good.

title: 433 Hogs Are Slaughtered in Drive to Prevent the Spread of Cholera
description: NEW JERSEY

title: Credit Markets
description: Demand by investors for the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's $350million debenture offering, after some initial hesitation, built to the point where 85 to 90 per cent was reported placed by midafternoon yesterday.

title: Both Sides Acknowledge Strike May Not End Soon
description: Negotiators for the Long Island Rail Road and its 5,000 striking employes explored possible areas of compromise in their dispute yesterday, but acknowledged that they were still far apart.

title: BACH'S FLUTE MUSIC PLAYED BY KRABER
description: Bach wrote a great deal of music for the flute (or flauto traverso, its baroque ancestor), but most of it is tucked away In larger, usually vocal, works and not especially suited for recital performance. For his allBach Tully Hall program Wednesday night, Karl Kraber chose three of the six solo sonatas and as a welcome touch of variety tossed in three cantata arias and the complete Cantata No. 209, all of them with prominent parts for the flute.

title: Personalities: Yes, Virginia, He's Been Here
description: Santa Claus has arrived a little early this year for Earl Ellis, swimming coach at the University of Washington.

title: Rodriguez's 65 Leads by a Shot
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Nov. 30  Juan (Chi Chi) Rodriguez, one of the smallest golfers on the pro tour, equaled the course record of 65 today as he led the $150,000 Walt Disney open field in the rain.

title: Court Ejects School Team
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 30 (UPI)  The State Supreme Court ordered Tulsa Washington out of the Class AAAA high school football playoffs today and reinstated Muskogee Central in a game with Tulsa Hale. After the Oklahoma Secondary Schools Activities Association ruled that Washington forfeited its games because it used an ineligible player, a Tulsa district judge had overturned the association's ruling.

title: GUSTAVE F. SODERLUND
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Nov. 30 (AP)Gustave F. Soderlund, a composer and former professor of music theory and counterpoint at the University of Rochester's Eastman School of Music, died Tuesday at the Episcopal Church Home. He was 91 years old.

title: Vietcong Try to Popularize Possible Postwar Figures
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 30Recent Communist radio broadcasts have been mentioning the names of members of the National Liberation Front and Provisional Revolutionary Government of South Vietnam, apparently in a campaign to make them recognizable figures after a ceasefire, American analysts believe.

title: Union Official Retires
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (AP)Ralph Helstein, 64 years old, who was president of the United Packinghouse Workers of America from 1946 until its merger with the Amalgamated. Meat Cutters and Butcher. Workmen Union in 1968, retired today with the title of president emeritus. He had served as vice president and special counsel of the merged union.

title: WHEAT FUTURES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Wheat futures prices continued to rise yesterday, setting some new lifeofcontract highs. Again, there was talk of good export demand and the potential of a sizable purchase by India. It is expected that commercial buyers will take heavy deliveries of December delivery wheat to meet commitments.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Without Trains, No People, No Money
description: MERRICK, L. I., Nov. 30Abe Eisenberg stared down the counter of his empty candy store across the street From the deserted Long Island Rail Road station at 7:30 this morning and shook his head.

title: Lindgren Turns Pro
description: SPOKANE. Wash., Nov. 30 (UPI)The former Washington State distance star, Gerry Lindgren, confirmed today he had signed a professional contract with the International Track Association. Lindgren said his contract called for participation in 36 of the 50 meets scheduled in 1973 by the newly formed ITA.

title: City Starts Crime Building Inspections
description: Three sixman teams of city officials yesterday carried out rooftocellar inspections of five single  room  occupancy buildings designated by the police as centers of crime and addiction.

title: BRITAIN SLASHING AID FOR UGANDANS
description: LONDON, Nov. 30  Britain announced a series of measures today aimed at punishing President Idi Amin of Uganda for his recent expulsion of 20,000 Asians and, possibly, at deterring other African nations from doing the same thing.

title: Thieu Said to Draw Plans For a PostTruce Cabinet
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 30Political figures inside and outside the Government say that President Nguyen Van Thieu is forging plans for, major changes in his Cabinet, based on the conviction that a ceasefire will come to Vietnam soon.

title: Notes on People
description: The first American to orbit the earth, John H. Glenn, said he would try again to win a seat in the Senate from Ohio. Mr. Glenn, who orbited the earth 10 years ago and was defeated in a Democratic Senate primary two years ago, said he wanted to challenge Republican Senator William S. Saxbe in 1974. The 50yearold Mr. Glenn announced his intention in Jefferson City, Mo., where he was visiting the plant of a billiardtable company he serves as a board member. He described himself as a liberal Democrat who doesn't like to sit back and just let things go.

title: Mass Transit Plan for Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30Gov. Francis W. Sargent announced tonight a major new transportation policy designed to turn away from highway construction in favor of mass transit and commuter rail service.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: NEW JERSEY

title: Stars Down Rockets
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 30 (AP)Willie Wise and Glen Combs led the revitalized Utah Stars to a 11195 victory over the Denver Rockets tonight. Wise and Combs hit 21 points each as the Stars posted their second triumph in a row after losing nine out of 11.

title: L.I.R.R. COMMUTERS COPE WITH STRIKE BY SHIFT TO ROADS
description: Despite a strike on the Long Island Rail Road that began yesterday, 90,000 regular commuters made their way to the city with relatively little difficulty, primarily because so many of them had started out early.

title: 2 Lumber Companies Ordered By U.S. Panel to Reduce Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Price Commission, pursuing its drive to check rising lumber and plywood prices, announced today its strongest sanctions yet against a manufacturer of these products.

title: GARBAGE STRIKE IS AVERTED HERE
description: A strike by 2,100 private sanitation drivers that had been set for today was averted two hours before a midnight deadline last night when Teamsters Local 813 ratified a new threeyear contract.

title: DRY CLEANER SHUT, 200 SEEK CLOTHING
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz moved in State Supreme Court yesterday to assure 200 customers of a defunct West Side drycleaning establishment that they would get back thousands of dollars worth of clothing they had left for cleaning or storage.

title: Bread From Sweet Potatoes
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Nov. 30 (AP)Art Baker, an assistant for the last three years at Texas Tech, has accepted the head football coaching job at Furman University.

title: Dutch Left Proposes to Form a Cabinet
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Nov. 30 (AP)The leftwing alliance headed by the Labor party proposed a minority government for the Netherlands today after picking up four seats in yesterday's general election and reducing the previous Government coalition headed by the Christian Democrats to a onevote majority.

title: U.S. Aide Comments
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30A spokesman for the State Department, reacting to Foreign Minister Swaran Singh's speech, said today that as we have said previously, we are interested in improving relations with India.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISIt is five and a half years since Egypt broke off diplomatic relations with the United States during the disastrous sixday war with Israel, and the time is long overdue for a restoration of normal ambassadorial exchanges.

title: An Area West of Syracuse Scoured for Missing Coed
description: SENNETT, N. Y., Nov. 30 (AP)About three dozen state troopers today resumed an air and ground search of a secluded area 20 miles west of Syracuse for Karen Levy, a college coed missing for 20 days.

title: Autonomy for Each Sport Is Recommended in A.A.U.
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 30 (UPI) The law and legislation committee of the Amateur Athletic Union recommended today a proposal that would legalize sports autonomy within the organization. The proposal would provide legal status to separate committees governing sports under the A.A.U.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: About Pro Football
description: Two teams, the Miami Dolphins and Washington Redskins, have qualified for the eight playoff positions and another, the Oakland Raiders, can make it on Sunday with a victory over the San Diego Chargers. That game will be televised here, Channel 4 at 4 P.M., as will be the Giants' game in Cincinnati, Channel 2 at 1 P.M. The Jets are favored by 12 points in their game here against New Orleans. Here is a preview of all games with wonlosttied records in parantheses:

title: U.S. Aide Dies in Laos Crasb
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 30An American spokesman said today that Maj. Walter H. Trisco of Austin, Tex., an assist ant air attach of the United States Embassy who was based at Savannakhet, was killed Monday when the unarmed T28 aircraft he was flying crashed into the Mekong River He was on his way to pick up mail at the American air base at Nakhon Phanom across the Mekong River when his engine failed.

title: Saigon Asks Direct Talks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 30Tin Song, the quasiofficial Saigon newspaper, said today that South Vietnam and the Communists should begin negotiating directly and do away with gobetweens.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Nov. 30 (AP)Pancho Segura and Bobby Riggs led the advance of favorites today into the quarterfinals of the national senior hardcourt tennis championships. Segura, La Costa, Calif., seeded No. 1, breezed to a. 60, 61 victory over Alan Cheesebro of San Diego. Riggs, Newport Beach, Calif., No. 2, downed Bob Galloway of San Diego; 63, 64.

title: DMZ Report Is Denied
description: PARIS, Nov. 30North Vietnam's spokesman at the Vietnam talks here, Nguyen Thanh Le, today reiterated Hanoi's position that the demilitarized zone between North and South Vietnam had been established by the Geneva Accords of 1954 as a provisional military demarcation line and of no lasting political or territorial significance.

title: Advertising:
description: For its daylong conference on new products the New York chapter of the American Marketing Association had as its luncheon speaker William G. Salatich, president of Gillette North America. That's a company that sells $2million worth of products daily off the shelves of America and a company whose products are No. 1 in sales in 10 of 16 fields.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Busing: Unfair and Impractical

title: St. Nick's Six Triumphs
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 30 Charlie Brown, a defenseman, and Jake Turco, a wing, scored unassisted goals tonight in leading the St. Nick's Hockey Club to a 42 victory over Princeton at Baker Rink.

title: Paper Identifies 4 Nazis Said to Be in South America
description: LONDON, Friday, Dec. 1The Daily Express announced today the names of four senior Nazi officials it said were still living in South America along with Hitler's closest aide during World War II, Martin Bormann.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Gary Player of South Africa held off a strong challenge from John O'Leary of Ireland today to take the lead after two rounds of the Dunlop Masters golf tournament. Player shot a fiveunderpar 65 to complete his raininterrupted first round, then had a 68 for a 133 total.

title: Man in the News
description: The zest for organizing and struggling for benefits first came to Anthony F. D'Avanzo in 1940 while he was in the mountains of Montana, a transplanted Brooklynite building fences and chopping trees with the Civilian Conservation Corps. For 12 days he and a group of other teenage corpsmen were boxed in by a 21mile forest fire. After rescuers finally reached them and they returned to camp, their first meal was leftover beans and franks. They were unfit to eat, Mr. D'Avanzo recalls.

title: Fatal Mine May Reopen
description: BOISE, Idaho, Nov. 30 (AP)State Mine Inspector W. Carl Griner said today that the Sunshine Mine, scene of a fire that killed 91 miners last May, could be reopened. Mr. Griner said that the mine would be returned to operation by opening sections as they were deemed safe by a state mine inspector.

title: An Appraisal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The list of accomplishments of the Securities and Exchange Commission in, the 19 months that William J. Casey has been its chairman is long.

title: CONSOLIDATED FOODS IN ACCORD FOR LAMA
description: The Consolidated Foods Corporation agreed in principle yesterday to acquire the Tony Lama Company, Inc., a maker of handcrafted Westernstyle boots for men and boys in an exchange of stock valued at $18million.

title: PRESIDENT MEETS WITH JOINT CHIEFS ON TRUCE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Joint Chiefs of Staff reviewed the Southeast Asian situation with President Nixon today and told him, according to a wellplaced Administration official, that they supported the terms of the projected settlement in Indochina now being negotiated with North Vietnam and being urged on South Vietnam.

title: Helsinki Talks Continue
description: HELSINKI, Nov. 30 (Reuters) Talks among 34 nations designed to prepare the ground for a European security conference continued today, with Britain warning that she needed expectations of success before agreeing to attend such a meeting.

title: Michelangelo Monogram Found on Pieta
description: ROME, Nov. 30The Vatican announced today that a hitherto unknown monogram, or secret signature, of Michelangelo had been discovered during work to repair the vandalized Piet group.

title: Store Sales in City Trail U.S. Gains
description: Mrs. Ivi Tamm, wife of a New York architect, tried vainly yesterday morning to restrain the squeals of her two young children as they gaped at toys on the fifth floor of Macy's Herald Square.

title: Double Veto
description: Only twentyfour hours after denying that his postelection aim is to concentrate more power in the White House, President Nixon has by simple dictate undermined a law sweepingly passed by Congress over his veto. The 1972 Water Pollution Control Act not only authorized an outlay of $11 billion for waste treatment plants in fiscal 1973 and 1974; it expressly enjoined the Govern ment to allocate that sum of money, by fixed dates, according to a formula based on the varying needs of the fifty states.

title: Plea for Freedom
description: In common with almost every other public official, Governor Rockefeller has frequently felt aggrieved at specific newspaper accounts or editorial appraisals of his policies and actions. Yet, Mr. Rockefeller has remained faithful to the fundamental principle that a free press, however irritating and even occasionally unfair to those in positions of power, is indispensable to a free society.

title: Pistons Overcome Braves, 127 to 116; Lanier in Hospital
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30 (AP)The Detroit Pistons overcame a 16point deficit and the loss of their star center, Bob Lanier, tonight and defeated the Buffalo Braves, 127116, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Caso to Head County Chiefs
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Nov. 30 (AP)Ralph G. Casa, Nassau County Executive, was elected president of the New York State County Executives Association today, succeeding Louis V. Mills of Orange County. Edwin Crawford, Broome County Executive, was elected vice president, and John V. N. Klein, Suffolk County Executive, secretary.

title: Books of The Times
description: P. S. YOUR NOT LISTENING. By Eleanor Craig. 215 pages. Illustrated. Richard W. Baron. $5.95.

title: Adding Up Our School Days, GettingWhat?
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Last month seven Harvard colleagues and I published a research study which suggested that inequality in the schools was not a major cause of economic inequality among adults. Our book concluded that if we want to eliminate poverty in America we will have to make fundamental changes in our economic institutions rather than ask the schools to solve a problem for which they are largely unsuited.

title: LATE BRUIN RUSH TOPS SABRES, 54
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)Johnny Bucyk and Don Marcotte scored goals in the last five minutes tonight to give the Boston Bruins a 54 victory over the Buffalo Sabres in a National Hockey League game.

title: Phoenix Troupe Winning Fans for Stage on Campus
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Nov. 30 Thwack! clang! thwack! two figures carrying huge metal broadswirds lunge at each other, absorbing the fearsome blows with wooden shields. Fifty students nearby wince at the seeming reality of the battle.

title: Parking Area at Mitchel Proves More Elusive Than Seat on Bus
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 30 Finding the parking area at Mitchel Field presented more of a problem today than finding a seat on a bus as commuters who customarily use the Long Island Rail Road gathered here in predawn darkness to board express buses bound for the IND subway in Jamaica.

title: Racial Clash Described
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 30Crewmen from the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Kitty Hawk have told Navy investigators that the ship's captain had an open disagreement with his executive officer after racial violence broke out on the ship while she was at sea six weeks ago.

title: Military Justice Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30A study group on military justice said today that there was intentional and systematic discrimination against blacks in the military services and called for longterm reform, no matter what the cost.

title: Business Briefs
description: BUFFALO, N. Y., Nov. 30 (Reuters)The real United States gross national product will increase by more than 6 per cent in 1972 and will probably be as large in 1973. Harold C. Passer, Assistant Secretary of Commerce, said a speech to the Buffalo Chamber of Commerce here.

title: Decentralization: The Basics
description: New York City's school system opened under decentralization in the fall of 1970, following passage of a law in 1969 that divided the city into 31 local school boards.

title: Raw Farm Product Prices Up to Peak
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)Average prices for raw farm products rose 1 per cent to another record in the month ending Nov. 15 as wheat rose again to the highest level in nine years, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Japan's external reserves in November reached a record $18.4billion, an increase of $616million over a month ago, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: China to Buy Hino Trucks
description: TOKYO, Nov. 30 (UPI)Hino Motors, a leading auto maker in Japan, announced today receipt of an order from China for 533 fiveton trucks worth some $2.6million. The announcement said the shipment would be made between April and May next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Talk of the Coal Mines
description: FARMINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 30It's part of the miners' traditionyou know, why they are willing to go in the mines at all. When you go in the mines, if you can't walk out you expect someone to come get you out, dead or alive.

title: Porter Says U.S. Works for Stable Peace
description: PARIS, Nov. 30William J. Porter, the chief United States delegate to the Paris peace talks, affirmed to the Vietnamese Communist negotiators today that President Nixon intended to permit no avoidable delay in ending the war.

title: The Soil and Some of Its Fruits
description: Books of The Times

title: Fading Legend?
description: So long as he remained abroad, sending back a steady flow of instructions, manifestos and taped speeches to his hodgepodge following, Juan Pern was a powerful negative force in Argentine politics. No government in Buenos Aires, civilian or military, could rule effectively without support from the Peronists, who made up at least a third of the electorate.

title: Ancient Fez Still Breeds Morocco's Progress and Corruption
description: FEZ, Morocco, Nov. 10 Twelve former ministers and high civil servants are on trial in Rabat on charges of corruption. Half are Fassis, people born in this ancient political, religious and commercial center or descended from its families.

title: Shops Thrive on Sales of Review Copies of Books and Records
description: Authors and musicians hate them, record and book companies wink at them, pennypinching consumers love them.

title: Arthur Miller's Creation of World
description: Arthur Miller's new play, The Creation of the World and Other Business, which opened last night at the Shubert Theater, is a Biblically based parable concerned with good, evil and the human dilemma. It emerges as a victory of craft over artistry and of mind over matter. It is a play that wants to be taken seriously because it is dealing with serious moral subjects, and to be taken all the more seriously because it is dealing with those subjects in a seriocomic fashion.

title: 58 Europeans Expelled
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Nov. 30  President Idi Amin announced today the expulsion of 58 European missionaries and said he intended to go ahead with plans to Africanize the churches despite signs that many Ugandans would oppose the policy. However, he added that he would not throw the white missionaries out overnight.

title: PRICES ARE RAISED BY PAPER COMPANY
description: The International Paper Company announced yesterday that it would increase prices by an average of 1.09 per cent for kraft linerboard and semichemical corrugating medium, beginning today.

title: GLAMOUR ISSUES SHOW BUOYANCY
description: Glamour issues, market laggards during the bluechip rally of the last six weeks, took on a bouncier tone yesterday while ??eading stock averages showed only minor moves.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 910,000 common shares of Wells Fargo & Co. at $27 a share was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Merrill Lynch, Salomon Brothers and Dean Witter & Co. The bank holding company's when issued stock closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 27, up .

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 30Councilman Frank G. Megaro, who presented to the City Council the taxabatement resolution that was one of the first steps in the construction of the controversial highrise Kawaida Towers here, now says his political future depends on whether he can help kill the apartment building project.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Philosophical Differences Separate Baseball Parties, Club Owners Say
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 30Baseball owners said today that two philosophical differences stood between them and the players in their sweeping labor talks: The players want to become free agents after seven years in the big leagues and they want to submit all salary stalemates to binding arbitration.

title: Fernandez Recital Presents a Rarity: Music for 2 Cellos
description: One of the rarer combinations of instruments in recital turned up in Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night, when music for two cellos was played by Rodolfo and Barbara Fernandez. Mr. Fernandez, who teaches at Centenary College of Louisiana in Shreveport, and his wife demonstrated one thing at least, that two cellos make very engaging sonorities that, surprisingly, do not grow tiresome over a recital's length.

title: Me Too on Long Island
description: The misery inflicted on tens of thousands of commuters and Christmas shoppers by the strike of Long Island Rail Road shop employes and clerks is another shabby product of the me too spirit that has long bedeviled labor relations in both transportation and the municipal civil service.

title: Blue Boys Closes
description: Blue Boys, the Allan Knee play that opened at the Martinique Theater Wednesday, has ended its engagement after one performance. Neal Kenyon directed, Michael Carson produced.

title: Gov. Shapp Vetoes Pennsylvania Plan To Curb Abortions
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 30  Gov. Milton J. Shapp vetoed today a bill that opponents said had embodied the toughest restrictions on abortions in the nation.

title: TB IN ADDICTS FOUND OUTSIDE THE LUNGS
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (AP)Tuberculosis in parts of the body other than the lungs is being seen in heroin addicts, a New York medical researcher reported today.

title: OPPONENTS TO SHARE QUEENS G.O.P. HELM
description: The Republican party will have leaders of opposing factions in its two highest posts in Queens as the result of elections held there last night. (Meanwhile, the Conservative party elected a new county leader in Brooklyn.

title: In Tokyo Aside, Lindsay Spurs Investment Here
description: TOKYO, Nov. 30  Mayor Lindsay has been promoting Japanese investment in business in New York City while attending a conference here of the Mayors of London, Moscow, New York, Paris and Tokyo.

title: S.E.C. Testimony Sought
description: Beverley C. Moore, an attorney and associate of Ralph Nader, filed suit yesterday against William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, for copies of the testimony of bank officers at a recent S.E.C. investigation into the difficulties of the Penn Central Transportation Company. He charged that the banks, the Chase Manhattan, Morgan Guaranty and Continental Illinois, sold Penn Central stock before the public was informed of the company's financial condition.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE VAMPIRE OF CURITIBA AND OTHER STORIES. By Dalton Trevisan. Translated from the Portuguese by Gregory Rabassa. 268 pages. Knopf. $7.95.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 1.4 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 127.9 from 126.5 last week.

title: Sports of The Times
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov.30In the distance, the top of the Empire State Building towered above the plateau where North Bergen and Jersey City perch. But here, swaying in a chilling breeze under a gray sky, the brown reeds of the marshes were taller than Kareem AbdulJabbar, and slightly thinner. Near the edge of the marshes, a small platform, draped in red, white and blue bunting, had been erected for the dignitaries. The occasion was the groundbreaking ceremonies today for the New Jersey Sports Complex, but once again imagination had lost to practicality. Had they had it 50 feet deeper into the marsh, it could have been the first waterbreaking ceremonies. If it had been on the site of either the proposed race track or the proposed football stadium, the dignitaries could have assembled on a raft. Gov. William T. Cahill could have used a pail instead of a spade. And the hecklers could have been detained behind a natural moat. But then again, New Jersey is part of the United States, although most New Yorkers usually think of it as out there with Wyoming some place, so the hecklers were tolerated.

title: Music
description: Mahler's Symphony No. 2, the stupendous fivemovement Resurrection, can lift a listener out of the here and now in any responsible performance. Played to the hilt, of course, feverishly at times and with the aching longing for lost Romantic innocence that Mahler poured into his greatest works, the Resurrection reaches planes inhabited only by a few inspired scores in our musical history.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: L.I.R.R. COMMUTERS COPE WITH STRIKE BY SHIFT TO ROADS
description: Despite a strike on the Long Island Rail Road that began yesterday, 90,000 regular commuters made their way to the city with relatively little difficulty, primarily because so many of them had started out early.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Asked today for reaction to the appointment of Peter J. Brennan as Secretary of Labor, the president of a fairly liberal A.F.L.C.I.O. union replied:

title: DEFICIT CUT SEEN BY TREASURY AIDE
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 30  Deputy Secretary of the Treasury Charts E. Walker said today that the current economic expansion had become so robust that the Federal budget deficit for the fiscal year 1973 would probably be smaller than previously expected.

title: DuoPiano Recital Given By Filgate and Bosworth
description: Filgate and Bosworth, a duopiano team from Ridgefield, Conn., created a prevailingly bland impression at their first New York recital Wednesday night at the New York Cultural Center.

title: Flames Tie Flyers, 55
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 (AP) Ray Comeau tied the score late in the third period tonight as the Atlanta Flames rallied and played a 55 deadlock with the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Quota Extension Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)  Representative Charles A. Vanik, Democrat of Ohio, asked President Nixon today to extend suspension of the meat import quota law for at least two years.

title: Releasing of 75 Mink Ruins Research Effort
description: PULLMAN, Wash., Nov. 30 (AP)More than two years of research into muscular dystrophy was destroyed when someone released a group of mink affected with the disease, Washington State University scientists reported today.

title: SchoolDecentralization Backers Dismayed by Clark's Criticism
description: Advocates of school decentralization here reacted with dismay and sadness to Dr. Kenneth B. Clark's announcement before the Temporary State Charter Revision Commission for New York City that he had become a vehement foe of decentralization.

title: Racial Clash Described
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 30Crewmen from the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Kitty Hawk have told Navy investigators that the ship's captain had an open disagreement with his executive officer after racial violence broke out on the ship while she was at sea six weeks ago.

title: Ball to Captain Brown Eleven
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 30 Brian Ball, a junior defensive tackle from Washington, has been elected captain of the 1973 Brown University football team. The announcement was made tonight at the annual team dinner sponsored by the Brown Football Association.

title: INDIA MAKES BID TO U.S. AND CHINA
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 30India today made her most conciliatory offer in years to improve her strained relations with the United States and with China.

title: TV: A Holiday Special for Children
description: With Christmas specials starting to zero in on television, it's only right that the toddlers should have something tasty of their own to nibble on this early. The answer is Santa Claus Is Coming to Town, a cute, perky bundle for the romper set.

title: East Germany Joins U.N. Parley in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Nov. 30United Nations history was made here today as East Germany participated in a conference sponsored by the world body.

title: Seales to Fight as Pro
description: TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 30 (UPI)The lightwelterweight, Ray Seales of Tacoma, only United States boxer to win a gold medal at this year's Olympic Games, will make his professional debut Jan. 11, Promoter George Yelton announced today. Yelton said Seales's opponent would be announced in about 10 days.

title: NURSING HOME FIRE IN ATLANTA KILLS 9
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 30 (AP) Nine persons died and 32 were injured in a fire today at a newly built home for the elderly. Panic, sleepiness and a dark, smokefilled hallway were among the factors that resulted in the deaths and injuries.

title: Dining Out: Museum of Jewish Fare
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: RESTRAINT ORDER ISSUED ON FUNDS
description: The Government won a 10day restraining order here yesterday to restrict the financial activities of four mutual funds run under the aegis of I.O.S., Ltd.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rain and Rail Strike Delay a Vote at U.N.
description: Rainy weather and a strike on the Long Island Rail Road caused the postponement yesterday of a scheduled vote on a United States proposal to cut its share of the United Nations budget from 31.5 per cent to 25 per cent.

title: Advertising:
description: Gabe Massimi, an expatriate ad man, is returning to his homeland in glorythat is, if being executive vice president and creative director of Clyne Maxon, Inc., is glory.

title: East German Sees Trade Obstacles
description: A high trade official from East Germany wound up a twoweek visit to the United States yesterday with a demand for an end to discriminatory practices against East Germany and its goods.

title: First RevenueSharing Checks Ready
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 30The heads of the nation's municipalities learned today that their first shares in the new Federal revenuesharing program would be placed in the mails on Dec. 8.

title: Michelangelo Monogram Found on Pieta
description: ROME, Nov. 30The Vatican announced today that a hitherto unknown monogram, or secret signature, of Michelangelo had been discovered during work to repair the vandalized Piet group.

title: OIL NATIONS BACK IRAQ ON SEIZURE
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 30Ending a twoday meeting, the 11member Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries voiced its support today of Iraq's nationalization of foreign oil operations. Delegates agreed to implement a resolution calling for member states to withhold sales of oil to the Iraq Petroleum Company whose operations in Iraq were nationalized last summer.

title: InterAmerican Center Names New Chairman
description: Emilio G. Collado, executive vice president and a director of the Exxon Corporation, was elected chairman of the Center for InterAmerican Relations, David Rockefeller, the center's honorary chairman, announced yesterday.

title: No. 2 in Indian Bureau Assails No. 1
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The secondranking official in the Bureau of Indian Affairs denounced his chief today as an incompetent administrator.

title: Hanukkah Party, With a Lesson
description: When a young woman in a red blouse smiled and asked, What's your very, very, very favorite Hanukkah song? wellbehaved firstgraders from the Ramaz Hebrew Day School raised their hands for permission to reply.

title: Drug Indictment Won by 5 Students
description: A Kings County grand jury yesterday indicted a wholesale drug company in Brooklyn on four counts of illegally selling dangerous drugs to an exporter of pharmaceuticals that was not licensed to receive them. Some of the pills involved reportedly wound up in Tokyo.

title: 3 Held as a Traffic Check Yields Marijuana in Truck
description: UTICA, N. Y., Nov. 30 (AP)A routine traffic check has led to the seizure of about 50 pounds of marijuana and the arrest of three young men, the city police reported.

title: GARBAGE STRIKE IS AVERTED HERE
description: A strike by 2,100 private sanitation drivers that had been set for today was averted two hours before a midnight deadline last night when Teamsters Local 813 ratified a new threeyear contract.

title: DOREEN MASKER, 52, FORMER BUNCHE AIDE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 30Mrs. Doreen Bolton Mashler, who as a personal assistant to the late Dr. Ralph J. Bunche participated in the United Nations peacemaking efforts in the Middle East, died last night in the New Rochelle Medical Center. She was 52 years old and had been on the United Nations staff from 1946 until 1962.

title: Vanderbilt Five's Rally Downs Louisville, 6657
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 30 (UPI)Vanderbilt used its savvy and poise tonight to pull away from Louisville for a 6657 victory behind the 22point scoring of Terry Compton and the floor generaliship of Jan Van Breda Kolff.

title: Lansky Back in Hospital
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 30 (AP) Meyer Lansky, 71 years old, reputed underworld financial genius, has been readmitted to Mount Sinai Hospital, suffering from a heart ailment. Hospital officials described his condition today as satisfactory.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30  A threejudge Federa court heard testimony today in a case that seeks to strike down a state law providing $19.5million in aid to nonpublic schools.

title: Rogers to Remain in Post; 3 New Aides Nominated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30President Nixon announced today that William P. Rogers would remain as Secretary of State to provide diplomatic continuity in the second Nixon Administration.

title: Jersey Model
description: New Jersey has passed a law to reduce flood damage which is at once so simple and so sensible that one can only wonder why so few states have adopted similar legislation. The bill, approved overwhelmingly by the legislature, would empower the state to limit, in whatever degree necessary, the development and use of lands subject to flooding.

title: Board of Estimate Rejects Yorkville Housing Project
description: A controversial $43million housing and school development proposed on the threeacre site of an abandoned city asphalt plant in Yorkville was killed yesterday by the Board of Estimate.

title: PROJECT IS KILLED AT YORKVILLE SITE
description: A controversial $43million, housing and school development proposed on the threeacre site of an abandoned city asphalt plant in Yorkville was killed yesterday by the Board of Estimate.

title: Rises to 5.2% for Week
description: The rate of growth in the nation's money supply, which has been decelerating this year, speeded up a little in the week ended Wednesday, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Einstein Letters Show the Physicist as Person
description: PRINCETON, N. J.  Albert Einstein's paper on the Special Theory of Relativity, which was published in 1905 and may have been the most important scientific publication of this century, was the very model of an impersonal scientific communication.

title: People and Business
description: David V. Picker, the 41yearold president of the United Artists Corporation, will get top billing at the big film distributor on Jan. 1 when he becomes chief executive officer. At the same time, Eric Pleskow, 48, now a vice president, will become executive vice president and take on Mr. Picker's previous title of chief operating officer.

title: INDIA MAKES BID TO U.S. AND CHINA
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 30India today made her most conciliatory offer in years to improve her strained relations with the United States and with China.

title: Aussies Stop French Bid
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Nov. 30 (AP)Favored Ken Rosewall and three fellow Australians halted the French raid on the Queensland lawn tennis championships today by scoring a quarterfinal sweep.

title: Rogers to Remain in Post; 3 New Aides Nominated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 President Nixon announced today that William P. Rogers would remain as Secretary of State to provide diplomatic continuity in the second Nixon Administration.

title: FINO'S HAT IN RING, BUT WHICH RING?
description: Supreme Court Justice Paul A. Fino said yesterday that he was available as a candidate for Mayor if the kingmakers fashioning a fusion New York City ticket for 1973 were truly interested in a lawandorder candidate.

title: Council Is Planned to Monitor the Press
description: The Twentieth Century Fund announced plans yesterday to create a 15member press council to monitor the performance of the national news media and investigate complaints by the public.

title: Charter Hearing, in Shift, Gives Top Billing to Public
description: The pace of the City Charter Revision Commission's hearings picked up perceptibly yesterday as members of the public  rather than politicians were given speaking priority.

title: SMITH OVERCOMES KODES BY 61,60
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Nov. 30 (AP)  Stan Smith, United States Davis Cup tennis star, trounced Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia, 61, 60, tonight and moved into the semifinals of the Commercial Union masters tournament.

title: Saravane Reported Hit
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 30 Communist forces reportedly launched an attack early today against Government positions around the town of Saravane in southern Laos.

title: CRUSADERS LOSE TO NATIONALS, 32
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 30 (UPI)The Ottawa Nationals scored a 32 upset over the East Divisionleading Cleveland Crusaders tonight in a World Hockey Association game. The Nationals got their second victory in 48 hours as they outhustled and outhit a listless Cleveland club.

title: Metropolitan Museum Acquires 13 Outstanding Medieval Ivories
description: The Metropolitan Museum has recently completed the acquisition of 13 outstanding medieval ivories that, scholars say, make the museum's collection one of the three best in the world.

title: Cambodian City Shelled
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 30 (Agence FrancePresse) Military sources reported today that North Vietnamese and Vietcong gunners shelled Komnong Cham, a province capital 70 miles northeast of Pnompenh, with heavy rockets, killing two students and wounding 20 civilians. Seven 122mm. rockets of Soviet make were said to have struck the center of the city.

title: An Earlier Bloodbath
description: The Nixon charge of a bloodbath in North Vietnam after the 1954 Geneva Conference has been widely debated but silence shrouds the bloodbath which did occur in the South at the time. This is curious and unfortunate, since the conditions which gave rise to the savage repressions of the Diem regime have persisted in Saigon and the peril of repetition is not small.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, electrical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: 2 Injured in Crash Of Congressional Train
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)The $7million subway train for the House of Representatives lost its brakes and crashed into a barrier at the end of its run tonight, injuring the operator and a passenger.

title: Emerson Is Seeded No. 1 In $75,000 Clean Air Tennis
description: Roy Emerson of Australia and Mrs. Nancy Richey Gunter of San Angelo, Tex., head the seedings for the $75,000 Clean Air Tennis Classic Dec. 4 through 10 at the Seventh Regiment Armory.

title: Blast in Rome Kills 15; Fireworks Are Blamed
description: ROME, Nov. 30 (AP)A powerful explosion in a clandestine fireworks factrory wrecked an eightfloor apartment house this morning, killing 15 persons and injuring 100, the police said. Five children were among the dead.

title: U. S. AGENCY REJECTS FOOD VENDER CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)  The Government backed down today on a proposal to curtail food sales at vending stands operated by blind persons in Federal buildings.

title: DR. JULIEN BENJAMIN;
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 30Dr. Julien E. Benjamin, a former vice president of the Family Welfare Association of America and the first president of the Cinccinnati Public Health Federation, died here yesterday at the age of 83.

title: LYNCH MAY CALL ELECTION ON I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 30  With election fever rising, Prime Minister John Lynch's Government struggled today to win approval in Parliament for sweeping powers to arrest and convict members of the outlawed Irish Republican Army.

title: Blood Feuds Plague a Yugoslav Province
description: PRISTINA, Yugoslavia, Nov. 23  An ancient bloodfeud tradition among Albanians, requiring a death for a death to uphold honor, is stubbornly resisting official sanctions in the autonomous Yugoslav province of Kosovo.

title: Addiction Agency Expanding Programs to Aid More on Drugs
description: Asserting that drug programs in the city have reached a point where it's harder to get people, Health Services Administrator Gordon Chase yesterday announced a steppedup effort to reach addicts on the street and refer them to treatment.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, Nov. 30 Governor Cahill broke ground today at the site of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority amid almost continual heckling by a group of local citizens who oppose construction of the $200million project.

title: Paperback on Bormann Commissioned by Bantam
description: Bantam Books, the paperback house, disclosed yesterday that it had commissioned William Stevenson, a Canadian journalist and author, to write a book about Martin Bormann, former aide to Hitler, and his background. It will be called The Bormann Brotherhood, to be published some time next year.

title: Ward Stars as Raiders Top Fighting Saints, 52
description: A defector from Czechoslovakia who carries around an EnglishCzechoslovak dictionary and a converted defenseman who leads the World Hockey Association in scoring provided some of the highlights last night as the New York Raiders routed the team from Minnesota nicknamed the Fighting Saints, 52.

title: COUGARS VICTORS OVER Q'S, 121108 Cunningham, Jones Direct 4thPeriod Comeback
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 30 (AP)  Billy Cunningham and Steve Jones led a fourthquarter surge that lifted the Carolina Cougars to a 121108 victory over the San Diego Conquistadors in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: REDDEN TO RESIGN; SCORES OFFICIALS
description: NEWARK, Nov. 30John L. Redden said today that he would resign as Police Director on Jan. 1 and return to the department in his permanent rank as deputy police chief because of increasing racial polarization caused by the Kawaida Towers housing project.

title: Guard in Jersey Accused Of a Threat to Kill Nixon
description: NEWARK, Nov. 30 (AP).A hospital security guard has been indicated on charges of threatening to kill President Nixon and of transporting a revolver from New Jersey to Georgia, the United States Attorney's office announced here today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today Dec. 1, 1972
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Market Place: Echoes of '69 For Natomas
description: Natomas, the company whose shares spurted ever higher in the 19681969 bull market, then slipped under a heavy shadow when the bears took over, may be beginning to pick up new support from speculators.

title: Sir Compton Mackenzie, Playwright, Is Dead at 89
description: Sir Compton Mackenzie, the novelist, playwright and biographer, died yesterday at his home in Edinburgh, Scotland. He was 89 years old.

title: J. & L. Steel to Close Plant
description: MARTINSBURG, W. Va., Nov. 30 (UPI)The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation announced today it was shutting down its limestone quarry near Millville, W. Va. on Dec. 31. The shutdown will result in the loss of jobs for about 55 hourly and salaried employes.

title: COUNTDOWN IS ON FOR LAST APOLLO
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 30The countdown for Apollo 17, the last countdown for an American moonlanding mission in this decade and for years beyond that, began this morning and was ticking away smoothly toward a launching, scheduled for next Wednesday night.

title: Redden to Resign Jan. 1; Scores Newark Officials
description: NEWARK, Nov. 30John L. Redden said today that he would resign as Police Director on Jan. 1 and return to the department in his permanent rank as deputy police chief because of increasing racial polarization caused by the Kawaida Towers housing project.

title: SYRIA WILL REOPEN BORDER WITH JORDAN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 30 Syria announced tonight that she would reopen her border with Jordan tomorrow in an effort to clear the Arab atmosphere and to enable the Jordanian Army to participate in the confrontation with Israel.

title: At a Needlework Class, Men Have a Lot to Learn
description: If the man next to you on the bus pulls out his needlepoint canvas and starts stitching away, don't look surprised. It may be Arthur. Kilcup, an advertising man turned needlepoint entrepreneur.

title: AntiSemitism Charges Irk Italian Reds
description: ROME, Nov. 30Charges of antiSemitism are irking and embarrassing the Italian Communist party, the strongest Marxist movement in the West.

title: BREZHNEY VOICES ROPE ON TROOP CUT
description: BUDAPEST, Nov. 30The Soviet Communist party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, spoke hopefully today of the prospect of the reduction of military forces in Europe, saying it was a natural consequence of the general political activity on the Continent.

title: Armco Steel Plans Revamping of Units Into 2 Major Parts
description: The Armco Steel Corporation announced yesterday at Middletown, Ohio, that effective Jan. 1, its various businesses would be organized into two major corporate groupings, each to be headed by an executive vice president. The organizational changes were approved at directors' meeting early yesterday.

title: To the Editor:
description: The election is over. The game has been played and a decision reached. The loser has conceded. The President won by a landslide. What more does he want?

title: CHANGES BACKED IN INDIAN BUREAU Bruce Replies to Criticism of Deputy Commissioner
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Louis R. Bruce, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, said today that the struggle of a few bureaucrats against inevitable change in the bureau only harms the Indian people.

title: Navy 6Point Choke Over Army in That Game Today
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 A chance of rain or snow and evenly matched teams going down to the wire again are the forecasts for the 73d ArmyNavy football game at John F. Kennedy Stadium tomorrow.

title: The Talk of Toronto
description: TORONTO, Nov. 15  For decades Toronto was the bleak outport on the northwest shore of Lake Ontario where people went to work hard, make money and pursue stern AngloSaxon virtues. In a word of recent vintage, it was Dullsville.

title: To the Editor:
description: President Nixon, speaking through surrogate Buchanan, revealed yet another side of his characterthat of the rotten winner.

title: Bulls Win in Overtime
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 1 (UPI) Bob Love scored 8 straight points in overtime tonight in leading the Chicago Bulls to a 10697 victory over the Kansas CityOmaha Kings.

title: Quest for the M.D.
description: Once again the annual competition for admission to medical school is under way on the nation's collegiate campuses, a competition fiercer than ever. A decade ago, three out of five applicants were admitted. Now for every freshman in medical school, there are two wouldbe M.D.'s who failed to be admitted. And all signs suggest that today's college seniors eyeing medical school face even worse odds than the Class of 1972 did. One result is that an increasing number of young Americans are attending medical school abroad; a recent report put the number of them in Mexico's University of Guadalajara alone at about 1,000.

title: MICHAEL GOODSON
description: Michael Goodson, since 1957 a partner in the investmentbanking house of Bear, Stearns & Co., died at Lenox Hill Hospital on Thursday. He Was 70 years old and lived at 945 Fifth Avenue.

title: Construction Outlay Made Slight Gain for October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Various Government agencies released a stream of economic statistics today, most of them at least moderately favorable.

title: Rosner Says Listening to Plan To Fix Case Was Polite Gesture
description: Edmund A Rosner testified at his bribery trial yesterday that politeness had prevented him from leaving a discussion that included plans to fix a narcotics case.

title: Field Marshal Ettore Bastico, North Africa Axis Leader, Dies
description: ROME, Dec. 1  Field Marshal Ettore Bastico, who was commander in chief of all Axis troops in North Africa from 1941 to 1943, died here today of heart failure. He was 96 years old and had been in retirement since 1947.

title: A Vote for Primaries
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Woman, 78, Living In Tiny Apartment, Leaves $3Million
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Dec. 1 A quiet, 78yearold spinster who lived in a tiny apartment in a declining residential section here left more than $3million when she died on Oct. 28.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., Dec. 1A trip to Florida in the middle of the winter is scheduled for the Bloomfield College basketball team.

title: Leningrad Presenting New Face to the West
description: LENINGRAD, Nov. 24Two and a half centuries after its founding by Peter the Great as Russia's window on Europe, this coldly beautiful imperial capital is once again striving to look outward on the rest of the world.

title: Celtics Squander a Lead Of 17 Points, Top 76ers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 (AP) Boston coasted to a 17point lead, then hung on for a 10599 National Basketball Association victory tonight over streakshooting Fred Carter and the lowly Philadelphia 76ers.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none.

title: Sill GAMBLING RING UNCOVERED IN RAID Policeman and Six Others SeizedYearly Take Put at $5Million
description: Two New York City policemen were credited yesterday with the breaking up of a major gambling ring on Staten Island that led to the arrest of a third policeman and six alleged gamblers who handled bets running into at least five million dollars a year, according to police sources.

title: To the Editor:
description: The attack on George McGovern as some kind of venomous slanderer began early on the apparent theory that if Richard Nixon, after four years of war, could be made a man of peace, anything was possible. For the White House to continue the attack nowafter the electionmakes it only too clear, alas, that Mr. Nixon is one of those Presidents to whom it is not enough to be reelected. He must also be loved.

title: U.S. Reports Major Advance In Controlling Nuclear Fusion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Atomic Energy Commission announced today a major advance in the long laboratory struggle to control nuclear fusionthe basic force of the hydrogen bomband turn it toward useful work.

title: Subcontinental Impasse
description: The United Nations has shrewdly averted an acrimonious debate over the divided Indian subcontinent by endorsing the arguments of both sidesthe IndianBengali plea for early admission of Bangladesh to the world organization and Pakistan's call for prompt return of prisoners of war. The effect is to toss the problem peace back to the parties themselves, denying them the luxury of using the world forum to score paints against each other while avoiding necessary compromises home.

title: A LutheranCatholic Unit For Cooperation Planned
description: GENEVA, Dec. 1 (UPI)Representatives of the Lutheran and Roman Catholic churches agreed today to establish a joint committee to discuss interfaith cooperation.

title: FOREIGN SERVICE FACING SHAKEUP Nixon Said to Want Younger Men in Top PostsSenior Aides May Be Retired
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1President Nixon has directed Secretary of State William P. Rogers to force the retirement or transfer of many senior officers in the State Department and in embassies abroad to allow the quicker promotion of younger Foreign Service officers, a White House official said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DETROIT, Dec. 1 (AP)Bill McPeak, coach of the Detroit Lions' offense, is being sought as a general manager for the St. Louis Cardinals of the National Football League. William V. Bidwell, owner of the Cards, has received, permission from the Lions' general manager, Russ Thomas, to talk to McPeak about the job.

title: Tea Chests and Ivory Fans
description: Books of The Times

title: Florida Moves to Reduce Pollution From Phosphates
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 1 (AP)Florida will ban the sale of laundry detergents with phosphate levels higher than 8.7 per cent beginning New Year's Day.

title: Louisiana Seeks U.S. Aid For Study of Transit Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) A coalition of Louisiana agencies asked the Federal Government today for $2.8million to find the best way of transporting people in the New. Orleans metropolitan area.

title: Honestous Scores by Neck; Wallis Rides 4 Winners
description: Honestous made her second traight trip to the winner's ircle at Aqueduct after she von the feature race yesterlay. The Wilrun Farm's filly, rained by Eddie Yowell, preailed by a neck over Hard tnd Fast of the Bwamazon arm, with Ferly third in the mile test for fillies and nares.

title: Protest in Arkansas
description: PINE BLUFF, Ark., Dec. 1 (UPI)More than 1,300 students boycotted classes at the predominantly black University of Arkansas campus here today protesting the refusal of four administration officials to resign.

title: De Sapio Released From Prison, Says He Has No Political Plans
description: Carmine G. De Sapio was released from Federal prison yesterday morning after serving the Maximum time on his twoyear sentence for bribery conspiracy.

title: MAURICE M. BECKES
description: FALMOUTH, Mass., Dec. 1Maurice M. Beckes, who retired in 1965 as an executive of the Mobil Oil Company in New York, died Tuesday in the Falmouth Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: U. S. Wins a Round in U. N. In Bid to Cut Assessment
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 1The United States won a crucial test today in its effort to lower its contribution to the United Nations' regular budget.

title: Market Place: Stock Turnover And Speculation
description: It's a rough barometer of speculation, but one in which many a market observer puts some faith.

title: Negotiator to Sign Pact in East Berlin In Brandt's Stead
description: BONN, Dec. 1The treaty to establish formal relations between West Germany and East Germany will be signed in East Berlin on Dec. 21, it was announced today, but not by Chancellor Willy Brandt.

title: UNICEF's 26th Year
description: Letters to the Editor

title: PRICE COMMISSION APPROVES RISES FOR G.M. AND FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Price Commission authorized the General Motors Corporation today to increase prices on cars and trucks by an average of $54, the full price rise the No. 1 auto maker had requested.

title: Computer Reads Aloud Producer of Artificial Talk Converts Printed English Into Synthetic Speech
