description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Computers can be taught to convert a printed English text into synthetic speech. Some day a surgeon about to perform an operation may be

title: MARK ANTON, 80
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Dec. 1 Mark Anton, former board chairman of the Suburban Propane Gas Corporation and a former New Jersey State Senator, died today in. St. Barnabas Medical Center, Livingston. He would have been 80 years old on Sunday.

title: South Vietnamese General and Six Others, Including Two Americans, Die in Plane Crash
description: SAIGON, Saturday, Dec. 2 (AP)A South Vietnamese general, four other Vietnamese and two United States officials were killed yesterday when a military plane taking them on a visit to refugee camps crashed on the central coast northeast of Saigon.

title: Music: Bells of Zlonice De Preist Conducts the Philharmonic in Rare Symphony No. 1 by Dvorak
description: The really unusual work on yesterday afternoon's New York Philharmonic program was the Symphony No. 1 in C minor by Dvork, the socalled Bells of Zlonice. In the program, under the work, was a little line: First performances in the United States? The question mark was the Philharmonic's.

title: Massachusetts Final Vote
description: BOSTON, Dec. 2 (UPI)Official tabulations released yesterday showed that Senator George McGovern carried Massachusetts by 220,462 votes, or 54.5 per cent, over President Nixon in the South Dakota Democrat's only state victory of the Presidential election. Mr. McGovern and Sargent Shriver, his runningmate received 1,332,540 votes to 1,112,078 for President Nixon and, Vice President Agnew.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Humble Oil Files Suit for Damages

title: Kosygin Turns Down Appeal on Emigration Tax by Humphrey Group in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1  A threeman Congressional delegation headed by Senator Hubert H. Humphrey was rebuffed here by Premicr Aleksei N. Kosygin yesterday when the visitors raised the issue of the Soviet emigration tax in the context of SovietAmerican trade.

title: OLD SPANISH PATIO IS RECITAL SETTING Yepes, Classical Guitarist, Plays at Metropolitan
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art has the laudable habit of moving its concerts out of its conventional Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium into the museum rooms. On Thursday night, it presented a guitar recital for the first time in the Velez Blanco Patio, with its structural segments from an early 15thcentury Spanish building. A high rectangular room, it has both the right ambiance for a program of classical Spanish guitar music and brilliantly resonant acoustics, which make evident the instrument's smallest

title: The Money's Out There for Herve Filion
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 1Outside, cold rain slanted into muddy puddles last night on the Roosevelt Raceway track. Inside, at the wooden card table in the drivers' room, Nerve Filion, his red, white and blue jacket glistening with rain and mud, was wiping his goggles between races.

title: Jets Bow to Nationals
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 1 (AP)Tom Simpson's first goal of the season, in the third period gave the Ottawa Nationals a 43 victory over the Winnipeg Jets tonight.

title: Florida Legislature Votes Death Penalty In Murder and Rape
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 1 (UPI)The Florida Legislature voted today to reinstate capital punishment for premeditated murder and child rape, becoming the first State to do so and inviting another hearing in the United States Supreme Court on whether the death sentence is cruel and unusual.

title: Staggered Distribution System For Welfare Checks Set by City
description: Jule M, Sugarman, the city's Human Resources Administrator, announced yesterday that on Jan. 2 the city would start distributing welfare checks on a staggering basis rather than on the first and 16th of the month only.

title: U.S. Steel Corp. Announces Changes in Executive Ranks
description: The United States Steel Corporation has named J. Tucker MacKenzie as vice presidentinternational. John B. French was elected to succeed Mr. MacKenzie as president of United States Stee International (New York), Inc., and United States Steel International, Ltd., the two exportsales subsidiaries. Mr. French had served for the last two years as vice presidentcommercial of United States Steel International, Inc. Both appointments were effective yesterday.

title: Big Board Chairman Says Amex Merger Lacks Priority
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 1James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Exchange, called today for the creation of two central markets in which all securities trading in the United States would occur.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of leading football games will be given at the end of the WQXR 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times or WQXR for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and the radio station.

title: NATO OBJECTIVES WORRY U.S. NAVY Submarines Called Peril to Control of the Atlantic
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 29 On its 25th anniversary, the Navy's Atlantic Command is taking a long and not particularly optimistic look at its commitments in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: U.S. Reports Major Advance In Controlling Nuclear Fusion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Atomic Energy Commission announced today a major advance in the long laboratory struggle to control nuclear fusionthe basic force of the hydrogen bomband turn it toward useful work.

title: India, Pakistan Free P.O.W's
description: WAGAH, India, Dec. 1 Amid music, garlands of flowers and tears of joy, Indian and Pakistani prisoners of war were exchanged today at this border post, 300 miles northwest of New Delhi.

title: NIXON DESIGNATES SHULTZ TO GUIDE ECONOMIC POLICY
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 1  President Nixon announced today that George P. Shultz would stay on as Secretary of the Treasury and would also assume the title and responsibilities of assistant to the President, at the head of a new Cabinetlevel Council on Economic Policy.

title: Hamilton Is Favored by 4 Over Regina for Grey Cup
description: HAMILTON, Ontario, Dec. 1 (UPI)  The Hamilton Tiger Cats, favored by 4 points, meet the Regina Rough Riders here Sunday in the Grey Cup game for the Canadian Football League title.

title: Cerro Is Owed $37,554,000 For Chile Copper Holding
description: Tlte Cerro Corporation said here yesterday it expected the Chilean Government to pay it $37;554,000 for copper properties nationalized in that nation.

title: Hanoi Defense Shift Seen As Discounting New Raids
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 1  American intelligence sources say that North Vietnam has shifted almost all its antiaircraft defenses to its southern sector, in what they interpret as an indication that Hanoi does not expect to provoke the United States into resumption of the bombing farther north.

title: Business Briefs.
description: LONDON, Dec. 1 (UPI)The dollar fell to an 11week low in West Germany today but climbed against a weak British pound on the London exchange market. In Continental markets, the dollar tended to lose a little ground but in early trading in Paris it inched higher.

title: Regnat Concert Postponed
description: Franoise Regnat, the pianist who was scheduled to give a recital Monday evening in the Young Concert Artists Series at the Hunter College Playhouse, is ill and will be unable to appear. Her recital has been postponed to March 11. Tickets will be honored on the later date.

title: G.O.P. National Chairman Says He Is Ready to Leave
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Senator Robert J. Dole, Republican of Kansas, said today that he was ready to step down as Republican national chairman when the party agreed on a successor.

title: Rockefeller's Plan On Courts in State Called Dangerous
description: Federal Judge Jack B. Weinstein declared his opposition yesterday to Governor Rockefeller's proposal to turn the administration of New York State's courts over to the executive branch as extremely dangerous violations of the American tradition of separation of powers.

title: Rogers Quickly Reciprocates India's Calls for Improving Chilled Relations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Secretary of State William P. Rogers, responding with unusual swiftness to calls by India for improved relations with the United States,, said today that the two countries should develop a sounder relationship based on understanding and respect for mutual interest.

title: Delaware and Ecology
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Letter to Mrs. Gandhi Is Handled With Care
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 1 (AP) The thick envelope was addressed to Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and carried stamps worth $1.30, much more than required. The sender had scrawled on the envelope that it was not to be opened without the Prime Minister's permission.

title: Equity Financing
description: Colony Kitchens, Inc., said yesterday it had filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a combination offer of 200,000 shares of common stock. The company operates restaurants primarily California and Arizona. It will offer 51,005 shares and the proceeds will be used to reduce longterm debt. The remaining shares will be offered by a nonaffiliated shareholder. Mitchum Jones & Templeton Inc. will manage the undbrwriting group.

title: To the Editor:
description: Restraint practiced by a public servant or a writer is the hallmark of disciplinethe moral discipline we all applaud.

title: President Sought Again By Vancouver Exchange
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Dec. 1 When Justice Thomas A. Dohm gave up his lifetime $40,000ayear post on the British Columbia Supreme Court to assume the presidency of the Vancouver Stock Exchane last January for a fiveyear contract worth $300,000, Canada's investment community was mildly agog.

title: 3 Held in RapeRobbery of Prostitutes
description: A detective and a patrolman for the Housing Authority and a retired fireman were charged yesterday in Brooklyn Criminal Court with raping and robbing two prostitutes in their Flatbush apartment seven weeks ago.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: County Chiefs Urge No Freeze in Aid

title: Simon Acquires a $3Million Raphael
description: A Raphael Madonna, considered by experts to be one of the most important of its kind in the world, has just been purchased by Norton Simon, the industrialist and art patron.

title: A's Send Epstein to Rangers; Scheinblum, Nelson to Reds
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 1 Baseball's annual business meeting ended tonight in a tide of trades that created the heaviest talent turnover in the game's history.

title: To the Editor:
description: Mr. Buchanan's piece is so full of inaccuracies, lies and truths warped to serve his purpose that the defense might well consider simply reading it to the jury and then resting its case. However, the jury may not remember, the facts.

title: To the Editor:
description: It will be interesting to note the yowling by the New Left about that beautiful article debunking the legend of George McGovern. Three rousing cheers for Mr. Buchanan.

title: LAUNDRY INDUSTRY IN TENTATIVE PACT Ratification Is Due TodayPrice Increases Slated
description: A strike by laundry workers was averted yesterday when industry negotiators representing 400 cleaning establishments reached a tentative settlement with the Joint Laundry Workers Board of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America.

title: Airliner Is Evacuated
description: WARWICK, R. I., Dec. 1 (AP) Fortyfour passengers aboard an Allegheny Airlines flight originating in Norfolk, Va., were evacuated from the aircraft when it landed at Green Airport here today after airline officials received a bomb threat. No bomb was found, and the DC9 was cleared for service and left for Washington.

title: Personalities: Out at Home Plate
description: Frank Robinson, the slugging outfielder who was traded Tuesday from the Los Dodgers to the California Angels, will have a 15day vacation from his job as manager of the Santurce Crabbers in the Puerto Rican Winter League. Robinson, often mentioned as a candidate for the role of first black manager in major league baseball, was suspended 15 days and fined $200 because of an incident at home plate with Umpire Tom Romanesko last Saturday. During an argument, Robinson allegedly stepped on Romanesko's shoes, spiking him, and removed the umpire's mask two times. Guigo Otero, the league president, said the suspension was imposed because Robinson stepped on Romanesko's shoes.

title: Author Says Argentina Jails Man Who Exposed Borman
description: LONDON, Dec. 2Ladislas Farago, the author who has said in a series of articles in The London Daily Express that he has definite proof that Martin Bormann is alive in South Amerka, said today in the final installment that the Argentine agent who helped him had been arrested.

title: TOO MANY SULLIVANS IN THIS UNIT, SOLDIER
description: ALBANY, Dec. 1The Rev. Arthur T. Sullivan is a 52yearold Catholic priest with a parish in West Seneca, N. Y., a Buffalo suburb. Michael T. Sul livan Jr. is a 43yearold Buffalo lawyer. Both are lieutenant colonels in Buffalobased National Guard units.

title: Defense Moves Bring New Delay of Ellsberg Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1Allegations that the Government has failed to comply with the court's orders for full disclosure of documents it plans to use in the prosecution of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. today caused a further delay in the Pentagon Papers trial.

title: Optimistic Reports on Vietnam Help to Spur Upturn
description: The stock market turned strong yesterday after three days of consolidation, sparked by optimistic reports that Vietnam ceasefire was near.

title: AUTO OUTPUT PASSES EIGHTMILLION MARK
description: DETROIT, Dec. 1 (AP)Auto production in the United States passed the 8 million mark last Monday, about a week earlier than in 1971, the trade paper, Automotive News, reports in its Dec. 4 issue.

title: A Link Is Found Between Two Major Cave Systems
description: CAVE CITY, Ky., Dec. 1Subterranean explorers announced today their discovery of a longsought link between two of the world's major cave systems, which stretch for 150 miles underground.

title: In Belfast: Tinsel, Tears and Hatreds
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 1Silver tinsel and Christmas decorations are draped behind window grates on Royal Avenue, the main street. British soldiers, trembling with cold, stand beside sandbag emplacements and wooden gates that block side streets. Helicopters whirr overhead.

title: MANILA FREES 15 SEIZED BY REGIME Links Action to Its Pledge of Open Debate on Charter
description: MANILA, Dec. 1The Government today released from detention 15 persons, including a senator, seven constitutional convention delegates and seven newsmen, who were rounded up after martial law was declared last Sept. 21 by President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: Tale of the Northport 5, Or, a CarPool Odyssey
description: It was 39 minutes until sunrise yesterday when Herb Greenberg, his large form hunched over the wheel, swung his gray, 1969 coupe out of the driveway of Mike Evall's home in East Northport, and turned toward New York City, 42 miles away.

title: Chaparrals Down Pacers
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 1 (AP) The Dallas Chaparrals opened a big lead in the third period tonight and ended the Indiana Pacers five  game winning streak with a 123117 victory.

title: MRS. PAVEL GROUEFF
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Dec. 1Mrs. Daphne Groueff, widow of Pavel Groueff, chief counselor to King Boris III of Bulgaria executed in a coup with all members of the Government in 1945, died yesterday in a convalescent home after a long illness. Her age was 79.

title: CALIFORNIAN PUSHES FOR DEMOCRATIC JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Charles T. Manatt, the Democratic party chairman in California, opened his campaign for the party's national chairmanship today, claiming support in Iowa, New Mexico and Tennessee as well as in his home state.

title: SOVIET SAID TO FREE LITVINOV GRANDSON
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1 (AP) Pavel M. Litvinov, the grandson of Stalin's Foreign Minister, Maxim M. Litvinov, has returned to Moscow after four years of exile in Siberia for protesting the Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia in 1968, sources among Soviet dissidents reported today.

title: In the Way Of Peace
description: LONDON, Dec. 1As Le Duc Tho and Henry Kissinger approach another round of talks, there are the most directly conflicting estimates of the prospect for agreement. Pessimistic reports from Paris say that the United States has attempted to reopen basic issues in the draft Vietnam peace terms published in October. But Washington officials, privately and publicly, gay they are extremely optimistic that a final settlement will be reached soon.

title: To the Editor:
description: When Mr. Buchanan chose the word slander to describe Senator McGovern's campaign statements about President Nixon and his Administration he chose a term which by definition implies falsehood in the Senator's remarks.

title: Sharks Defeat Cougars
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (AP)Thirdperiod goals by J.P. LeBlanc and Bart Crashley clinched a 53 victory for the Los Angeles Sharks over the Chicago Cougars tonight.

title: Garcia Challenges Marcel
description: PANAMA CITY, Dec. 1 (AP) Ernesto (Nato) Marcel predicted today he would knock out Enrique Garcia of Mexico, the challenger, within eight rounds of their scheduled 15round World Boxing Association featherweight title fight tomorrow night. It will be Marcel's first title defense since he won the W.B.A. version of the 126pound championship by outpointing Antonio Gomez last Aug. 19.

title: Frederick B. Smith Marries Mrs. Gane
description: NOROTON, Conn., Dec. 1 Mrs. Rebecca Torrey Gene of Darien and Frederick Bancroft Smith of West Redding were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Lawrence MacColl Horton of the Noroton Presbyterian Church performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Eric T. Lexow, friends of the couple.

title: AN AIDE OF HOOVER AT F.B.I. RETIRING Bishop, Who Has Served as Spokesman, Leaving at 55
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced today that Thomas E. Bishpp, who rose under the late T. Edgar Hoover to become assistant director in charge of the crime research division, would retire on Feb. 1.

title: Auto Strikes Threatened
description: Detroit, Dec. 1 (UPI)The United Auto Workers has served fiveday notices of intent to strike five General Motors assembly division plants next weekend, G. M. said today. The plants are in St. Louis, Kansas City, Mo., Wilmington, Del., Janesville, Wis., and Willow Run, Mich. All but the Willow Run plant have been shut down in the recent long weekend walkout over production standards.

title: Rumania's Revolt
description: The most adroit diplomacy in Eastern Europe in the last decade has been practiced by Rumania. A small country, with most of its borders touching the Soviet Union or countries obedient to Moscow, it has managed neverthelessby taking advantage of every opportunity that could be exploited without provoking Moscow to explosive reactionto win for Rumanians far more independence and selfdetermination than are enjoyed in any other small state yoked to the Warsaw Pact and its economic analogue, Comecon. The key tactic has always been to insist that agreements calling for the equality of nations and for unanimous decisions be upheld to the letter, though the Moscow drafters of these agreements had originally viewed this verbiage as mere camouflage for Soviet rule.

title: Nicklaus Leads With 136; Palmer's 146 Misses Cut
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Dec. 1Jack Nicklaus led after 36 holes al 136 in the $150,000 Walt Disney open tournament today as his golfing rival of the last decade, Arnold Palmer, was forced to bow out.

title: Grandmother's Old Knitting Bag Is Here Again
description: SHOP TALK

title: Iselin Named WNET Operations Vice President
description: John Jay Iselin has been appointed executive vice president of WNET/I3. The announcement was made by James Day, president of the New York public broadcasting station.

title: Bullets Down Rockets
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 1 (AP) Phil Chenier, Elvin Hayes and Mike Riordan combined for 76 points to lead the Baltimore Bullets to a 103.96 victory over the Houston Rockets. Chenier scored 27 points, Hayes 25 and Riordan 24.

title: Garcia Challenges Marcel
description: PANAMA CITY, Dec. 1 (AP) Ernesto (Nato) Marcel predicted today he would knock out Enrique Garcia of Mexico, the challenger, within eight rounds of their scheduled 15round World Boxing Association featherweight title fight tomorrow night. It will be Marcel's first title defense since he won the W.B.A. version of the 126pound championship by outpointing Antonio Gomez last Aug. 19.

title: KAWAIDA PICKETS RESTRICTED TO 200
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1A Superior Court judge placed limitations today on the number of pickets permitted at the site of Kawaida Towers, the controversial housing project in the predominantly ItalianAmerican North Ward, and on the language they could use.

title: Fla. State Wins, 10987
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 1 (AP)  Ron King, a senior, scored 24 points for Florida State tonight, leading the Seminoles to a 109.97 basketball victory over Georgia Southern.

title: U.S. Wins a Round in U.N. In Bid to Cut Assessment
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 1The United States won crucial test today in its effort to lower its contribution to the United Nations' regular budget.

title: RANGERS, SEALS PLAY TO A 33 TIE
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11The New York Rangers, who went west in search of first place in the National Hockey League East, wound up their trip with a frustrating 33 tic against the California Golden Seals tonight.

title: PreTeenAgers Who Thrive on Cooking Classes
description: Lillian and Rhonda, armed with a quartercup and a quarter  teaspoon measure, figured out how to measure ingredients for a batch of sweet potato biscuits. Jackie used a pair of scales as she weighed, cooked and sieved sweet potato for a cake. And George, with a drop of iodine, discovered there was starch in sweet potatoes.

title: Pistons Win on Late Shot
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 1 (AP)Stu Lantz Sank a pressure free throw in the, final three seconds tonight to give the Detroit Pistons a 114113 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: CubanSpanish Group in 1. O. S. Is Reported Pulling Out of Deal
description: MADRID, Dec. 1  A CubanSpanish group that bought a controlling Interest in Investors Overseas Services last October was understood tonight to have rescinded the transaction.

title: Art: Sparkling Vigor in Blaine Work
description: Nell Blaine, according to biographical notes in the brochure of her new exhibition at the Poindexter Gallery, 24 East 84th Street, went through the Hans Hofmann mill as a student in the early nineteenforties and worked for about 10 years in various forins of abstraction. Then her work from 1949 through 1953 gradually became more figurative and since 1955 has been created directly from nature.

title: Cincinnati's First Black Mayor Stresses Togetherness Theme
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 1Theodore M. Berry, 67 years old, became today the first black Mayor of Cincinnati.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 1  The first team of physical scientists and engineers from China to visit the United States in nearly 20 years came to Princeton University today to inspect some of the country's most prominent research facilities.

title: ATLANTIC RUN IS CUT BY JAPAN AIR LINES
description: TOKYO, Dec. 1Japan Air Lines announced today the suspension of its transAtlantic service linking London, New York and San Francisco beginning Dec. 6 and extending to March 31 next year. The action followed the crash of a Japanese airliner at the Moscow airport this week and subsequent strong Government and public criticism of the airline.

title: BANK AIDE CITED ON DRUG CHARGES Fiduciary Vice President and Wife Accused of Growing Seven Marijuana Plants
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 1 Peter Schuyler Alsop, 35yearold vice president of the Fiduciary Trust Company of New York, and his 29yearold wife, Susan, were indicted late yesterday by a Suffolk County grand jury on felony narcotics charges after seven marijuana plants were allegedly found growing in the garden of their summer estate.

title: French Bank Set in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1 (Agence France  Presse)  The Soviet Union has authorized the French bank, Credit Lyonnais, to open a branch for operations in Moscow, it was learned today. An informed source said the authorization was formally granted on Nov. 28 by the Soviet Central Bank following the visit here two months ago of Francois BlochLaine, president and manager general of the Credit Lyonnais, one of the big three nationalized French banks.

title: De Sapio Leaves Jail
description: Carmine G. De Sapio, the former leader of Tammany Hall, returned home here yesterday after serving a twoyear sentence for bribery conspiracy at the Federal prison camp in Allenwood, Pa. Details on Page 32.

title: Theater: Rock Musical
description: There is a new rock musical in town. It opened last night, officially, at the Villageast, which is the new odd name for the theater on Second Avenue that used to relish and relax in the name of the Fillmore East. The Fillmore East is no more, but the Villageast wishes to join the community.

title: 2 Detectives and 2 Patrolmen Dismissed for Taking Bribes
description: Two detectives and two patrolmen who were formerly detectives were dismissed from the city police force after departmental trials found them guilty of taking bribes from people involved in narcotics and policy operations, a police spokesman said last night.

title: Boycott Closes 13 East Harlem Schools
description: The East Harlem parents' boycott shut down 13 schools yesterday  one more than on Thursday  as Board of Education officials were reported ;attempting to work out a budget adjustment to make additional funds available to all school districts in the city.

title: DISTRICT 3 CHIEF QUITS SCHOOL POST First Puerto Rican to Direct Local Area to Leave Jan. 15
description: Alfredo Mathew Jr., who became the first Puerto Rican school superintendent in New York City when he assumed the superintendency of Manhattan's Community School District 3 two years ago, has resigned from the position after what he described as a period of profound soulsearching.

title: Business Briefs.
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame renewed his attack yesterday on the services that assign ratings of creditworthiness to bonds. In a letter to Moody's Investors Service, which retained its Baa1 rating on New York City for a $293.98million offering next Tuesday, Mr. Beame said it was an insult that the city's credit was not rated A.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 1 (AP)The Padres are threatening to leave San Diego unless financial arrangements involving the city improve. The National League baseball club angry over large advertising panels erected on each side of the San Diego Stadium scoreboard to promote products in direct conflict with the Padres' radio sponsors.

title: PINCHHIT METHOD STAYS UNCHANGED BatforPitcher Proposal Fails by Vote of 5 to 3
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 1  The American League gained support today in its campaign to get more hitting back into baseball, but still lost on a formal vote that would have allowed the freer use of pinchhitting.

title: Antiques Prices Rise for Ornate Russian Enamels
description: Carl Faberg, genius goldsmith that he was, noted for his understated enamels and bejeweled Easter eggs, could, when an aristocrat's commission so moved him, fashion Russian enamels in the Pan Slavic style, as bizarre and weightylooking as anything by his lesserknown contemporaries.

title: RUSSIANS ARE 123 IN CHESS TOURNEY
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 1 (AP) The threeman Russian delegation held or shared the top three places today as the Church's international chess tournament neared the twothirds mark in its 15round format.

title: Britain Urges a New Try at Reopening the Suez Canal
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1Britain today suggested a renewal of negotiating efforts toward reopening the Suez Canal.

title: Doctors Clear Apollo 17 Team; Strike Threat Worries NASA
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 1 The Apollo 17 astronauts received medical clearance today for their mission to the moon, the last of the Apollo series.

title: A Heroin Smuggler Chooses U.S. Prison Over the Guillotine
description: Christian David, the alleged kingpin of one of the world's largest heroinsmuggling rings, chose here yesterday to go to prison in the United States for narcotics trafficking rather than face the French guillotine for murder.

title: Heroin Smuggler Chooses U. S. Prison Over Guillotine
description: Christian David, the alleged kingpin of one or the world's largest heroinsmuggling rings, chose here yesterday to go to prison in the United States for narcotics trafficking rather than face the French guillotine for murder.

title: A.T.&T, WANTS RISE BORNE BY BUSINESS Submits Rate Proposals on $145Million Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The American Telephone and Telegraph Company said today that it wanted most of a planned $145million rate increase to be borne by its business customers.

title: Music Evening of Real Jazz Given at Town Hall
description: Any concert that chooses to call itself An Evening of Real Jazz seems to be asking for an argument since the jazz spectrum is so wide and the music's following is splintered into so many factions that each listener is bound to have a personal view of what constitutes the real thing. But, under the circumstances, the program presented at Town Hall on Thursday evening as a benefit for the Sickle Cell Disease Foundation of Greater New York managed to focus on such a broad middle ground that it could encompass most jazz followers' concept of reality.

title: Smoking in Aircraft
description: Letters to the Editor

title: U.S. IS CONTINUING TO PRESS SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The United States continued today to urge South Vietnam to agree to the Indochina settlement that the Administration believes will emerge in Paris after Henry A. Kissinger resumes negotiations with North Vietnam on Monday.

title: Braves Top SuperSonics
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 1 (AP) Randy Smith scored 27 points and Elmore Smith scored 20 and got 22 rebounds tonight as the Buffalo Braves beat the Seattle SuperSonics, 9390.

title: To the Editor:
description: Mr. Buchanan wrote: To those of us charged with working up the winter book; preliminary research arid early scouting reports  McGovern wasn't all that nice. The us implies he assisted in this research. As an interested taxpayer, I would like to know if Mr. Buchanan and associates did this work while on the Government payroll and if so, could he please explain why our tax dollars should support such political activities?

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1 (AP)The American Hockey League denied today a request by Nick Mileti, owner of the Cleveland Barons, to move the franchise to Lewiston, Me.

title: A Rothschild Who Is Dedicated to Mouton
description: PAULLIAC, FranceThe vast, bright room looks out through halfmoonshaped windows on the telling fields of the Medoc. Ranged along one wall, amid a profusion of plants, is a priceless collection of pictures and sculpture  Kandinsky, Braque, Brancusi, Lippold. In the corner, champagne cools in ice. There is scotch, gin, and a pitcher of tomato juice for those extraordinary Bloody Marys Americans seem to like.

title: U.C.L.A. CONQUERS BRADLEY BY 7338 Beats Slowdown Tactics Extends Streak to 47
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1 (AP) The University of California, Los Angeles, increased its basketball winning streak to 47 games tonight, burying Bradley, 7338.

title: Bucks Put Knicks To Rout, 100 to 74
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 1Lightning did not strike again to night as the Milwaukee Bucks routed the New York Knicks, 10074, before a capacity crowd of 10,746, all of them well aware of what had happened in New York 13 days before.

title: Antiaircraft Guns Set Up Briefly at Peron Home
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 1 Four antiaircraft guns were set up briefly this afternoon in the suburban neighborhood of Buenos Aires where Juan D. Pern, the controversial former Argentine President, is living.

title: Mr. Buchanan, Would You Step Outside and Say That, Please?
description: To the Editor:

title: Newcombe Halts Richey
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 1 (Reuters)John Newcombe of Australia made tremendous recovery in both sets for a 76, 64 victory over Cliff Richey, American star, in the semifinals of the Castle Lager tournament tonight.

title: Simon Acquires a $3Million Raphael
description: A Raphael Madonna, considered by experts to be one of the most important of its kind in the world, has just been purchased by Norton Simon, the industrialist and art patron.

title: Jones of Duke Voted Best
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Dec. 1 (UPI) Steve Jones of Duke, one of the best allround backs in college football, has been voted player of the year in the Atlantic Coast Conference. The 202pound senior led the A.C.C. in rushing with 112.4 yards game this season, punted for 41.3 average and was a good blocker.

title: Fighting Saints Turn Back Oilers on Big Finish, 6 to 4
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Dec. 1 (UPI)Minnesota's Fighting Saints erupted for three goals in the final period to defeat the Alberta Oilers, 64, tonight in the World Hockey Association.

title: Bus Strike in Duluth
description: DULUTH, Minn., Dec. 1 (AP) Union drivers and mechanics struck the Duluth public bus system early today, an hour after their contract expired. No talks have been scheduled.

title: Lane Bryant Sales Gain, Interstate Volume Drops
description: Lane Bryant, Inc., and Interstate Stores, two major New Yorkbased retail chains, reported yesterday a rise and a decline, respectively, in their November sales compared to the yearearlier month.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson said today he had accepted the resignation of Police Director John L. Redden and that he expected to name a new director for the 1,400member force before Jan. 1.

title: L.I.R.R. Talks Suspended; Queens Traffic Is Smooth
description: Ninety thousand commuters found less trouble getting in and out of the city yesterday than on Thursday when the strike against the Long Island Rail Road began. In the bargaining, both sides were described, as still far apart early today as negotiators suspended direct bargaining upon the advice of a Federal mediator who said they probably would not resume until Monday.

title: De Sapio Leaves Jail
description: Carmine G. De Sapio, the former leader of Tammany Hall, returned home here yesterday after serving a twoyear sentence for bribery conspiracy at the Federal prison camp in Allenwood, Pa. Details on Page 32.

title: Hanoi Defense Shift Seen As Discounting New Raids
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 1  American intelligence sources say that North Vietnam has shifted almost all its antiaircraft defenses to its southern sector, in what they interpret as an indication that Hanoi does not expect to provoke the United States into resumption of the bombing farther north.

title: Herbert Klein Criticizes Jailing of 2 Reporters
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Dec. 1 (AP)  Herbert G. Klein, the White House communications director, criticized today the jailing of two newsmen for refusing to disclose their sources and urged journalists to work to strengthen state laws protecting reporters' rights. The two reporters are Peter Bridge and William Farr.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE IN HEAVY TRADING Counter Stocks Also Make Gains as Index Adds 1:28
description: Prices increased in heavy trading on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market yesterday, for the second day after a temporary setback on Wednesday.

title: Canada Freezes Fund Assets
description: TORONTO, Dec. 1 (Canadian Press)The Ontario Securities Commission yesterday froze the assets of I.T.T. Fund, a mutual fund managed by a subsidiary of the Transglobal Financial Services, Ltd., part of the operations of I.O.S. Ltd., of Saint John, New Brunswick. The move had been sought by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Lakers'
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 1 (UPI)Herm Gilliam sank points in overtime tonight to lead the Atlanta Hawks to a 114109 victory over Los Angeles, breaking a 13game Laker winning streak.

title: Air Force Drops Effort To Oust Woman Captain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)The Air Force gave up its twoyear battle today to discharge Capt. Susan Struck, the unmarried nurse who appealed to the Supreme Court to block her dismissal for giving birth.

title: Merger News
description: The National Homes Corporation and Kaufman & Broad, Inc., two leading builders of low and moderatepriced housing, announced yesterday that they are engaged in preliminary merger discussions. If successful, the merger could produce a new leader in the housing field, surpassing Levitt & Sons in terms of dollar volume of the two merged concerns. Levitt, a subsidiary of I.T.T., is due to be divested in 1971.

title: Rockets Strike Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 1 (AP)Two rockets fired from wooden ramps a block away struck a Government building in downtown Pnompenh today, causing extensive damage. One person was Injured by flying glass.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DENVER, Dec. 1 (UPI)The first contingent of the. United States Alpine ski team has left for Val d'Isere, France, for the first round of the 1972 World Cup competition. Four men will compete in downhill and giant slalom Dec. 710 while five women will compete in slalom and giant slalorn.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: \TRENTON, Dec. 1A father whose son plunged from the George Washington Bridge while he was a patient at Greystone Park, the state's largest mental hospital, today told a legislative committee investigating suicides at the institution: Thank God he's in Heaven and not in that hell hole of Greystone.

title: Parent Back in Goal, As Blazers Triumph Over Whalers, 53
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 (AP) Johnny McKenzie and Bernie Parent shook off their injuries tonight to lead the Philadelphia Blazers to a 5.3 victory over the New England Whalers in a World Hockey Association contest.

title: Ibar Outpoints Rondon
description: MADRID, Dec. 1 (AP)Jose (Urtain) Manuel Ibar of the Basque region of Spain outpointed Vicente Rondon of Venezuela, former world lightheavyweight champion, in a 10round heavyweight bout tonight.

title: Federal Aid for Michigan
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 1 (AP)  President Nixon today declared nine Michigan counties a major disaster area in the wake of severe storms and flooding there last month. The action will make available Federal funds for relief and recovery in the affected area, which includes counties bordering Ginaw Bay and the Great Lakes id southern Michigan.

title: Antonio Segni, Former Premier And President of Italy, Is Dead
description: ROME, Dec. 1 (UPI)Former President Antonio Segni died today at the age of 81.

title: Arm in Arm
description: Letters to the Editor

title: United Way Set a Record With $910million in Year
description: New United Way symbol, left, will be used nationally. Local chapters, such as the United Fund of Greater New York, whose symbol is shown at the right, will still retain their local symbols.

title: 3 Top Pathet Lao Negotiators Leave Peace Talks in Vientiane
description: VIENTIANE, Lacis, Saturday, Dec. 2  Three members of the Pathet Lao delegation that arrived here eight weeks ago to negotiate a peace settlement with the Laotian Government left here for consultations today, apparently as the result of deadlock in the talks the three included the head of the delegation. Gen. Phoune Sipraseuth. With Laotian Government policemen checking all vehicles near the airport, the Pathet Lao leaders left aboard a Soviet Aeroflot flight for Hanoi enroute to the Pathet Lao capital at Sam Neua.

title: Guiomar Novaes Declines To Call It a Piano Finale
description: Guiomar Novaes, as legendary and beloved a pianist as we have today, is giving what is billed as her farewell New York recital tonight at Hunter College. At least, the publicity fliers and press releases call it a farewell. The Brazilian pianist herself seems to have different ideas.

title: NO. 1 U.S.C. MEETS NO. 10 IRISH TODAY Trojans Heavy Favorites in National TV Game
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1 (AP) Southern California and Notre Dame, both with potent multiple offenses, look to defense tomorrow in the 44th renewal of college football's biggest intersectional rivalry.

title: Patriots Activate Mathews
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 1 (AP)The New England Patriots activated today Henry Mathews, a rookie running back from Michigan State, for Sunday's National Football League game against the unbeaten Miami Dolphins. Mathews replaces Bob Gladieux, who was released this week.

title: FIREPROOFING SHIFT BLOCKED BY HOLDERS
description: General Fireproofing Company in Youngstown, Ohio, said yesterday that shareholders at a special meeting on Nov. 21 had turned down management's recommendation to change the company's state of incorporation from Ohio to Delaware.

title: To the Editor:
description: Presidential aide Buchanan is on dangerous ground when he breathes surrogated fire and smoke against the double standard of the national media. Has he forgotten the schizoid difference in Administration treatment of Calley and Lavelle as opposed to the Berrigans and the draft resisters? Now there is a double standard!

title: INQUIRY AFFIRMS SHOTGUN DEATHS Pellets Cited in Slaying of 2 Blacks on Campus
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 1 (UPI)A state commission conducting secret hearings on the slaying of two black students at Southern University here Nov. 16 has concluded that the youth were killed by shotgun blasts.

title: METALS IN HARBOR LINKED TO SEWAGE
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 1 (AP)Heavy metals found in sediments of the New Haven Harbor come mainly from municipal sewage treatment plants and not directly from industry, according to a Yale University study.

title: Rx for Democrats
description: Letters to the Editor

title: BERNETTA A. MILLER, A PIONEER IN FLYING
description: DOYLESTOWN, Pa., Dec. 1Bernetta Adams Miller, who I was the fifth American woman to receive a flying license, just nine years after the first successful flight by the Wright Brothers, died yesterday at the Doylestown Hospital. Her age was 88 and she lived in New Hope.

title: ADMISSION OF ARSON IS DENIED BY SAILOR
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 1 (UPI) Jeffrey G. Allison testified today that he never admitted to naval investigators that he set a fire that caused more than $7.5million damage to the attack carrier Forrestal last summer.

title: Organic Food Study Finds Pesticides
description: A survey of 55 organic food products showed pesticides more prevalent in them than in regular food, a New York State Agriculture and Markets Department official testified yesterday.

title: Thieu's Daughter and Fiance to Study at Pitt
description: JAMES F. CLARITY

title: A Talented Quintet Offers Wind Works Of the 20th Century
description: Though you would never guess it from the name, the Ars Cameralis Ensemble is a wind quintet composed of young performers who got together at the Juilliard School just last year. The five are Timothy Malosh (flute), Joel Marangella (oboe), George Hirner (clarinet), Lauren Goldstein (bassoon) and Joseph Anderer (French horn), and they are really good.

title: ALFRED W. GLASER
description: LANSDOWNE, Pa., Dec. 1Alfred W. Glaser, president and chief executive officer of Riggs Distler & Co., Inc. of Baltimore, mechanical and electrical contractors, died yesterday of cancer in the Delaware County Memorial Hospital, Drexel Hill. He was 75 years old.

title: State's 22 House Democrats Face Lack of Leadership With Celler Out
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The 22member delegation of Democrats from New York State in the House of Representatives, seldom a cohesive unit in the past, will have a leadership vacuum to contend with when the 93d Congress convenes on Jan. 3.

title: Manila Silent in Clashes
description: MANILA, Dec. 1 (AP)Authorities maintained silence to clay in the wake of continuing; reports of bloody clashes be tween Government troops and Moslem dissidents in the southern Philippines.

title: GREENWICH BAZAAR IS RICH IN ANTIQUES
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 1 Connecticut antiques shows are usually beguiling events, particularly for collectors of Early Americana, and the 15th annual Christmas bazaar, which ends here tomorrow, is running true to form.

title: Bridge: ControlShowing Responses To a Strong 2 Clubs Popular
description: For those who use two clubs as a strong artificial opening bidand they represent the majority in tournament playthere are three distinct methods of responding.

title: MRS. HAROLD INGRAHAM
description: SHARON, Conn., Dec. 1 Mrs. Martha L. Ingraham, widow of Harold O. C. Ingraham, who was president of the general chemical division of the Allied Chemical Corporation, died today at Sharon Hospital. Her age was 89.

title: Ohio State Five Bows
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 1 (AP)The University of Washington, led by the 16 points each of Ray Price, Louie Nelson and Reggie Ball, beat 10thranked Ohio State, 6763, tonight.

title: DUBLIN APPROVES I.R.A. CRACKDOWN AS BLASTS KILL 2
description: DUBLIN, Saturday, Dec. 2The Irish Parliament approved legislation cracking down on the Irish Republican Army last night, shortly after three explosions in the center of Dublin killed at least two people and injured more than 70.

title: NIXON HELP IS ASKED ON SOCIAL PROGRAMS
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 1The executive vice president of the American Jewish Committee warned the Nixon Administration today that unless it placed emphasis on improving social programs fragmentation, frustration and hopelessness will increase among the nation's minority groups.

title: S.E.C. IS ACCUSED OF A PBW DEAL Casey Denies Charge Made by Connecticut Official on Institutional Membership
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Securities and Exchange Commission was accused today of having made a secret deal to resolve the issue of institutional membership on stock exchanges in such a way as to bar them.

title: Kawaida Pickets Curbed On Number and Language
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1A Superior Court judge placed limitations today on the number of pickets permitted at the site of Kawaida Towers, the controversial housing project in the predominantly ItalianAmerican North Ward, and on the language they could use.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, electrical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: People and Business
description: Arthur K. Watson, who resigned as a director of the International Business Machines Corporation some two and a half years ago when he became Ambassador to France, is back on the board of the company founded by his father, Thomas J. Watson Sr. Arthur Watson, who is 53 years old, left the Paris post last August.

title: NIXON DESIGNATES SHULTZ TO GUIDE ECONOMIC POLICY
description: KEY BISCAYNE. Fla., Dec. 1  President Nixon announced today that George P. Shultz would stay on as Secretary of the Treasury and would also assume the title and responsibilities of assistant to the President, at the head of a new Cabinetlevel Council on Economic Policy.

title: Dear Injurious Physician
description: In 1957, pregnant with my first child, I told my doctor that I planned to breastfeed. You wouldn't make a good cow, he said. To his mind that settled the matter, for he gave me laxative that went straight to the milk and almost finished off my son.

title: Senator Curtis Marries
description: SAUSALITO, Calif., Dec. 1 (AP)Senator Carl T. Curtis, 67yearold Republican of Nebraska wed a Canadianborn nurse today at the Christ Epis copal Church. Both were previously married. Mrs. Curtis, 59, was divorced, and the Senalor's first wife died in 1970.

title: LINDSAY CUTTING BUDGET AT CITY U. Tells Governor Chancellor's Request Can't Be Met
description: Mayor Lindsay notified Governor Rockefeller in a letter yesterday that he was cutting the proposed 197374 City University budget by $20.2million because the city could not possibly finance the university at the level requested.

title: Four Corners Commission Declines to Widen Its Scope
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 1 (UPI)The Four Corners Regional Commission has tabled a motion that would have put the entire state of New Mexico under the commission's area of responsibility.

title: DYNAMICS LOSS UP FOR 9 MONTHS But Company Lists a Profit on Continuing Operations
description: The Dynamics Corporation of America, which has operated under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act since Aug. 2, 1972, reported yesterday a net loss of $6.97million for the first nine months of 1972 compared with a loss of $4.3mil lion for the period last year.

title: Nigeria Seeking Controlling Share in Rising Oil Output
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 29Sonic 1.9 million barrels of crude oil are produced every day in the oil fields of Nigeria and untold millions of cubic feet of marketable gases are burned away.

title: Soviet Lofts 8th Satellite In Program With Allies
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1The Soviet Union today launched the eighth scientific satellite of its joint space exploration program with its European allies.

title: Kennecott Censure Set
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 1 (Reuters)The four major copper exporting nations, meeting in secret session here have agreed on a joint declaration condemning the Braden Kennecott Corporation of the United States for its attempt to block sales of Chilean metal to Europe, conference sources said today.

title: Clear Field Ahead for Clements
description: When Vince Clements of the Giants enters the game against Cincinnati Sunday, he'll be pleased to learn the hashmarks at Riverfront Stadium aren't as high as those at Yankee Stadium.

title: For Veterans'Patriots'Day
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Yale Man Lifts a Princeton Ban
description: The Princeton Club's last sex barrier fell yesterday.

title: Queens Roads Unclogged Despite Strike on L.I.R.R.
description: Ninety thousand commuters found less trouble getting in and out of the city yesterday than on Thursday when the strike against the Long Island Rail Road began. In the bargaining, the striking unions said they were preparing a new approach that could move the stalled sessions off, dead center.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 1 (UPI)An unexplained blast in the boiler room shook the submarine tender Proteus at Pearl Harbor today, the Navy reported. The vessel, used to service Polaris nuclear submarines, suffered only minor damage, according to the Navy.

title: SMITH IS WINNER AS GORMAN QUITS Foe Hurts Back When Only Point From Upset Victory in Barcelona Tennis
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Saturday, Dec. 2 (AP)Tom Gorman, United States tennis star retired with back trouble early today when he was within a point of beating Stan Smith for perhaps the greatest triumph of his career.

title: Dr. Clark's Warning
description: In lambasting the sour fruits of school decentralization, Kenneth B. Clark has reacted with the characteristic impatience that springs from his compassion for children victimized by adult power plays. Both his sense of justice and his professional integrity are intolerably assailed when the politics of black and white racism move front and center on a stage that ought to be totally reserved for improving children's education.

title: Issel and Gilmore Spark the Colonels In 127107 Victory
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 1 (AP)Dan Issel and Artis Gilmore had 31 points apiece tonight as the Kentucky Colonels extended the Memphis Tams' losing streak to seven with a 127107 American Basketball Association victory.

title: Business Briefs.
description: LONDON, Dec. 1 (UPI)The International Wheat Council has decided against setting minimum or maximum prices before the end of the present wheat agreement 1974, a council statement indicated today. The 32 members of the council, in a fourday session that ended last night, ddcided there was not time to bring price limits into effect before the agreement expires on June 30, 1974, the statement said.

title: Lozowick Lithographs at the Whitney
description: Two new exhibitions, neither of them major but one of them quite superb, are currently on view at the Whitney Museum of American Art, Madison Avenue at 75th Street. The larger and more importantby a wide marginis a show of 64 lithoy,ranhs, from the period 1923 to 1972, by Louis Lozowick. The other is a silly little improvisation by Italo Soanga, an exsculptor who has now taken to placing pleasant artifacts in innocuous roomsize arrangements.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Dioguardi Indictment Dismissed

title: Suns Beat Warriors
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 1 (AP)Connie Hawkins, with a season high of 32 points, led the Phoenix Suns to a 115106 victory over the Golden State Warriors tonight.

title: U.S. IS CONTINUING TO PRESS SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The United States continued today to urge South Vietnam to agree to the Indochina settlement that the Administration believes will emerge in Paris after Henry A. Kissinger resumes negotiations with North Vietnam on Monday.

title: Diebenkorn Art Shows Special Facet
description: The exhibition of prints and drawings by Richard Diebrnkorn on view at the Martha Jackson Gallery, 32 East 69th Strel, reveals a Special and stunning facet of that artist's work. The subject matter of the etchings and lithographs, all of which were executed in 1965, is the female figure, clothed and nude, lolling about or sitting meditatively in interior views. It is one of the persistent themes of Mr. Diebenkorn's art and one that he invests with a rigorous formal clarity. That is when the artist is pursuing figurative considerations, for Mr. Diebenkorn's work, over the years, has been characterized by a restless shuttling back and forth between its largely abstract origins in the early fifties and his later involvement with figure and landscape painting.

title: To the Editor:
description: Mr. Buchanan's article contains certain misstatements about me which would like to refute.

title: Business Briefs,
description: PARIS, Dec. 1 (UPI)France will contact her fellow members in the European Economic Community to? see they can take concerted action against the Continent's soaring inflation, the Government said today.

title: Legal Insurance Backed
description: LAS VEGAS, Dec. 1 (AP)Legal insurance should be promoted to help the middle class receive services now generally available only to the very rich and poor, the president of the American Trial Lawyers Association said today. Today only the poor and the rich generally have access to legal services, said J. D. Lee, president of the organization.

title: HOTEL IS REBUFFED EVICTING A SINGLE Poverty Unit Backs Tenant on Refusal to Move Out
description: A singleroomoccupancy hotel was rebuffed yesterday when it sought to remove an undesirable tenant as part of the city's new drive to rid such buildings and their neighborhoods of crime.

title: Cities in Spain Vie for New Ford Plant
description: MADRID, Dec. 1  A report that the Ford Motor Company is interested in setting up operations in Spain has provoked flood of bids from cities that want the factory.

title: JOSEPH ZWECKER, 76, HEADED FINK BAKERY
description: Joseph Zwecker, president of the Fink Baking Corporation of Long Island City, Queens, the largest independent bakery in New York, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home, 7711 35th Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens. He was 76 years old.

title: Issue and Debate
description: The East Harlem school boycott has kept more than 10,000 children out of classes for more than a week, anddespite some intensive behindthescenes efforts aimed at resolving the protestis scheduled to continue Monday.

title: PRICE COMMISSION APPROVES RISES FOR G.M. AND FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Price Commission authorized the General Motors Corporation today to increase prices on cars and trucks by an average of $54, the full price rise the No. 1 auto maker had requested.

title: Great Northern Is Planning to Raise Newsprint Price
description: Price Changes

title: Scramble by Car, Bus or Helicopter
description: At the subway, terminals in Queens, business boomed. At the Long Island Rail Road conbourse in Pennsylvania Station, business dropped. Highways, subways, buses And railside businesses all felt the impact of the strike on what is normally the city's busiest commuter railroad.

title: Women Renew Cabinet Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) The National Women's Political Caucus repeated its request today that President Nixon name women to his Cabinet and that an obvious candidate was the chairman of the Federal Maritime Commission, Helen Delich Bentley.

title: Music: Anne English's Taste in Song
description: Anne English, a Massachusetts soprano who has been performing and studying in Europe in recent years, gave a recital at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night that left One with mixed impressions. To the good, she showed her high seriousness of purpose with a difficult program that ranged from the bel canto floridities of Alessandro Scarlatti, Porpora and Bellini to the lush romanticism of Liszt and Strauss.

title: Penn Romps, 9454
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 (AP)  Phil Hankinson scored 24 points as ninthranked Penn Opened its season with a 94.54 romp over King's College of Pennsylvania tonight. The Quakers broke away to leads of 134 and 237 and Hankinson, scored 10 straight points at one stretch. King's managed only two field goals in the first 13 minutes.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 1An independent research group supported by college and high school students around the state asserted today that one of its student teams turned up hundreds of potentially hazardous toys among the. Christmas cheer offered at all the nine department stores included in a survey last month.

title: Gus Johnson Put on Waivers
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 1 (AP) The Phoenix Suns placed Gus Johnson on waivers today. Johnson, in his 10th season in the National Basketball Association, was acquired from Baltimore last spring for a future draft choice. He averaged 7.8 points a contest in 21 games this season.

title: JURY CONVICTS TWO ON HEROIN CHARGES
description: After smelling 20 pounds of Southeast Asia heroin and seeing videotapes again of summernight dealings in the shadow of the Brooklyn Bridge, a Federal court jury convicted a Chinatown businessman and a Chinese alien yesterday of possessing heroin with intent to market it.

title: Stars and Stripes Reunion Conjures Up Yarns of War
description: The people who put out Stars and Stripes and Yank magazine during World War II got together last night and reminisced. It was approximately the 30th anniversary of the invasion of North Africa, and so they talked about that. Mostly, however, they talked about one another.

title: Cougars Top Nets; Melchionni Injured, To Miss 3 Weeks
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec 1The Nets had a bad night. They were beaten by the Carolina Cougars, 10399, tonight at the Nassau Coliseum and lost Billy Melchionni, their captain and the American Basketball Association's assist leader, for three weeks.

title: U.S. Envoy Apologizes To Japan Over Murder
description: TOKYO, Dec. 1 (Reuters)The United States Ambassador, Robert S. Ingersoll, took the unusual step of apologizing to Japan today for the murder of a Japanese woman for which an American soldier has been arrested.

title: TRADING IS HECTIC ON CHICAGO BOARD Commodity Volume Called One of the Biggest Ever
description: Brokers described trading on the Chicago. Board of Trade as wild yesterday, possibly one of the biggest days in history for the nation's leading grain center.

title: Relationship of Crime Rate to Building Height
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Harris's Scoring Slump Has Islanders Worried
description: Billy Harris and Bill Torrey, the general manager of the Islanders, had another chat yesterday, this time about tonight's game with the Detroit Red Wings at Nassau Coliseum.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The New Jersey Public Interest Research Group recommends the following guidelines for toy buying:

title: President Tells Chef: I Love the Chinese
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 1 (AP)President Nixon went out to a Coral Gables restaurant tonight and later visited an ice cream parlor that he used to frequent as Vice President.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 1 (AP)Coach Bill Fulcher of Georgia Teth announced tonight the suspension of Eddie McAshan, the school's first black quarterback, who failed to appear the team's practice yesterday.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 1 (AP)  Law enforcement officers tossed the first tear gas canister in the confrontation Nov. 16 between sheriff's deputies and Southern University students, the state commission investigating the clash reported today.

title: Back to Paris
description: As the chief negotiators of the United States and North Vietnam prepare for another round of secret talks in Paris there are signs that a ceasefire, although not necessarily a durable peace, may at last be at hand in Indochina.

title: Quaint Old Medical Practice: The House Call
description: Sorry, the doctor does not make house calls.

title: NAVY IS FAVORED OVER ARMY TODAY
description: Continued From Page 43 er, and Army's new Iformation, which gives the Cadets an offensive look similar to Navy's.

title: Mal Anderson Forfeits
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 1 (UPI)Mal Anderson, Australian Davis Cup player, who was seeded No. 2 in the Queensland grass court championships, surrendered his semifinal match today because of a leg injury when leading two sets to none.

title: LetterBombs Mailed to Truman in 1947
description: The socalled Stern gang of Zionist terrorists tried to assassinate President Truman by letterbomb in 1947, according to a new biography written by Mr. Truman's daughter.

title: MINE WORKERS BEGIN BALLOTING 1,000 Federal Observers Supervising 8Day Vote
description: NANTICOKE, Pa., Dec. 1The carpet of snow gave a frigid common denominator to the men who shivered and stamped their feet outside the. American Legion Hall today.

title: WOODCOCK ATTACKS NIXON ON POLLUTION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 2 (AP)  Leonard Woodcock, president of the United Auto mobile Workers, has accused President Nixon of a strategy of daydreaming en environ mental issues and had called for a new political awareness to assure human survival.

title: The Doll
description: Swings and seesaws began as elements in Greek fecundity rites, masquerades as elements in religious celebrations. The rituals, religious objects and tools of a whole comunity are copied and used by the children, and, as they are abandoned by the adults, become the games and toys of the children. Even dolls, which for us are practi cally symbols of decorative and useless objects, have respectable ancestors in the images and effigies of the past. The Egyp tians put models of slaves in with the dead to do the work in the hereafter; the Indians sacri ficed dolls instead of children to the river Ganges. And in China ladies avoided the embarrass ment of undressing in front of a doctor, or of even seeing him, by sending a servant along with a doctor doll to demonstrate where an ache was. (Who wouldn't love a doctor doll.) Some of the most glamorous old dolls in America were originally dolls sent by Paris dress makers to show colonial ladies the latest fashions.

title: Emanuel Leplin, Composed And Painted Despite Polio
description: MARTINEZ, Calif., Dec. 2 (AP)  Emanuel Leplin, who composed symphonies and painted although almost com pletely paralyzed by polio for 18 years, died yesterday at Contra Costa General Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived in San Mateo.

title: State Study On Bridge Over Sound Is Opposed
description: A study of the environ mental impact of the pro posed Oyster BayRye Bridge released last week by state officials, was criticized by the project's opponents as making the project appear to be more definite than it really is.

title: Westfield Adoption Unit Finds Homes for Special Children
description: WESTFIELD  The walls of the foyer of the old house on Elm Street are festooned with pictures of smiling chil dren.

title: Art Buchwald suggested jokingly that Hoffa be made Secretary of Transportation. Said Jimmy Hoffa: Why not?
Whose Honor? What Peace?
description: Every day, like millions of others; I follow, the reports of the increasingly dubious peace negotiations in Paris. We see photographs of Dr. Kissinger smiling, always smilinga man happy at his work. At the same time we read that today was the heaviest bombing of the war, and again tomorrow it is heavier still.

title: The World
description: UNITED NATIONSIt was a maxi mum effort by the United States that began early last spring. Before it ended, it involved negotiations in United States missions all over the world, some at a very high level, many conferences between the State De partment and foreign embassies in Washington, and a great deal of the most intense lobbying here at the United Nations.

title: A Puzzle for the Jets: When Will the Old Joe Namath Take Over Again?
description: Joe Namath surprised everyone this year by reporting to training camp only one week late (with the coach's permis sion) signing his twoyear contract be fore the first preseason game, staying healthy all season and then leading the Jets to their current mediocre 65 won lost record.

title: Walking Horse Complaints
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 2 (AP)Alleged soring of horses at Tennessee walking horse shows has prompted Federal officials to consider prosecu tion in 83 cases, a Federal official said today. Soring is the practice of treating show horses, hooves and ankles with chemical irritants or barbtype objects to produce a highstep ping gait.

title: DRIVE FOR NEEDY TO OPEN SUNDAY
description: The 61st annual appeal for the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund will open next Sun day instead of today as had been previously announced. The appeal traditionally begins on the third Sunday before Christ mas Day.

title: Nassau Budget Hearings Set
description: MINEOLA, L. I.Nassau residents who choose either to criticize or acclaim the proposed county budget for 1973 may speak out tomor row at two public hearings.

title: Richardson Sells Home And Land in Brookline
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Dec. 2 (UPI)  Defense Secretary designate Elliot L. Richard son has sold his home and 2.6 acres of land here for $175,000.

title: Peace Talks
description: WASHINGTONHenry A. Kissinger, seemingly confident that after more than a month's delay peace is really at hand, is scheduled to fly to Paris today for what the Administration bills as the final final round of negotia tions with the North Vietnamese.

title: R.M. Steuer Fiance of Miss Forchheimer
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Dec. 2The engagement of Miss Audrey Pauline Forchheimer to Richard Marc Steuer, son of Mrs. Harold Steuer of East Meadow, L.I., and the late Mr. Steuer, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Rudolph Forchheimer of Scarsdale.

title: Sons of the Rebel Staves
description: MAJOR MANN O. ROWE is the Keeper of the Treaty of the Maroon nation. Recently the major waved a bony black hand at the hills of Jamaica's Cockpit Country and talked about his dream with two visitors to the remote Maroon community of Accompong. Look, dears, he said, we bring the tourists up here soon. We make places for them. Rooms with electric lights. We do special dances for them, show them the treaty book and tell them the history of the Maroons.

title: U. S. Space Program Was Spurred by Flight of Gagarin
description: On April 12, 1961, the Soviet Union electrified the world by carrying out history's first manned flight in spacea one orbit rocket trip by Lieut. Col. Yuri A. Gagarin.

title: TO THE EDITOR:
description: Having spent over two years living and touring in Asia, I enjoyed reading about Mr. Sterba's experiences. In gen eral, his comments are both interesting and perceptive. In fact, I would appre ciate another such article, with remarks about South Korea, Burma and Macao.

title: Westward Course of Empire
description: When Bert Bell was commissioner of the National Football League many years, ago, he had matchless sources of infor mation because his pipelines extended in every direction. He never wasted them and this was true if he were digging up a prospective new owner or running down an unfounded gambling rumor.

title: A Critic Finds the Gains Weren't Worth the Efforts
description: The Most hopeful epitaph for Project Apollo might be: This was the last gasp of a technologically addicted, pub licrelationsminded society, the last escapade engineered by an industrialmilitary coalition seeking conquests in outer space, while avoid ing swelling needs on earth.

title: Antiques Show at Coliseum
description: UNIONDALE, L. I.Long Is land's first sizable antiques show will open Thursday at the Nassau Coliseum here.

title: SPECIALIST DUBIOUS OF DAYCARE TREND
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 2 (AP)A childcare specialist from New Zealand says she fears that proposals of the women's liberation movement for child care might lead to extended emotional illness among chil dren left in daycare centers.

title: GOVERNORS WEIGH PARTY POST FIGHT
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 2The gathering of Democratic Gover nors and Governorselect here this weekend is the moment of truth for Robert Strauss, the Dallas lawyer who wants to head the Democratic National Committee.

title: KASHMIR VIEWS
description: I would like to offer a few observa tions concerning Kashmir Houseboats: The Unhurried Life, by Rene Lecler (Travel Section, Oct. 8).

title: Lured to His First Recital
description: By guile and deception on a Sunday afternoon in 1928, a despairing young man who was to become one of the great figures in modern dance was lured by friends to his first recital.

title: Church Is Honored
description: THE Episcopal Church is honored on the most recent issue in the fine art medal series titled. Great Religions of the World, which was intro duced more than a year ago to encourage a better under standing and appreciation of the leading religions.

title: Glover, Nebraska Guard, Is Voted Outland Trophy
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Dec. 2 (AP)  Rich Glover, Nebraska's de fensive middle guard, was named winner today of the Outland Trophy, presented an nually by the Football Writers Association of America to the nation's outstanding guard or tackle.

title: Officer to Marry Elizabeth Owen
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn., Dec. 2Miss Elizabeth Gib son Dobie Owen and Lieut. Edward Spence Rogerson, U.S.N.R., plan to be mar ried this winter. Their en gagement has been an nounced by the prospective bride's mother and step father, Mr. and Mrs. John Jerauld Owen of North Haven, and Londonderry, Vt.

title: 20 Chinese Are to Study At a French University
description: PEKING, Dec. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)Twenty Chi nese students are to leave for France this month to study at Aixen Provence University.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: JAPAN'S external reserves in November reached a record $18.4billion, up $616million from the October level  France increased her discount rate from 6.5 per cent to 7.5 per cent. West Germany's rate went from 4 per cent to 4.5 per cent  Securities and Exchange Com mission charged Robert L. Vesco, former chairman of International Controls Corporation, and 41 other defend ants with spiriting away some $224million in cash and securities of four I.O.S.managed mutual funds.

title: ALBATROSS, 19, WINS RICH PACING CLASSIC
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 2 (AP) Albatross, the richest pacer in the sport's history, wound up his career with a fivelength victory in the $100, 000 American Pacing Classic at Hollywood Park last night.

title: Beckett, Yes, But Also A TandyCronyn Festival
description: WHENEVER we talk about the desirabil ity of having a house like Lincoln Center's Forumor any other smallish, hospitable acting space in which uncommercial work can be performed for limited engagements  we speak primarily of plays. How good to have a place in which we can put four Samuel Beckett plays back to back for a few weeks, we say to ourselves, more or less let ting the subject drop there.

title: How the West Was Brutal
description: ROBERT ALDRICH'S Ulzanta's Raid, a Western designed with out apologies for mass audiences, is so consistently unsentimental and provocative that it should restore some measure of faith in the future of the action film, which, except for the films made for black audiences, would be practically extinct today. At the least, it restores a good deal of my faith in Aldrich, the tireless, idiosyncratic direc tor of films good (Kiss Me Deadly, The Dirty Dozen), bad (The Killing of Sister George), grotesque (What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?) and wildly mixedup (The Legend of Lylah Clare).

title: Vietnam
description: SAIGONWanted: aircraft mechan ics, radar operators, data processors for highly classified material. Immedi ate openings. Must be United States citizens.

title: Heart Anniversary
description: It was on an earlier Sunday, exactly five years ago today, that the first human heart transplant took place. The exuberant hopes then aroused, the epidemic similar transplants that followed and the bitter dis appointments that went with most of them, all these emotionfilled episodes are too recent to require detailed recounting. More useful might be an effort to draw up a tentative balance sheet of the great medical drama of the last half decade.

title: Can't We Agree on Pensions?
description: Robert D. Paul's article Pensions: An Issue That Won't Retire (Oct. 22) pre sents an interesting approach that certainly has consider able merit.

title: Newcombe Beats Alexander
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec. 2 (Reuters)  Top seeded John Newcombe tamed the booming service of fellow Australian John Alexander to day and won the Castle Lager tennis tournament. The score was 61, 76.

title: New Weapon Laws Curbing Deer Hunt
description: PRINCETON Starting to morrow morning, many of the 100,000 licensed firearm hunters in New Jersey will begin their annual sixday assault on male deer.

title: Stolen Goya and Reni Found by Italian Police
description: MESTRE, Italy, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The police report ed today the recovery of paintings by Goya and Reni stolen from a villa near here last month.

title: Environmental Priorities Under Fire
description: A top Federal environmental offical says that the nation's environmental priorities are cockeyed because the prob lems of land use and develop ment have almost been totally neglected while attention has been concentrated on control ling air and water pollution.

title: Space Pioneer Reflects on Apollo's Achievements
description: Apollo lunar exploration has come a long way since Neil Armstrong made that famous first step at Tran quility Base in July, 1969.

title: Business Index Falls
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Busi ness Activity fell to 372.3 from 383.5* a week earlier. A year ago it was 344.1.

title: Humphrey in Warsaw
description: WARSAW, Dec. 2 (Reuters) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey arrived here today for a four day visit. He will hold brief talks with Polish leaders and is expected to concentrate on trade and agriculture.

title: Janet Blaylock, Henry Phillips to Wed
description: NORTH CHATHAM, N. Y., Dec. 2Mr. and Mrs. John Blaylock have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Janet Lynn Blay lock, to Henry Alexander Phillips, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Phillips of Holderness, N. H., and Cambridge, Mass.

title: Plan to Preserve Wolves Termed Danger to Them
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) The Fund for Animals, Inc., contends that a federallyap proved plan to preserve the few hundred Eastern timber wolves remaining in the United States threatens instead to make them extinct.

title: Legislative Notes: Cahill Is Rebuffed on ParoleReform Plan
description: TRENTON  One of the most bitter complaints voiced by the inmates who took over a wing of Rahway State Prison on Thanksgiving Day, 1971, was directed at the parole system.

title: When Sparks Fly Across the Sales Counter
description: Recently two separate in cidents involving the same amount of money served to highlight the ageold struggle between buyer and seller.

title: Sailors' Carving Art Lives
description: GLEN ROCK In the whaling years of the 19th century, sailors often turned to scrimshaw  the etch ing and carving of whales' teeth and bone  as a ref uge from the destructive boredom of long ocean voy ages.

title: Montclair Becomes Landlord to Assist Tenants
description: MONTCLAIRA landlord tenant dispute of the sort that has come to be regarded as a classic New York City confrontation has moved west to this 104yearold suburb and has forced it to abandon one of its traditional methods of dealing with municipal problems.

title: Looking for a Thumb Print
description: Art

title: Hannah Gonski Fiancee
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Dec. 2 Mr. and Mrs. Max Gonski have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Hannah Gonski, to Bruce Eric Goldman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Goldman of New Milford. Mr. Goldman and his fiance plan to be married in August. The pro spective bride, a senior at Douglass College, plans to attend law school in the fall. Her fianc, a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Rutgers University, is studying at the Villanova University Law School.

title: Life Cycle, 351, Wins in Florida
description: MIAMI, Dec. 2When Wil liam L. McKnight, owner of Tropical Park, decided to transfer Tropical's dates to Calder Race Course this year, one of his principal concerns was the name of Tropical be retained. Officially, the present meeting is called TropicalatCalder.

title: LIRR
description: The Nation

title: Saigon Drive Near DMZ Reported Bogged Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sun day, Dec. 3 (AP)South Viet nam's northern counteroffen sive was reported bogged down in rain and mud yesterday, but American B52 bombers kept hammering the desolate foot hills below the demilitarized zone.

title: Trial Is Set On Funds For Transit
description: HACKENSACK A suit challenging the constitution ality of a state law that prohibits the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey from spending bond proceeds on mass transit is scheduled for trial in Superior Court here on Jan. 16

title: Louise E. Walsh Is Married on L. I.
