description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 3Uninspired but unrelenting, the Miami Dolphins remained unbeaten today with a 3721 victory over the New England Patriots and joined the 1934 Chicago Bears as the only National Football League teams to win 12 consecutive games from the start of the season.

title: SovietEgypt Rift Persists, Causing Strains in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Dec. 3An Egyptian military delegation led by Gen. Hosni Mobarak of the air force has returned from Moscow amid indications that SovietEgyptian relations remain almost as distant as they were after President Anwar elSadat abruptly expelled 20,000 Soviet military advisers last July.

title: Two Young Divers Die
description: LIVE OAK, Fla., Dec. 3 (AP) Leonard Stubbs, 16 years old, and Richard Broman, 16, both of Jacksonville, died today while scuba diving in caves near Peacock Sleugh Springs.

title: East German Observer Here
description: Dr. Horst Grinert, the newly appointed East German observer at the United Nations, arrived from Paris last night to take his post. A spokesman for his party said at Kennedy International Airport, Our arrival reflects international dtente. He declined to say where the group would set up headquarters.

title: Police Sick Call Continues
description: EAST LIVERPOOL, Ohio, Dec. 3 (UPI)A sickcall strike by this city's 30man police force entered its third day today with no signs of ending before Wednesday, when wage negotiations resume with the City Council. However, before striking Friday, the patrolman made arrangements for two men of each sixman shift to report for duty and devised a secret code system to insure quick mobilization in case of emergency, a spokesman said.

title: L. Francis Herreshoff, 82, Dies; Dean of U.S. Yacht Designers
description: BOSTON, Dec. 3L. Francis Herreshoff, known as the dean of American yacht designers, died today in Massachusetts General Hospital after having undergone surgery for a broken hip. He was 82 years old and had lived since 1945 in The Castle, a stone house on the harbor at Marblehead.

title: Prof. Lillian Hudson Dies; Long on Columbia Faculty
description: Lillian A. Hudson, professor emeritus of nursing education at Teachers College, Columbia University, died Saturday in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 86 years old and lived at 90 Morningside Drive.

title: News Analysis
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 29 After more than a generation of defining Europe by politics, geography is coming to reassert itself in the European conference here. In view of this partial triumph of geography, one American participant commented: The surprising thing is how easily we and the Ca nadians are being accepted as Europeans. Thirtytwo European countries only Albania refused, evidently fol lowing Chinese instructions to beware of being caught where Moscow and Washington converge  and the two biggest countries of North America are attending the Helsinki talks.

title: Six Coast Players Hart in Car Accident
description: SAN LUIS OBISPO, Calif., Dec. 3 (AP)  Five starters and another player from California PolytechnicSan Luis Obispo's Camellia Bowlbound football team were injured in an automobile accident last night. They were returning from a bachelor party.

title: BUCKS OVERCOME SUNS' FIVE,119101
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 3 (AP) Bob Dandridge, with 26 points, Kareem AbdulJabbar, with 33, led the Milwaukee Bucks to a 119101 National Basketball Association victory over the Phoenix Suns tonight.

title: LEONARD I. CHARNEY
description: Leonard Irving Charney, a civil engineer and president of the Elan Construction Corporation of New York City, died yesterday at Memorial Hospital after a long illness. He was 36 years old and lived at 85 East End Avenue.

title: CITY BOND ISSUE IS DUE TOMORROW
L.I.R.R. Negotiations Unravel In Informal, ArmChair Setting
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, wearing a conservative bluegray suit, looked like any airtraveling businessman yesterday as he strode through the lobby of the International Hotel near KennedyInternational Airport. He was heading for his thirdfloor room where, at what is conveniently called the bargaining table, he was to resume negotiations in the Long Island Rail Road strike.

title: ROSEWALL TRIUMPHS IN AUSSIE NET FINAL
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 3 (AP)Thirtyeightyearold Ken Rosewall withstood a strong challenge from young Geoff Masters today and beat his 22yearold fellow Australian, 62, 57, 64, 36, 75, in the men's singles final of the Queensland lawn tennis tournament.

title: BRUINS TROUNCE ISLANDERS, 5 TO 1
description: BOSTON, Dec. 3While the Boston Bruins were coasting to a 51 annihilation of the Islanders tonight, someone asked a visitor if the Islanders televised their games back to New York.

title: Her Crowd
description: I met the woman I'll call Minnie Goldbloom in the courtyard of the lowincome Vladeck Houses on New York's Lower East Side. She is a 69yearold widow who lives on less than $3,000 a year, who is constantly afraid of mugging or theft. I was working on a story that day for The Village Voice about poor Jews. I must have been the first outsider in years who seemed interested in her problems. So, with a clinging eagerness that startled me, she invited me to her fourth floor apartment for tea and cookies.

title: Gunman and Policemen Exchange 20 Shots Before Midtown Capture
description: A bearded man with a gun exchanged shots with several pursuing policemen yesterday afternoon in a sixblock chase that began with bullets whizzing in a crowded midtown restaurant and ended when an anonymous young man tackled the gunman in Times Square.

title: Recalcitrant Republicans Likely to Compound Nixon's Problems With Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3President Nixon's problems with a Democraticcontrolled Senate are likely to be compounded by an antiWhite House mood within the Republican minority two Republican seats in the election, there will be 43 Republicans and 57 Democrats in the new Senate; ideologically, there has probably been a shift of three to four votes to the moderate liberal side.

title: Concert Is a 40th Anniversary for Duo
description: If Roman Totenberg and Artur Balsam had not met until a few hours before they performed together at Tully Hall Saturday night, their interpretation of Beethoven's Kreutzer Sonata would very likely have been, a superior one. But this concert marked the 40th anniversary of their first appearance together, in Berlin, and it was only natural to feel that a mature musical understanding of long duration enriched their playing.

title: Nordiques Score, 62
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Dec. 3 (UPI)The Quebec Nordiques, paced by the twogoal performance of Robert Guinbon, beat the Alberta Oilers, 62, tonight. It was the seventh loss in the last nine games for Alberta.

title: Hammarskjold, a Biography Based on Private Papers, Tells of Rifts With Big Powers
description: Dag Hammarskjold left behind not only a public legacy in documents of the United Nations whose Secretary General he was from 1953 to 1961, but also a collection of private papers preserved from public view.

title: People Expect More From Democrats
description: Letters to the Editor

title: KISSINGER ARRIVES IN PARIS TO BEGIN ADDITIONAL TALKS
description: PARIS, Monday, Dec. 4Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, arrived here last night to start another round of Vietnam ceasefire negotiations today.

title: E. V. BERESLAVSKY
description: Euphine V. Bereslaysky, chemical and metallurgical engineer, died Saturday at his home, 1075 Park Avenue. He was 83 years old.

title: NO CEILING IS SEEN ON COST OF MONEY
description: The Nixon Administrationdespite its recent efforts to induce major banks to hold down their prime lending ratesappears to be determined to avoid setting a ceiling on the cost of money.

title: Permanent Olympics
description: Letters to the Editor

title: CATHOLIC PRELATE IS ACCUSED BY AMIN
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Dec. 3The conflict between President Idi Amin and the Roman Catholic Church here worsened this weekend as the President accused the Archbishop of Kampala, the Most. Rev. Emmanuel Nsubuga, of connections with purported Israeli and South African plots against the Government.

title: Harlem Prep Is Striving To Survive as Funds Fall
description: Harlem Prep, the private, tuitionfree high school situated in a renovated Harlem supermarket, is in financial trouble again.

title: Arms Overruns Up Billion in 3 Months, G.A.O. Study Says
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) Excess costs in military weapons systems increased by more than $1billion in a threemonth period this year, a Government study said today.

title: POLICE KILL ONE MAN AFTER BRONX HOLDUP
description: Two gunmen were shot, one fatally, early yesterday in an exchange of gunfire between three plainclothes policemen and five young men. The police said they had seen the men fleeing from a Bronx social club where six patrons had been robbed of $110.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Guiomar Novaes Recital Evokes Fond Memories
description: Word got out that the Saturday night appearance of Guiomar Novaes, at Hunter College, was going to be her farewell concert. Late last week the lady denied it. But whether Miss Novaes is indeed going to leave the concert stage, or quietly continue, or give annual grand farewell concerts a la Patti, nobody was taking any chances this time. The hall was sold out.

title: Sabres On Top, 74
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 3 (AP)Gerry Meehan and Don Luce scored two goals each to lead the Buffalo Sabres to a 74 victory over the Minnesota North Stars tonight. The Sabres extended their unbeaten streak at home to 13 games.

title: Dublin Awaits Crackdown
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 3The legislation aimed at the Irish Republican Army that was rushed through Parliament this weekend became law today, but the crackdown on the outlawed organization is not expected until later this week.

title: A.A.U. Board Endorses Liberalized Amateur Code
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 3 (AP) The board of governors of the Amateur Athletic Union passed a resolution, today calling for the United States Olympic Committee to liberalize its definition of an amateur.

title: Analyst Recounts Signals In A. T. & T. Turnaround
description: The rising stock of American Telephone has been a Wall Streetand Main Streetwonder in recent months. For more than seven years, from its record high of 75 1964, the stock moved in a down channel. In recent years, some brokerage houses forecast a turnaround in the giant company with monotonous regularity, only to see their predictions go aground. One man who did spot the actual turn was Benjamin M. Rosen, 39, a partner and research director at Coleman & Co. In an interview last week with Vartanig G. Vartan of The New York Times, Mr. Rosen told his version of the Telephone storyhis first buy recommendation came on Aug. 4 of this year when the stock was at 42and what he expects for the future. The Coleman firm concentrates on research and its clients are 150 major financial institutions around the country.

title: Mayor of East Orange to Head Black Caucus of Elected Officials
description: New Jersey Notes

title: Ensemble Directed By Denis de Coteau In Pleasant Concert
description: Denis Montague de Coteau conducted the Symphony of the New World in a pleasant concert yesterday afternoon at Philharmonic Hall, but he didn't really get to show his stuff until the final piece on the program.

title: Corporate Interlocks
description: In response to a complaint by the Federal Trade Commission, Russell DeYoung has resigned from the board of directors of the Aluminum Company of America while retaining his directorate on the Kennecott Copper Corporation. The F.T.C. had accused three corporationsAlcoa, Kennecott and Armco Steelof having illegal interlocking directorates. The complaint is based on a section of the Clayton Antitrust Act which states that no person shall at the same time be a director in any two or more corporations if they are competitors.

title: McGovern Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)senator McGovern, in a statement issued here tonight, endorsed a suggestion that both Mrs. Westwood and Mr. Strauss take themselves out of the race for the party chairmanship.

title: W. W. CLELAND, 84, EDUCATOR, IS DEAD
description: HIGHLAND PARK, Ill., Dec. 3 (UPI)Dr. W. Wendell Cleland, a founder of the American University in Cairo and specialist in Egyptian affairs, died yesterday of a stroke. He was 84 years old.

title: Mrs. Cinnabelle Morris Bride Of Dr. Benjamin Esterman
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Dec. 3 Mrs. Cinnabelle Morris of Hewlett, widow of Dr. Abner Morris, was married here today to the opthalmologist and surgeon Dr. Benjamin Esterman, who is a widower. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Joel. Y. Zion, spiritual leader of Temple Israel, in his study. Only the couple's five children attended. A family dinner was given at the home of, the bride.

title: FILM RIGHTS BOUGHT FOR A POLICE NOVEL
description: Screen rights to Law and Order, a forthcoming novel by Dorothy Uhnak, have been purchased by Robert Evans, executive vicepresident in charge of Paramount production, for his first personal production under a multiplefilm arrangement with the company.

title: Theater: 12 Angry Men
description: The Queens Playhouse, the attempted reclamation project on the site of the old World's Fair, is offering the first New York stage production of Reginald Rose's Twelve Angry Men. I hope that it will not be followed. by the first New York stage productions of Marty and Patterns.

title: Shorter Takes Marathon in Japan
description: FUKUOKA, Japan, Dec. 3 (AP)Frank Shorter, the Olympic marathon champion, galloped to an easy victory in the Fukuoka international marathon today despite suffering from stomach cramps.

title: Bishop's Vestments Stolen
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3 (UPI)  A thief broke into a parked car belonging to the Right Revlverson Noland, the Episcopal Bishop of Louisiana, and stole! his clerical robes headpieces and ceremonial staff, all valued at $1.100.

title: Scarsdale Man Is Named Head of Reform Judaism Unit
description: An insurance executive who once studied for the rabbinate was elected yesterday chairman of the board of trustees of the Union of American Hebrew Congregations, the highest lay position in Reform Judaism.

title: Party Guests Robbed
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 3 (AP) Five holdup men escaped with an estimated $3,000 early today after terrorizing 40 guests at party held to raise money for charity, the police said. The party was at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Gayle Cooper.

title: Tams Snap Losing Streak
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 3 (AP)Fthe Memphis Tams posted a 124115 victory over, Virginia tonight to break an eightgame losing streak despite 17 points by Virginia's Julius Erving.

title: Last 2 Privately Held Bridges Bring Owners Handsome Profit
Colonels Triumph, 10991
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 3 (AP) The Kentucky Colonels went out to a 3013 firstquarter lead tonight, then coasted to their sixth straight A.B.A. victory, a 10991 decision over the San Diego Conquistadors.

title: Jets 51 Victory
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 3 (AP)Danny Johnson, Larry Hornung and Bob Woytowich scored for Winnipeg in the first five minutes and the Jets skated to a 51 victory over the Minnesota Fighting Saints tonight.

title: Tanqueray Gin Account Switched
description: The call was to the New York office of Bozell & Jacobs and the question was, Do you have any comment on the loss of the Tanqueray Gin account?

title: U.C.L.A. Wins Water Polo Title
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 3 (UPI)Eric Lindroth scored six goals last night to give the University of California, Los Angeles, a 15 victory over San Jose State and its second consecutive National Collegiate water polo championship.

title: Yseult Snepvangers Is Bride of a Lawyer
description: Miss Yseult Snepvangers was married here yesterday afternoon to Morton Freilicher, a member of the New York law firm of Phillips, Nizer, Benjamin, Krim & Ballon. Rabbi Judah Cahn performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Ira J. Palestin, cousins of the bride.

title: RUPP'S SUCCESSOR VICTOR IN OPENER
description: The changing of the guard took place Saturday night at Kentucky. For the first time in 42 years Adolph Rupp, the man in the brown suit, was not the basketball coach of the Wildcats. In his place was Joe Hall, wearing the blue blazer of Kentucky, but just as active on the bench as Rupp had been.

title: Plante Stops Wings
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3 (UPI)Jacques Plante, 43yearold goalie, registered his first shutout of the season and the 80th of his career as the Toronto Maple Leafs beat the Detroit Red Wings tonight, 30. He turned back 26 shots. Rick Keyhoe, Ron Ellis and Pierre Jarry scored.

title: Black Hawks Win, 42
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3 (AP)Cliff Koroll scored twice and Stan Mikita picked up four assists to pace the Chicago Black Hawks to a 42 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight. The victory moved the Hawks to within a point of firstplace Minnesota.

title: Coeds Finding a Welcome in R.O.T.C.
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind., Dec. 3  Like cheerleaders watching a game that slightly scares them, the young women stood in small groups off to the side of the rifle range covering their ears as the men fired round after round during target practice in their Naval Reserve Officer Training Corps class.

title: IMPERIALE AGREES TO LIMIT PICKETS
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3Assemblyman Anthony Imperiale said he would obey the courtimposed limit, of 200 pickets in tomorrow's protest at the site of the Kawaida Towers Miming project, but he urged Other supporters to come out as onlookers.

title: Levitt Reports Public Authorities Owe $8.9Billion
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt said yesterday that 34 public authorities had $8.9billion in debts outstanding  more than two and a half times the state's $3.4billion debt  and that much of this might have to be shouldered by taxpayers.

title: Carrier Ticonderoga Off to Splashdown Site
description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii, Dec. 3 (AP)The aircraft carrier Ticonderoga sailed from here today on the last astronaut recovery mission of the Apollo lunarlanding program.

title: French Rothschilds Feel Financial Tweak
description: PARIS, Dec. 3It's as disconcerting as misplacing that gold ingot or watching greenbacks fluttering in the wind. The French branch of the House of Rothschild, a family that has bankrolled governments, companies and even New York subways, is in unaccustomed difficulties.

title: Anzacs Opt For Change
description: In New Zealand's election campaign last month, the Labor party, out of power twelve years, hammered the theme: It's time for a change. Australia's Labor party, even hungrier for office after 23 years of LiberalCountry party coalition rule, shortened the slogan to It's time. The slogans were equally effective. Australia has now followed New Zealand's lead in thrusting Labor into office with a big majority.

title: Blast in German Store
description: MANNHEIM, West Germany, Dec. 3 (UPI)An explosion in a department store today caused an estimated $30,000 in damage, but apparently no injuries, the police reported. They said that experts had not ruled out the possibility that the blast, in a store owned by Josef Neckermann, head of mailorder house, had been caused by a time bomb.

title: Cavaliers Win in Overtime
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 3 (AP)Barry Clemens, a substitute, sparked the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 105103 overtime victory over the Seattle SuperSonics in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Clean Air Tennis Classic Helps Its Promoters Most
description: The bright red and yellow brochures and the advertisements for the $75,000 Third Annual Clean Air Tennis Classic feature a cartoon of two tennis players wearing gas masks. The ads say that proceeds will go to improving your air.

title: C.B.S., Citing Sabotage, Cancels Telecast of Jets
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System canceled its scheduled telecast yesterday of the New York JetsNew Orleans Saints football game at Shea Stadium, charging that camera cables had been cut and disconnected and that employes had been assaulted.

title: Muniz Knocks Out Pruitt
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Dec. 3 (AP)Armando Muniz retained his North American welterweight boxing title last night with an eighthround knockout of Adolph Pruitt. Both fighters weighed 145 pounds.

title: Seoul Police Arrest 2 In Fire That Killed 51
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 4 (Reuters)The police today arrested a lighting technician and a property man following a fire Saturday night, which gutted the Citizens Hall, a municipal theater here, leaving 51 dead and 76 injured.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Retired Publisher Gives State Land

title: Mrs. Gandhi Urges U.S. To Understand India Better
description: Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India said in an interview published today that better relations with the United States could be brought about by an improved American understanding of India.

title: Bowie, Marlboro Tracks to Merge
description: BOWIE, Md., Dec. 3 (UPI)Owners of Bowie and Marlboro race tracks have announced an agreement for common ownership of the two suburban Washington tracks. The tracks plan to continue operations as in the past, with Bowie conducting mile racing and Marlboro conducting halfmile racing, said Bowie's assistant general manager, Al Karwacki. The Maryland Racing Commission will meet Dec. 14 to consider the merger.

title: I.B.M. Denies It Plans European Stock Issue
description: The International Business Machine Corporation issued here yesterday a denial of an article that appeared in yesterday's Sunday Times of London that stated that I.B.M. was planning to issue $5billion of its stock to European shareholders. The I.B.M. statement read in part:

title: Moe Jaffe, Composer, Dead; Wrote Gypsy in My Soul
description: CRESSKILL, N.J., Dec. 3 Moe Jaffe, songwriter and lyricist, died at a nursing home here yesterday. He was 71 years old and lived at 1123 Magnolia Road, Teaneck.

title: Panel at Lincoln Center To Revitalize Repertory
description: The formation of the Committee for Theater at Lincoln Center to recommend steps to carry out the artistic, financial and administrative reorganization of the Repertory Theater was announced yesterday by the theater's board of directors. The action follows the recent decision to curtail the season at the Forum and the resulting resignation of Jules Irving as artistic director, effective at the end of the current season.

title: Russians and U.S. Signing Agreement On New Embassies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The United States and the Soviet Union plan to sign tomorrow an agreement leading to construction of a new American Embassy complex in Moscow and a new Soviet Embassy here.

title: Apollo Countdown Continues as Crew Flies Jet Trainers
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 3 Preparations for the launching of Apollo 17, the last of the missions to land men on the moon, continued tonight.

title: Amphetamine and Accidental Addicts
description: Amphetamine, a powerful mental stimulant that was once widely and carelessly prescribed, has, in the preponderant opinion of medical experts, led to more serious problems of inadvertent addiction and psychiatric complications than any other legally available drug.

title: CONGRESS FACING SENIORITY BATTLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3When the 92d Congress convened nearly two years ago, 38 men were chosen to head the 38 Senate and House committees. Their average age was 64 years.

title: MRS. JAMES MULLANEY
description: Mrs. Marie Brett Mullaney, widow of James Mullaney, who had been an employe of the New York Telephone Company, died yesterday at the home of her daughter, Mrs. Catherine Dalton, 16050 24th Avenue, Whitestone, Queens. She was 84 years old.

title: Adair Squash Victor
description: Colin Adair triumphed in singles and Romar Holleran paired with Maurice Heckscher to take the doubles yesterday in the Gold Racquets squash tournament at the Rockaway Hunting Club in Cedarhurst, L. I. Adair defeated Vic Niederhoffer, 1513, 1511, 1015, 18 17. Holleran and Heckscher beat Bailey Brown and Charles Hamm, 1518, 615, 1512, 156.

title: Raiders Score 4 Goals in First Period and Topple Crusaders, 52
description: It was difficult to believe that the New York Raiders could make such a complete turnaround in 24 hours.

title: Abortion and the Church
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Grim Echo in Shadow of Gunman
description: Sean O'Casey's Shadow of a Gunman, first produced at Dublin's Abbey Theater in 1923, survives as pertinently as if it were written yesterday. That may well be a tribute to O'Casey's genius. Or it may be a devastating comment on the peculiar inability of Ireland to settle her Troubles. Probably it's good bit of both.

title: Dissident in Soviet Jail Is Reported to Recant
description: LONDON, Monday, Dec. 4 The Daily Telegraph reported today that Pyotr I. Yakir, a Soviet dissident and civilrights activist who was arrested June 21, has recanted his position and is cooperating with the authorities.

title: No. 1 Xerox Wants More Copier Business
description: In 1971 more than one trillion copies were made throughout the world on office copiers, duplicators, offset, mimeo devices and carbon paper, according to a man who should know, William F. Sounders, senior vice president of the Xerox Corporation.

title: Clarke's Two Goals Lead Flyers To 52 Victory Over Canadiens
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 3 (AP) Two goals by Bobby Clarke and a tough checking defense carried the Philadelphia Flyers to a 52 National Hockey League victory over the Montreal Canadiens tonight. It was Philadelphia's first triumph in five games. Montreal lost only its fourth game of the season.

title: President Allende of Chile Here To Address General Assembly
description: President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile arrived here yesterday for a oneday visit to address the United Nations General Assembly.

title: RUMSFELD CHOSEN AS ENVOY TO NATO Cost of Living Panel Chief to Succeed David Kennedy New Moves Due Today
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 4  President Nixon announced today that he would nominate Donald Rumsfeld, director of the Cost of Living Council, to be the next United States representative to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Advertising:
description: Following the lead of several international advertising agencies, the Leo Burnett Company, Chicago, the fifth largest United States agency, is making the domestic operation a separate division and is giving it a president and a chairman.

title: Fear and Fantasy in Future Folly
description: We cannot live without dreams, observes Herman Kahn and B. BruceBriggs of the Hudson Institute in their new book, Things to Come, but we should not permit our fantasies to substitute for the real and concrete future.

title: $40,000 Apartment Burglary
description: The apartment of an investment broker was robbed of $40,000 worth of jewelry over the weekend, the police reported yesterday. The victim was Frits Markus of 120 East End Avenue, near East 85th Street, who operates an investment office at 30 Wall Street. In another burglary, the home of Jerome Belson, a former assistant city corporation counsel, was broken into at 197 Rugby Road, Flatbush, Brooklyn, and jewelry valued at $10,000 and $2,850 in cash were stolen.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City Presidential Vote Tallied

title: Identifying Defendants A Complicated Matter
description: Identifying defendants is, like everything else in the court system, a complicated matter. Before arraignment, defendants are fingerprinted and photographed. Sometimes they refuse to be fingerprinted and in those cases they are held without bail.

title: Summary of Actions taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Fire Knocks Out Elevators
description: Residents of a 15story building at 1010 Fifth Avenue, at 82d Street, lost their elevator service arid had to use stairways when a short circuit in an electric service box caused a fire and an explosion early yesterday morning in a manhole near the building. Windows were shattered in groundfloor offices of several physicians. No injuries were reported. Elevator service was restored at 8:45 P.M.

title: Leadership by U.S. Seen for Future
description: PITTSBURGH  John W. Simpson is sure that the broad technological data base the United States is building up in breeder reactor technology will allow it to catch up and go ahead of the Russians, the British and the French in the years ahead.

title: WELFARE REFORM OR CUTS IN FUNDS FACED BY STATES New Federal Rules Would Penalize Faulty Systems $400Million a Year MAY AFFECT 2 MILLION Goal. Is to Restore Public Confidence in Program Officials Here Baffled; CUTS IN WELFARE FACED BY STATES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Nixon Administration moved today to tighten the management of state welfare programs and thus restore public confidence in financial assistance to the needy.

title: Genesco Plans a Reorganization
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 4  Genesco, Inc., told its shareholders here today that a management reorganization of the troubled company would take place by March. Genesco is the country's largest apparel manufacturer and a major retailer.

title: Strong Quake Jolts Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4 (AP)  A powerful earthquake shook Japanese islands in the Pacific and was felt 200 miles away in Metropolitan Tokyo today, damaging roads and disrupting telephone service. There were no reports of casulaties. Early reports from Hachijo Island, near the center of the tremor, said that the 10.000 inhabitants had fled their homes.

title: The State of State
description: President Nixon has decided to preserve unchanged the imbalance in the making of foreign policy, at least until his prime international objectivepeace in Vietnamis achieved. That is the plain import of his reappointment of Secretary of State Rogers, coupled with his announcement that Henry A. Kissinger will stay in the White House.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: Despite one of their worst Western swings, another serious injury and a loss of scoring punch, the Rangers yesterday found themselves closer to the Montreal Canadiens, leaders of the East Division. A week ago the New Yorkers were 4 points behind the Frenchmen. We're only 2 behind now, said Coach Emile Francis. That's because we've tightened up our defense.

title: Italy Raises Rate
description: ROME, Dec. 4Italy announced today an increase in the interest rate on one week, twoweek and threeweek loans to commercial banks from 3.5 to 5.5 per cent. The change, effective tomorrow, is intended to limit the rise of shortterm borrowings from Italy's central bank following recent bankrate increases in Britain, West Germany and France.

title: KENTUCKY UPSET BY IOWA, 7966 Fegebank Leads Winners' Rally at Lexington
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 4 (AP)Neil Fegebank led a secondhalf surge that sent the Iowa Hawkeyes to a 7966 basketball upset victory over ken, tucky tonight.

title: CONSUMER CREDIT STILL EXPANDING October Gain Set a Record, Federal Reserve Reports
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) Consumer credit rose by a record amount in October, the Federal Reserve said today, with the total up a seasonally adjusted $1.9billion from September.

title: Michigan Tops Oregon State
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. (UPI)Henry Wilmore scored 26 points tonight to lead Michigan to a 6857 victory over Oregon State. Richard Plante, the Beavers' leading scorer, did not play because of illness. Sam Whitehead led Oregon State with 18 points, while Ron Jones had 10.

title: REVOLUTION ASKED IN U.S. CHURCHES Baraka Calls U.S. a Major Obstruction to Progress
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4  Imanu Athiri Baraka, the writer, and black militant leader, told the National Council of Churches today that the church would disappear if it did not become revolutionary.

title: Counter Index Tops High of April 18Amex Advances
description: A record for the NASDAQ overthecounter composite index was reached yesterday as it closed at 134.14. The previous high of 134.10, was attained on April 18.

title: Mayor Visits the John V. Lindsay Park in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4Mayor Teddy Kollek of Jerusalem took his counterpart from New York ion a tour of the city today that included, in addition to the usual stops, a visit to John V. Lindsay Park.

title: 13 Harlem Schools Still Closed As 2 Brooklyn Boycotts Begin
description: East Harlem parents kept 13 schools closed yesterday in a continuing protest against school budget cuts. In Brooklyn, parent boycotts virtually emptied two schools.

title: The Theater: Say When
description: The only answer to the possibly rhetorical question posed by the new show Say When, which opened last night at the Plaza 9 Theater, is probably say never. It was a little monster. The Plaza 9 should watch out  this is the kind of show that could drive people to the WaldorfAstoria in droves.

title: Playoff Chances
description: Here are the playoff possibilities for the two New York teams in the National Football League. Each can still be the fourth qualifier in its conference by finishing second in its own division and having a better record (through tiebreaking procedures) than the other two secondplace finishers in its conference. Possibilities involving tie games are still too complicated to consider.

title: ExMovie Union Official Is Held In Taking of Applicants' Bribes
description: A man who was a top official for several years in a labor union in the movie and television industry here was arrested yesterday in connection with an official investigation into high  level corruption within the union.

title: Men Charged With Kidnapping Of a Nephew of Carlo Gambino
description: Two men were charged yesterday with kidnapping Emanuel Gambino, the 29yearold nephew of Carlo Gambino, the reputed Mafia chieftain. Emanuel Gambino was last seen on May 18 and authorities believe he is dead.

title: UNION CARBIDE SETS COOLANT PRICE RISE
description: The Union Carbide Corporation announced yesterday higher 1973 bulk and packaged prices for custom brand ethylene glycol antifreeze and coolant.

title: Franco Is 80, and Spain Asks What Now
description: MADRID, Dec. 4Generalissimo Francisco Franco Bahamonde observed his 80th birthday quietly today with no indication that he was ready to end his 33year rule over Spain.

title: To Save the Witnesses: Evidence via Affidavit
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Philippines Frees 15 More Imprisoned Under Martial Law
description: QUEZON CITY, the Philippines, Dec. 4The Philippine Government today released 15 more persons who had been detained after the proclamation of martial law Sept. 21.

title: Echoes of Pushkin Square
description: On Dec. 5, 1965Soviet Constitution Daya small group of intellectuals assembled in Moscow's Pushkin Square, displaying the slogans Respect the Constitution  and We demand glasnost (public disclosure) for the trial of Sinyaysky and Daniel!

title: Featherbeds in TV Studios
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Hawaii to Play in Japan
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 4 (AP)The University of Hawaii football team will visit Japan in January for two games. The Rainbows, who had an 83 wonlost record this year, will play the Japanese intercollegiate AllStars Jan. 7 in Osaka and Jan. 15 in Tokyo.

title: 3 Boston Firemen Hurt
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)Three firemen were injured in a threealarm blaze that broke out in South Boston last night, causing heavy damage to twostory brick art studio.

title: F. C. WATKINS, 77, U.S. EXPRESSIONIST Winner of the Philadelphia Award in March Is Dead
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Dec. 4 (AP)  Franklin C. Watkins, an American artist whose paintings won critical acclaim in the United States and Europe, died today in a hospital here. He was 77 years old.

title: 49ers Are Beaten By Rams 26 to 16; Lose Division Lead
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (AP)Roman Gabriel threw a pair of touchtown passes and David Ray kicked four field goals tonight as the Los Angeles Rams beat the San Francisco 49ers, 2616, and knocked them out of the division lead in the National Football League's tightest race.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BELFAST Northern Ireland, Dec. 4 (Reuters)Northern Ireland's Social Democratic and Labor party, the main Roman Catholic party in the province, tonight called off a planned meeting with the British administrator, William Whitelaw, because of a security leak. The party had been hoping for talks on the future of Northern Ireland, including its suggestion that the province should be governed jointly by London and Dublin.

title: OBSERVER
description: A 135,000yearold ox bone with human writing on it has been found in France. The writing, according to The Associated Press, is a grouping of symbolic arcs, branches, angles and parallel lines, which proves, among other things, that even 135,000 years ago most people had trouble with French.

title: Lawyer Hurt in Car Blast
description: SCOTTSBORO, Ala., Dec. 4 (AP)W. Loy Campbell, 47yearold Scottsboro lawyer and former state legislator, was critically injured today when a dynamite bomb exploded as he tried to start his car in his driveway. Sherrif Bob Collins said he had absolutely nothing to go on in determining who did it.

title: Acupuncture Center Here Agrees to Cease Operation
description: The Acupuncture Center of New York, which has been under fire by the State Attorney General, agreed yesterday to go out of business.

title: Battle for Saravane Continues
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 4 (UPI)American officials said today that fighting for control of Saravane in southern Laos was continuing. Government troops were said to have driven occupying North Vietnamese troops to the northern tip of the town, killing 30.

title: Hill, Tackle on Offense, Defends Jets'
description: Winston Hill, the 6foot4inch, 270pound offensive tackle, came to the defense of the Jets' muchmaligned defense yesterday at the club's firstand10 luncheon at the Playboy Club.

title: Wallace Tells Democrats, Listen to the People
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 4 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace sent a fourpage letter, laced with appeals to listen to the people, to members of the Democratic National Committee today.

title: Adelphi Gains in Tourney
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Dec. 4 Adelphi scored a mild upset in the opening round of the Long Island Rotary tourney tonight, defeating Stony Brook State, 5648.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Months late, the Executive Club of the Republican party of New Jersey, whose members gave at least $100,000 to the reelection campaign of President Nixon, filed here last week the financialdisclosure, statement that Government officials said was required by Federal law.

title: Newark Searches Nation For Redden's Successor
Issue and Debate
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4  On Nov. 9 a group of demonstrators led by two State Assemblymen,. Anthony Imperiale and Frank Megaro, blocked construction workers from the site of the Kawaida Towers lowincome and middle  income housing project at 129141 Lincoln Avenue.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The Highway Action Coalition estimates that opening the massive Highway Trust Fund for some form of spending on mass transit projects is a more likely possibility during the coming year than ever before. But neither the coalition nor anyone else interested in slowing the highway juggernaut can afford to consider the victory inevitable.

title: Kansas City on Thin N.H.L. Ice
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (UPI)National Hockey League owners learned today that the new franchise holders for Kansas City may have trouble meeting requirements to begin competition in the 197475 season. There was speculation that Cincinnati might be chosen to replace Kansas City.

title: Carlo Gambino Summoned By Grand Jury in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 4Nassau County District Attorney William Cahn announced today that detectives of his rackets squad had served a subpoena last Saturday on a reputed Mafioso, Carlo Gambino, at Gambino's home in Massapequa.

title: Custom Tailor Is Accused Of Making Poor or No Suits
description: The city's Department of Consumer Affairs has begun legal action against a Manhattan custom tailor accused of failing to produce customman suits after demanding advance payments for them.

title: Frustration in Holland
description: Few developments are so frustrating for a democratic country as a national election that fails to break a serious political stalemate. More than 82 per cent of the voters went to the polls in the Netherlands last week; but the outcome left none of twentysix competing parties strong enough to form a workable Government on its own or with likely allies.

title: 2 More Banks Leaving Federal Reserve System
description: The trend for moderatesized banks to withdraw from the Federal Reserve System is accelerating.

title: Narcotics Smuggler Accused Of Threatening Witness in Jail
description: The Government charged yesterday that a convicted French heroin smuggler had threatened a key, witness in the trial of Auguste Joseph Ricord, an alleged overlord in narcotics traffic in the Western Hemisphere.

title: Thin Man Tests Knicks Tonight
description: If Nate Archibald can get into Madison Square Garden tonight, the smallest of the Kansas CityOmaha Kings, who will oppose the Knicks, will continue his remarkable quest of three National Basketball Association crowns.

title: 13 Interceptions Altered Gambling Star's Career
description: College Sports Notes

title: Police Escort 6 Workers To Kawaida Towers Site
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4  Six black laborers accompanied by policemen passed quickly through a wall of white pickets at the Kawaida Towers housing project site today, but the real test of the demonstrators' ability to block the construction failed to materialize.

title: CONFESSION ALLEGED IN FIRE ON CARRIER
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 4 (UPI) The Navy rested its case today in the courtmartial of Seaman Jeffrey G. Allison after prosecution witness testified that the 19yearold sailor had told him he set last July's $7.5million fire aboard the aircraft carrier Forrestal.

title: U.S. Reports Heavy Raids To Cut Enemy's Supplies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 5 (AP)  Heavy American bombing attacks were flown yesterday in the northernmost province of South Vietnam in an attempt to curb the resupply of North Vietnamese troops fighting a Government counteroffensive.

title: Cancer Center Slated at M.I.T.; Nobel Laureate Named as Head
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 4A major center of cancer research is to be established at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology under the leadership of Dr. Salvador E. Luria, the Nobel Prizewinning biologist.

title: Buchanan and Seeley Give 2 Koreans Ring Lessons
description: Esthetically, the night was a success for the South Koreans. Pugilistically, it was a disaster.

title: DR. QUEENIE BILBO
description: Dr. Queenie Bilbo, editor and author, died of cancer Sunday night at Roosevelt Hospital.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Lindsay Visits Lindsay Park

title: Power Plant to Be a Desalter, Too
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4  The Soviet Union has started up the world's first commercial atomic breeder reactor, using a nuclear process that has been described by its advocates as the most economical source of electrical power of the future.

title: Record Employe Bonuses Set in Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4 (UPI)Japanese companies will pay out a record 4.5 trillion yen ($1.5billion) in bonuses to employes at the end of the year, the Japan Federation of Employers estimated today.

title: Israeli Dancers Return to City Center
description: Vite, vite, vite. Director Wiliam Louther beat time to the Norman Dello Job music while five Israeli male dancers careened around their female partners. Faster, faster, he insisted, breaking into English, as the muscular young men, sweating and panting, swirled ecstatically.

title: Frederic W. Tipper Dies; Wool Merchant Was 96
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., Dec. 4Frederic W. Tipper, founder of a New York wool sales company bearing his name and owner of the Cascade Woolen Mills Company in Oakland, Me., died Saturday at a Cedar Grove nursing home. His age was 96 and he lived at 191 Fernwood Avenue.

title: New IndiaPakistan Meeting
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 4India and Pakistan will make another attempt to resolve the deadlock over the Kashmir ceasefire line, the Government said here today. The Defense Ministry said the Indian Army's Chief of Staff, Gen. S. H. F. J. Manekshaw, had accepted Pakistan's offer to meet Gen. Tikka Khan. The Pakistan radio said they would meet in Lahore Thursday.

title: BELGRADE'S VIEW OF U.S. TV IS DIM Popular Peyton Place Is Going Off Air in Spring
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 3  Are the melodramatic intrigues and scandals of rich and poor in Peyton Place, the small mill town in New England, subversive to a Marxist, workingclass Yugoslavia?

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, electrical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: Notes on People
description: Harvard is waiting for word from Henry A. Kissinger on his plans so it can decide whether to fill his vacant professorofgovernment post. Mr. Kissinger left Harvard in 1968 to become President Nixon's national security adviser, and the school's government, department has kept the slot temporarily open. But with the announcement that Mr. Kissinger would stay with the President, the prospect arose that somebody else would be taking his professorship.

title: Methodical State Majority Leader Warren Mattice Anderson
description: ALBANY, Dec. 4One of Warren Mattice Anderson's first decisions today as the new majority leader of the State Senate was an easyeven pleasant oneto make. It was to forsake the snow, the slush, the grayness and the cold of Albany tomorrow for a respite in Miami, where

title: Conflict in Greek Majority on Cyprus Is Imperiling Peace Efforts
description: NICOSIA, CyprusThe ethnic Turkish minority in Cyprus, where barbed wire and sandbags divide whole towns, is watching with apprehension a conflict within the Greek majority over peace talks and over the role of Archbishop Makarios, President since 1960.

title: Vietnam: A Lesson From History
description: The Presidential adviser, Henry A. Kissinger, flies to Paris, to Saigon, to Paris, and always back to Washington, saying, peace, peace, when there is no peace. The war in Indochina goes on, for there can finally be only one victor and one vanquished force in that struggle, and neither yet concedes defeat.

title: Chrysler Plans to Buy Its Entire British Unit
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (UPI)Chrysler Corporation, which plans to buy complete control of its British offshoot, Chrysler, U. K. Ltd., said today it would place its proposals before minority shareholders in the subsidiary.

title: KRISTOFFERSON IN SONG PROGRAM Talented Composer Shows Style With Charisma
description: In the first half of his performance Sunday night at Philharmonic Hall, Kris Kristofferson provedif it still needed provingthat he has become almost as effective a singer as he is a songwriter. In the second half he proved that too much laissezfaire mellowness and onstage intimacy can be a bad thing.

title: About Pro Football
description: Pro football's big event this Sunday will be in Bloomington, Minn., where the Vikings take on the Green Bay Packers in an event expected to settle the National Conference's Central Division title. The Packers are one game ahead of the Vikings and the Detroit Lions, whom they beat badly Sunday, 337. The Lions next play Buffalo. The following week Minnesota is at San Francisco, Detroit at Los Angeles and Green Bay at New Orleans.

title: Air Force Rejects Proposal That It Ground the F111A
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) The Air Force rejected today Senator William Proxmire's suggestion that the controversial F111A jet fighter should be grounded.

title: Aide Is Convinced Thieu Will Sign CeaseFire Pact
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4A Vietnamese source close to President Nguyen Van Thieu said today that he was convinced Mr. Thieu would sign the ceasefire agreement that is expected to emerge from this week's meetings between Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho.

title: Hashish in Bear Cages
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (Reuters)Fifty pounds of hashish, worth $220,000 on the black market, have been found in secret compartments of cages holding two Himalayan bears, the United States Customs Bureau said today. The bears were being taken from Nepal to a Californian animal farm. The drug was seized at Redding, Calif. Four persons were arrested on charges of smuggling hashish.

title: Liverpool, Tottenham Tie
description: LIVERPOOL, England, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur drew, 11 in an English Football League Cup quarterfinal tonight. The replay will be at Tottenham on Wednesday. The winners will meet Wolverhampton Wanderers in the semifinal.

title: Apollo 17 Fueling Spurred For Launching Tomorrow
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 14Technicians at the Apollo 17 launching pad quickened the tempo of preparations today for the nation's final mission to the moon in this decade.

title: People and Business
description: Eighteen years ago, George E. Johnson founded the Johnson Products Company with $250 of borrowed money. Yesterday he announced a gift of $1million for business education scholarships for minority students.

title: St. Peter's RalliesTo Win
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 4St. Peter's five got off a slow start, but bounded I back for a 7868 victory over Stonehill tonight before 2,689 fans at the Jersey City Armory.

title: Mr. Allende follows outline of speech
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 4 President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile came before the General Assembly today to charge that his country was the victim of serious aggression initiated by United States corporations, United States banking interests and United States governmental agencies.

title: To Eubie Blake, Near 90, All Numbers Are Songs
description: Eubie Blake, lively as a cricket, bubbling with joy and high spirits, gave another convincing demonstration at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday evening that life can begin all over again at 80.

title: KISSINGER AND THO MEET TWICE IN DAY AS TALKS RESUME Saigon Ambassador Says That the Negotiations Are in Their Final Phase 2 SIDES CONFER 5 HOURS New Session Is Scheduled for TodayHanoi Radio Reiterates Demands
description: PARIS, Dec. 4The Vietnam ceasefire talks were resumed once more here today.

title: Kawaida Towers Confrontation In the North Ward of Newark
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4On Nov. 9 a group of demonstrators led by two State Assemblymen, Anthony Imperiale and Frank Megaro, blocked construction workers from the site of the Kawaida Towers lowincome and middleincome housing project at 129141 Lincoln Avenue.

title: UNIT CITES ABUSE OF BARBITURATES Senate Subcommittee Sees Epidemic of Addictions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) A Senate subcommittee reported today that Americans' abuse of potentially deadly barbiturate drugs had reached epidemic proportions and was second only to alcohol as the most abused depressant.

title: OrganizedCrime Enforcer Gets 5Year Term for Perjury
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 4Daniel G. Sansans Sr., 64 years old, was sentenced to a maximum fiveyear prison term today by Judge John O. Henderspn in United States District Court here.

title: 3 Indicted in Restaurant Shakedowns
description: Three men were indicted yesterday on charges of systematic extortion in connection with an outbreak of violence and shootings in East Side restaurants in the last year.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: TURIN, Italy  Bruno Arcari, Italy, outpointed Everaldo Costa Azevedo, Brazil, 15 rounds, to retain World Boxing Council Junior welterweight crown.

title: Courtship of a 68 Athlete, 14, Begins
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Dec. 4 Wayne McKoy received a letter recently from the University of Tennessee. It was the first of hundreds of letters that are sure to follow with the same message: Remember us when it comes time to choose your college. It's the favorite term of the college recruiter.

title: Ski Group to Move Offices
description: BRATTLEBORO, Vt., Dec. 4 (AP)The board of directors of the Eastern Amateur Ski Association has voted to move the group's headquarters here next spring. The association has had its headquarters in Littleton, N.H., for 18 years.

title: 2 Clerks and a Counterman Seized in 1Million Bond Theft
description: Two clerks at the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company and a parttime counterman at a luncheonette were arrested yesterday and charged with stealing $1million in bonds issued by the Geenral Motors Acceptance Corporation.

title: Mr. Anderson in Albany
description: The cities are creatures of the state; the State of New York is largely guided by an Albany troika composed of the Governor, the Speaker of the Assembly and the majority leader of the Senate. Thus, State Senator Warren M. Anderson, a moderately conservative Republican who was elected majority leader yesterday, has now become one of the most powerful influences on life and politics in New York City and in the state.

title: Networks Planning Apollo Pool Despite Strike Threat to C.B.S.
description: The three major television networks made plans yesterday to use pool camera coverage of Wednesday's Apollo 17 launch at Cape Kennedy, despite threats that the presence of the strikebound Columbia Broadcasting System in the camera pool might create difficulties.

title: AUSTRALIA TO FREE DRAFT RESISTERS Incoming Labor Government Plans to End Conscription
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 4Young Australians who have refused military service have been given a virtual reprieve in anticipation of a promised repeal of the draft law by the incoming Labor Government of Gough Whitlam, the Prime Ministerdesignate.

title: MICHAEL E. J. FEDDEN
description: Michael E. J. Fedden, who retired as Chief Inspector in the Police Department in 1964 after 38 years of service, died Wednesday at his home, 18902 64th Avenue, Flushing, Queens. He was 71 years old.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Pratesi, the prestigious Italian firm that is to household linens what the Ferrari is to cars, has opened its first American shop on Madison Avenue at 69th Street.

title: Lake Placid Town Meeting Shows Interest in Olympics
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Dec. 4 (AP)About 70 per cent of the 350 persons at a town meeting tonight voted to have the town of North Elba formally commit itself to seeking approval of Lake Placid as the site of the 1976 Winter Olyirtpics.

title: Reverse Commuters Increasing
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2Charles Armstrong, an auto worker who lives in the city, jumped into a car on a recent Morning, picked up two fellow workers and in 20 minutes drove to work at a Ford assembly plant in a semirural area 21 miles outside the city.

title: Oil Rig Fire in Gulf Is Out
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 4 (AP) An erratic fire inland offshore oil rig, which started late yesterday with a well blowout and turned off and on during the day, went out by itself this afternoon, the Coast Guard reported. The blaze left a scorched wellhead and a film of oil extending about eight miles into the Gulf of Mexico near the mouth of the Mississippi River.

title: UPSTATER NAMED TO BRYDGES POST Anderson of Binghamton Is New State Senate Chief
description: ALBANY, Dec. 4Warren M. Anderson, Republican of Binghamton, was unanimously chosen today as the State Senate majority leader to replace Senator Earl W. Brydges of Niagara Falls, who did not seek reelection.

title: 62 NATIONS SEEK ACCORD ON COFFEE
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (UPI) Representatives of 62 nations met here today to decide the future of the International Coffee Agreement, which for 10 years has regulated the worldwide marketing of coffee.

title: McMahon Resigns
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Tuesday, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Australia's Governor General, Sir Paul Hasluck today called on Gough Whitlam, the Labor Party leader to form a new government.

title: YUVAL TRIO CONCERT IS HIGHLY SATISFYING
description: The members of the Yuval Trio have been playing together only since 1969, but these three Israeli musicians  Jonathan Zak, piano, Uri Planks, violin, and Simca. Heled, celloare already a polished ensemble. Their first appearance here was at Hunter College last season, and they returned to the Playhouse Sunday night for another highly satisfying concert.

title: Federal Court Approves Plan for Sale of Seeburg
description: The confused affairs of the Commonwealth United Corporation, a financially troubled conglomerate, were partially resolved yesterday with Federal Court approval of a plan for the sale of its major subsidiary, the Seeburg Corporation, to newly formed company called Seeburg Industries.

title: Whalers Get 4 Fast Goals In Downing Nationals, 72
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The New England Whalers struck for four goals in the first 12 minutes, then coasted to a 72 World Hockey Association victory over the Ottawa Nationals tonight.

title: Table on Nation's Decline in Births
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The following table shows the continuing decline in the number of births nationally and in the general fertility rate (births per thousand women of childbearing age, 15 to 44 years old):

title: 23 Hurt as Bus Flips
description: RENO, Dec. 4 (UPI) A Con tinental Trailways bus made complete flip on an icy highway today, injuring 23 persons. The Nevada Highway Patrol said the bus, going from San Francisco to Sparks, Nev., on lnterstate 80, skidded out of control flipped and landed on it wheels on the median strip.

title: TEXTILE UNIT SOLD BY UNION CARBIDE Fiberbond Corp. Buys Back Business in Nonwovens
description: Merger News

title: U.S. Asks a Firm. Agenda In Europe Security Parley
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 4The United States asserted today that a conference on European security and cooperation should remove some of the real impediments to the free exchange of contacts and information between East and West.

title: LAIRD TELLS OF RISE IN PENTAGON BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that the budget for the Pentagon in the next fiscal year would be increased to more than $80billion.

title: Cigar Test Finds Smoke Accompanied by Fervor
description: The Wine and Food Society of New York, whose members burn with a consuming zeal, met for a cigartasting last night.

title: Nassau Jail Guards Say Cahn Attempted Bribery Entrapment
description: MINEOLA, L. I.,The president of the Nassau County Correction Officers Benevolent Association, John DeCarolis, charged today that the Nassau County District Attorney had planted an informer in the county jail to entrap guards by offering to give them rewards in exchange for favors.

title: For a Strong Freedom of Information Act
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Woman Adrift: She, Too, Needs A Place to Stay
description: Her name is Elizabeth Mary, and she sat in a corner of the city's only shelter for women derelicts, talking about happier times. She is 64 years old, she conceded, and her hair is blondfadedtowhite, her lips bright red, her face still attractive despite the ravages of booze and time.

title: CAR MAKERS PLAN 18% RISE IN OUTPUT 2.6 Million Assemblies Set for First Quarter28% Gain Seen for Trucks
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4  The automobile industry is planning to build more than 2.6 million cars in the first quarter of next year, which would be an 18 per cent increase from this year's first quarter.

title: 2 ExCity Aides Sentenced In Municipal Loan Bribery
description: Two former borough superintendents for the Municipal Loan Program was sentenced yesterday to three years each in prison.

title: TENTATIVE ACCORD IN SHIPPING STRIKE Deck Officers Must Ratify West Coast Settlement
description: A tentative agreement ending! a 41day strike by deck officers against West Coast ship owners was announced here yesterday, after a weekend of intensive bargaining.

title: Amphetamine and Ethics The Lack of Complaints About Some Medical Practices. Points Up Issues
description: News Analysis

title: Hospital League Elects
description: Andrew R. Portelli, associate administrator and director of human resources at the Long Island Jewish Medical Center, has been elected president of the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes of New York, the league announced yesterday.

title: Publisher Allowed Change Of Name to Macmillan, Inc.
description: Crowell Collier and Macmillan, Inc., a New York publishing concern, was granted permission yesterday to change its name to Macmillan, Inc., pending the outcome of a legal battle with Macmillan, Ltd., of London.

title: Simon Collection on View at Princeton
description: The current show of the Norton Simon, Inc., Museum Collection at the Princeton University Art Museum marks the first public display of the collection almost in its entirety.

title: REV. M. J. CURLEY, 72, OF REDEMPTORISTS
description: The Rev. Michael J. Curley, historian of the Baltimore province of the Redemptorist order of the Roman Catholic Church, covering the Northeastern United States, died of brain cancer Sunday in Lutheran Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 72 years old and lived at the rectory of Our Lady of Perpetual Help Church in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn.

title: School Bars Bormann's Son
description: MUHLDORF, West Germany, Dec. 4 (AP)  Adolf Martin Bormann, eldest son of Hitler's deputy, has been rejected as a teacher of religion by a vocational school in this city. No reason for the rejection was announced. The application had been supported by the Munich Roman Catholic archdiocese. Mr. Bormann, a former monk, once served in the Congo for the Fathers of the Sacred Heart. He left the priesthood to marry.

title: Dow Average Rises by 3.09 PointsTrading Heavy
description: The stock market continued churning yesterday at a high level in heavy trading. Most of the popular price indicators climbed to record highs.

title: COURT ORDER BARS RAZING OF CRAVES Enjoins Cemetery in Hudson From Leveling MarkersInvestigation to Open
Exterminating Poison Stolen
description: Herman Weinstein of East Bruswick, N. J., an exterminationservice salesman, reported to the police yesterday that his fiber case, containing six types of liquid and powder exeterminating poisons, was grabbed from his hand at 9:30 A.M. as he boarded an IRT subway train, at Lexintgon Avenue and 51st Street. There were no markings on the case that contained the poisons.

title: Suffolk Downs Statistics
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)Suffolk Downs, which closed its 1972 racing season yesterday, reported total attendance for the 42day meeting of 297,749 and a total handle of $24,500,871. The 1973 meeting begins Dec. 30 and ends July 11.

title: Inmate Termed Executed
description: WALPOLE, Mass., Dec. 4 (AP) An inmate at the State Prison here whose stabbed body was found in his bed yesterday was the victim of a planned execution, according to District Attorney George Burke. He made the assertion today as investigators continued their inquiry into the death of Robert Bennett, 22 years old, of Boston.

title: Aide Is Convinced Thieu Will Sign CeaseFire Pact
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4A Vietnamese source close to President Nguyen Van Thieu said today that he was convinced Mr. Thieu would sign the ceasefire agreement that is expected to emerge from this week's meetings between Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho.

title: HAROLD P. BOCK DIES; A HOTEL LEADER, 72
description: RICHFIELD, Conn., Dec. 4Harold P. Bock, who retired last year as vice president and general manager of the Carlyle Hotel in New York, died of cancer yesterday in Danbury Hospital. His age was 72.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Supreme Court refused today to consider overturning the settlement that has been made with stockholders of the Dreyfus Fund, following the sale to the public of stock in the Dreyfus Corporation, the investment adviser to the fund.

title: City Charges 22 Food Outlets With Violations of Health Code
description: The city's Health Department yesterday named 22 restaurants and other food establishments charged with serious violations of the Health Code.

title: Books of The Times
description: Another Christmas coming up, another pile of books at hand. The following, while not necessarily published as gift books, struck me as unusual items I'd want to get or give this year. They are listed in the approximate order of their price.

title: Talking in Korea
description: The slow pace of negotiations between the regimes of North and South Korea need provoke neither surprise nor dismay. It is still little short of stunning that these longimplacable rivals are in fact talking to each other at all.

title: Size of U.S. Force In Vietnam 25,500, 1,500 Below Quota
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4  American troop strength in South Vietnam dropped to 25,500 at the beginning of this month1,500 fewer men than President Nixon's authorization of 27,000, the United States command announced today.

title: EL PASO WEIGHS NEW GAS PIPELINE Examines the Possibility of a 790MileLong Facility South Across Alaska CUT IN COSTS EXPECTED Liquefication Would Be Done at Unspecified Port on State's South Shore
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The El Paso Natural Gas Company announced today that it was examining the possibility of building a 790mile natural gas pipeline southward across Alaska from the prolific oil and gas fields at Prudhoe Bay, on the North Slope.

title: Advertising:
description: Smithsonian magazine is a young magazine backed by years of experience. It appears to help.

title: COURT ON HOUSING IS HELD IMPERILED Botein Says Lack of Funds May Hinder Prosecution After April 1 Opening
description: The failure of the Mayor, the Governor and the Legislature to provide funds for the newly established housing part of Civil Court, former Judge Bernard Botein warned yesterday, poses the threat that there will be no agency in the city to prosecute most housing violations after April 1.

title: Fairfield Beats Seton Hall
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Dec. 4 (AP)  George Groom led the attack with 27 points tonight as Fairfield University defeated Seton Hall, 8271.

title: Court Complexity: Probation Check Delays the Sentencing
description: To show how the courts in the city handle the flood of criminal cases, most so routine that they go unreported, one case was chosen at random and followed from beginning to end. This is the last of three articles.

title: NURSE SHOT 8 TIMES IN A MONEY DISPUTE
description: A 35yearold nurse was shot eight times last night in a Bronx nursing home after arguing with an elevator operator about $255 she owed him, the police said.

title: Massage Parlors Provoke Threat To Shut Theaters
description: Charging the City Council with having abandoned the Times Square area to prostitution, Alexander H. Cohen, the Broadway producer, yesterday threatened a protest shutdown of some theaters on March 31 unless the Council showed good faith and passed a bill to license massage parlors.

title: Stage: Gaines's Off Broadway Wilder!
description: Frederick Gaines's Wilde!, which was presented last night at the Theater de Lys as part of Lucille Lortel's Matinee Series, takes place before and during the death of Oscar Wilde. Unlike Dear Oscar, which played briefly off Broadway earlier this season, Wilder is not a musical, but a seriousalthough somewhat romanticimpressionistic drama.

title: Mother and 4 Die in Fire
description: MIZPAH, Minn., Dec. 4 (UPI) A woman and her four children died in a fire that destroyed their northern Minnesota farm home early today. The victims were Mrs. Ronald Vernlund, 26 years old, and her children, Rhonda, 7; Melissa, 5; Kimberly, 3, and Timothy, 1. Mrs. Verniund's husband, Ronald, and Ronald's brother, John, escaped by jumping from secondstory window.

title: S.E.C. Refuses to Get Involved In Dispute on Silver Dollar Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission refuses to get involved in a dispute over the manner in, which the Federal Government is advertising an auction of 2.3 million silver dollars.

title: Typecast to Be Sold at Auction
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 4 (UPI)More than 140 thoroughbreds owned by the estate of the late Fletcher Jones, owner of Westerly Stud, will be sold at auction at Hollywood Park Jan. 28.

title: Cordero Banned 20 Days, Giving Idle Velasquez Title
description: Jorge Velasquez, enjoying a short vacation in Europe, gained the New York State jockey championship by default yesterday. The Panamanian rider backed into the title, as the result of a 20day suspension handed his nearest rival, Angel Cordero.

title: Eligible Receiver
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Dec. 4New Jersey will be represented by a personable Passaic County merchant when 11 new members are inducted into football's Hall of Fame tomorrow night at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel in New York. Angelo Bertelli, Notre Dame's star quarterback of the World War II era, is in the group.

title: German Weighs Legal Step on Bormann
description: BAD HOMBURG, West Germany, Dec. 4Documents concerning Martin Bormann collected by the author Ladislas Farago have persuaded a West German state prosecutor to consider reopening warcrimes proceedings as a means of obtaining the extradition from South America of a man who is said to be the missing Nazi leader.

title: Chess: Rules to Win End Games by? Start With, There Are None
description: There's always been a lot of talk about technique in chess, and 90 per cent of it is misleading. I don't remember every having heard anyone use the terms opening technique or middlegame techniquefor the creative character of those phases is only too apparent but someone is sure to sling the term endgame technique around.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Tickets may be obtained at the public desk, main lobby, United Nations Headquarters. Tours: 9 A.M. to 4:45 P.M.

title: Nigeria Opens $20Million Stadium
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 4 (Agence FrancePresse) Nigeria's $20million 60,000seat National Stadium and sports complexsite for next month's AllAfrican Games was officially opened today and Gen. Yakubu Gowon marked the event with a 15yard dashpursued by a startled West German Ambassador.

title: BOYCOTT STILL ON IN 13 CITY SCHOOLS Possibility of More Funds Is Seen for E. Harlem Area
description: East Harlem parents kept 13 schools closed yesterday in a continuing protest against school budget cuts. In Brooklyn, parent boycotts virtually emptied two schools.

title: U.S. Issues Rules on Plane Emissions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Environmental Protection Agency announced today its longawaited and overdue proposals to limit the emission of air pollutants from aircraft engines.

title: Ahlers Says His Last Word As the Spokesman for Bonn
description: BONN, Dec. 4State Secretary Conrad Ahlers, a spokesman for the West German Government for the last six years, held his farewell news conference today. He was elected to the lower house of parliament on Nov. 19 as a Social Democratic member from the RhinelandPalatinate.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: Pacific Southwest Airlines announced yesterday that it had signed a definite contract with the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation for the purchase of five L1011 Tristar jetlines valued at about $100million. The airline said that two of the jetliners will be delivered in the spring of 1974, and the other three will be delivered during 1975 and 1976. Pacific Southwest added that financing of the purchase consists of $18million from the sale of stock in 1971, proceeds from aircraft sales and new borrowings yet to be arranged.

title: Boston Club Honors Jauron
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The Gridiron Club of Greater Boston said today it had selected Dick Jauron of Yale as the 34th winner of the Bulger Lowe award as the outstanding college football player in New England. The award will be presented Dec. 12 at the awards dinner.

title: Incendiary Device Damages An Unoccupied Police Car
description: An unoccupied police radio car was slightly damaged yesterday in the explosion of small incendiary device that had been placed on a door handle.

title: L.I.R.R. Talk Deadlocked; Most Commuters Make It
description: Union and management negotiators remained deadlocked yesterday in the fifth day of the Long Island Rail Road strike, but commuters appeared to have been successful, for the most part, in finding alternative ways of getting to and from work.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Elizabeth Crackdown Planned

title: Armed Forces Commander Seizes Power in Honduras in a Bloodless Coup
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Dec. 4 (AP)The Honduran Army overthrew President Ramn E. Cruz before dawn today and installed the commander of the armed forces as President for the five remaining years or the presidential term. No violence was reported.

title: Baltimore Is Pressing Its Port Rivalry Here
description: Port Notes

title: Market Place: U.S. Financial Adjusts Income
description: U.S. Financial Inc., a, West Coast company that produces, finances and Markets a variety of, types of housing, asked the New York Stock Exchange yesterday to allow trading to resume in its securities.

title: Bristol Wins in Rugby Union
description: BRISTOL, England, Dec. (Reuters)  Bristol beat Newport, 2910, in a Rugby Union match tonight.

title: Amphetamines in Medications
description: A patient who is concerned that the medication administered or prescribed by his physician might contain amphetamines can most easily find out by directly asking the doctor.

title: Two Get Life for Setting Montreal Nightclub Fire
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4 (UPI)Two unemployed laborers were sentenced to life imprisonment today for setting a nightclub fire on Sept. 1, in which 37 persons were killed and 54 injured.

title: Indian Story Told Through Fashion
description: Linda Little Eagle, a high school freshman in Tenafly, N.J., wore her own white fringed buckskin dress down the runway in the Hotel Americanas' grand ballrcom at lunchtime yesterday. Linda is a CherokeeSioux Indian.

title: Apollo Crew to Get More Restricted Potassium Diet
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 4The Apollo 17 astronauts, in the last Apollo flight to the moon, will have less potassium to digest than their predecessors did, but they will be watching their total fluid intake and outgo much more carefully.

title: L.I.R.R. Talk Deadlocked; Most Commuters Make It
description: Union and management negotiators remained deadlocked yesterday in the fifth day of the Long Island Rail Road strike, but commuters appeared to have been successful, for the most part, in finding alternative ways of getting to and from work.

title: TARASEWICZ SHOWS ENJOYMENT OF SONG
description: Billed as the First Tenor of the State Operetta in Warsaw, Richard Tarasewicz came to Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night with a lightweight program of Lehar, Kalman and Stolz tunes (in Polish), Ebb Tide (in English, of sorts) and assorted other pop and operetta numbers by Polish composers. He has a confident, relaxed manner that made it seem entirely logical to sing while strolling around the stage, and his joking rapport with the audience added further to the easy informality of the evening.

title: LUMBERPRICE PACT IS RESCINDED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) The Price Commission revoked a pricing agreement with a large lumber concern today, in pushing its crackdown on illegal practices in the lumber industry.

title: Reformist Toronto Candidates Stage Upset Victory in Election
description: OTTAWA, Tuesday, Dec. 5 Reformist candidates who campaigned against the bulldozer development of their city won an upset victory in municipal elections in Toronto last night.

title: Ohio State 8175 Victor
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 4 (AP)  Allan Hornyak, senior guard, scored half of Ohio State's 12 points in overtime tonight as the 15thranked Buckeyes struggled past Notre Dame, 8175.

title: In the Beginning, Miller's Creation
description: Hal Holbrook and Barbara Harris, at left, the original Lucifer and Eve. Susan Batson, at right, who replaced Miss Harris, and in turn was replaced, below, by Zoe Caldwell, while George Grizzard played Lucifer.

title: $400Million Suit Names Calley and the Government
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (Reuters)A lawyer hired by leaders of the Buddhist movement in South Vietnam has filed a $400million suit in Federal court here, seeking damages from First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. and the United States Government.

title: WEARY ISLANDERS FACE KINGS NEXT Take 6Game Loss Streak Onto Nassau Ice Tonight
description: Gerry Desjardins, who has stopped so many shots as the Islanders' goalie that he says, I'm starting to look like a puck  black and blue, probably will be called on tonight to halt a sixgame losing streak when the New Yorkers face the Los Angeles Kings at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: GALLEY'S LAWYERS DEFEND KILLINGS They Say Victims Were Not Clearly Noncombatants
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., Dec. 4 Attorneys for First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. argued today that the slain villagers of Mylai 4 did not qualify for protection as prisoners of war wider international law because they were not recognizable as noncombatants at a distance.

title: Our NotSoSilent Superprosecutor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: M'GOVERNATTENDS FUND DINNER HERE He Slips Unannounced and Almost Unnoticed Into City
description: Senator George McGovern, minus the scores of newsmen, aides and Secret Service agents who escorted him for nearly a year, slipped into New York last night almost unannounced and unnoticed.

title: WHITE HOUSE ROLE ON INDIAN SCORED House Panel Calls Conduct Dictatorial Nonsense,
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The White House was accused today of usurping the Congressionally delegated authority of the Secretary of the Interior as a House panel opened an Investi gation into the Indian takeover and ransacking of the Bureau of. Indian Affairs last month.

title: A.E.C. Staff Report Backs Nuclear Plant for LILCO Need for the Power Is Said to Outweigh Any Damage to EnvironmentExaminers Open Hearings
description: CENTEREACH, L. I., Dec. 4 An Atomic Energy Commission staff report made available here today recommends that the Long Island Lighting Company be allowed to build an 820megawatt nuclear power plant at Shoreham, adjacent to Long Island Sound.

title: British Reserves Rose in November; Pound Unaffected
