description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (UPI)Britain's gold and dollar reserves, which back the pound sterling, rose $36million in November to $5,895,000,000 at the end of the month, the British Treasury reported today.

title: Pact Is Terminated By Stereotypers At 4 Papers Here
description: New York Stereotypers Union No. 1 yesterday became the third union to notify the city's four major daily, newspapers that it was terminating its contract because the Federal Pay Board had reduced the wage increase put into effect last March.

title: BlueGray Coaches Picked
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 4 (UPI)Vince Gibson of Kansas State and Charley Coffey of Virginia Tech were named today to coach the North and South teams in the annual BlueGray football game here Dec. 27.

title: Cougars Defeat Chaparrals As Cunningham Sets Pace
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4 (AP)Billy Cunningham scored 28 points and Mike Calvin 19, tonight as the Carolina Cougars defeated the. Dallas Chaparrals in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Taiwan Bars a Candidate, Charging Lack of Education
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 4 (AP) A Taiwanese doctor who has been critical of the Government announced today that he had been told to stop campaigning for a parliamentary seat because he was insufficiently educated.

title: 3 Indicted in Restaurant Shakedowns
description: Three men were indicted yesterday on charges of systematic extortion in connection with an outbreak of violence and shootings in East Side restaurants in the last year.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Norway Seeks Free Trade With E.E.C.
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 4 (AP)Norway officially asked today for a free trade agreement with the European Economic Community on industrial goods. She also sought special aid for her exports on newsprint, fish and special steels.

title: Watergate Trial Judge Indicates Political Aspects of Case Will Be Examined
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The judge in the Watergate case said today that one of the crucial issues in the forthcoming trial Would be the motives behind the bugging of the offices of the Democratic National Committee last June.

title: GIANTS NOW LOOK TOMMY JOHNSON He Is Expected to Replace Snead at Quarterback for. Contest With Dolphins
description: The quarterback situation of the New. York Giants is right back where it was on Sept. 18, and that's why it is reasonable to expect Randy Johnson to get the starting assignment over Norm Snead on Sunday against Miami here.

title: SunKollsman Delay
description: Special stockholder meetings of the Sun Chemical Corporation and Standard Kollsman Industries, Inc., scheduled yesterday to approve their merger, have been postponed until Dec. 15.

title: PARLEY PAYMENT IS BARRED 2D TIME Beame Won't Honor Bills for Tarrytown Talks
description: The office of Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday refusedfor the second time in a weekto honor bills submitted by a Bronx community school district for outoftown weekend conferences.

title: Rise in Earnings and Revenues Reported by Utah International
Music Chamber Society Offers a Quartet by Faure
description: Choosing other music to stand beside Schubert's glorious Quintet in C for Strings (Op. 163) is not easy. Not only in its Brucknerian length but also in its eloquence the work tends to dwarf most other chamber music. Certainly, Faur's Quartet No. 2 in G minor for Piano and Strings (Op. 45) inhabits a different world: though it sprawls as much as the Schubert, it never adds up to much beyond endless sequences of pretty, rather weak phrases.

title: Duke of Windsor Leaves $18,800 Estate in England
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (AP)The Duke of Windsor, who once ruled England as King Edward VIII, left an estate in England and Wales valued at about $18,800.

title: AllorNone Policy on Sabbath To Be Demanded by Alexander's
description: The management of the Alexander's departmentstore chain said yesterday that it would serve a demand on every law enforcement official in the City of New York to close up every store that had been open on Sundays without a specific exemption from Sabbath closing laws.

title: Nation's Births Show Drop. Below ZeroGrowth Level Federal Statistics for Nine Months Give Rate of 2.08 Children a Family NoIncrease Figure Is 2.1
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Fertility in the United States has dropped, for the first time, below the replacement level 2.1 children a family that is necessary to achieve zero population growth.

title: VIEW INTO FUTURE IN COMPUTER ART National Endowment Unit Holds Forum for Media
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The advent of an arts media revolution was the theme of a marathon production of light and sound presented to several hundred artists, critics and interested citizens on the first day of a symposium convened last weekend by the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: PASARELL SCORES 60, 61 VICTORY Seewagen Beats Froehling HereRalston Wins
description: A kind of loveless tennis came to town yesterday. Under the name of the Clean Air Tennis Classic and with a purse of $75,000, the sevenday tournament at the Seventh Regiment Armory features the Van Alen Simplified Scoring System (VASSS).

title: Cohen Is Israeli Show Host
description: Myron Cohen will be the host star of The Grand Music Hall of Israel, scheduled to open a twoweek engagement at the Felt Forum of Madison Square Garden on Jan. 4. The show is composed of 36 performers from Israel. Jonathan Karmon has conceived and staged it.

title: Bormann's Power During War Was Second Only to Fuhrer's
description: In the turbulent years of World War II from 1941 to 1945, Martin Bormann had no personal forces at his command, no public appeal and virtually no allies in the court of Adolf Hitler. But his power in the Third Reich was second only to that of his Fhrer, and he used it ruthlessly, according to historians.

title: Swiss Envoy to Cuba Coming To See Rogers About Hijacking
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The State Department said today, that the Swiss Ambassador to Cuba was flying to Washington to consult with American officials tomorrow on the progress so far in the negotiations with Cuba for an agreement against hijacking of airliners.

title: KADISH LUZ, 77, DIES; EXKNESSET SPEAKER
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4 (UPI)Kadish Luz,, a former speaker of the Israeli Knesset (Parliament) and Minister of Agriculture, died today in Kfar Sava. He was 77 years old. He served in the post for more than 10 years before retiring in 1969 to his kibbutz home in Degania Bet near the Sea of Galilee.

title: Change at Jamaica Now Means Crush Hour at Subway There
description: Ten thousand commuters in excess of the normal rushhour total poured through the 179th Street IND subway terminal in Jamaica, Queens, both morning and evening yesterday.

title: Commodity Futures Soar
description: A combination of factors sent agricultural commodity futures prices soaring yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The factors included bad weather, possible crop losses and boommg export business.

title: Mythology and Metaphors
description: Letters to the Editor

title: New Faces, Some Quite Old, Enliven Japanese Campaign
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4The candidate for Parliament stood atop the station wagon with a microphone in his hand to appeal for votes among the shoppers darting in and out of the small stores that lined the narrow street.

title: Gaza Free Entry Allowed
description: GAZA, Dec. 4 (AP)  Arab vehicles were allowed to pass freely in and out of the Israelioccupied Gaza Strip today for the first time since the 1967 war. Arabs formerly were required to stop at Israeli checkpoints. The new rule resulted from a relaxation of tension in the 30milelong strip, the Israelis said.

title: Hood Ornament Makes Comeback
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4It may be nostalgia, man's craving to be a little different from his neighbor, or even a secret expression of sexuality.

title: In the Beginning, Miller's Creation
description: Once they have been signed for a part, actors are able to whip themselves into spirals of enthusiasm for even the creakiest play. So imagine the euphoria that enfolded the nine players who were chosen last summer for the cast of Arthur Miller's The Creation of the World and Other Business.

title: U.S.C. WINS TITLE IN COACHES'
description: Southern California, whose 110 wonlost record was the only perfect mark in the country by a major college this season, yesterday was named unanimously by the United Press International board of coaches as the 1972 college national champion.

title: WHARTON STUDY SET FOR SAVINGS BANKS
description: The National Association of Mutual Savings Banks, which is holding its annual midyear meeting yesterday and today at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, has hired the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania to conduct a study of the viability of its own members.

title: October Turnover Slowed For Checking Accounts
description: The turnover of checking accounts at the nation's banks slowed somewhat in October after reaching a record high the month before, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday. Demand deposits turned over at annual rate of 86.7 times, down from 88.7 times in September, largely due to a marked drop in deposit activity at New York City banks.

title: 4 POLICEMEN SHOT IN NARCOTICS HUNT
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (UPI)Four plainclothes policemen investigating a narcotics operation were wounded today, one of them critically, when they stopped a car on the city's northwest side and three men jumped out of the car and started shooting.

title: Trevino, With $214,805, Is 2d in '72 Golf Earnings
description: Leo Trevino again finished second to Jack Nicklaus in yearly earnings, the Professional Golfers' Association Tournament Players Division announced yesterday. Trevino won $214,805 and George Archer finished third with $145,027.

title: Soviet Said to Give Dissident Biologist A Visa for Britain
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4 (AP) Reliable sources said today that Zhores A. Medvedev, the wellknown biologist and champion of civil rights, had been given permission to leave the Soviet Union and spend a year at a British university.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It must be obvious by now that the Jets have little respect for the verities. They prefer fictional endings and even had the gall last Sunday to offer one of the most preposterous finishing touches of all. It might have been more believable if they had used the gifted throwing arm of Joe Namath or the power running of John Riggins. Instead, they elected to strain credulity to the limit by asking their British import, Bobby Howfield, to kick them into a lastsecond victory.

title: Commuter Service: Much Has Been Accomplished
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Bridge: TeacherWriter and Novelist Put Together Lively Dialogue
Head of G. A. O. Calls Housing Subsidy Program Unfair
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Elmer B. Staats, the head of the General Accounting Office, said today that recipients of federally funded housing subsidies and the taxpayers who underwrite them were both being seriously shortchanged.

title: Personalities: Purdue Shuffles
description: Bob DeMoss, who has spent 26 of his 45 years as player and coach at Purdue, resigned yesterday as head football coach. He will become an assistant athletic director under George King Jr., while Ray Eddy, the current athletic director, was named an associate director. It's gotten to the point where football was taking 100 per cent of my time, said DeMoss, and my family deserves better than that:

title: Jury Weighs Bribery Case Against Lawyer Here
description: Jury deliberations began yesterday in the trial of Edmund A. Rosner on charges of paying, bribes to obtain grandjury testimony and other confidential information about Federal investigations.

title: Personalities: Purdue Shuffles
description: Bob DeMoss, who has spent 26 of his 45 years as player and coach at Purdue, resigned yesterday as head football coach. He will become an assistant athletic director under George King Jr., while Ray Eddy, the current athletic director, was named an associate director. It's gotten to the point where football was taking 100 per cent of my time, said DeMoss, and my family deserves better than that.

title: 2 Jewish Groups Picket Japan Air Lines Offices
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith and the Jewish War Veterans yesterday started a weeklong demonstration in front of the Japan Air Lines office at Fifth Avenue and 52d Street to protest what they said was the airline's participation in the Arab economic boycott of Israel.

title: COMPANY FORECAST ON FINANCES URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4An advocate of the rights of investors of moderate means today endorsed the idea that companies be required to make public their internal forecasts of sales and earnings.

title: Policemen in Newark Escort Six Workers to Kawaida Site
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4Six black laborers accompanied by policemen, passed quickly through a wall of white pickets at the Kawaida Towers housing project site today, but the real test of the demonstrators' ability to block the construction failed to materialize.

title: Music: Soprano's Spell
description: Elisabeth Schwarzkopf is a grand illusionist. Her recital on Sunday night at Carnegie Hall put to shame most of the wouldbe lieder singers currently before the public, even though many of them could have handled the purely technical problems of her program more securely and accurately than the imimperious soprano did. Miss Schwarzkopf, who will be 57 years old this week, persuaded one that her flaws were virtues, and that is magicianship of the sort great lieder singers deal in.

title: Hood Ornament Makes Comeback
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4It may be nostalgia, man's craving to be a little different from his neighbor, or even a secret expression of sexuality.

title: CONGRESS VIEWED AS A NEAR RELIC ExSenator Tells Reformers to Become Disagreeable
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Young Congressional reformers were advised today by a former Senator to become disagreeable in a friendly way to their seniors if they expect to get anywhere.

title: Military Law and Order
description: After the embattled carrier Kitty Hawk docked in San Diego the other day following a recordlong tour of war duty off Vietnam, crewmen indicated that one of the principal causes of a bloody racial fracas at sea had been the belief of black sailors that they had been subjected to unequal disciplinary treatment.

title: Wood Field and Stream. A Warning to Women's Lib Movement: Beware of the Wrasse Syndrome
description: The standardbearers of the women's liberation movement would do wellunless their goal is also malehood  to consider the plight of Labroides dimitiatus, better known as wrasse.

title: 23 Freight Cars Derailed
description: ALLENTOWN, Dec. 4 (AP)Twentythree cars of a 90car Lehigh Valley Railroad freight train derailed north of here early yesterday, scattering wreckage for several hundred feet.

title: Equity Financing
description: Western Air Lines Inc. announced filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission a secondary offering of 500,000 shares of its capital stock all of which are outstanding and being sold by Kirk Kerkorian. Mr. Kerkorian presently owns 3,635,238 shares or about 27 per cent of Western Air Lines shares outstanding after giving effect to a 2forone stock split effective Oct. 31, 1972. The proposed sale would reduce Mr. Kerkorian's holding to 3,135,238 or about 23 per cent of the outstanding shares. Salomon Brothers will manage the underwriting which is expected later this month. Western Air Lines closed at 15, down 1 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: JUSTICES REFUSE STATE'S OTB CASE Decision Backing New York System Left StandingTrack Owners Rebuffed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Supreme Court refused to review today a lower court decision that New York State's offtrack betting system was constitutional.

title: Apollo 17 Fueling Spurred For Launching Tomorrow
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 4Technicians at the Apollo 17 launching pad quickened the tempo of preparations today for the nation's final mission to the moon in this decade.

title: Vice Adm. Harold Martin, Comanded First Fleet
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 4 (AP)Vice Admiral Harold M. Martin, former commander of the First and Seventh Fleets in the Pacific, died here last night at the Naval Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: TV: Young Marrieds Couple Takes a Wife, Movie on A.B.C., Has Charm Here and There
description: It won't take long to see what's ahead in The Couple Takes a Wife, when two nice young marrieds like Paula Prentiss and Bill Bixbywith two office careers and two childrenhire a delectable blonde like Valerie Perrine as a superhousekeeper. Yes, it's the old story coming up and that's not spoiling the plot of tonight's Tuesday Movie of the Week at 8:30 over the American Broadcasting Company network.

title: DraftEvasion Compromise Favored by Most in Poll
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (AP)Only a quarter of Californians surveyed in a poll favored punishing draft evaders to the maximum extent permitted under law.

title: RAY'S LAWYERS OPEN BID FOR A NEW TRIAL
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 4 (AP)Attorneys for James Earl Ray filed a petition today in Federal court requesting a hearing that would allow Ray to withdraw his plea of guilty in the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: On Sanctifying C.B.S.
description: Letters to the Editor

title: BRITAIN AND IRELAND TRADE DATA ON I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 4 (AP)Irish and British security chiefs exchanged information today in a campaign to trap dozens of commanders of the Irish Republican Army who are now reported to be fleeing to England and Northern Ireland to evade arrest in the Irish Republic.

title: Kewal Singh Replaces Kaul As Indian Foreign Secretary
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 4  T. N. Kaul retired today as Foreign Secretary. The Government named Kewal Singh his successor.

title: John Carter Vincent Dies; Specialist on China Policy
description: John Carter Vincent, a China specialist and former director of the State Department's Office of Far Eastern Affairs, died Sunday night of lung failure at Mount Auburn Hospital, Cambridge, Mass. He was 72 years told and had lived in Cambridge since 1953, when he was summarily retired from the department by Secretary of State John Foster Dulles.

title: Tax Plan Decried In N.A.M. Survey Of Multinationals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Two widely supported proposals to raise taxes on the overseas operations of multinational companies would create serious adverse impacts at home and reduce United States competitiveness abroad, a new survey concluded today.

title: HANOI TROOP PLAN SAID TO BE ISSUE AT PEACE PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Wellplaced Administration officials report that Henry A. Kissinger is raising questions with North Vietnamese negotiators in Paris about intelligence reports showing that Hanoi, after a ceasefire, intends to hide much of its army in South Vietnam in Vietcong units.

title: Guidelines Proposed On Courthouse Photos
description: TRENTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) The State Supreme Court proposed guidelines today limiiting photographs in the State House Annex, where the Supreme and Superior Courts and the state grand jury room are situated.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Liquor Delivery Resumes in 3 Counties

title: Police Are Warned Against Accepting Holiday Gratuities
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy threatened yesterday to suspend or arrest any policeman who accepted a Christmas gift as a gratuity.

title: 98 Indicted on Draft Charges As Upstate Jury Clears Docket
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 5A Federal grand jury indicted 98 young men here today on charges that they violated the Selective Service Law and United States Attorney John T. Elfvin said he expected about 100 more indictments on similar charges within the next few weeks.

title: Truman in Hospital
description: Former President Harry S. Truman, 88 years old, was admitted to a hospital in Kansas City, Mo., yesterday. Doctors said his lungs were congested and described his condition as fair Page 53.

title: Buses From L.I. to City
description: Following is a list of bus services available to Nassau and Suffolk County commuters to subway stops in Queens:

title: Professor Toynbee Looks to the Future
description: LONDON, Dec. 5The end of the year is a time for summing up and looking forward, and since Arnold Toynbee, the British historian, has been keeping book on the human race for most of his 83 years, it seemed reasonable to look him up in St. James's Square for a personal judgment about where we all now stand.

title: A.T. & T. to Accept Shares Of New England Telephone
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company said yesterday it would begin today accepting shares of New England Telephone and Telegraph Company common stock for deposit under its exchange offer.

title: U.S.Cuban Hijacking Pact Would Cover Ships as Well
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The State Department said today that the United States and Cuba had agreed in principle that their proposed accord to curb hijackings should cover ships as well as planes.

title: U.M.W. Vote Goes On
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 5 (UPI)Miners in smaller coalproducing states began voting today on the fifth day of an eightday Governmentmonitored election to select a president of the 205,000 member United Mine Workers of America.

title: TV Network Schedule On Covering Launching
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 5 (AP)Following is how the three major television networks will cover the Apollo 17 launching at 9:53 P.M. tomorrow. All times are Eastern standard.

title: G.O.P. GOVERNORS ASK TO MEET NIXON
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 5 Fearful that their influence on party policy might be declining, the nation's Republican Governors called today for a summit meeting with President Nixon.

title: ARMY IN TURKEY IN FIRM CONTROL
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 2By the Constitution, elected civilians are supposed to run the country, but if you look at Turkish affairs in practical termsthe newspaper editor's voice trailed off.

title: A Huge Loyalty Rally Is Staged in Mekong Delta
description: CANTHO, Vietnam, Dec. 5 (UPI)  About 200,000 South Vietnamese Government workers staged a widespread series of demonstrations today to denounce Communism in general and the Vietcong in particular.

title: Secondary Offering by Gulf Oil Is Among the Largest Ever Sold
description: A huge block of stock in the Gulf Oil Corporation was sold yesterday in one of the largest secondary offerings of common stock on record.

title: $250,00 Bail Upstate Is Set for California Man
description: UTICA, N. Y., Dec. 5 (AP)A California man was held in lieu of $250,000 bail in the Oneida County jail today after his arrest by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents on a warrant charging unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.

title: PLISE ?? wonderful years, two marvelous children. Love, Jerry.Advt.
U.S. EXPECTS RISE IN PLANT OUTLAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Business investment in plant and equipment in the first half of next year is expected to be 12 per cent higher than in the first half of this year and 8 per cent higher than in the 1972 second half, the first Government survey of this important sector of the economy disclosed today.

title: Panthers Run Bus Service To Halt Muggings of Aged
description: OAKLAND, Calif. Dec. 5 (UPI) The Black Panthers have announced a new bus and escort service designed to protect senior citizens from muggings.

title: PUBLISHER IS HELD BY MANILA REGIME
description: MANILA, Dec. 5While the Philippine Government has released 30 persons detained after the proclamation of martial law in September, others are still being held, among them some whose arrest has not been officially announced.

title: Truman in Hospital
description: Former President Harry S. Truman, 88 years old, was admitted to a hospital in Kansas City, Mo., yesterday. Doctors said his lungs were congested and described his condition as fair. Page 53.

title: City Sells New Bond Issue At Lowest Rate in 4 Years
description: New York City sold a $293,980,000 bond issue yesterday at its lowest average rate of interest in more than four years 4.98 per cent.

title: BRACCIALE RIDES 4 LAUREL WINNERS
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 5Vincent Bracciale Jr., Laurel Race Course's leading jockey, helped himself today before starting a theday suspension by riding four winners, including Joseph Kaplowitz's Interwood in the 1116mile feature.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: VALDO LEE FREEMAN
description: Valdo Lee Freeman, a producer, director and performer in Negro operas, died on Monday of a heart attack at his home, 137 West 130th Street. He was 72 years old.

title: Skier. 16, Killed in Fall
description: GRAZ, Austria, Dec. 5 (AP) A 16yearold member of the Austrian junior ski team was killed and another seriously injured today when they fell in downhill training on the Hochwurzen Mountain.

title: STRIKE STRANDS FREIGHT CARGOES
description: Nearly 400 carloads of freight, including 80 to 100 with food destined for Long Island stores, have been stranded in Long Island Rail Road freight yards because of the strike.

title: New Mexico Wins, 8867
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 5 (AP)  New Mexico opened the second half with 13 consecutive points, then coasted to an 8867 victory over foulplagued New Mexico State before 15,139 fans tonight.

title: H.U.D. Chief With a Personality James Thomas Lynn
description: Man in the News

title: Helmet Night Slated For Westbury Friday
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Dec. 5 Helmet Night, old hat at baseball games, but an innovation on a betting program at a local harness racing track, will be one of the highlights of Friday night's card at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: GOVERNOR URGED TO JOIN RAIL TALK
description: The Striking Long Island Rail Road unions urged Governor Rockefeller yesterday to enter the dispute, but they warned him that they required more money than has been offered to settle.

title: Texan Indicted in Slayings
description: GREENVILLE, Tex., Dec. 5 (AP)A Hunt County grand jury indicted today Danny McCrary, 19 years old, a member of the family being investigated in connection with 22 slayings in six states, on the charges of murder with malice.

title: 2,001 of 2,630 Applicants Pass Written Part of State Bar Exam Given in July
PARLEY IS SOUGHT BY BLACK CAUCUS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Members of the Congressional Black Caucus called today for a meeting as soon as possible with the newly nominated Secetary of Defense, Elliot L. Richardson, to work on problems of mounting tensions among the races in the armed forces.

title: Allende Sees Boumediene On His Way to Moscow Talk
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 5  President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile arrived in Algiers today for a 19hour stopover on his way to Moscow and held more than three hours of conversations with Algeria's president, Houari Boumediene.

title: Three Prisoners Captured
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J., Dec. 5 (AP)Three prisoners, who along with nine others escaped from the Bucks County Prison in Doylestown, Pa., last Thursday, were captured by the New Jersey state police at a motel near here last night. They were identified as George Stagmeier of Trenton; David G. Vandermay of Levittown, Pa., and John J. Konewal of Philadelphia.

title: Pan Am Plans Offering
description: Pan American World Airways, Inc., announced yesterday plans for an offering of $75million of convertible subordinated debentures. The issues, expected in the latter half of next month, will be sold through an underwriting group headed by Lehman Brothers.

title: Canada Withholds Decision
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 5  Mitchell W. Sharp, Secretary of State for External Affairs, said yesterday that Canada was still in no posititon to commit herself to providing troops for a peacekeeping role in Indochina.

title: Author Concedes He Did Not Verify Report of a Bormann Visit to Argentina
description: Ladislas Farago, the writer, said yesterday that he had heard in Uruguay but had not been able to check the detailed account of an alleged visit by Martin Bormann to Argentina. The account formed the opening of his recent series of articles asserting that the former top Hitler aide was alive and prospering in South America.

title: Wall Street Boom Apparently Won't Include Bonuses
description: It's Christmas bonus season again on Wall Street. Stock prices and volume have been booming, but the boom apparently will not extend to bonus payments.

title: Mobile Aid Is Making WelfareHotel Life a Little Better
description: In a number of ways  the isolation of its tenants, the poverty, alcoholism and drug addiction that are apparentthe Harvard Residence Club at 304 West 99th Street and a nameless hotel at 207 West 85th Street are similar. Both are single  room  occupancy dwellings.

title: North Carolina Sets Mark Routing Dartmouth, 12886
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Dec. 5 (AP)North Carolina broke away midway in the first half tonight and set a school scoring record with a 12886 basketball rout of Dartmouth.

title: Less Peculiar Hours Proposed for British Pubs
description: LONDON, Dec. 5A longawaited report today proposed a major easing of Britain's drinking laws to allow longer hours for pubs and the admission of children under certain conditions.

title: Leonard G. Feldmann, 63, Dies; Buffalo CourierExpress Editor
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 5Leonard G. Feldmann, managing editor of The Buffalo CourierExpress since 1948 and past president of the New York State Society of Newspaper Editors, died last night in a hospital here. Mr. Feldmann, who was 63 years old, suffered injuries in a fall on Nov. 22 in his home in the town of Tonawanda.

title: Rights of the Fetus
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Postal Service Offers Christmas Mail Guide
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) If packages are not mailed by Sunday, they may not arrive in time for Christmas, the United States Postal Service said today. And to have Christmas cards delivered by Dec. 25 they should be mailed within 10 days, it was said.

title: New York, Jersey and Connecticut Face Loss of $40Million in Revenue Sharing Under New U.S. Plan
description: New York, New Jersey and Connecticut face the withholding of $40,870,000 in Federal welfare sharing for the next six months in a crackdown that angered some officials yesterday.

title: Rodgers of Nebraska Voted Winner of Heisman Trophy
Charter Group on Bus Tour Sees Brooklyn's Good and Bad Points
description: The City Charter Revision Commission began its visit to Brooklyn yesterday with a long bus tour that made a dozen stops along the way to take on informed and talkative neighborhood leaders.

title: City Plans Night Checks On SingleRoom Buildings
description: Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton announced yesterday plans to have the city start evening and latenight inspections of singleroomoccupancy facilities to check on crime.

title: Ulster Workman, Taken for Sniper, Shot and Killed
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 5 (AP)Guerrillas of the Irish Republican Army staged attacks in Northern Ireland with rockets, bombs and sniper fire today. Two bricklayers working atop a building in Belfast were mistaken by British soldiers for snipers and were shot, one fatally.

title: Brazil Reports Seizing 7 in Drive on Subversives
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 5A Brazilian official said tonight that four newsmen, an engineer, a professor and a university student had been arrested in recent weeks as part of a major new drive by the militaryGovernment against subversive activities.

title: 200 Rowdy Students Snarl IND Line for a Half Hour
description: About 200 rowdy highschool students pulled the emergency cord several times on a northbound IND A train yesterday morning between 181st Street and 190th Street in Washington Heights. The train halted each time.

title: Helena, Ark., an Embryonic Center of Music
description: HELENA, Ark., Dec. 5A hundred years from now, when history records how this Mississippi River town of 21,422 persons became a famous musical center during the last quarter of the 20th century, there is a risk that the story will be dismissed as a Jack and the beanstalk legend.

title: U.S. HOUSING PLANS SCORED BY A MAYOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Roman S. Gribbs, the Mayor of Detroit, told a Congressional subcommittee today that in his view the Federal housing program was frequently underfunded and sometimes misdirected and mismanaged.

title: LAST OF APOLLOS SET FOR LIFTOFF TO MOON TONIGHT
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 5Apollo 17, the nation's last planned flight to the moon for years to come, was declared ready today for its fiery nighttime launching, a promised spectacle of blazing light scheduled for 9:53 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Soviet Annual Honors Silenced Poets
description: MOSCOWThe names of Anna Akhmatova and Osip Mandelstam are legendary to Soviet poetry lovers, but so rarely are their works in print that even the briefest selections cause a sellout in hours.

title: P.O.W. Wives Await Peace With Joy and Dread
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The knowledge that a ceasefire in Southeast Asia may truly be at hand has thrown the families of the 1,268 missing Americans and 554 prisoners of war onto the cruelest of rollercoasters, swooping between exhilaration and dread.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Carnegie Study Urges Colleges To Help Cities Meet Problems
description: The Carnegie Commission on Higher Education, in the latest of its massive studies of American colleges and universities, recommended yesterday that urban campuses deepen their involvement in bigcity problems and increase the access of urban dwellers to higher education opportunities.

title: Wilber Named Coast Pilot
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 5 (UPI)Del Wilber, a former catcher who has been in organized baseball since 1938, will manage the Portland Beavers of the Pacific Coast League next season, the owneroperator of the club, Bilyl Cutler announced today. Wilber managed the Texas Rangers' triple A farm team at Denver for the past two seasons.

title: Slaying Suspect, 91, Wins Freedom After 22 Years
description: A 91yearold defendant in a Dutchess County murder who has spent 22 years in state mental institutions has been ordered freed because the District Attorney's office has admitted that it has no evidence against him.

title: U.S. SURVEY SEES TIMBER SHORTAGE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  In a study released today, the United States Forest Service said that, under present management practices in the nation's forests, the timber supply would fall short of demand well before the turn of the century.

title: Javits Asks Nixonto Act on Trade
description: People and Business

title: CANARSIE DEVISES NEW ZONING PLAN
description: The local school board in Canarsie  where racial friction led to a boycott, picket lines and a whiteblack confrontationmoved yesterday to keep black children from the Tilden Houses from entering junior high school in Canarsie by 1975.

title: Burlington Plans Approved
description: Directors of Burlington Northern, Inc., yesterday approved Plans to spend $135million in 1973 for new rolling stock and other capital improvements, with provisions for the acquisition of 30 locomotives and 650 boxcars prior to Jan. 1.

title: Justices Back State Bans On Sex Acts in Nightclubs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Supreme Court ruled today that a state can deprive a nightclub of its liquor license for permitting acts of gross sexuality among its entertainers, waitresses and patrons.

title: U.S. Again Offers Help on Suez Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 5The United States renewed its offer today to help Egypt and Israel negotiate an interim agreement for reopening the Suez Canal.

title: First TV College Course In State to Begin Jan. 11
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5Three New Jersey colleges, in conjunction with WNET, the Public Educational Television station, will offer a college course for credit on television for the first time in this state.

title: To Some Hog Farmers, Cholera Spells Finis
description: NEW JERSEY

title: DETROIT POSTPONES CLOSING OF SCHOOLS
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5  Detroit's school board canceled a plan today that would have kept schools here closed for two months starting Dec. 21.

title: World Cup Skiing Shifted
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 5 (UPI)  Poor snow conditions forced organizers today to change the order of races at the season's first World Cup ski meet at this winter resort. It was decided to advance the women's downhill, the first event, to Thursday from Saturday. The men's giant slalom will be held Friday, the women's special slalom Saturday and the men's downhill Sunday,

title: Judge in I.B.M. Case To Scrutinize LiftOff
description: A Federal judge will take a close look at the Apollo 17 liftoff tonight at Cape Kennedy, Fla., to help him assess the Government's contention that the International Business Machines Corporation has a monopoly in the computer business.

title: Winged Foot Golfers Card 59
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 5 Winged Foot Country Club of Mamaroneck, N. Y., shared the lead at 12 under par after first round of the Bermuda Goodwill golf tournament today. The Winged Foot foursome of Dave Marad, Dr. Albert Roberto, James Ryan and Jack Cassidy carded a net score of 59 at Port Royal course. A field of 130 teams from the United States, Canada, Britain and the West Indies are competing over four courses in the tournament that ends Friday.

title: Where Is The Ice Drifting?
description: PARISThe world has now spun into a curiously intricate era of multipolarity. Some Western alliances are being buried, just as the SinoSoviet pact was long ago interred, and others face alteration. Various power coalitions suddenly find themselves pitted against each other in differing patterns on differing issues and on differing occasions.

title: Unionized University
description: The stalemated negotiations between the Board of Higher Education and the Professional Staff Congress over a new contract for the City University's 17,000member instructional staff involve no ordinary labormanagement confrontation.

title: Gibson Reports H. U. D. Backs Newark's Model Cities Budget
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson announced today that the city's troubled Model Cities program had received approval from the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development for continued financing of its $5.6million annual budget until Nov. 1, 1973.

title: The View From Hanoi
description: HANOI, North VietnamThere is growing skepticism in North Vietnam about Washington's willingness to sign the ninepoint peace agreement or to implement it, if signed.

title: U.S. Opens Case Against Alleged Kingpin of Heroin Ring and Outlines Smuggling Route
description: The Federal Government said yesterday that it had conclusive proof of a complete cycle of a complex heroinsmuggling conspiracy masterminded by Auguste Joseph Ricord, allegedly an overlord of drug trafficking in the Western Hemisphere.

title: HANOI TROOP PLAN SAID TO BE ISSUE AT PEACE PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Wellplaced Administration officials report that Henry A. Kissinger is raising questions with North Vietnamese negotiators in Paris about intelligence reports showing that Hanoi, after a ceasefire, intends to hide much of its army in South Vietnam in Vietcong units.

title: James Lynn H.U.D. Chief; Morton Stays at Interior
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  President Nixon announced today that he would appoint James T. Lynn, Under Secretary of Commerce, to be Secretary of Housing and Urban Development in Mr. Nixon's secondterm Cabinet, and that Rogers C. B. Morton would stay on as Secretary of the Interior.

title: U.S. SEEKING DATA ON INDIAN FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Government has repeatedly but unsuccessfully sought an accounting of $60,000 it gave to Indians who occupied the Bureau of Indian Affairs building last month, Congressional investigators were told today.

title: 169 Dead, 2,500 Homeless As Storm Hits Philippines
description: MANILA, Dec. 5 (AP)  A tropical storm blew out of the Philippines and into the South China Sea today, leaving at least 169 persons dead and nearly 2,500 persons homeless.

title: Three Prisoners Captured
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J., Dec. 5 (AP)Three prisoners, who along with nine others escaped from the Bucks County Prison in Doylestown, Pa., last Thursday, were captured by the New Jersey state police at a motel near here last night. They were identified as George Stagmeier of Trenton; David G. Vandermay of Levittown, Pa., and John J. Konewal of Philadelphia.

title: U.S. Subsidy Programs
description: Economic Analysis

title: Rich and Beautiful Help to Raise Funds at Dalton School Auction
description: The Dalton School held an auction Monday night, selling off things that brought in $49,525 for a scholarship fund. There was a Cadillac, for instance, and a West Highland terrier puppy. The Cadillac went for $6,500; the puppy fetched $250.

title: BUS PLAN OFFERED BY CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 5  In an effort to get Connecticut's crippled bus transportation system rolling again, Gov. Thomas J. Meskill's administration offered last night to subsidize fully all bus operating deficits over a 12month period in cities that agreed to set up their own transit districts.

title: S.E.C. Halts Trading in U.S. Financial
description: Business Briefs

title: Court Bars Ruling in Nader Appeal
description: HARTFORD, Conn., Dec. 5 (AP)The state Supreme Court refused today to order a Superior Court judge to rule on the issues in Ralph Nader's attempt to dissolve the merger of the Hartford Fire Insurance Company and the International Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: Turn Off the Motor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: TeenAge Abortion Rate
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 5 (UPI) More than onethird of the legal abortions performed in Washington state last year were performed on teenage girls, according to a study by University of Washington specialists. There were 14,295 abortions performed with 4,092 on teenagers.

title: Jazz: Saxophone Sextet
description: The challenge involved in bringing together six saxophonists for a jam session called Saxophone Summit, which Jazz Interactions did on Monday evening at the Village Gate, is not one that faces only the saxophonists. It also applies to the listener: how many successive, long, somewhat similar saxophone solos can one listen to?

title: Squibb to Sell British Unit
description: The Squibb Corporation and Gnrale Occidentale, S.A., of France announced yesterday they had agreed in principle on the sale of the baby food operations of Squibb's BeechNut subsidiary to Cavenham, Ltd., of England, an affiliate of Gnrale Occidentale.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Sanitationmen Seeking Unpegged Pay
description: John J. DeLury, the president of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, began a major campaign yesterday to break the pattern that has tied Sanitationmen's wages to those of policemen and firemen.

title: Kohl Calls Request By Jersey Central For Aid Too Costly
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5 (AP)State Transportation Commissioner John C. Kohl said today that requests by the Central Railroad of New Jersey for increased subsidies were excessive and would not be met.

title: For Parents, a Psychologist Explains the Baby's Point of View
description: Tenweekold William was sleeping off his bottle in his mother's arms as a small group of young parents with their infants gathered one evening recently in a corridor of New York Hospital. They were about to start a short course designed to make the first year of their babies' lives easier, both for the infants and for themselves.

title: Maple Aids Research but Loses 3 Races
description: While Angel Cordero and Laffit Pincay brought home three straight winners each, Eddie Maple rode three losers at Aqueduct yesterday in the cause of research.

title: Viewers Arrive Early to Watch Last Moon Shot
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 5Harrison T. Tracy, a retired Air Force tech sergeant from Hope Mills, N. C., squinted into the horizon, pointed a meaty finger and drawled:

title: Player X to Testify on Bribe Attempt at House Inquiry
description: Player X, the athlete currently performing in the National Football League who was allegedly offered a $10,000 bribe by a former teammate, will testify early next year before the House Select Committee on Crime, according to the committee's counsel, Joe Phillips. The un

title: James Lynn H.U.D. Chief; Morton Stays at Interior
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 President Nixon announced today that he would appoint James T. Lynn, Under Secretary of Commerce, to be Secretary of Housing and Urban Development in Mr. Nixon's secondterm Cabinet, and that Rogers C. B. Morton would stay on as Secretary of the Interior.

title: Market Place: Skills Needed For Arbitrage
description: Small investors  and even big oneshave had little opportunity to invest on one basis that has provided partners of brokerage firms with one of their most reliable sources of steady income.

title: Marshall Rites Tomorrow
description: A memorial service for Lawrence Clark Marshall, retired vice chairman of the board of the Chase Manhattan Bank, will be. held tomorrow at 11 A.M. at St. James' Episcopal Church, Madison Avenue at 71st Street. Mr. Marshall, who retired in 1969, died in Sarasota, Fla., on Nov. 29 at the age of 68.

title: LAST OF APOLLOS SET FOR LIFTOFF TO MOON TONIGHT
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 5Apollo 17, the nation's last planned flight to the moon for years to come, was declared ready today for its fiery nighttime launching, a promised spectacle of blazing light scheduled for 9:53 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Kenny Dorham, Trumpeter; Early Exponent of BeBop
description: Kenny Dorham, a jazz trumpeter, leader and composer who was an early exponent of the bebop style, died yesterday at his home, 528 Riverside Drive. He was 48 years old and had been suffering from a kidney disorder.

title: RIGGINS OF JETS HASKNEE SURGERY
description: John Riggins, the New York Jets leading rusher, was operated on for an articular fracture of his right kneecap by Dr. James Nicholas, the team physician, at Lenox Hill Hospital yesterday.

title: TRUMAN ENTERS HOSPITAL AGAIN
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 5 (AP)Former President Harry S. Truman was hospitalized today with a congestion of the lungs. His condition was described as fair.

title: Medical Unit to Weigh Filing of Charges Against Dr. Jacobson
description: The Medical Society of the County of New York said yesterday that its Board of Censors would discuss tomorrow whether to bring charges against Dr. Max Jacobson in connection with his practice of prescribing amphetamines.

title: CORNELIA CHAPIN, SCULPTOR, WAS 80
description: Cornelia Van Auken Chapin, a sculptor whose Christ the King adorns the high altar at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine here, died Monday night at her home in Lakeville, Conn. She was 80 years old.

title: Advertising:
description: Three marketing men from the Block Drug Company, Jersey City's No. 1 advertiser and the country's 83d, came to town yesterday. It was a trip they wouldn't have taken two short years ago.

title: Five Indicted Here, Accused of Dealing In Stolen U.S. Bonds
description: A threemonth investigation by District Attorney Frank S. Hogan's office into the appearance here of thousands of United States Savings Bonds stolen from all over the country led to the indictment and arrest of five men yesterday.

title: RCA Will Use Canada's Message Satellite
description: TORONTO, Dec. 5  Canada's domestic satellite company has authorized the use of one of its satellites for domestic communications within the United States, it was announced today.

title: Laotian Gain Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 5 (AP)A United States spokesman said today that Laotian troops had fought their way back to the center of the strategic Boloven Plateau in southern Laos.

title: Tapes Link Police to Bribery by the Mob
description: Excerpts from conversations in the headquarters of the reputed Mafia captain Paul Vario Sr., which was bugged for six months earlier this year by the office of Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold, show that the Vario organization used policemen for everything from fixing cases to getting coffee.

title: Justices Back State Bans On Sex Acts in Nightclubs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Supreme Court ruled today that a state can deprive a nightclub of its liquor license for permitting acts of gross sexuality among its entertainers, waitresses and patrons.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Pacific Gas and Electric Company announced yesterday a public offering of 2 million shares of 8 per cent redeemable first preferred stock of $25 par value at $27.875 a share through underwriters headed by Dean Witter & Co. Inc. and Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. Inc. The shares are redeemable by the company at $30 a share prior to Feb. 1, 1978; thereafter and prior to Feb. 1, 1983 at $29 a share; thereafter and prior to Feb. 1, 1988 at $28 a share and thereafter at $28 a share, plus accrued dividends in each instance.

title: Goodyear to Push Steel Radial Tires
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, the most important holdout against the growing trend to radial tires in the United States, announced yesterday four lines of steelbelted radial tires.

title: L.S.U. Trips Memphis State
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 5 (AP)Eddie Talubinskas tallied 32 points for Louisiana State as the Tigers upset Memphis State, 9481, tonight.

title: Football Foundation Cites Ford Here
description: The National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame kicked off the postseason banquet circuit last night at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel by giving its top annual awards to Representative Gerald Ford, Republican of Michigan, the House minority leader, and Dr. Jerome H. (Brud) Holland, former Ambassador to Sweden.

title: Boycotted Schools Ask 2Million More
description: Officials of the East Harlem school district, where a parent boycott over what they call poor school conditions has kept 13 schools closed, said yesterday that they would need a minimum of $2million in additional funds this year to make any significant improvements in the schools.

title: EL PASO GAS PLAN MEETS CRITICISM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  United States officials reacted skeptically today to a suggestion that natural gas from northern Alaska be transported across Alaska by pipeline and then by tanker ship to the West Coast.

title: PARIS TRUCE TALK PUT OFF FOR A DAY
description: PARIS, Dec. 5The Vietnam ceasefire meeting scheduled for today was suddenly canceled this morning, and both the American and North Vietnamese delegations announced that they would meet tomorrow morning at 10:30.

title: Daley Associate Favors Strauss as Democratic Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Representative Dan Rostenkowski, an Illinois Democrat and often the voice of Chicago's Mayor Richard J. Daley, endorsed Robert Strauss of Texas today to head the Democratic National Committee.

title: Dr. Pepper TV Ads Have a Ball
description: According to the Sunday society pages Mary Wells Lawrence of Wells, Rich, Greene, was quite the hit at a charity ball in Dallas. Well, let it be noted here that Edward N. Ney, the chief of Young & Rubicam, did all right at the Hotel Diplomat, in fashionable West 43d Street Monday night.

title: Boy, 10, Hangs Himself In Bedroom of L.I. Home
description: SEAFORD, L. I., Dec. 5 (UPI)The Nassau County police reported the death early today of John Mueller, a 10yearboy, who they said had hanged himself in a bedroom in his family's home at 3669 Nimrod Street, Seaford.

title: Laos Premier Hopeful on Peace But Says Hanoi Troops Must Go
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 5Prince Souvanna Phouma, Premier of Laos, expressed the belief today that there was a chance peace would soon return to Indochina but he reiterated his Government's intention to fight on unless North Vietnamese troops left Laos.

title: Brief Moscow Protest Staged by 25 Dissidents
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5 (AP)The noted physicist Andrei D. Sakharov and 24 more political dissidents held a silent demonstration in Pushkin Square tonight.

title: Quarterback Is a Giant Problem
description: Alex Webster, who had been leaning toward Randy Johnson as the Giants' starting quarterback for Sunday's game against unbeaten Miami, tilted himself back toward the center yesterday.

title: Voters Exhibit Good Sense
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Japan to Cut Car Exports
description: TOKYO, Dec. 5The Japanese Government adopted program today to restrict exports of automobiles and motorcycles under a revised export tradecontrol ordinance, scheduled to begin Jan. 1.

title: Food for Thought
description: ORADELL, N. J., Dec. 5Hagler's, situated at the intersection of Kinderkamack Road and Ridgewood Avenue, is a Bergen County landmark. I never figured how many people a day come through the diner, restaurant and bar. George Hagler says, but it's got to be more than a thousand.

title: Court Orders Biaggi to Return Surety Concern's $100,000 Fee
description: Representative Mario Biaggi, a Bronx Democrat and an undeclared candidate for Mayor, was ordered by State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday to return $100,000 in legal fees paid by an ailing insurance company that unsuccessfully fought to remain in business.

title: JAMES M. BECK DIES; A SOCIETY FIGURE, 80
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 James M. Beck, long prominent in society in New York, London and Newport, died in a hospital here yesterday. He was 80 years old and resided at Plaisance, a villa in Newport, R. I., and until recently at 300 Park Avenue in New York.

title: Dow Index Drops 4.07 as Volume Slips Highs Top Lows
Judge Here Limits Coverage of a Trial
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn ordered a reporter for The Daily News yesterday to restrict his coverage of the extortion trial of Harry Davidoff, secretarytreasurer of a teamsters union local at Kennedy international Airport.

title: Praise for a Woman F.B.I. Agent
description: Notes on People

title: Statement by Dr. Jacobson
description: I could detail the inaccuracies and the distortions which disfigure every page of The New York Times article of Dec. 4. But it would be tedious and pointless to do so.

title: Raiders Beat Aeros, 64, Paced by Peacosh, Ward
Uneasy Peace in Sudan: President Is the Keystone
description: JUBA, the Sudan, Nov. 22Eight months after the conclusion of the peace agreement that ended the long civil war in the Sudan, it remains a fragile matter of personal trust between President Gaafar alNimeiry and the leaders of the formerly secessionist south.

title: G.M. of Canada Weighs 1973 Prices
description: Business Briefs

title: Supreme Court Reform
description: Letters to the Editor

title: KNICKS SET BACK KINGS, 125 TO 103; 26 FOR ARCHIBALD
Judge Here Limits Coverage of a Trial
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn ordered a reporter for The Daily News yesterday to restrict his coverage of the extortion trial of Harry Davidoff, secretarytreasurer of a teamsters union local at Kennedy International Airport.

title: P.O.W. Wives Await Peace With Joy and Dread
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The knowledge that a ceasefire in Southeast Asia may truly be at hand has thrown the families of the 1,268 missing Americans and 554 prisoners of war onto the cruelest of rollercoasters, swooping between exhilaration and dread.

title: NEW LEADER ENDS AUSTRALIAN DRAFT
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 5 The new Government of Prime Minister Gough Whitlam today announced an end to the military draft and steps to establish diplomatic relations with China.

title: NATION IS TERMED BADLY NOURISHED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Americans have turned into a nation of nutritional illiterates who know so little about what to eat that the annual cost of malnutrition among rich and poor alike may be $30billion, several experts told a Senate committee today.

title: Court Delays Order By Safety Agency For Auto Air Bags
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 5A Federal court told the United States Government today to delay implementation of standards requiring air bag safety devices in automobiles produced after Aug. 15, 1975.

title: Barry Sparks Warriors
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 5 (AP) Rick Barry scored 8 points in the final five minutes tonight to lead the Golden State Warriors to a 108101 victory over the Houston Rockets.

title: Rogers to Assure NATO On U.S. Troop Strength
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that he would stress to the North Atlantic alliance that despite the current improvement in EastWest relations, the United States would not reduce its troop strength in Europe until some, reciprocal agreement was reached with the Soviet Union.

title: Allison Honored as Race Driver of Year
description: Bobby Allison of Hueytown, Ala., whose purses have totaled more than $500,000 in the last two years, was honored at Gallagher's Restaurant on 52d Street yesterday as the Martini & Rossi auto racing driver of the year. A check for $7,500 accompanied the trophy. The check was promptly pocketed by petite, blond Judy Allison, the wife of Bobby and the mother of their four youngsters.

title: MacPherson, Jauron Feted
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 (AP)Dick MacPherson of the University of Massachusetts was honored as New England's coach of the year and Dick Jauron of Yale as the area's outstanding player at the annual awards luncheon today of the New England College Football Writers Association.

title: APOLLO TO CARRY 5 MICE FOR TESTS
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 5Five brown and white desert mice, formerly of Palm Springs, Calif., will accompany the astronauts to the moon on Apollo 17 so that men can learn more about the special hazards of interplanetary space flight.

title: Sales of New Cars Boom
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5The boom in car sales continued in late November, with the four auto manufacturers reporting record retail deliveries for the period Nov. 2130 and for the full month.

title: Mother of 4 Dies After Fire
description: STRATFORD, Conn., Dec. 5 (AP)Mrs. Andrew Kupec Jr., a 43yearold mother of four, died early today after being found in a burning chair in her home. Firemen said they found Mrs. Kupec unconscious in the living room. They rescued four children ranging in age from 3 to 13 from the second floor, one by a ladder and three down the stairs. Mr. Kupec was at work.

title: Fighting Continues in South
description: MANILA, Dec. 5 (AP)Despite the use of jet fighter planes and artillery, Philippine Army forces have reportedly suffered severe casualties in attempts to put down a Moslem uprising in the southern Philippines.

title: HOUSING VENTURE SET UP BY SEARS
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co., the nation's largest retailer, is going into the housing business.

title: BULLDOZER LOSES IN TORONTO VOTE
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 5The bulldozer lost out yesterday in Toronto's municipal election.

title: Moseley Aboard 4 Winners
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 5 (AP)  Jimmy Moseley rode Mr. Poverty to a nose triumph today in the feature race at Liberty Bell for his fourth triumph of the day.

title: G. P. MONTGOMERY, BANKER, DIES AT 87
description: George P. Montgomery, a former vice president of the Seamen's Bank for Savings, died in Roosevelt Hospital on Sunday. He was 87 years old and lived at 173 East 80th Street.

title: Van Buren Ceremony Draws 6 to Gravesite
description: KINDERHOOK, N. Y., Dec. 5 (AP)The local American Legion was annoyed at having to wait an hour in the cold last year and several local residents decided they could not wait any longer this year, so only six persons attended the annual wreathlaying ceremony today at the gravesite of President Martin Van Buren, who was born Dec. 5, 1782.

title: Charter Group on Bus Tour Sees Brooklyn's Good and Bad Points
description: The City Charter Revision Commission began its visit to Brooklyn yesterday with a long bus tour that made a dozen stops along the way to take on informed and talkative neighborhood leaders.

title: Takers Crush Bucks
description: LOS ANGELES, (AP)  Gail Goodrich sparked a thirdperiod flurry tonight with 10 of his 24 points and the Los Angeles Lakers routed the Milwaukee Bucks, 11694.

title: SAIGON'S AIRPORT IS HIT BY ROCKETS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 6 (AP)Vietcong gunners rocketed Saigon's big Tansonnhut air base shortly after dawn Wednesday, killing one American and wounding nine others.

title: Population at 209,298,000
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) The Census Bureau estimated today that the American population reached 209,298,000 Oct. 1, up 159,000 from Sept. 1. The population was up 1.7 million from Oct. 1, 1971, or 0.8 per cent.

title: Marian Williston Smith, 57, Held Posts at 2 Colleges
description: Buffalo, Dec. 5Marian Williston Smith, who had been admissions director at Elmira and Barnard Colleges, died of cancer at her home here yesterday. Her age was 57.

title: Police Question C.B.S. Workers Over Reported Violence at Shea
description: The police questioned several employes of the Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday in an investigation of alleged strikerelated violence at Shea Stadium on Sunday.

title: Woman's Role in Church
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Wind Damages Missile Range
description: WHITE SANDS MISSILE RANGE, N.M., Dec. 5 (AP)Wind gusting to more than 90 miles an hour hit White Sands Missile Range today causing damage at the sprawling test facility.

title: Tapes Link Police to Bribery by the Mob
description: Excerpts from conversations in the headquarters of the reputed Mafia captain Paul Vario Sr., which was bugged for six months earlier this year by the office of Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold, show that the Vario organization used policemen for everything from fixing cases to getting coffee.

title: N.H.L. APPROVES A SOVIET SERIES
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (UPI)National Hockey League governors approved today a plan for the league's member teams to play a 10game series against a leading Soviet team as part of the regular season in 197374.

title: Fuentes Backers to Keep Seat On Board, Appeals Court Rules
description: The Appellate Division generally upheld yesterday a decision by State Supreme Court Justice Arnold G. Fraiman that declared unconstitutional a section of the State Education Law permitting the city's community school boards to appoint successors to unexpired terms of former elected board members.

title: Relics of St. Nicholas Enshrined in a Queens Church
description: Relics of St. Nicholas, the historical prototype of Santa Claus, were enshrined yesterday in a Greek Orthodox church in Queens.

title: Teaching and Learning How to Read
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Santa's Wallet Lifted
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 5 (UPI)George Underwood, 26 years old, said today after his appearance as Santa Claus at the Coral Ridge shopping center that one of the children who sat in his lap had stolen his wallet.

title: City Sells New Bond Issue At Lowest Rate in 4 Years
description: New York City sold a $293,980,000 bond issue yesterday at its lowest average rate of interest in more than four years 4.98 per cent.

title: The Last Apollo
description: When Apollo 17 rises slowly on its tail of fire tonight, it will be the start of the final chapter in the first round of man's exploration of the moon. Many years perhaps many decadeswill pass before another crew of earthmen again soars upward on this celestial track.

title: Ship Hits East River Reef And Loses 150 Tons of Oil.
description: A 659foot oil tanker ran aground on a reef in the fogblanketed East River last night, rupturing one of her tanks and sending a thick layer of heavy fuel oil spilling into the water.

title: Friedrich C. Christiansen, 93, General of the Luftwaffe, Dead
description: INNIEN, West Germany, Dec. 5 (UPI)  Friedrich Christian Christiansen, a former Luftwaffe general, died over the weekend at the age of 93.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Dec. 5 The Long Island Aggies, seeking a third successive title in the junior division of the Long Island College basketball classic, crushed Bronx Community College 95.66, tonight at Roosevelt Gymnasium.

title: Continental Can Speeds Metal Printing
description: Business Briefs

title: Hayden, Stone Studies A Change in Pay Basis
description: Hayden, Stone, Inc., the brokerage house, is considering revamping its salesmen's commission structure, Arthur Levitt Jr., president, said yesterday.

title: Arms Talk of Record Length
description: GENEVA, Dec. 5 (AP)United States and Soviet negotiators today held the longest meeting so far in the second phase of the talk on limiting strategic arms. A conference source said that Gerard C. Smith of the United States and Vladimir S. Semyonov of the Soviet Union met for 110 minutes at the Soviet mission.

title: Gwen Verdon to Star in Musical Revival of Chicago
description: Gwen Verdon is set to star in a musical version of Chicago, the 1926 hit comedy by Maurine Watkins.

title: Swifty Gal Calder Winner
description: MIAMI, Dec. 5 (AP)D. A. Markmann's Swifty Gal, the second longest shot in a field of 11, rallied today to score a nose decision over Wading in the feature allowance race at Calder Race Course.

title: Philadelphia Race Groups Ordered to Build a Track
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 5 (AP) The Pennsylvania Horse Racing Commission ordered Philadelphia's two thoroughbred racing associations today to proceed with construction of a new track in nearby Bensalem Township, Bucks County.

title: KARPOV MAINTAINS LEAD IN CHESS PLAY
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 5 (AP)Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union, with 9 points, held a onepoint lead today as he met Julio Kaplan of Puerto Rico in the 13th round of the Church Fried Chicken International chess tournament.

title: Unsecular Man Crucified: II
description: Books of The Times

title: Advice in Time
description: Out of pique over unwanted advice, the Administration abruptly terminated last year the American Bar Association's role in screening potential candidates for the Supreme Court. Yet the very cases that prompted the break had saved President Nixon potential embarrassment in connection with some blatantly unqualified candidates that the White House had under consideration.

title: International Monetary Fund Accepts Rumania
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  The International Monetary Fund has formally approved the membership of Rumania, it was learned tonight.

title: A New Hijack Plan
description: Citing a new breed of hijackers  unequalled in their ruthlessness, the Administration has taken tardy but welcome steps to tighten security at the nation's airports.

title: In Imperiale and Baraka, A Sharp Contrast in Styles
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5An intense mutual dislike is the only thing shared by Anthony Imperiale, a white militant, and Imamu Amiri Baraka, a black nationalist, the men who have emerged as the chief antagonists in the Kawaida Towers housing controversy.

title: ROSNER IS GUILTY OF BRIBE CHARGES
description: Edmund A. Rosner was convicted yesterday of bribing a Federal official to obtain secret documents in criminal investigations.

title: Personalities: Patriots Oust Bell, Regain Garrett
description: Upton Bell, the 34yearold general manager of the New England Patriots, was discharged yesterday by vote of the professional football team's executive committee headed by its president, Bill Sullivan. Bell had one year left on his threeseason contract.

title: Music: A Worthy Rarity
description: Daniel Barenboim led things off at his Philadelphia Orchestra concert Monday night in Philharmonic Hall with a meticulous, fullblooded account of Beethoven's Eighth Symphony. But the real order of business was Sir Edward Elgar's Symphony No. 2.

title: Indian Love Call
description: Indian Foreign Minister Swaran Singh's call for renewed friendly and cooperative ties with the United States signals a welcome change in the poisoned atmosphere that has estranged the world's two largest democracies since last year's IndianPakistani war over Bangladesh.

title: The Wrong Answer
description: Letters to the Editor

title: GERMANS SENTENCE 5 EXGESTAPO MEN
description: ARNSBERG, West Germany, Dec. 5 (AP)Five former Gestapo agents received prison terms today of up to five and onehalf years for assisting in the 1942 killings of about 5,000 Jews in Germanoccupied Poland.

title: NEW LEADER ENDS AUSTRALIAN DRAFT
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 5 The new Government of Prime Minister Gough Whitlam today announced an end to the military draft and steps to establish diplomatic relations with China.

title: ARTHUR F. DALY
description: Arthur F. Daly, a retired newspaper advertising executive, died of a heart attack on Friday in Barbados, West Indies, where he had been on vacation. He was 66 years old and lived at 4332 Barnes Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Boston College Wins, 8575
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Dec. 5 (AP) Jere Nolan's 7 points and 3 by Dave Udrich in the last 20 seconds put the game out of reach tonight as Boston College beat the University of Rhode Island, 8575.

title: Sailor on Forrestal Denies He Admitted Setting Ship Ablaze
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 5 (UPI) Seaman Jeffrey G. Allison, contradicting testimony of naval investigators, insisted today that he had never admitted starting a $7.5million fire last summer aboard the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Forrestal.

title: Funds Raised
description: Metropolitan Briefs

title: Pompidou to Visit Moscow In January, Tass Says
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5 (AP) President Pompidou of France will visit the Soviet Union on Jan. 11 and 12 for conferences with the Communist party chief, Leonid I. Brezhnev, Tass, the Soviet press agency, announced today.

title: Dance: Darpana Troupe Makes Debut
description: Mrinalini Sarabhai may be the Ida Rubinstein of India. Wealthy, head of a company that serves both as a vehicle for herself and her ideas, creating an atmosphere of the arts that is open to new paths (through her school) she may also may be too ambitious. Ida Rubinstein, Michel Fokine's rich private pupil in Russia, formed her own company after dancing briefly with Diaghilev, but that company was always subDiaghilev in tone rather than the real thing.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Federal grand jury in Newark opened an inquiry into whether several Jersey shore communities are violating a Federal court order against dumping raw sewage into the Atlantic Ocean. Appearing before the panel was Mayor Alan F. Conner, of Lavalette, one of several municipal officials in Ocean and Monmouth county expected to be called.

title: The Cowboy From Wounded Knee
description: Sports of The Times

title: 2 Texans Oppose Strauss, Charging Links to Connally
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 5Two Texas political leaders contended today that Robert S. Strauss was closely associated with the former Secretary of Treasury, John B. Connally, to head the Democratic party.

title: C130 Transport And a Jet Fighter Collide in Carolina
description: BAYBORO, S. C., Dec. 5 (UPI) A jet fighter and a military transport plane collided in flight over coastal South Carolina tonight, killing at least four persons.

title: A Significant Victory
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5The court action today on air bags is considered significant because this is the first case in which the auto industry has chal lenged the Government's safety rulemakers.

title: RATE RISE LOOMS IN BOND MARKET
NIGHTCLUBS SCORE RULE ON SEX ACTS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5 (AP)Spokesmen for this city's topless and bottomless night clubs predicted a wave of censorship and court cases as a result of the United States Supreme Court ruling today that states can shut down bars featuring nude dancers and explicit sex.

title: TV: 'Tis the Season for Family Entertainment
description: It may not be something for everybody, exactly, but television seems to be trying these days. Deck the halls, and so forth.

title: GOVERNOR URGED TO JOIN RAIL TALK
description: The striking Long Island Rail Road unions urged Governor Rockefeller yesterday to enter the dispute, but they warned him that they required more money than has been offered to settle.

title: Man Browsing in Store Is Held as Bank Robber
description: A Queens savings institution was robbed of $1,800 yesterday and the police shortly afterward arrested a man who was browsing through the coat racks of a nearby store and charged him with the crime.

title: Reds' Bench to Undergo Surgery on Right Lung
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 5 (AP)  Johnny Bench, star Cincinnati Reds catcher, disclosed tonight he would undergo surgery Monday for treatment of a spot on his right lung.

title: ASIA THREATENED BY RICE SHORTAGE
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 5 Less than a year after agricultural experts predicted that Asia would soon face a rice glut caused by increased production, the weather has caused the opposite to happen: the continent is facing a serious rice shortage.

title: Music: Joys of Bach
description: The Bach sampler program, popularized by the Bach Aria Group and still promulgated by that 26yearold organization, continues to offer audiences a pleasant way of browsing through the rich profusion of splendid arias tucked away in the more than 200 existing cantatas. The second concert in Town Hall's International Festival of Chamber. Music, presented by an ad hoc ensemble of firstrank artists on Monday night, proved again the vitality of the concept. It also demonstrated some of the basic drawbacks in the sampler idea.

title: Triangular Power
description: NEW HAVEN  The constructive results of China's turn to the United States during the last year are beginning to be visible, even in Vietnam, Korea and the Middle East. At long last Soviet policy shows signs of restraint, which have been reinforced by a disastrous harvest and the necessity of relying on the United States for food.

title: Tighter Airport Security Ordered by Government
description: The Nixon Administration issued an emergency order yesterday requiring the nation's airlines by Jan. 5 to search all carryon luggage and to search all passengers electronically for possession of weapons.

title: MANY FROM STAGE AT WEBSTER RITES
description: Men and women who had been associated with Margaret Webster during her stage career attended a memorial service yesterday at the Episcopal Church of the Transfiguration (The Little Church Around the Corner), 1 East 29th Street.

title: Steel Chief Sees Threat In Antipollution Program
description: There could be a steel shortage by 1980 if the industry is held to present timetables for antipollution controls, Edwin H. Gott, chairman of the United States Steel Corporation said here yesterday.

title: She's Making Her Mark In the World of Cosmetics
description: The success stories of most cosmetics queens begin with the little woman whipping up creams in her kitchen and end with her surrounded by millions.

title: &73 EXPANSION SEEN IN BUSINESS ACTIVITY
description: If 1973 turns out the way economists and investment analysts now foresee, business activity will continue to expand strongly throughout next year, interest rates will rise but not precipitously and the volume of equity financing will increase.

title: U.S.Cuban Hijacking Pact Would Cover Ships as Well
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The State Department said today that the United States and Cuba had agreed in principle that their proposed accord to curb hijackings should cover ships as well as planes.

title: Woyzeck by Die Brucke
description: The dedication shown last week by Die Brcke (The Bridge) in its cheerful German adaptation of Aristophanes's satire Peace, again is strongly evident in the traveling troupe's version of a fairly cheerless Woyzeck, which opened last night at the Barbizon Plaza Theater. Of course, an English program synopsis helps bridge part of the language gap. Georg Bchner's stark and moody, 135yearold drama about man's injustice to man may still be somewhat incomprehensible in German to Americans. But it is, nevertheless, brought alive by a company obviously devoted to an enduring, important work.

title: CANARSIE DEVISES NEW ZONING PLAN
description: The local school board in Canarsie  where racial friction led to a boycott, picket lines and a whiteblack confrontationmoved yesterday to keep black children from the Tilden Houses from entering junior high school in Canarsie by 1975.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
JACK A. HEIDENBERG
description: Jack A. Heidenberg, curtain manufacturer who founded Heidenberg Textile Fabrics, now a part of Associated Products, Inc., died Tuesday in BeekmanDowntown Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 390 Highview Road, Englewood, N. J.

title: HOSPITAL MAY OPT FOR CITY CONTROL
description: The city is actively exploring the possibility of taking over Knickerbocker Hospital, the nearly bankrupt voluntary hospital in west Harlem.

title: HalfMillion Spectators Wait in a Tense Silence
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Thursday, Dec. 7For more than eight hours it stood silent in the black Florida night, a brilliant white shaft, set shimmering by floodlights.

title: Panda Watchers Spend All Night Peering Into Cage
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 What do pandas do at night? The National Zoo has been holding an allnight panda watch to find out.

title: 6,000 Localities Face Big Cuts in U.S. Fund Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  New York City will receive considerably less money than it had expected under the new Federal revenuesharing programa cut that will reportedly approach 10 per cent of the $268.5million previously estimated.

title: 2 Detectives and 7 Others Indicted in Mafia Inquiry
description: A Kings County grand jury yesterday indicted two detectives, three reputed organizedcrime figures and four women on charges ranging from bribery and conspiracy to grand larceny and official misconduct.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The president of the Camden City Council, Elijah Perry, and the CamdenHousing Authority chairman, Joseph P. Keene, were indicted on charges of conspiring to commit misconduct in office, bribery and fraud.

title: C.B.S.Union Talks In 5Week Strike Resume Tomorrow
description: The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service announced yesterday that negotiators for the Columbia Broadcasting System and its striking technicians union will resume mediation talks tomorrow in Washington.

title: Market Place: Now Individual Is Trading Key
description: Can it be that the little guy, disenchanted with Wall Street for so long, has come storming back into the stock market with both feet?

title: Education Board Bars Contract For Company Hiring ExAides
