description: The Board of Education voted yesterday not to award proposed evaluation contracts totaling $808,357 to a private concern that had employed the board's former chief research official and a member of a local school board.

title: Coming Up Roses
description: This has been an absolutely scrumptuous season for John McKay. Not only has he been acclaimed as coach of the year, but his Southern California football forces ripped through unbeaten and have been awarded the MacArthur Bowl as unchallenged national champions. And now his Trojans await an encore performance, a final flourish against Ohio State in the Rose Bowl on New Year's Day.

title: Vasile Posteuca is Dead; Rumanian Poet in Exile
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (AP)  Vasile Posteuca, an exiled Rumanian poet whose desires to became a United States citizen and be reunited with his daughter and grandson were fulfilled during his fight for life, died today of cancer. He was 60 years old.

title: Johnson's Ranch Home Donated to the Public
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 Former President Lyndon B. Johnson has donated his home on the LBJ Ranch in Stonewall, Tex., to the public, Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton announced today.

title: 2 Other Flights Faced Delay During Launching
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6 (UPI) The last time a manned spacecraft was delayed close to launching was Dec. 12, 1965, when Gemini 6 was aborted automatically one and a half seconds after the rockets ignited.

title: OLIVER BALDWIN
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 6 Oliver Hazard Perry Baldwin, who retired last year as chairman of the board of the Farmers Bank, died yesterday of a stroke at the Wilmington Medical Center. His age was 68.

title: 8 Killed in Gales in Britain
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (AP)  Winter gales battered the British Isles and surrounding seas today, killing at least six sailors and two motorists, flooding roads and homes and causing widespread damage. Thirteen seamen were missing and believed drowned.

title: Caution on Air Bags
description: The Federal Court of Appeals has saved the United States Government from committing a costly error: the required installation of airbag safety devices in all cars manufactured after Aug. 15, 1975. The court majority nullified the deadline on a relatively narrow technical basis arising from dissatisfaction with the Government's testing specifications for these devices.

title: GOVERNOR SCORES L.I.R.R. STRIKERS
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday assailed the 12 unions striking the Long Island Rail Road and demanded that their members return to work immediately.

title: Indians' Capital Protest Has Not Resolved Any of Their Grievances
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6One month after the seizure of the Bureau of Indian Affairs, hostility between the Government and militant Indians persists, and no progress toward resolution of grievances has been made.

title: Reporter Who Was Jailed Asks Newsmen's Immunity
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) Peter Bridge, the newspaper reporter who was jailed for refusing to answer questions before a grand jury in New Jersey, said today that journalists should be given the absolute right not to divulge sources.

title: Skiers Finding a Choice Of PreHoliday Bargains
S.E.C. ACCOUNTANT BACKS FORECASTS
description: The chief accountant of the Securities and Exchange Commission asserted yesterday that corporations will soon have to include useful and understandable financial forecasts in their reports to shareholders and the public.

title: Fee Cuts for Doctors Held To Pinch Medicaid Clients
description: The 1969 state cutback in Medicaid fees to physicians appears to have forced the sick poor to turn to the more expensive outpatient care given by hospitals, the city Health Services Administration said yesterday.

title: One Fin on a Wide Blank Sea
description: Books of The Times

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, electrical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: Stone Container to Expand
description: The Stone Container Corporation announced yesterday a $33million expansion program to increase kraft linerboard production at a plant in Florence, S.C. The plant is run by South Carolina Industries, an affiliate in which Stone Container has a 65 per cent interest.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: One food product that has escaped the nearly ubiquitous embrace of plastic packaging is salt cod. One can still buy salt cod, as one did 25 years ago, in a sturdy wooden box with a sliding cover, a box, by the way, that can be used for other things if one does not mind its rich and everlasting aroma.

title: 1,200 U.S. Poets Listed In an Enlarged Directory
description: A revised, enlarged Directory of American Poets, which lists more than 1,200 contemporary writers, has been published by Poets & Writers, Inc., a nonprofit educational organization.

title: REFUGEES TO GET U.S. AID PRIORITY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Nixon Administration has ordered that postwar aid programs gave highest priority to the resettlement and rehabilitation of the millions of refugees dislocated by the fighting in South Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia, a wellplaced Administration official said today.

title: Bridge: Remember the Superstition: Club King Is Always Bare
Strauss Foes in Texas Seeking To Block Bid for Party Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 Robert Strauss's factional enemies in Texas Democratic politics moved today to undermine the Dallas lawyer's drive to head the Democratic National Committee.

title: Hearings Open on Felling of 7 In Garage Under Lincoln Center
description: The man who was in charge of the Lincoln Center parking garage on Thanksgiving Day, when seven children were overcome by fumes, said yesterday he had opened a second exit for waiting cars that morning but shut it when cars left without paying and a supervisor told him on the telephone to shut it.

title: Tokyo Stock Prices Climb to Record
description: TOKYO, Dec. 6The prices of the Tokyo Stock Market climbed sharply to a new high today, exceeding 4,900 yen.

title: CUBA SEEKS RISE IN CANADA TRADE
description: TORONTO, Dec. 6Cuba's first trade mission to Canada since the early nineteensixties is currently visiting Toronto, Montreal and Ottawa, hoping to increase sales of Cuban sugar and other products.

title: Inflation Curbs Are Ordered by Bonn
description: BONN, Dec. 6  The West German Government took steps today to curb the inflationary trend here, ordering restrictions on foreign loans and projecting plans for a 10 per cent surcharge on income taxes for 1973.

title: DR. MALCOLM S. EDGAR
description: SUMMIT, N.J., Dec. 6Dr. Malcolm S. Edgar, a retired physician and former chief of the staff at Overlook Hospital here, died of a heart attack Monday, at his home, 76 New England Avenue. He was 79 years old.

title: Coffee Exchange Elects
description: Thomas L. Triggs has been named executive director of the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, Inc. He succeeds Edwin B. Dexter, who is retiring.

title: $25,000 Ransom Is Asked For Missing Boston U. Coed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6The family of a missing Boston University coed, Damaris Synge Gillispie, 21 years old, of Bedford Hills, N.Y., has received what they believe to be a legitimate $25,000 ransom demand, despite the hundreds of phony calls we've received, according to a family member.

title: Wilder, Sezna Share Lead In Seniors Golf With 146's
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla., Dec. 6 (AP)Web Wilder of San Antonio, Tex., and Wally Sezna of Greenville, Del., shared the secondround lead today of the eighth annual American seniors golf championship at the Professional Golfers' Association National Golf Club.

title: Court Specifies $8Million Drug Refunds
description: A Federal judge has ordered the distribution of refunds to 36,000 people who had been overcharged on purchases of antibiotics. About $8million is involved.

title: KAWAIDA: ALL QUIET ON A VERY WET DAY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 6  Picketing at the Kawaida Towers housing project was called off today because of rain, and an apparent lack of interest by construction workers.

title: Rev. Daniel Berrigan Presides Over Benefit Here for Himself
description: It seemed to me that after the election the thing to do was to get together and celebrate, said the Rev. Daniel Berrigan. After all, what's a movement for if it can't create some art?

title: Probe for Rocketers Reported
description: SAIGON, Thursday, Dec. 7 (AP)The area from which Communist rockets struck Tan?onnhut air base yesterday was reported attacked soon afterward by about 1,500 Government troops supported by armored vehicles and air strikes.

title: State Finds Quacks In Mental Therapy
description: A sixmonth investigation into the practices of unlicensed mentalhealth therapists by the State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, has uncovered evidence of widespread quackery, sexual misconduct and the deception of clients through the use of phony academic credentials and titles, it was reported yesterday.

title: Kadar Appears Stronger Than Ever in Stable, Affluent Hungary
description: BUDAPEST, Dec. 3A middleaged woman visited her doctor recently, according to a current joke here, for diagnosis of some vague ills. The doctor examined her and said, Madam, there are going to be some changes.

title: The Niermann System of Shorthand
description: The Dobermann (spelled with one n in the United States) pinscher takes its name from Louis Dobermann, who developed the breed at Apolda, Germany in the late 19th century. The breed spread quickly in Europe and reached the United States shortly after World War I.

title: The Prison Is The Problem
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger is not generally regarded as an apostle of permissiveness, so perhaps even the hardestnosed crime fighters will heed the warning he gave the other day that harsh prison sentences and bigger police forces are not going to stop the rising crime rate.

title: Necklaces That Have Sound
description: When Irena Corwin explains her necklaces it's a multimedia performance. For the ebullient designerartisan talks, dances, acts and, with every movement, whatever necklace she happens to be wearing, fills the air with sound.

title: Rackets Using Jersey Lottery Numbers
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6The Superintendent of the state police testified here today that organized crime had begun using the new daily New Jersey lottery as a means of determining the winning combination in the daily illegal numbers game in the state.

title: Navy Routs Baltimore
description: ANNAPOLIS, Dec. 6 (AP) Bob Burns scored a gamehigh 20 points as Navy trounced Baltimore, 6945, tonight. Burns also had 12 rebounds. The Middies have won three of three games.

title: GOVERNOR CALLS STRIKE ON L.I.R.R. UNCONSCIONABLE
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday assailed the 12 unions striking the Long Island Rail Road and demanded that their members return to work immediately.

title: INDIA TIGHTENING GUARD OF P.O.W.'S
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 6The Indian Government says it has tightened security measures around the Pakistani prisonerofwar camps in central and northern India.

title: HAROLD A. SOTHERN
description: ARDSLEYONHUDSON, N. Y. Dec. 6Harold A. Sothern, an importer and exporter of essential oils of 230 Park Avenue, New York, died Monday of cancer at Phelps Memorial Hospital, Tarrytown. He was 69 years old and lived in Tarrytown.

title: Countess Lloyd George, Widow Of World War I Leader, Is Dead
description: LONDON, Dec. 6Frances, Countess Lloyd George, widow of David Lloyd George, Britain's World War I Prime Minister, died yesterday at her home in Churt, Surrey. Her age was 84.

title: With Song and Wit, Joe Williams Puts Warmth Into Club
description: In the 12 years since Joe Williams left Count Basie's orchestra to follow his own path as a singer, he has grown slow ly but steadily from the powerful blues singer he was with the Basie band to an extremely perceptive and convincing singer of ballads and unusual pop songs and, eventually, to a relaxed, witty and debonair monologist or onstage conversationalist.

title: Perspectives on Crime in the Streets
description: Seventyfive per cent of the 10,000 members of the prestigious Bar Association of the City of New York fear traveling on the streets at night and recently voted to hold meetings at 7 P.M. instead of 8 P.M. For over sixty years the later hour was safe; now it is not. This fall the New York Women's Bar Association advanced its meeting time by two hours since members have advised they will not attend meetings after night falls because of the dangers they face. Among the members of these associations are District Attorneys, judges and lawyers whose daily work is bound up with justice, fair trial and protection of the rights of the accused. Many of the meetings consider the constitutional protections of the accused.

title: TERRORISTS RAID 4 BASQUE TOWNS
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Dec. 6 (UPI)Masked gunmen believed to be Basque separatists attacked local headquarters buildings of the statecontrolled trade unions today in four Spanish towns near the French border, police sources said.

title: Nixon Agrees to Meet Soon With Republican Governors
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 6 (AP) Republican Governors, seeking a larger role in national party politics, ended their semiannual conference today with word that President Nixon had agreed to meet with them soon.

title: N.A.M. Elects Kenna As Its Next President
description: E. Douglas Kenna was elected president of the National Association of Manufacturers at a meeting yesterday of the N.A.M.'s board in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel. He is president of Robert B. Anderson & Co., Ltd., an international financial service firm.

title: St. Joe Employs a Rock Hound
description: Though he's just 3 years old Jai has a contract to work for the St. Joe Minerals Corporation in upstate New York.

title: Democrats Sued on Bills Of $251,992 From 1968
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (AP)Operators of the International Amphitheater sued the Democratic National Committee today to collect $251,992.39 in bills they said were unpaid from the party's 1968 national convention.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)Bob McManama scored two goals and his linemates, Dave Hynes and Bill Corkery, got one each tonight, as Harvard topped Boston University, 65, and handed the defending National Collegiate hockey champions their first defeat in six games. Harvard has a 20 record.

title: TB HIGH IN HOTEL CALLED CRIME HUB
description: The city's Department of Health yesterday disclosed it had found a high concentration of tuberculosis cases in the Harvard Residence Club, 304 West 99th Street, a singleroomoccupancy facility described by the police as a major crime center.

title: East Germans Said to Require Pledges of Secrecy From Persons in Contact With Relatives in West
description: BERLIN, Dec. 6A West Berlin newspaper today published reproductions of what it said were registration forms and pledges of secrecy that all employes of an East German city government had to sign in connection with contacts with relatives in the West.

title: Auction of List Property Recalls 5 Westfield Slayings
description: WESTFIELD, Dec. 6  At 10:10 P.M., one year ago tomorrow night, Patrolmen Charles Haller and George Zhelernik, making a routine investigation on a suspicious motorist, radioed police headquarters here from 431 Hillside Avenue:

title: JANET MUNRO DEAD; SCREEN ACTRESS, 38
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (Reuters) Janet Munro, the Scottish film actress, died today on the way to a hospital after collapsing at her home here. She was 38 years old.

title: 111Day British Bomb Trial Ends as 4 Get 10 Years
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (Reuters) Britain's longest trial in nearly 100 years ended tonight with four of the eight accused each sentenced to 10 years in prison for plotting bomb blasts in the country between 1968 and 1971.

title: An Imperfect Peace
description: Reports from Washington and Saigon that the North Vietnamese are planning to hide much of their army in South Vietnam in Vietcong units after a ceasefire should come as no surprise. It is only to be expectedif they agree to pull out their troops in the first place, which is not yet certain.

title: Peron Greeted by Shantytown Dwellers
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 6 (AP)  Juan D. Pern paid a surprise visit to a shantytown in the port area today and was welcomed by firecrackers and the cheers of nearly 1,000 people.

title: Nixon's Life Threatened
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 6 (AP)Secret Service agents arrested Arnold Frederick Herborn, a 45yearold plumber, at his home here yesterday and said he would be charged with threatening the life of President Nixon.

title: Holy Cross 8990 Victor
description: STORRS, Conn., Dec. 6 (AP) King Gaskins scored 30 points tonight to spark Holy Cross a 9690 basketball victory over Connecticut.

title: Apollo 17 Gives Photographers Rare Chance to Test Techniques
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 6  Apollo 17 provided a onceinalifetime occasion for legions of professional and amateur photographers.

title: Southampton in Final
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Dec. 6 Glenn Berry hit on a 10foot jumper from the baseline with 1:02 remaining to give Southampton a 6765 victory over Dowling in the semifinals of the Long Island Rotary Classic tournament tonight.

title: Coast Feminist Acquitted Of Illicit Medical Practice
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6 (AP) A feminist has been acquitted by a Municipal Court jury on misdemeanor charges of practicing medicine without a license.

title: Testimony Offered
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The investment banking firm of Butcher and Sherrerd said at a Securities and Exchange Commission hearing today that it favored requiring companies to include earnings forecasts in their stock prospectuses, but only under carefully restricted conditions.

title: Naderism Assailed by Kemper
description: People and Business

title: Finance Agency Raises Limits for Mortgages
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The New Jersey Mortgage Finance Agency announced today it would provide special low interest rates on more expensive homes.

title: Swiss Move Against Inflation
description: GENEVA, Dec. 6The Swiss government called today on Parliament to grant it wide powers to decree emergency measures to fight inflation.

title: U.S. Team in Low Gear For Start of Ski Season
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 6The United States ski team is full of confidence, but is in no hurry to jump into the ski season, which opens tomorrow.

title: Marine Life Is Discovered In Houston Ship Channel
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6 (AP) While pollution in the Houston Ship Channel still exceeds acceptable limits, for the first time in years marine life has been found in its midreaches, a joint Federalstate pollution conference was told yesterday.

title: Tenants Ask Ban on Income CheckUps
description: Angry tenants in MitchellLama developments stormed City Hall yesterday to demand passage of a City Council bill that would end the Housing and Development Administration's right to look at their city incometax returns.

title: Letter to the Editor 1 -- No Title
description: It is claimed that mugging and other forms of street assault are on the increase. As a remedy for this alleged problem, it is suggested that more money be appropriated so the number of police may be increased, that patrolmen be taken off desk and traffic assignments and reassigned to street patrol, that the police be unleashed by removal of laws and rules governing treatment of suspects and arrested persons and so on.

title: Jury Acquits Brooklynite On Albany Murder Count
description: ALBANY, Dec. 6 (UPI)Rudi Hertwig, a 51yearold Brooklyn resident, was acquitted of murder charges yesterday in the shooting of two men last summer in full view of three Albany police detectives.

title: NEW DRIVE FACING ULSTER ASSASSINS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 6The British Government announced the formation of a joint police and army task force today to investigate the continuing move of apparently religious killings in Northern Ireland.

title: College Games Offered At Garden and Coliseum
Who's in Command?
description: Statehood for Puerto Rico was defeated in the recent election. For the second time it was an issue and was turned down. No other United States territory, colony, dominion or possession, given the choice, had ever rejected statehood. Why then our decision?

title: Personalities: The Pitch Looks Good for Bench
description: The surgeon who will operate on Johnny Bench of the Cincinnati Reds said yesterday the odds were overwhelming that the lesion in the slugging catcher's lung would turn out to be benign.

title: For Dolphins, Peak Gets Higher and Higher
description: The Miami Dolphins need another victory Sunday like Neil Simon needs another hit comedy. But just as the inimitable Simon wants to keep writing Broadway successes, the unbeaten Dolphins want to keep winning football games.

title: TV: A Diverse TrioIreland, Jail and Rothschilds
description: Presented on the The New C.B.S. Tuesday Night Movies, James Costigan's A War of Children got off to a finely realized start and came to a convincingly moving end. It was somewhere around the middle that the drama failed.

title: Helicopter Lands on Road
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Dec. 6 (AP)Rex Chadwell, 24 years old, made an emergency landing in his helicopter on Interstate 94 last night. No one was injured, but the craft tore down high tension wires and caused a disruption in traffic.

title: W. HARMAN BROWN
description: W. Harman Brown, former institutional sales specialist in securities for Goldman Sachs & Co., Chicago, died Tuesday after open heart surgery at the Presbyterian Hospital. His age was 73 and he lived in Denville, N. J.

title: CORNELL SIX BEATS ST. LAWRENCE, 7 TO 3
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 6 (AP) Cornell's Bob Murray scored three times tonight to spark his team to a 73 college hockey victory over St. Lawrence.

title: Engineer Society Charged With Curbing Competition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The Justice Department yesterday accused the National Society of Professional Engineers of eliminating price competition among its members in the sale of engineering services.

title: Visitors Are Drawn To Pearl Harbor For Today's Rites
description: PEARL HARBOR, Dec. 6 (UPI)Pearl Harbor is the target of cleanup crews and tourists 31 years after the Japanese attack that plunged the United States into World War II.

title: East Harlem Boycott
description: The East Harlem parents appear to have won their fight to restore some of the educational services which had fallen victim to local and Federal budget cuts. It is still unclear just how much money, and from what source, will be allocated by the Board of Education to District 4 and to other hardpressed districts throughout the city. But new money has apparently once again been found.

title: WaterCleanup Cut Is Expected to Stall Connecticut Efforts
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 6 (AP) President Nixon's cuts in water cleanup funds will force the postponement of one major antipollution project in Connecticut and possibly will delay future projects. Environmental Protection Commissioner Dan W. Lufkin said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 45yearold man from Rockaway, Queens, who collected $250,000 in insurance payments for 30 fires over the last 14 years, was arrested yesterday morning on an arson charge in connection with one of the fires, Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell said. His office is investigating the other fires, which took place in Brooklyn, Queens and Nassau Counties, he said.

title: Chess: Rook Power, Subtle or Blunt, Must Be Used With Timing
8 ARE DISMISSED FROM HIGH POSTS IN INTERIOR DEPT.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Administration has ordered a housecleaning of topechelon officials of the Department of the Interior.

title: WELFARE SHELTER CALLED A SUCCESS
description: A new kind of temporary housing for impoverished families suddenly displaced by a tenement fire or other emergency was hailed by city and civic officials here yesterday as a successful alternative to welfare hotels.

title: W. T. Grant Sales Up 20%
description: W. T. Grant Company reported yesterday a 20 per cent advance in its November sales to $176 6million from $147.2million in the same 1971 month. The retail chain said its sales in the 10 months of the fiscal year through November were up 19 per cent to $1.276billion from $1.072billion.

title: RARE ONE ARRIVES FROM DOWN UNDER
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 6In New Zealand, harness horsemen devote most of their efforts to pacers. Trotters are decidedly in a minority in a country that has produced Cardigan Bay, Caduceus, False Step, Good Chase and other noted pacers that fared so well in the United States.

title: DICK ELLIFFE DEAD; LONG A COACH HERE
description: UPLAND, Calif., Dec. 6Dick Elliffe, an allround athlete who became a coach at Erasmus Hall and George Washington High Schools in New York, died yesterday at Upland Hospital. His age was 83.

title: $625Million Claims Filed Against U.S. in Fatal Blast
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 6 (UPI) Claims totaling $625million are being made against the Army and the Department of Defense in connection with an explosion in a chemical plant hat took more than two dozen lives Feb. 3, 1971.

title: MEXICO CURBING SALES OF DRUGS
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 4  A wellknown Mexican businessman walked into his neighborhood pharmacy recently and asked for a new supply of the relatively mild tranquilizer he had used for years.

title: Counterfeit Bills Seized
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6 (UPI) Secret Service agents raided a house yesterday and seized a quartermillion dollars in high quality counterfeit bills. A spokesman for the Secret Service said a complete counterfeiting plant and plates for $5 notes were seized. Raymond Blunt Jr., John E. Polidoro and Robert W. Ribel, were arrested.

title: $1Million Lottery Winner
description: PLAINFIELD, Dec. 6 (UPI) Now I can get out of debt, said Louis W. Bradley, a 49yearold Moorestown man, after winning $1million in the special drawing of the state lottery. Mr. Bradley, the owner of a tool company in Willow Grove, Pa., said that he bought two lottery tickets every week, gave his wime one and kept the other for himself. It was his that bore the winning number.

title: Rackets Using Jersey Lottery Numbers
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6The Superintendent of the state police testified here today that organized crime had begun using the new daily New Jersey lottery as a means of determining the winning combination in the daily illegal numbers game in the state.

title: Banking Group to Acquire a Computer Operation
description: The First National Boston Corporation, a bank holding company, announced yesterday it had reached a preliminary understanding to acquire the computer leasing assets of the Randolph Computer Corporation, a unit of the Travelers Corporation, a leading insurance company. First National

title: STATES' AIDES ASK A DEATH PENALTY
description: CORONADO, Calif. Dec. 6 (AP)A resolution recommending the death penalty for certain crimes was approved today, 32 to 1, by the National Association of Attorneys General.

title: Amex and Counter Prices Rise After Late Upsurge of Trading
Congressional Investigators Ask Marines to Explain Role in Racial Trouble Aboard the Carrier Kitty Hawk
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 6  The Marine Corps was brought into a congressional investigation of racial disorders aboard Navy ships today to respond to charges that clubswinging marine guards escalated a 15hour riot aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk.

title: C.A.B. CHIEF ASKS AIRLINE CHANGES
description: Secor D. Browne, chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, said last night the time had come for a fundamental restructuring of much of the world's air transportation system.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Angry tenants of the city's MitchellLama developments stormed City Hall and crowded both Council and Board of Estimate chambers to demand passage of a law that would ban the Housing and Development Administration from checking their annual income affidavits against their city income tax returns, a requirement that they said was an invasion of privacy.

title: C. NORTHROP POND
description: SCOTCH PLAINS, N. J., Dec. 6C. Northrop Pond, board chairman of the United National Bank of Plainfield, died Monday at his home here. He was 61 years old.

title: Stand on Marijuana
description: Letters to the Editor

title: BURGER RENEWS PLEA FOR AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  Leaders of the bar and concerned laymen met here tonight at the behest of the American Bar Association to consider whether and how a new national organization could help meet what the association's president called our total justice crisis.

title: Thieu and U.S. Envoy Confer for 80 Minutes
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 7 (UPI)The United States Ambassador, Ellsworth Bunker, met with President Nguyen Van Thieu for more than an hour today, apparently to discuss progress at the Paris peace talks.

title: Half Million Spectators Wait, Watch, Wonder
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 6It was billed as the spectacular final launching in a highly successful series of Apollo flights to the moon, and half a million persons had come to see it.

title: FINCH IS PREPARING FOR A RACE IN 1974
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Robert H. Finch, President Nixon's original Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said today that he was leaving his present post as counselor to the President to return to California in preparation for a race there for either Senator or Governor in 1974.

title: Inquiry Is Begun in Death Of Contractor in Garage
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Dec. 6 (AP)Dr. Fred Zugibe, Rockland County's Medical Examiner, said today he believed that foul play might have been involved in the death of John Lutz, whose body was found in the garage of his Mount Ivy home.

title: Remembrance Of Harbors Present
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Yesterday December 7, 1941, a date that will live in infamy

title: CHRYSLER'S PRICES ARE RAISED BY $40
description: DETROIT, Dec. 6The Chrysler Corporation increased the price of its 1973 model automobiles and trucks by an average of $40 today.

title: High Court Upholds Identification of Suspect Without LineUp
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6An accused criminal may be convicted on the basis of a yesorno identification by the victim without the necessity of picking him out of a lineup, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: SUITS ALLEGE FRAUD ON SITES IN ARIZONA
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (AP)Two suits have been filed in Federal District Court here against an Arizona land development company and four of its officers alleging that they had conspired to cheat and defraud the general public by selling land on installment sales contracts.

title: Nixon Picks a Textile Man To Take Commerce Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  President Nixon announced today that Frederick B. Dent, a South Carolina textile manufacturer, would replace Peter G. Peterson as Secretary of Commerce. He also announced that Earl G. Butz would remain in the Cabinet as Secretary of Agriculture.

title: Brennan as Labor Secretary
description: Richard Nixon's appointment of Peter Brennan as Secretary of Labor is a paradoxical omen.

title: They See What's Cooking at the Waldorf
description: Twenty curious people got an insider's view of how the other half's food is cooked yesterday at a tour billed as Backstage at the Waldorf.

title: Baby Bottle as Pacifier Linked to Tooth Decay
description: The common practice of using a baby bottle as a pacifier may be causing serious decay in the teeth of as many as 80 per tent of children, an expert on children's dentistry said yesterday.

title: 49 Indicted in Newark in Schools Fraud
APOLLO DELAYED IN ITS COUNTDOWN FOR MOON FLIGHT
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 6 The launching of Apollo 17 was temporarily delayed tonightjust 30 seconds before the scheduled liftoff timewhen trouble developed in the third stage of the Saturn 5 rocket.

title: Stocks Rally to Records, In Spite of Profit Taking
Oregon Has Intense Storm
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 6 (UPI)Oregon residents were told to turn off their Christmas tree lights, lower their thermostats and wear sweaters indoors today to conserve power after an intense prewinter storm.

title: Allende Arrives in Soviet, Seeks New Aid for Chile
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile started a threeday visit to the Soviet Union today in an effort to elicit new financial and technical support for the embattled Chilean economy.

title: U.S. PLANES STRIKE NEAR SAIGON BASE IN A REPRISAL RAID
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 7  American planes flew tactical air strikes within 10 miles of Tansonnhut Airport last evening in an attempt to hit back at Vietcong forces that fired rockets into the huge Saigon air base earlier in the day.

title: Missouri Wins No. 4
description: COLUMBIA, MO., Dec. 6 (UPI)John Brown scored a career high of 35 points and pulled down 15 rebounds tonight to lead unbeaten Missouri to its fourth victory, 8475, over stubborn Purdue.

title: Newark's Clay St. Bridge Is Closing Today as Unsafe
description: NEWARK, Dec. 6 (AP)The Clay Street Bridge, one of Newark's heavily used Passaic River crossings, was ruled unsafe today and ordered closed to traffic effective 10 A.M. tomorrow.

title: Closing of Navy Yards
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6 (UPI) Senator Richard S. Schweiker Republican of Pennsylvania, said today that the United States Navy Yard in Boston might be closed before the one here was because President Nixon did better in Pennsylvania in the election than he did in Massachusetts.

title: Power Boat King
description: CLARK, N. J., Dec. 6For the first time in its history, the championship of the Pacific Offshore Power Boat Racing Association has been won by a driver from the Atlantic Coast. He is Billy Martin, a mildmannered furniture dealer from Clark who from time to time changes into a hardnosed raceboat driver and beats the best ocean pilots in the world.

title: HEROIN SMUGGLING DETAILED BY PILOT
description: An Argentine pilot testified yesterday that he had smuggled 290 pounds of heroin from Paraguay to Miami in 1970 in behalf of Auguste Joseph Ricord, who is reputed to be the largest trafficker of heroin into the United States.

title: Confusing and Inaccurate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The State Department asserted today that President Allende was confusing and inaccurate in his United Nations speech attacking the United States.

title: 16 WRITERS RECEIVE '72 PLAYBOY AWARDS
description: Sixteen writers were the recipients yesterday of the 1972 Playboy magazine writing awards. Eight firstplace winners received $1,000 each and a silver medallion and eight runnersup received $500 each and a silver medallion.

title: Noise Stirs Growing Efforts To Close Jetports Overnight
description: Legislative and community efforts to close jet airports at night because of the noise have increased sharply during the last year.

title: Union Election in 6th Day
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 6 (AP)Miners went to the polls today for the sixth day in the eightday United Mine Workers election in which President W. A. (Tony) Boyle is challenged by Arnold Miller.

title: MRS. ALEX JACKINSON
description: Mrs. Matilda Halpern Jackinson who with her husband Alex Jackinson operated the literary agency of that name, died of cancer Monday in Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx. She was 62 years old and lived at 2320 Bronx Park East.

title: KARPOV IS ASSURED OF TIE IN CHESS PLAY
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 6 (AP)Anatoly Karpov, the 20yearold chess champion of Russia, was assured today of retaining at least a tie for the lead when all adjourned games are completed in the Church's Fried Chicken International tournament here.

title: Truman on Critical List; Heart Condition Weakens
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 6 Former President Harry S. Truman's condition became critical tonight as he struggled with a weakened heart to overcome an attack of lung congestion.

title: Accountant Is Indicted in Theft Of $1Million From Allen Funt
description: A certified public accountant who specialized in television and motion picture accounts was indicted yesterday on charges of stealing more than one and a quarter million dollars from Allen Funt, the film producer and creator of Candid Camera.

title: Dry Named Tulsa Coach
description: TULSA, Okla., Dec. 6 (AP) F. A. Dry, athletic director and interim football coach since Oct. 27 at the University of Tulsa, was officially named coach today. He will continue as athletic director.

title: SoftSpoken Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6In the early days of the washwear fabrics, Frederick Baily Dent was trying to explain to visitors to his South Carolina textile mill how the new finish weakened the cloth. He extended one arm, flexed his elbow and pop went the fabric. He lost his shirt, but

title: Penn Tops Citadel, 6734; La Salle Is 6967 Victor
Board of Education Gives $9.75Million to Schools
description: The Board of Education announced yesterday that it would give $9.75million more to the city's 31 local school districts, including $225,289 to District 4 in East Harlem.

title: 8 ARE DISMISSED FROM HIGH POSTS BY INTERIOR CHIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Administration has ordered a housecleaning of topechelon officials of the Department of the Interior.

title: Columbia Spectator Says It Expects to Fold Next Week
description: The Columbia Daily Spectator, one of the nation's oldest college newspapers, will cease publication next Wednesday unless it can obtain outside financial assistance, John Brecher, the editor in chief, announced yesterday.

title: Nixon Picks a Textile Man To Take Commerce Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  President Nixon announced today that Frederick B. Dent, a South Carolina textile manufacturer, would replace Peter G. Peterson as Secretary of Commerce. He also announced that Earl L. Butz would remain in the Cabinet as Secretary of Agriculture.

title: Apollo 17
description: Apollo 17 and its three brave, highly trained astronauts finally blasted off last night after a tensionfilled delay of over two hours. For days they will cruise through interplanetary space in their artificial cocoon; then two of the astronauts will land on and explore an area of the moon never before visited by man while the third astronaut circles earth's natural satellite waiting for his comrades to rejoin him. Finally the men on the moon will blast off to return to the mother ship and begin the quarterofamillionmile homeward trek.

title: PUBLISHERS SEEKING TERMINATION RULING
description: The Publishers Association of New York City, The New York Times and the Daily News filed a suit in Federal Court here yesterday asking that the purported termination by New York Mailers Union No. 6 of its contract with the newspapers be declared a nullity.

title: Treasures of Jerusalem Coming to Metropolitan
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 6An archeological portrait of ancient Jerusalem, including several major and previously unexhibited discoveries, is to be sent to the Metropolitan Museum of Art next year as the centerpiece in New York's celebration of the 25th anniversary of Israel's independence.

title: DR. BERNARD G. FARIS
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Dec. 6 Dr. Bernard G. Faris, a professor of English at Upsala College, where before his long illness he was appointed director of the honors program for gifted students, died Monday in Mount Sinai Hospital in New York. He was 43 years old.

title: Poland Honors Rockefeller for Aid to U. N.
description: For his support of the United Nations, Governor Rockefeller was given a medal yesterday in his Manhattan office by Stanislaw Trepczynski, the Polish Deputy Foreign Minister and president of the United Nations General Assembly. The award was given by the Polish Government in recognition of the Rockefeller family's and the Governor's donations to the United Nations. The medal has an image of Copernicus, the Polish astronomer, who proved that the earth moves around the sun.

title: East River, Lower Harbor Get OilSpill Cleanup
description: The task of cleaning up an oil spill in the East River and Lower Harbor began yesterday following the grounding of a 20,889ton oil tanker late Tuesday night at Hell Gate, off 90th Street in the East River.

title: Music: A Polished Debut
description: Susan Davenny Wyner gave her New York debut recital on Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall and if composers didn't immediately start lining up at the stage door, asking her to sing their songs, they're slower afoot than they used to be. Mrs. Wyner, a lyric soprano in her mid20's, gave a performance that was everything one might ask of a debut. Her interpretative ideas sometimes were a little too bright eyed and reliant on charm, but mostly she plunged beneath the surface like a real artist.

title: BONN WINS A POINT ON TIES WITH EAST
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 6  The United States, Britain and France agreed with West Germany today to delay their negotiations to establish relations with East Germany, until after Dec. 21, when the two Germanys are expected to sign a treaty.

title: Letter to the Editor 2 -- No Title
description: The defeat of the school and housing proposal for Yorkville by the Board of Estimate is a cowardly blow against the public school children in the area who attend dilapidated turnofthecentury schools. There are virtually no sites available for school construction in crowded Yorkville. Furthermore, those who run the education system have been unable to come up with the funds for new schools in the area.

title: Jersey to Fight New Federal Welfare Penalties
description: New Jersey's welfare chief said yesterday that his state would challenge the new Federal plan to penalize states for any welfare ineligibility and overpayments.

title: Woman Gains Presidency
description: Mrs. Dorothy Callahan has been elected president of the Long Island Board of Realtors, The Associated Press reports. Mrs. Callahan is the first woman president of 1,200member organization in its 62  year history.

title: Mrs. Heiskell Will Head Community Service Society
description: Marian S. Heiskell, director of special activities at The New York Times, yesterday was elected chairman of the board of trustees of the Community Service Society of New York.

title: Transcript Case Appealed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals has been asked to overturn a lawer court decision denying two court stenographers the exclusive right to sell their transcript of a 1970 inquest into the death at Chappaquiddick of Mary Jo Kopechne.

title: Truman on Critical List; Heart Condition Weakens
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Thursday, Dec. 7Former President Harry S. Truman's condition became critical last night, but he rallied slightly about midnight as he struggled with a weakened heart to overcome an attack of lung congestion.

title: A Successor to Ash
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Dec. 6Fred W. O'Green, a Litton Industries executive for 10 years, has been selected as the new president of the troubled conglomerate.

title: Justice and Military Justice
description: Letters to the Editor

title: C.C.N.Y's President Loses Dreydl Crown in SpinOff
description: Dr. Robert E. Marshak, president of City College, went down to smiling defeat last night in the faculty's annual dreydlspinning contest.

title: RELATIVES ADVISED ON CALLING VIETNAM
description: The telephone company yesterday advised relatives wishing to exchange holiday greetings by telephone with servicemen in Southeast Asia to arrange beforehand to have the servicemen place the call from Vietnam.

title: YOUNG IN POLAND IGNORE THE PARTY
description: WARSAW, Dec. 6  Stanislaw is a graduate of Warsaw's medical academy and is in his late 20's. He has long hair, wears hornrimmed glasses and combines teaching with his research work.

title: Foreign Diplomats Are Wined, Dined On Englewood Tour
description: ENGLEWOOD, Dec. 6Opening an effort to attract foreign residents and businesses to Englewood, city officials and community leaders today walked, talked, wined and dined 38 representatives of the Society of Foreign Consuls.

title: Herbert Retires From Bench
description: NEWARK, Dec. 6 (AP) Superior Court Judge Ward P. Herbert stepped down from the bench today, his 70th birthday. But Judge Ward's retirement will be shortlived. He resumes his interupted career as a practicing lawyer tomorrow morning. Judge Herbert, who has been in the Chancery Division for 11 years, will rejoin the Newark law firm of McCarter and English.

title: Editor at Newsweek. Named RCA, Official
description: Advertising:

title: Councilman to Oppose Yorty
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6 (AP) Councilman Tom Bradley, defeated by Mayor Sam Yorty in the last mayoral election in Los Angeles, announced yesterday that he would run again in April. He joins two other announced candidates for the officeformer Police Chief Tom Reddin and former Assembly Speaker Jess Unruh.

title: HANNA MINING POSTS INCREASE IN PRICES
description: The Hanna Mining Company announced yesterday that it would raise prices by 54 cents a ton on four types of natural iron ore, beginning Jan. 1.

title: State Finds Quacks In Mental Therapy
description: A sixmonth investigation into the practices of unlicensed mentalhealth therapists by the State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, has uncovered evidence of widespread quackery, sexual misconduct and the deception of clients through the use of phony academic credentials and titles, it was reported yesterday.

title: Yorkville and the Asphalt Plant Project
description: Our Neighborhood Committee on the Asphalt Project, in opposing the Park Plaza East project, has stressed that the luxury housing, now a glut in our area, must give way to desperate community needs for green space and recreational facilities.

title: Yugoslavs Open Talks On Wider Youth Role
description: BELGRADE, Dec. 6  Troubled by a loss of influence over youth, the Yugoslav League of Communists opened a conference here today aimed at mobilizing young people ideologically, tightening their involvement in political and economic activity and, not least, improving their opportunities.

title: World Trade Rose 11% in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  Total world trade of the Industrial countries increased by 11 per cent in the third quarter of this year over the corresponding period of 1971, the International Monetary Fund reported today. As measured by total exports, trade of these countries in the third quarter was at an annual rate of $257.5billion. This compared with $231.3billion in the third quarter of last year. Figures for total world trade are not yet available.

title: CEASEFIRE TALKS RESUME IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Dec. 6The Vietnam ceasefire talks resumed today after a 24  hour pause during which President Nixon sent what the White House called detailed new instructions to the American negotiators.

title: U.S. PLANES STRIKE NEAR SAIGON BASE IN A REPRISAL RAID
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 7  American planes flew tactical air strikes within 10 miles of Tansonnhut Airport last evening in an attempt to hit back at Vietcong forces that fired rockets into the huge Saigon air base earlier in the day.

title: Music: Two at Keyboard
description: Those having only a slight acquaintance with the piano sometimes assume that if two rands and 10 fingers make it sound good, more hands and fingers should make it sound better.

title: Jets' Thomas Likes BumpandRun Game With Foe
description: When Danny Abramowicz, the New Orleans Saints' wide receiver, came to Shea Stadium last Sunday to play against the Jets, the sixthyear pro had a streak of 75 straight games in which he had caught at least one pass.

title: Bay State Unemployed Rate
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)The unemployment rate in Massachusetts dropped from 6.7 per cent in September to 6.3 per cent in October, the State Division of Employment Security said today. Adjusted for seasonal factors, the rate in October was 7.2 per cent of the total work force compared to an adjusted rate of 7.4 per cent in September. The adjusted rate for the United States in October was 5.5 per cent.

title: Cambodia's Refugees The Forgotten People
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 6Refugees have become so much a part of the Indochina landscape that they are hardly noticed any more. It is a surprise, in fact, when one travels down a road for any distance and does not find a stream of people laden with sacks and cardboard valises and perhaps some chickens and a pig or two, who are fleeing a bombing or mortar attack.

title: Deadlock in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: The deadlock in the Long Island Rail Road strike appears to be a classic confrontation, this one involving a deficitridden carrier on one side and nonoperating unions on the other. The unions are seeking pay increases equivalent to those received by fellow workers in the operating groups.

title: No Special Apollo TV
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)The national television networks plan no special space broadcasts tomorrow as the three Apollo 17 astronauts head toward the moon, officials at the Manned Spacecraft Center said today.

title: Rheingold Directors Omit Dividend
description: Business Briefs

title: Judge Warns Press of Davidoff Mistrial
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn said yesterday that he might declare a mistrial in a current extortion case if newspapers continued to print material that did not actually come out of the courtroom.

title: Prof. Chang Hsinhai, 74, Of Fairleigh Dickinson Dies
description: Chang Hsinhai, a former Chinese diplomat who was professor of humanities at Fairleigh Dickinson University in New Jersey, died Tuesday in Shanghai. Professor Chang was on a visit as a guest of the People's Republic of China. He was 74 years old and lived at 220 Schenck Avenue, Great Neck, L. I.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you've been contemplating giving money, stock or other property of value to relatives or close friends, the time to act.

title: Two Farewells to Father Hesburgh
description: The fuss being generated about Father Hesburgh's resignation as chairman and member of the U. S. Commission on Civil Rights is much ado about nothing.

title: Batiks More Like Paintings
description: The wonder of Tamara Conroy's batik pictures is that they look like meticulous paintings of flower gardens. Each daisy, each geranium is as distinct as if a skillfully guided brush had done the petals. How the artist gets this unblurred effect is her secret and even when her works are seen they are hard to believe. Floral paintings, yes. Batiks? No.

title: Postel Says $500Million Is Lost in Transit Abuses
description: City Councilman Robert I. Postel charged yesterday that grossly inflated overtime payments, fraudulent personnel practices and other corrupt activities in the city's Transit Authority had cost taxpayers more than $500million in the last 10 years.

title: DON CARNEV ALE, 62, OF HARRY WINSTON
description: Don Carnevale, a sales executive and vice president of Harry Winston, Inc., international jewelers, died Tuesday of a heart attack at Le Roy Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 15 East 63d Street.

title: Esquire Sued by Black Author On Editorial Changes in Article
description: A black author and publisher suing Esquire magazine charged yesterday that its editors had changed an article he wrote for them doing substantial injustice to him to black intellectuals and to the publishing company he owns.

title: 2 Indicted in Connecticut In Holdup Slaying at Cafe
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 6 (UPI)  Murder indictments have been returned by a Fairfield County grand jury against two young men charged with the holdup slaying of a woman cafe owner in Bridgeport.

title: Pillsbury Chief Retiring
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 6 (AP) Robert J. Keith announced today his retirement as chairman of the board and chief executive officer of the Pillsbury Company because of ill health.

title: A MEXICAN ACCUSED IN DRUG CASE DIES
description: PARIS, Dec. 6 (AP)Humberto Mariles Cortes, who, as an equestrian, won Mexico's first gold medal in the Olympics in 1948, died today in a French prison.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: INDIANS Arthur Kopit's Indians played Broadway in 1969 a lavish, wellnopulated drama that wh?rled about in the guise of a Wild West show, with Buffalo Bill and other nonIndians ending up burdened by guilt, much less the heroes they had tried to be. Indians is coming back this week, by way of Brooklyn, specifically through The Good Medicine Company, a group of Brooklyn College students who are presenting it at the Cubiclo, 414 West. 51st Street.

title: TakeOut Chicken Stores Are Taking Firmer Hold Here
description: New York City may set the trends for the nation in culture and fashion, but it is a benighted backwater in that most American areafast food.

title: Tobacco Agents Seize Two
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 6 (AP)State tobacco tax agents have arrested a New York man and woman and charged them with transportation of untaxed cigarettes through Maryland. The agents seized 2,010 cartons of cigarettes yesterday after stopping a Volkswagen bus. Arrested were Richard Kunta of Bay Shore, L.I., and Dorothy Kappauf of Lindenhurst, L.I.

title: ERNEST C. HALL
description: WARREN, Ohio, Dec. 6 (AP) Ernest C. Hall, an early aviator, died of a heart attack last night. He was 82 years old.

title: Storm Adds to Rainfall And Commuters' Woes
description: A downpour flooded roads in the metropolitan area last night causing flooding on the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive and on a number of roads in Queens leading to Nassau County.

title: Swiss President Named Under Rotating System
description: GENEVA, Dec. 6Roger Bonvin, 65yearold Minister of Transport, was elected today by Parliament to serve as Swiss President for 1973.

title: BRITISH TO STRESS NURSERY SCHOOLS
description: LONDON, Dec. 6The British Government proposed today a sweeping education policy that would enable most 3 and 4yearold children to attend school without charge.

title: Frazier Starts Drills for Foreman, But Ali Bobs Up in Every Corner.
description: MCAFEE, N. J., Dec. 6 Munching on bacon and sausages, Joe Frazier was having a noontime breakfast today in the Playboy Club Hotel at Great Gorge, the antithesis of Sparta where all good heavyweight champions are supposed to train.

title: Foreign Service Association Chosen as Employes' Agent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The American Foreign Service Association has been chosen as the bargaining agent for foreign service officers and other State Department employes.

title: 2 Attendants at Willowbrook Accused of Beating 3 Patients
description: Two young women employed as ward attendants at the controversial Willowbrook State School for the mentally retarded were arrested yesterday after they were accused of beating three boy patients on Sunday with a broomstick.

title: TOM CLARK BACKS ALAWYER DRAFT
description: Former Supreme Court Justice Tom C. Clark has proposed that lawyers here be drafted, if necessary, to help reduced the congestion among impoverished prisoners awaiting trial and that every city prison have a legal clinic, staffed mainly by lawschool seniors.

title: IMPORTER INDICTED AS CHEETAH CHEATER
description: A major importer of wild animals was indicted by a Federal jury here yesterday on charges of submitting false statements in an attempt to import 20 live cheetahs for a Florida commercial attraction called Wild Kingdom. Inc.

title: Alexandra Bemberg Married In Paris to Jean de Yturbe
description: Miss Alexandra Bemberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward P. Bemberg of Paris and Buenos Aires, formerly of New York, and Jean de Yturbe, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles de Yturbe of Chateau d'Anet, EureetLoir, France, were married yesterday afternoon at St. Clotilde's Roman Catholic Church in Paris. Abb Jean de Montalembert, a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: SOYBEANS DOWN ON PROFIT TAKING
description: Future prices of agricultural commodities fell yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade after having risen for several previous sessions. The decline was caused by profit taking.

title: Hawley Wins at Laurel
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 6 Hawley, bidding for his second North American riding title in three years, won his first race at Laurel Race Course today when he brought home Dillquest 1 lengths in front in the sixth race.

title: BRAZIL CONTINUES ANTIRED DRIVE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 6 The Brazilian political police announced today that they had raided a Communist party hideout here as part of a continuing drive against the party by the militarybacked Government.

title: NEW JAZZ TALENT SOUGHT FOR FETE
description: A nationwide talent search, for young performers who will appear this summer at the Newport Jazz Festival was announced yesterday by George Wein, the festival's founder and producer, and John M. Anderson, executive director of the Tea Council of the U.S.A., sponsor of the talent hunt.

title: Aliens Must Report
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) Noncitizens living in the United States must report their addresses in January to the Immigration and Naturalization Service, the agency announced today.

title: A FLASH IN NIGHT
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Thursday, Dec. 7Apollo 17 blasted off toward the moon early today, its fiery exhaust turning the night into day, in a delayed but spectacular beginning of the nation's last planned lunar mission.

title: 49 Are Indicted in Newark In Fraud on School Guards
description: NEWARK, Dec. 6An Essex County grand jury investigating charges of fraudulent practices in the Newark public school system indicted 49 persons today, including the School Superintendent, a former Board of Education secretary and a former school board member.

title: U.N. AIDES FEUD ON ENVIRONMENT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Dec. 6Maurice F. Strong, head of the United Nations environmental program, abruptly submitted his resignation this morning amid reports of growing friction with Secretary General Waldheim.

title: Buses From L.I. to City
description: Following is a list of bus services available to Nassau and Suffolk County commuters to subway stops in Queens:

title: BROOKLYN VISITED BY CHARTER PANEL
description: The state commission studying reorganization of the city government sat in a Brooklyn junior high school auditorium yesterday and heard praise for Mayor Lindsay's neighborhood government test and optimism about the city's neighborhoods.

title: 2 Panels by Fra Angelico Bring $575,000 in London
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (Reuters) Two small panels by the 15th century Italian artist Fra Angelico that were auctioned for $20,000 here 15 years ago sold for $575,000 in an auction at Sotheby's today.

title: Stars Set Back Cougars
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 6 (AP)Glen Combs, James Jones and Zelmo Beaty combined for 73 points tonight to lead the Utah Stars to a 119108 victory over Carolina.

title: N.Y.C.: Good Risk
description: After all the years of budget crises and warnings of imminent municipal bankruptcy, it is reassuring to find investors becoming increasingly bullish about the outlook for New York City's longterm financial soundness.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 1.5 million common shares of the San Diego Gas & Electric Company at $20.50 per share was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Blyth Eastman Dillon and Merrill Lynch. The company's stock closed at 20, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: California Students Run Organic Farm As a College Bonus
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., Dec. 6 (AP)  Some students at the University of California campus here sleep in tents and teepees on an oldfashioned farm.

title: Voters in Massachusetts Back School Prayer 4 to 1
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)Massachusetts voters backed voluntary school prayers by a margin of more than 4 to 1 in a Nov. 7 referendum, according to results tabulated yesterday.

title: WEINBERGER SEES REDUCED SPENDING
description: The Nixon Administration plans to cut $9.5billion to $10billion from a relatively narrow sector of the Federal budget to keep total spending in the current fiscal year within $250billion, Caspar W. Weinberger, director of the Office of Management and Budget, said here yesterday.

title: FLIGHT IS HALTED BY A SEQUENCER
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 7 It was an intricate computeroperated automation system that caused the long and worrisome halt in the Apollo 17 countdown with a bare 30 seconds to go last night.

title: Pasarell, Gonzales Win; Gerken Upsets Stockton
description: Charlie Pasarell upheld his No. 1 seeding despite stiff resistance from Sandy Mayer in the second round of the $75,000 Clean Air tennis tournament at the Seventh Regiment Armory yesterday.

title: REFUGEES TO GET U.S AID PRIORITY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Nixon Administration has ordered that postwar aid programs give highest priorty to the resettlement and rehabilitation of the millions of refugees dislocated by the fighting In South Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia, a wellplaced Administration official said today.

title: Target Cone Intercepted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (Reuters)  A Sprint antiballistic missile has successfully intercepted a target cone in a test over the Pacific the Defense Department said today. The test was conducted over the Kwajalein atoll, the department said. The Sprint was not armed with an explosive warhead.

title: VACLAV BENES DIES; CZECH DIPLOMAT, 62
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 6 (AP)Dr. Vaclav Benes, a former Czechoslovak diplomat who was forced to relinquish his Government posts during the Nazi and Communist regimes, died here today. He was 62 years old.

title: DELEGATES REVISE CHURCHES COUNCIL
description: DALLAS, Dec. 6The General Assembly of the National Council of Churches voted itself out of existence today by approving a broad reorganization of the 22yearold ecumenical council.

title: Vacancy Is Filled
description: The General Foods Corporation reached into its own executive ranks yesterday to fill the presidential vacancy that suddenly occurred last April in the wake of the company's costly mistake in the fast food field.

title: New Gillette Trim
description: The Gillette Company, which began trimming its agency list about three years ago, trimmed further yesterday by dropping Clinton E. Frank, Inc.

title: Trenton Prison Unveils Contact Visiting Area in Old Death House
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6The State Prison here opened its gates today for a preview of a newly decorated contact visiting area transformed by paint and convict labor from its old Death House into colorcoordi nated cubicles where prisoners will be able to see and touch their families and friends.

title: GLOVER TOPS VOTE FOR STARS' SQUAD
Front Page 1 -- No Title
description: NonFiction Writers Workshop Sat., Dec. ?? at The New School?? Barbara Tuchman, Vance Packard, othersOR 53700.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 6 (AP)George Clark scored three goals and assisted on three others tonight in leading Army to an easy 82 hockey victory over Ithaca College.

title: RollsRoyce Tax Request Rejected
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (UPI)The bankruptcy receiver for RollsRoyce, Ltd., said today the Inland Revenue Service had turned down his request to offset taxes of a successor company with the old company's losses.

title: J. P. Morgan Lifts Dividend And Proposes Stock Split
description: Directors of J. P. Morgan & Co., Inc., increased the quarterly dividend yesterday and proposed a twoforone stock split, subject to shareholder approval at the annual meeting March 21. The 73cent dividend will be paid to holders of common stock on Jan. 15 to holders of record on Dec. 15. The previous quarterly rate was 70 cents. In the stock split, the par value would be reduced to $2.50 from the present $5.

title: LowPriced Volume Spurs Printing Success
description: Gene Sanger, a printer, remembers reading the auction notices in The Sunday New York Times six years ago with alarm.

title: Sentenced in Cycle Killing
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Dec. 6A 33yearold Norwich man was setenced yesterday to a onetofive year prison term in the shooting death of a rival motorcycle club member last August. James T. Kenny pleaded guilty to manslaughter in the killing of William J. Zilko, a member of the Branded Ones Motorcycle Club and was sentenced by Superior Court Judge Leo Parskey.

title: AGLIMMER FIRST IN INTERBOROUGH, SETTING RECORD
description: Aglimmer gave a flashing performance as she won the $29,425 Interborough Handicap in record time at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: American Satellite Reaches Pact With Telesat Canada
description: The American Satellite Corporation, which is jointly owned by Western Union International, Inc., and Fairchild Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it had also reached a preliminary agreement with Telesat Canada for an interim lease of capacity on Canadian satellites for communications within this country.

title: Blacks in South Struggle to Keep the Little Land They Have Left
description: FROGMORE, S. C., Dec. 5  Since 1861, getting and losing land has been the pride and despair of people like Evelina Jenkins.

title: Report on Judiciary Set
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 6 (AP)  Chief Justice Charles House of Connecticut will be asked to address a joint session of the General Assembly on the state of the judiciary next year, a new step in the Legislature.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: The President's request for Father Hesburgh's resignation from the Civil Rights Commission is one of the most alarming signs of the times.

title: Auction of List Property Recalls Jersey Slayings
description: WESTFIELD, Dec. 6  At 10:10 P.M., one year ago tomorrow night, Patrolmen Charles Haller and George Zhelernik, making a routine investigation of a suspicious motorist, radioed police headquarters here from 431 Hillside Avenue.

title: Irish Arts CenterA Proud Beginning
description: There are few real Irish people in the United States, said Brian Heron, a light brogue softening the edge of his fighting words. They know little about authentic Irish culture, and care less. The IrishAmerican is a victim of cultural disintegration, as much so as the Mayan Indian. We have to go back to the beginning, to learn again what it means to be Irish.

title: Herbert Retires From Bench
description: NEWARK, Dec. 6 (AP)  Superior Court Judge Ward P. Herbert stepped down from the bench today, his 70th birthday. But Judge Ward's retirement will be shortlived. He resumes his interupted career as a practicing lawyer tomorrow morning. Judge Herbert, who has been in the Chancery Division for 11 years, will rejoin the Newark law firm of McCarter and English.

title: Gambino Believed Seeking Single Mafia Family Here
description: Mafia leaders here were re ported to be working on plans for the most dramatic reorgan ization of the crime syndicate in more than 40 years, includ ing the eventual amalgamation of the city's five Mafia fam ilies into one.

title: Tennessee Gets Ray Order From U.S. District Judge
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 7 (AP)  Judge L. Clure Morton of United States District Court ordered the State of Tennessee today to show within 20 ays why James Earl Ray should not be released from the Tennessee State Prison.

title: U.S. AIDES ALERTED FOR VIETNAM DM AFTER CEASEFIRE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The State Department has quietly alerted 100 Foreign Service offi cers to prepare to go to South Vietnam, once a ceasefire is declared, to check on how the truce is being observed, depart ment officials said today.

title: Flyers Trounce North Stars
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7 (AP)  Gary Dornhoefer scored goal in his seventh straight game for the Philadelphia Fly ers tonight as the Flyers downed the Minnesota North Stars, 62, in an N.H.L. game.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 7 (UPI)A state Gaming Commission official says the lack of turnout at hearings on offtrack betting is an indication of public support for the program.

title: 16 Heroin Indictments
description: Sixteen alleged smugglers of heroin, said to have made up one of the world's largest rings in the narcotics trade and to have brought a ton of heroin into the United States each year, were indicted here yesterday on conspiracy charges. Details, Page 90.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)The Federal Home Loan Bank Board announced today that it would permit for the first time issuance of subordinated debentures and capital notes by savings and loans concerns. The board's acting chairman, Carl O. Kamp Jr., said the longterm debt issues subordinated to saver claims add a new capital cushion to support future expansion of savings and loan mortgage portfolios.

title: Australian Leader Halts Nominations For Royal Honors
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. Gough Whitlam, the new Prime Minister of Australia, took several steps today to give his threedayold Labor party Government a more proletarian image.

title: News of Skiing
description: If Ernie Blake, that well known student of skiing who operates the challenging Taos resort high in New Mexico's Rockies, has his way, the graduated length method (GLM) is going to take a bit of a reverse turn.

title: Solti, Conducting Damnation of Faust, Wins Ovation
description: The newest culturehero among contemporary conduc tors is Sir Georg Solti, and his appearances in New York are a phenomenon. Not even Karajan has ever evoked this kind of hysterical approval. To match it, one has to go back to the great days of Toscanini; and, indeed, there is something in common be tween the two.

title: TV Coverage of Landing
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 7 (AP)No more special telecasts of the Apollo 17 flight are scheduled by the three major networks until Monday, when Capt. Eu gene A. Cernan and Dr. Harri son H. Schmitt land on the moon and begin the first of three lunar explorations. Mon day's schedule follows, all times Eastern standard. C.B.S.: 2:50 P.M. to 3 P.M.; 11:30 P.M. to midnight; N.B.C.: 2:30 P.M. to landing conclusion, sched uled about 2:54 P.M.; 7:30 P.M. to 8 P.M.; 11:30 P.M. to 1:30 A.M.; A.B.C.: 2:30 P.M. to con clusion of landing; 7:30 P.M. to 8 P.M. McDonnellDouglas Corpora tion. He was manning one of countless consoles in the firing rooma console keeping track of conditions relating to the third or top of the Saturn 5 launching rocket. His company manufactures that stage.

title: PERON WIll SPEND HOLIDAYS IN SPAIN
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 7 (AP) Juan D. Pern will leave Ar gentina next week to visit Lima, Peru, and other Latin American capitals before re turning to Spain for the holi days, his personal delegate said today.

title: Rebozo's Brother Fined
description: MIAMI, Dec. 7 (AP)William Rebozo, younger brother of President Nixon's friend, C. G. Rebozo, was fined $20 today on a charge of public drunken ness. He was found slumped over the wheel of his car last month, the police said. Judge C. P. Rubiera of the Dade County Metro Court fined him $15 on the charge and $5 for court costs.

title: Rangers' Rolfe to Miss 10 Days
description: Injury problems continued to mount yesterday for the New York Rangers, who already have three players sidelined until after Christmas.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As representatives of some six hundred attorneys who practice daily before the Immigration and Naturali zation Service, from coast to coast, we welcome an indepth study of the administration of our immigration laws, as has been undertaken by Times reporter Martin Tolchin. We regret, however, several aspects of Mr. Tolchin's articles concerning the im portant investigation now being con ducted by the United States Attorney in San Diego.

title: HOCQUARD, 3 TO 5, FAILS U.S. DEBUT
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 7 The American debut of New Zealandbred Hocquard (pro nounced Hocard) turned out as big a flop as any vaudeville act that died in Sheboygan or New Haven.

title: Ship Blown Up at Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 7 (AP)Cambodian authorities reported that four frogmen blew up the Bright Star, a 1,900ton Hong Kong freighter docked here early today. They said that a Chinese crew man and three Cambodians were killed and that 14 Cam bodians were wounded. A mili tary police source said three of the frogmen were killed by sentries, and that the fourth was believed to have escaped.

title: Key CrimeSyndicate Men Among 25 Indicted Here
description: Federal and state grand juries have handed up 19 in dictments against 25 persons, including highranking figures in organized crime, in connec tion with their activities in the United States and Latin Amer ica, it was announced yester day by District Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: SAIGON YIELDING ON PRISONER ISSUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 7South Vietnam's For eign Minister, Tran Van Lam, said today that the Saigon Government would not refuse to do whatever can be done to free the American prisoners of war and could even agree to release political prisoners in its jails to help bring about an ac ceptable ceasefire accord.

title: Manhattan and Princeton Win in Garden Basketball
description: Princeton won a game of ugly basketball and Manhat tan won a sloppy one in the first college basketball double header of the season at Madi son Square Garden last night. The Princeton victory was a 51 47 upset of Rutgers in the sec ond game berore a crowd of 11,023, after Manhattan had overwhelmed St. Peter's, 9678.

title: Miss Proell Captures Opening Ski Cup Race
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 7 Annemarie Proell plowed to victory today in the downhill of the Criterium de la Pre mitre Neige, the opening event of the 197273 World Cup ski season.

title: EVICTION BASED ON SON'S JAILING
description: The New York City Housing Authority is evicting a couple from a housing project in Har lem because their son was jailed for an attempted rob bery.

title: Bogs Outpoints Vinales
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 7 (AP)Tom Bogs of Denmark knocked down Luis Vinales of New York in the fifth round and scored a 10 round decision tonight in a middleweight fight. Bogs weighed 164 pounds, Vinales 16.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: No doubt for reasons of space, Prof. Ivan Morris' Prisoners of Conscience [OpEd Nov. 11] mentioned only a few of the prominent intellectuals jailed by authorities for daring to criticize conditions in their native countries.

title: The Welfare Mess
description: There now seems general agreement among the Fed eral, state and local levels of government that adminis tration of this city's massive welfare system is itself colossal mess.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I noticed your Nov. 27 editorial on the taxicab mess in New York City and the desire of taxi commission chair man Michael J. Lazar for a new type of taxi similar to the London vehicle.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 7State of ficials and representatives of professional and voluntary health associations clashed to day on proposals to split the Department of Institutions and Agencies into two separate units.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Dec. 7Everyone had a sad story to tell at today's New Jersey college basketball writers weekly luncheon, but Wynn Phillips's story of Union was possibly the saddest.

title: Candidate in Japan, Forsaking Bow, Seeks Votes With Handshake
description: HIGASHI  KUNISAKI  GUN, Japan, Dec. 6  Bunsei Sato bounced over rocky roads up the mountains covered with or chards and bamboo groves and across the valleys of rice and vegetable fields in this rural country for 11 hours today in search of votes for his reelec tion to Parliament on Sunday.

title: GOVERNOR PUSHES FEDERALISM STUDY
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that he would under take a wideranging inquiry into the role of the modern state in our changing Federal systema study he has dis cussed with President Nixon.

title: Fire Officer Collapses On the Job and Dies
description: A fire lieutenant died of a heart attack last night after he collapsed on the job as firemen battled a blaze in a threestory frame building in the BedfordStuyvesant sec tion of Brooklyn, the depart ment reported.

title: Du Pont Is Expected to Halt Producing Packaging Film
description: The film department of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. an nounced yesterday that it ex pected to halt production of coated polypropylene packag ing film, which it has been making for eight years at a plant in Clinton, Iowa. Produc tion would continue during a phaseout period to permit customers to establish other sources of supply.

title: MICHIGAN BEATEN BY BRIGHAM YOUNG
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 7 Brigham Young defeated Michi gan, 8377, tonight in the first collegiate basketball game played in Nassau Coliseum.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Every December just about this time thousands upon thousands of Christ mas trees are trucked into New York City, sold on street corners to city dwellers and taken home to brown stones and highrise apartments where they are decorated for the holidays.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It appears to me that the New York Police Department is accelerating a campaign of entrapment while dimin ishing its real and important duty of crime prevention and the protection of the people of this city.

title: Notes on People
description: Gold medals for distin guished service to humanity were awarded to three recipi ents at a dinner of the Na tional institute of Social Sci ences in New York last night, but a fourth medalistDr. Henry A. Kissinger was un able to attend. The President's chief national security ad viser was detained in Paris by the Vietnam peace nego tiations. The three who did make it were Mrs. Laurance Rockefeller, member of the National Board of the Y.W.C.A. and chairwoman of its world relations commit tee: Ambassador George Bush, United States perma nent representative to the United Nations, and Arch bishop Fulton J. Sheen, for mer Auxiliary Bishop of New York and national director of the Society for the Propaga tion of the Faith.

title: F.D.A. AIDE CHARGES ANTIBIOTICS MISUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) A top official of the Food and Drug Administration cautioned today against the use of anti biotics to treat minor infections, saying some drugs can not only cause blood poisoning but also create deadly superinfections.

title: PACT WORKED OUT ON HOSPITAL TAX
description: The administrator of Knicker bocker Hospital said last night that the financially troubled voluntary institutions in Har lem had worked out an agree ment with the Internal Revenue Service for repayment of $765,000 in taxes it owes the Federal Government.
