title: Letters to the Editor
description: How shall one assess the United States stance in the present United Nations General Assembly? The U.S. has just repeated its solo performance reported in The Times of Nov. 26 by again choosing to be the only country abstaining on the question of a world disarmament conference. The hopes may never have been bright. The U.S. action makes them less so. The vote in the General Assembly was 105 in favor to none against, with one abstentionthe U.S.

title: Court Backs Suits by Tenants Of Racially Segregated Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Supreme Court decided today that people living in racially segregated housing projects can suffer economic and social in jury just as can those forced to live outside such projects.

title: COLETTE BOKY SINGS FIRST LUCIA AT MET
description: Since Colette Boky has sung numerous roles during her years with the Metropolitan Opera, it was surprising to dis cover that until Wednesday night she had not gotten around to Lucia in Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor. The opportunity presented itself when Gail Robinson, who was originally scheduled for the performance, became indis posed.

title: The Arts in Brief
description: George Bernard Shaw's 70 yearold excursion into sexual politics and prophecy, Don Juan in Hell, will open a fourweek engagement at the Palace Theater on Jan. 15. Don Juan, the rarely per formed third act of Shaw's masterwork, Man and Super man, will star Paul Henreid, Ricardo Montalban, Edward Mulhare and Agnes Moore head. John Houseman direct ed, and the producers are Lee Orgel and William J. Griffiths.

title: New Kuhn Loeb Partner
description: Kuhn Loeb & Co. announced yesterday that Robert M. Shep ard would be admitted as general partner of the invest ment banking firm on Jan. 1, subject to approval by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
The Talk of Crane, Ind.
description: CRANE, Ind.Every week day morning for the last sev eral years, Mrs. Patricia Ash has awakened around 5 A.M., fed and sent her two teen aged children off to school and driven 26 miles to work here. Her earnings of $3.84 an hour, combined with her husband's income from a gas station, mean that the Ash family can have new clothes more often and live consid erably better than it expected to a few years ago. But when peace comes in Vietnam, that may all end. For like several thousand other workers here in south western Indiana, Mrs. Ash's income depends on war. She makes bombs.

title: RUSSELL G. CONNALLY
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 6Rus sell G. Connally, vice president and corporate secretary of the Gulf Oil Corporation, died to day, apparently of a heart at tack. He was 59 years old and lived in Wexford.

title: They Paint The Town With No. 1
description: Dave Nelson, the Univer sity of Delaware's athletic di rector, referred to the latest of the football award series yesterday as The Tubby and Joe Show, produced and di rected by the Lambert broth ers, with the longest current run on Broadway.

title: MISS WAGNER WINS IN FIGURE SKATING
Census Shows Big Rise in Schooling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Census Bureau issued new evi dence today of the education al transformation that has oc curred in the United States in the space of a single generation.

title: NETS BACK HOME TO MEET SQUIRES
description: Having snapped a fourgame losing streak by defeating the Tams, 10195, at Memphis on Wednesday night, the New York Nets return to Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L. I., tonight to face the Virginia Squires.

title: Merger News
description: The WarnerLambert Com pany announced yesterday that Andrew C. Goodhope, an ad ministrative law judge, who is presiding in the Federal Trade Commission's proceeding chal lenging the acquisition of Parke, Davis & Co. by WarnerLam bert in 1970, had denied the mo tion of the commission's lawyers for a summary decision that the merger violates Section 7 of the Clayton AntiTrust Act. The commis sion filed suit to undo the $450 million merger in 1971, charg ing that it has substantially lessened competition in the drug business. The merger combined two of the nation's largest pharmaceutical concerns. Judge Goodhope is the hearing ex aminer in the case.

title: Tunex Rallies in the Stretch to Defeat Naskra by Neck in Aqueduct Feature
description: Tunex of the Hobeau Farm contributed a characteristic stretch rush to win the $15,000 main event at Aqueduct yes terday.

title: 11.5% Increase Reported In Intercity Truck Tonnage
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The American Trucking Associa tions, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 11.5 per cent above the corre sponding week last year. Truck tonnage in the week was 29.6 per cent above the immediately preceding week, which included the Thanksgiving Day holiday.

title: HAMILTON ASSAILS DAYCARE PROPOSAL
description: Higher fees for children's day care proposed by state welfare officials were denounced as harsh and unreasonable yes terday by Deputy Mayor Ed ward K. Hamilton as he an nounced a citywide campaign to fight the rise.

title: Census Shows Big Rise in Schooling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Census Bureau issued new evi dence today of the education al transformation that has oc curred in the United States in the space of a single generation.

title: Stock Prices Scale New PeaksDow Advances 5.72
description: The Dow  Jones industrial average and other leading mar ket indicators forged to new peaks yesterday on the heels of Wednesday's recordshatter ing session for stock prices.

title: Miller's Play Closes Dec. 16
description: Arthur Miller's The Crea tion of the World and Other Business will end its run at the Shubert Dec. 16 after 20 performances. The cast of nine includes Zoe Caldwell, George Grizzard, Bob Dishy and Stephen Elliott.

title: Phone Bill in Bugging Case Linked to White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Bills for an Executive Office Build ing telephone used by E. How ard Hunt Jr., a defendant in the bugging of the Democratic headquarters at the Watergate complex here, were sent to the private home of a secretary and then forwarded for pay ment to a White House aide, the secretary said tonight.

title: BLACKS ARE NAMED TO BATTLE CRIME
description: A newly appointed citizens' anticrime task force will take whatever steps are necessary to insure that the black com munities here will become places of peace and tranquil lity for all except the criminal, the chairman or Harlem's Har youAct Community Corpora tion announced yesterday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmos phere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: F.P.C. BARS ROLE ON SYNTHETIC GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7In a decision that could ignite a major debate about government energy policy, the Federal Power Commission ruled today that it has no jurisdiction over the price of certain synthetic gas provided it is not mixed with natural gas.

title: Miller Charges Kuhn With Bad Faith
description: Bowie Kuhn, the commission er of baseball, was accused by the players' representative yes terday of clouding the climate of labor negotiations by state ments that tend to harden the positions of both sides.

title: Foster Trio's Jazz Overcomes Hubbub At New Restaurant
description: One more in the steadily growing list of places where jazz can be heard in New York is a new restaurant, the Rust Brown Room on West 96th Street, between Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues, which has ambitions to be an uptown Toots Shor's. Sur rounded by sports pictures and a strongly conversational au dience, Herman Foster, leading a trio, plays piano with such exuberantly driving force that he cuts through the room's bubbling hubbub.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES MAKE COMEBACK
description: Soybean futures, which had dropped the day before on prof it taking, staged a comeback yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade and closed with gains of 3 cents to 8 cents a bushel.

title: Nassau Republicans March to Beat Of Powerful Drumming by Margiotta
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 7 The modernday version of the oldfashioned political boss is flourishing in Nassau County.

title: SemiRetired Graffiti Scrawlers Faint Mural at C.C.N.Y. 133
description: A lot of people don't like it, man, but like it or not, we've made the biggest art movement ever to hit New York City, said Super Kool, one of the city's leading graf fiti artists after putting the finishing touches on a wall painting this week.

title: Equity Financing
description: Caesars World, Inc., has made a public offering of 310,000 shares of common stock of the Centro nics Data Computer Corporation for $26.50 per share through a syndicate healed by Walston & Co., Inc. Upon completion of the sale, Caesars World would still hold 400,000 shares, or about 9 per cent of the outstanding stock of Centronics. The net proceeds from the sale will be about $7.25 million.

title: Court in Civil Case Backs Right Of Reporter to Withhold Source
description: A journalist's right to refuse to disclose a confidential news source was affirmed in a civil case yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Laotian Victory Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 7 (AP)A United States military spokesman said today that Gov ernment irregulars had seized Pak Song, a provincial capital near the center of the Boloven Plateau 290 miles southwest of Vientiane. North Vietnamese troops, who drove the Laotians from the plateau last year to halt raids on the nearby Ho Chi Minh supply trail, were moving south from Pak Song, the spokesman added.

title: Dance: Two by Batsheva
description: Two years ago, the choreo graphic style of the young Is raeli choreographers in the Batsheva Dance Company seemed particularly assertive, almost devoid of tranquillity.

title: Cuba, Emulating China, Is Using Army to Spur Development in Many Key Sectors of Her Economy
description: HAVANA, Dec. 9 (Reuters) The Cuban Army, which has just held 16th anniversary cele brations, is unlike any other in the world, with the possible exception of China's.

title: Red Light Curbs Jogger
description: SOUTH LAKE TAHOE, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI)Kiou Jalayer, 30 years old, got a ticket for run ning a red light at 15 miles an hour  literally. Mr. Jalayar, who said he was a marathon runner on the Iranian Olympic team, was pulled over to the curb by a patrolman who said he jogged through a red light. He faces a possible $5 fine.

title: Man Slain in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 7 (UPI)A woman found the body of a man in a truck in a Protestant neighborhood today. The police said they had no idea how he had died.

title: Peace Talks, Both Private And Formal, Held in Parts
description: PARIS, Dec. 7While Henry A. Kissinger continued his pri vate ceasefire talks with the North Vietnamese, delegates of Hanoi and the Vietcong deliv ered a message of toughness today in the formal negotiations a few miles away.

title: Sidney W. Farnsworth Dies; A Longtime Postal Aide, 86
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., Dec. 7 Sidney W. Farnsworth, a pos tal engineer and a former presi dent of the Torrington (Conn.) Manufacturing Company, died Tuesday at the Mountainside Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived in Upper Montclair.

title: Fashion Firm Got Minister's Blessing
description: Audrey Frazier and Connie Saunders threw a party this week in the garment center to celebrate the opening of Key Creations, their new showroom for sports clothes. It wasn't the usual fashion party. Percy Sutton, Manhat tan's Borough President, was there to tell the women he hoped he would see their clothes in all Fifth Avenue's best stores. Rev. Dr. Leon H. Sullivan, pastor of the Zion Baptist Church in Phil adelphia, went even further. These clothes will be in every department store in America by next Christ mas, he declared.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The Boy's Shop

title: Wholesale Index Reported 0.6% Higher in November
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Wholesale prices rose substan tially in November, with both food and industrial commodities contributing to the rise, the Labor Department reported to day.

title: Mrs. Meir Warns Israelis Of New Fighting in Mideast
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 7 (AP)Pre mier Golda Meir said today that because of arms shipments to the Arabs, she would not be surprised if war breaks out on the borders.

title: TV Coverage of Landing
description: Most astronauts keep their political opinions, except for the usual patriotic remarks, to themselves.

title: OILMAN WILL GET TRANSPORT POST; VOLPE TO BE ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  President Nixon selected today Claude S. Brinegar, an exec utive of a California oil com pany, as his secondterm Sec retary of Transportation, suc ceeding John A. Volpe, who was named Ambassador to Italy.

title: MRS. GERTRUDE WILLIS
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 7 Mrs. Gertrude Willis, widow of Dr. Waring Willis, a gyne cologist and surgeon, died at her home here yesterday. Her age was 65.

title: No Americans Died in War For Second Week in a Row
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 7 (AP)The United States com mand announced today that no Americans had been killed in action in Vietnam last week for the second successive week. But it said that three Americans died from noncombat causes, one was missing or had been cap tured, and seven were wound ed.

title: ELLSBERG TRIM TO START TUESDAY
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7  Most of the pretrial legal man euvering in the Pentagon papers case ended today, and, as of now, the trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. is scheduled to start Tues day.

title: GONZALES BEATS GERKEN BY 64, 64
description: Those sweet mysteries of life that tease the aging masters re turned to Richard (Pancho) Gonzales last night.

title: MonetaryGrowth Rate Held Moderate in Week
APOLLO SPEEDING ON MOON COURSE
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 7  Apollo 17, despite its tardy launching early today, is expected to make lip all of the lost time and reach an orbit of the moon on schedule at 2:48 P.M., East ern standard time, next Sunday.

title: Killer of Chicano Leader Free on SelfDefense Plea
description: ALMOGORDO, N.M., Dec. 7 (UPI)Perry Brunson, 57 years old, a service station owner who shot to death a Mexican American leader, Ricardo Fal con, last summer, was found not guilty of manslaughter by reason of selfdefense yester day.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Standardized testing on a statewide basis is a straitjacket approach to teaching, according to the executive director of the New Jersey Education Asso ciation.

title: French Connection Sticks
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7 (UPI) A New York actor who had a bit role in the movie The French Connection  a film about drug smugglingwas sentenced to prison yesterday for smuggling $1.5million worth of cocaine Into the coun try. Norman A. Gibbs, 24 years old, who pleaded guilty to the charge Oct. 24, was sentenced to four years in a Federal prison.

title: Rockets Triumph, 10289
description: DENVER, Dec. 7 (AP)The Denver Rockets struggled through a sluggish performance tonight but had enough guns to score a 10289 victory over the San Diego Conquistadors.

title: Advertising:
description: Renfield Importers, it is understood, is looking for a new ad agency home for Martini & Rossi vermouth.

title: CONSOLIDATION SET BY MARINE MIDLAND
description: Marine Midland Banks, Inc., an $11billion statewide bank holding company, announced yesterday longexpected plans to consolidate its present 10 banking subsidiaries into a sin gle bank  effective Jan. 1, 1976, when statewide branch banking in New York is to go into operation.

title: A Faulty Cable Cuts Power At Port Authority Terminal
description: The malfunction of an elec tric feeder cable caused a par tial loss of lighting and stopped escalator and elevator service at the Port Authority Bus Ter minal on Eighth Avenue last night.

title: Books of The Times
description: Writing about Protestantism as a whole is like trying to describe the Democratic party. The common denominator linking, say, Eugene Carson Blake and Carl Mc Intire is at least as nebulous as that between George McGovern and John Stennis. At least the Democrats hold meeting every four years.

title: DECEPTION IS LAID TO GRANT BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Federal Trade Commission ac cused the W. T. Grant Com pany today of using deceptive tactics in extending credit to customers.

title: Regular Nixon Wears Regular Sports Slacks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7At a news briefing at Camp David today, one questioner moved from policy making to haberdashery.

title: BOARD PRESERVES TUDOR CITY PARKS
description: The Board of Estimate gave final approval last night to an unusual proposal to block the construction of apartment tow ers over two parks in Tudor City while compensating the owner by transferring his build ing rights to another part of town.

title: ACCORD REACHED ON KASHMIR LINE
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 7India and Pakistan announced today that they had resolved the deadlock over designation of a ceasefire line in Kashmir.

title: Pomp and Politicians
description: Charles de Gaulle was buried in a $63 wooden casket made by a village carpenter, and, at the same time, the Kennedy family announced plans to build Senator Robert F. a $737,000 gravesite. Since the Kennedy family and their financial supporters are bearing threefourths of the cost (the Government is paying the rest), it is 75 per cent nobody's business but theirs. Still, the accidental juxtaposi tion of the two events points up a strange anomaly in the world's great est democracy: the tendency of its citi zens to surround political leaders, alive or dead, with a pomp practically un paralleled anywhere else in the world.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HACKENSACK, Dec. 7  Advocates of mas public trans portation today called for ex tensive public hearings on the $650million transit bills now before the State Legislature, charging that the public had not been informed about the contents of the proposals or of the extent of involvement of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: DENTIST'S CHART FREES A SUSPECT
description: The Bronx District Attorney's office disclosed yesterday that a dentist's chart had been used to clear a young man accused for the second time in less than a year of crimes he did not commit.

title: NarcoticsRelated Deaths Here Reach a Record High for Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Narcotics  related deaths in New York City have reached a record high this year and are expected to total 1,350 by year's end, a national addic tion conference was told here today.

title: Hawks Defeat Bulls
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 (AP)Pete Maravich, who scored 8 straight points to tie the game in regulation time, connected on two jump shots in the five minute overtime to lift the Atlanta Hawks to a 9489 vic tory over the Chicago Bulls to night. The Bulls, who led by 15 points early in the third quarter, fell into second place in the Midwest Division behind idle Milwaukee.

title: Experts Tricked the Computer
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 7 When something goes wrong in the countdown for a $450 million flight to the moon, how do mission directors decide what to do? weight motorcycles over the hills and woods near their home outside Houston. On weekends they can frequent ly be seen or heard roaring up and down the otherwise placid woods.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 7The air was filled with treble boos as Natalie Costa stepped for ward for her curtain call. She looked mildly surprised, but shouldn't have been: This was a performancedress re hearsal of the Opera Theater of New Jersey's production of Humperdinck's Hansel and Gretel, and children al ways boo the witch.

title: People and Business
description: The Emerson Electric Com pany has changed the titles of a group of its top manage ment officials, creating what it calls an expanded struc ture. Wallace R. Persons, 63 years old, remains as chair man and chief executive offi cer of Emerson (which is not connected with the Emerson Television and Radio Com pany) but the next four men in the hierarchy all have new positions.

title: Cape Hoping for the Best In Wake of Apollo's Boom
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 7 When Apollo 17's rocket cleared the launching tower seconds after liftoff early this morning, control of the mission officially shifted to Houston. As far as the huge Kennedy Space Center and the towns in this area were concerned, Project Apollo was over.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 7 (UPI)Belgium's lower house today gave final approval to a treaty admitting Britain, Ireland and Denmark to the European Economic Community. The vote on the treaty was 164 to 5, with the opposing ballots cast by members of Belgium's Communist party. The Senate had already approved the document.

title: Bridge: Advice in a Vulnerable Slam: You Must Persevere Doggedly
description: A belief in miracles  bridge miracles, that is  should be part of the psycho logical equipment of every player. Suppose you are playing in an important match and find yourself in vulnerable slain with two ob vious losers and a few other problems. There is nothing to be gained by griev ing about the bidding. You must persevere doggedly and hope, like Micawber, that that something will turn up.

title: 21 Black Sailors, Accused in Kitty Hawk Riot, Refuse to Appear Before Congressional Inquiry Unit
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 7  Twentyone black sailors of the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk, who face courtsmartial for their part in a 15hour riot at sea, refused today to appear before a Congressional group that is here investigating racial disorders aboard Navy ships.

title: 3MONTH EXTENSION SET FOR PRICE PACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) The Price Commission said today that it would not renew yearlong price increase agree ments with some of the nation's biggest corporations until it had better guidance from the White House on the future of wageprice controls.

title: DEVELOPER DEFENDS ADIRONDACKS PLANS
description: RAY BROOK, N. Y., Dec. 7 (AP)Louis Paparazzo, de fending his plans for a huge vacationhome project in the heart of the Adirondacks, says he has prepared legal docu ments to make sure the devel opment will not adversely af fect the environment.

title: Herbert L. Packer Is Dead at 47; Stanford Law School Professor
description: STANFORD, Calif., Dec. 7  Prof. Herbert L. Packer, an ex pert on criminal law and a member of the Stanford Uni versity faculty since 1956, died at a San Francisco hotel yes terday. He was 47 years old.

title: Men in the News
description: Eugene Andrew Cernan, the man who is to maneuver the Apollo 17 lunar module to a hopedfor gentle landing on the moon, was once fly ing a helicopter over water near Cape Kennedy when, as an investigative board later determined, he misjudged his altitude and slammed the craft into the water. The heli copter broke up and sank. Its fuel tank split open and caused a fire. Captain Cernan was picked up from the water suffering burns and bruises.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Why did less than half of the eligible 18to21yearolds vote? What turns off the educated new genera tion?

title: Medical Society to Ask Dr. Jacobson to Meeting
description: The Medical Society of the County of New York said yesterday that it would request Dr. Max Jacobson to appear at a special meeting of its Board of Censors to discuss what it called allegations of unethical conduct made in the news media.

title: 2 TEACHERS ROBBED IN FRONT OF CLASS
description: Two women elementary school teachers in Brooklyn told the police yesterday that they had been robbed of $41 by a man who walked into a classroom full of children at Public School 91, Albany and East New York Avenues in the Crown Heights section, and said, Give me your money or else.

title: JERSEY BANK PLANS ACCOUNTING CHANGE
description: The Summit and Elizabeth Trust Company, $200million bank in suburban Summit, N. J,. is planning a change in method of accounting for loan losses that will drastically re duce its reported earnings this year, Thomas D. Sayles Jr., president of the bank, said yes terday.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced yesterday that it would allow trading in securities of the Ecological Science Corporation, beginning Dec. 19.

title: About Pro Football
description: A dozen teams remain in contention for the five un filled playoff berths with nine key games over the weekend, There are two to morrow, Cleveland at Cincin nati and Washington at Dal las, and both will be tele vised, the first on Channel 4 at 1 P.M., the second on Channel 2 at 4 P.M. The Giants and Jets are un derdogs to win ning teams al ready qualified for the playoffs. The Dolphins are favored by 7 points over the Giants and the Raiders by 6 over the Jets on Mon day night. Games on tele vision Sunday will be Green Bay at Minnesota, Channel 2, 2 P.M., and Pittsburgh at Houston, Channel 4, 4 P.M. Previews of all games follow with wonlosttied records in parentheses.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: An article in The Times of Nov. 17 has just about capped it all off for me. The article's reference to the project of erecting an indoor recreation build ing at Attica beats all.

title: Chamber Members Back Merger
description: The prestigious New York Chamber of Commerce, which traces its origins back to King George III, voted by an overwhelming margin yes terday to merge with the Commerce and Industry As sociation of New York.

title: For Youth Cult Hero, a Private Reality
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7 Before Carlos Castaneda, au thor of three acclaimed books about Southwest Indian mys ticism, gave a lecture recent ly at the University of Cali fornia in San Diego, members of the class, he recalls, specu lated about his looks. He woudld be very tall, the speculation ran, with mysti cal feet, long red hair and no shoes. He was definitely Mexican, but somehow would talk like an Anglo.

title: Fighting Saints Win
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 7 (AP)Mike Curran, the goalie, registered his second shutout of the sea son tonight as the Minnesota Fighting Saints downed Hous ton Aeros, 30.

title: BRUINS TRIUMPH OVER BLUES, 50
description: BOSTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)  Mike Walton scored two goals and assisted on a third tonight for the Boston Bruins as the Bruins routed the St. Louis Blues, 50, in a National Hockey League game.

title: ISRAEL REPORTS ARREST OF SPIES
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 7  An Israeli police official asserted today that a Syrian spy ring with Israeli Arab and radical leftist Jewish members had been uncovered.

title: Carley Porter, Who Shaped Coast Water Project, Dies
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI)Assemblyman Carley V. Porter of Compton, cosponsor in 1959 of California's $1.75 billion waterproject bond issue, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, while attending a conference in Washington. He was 66 years old.

title: NECKING IMPROVES HIS CHESS STANDING
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 7 (AP)  Henrique Mecking of Brazil was assured today of a high finish in the Church's Fried Chicken International chess tournament.

title: U.N. Schedules World Conference on Law of Sea
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7  Agreement was reached today to hold a world conference on the law of the sea beginning here in Novem ber. 1973, and resuming in Chile in 1974.

title: OILMAN WILL GET TRANSPORT POST; VOLPE TO BE ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  President Nixon selected today Claude S. Brinegar, an exec utive of a California oil com pany, as his secondterm Sec retary of Transportation, suc ceeding John A. Volpe, who was named Ambassador to Italy.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COVENTRY, England, Dec. 7 (AP)Ray Terrell, the British swimmer dropped from the Olympic squad after a police raid on his room, was acquitted in court today of possessing marijuana.

title: PlayerOwner Issues
description: Following are the principal issues in the nego tiations between the baseball club owners and the major league players. The basic agreement on working conditions expires Dec. 31, the pension plan March 31. Talks have been going on in New York for three months. A dispute over pensions last April led to a 13day strike.

title: Pages of Violations Turn Up At West Side Residence Club
description: Two Health Department sani tartans made a roombyroom inspection of the Harvard Resi dence Club on the Upper West Side yesterday, only a day after the neighborhood health center had reported 12 cases of tuber culosis among its residents.

title: TRUMAN RALLIES WITH ANTIBIOTICS
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 7 Former President Harry S. Truman rallied somewhat to day in his fight against a lung infection, but doctors kept him on the critical list because of a weakened heart.

title: JAMES M. MULLIN
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 7 James M. Mullin, for many years an executive of General Motors Foreign Distributors, died last Thursday in Northern Westchester Hospital, Mount Kisco, N. Y. He was 58 years old.

title: The most expensive single colored gem ever sold at auctionthe 34carat socalled Ponti emeraldcost an anony mous dealer $385,000.
description: The woman in the sable coat shook her head in won der. It's amazing, she re marked to a friend. They're paying so much for jewelry when it isn't safe to wear it. Do they buy it just to keep in vaults?

title: Sports of The Times
description: If another player strike fouls up the next baseball season, a major share of the blame will belong to Bowie Kuhn. The front man for the owners has impaired nego tiations for a new basic agreement with the players by violating an understanding with the players' representa tives and presenting to the public a slanted and incomplete version of the owners' offer to relax the repugnant reserve system. In spite of this destructive act, the play ers' spokesman said yesterday, discussions will be resumed in the hope that Kuhn has not irrevo cably poisoned the atmosphere.

title: Turnout Is Low in Irish Vote on Church
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 7The people of Ireland voted today to decide whether the Roman Catholic Church should lose its favored place under the Con stitution.

title: 2,000 Protest Here To Support Strike Of C.B.S. Workers
description: In support of the technicians' union strike against the Colum bia Broadcasting System, the New York City Central Labor Council staged a mass demon stration at C.B.S. headquarters last evening.

title: Computer Hypochondria
description: The Apollo 17 astronauts are now tens of thousands of miles away on their historic trek to the moon. But for more than twoandahalf hours late Wednesday night and early yesterday morning it looked as if they might not take off. The automatic cutoff of launch preparations just thirty seconds before scheduled liftoff created an unprecedented situation; but the problems then posed were successfully overcome by the large and ingenious Apollo ground support team. The lessons implicit in this incident have wider applicability than just to the Apollo program now approaching its end.

title: Man Is Shot Dead After Wounding Wife of the Philippine President
description: MANILA, Dec. 7  A man in a dark suit drew a footlong dagger and stabbed the wife of President Ferdinand E. Mar cos today as she was presiding at a ceremony.

title: U.S. Indicts 16 as Plotters In HeroinRing Smuggling
Election Due March 20 For Boggs Replacement
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 1 (UPI)Gov. Edwin Edwards said today that he will call a special election March 20, to fill the Congressional seat of the missing House majori ty leader, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana, if Con gress declares the seat vacant by that time.

title: SUBURBS TO GAIN ON FUND SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Fastgrowing suburbs in the tri state area, such as Rockland County, will be the big bene ficiaries of the Administration's decision to use more upto date information in calculating how much money each state and local government will re ceive under the new revenue sharing program.

title: Revenue Sharing Hailed
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Dec. 7 (AP)The outgoing president of the National Conference of State Legislative. Leaders called the Federal revenuesharing bill a major achievement even though it was not all state leaders wanted. Aubrey W. Dirlam, Speaker of the Minnesota House of Representatives, told the 1,200 conference delegates that their organization had worked for revenue sharing over the years and it was a major ac complishment.

title: Dr. HenriMarie Coanda, 86, Pioneer in Aerodynamics, Dies
description: Dr. HenriMarie Coanda, who invented and flew a rudimen tary jet airplane in 1910, more than 30 years before jet air craft became a practical reality late in World War II, died Nov. 25, in Bucharest. He was 86 years old.

title: AustrianEast German Ties
description: VIENNA, Dec. 7 (AP)Aus tria and East Germany an nounced agreement today to es tablish diplomatic relations Dec. 21.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Sadly, and all too often, those who bring pleasure to our lives, not with a fanfare of trumpets or blinding genius, but in a gentle, kindly, unobtrusive way, are honored too late.

title: Doubt Lingers on Funds to Feed Aged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7A national conference on food for the aging ended today as it began on Tuesdaywith the participants uncertain about Federal funds for feeding the elderly.

title: 2 Arraigned in 1971 Police Slaying
description: Two men accused of kill ing two city patrolmen in Harlem on May 21, 1971, pleaded not guilty at their arraignment here yesterday after being flown from San Francisco by five New York City police detectives.

title: U.S. Troops to Stay in Europe, Nixon Tells NATO Ministers
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 7 (UPI) President Nixon said today that the United States would maintain its troop strength in Europe as long as the Soviet Union did and as long as America's European allies main tained their own defense levels.

title: National Unit on Uniform State Laws Joining Fight for NoFault Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A national organization of judg es, lawyers, law professors and legislators has joined the fight over automobile insurance re form as an outspoken advo cate of the nofault concept.

title: Guthrie Elected President Of Football Writers Group
description: Bill Guthrie of The New Haven Register and Journal Courier was elected yesterday to a oneyear term as president of the New York chapter of the Pro Football Writers Asso ciation of America.

title: Chicken Liver Done With Cognac and Sherry
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an aster isk is followed by a recipe. Chicken livers with noodles

title: Pragmatism at the U.N.
description: The heavy vote in a committee of the United Nations last week in favor of an American proposal to cut the maximum assessed contribution to 25 per cent repre sents not so much a victory for the United States as triumph of pragmatism on behalf of the international organization itself. If this Finance Committee action upheld by the General Assembly, as expected, the United Nations will have wisely reduced its dependence on its increasingly uncertain chief financial backer. At the same time, it will have improved chances for substan tial and sustained American support by averting a con frontation that would only strengthen its foes here.

title: Hughes Tool Company Sold for $150Million
description: Howard Hughes sold his oil well drillingbit business yesterday for $150million $10million more than ex pected. The stock, priced at $30 a share, sold fast and rose to a premium.

title: PAUL RUST
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 7 (AP)Paul Rust, president of the Connecticut Railway and Lighting Company since 1952, died yesterday at Bridgeport Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: Erving Registers 41 As Squires Subdue Pacers by 132129
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 7 (AP) Julius Erving scored a club rec ord 24 points in the third pe riod and had a game total of 41 as the Virginia Squires de feated the Indiana Pacers, 132 129, in an American Basketball, Association game tonight.

title: Council Delves Into Acupuncture
description: The city's Commissioner of Health, Joseph A. Cimino, said yesterday that while acupunc ture might make an important contribution to medicine, its indiscriminate use could de velop into a significant public health problem.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: Hull, QuebecDonato Paduano, 158 pounds, Montreal, knocked out Jimmy Mallish, 159, Quebec, 5 rounds.

title: Big Board Chairman Urges the S.E.C. to Drop Plan
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7  James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, called today for abandonment of efforts by the Securities and Exchange Commission to re quire corporations to forecast their financial results.

title: CHARTER HEARING TAKES UP SCHOOLS
description: As the New York City Char ter Revision Commission con tinued to take soundings in Brooklyn yesterday, two ex tremes of sentiment were es tablished by two witnesses, a woman from East New York and a man from Sheepshead Bay.

title: Books of The Times
description: No one can get everything into a single book, says Herbert S. Parmet, in this political biography of our 34th President. But he seems to have tried. The author is not a man who can let a fact go by. His book is as stuffed as an illmade mattress and as lumpy. The telling detail in a narrative that tries for an overall view (to use his phrase), can be reveal ing or colorful, but too many of his details tell us things we don't need to know for the purpose of his story. I am sorry to sound so grumpy right at the start of this piece, but his method makes for a clumsy, illproportioned book in which the material gets in the way of the subject. Mr. Parmet has made an obstacle course out of what should have been an exciting romp through the political woods.

title: Sabres Win Another
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 7 (AP)Gerry Meehan and Rene Robert scored two goals each tonight as the Buffalo Sabres ran their home unbeaten streak to 14 games with a 61 N.H.L. victory over the Detroit Red Wings. Tim Ecclestone ruined the shutout bid of Dave Dryden, Buffalo goalie, with a goal at 2:56 of the final period.

title: TV Review
description: With Santiago's Ark, Shown this week, the Ameri can Broadcasting Company has firmly established its series of afterschool spe cials as intelligent viewing for youngsters. A comparable series for intelligent adults at an even earlier afternoon hour, amid traditional soap opera and game show swill, suggests the bravery of Moses in crossing the Red Sea.

title: Market Place: Funds to Invest In Trust Shares
description: It was bound to happen sooner or later. There are a couple of hundred real estate investment trusts on the mar ket and it is only natural that someone would offer them on a market basket basis.

title: Jets Nurse Injuries, Slim Hope
description: The New York Jets pre pared yesterday to leave for their final trip of the season, nursing a patchedtogether backfield as well as hopes for a wildcard spot in the American Football Confer ence playoff.

title: WALK, SCOTT HELP SUNS DOWN 76ERS
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 7 (AP) The Phoenix Suns, with Neil Walk and Charlie Scott com bining for 52 points, defeated the Philadelphia 76ers, 117102, in a National Basketball Asso ciation game here tonight. The Suns broke a threegame los ing streak.

title: Gambino Believed Seeking Single Mafia Family Here
description: Mafia leaders here were re ported to be working on plans for the most dramatic reorgan ization of the crime syndicate in more than 40 years, includ ing the eventual amalgamation of the city's five Mafia fam ilies into one.

title: Burns Recommends Holding Spending by U. S. at $250Billion Level
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Arthur F. Burns, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, told a congressional subcom mittee today that a Federal budget of $270billion for the coming fiscal year would be too high in my judgment.

title: France to Cut Tax and Sell Bonds in Fight on Inflation
Economic Foundation Elects
description: Donald I. Rogers, former business and financial editor of The New York Herald Tribune, was elected yesterday president and chief operations officer of the American Economic Foun dation. He will also be in charge of expansion of the foundation's programs, which are aimed basically at economic educa tion of the general public. The group's headquarters are at 51 East 42d Street.

title: HOBART TAYLOR, FOUGHT POLL TAX
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 7  Ho bart Taylor Sr., who became the first black delegate from Texas since Reconstruction days when he attended the 1944 Demo cratic National Convention, died Tuesday In Memorial Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: U.S. AIDES ALERTED FOR VIETNAM DUTY AFTER CEASEFIRE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The State Department has quietly alerted 100 Foreign Service offi cers to prepare to go to South Vietnam, once a ceasefire is declared, to check on how the truce is being observed, depart ment officials said today.

title: Wholesale Index Reported 0.6% Higher in November
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Wholesale prices rose substan tially in November, with both food and industrial commodities contributing to the rise, the Labor Department reported to day.

title: Key CrimeSyndicate Men Among 25 Indicted Here
description: Federal and state grand juries have handed up 19 in dictments against 25 persons, including highranking figures in organized crime, in connec tion with their activities in the United States and Latin Amer ica, it was announced yester day by District. Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: Springfield Power Cut Off
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Dec. 7 (AP)About 10,000 homes here were without power for three hours yesterday because of what a Western Massachusetts Electric Company official said was a faulty underground cable.

title: Highly Leaded Tinsel Found in Stores Here
description: The city's Health Services Administrator, Gordon Chase, said yesterday that, despite statements to the contrary by the Federal Food and Drug Administration, highly leaded Christmas tinsel icicles were still being sold here. He said the tinsel had been found in 15 of 53 retail stores by sanitarians in his agency's bureau of lead poisoning control.

title: From Appetizer to Dessert, a Broad Range of Indian Fare
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their at mosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Music: Haydn Creation
description: The Biblical story of the Creation continues to tanta lize artists, as witness Arthur Miller's latest play and the products of contemporary choreographers. Usually they try to turn it to their own endsand fail. With a genius like Haydn who took the story on faith, the result is a musical setting that is a masterpiece.

title: Miners' Chief Votes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers, cast his ballot today in his reelection battle against Arnold R. Miller, a reform candidate.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The State Public Service Commission proposed rules yesterday that would forbid utilities to threaten to cut off service because a customer refuses to pay a disputed por tion of his bill.

title: Harrison Hagan Schmitt
description: There is a story that pic tures Dr. Harrison H. Schmitt on the moon as being totally unlike his nonscientist pred ecessors who ooohed and aaahed over every fantastic view and pretty rock.

title: White House Gets Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) The White House received today its official Christmas tree, a 20foot fir grown near Mount Sinai Helens in south west Washington state. Mrs. Edward Finch Cox was on hand for the ceremonies near the front portico, substituting for her mother, Mrs. Nixon, who was reported suffering from a slight cold.

title: Dunn/Dixon Group Performs 197273; HourLong Dance
description: There was a studied air about the quasiimprovisation 197273 that the Judith Dunn/ Bill Dixon Company performed Wednesday evening at the The ater of Riverside Church. There were moments of excitement, but mostly it was a comfort able performance with once fresh material.

title: U.N. CONDEMNS U.S. ON RHODESIAN TRADE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 7The General Assembly today condemned the importa tion by the United States of chrome and nickel from Rho desia in violation of the United Nations 1968 embargo on trade with Rhodesia.

title: U.S. WILL TIGHTEN RULES ON DUMPING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) The Treasury Department said today changes in anti dumping regulations intended to clarify and speed up the administration of dumping laws would become effective Jan. 8.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Graffitiwriting, the largest art movement ever to hit New York, has grown to the point where some of the artists have even formed as sociations aimed at persuad ing the public that graffiti scrawling is an art form worthy of museums.

title: YALE R. BURGE DIES; INTERIOR DECORATOR
description: Yale R. Burge, a leader in interior decorating and the first president of the National So ciety of Interior Decorators, died Wednesday night in the Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived at 219 East 61st Street.

title: C.W.Post Tops Southampton For Rotary Basketball Title
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Dec. 7 C. W. Post defeated South ampton College, 6150, tonight to win the Long Island Rotary College Basketball Classic.

title: The Peaceful War
description: Israel is closer to peace with Jordan than it has ever been with any of its other Arab neighbors. Trade flour ishes, the bridges across the Jordan River ceasefire line are jammed with travelers in both directions. Arab language newspapers and periodicals move back and forth; residents of both countries watch each other's television programs as a matter of course. Israelimade goods and Israeli citizens are not yet welcome in Jordan, but Israel's leaders are realistic enough to separate the symbolic from the meaningful. The two countries have demonstrated a tacit military cooperation against a com mon enemy, the Palestinian guerrillas, and King Hussein has repeatedly forsworn the option of war against Israel.

title: SEAMAN IS GUILTY IN CARRIER BLAZE
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 7 (AP) A military judge today found Seaman Apprentice Jeffrey Al lison guilty of arson, sabotage and hazarding a vessel in the $7.5million fire that swept the aircraft carrier Forrestal here July 10 and sentenced him to five years in prison.

title: KRUPP APPOINTS A NEW CHAIRMAN
description: BONN, Dec. 7Krupp, the major German industrial com pany based in Essen, an nounced today that State Sec retary ErnstWolf Mommsen will become chairman of the board.

title: Dent Nomination Stirs FreeTrade Fears
description: Textile industry leaders praised yesterday the nomina tion of Frederick B. Dent as Secretary of Commerce, but among other businessmen there was widespread unfamiliarity with him and some concern that he was not committed to free trade policies.

title: SUBURBS TO GAIN ON FUND SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Fastgrowing suburbs in the tri state area, such as Rockland County, will be the big bene ficiaries of the Administration's decision to use more upto date information in calculating how much money each state and local government will re ceive under the new revenue sharing program.

title: U.S. Seen Raping World
description: DALLAS, Dec. 7 (UPI)Mar garet Mead says the world can not withstand the emergence of another rich nation like the United States. We're simply raping the rest of the world of its natural resources, the an thropologist said here last night.

title: First Black Is Elected Head of Council of Churches
description: DALLAS, Dec. 7The Rev. W. Sterling Cary, administrator of the United Church of Christ's Greater New York District, was elected president of the Na tional Council of Churches to day, becoming the first black to hold the office. The 45 yearold minister succeeds Dr. Cynthia C. Wedel, who became the first woman president of the ecumenical organization three years ago.

title: TRUMAN RALLIES WITH ANTIBIOTICS
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 7 Former President Harry S. Truman rallied somewhat to day in his fight against a lung infection, but doctors kept him on the critical list because of a weakened heart.

title: Jazz Cruise Revives Glory of New Orleans
description: NATCHEZ, Miss., Dec. 7 The Good Time Jazz Cruise aboard the Delta Queen throbbed on up the Mississip pi last night, a nearperfect study in man's apparent hun ger for an occasional taste of yesterday.

title: CHAMBER ASSAILS PENSIONS BY CITY
description: Asserting that mushroom ing pensions were draining the city of money and services, the New York Chamber of Commerce recommended yes terday a series of measures designed to checkand even cut backretirement benefits for public employes.

title: ISRAEL AND SAIGON IN ACCORD ON TIES
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 7 (Reuters) Israel and South Vietnam formally announced today that they reestablished diplomatic relations.

title: Man Is Shot Dead After Wounding Wife of the Philippine President
description: MANILA, Dec. 7  A man in a dark suit drew a footlong dagger and stabbed the wife of President Ferdinand E. Mar cos today as she was presiding at a ceremony.

title: Flames Rout Canueks, 52
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 7 (AP)Ray Comeau's two quick goals in the first period started the At lanta Flames toward a 52 N.H.L. victory over the Van couver Canucks tonight.

title: Personalities: McAshan To Miss Liberty Bowl
description: Eddie McAshan of Georgia Tech, the star quarterback, Who was suspended last Fri day on the eve of the game against Georgia, will not play against Iowa State in the Lib erty Bowl at Memphis on Dec. 18, Coach Bill Fulcher said yesterday.

title: TRANSIT WORKERS DENY ALL CHARGES
description: Matthew Guinan, president of the Transport Workers Union, defended city transit workers yesterday against what he called smears and unfounded charges made by City Council man Robert I. Postel.

title: TV Figure Jailed Briefly
description: CHATTANOOGA, Dec. 7 (AP) Harry Thornton, a television personality who was jailed briefly on Tuesday for refusing to name a caller whose remarks he aired on station WDEFTV, vows to fight the ruling.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League have made preliminary inquiries about obtaining George Best from Manchester United, Cosmos Coach Gordon Bradley said yesterday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 7Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson has sched uled a news conference for Sat urday to name a successor to Police Director John L. Red den, who resigned as a result of the Kawaida Towers hous ing dispute.

title: Court Backs Suits by Tenants Of Racially Segregated Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Supreme Court decided today that people living in racially segregated housing projects can suffer economic and social in jury just as can those forced to live outside such projects.

title: Liberties Union Criticizes Court's Curb on Newsman
description: A decision by Federal Judge John R. Bartels ordering a re porter for The Daily News to restrict his coverage of a crim inal trial was criticized yester day by the New York Civil Liberties Union.

title: Monday Launching Planned
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI) Nimbus E, the sixth in a series of research weather satellites designed to make precise meas urements of atmospheric and surface phenomena, will be launched Monday from this coastal base, the National Aer onautics and Space Administra tion said today.

title: Store Sales Up in Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1,365,000,000, up 4 per cent from the yearearlier $1,317,000,000. Total retail store sales were an estimated $10,136,000,000, up 12 per cent from the yearearlier $9,082, 000,000.

title: The Salesperson
description: Next year at this time I will be one of four things: a Cliffic, a Yalie, a Smithie or a Flunkie. But right now I am just plain Cranky. It is a beau tiful day and I'd like to be out bike riding, but I have to stay in and start filling out my college applications that should have been filled out two months ago.

title: Buses From L.I. to City
description: Following is a list of bus services available to Nassau and Suffolk County commuters to subway stops in Queens:

title: Pension Rise Lures Many Senior Aides In State Department
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  As many as 100 senior State Department officials, including several ambassadors, are ex pected to retire by Jan. 31 to take advantage of a special pension increase linked to the cost of living.

title: Baltimore Home Bombed
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 7 (AP) The home of Dominic J. Carozza, a reputed Baltimore underworld figure, has been firebombed apparently, the police say, in retaliation for an earlier fire bombing incident. The fire last night caused no injuries and was extinguished quickly.

title: Boycott Leaders Say There Are None
description: Ask Alicia Rodriguez how she came to be a leader of the East Harlem school boycott, and she answers with surprise and even some indignation.

title: Skiers Over 70 to Go Free At New Hampshire Parks
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 7 (AP)  New Hampshire's elderly skiers will be given lower prices or allowed to ski free at the two stateoperated ski areas.

title: KENNETH PENDAR, EXVICE CONSUL
description: Kenneth W. Pendar, who was a special United States vice consul in North Africa in World War II, died Tuesday in the Italian Hospital at Tan gier, Morocco, it was learned, here yesterday. His age was 65.

title: SAIGON YIELDING ON PRISONER ISSUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 7South Vietnam's For eign Minister, Tran Van Lam, said today that the Saigon Government would not refuse to do whatever can be done to free the American prisoners of war and could even agree to release political prisoners in its jails to help bring about an ac ceptable ceasefire accord.

title: DR. ELI FRIEDMAN
description: NEWTON, Mass., Dec. 7 (AP) Dr. Eli Friedman, former chief of pediatrics at Boston City Hospital and Beth Israel Hospital, died Tuesday at his home. He was 82 years old.

title: 16 Heroin Indictments
description: Sixteen alleged smugglers of heroin, said to have made up one of the world's largest rings in the narcotics trade and to have brought a ton of heroin into the United States each year, were indicted here yesterday on conspiracy charges, Details, Page 90.

title: Two Giants Most Involved See No Quarterback Shift
description: Alex Webster has a Giant guessing game going this week. It goes something like this:

title: A Faulty Cable Cuts Power At Port Authority Terminal
description: The malfunction of an elec tric feeder cable caused a par tial loss of lighting and stopped escalator and elevator service att he Port Authority Bus Ter minal on Eighth Avenue last night.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MONTCLAIR, Dec. 7Stu dents and faculty members at Montclair State College devoted 12 hours today to a special Focus on Race Relations sem inar in an effort to identify and eliminate sources of racial ten sion on the campus.

title: Agency Consents to a Halt In Some Pesticides Uses
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)The Environmental Pro tection Agency refused once more today to ban immediately all remaining uses of the pestic ides aldrin and dieldrin, chem ical relatives of the already banned DDT.

title: British Conservatives Upset By Liberals in ByElection
description: LONDON, Dec. 7 (Reuters) Britain's minority Liberal party won a stunning victory today over the ruling Conservatives by winning the Sutton and Cheam parliamentary byelec tion with a majority of nearly 7,500 votes.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.9 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and in dustrial materials rose to 128.8 from 127.9 last week.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 7 (AP) New Jersey partially lifted its quarantine on the movement of hogs, which was designed to prevent the spread of hog cholera.

title: SCRIBNER AGREES TO ASK FUND RISE
Music: From the British
description: John Ogdon appeared at the New York Cultural Cen ter on Wednesday night in his wholly praiseworthy role of evangelist for contempo rary British music, but the bearded pianist's program at tracted about 20 persons. That disheartening turnout suggested, beyond the excuse of rainy weather, that British piano music is not yet known or beloved in New York.

title: Employment Project
description: While awaiting Senate confirmation as Secretary of Labor, Peter J. Brennan could make a useful contribution to labormanagement relations in New York City by Intervening in the stalemated negotiations for settlement of the fivemonthold strike of elevator constructors.

title: Soviet Queried on Rockets
description: LONDON, Dec. 7  Prime Minister Heath said today that the Soviet Union had been asked to help trace the origin of Russianmade rocket launch ers being used by the Irish Republican Army against Brit ish troops in Northern Ireland. They appeared a week ago in a series of coordinated assaults.

title: Public Presses for End to L.I.R.R. Strike
description: The deadlock in the Long Island Rail Road strike con tinued into a second week yes terday as public pressures mounted for a settlement.

title: B52's Bomb DMZ Area
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Dec. 8 (AP)  B52's have dropped more than 600 tons of bombs in and around the de militarized zone, the United States command reported yes terday.

title: 15 Weathermen Accused in a Bomb Plot
description: DETROIT, Dec. 7  A Fed eral grand jury here today ex panded charges against mem bers of the radical Weather men organization who have been accused of conspiring to bomb police and military in stallations in four cities in 1970.

title: HEROIN IS SHOWN AT RICORD TRIAL
description: The Government spread a pile of plastic bags containing $9 million worth of heroin before la jury yesterday as part of its case against Auguste Joseph Ricord.

title: Economic Gains Seen Continuing Into '73
description: The record economic pros perity generated this year will continue into 1973, Wal ter E. Hoadley, executive ter E. Hoadley, executive vice president and chief econo mist of the Bank of America, said yesterday. It is impor tant, however, that industry should not permit adverse criticism of the free enter prise system to affect deci sions for positive business planning, he added.

title: Strikes Close Girard College
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7 (AP) Girard College, which serves 400 fatherless boys, was closed today for the second day be cause of strikes by teaches and maintenance workers. The 54 faculty members have been out for three weeks, and when 154 janitorial, cafeteria and food service employes refused to cross the picket lines yesterday, the school was forced to shut down.

title: What Productivity?
description: The big thing in labormanagement relations these days is productivity bargaining. Everyone from Presi dent Nixon down is for it as a device for assuring high wages, stable prices and efficient industries. Its central goal is to foster heightened productivity by giving workers a share in the savings from abolition of wasteful work rules and introduction of new technology.

title: DEMOCRATS OPEN TALKS IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Democratic National Com mittee's 16member executive board opened two days of bar gaining here today over the party chairmanship and the reforming of last year's re forms.

title: Sales Gains Are Posted By Vornado and Murphy
description: Vornado, Inc., and the G. C. Murphy Company, two leading retail companies, reported yes terday higher sales in Novem ber than in the 1971 month.

title: SACS CHARGES DENIED BY VESCO
description: Robert L. Vesco, who has been charged by the Securities and Exchange Commission with looting four mutual funds, is sued a general denial yesterday. Mr. Vesco, in his first public statement since the S.E.C. charge, said that, contrary to the allegations, he had en gaged in no wrongdoing.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISUnited States economic dy namism is expanding everywhere and Soviet Russia is the new American fron tier, ready for massive development by U. S. enterprise and anxious to coop erate in this grand endeavor. This, at any rate, is the opinion of JeanJacques ServanSchreiber, 48yearold French editorwriterpolitician, publisher of the highly successful magazine L'Express, author of a bestselling book, The American Challenge, and president of the opposition Radical party.

title: JEWISH UNIT SETS $27  MILLION PLAN
description: The Joint Distribution Com mittee adopted a budget of $27,878,000 yesterday to carry out its humanitarian programs for 390,000 needy Jews in 25 countries.

title: LONDON
description: LONDON, Dec. 7The nations, large and small, are now concentrating on the problems nearest their hearts, their boundaries and their particular regions of the world. This trend is clear, not only in the new and struggling coun tries, but in the United States, the Soviet Union and China, and it is par ticularly marked here in Britain.

title: Appeals Court Bars Ruling On Conviction of Mulligan
description: The Appellate Division de clined yesterday to rule on an appeal of the criminal con tempt conviction of Hugh Mul ligan, a reputed gambler and loan shark, but ordered a new hearing on whether warrants for eavesdropping devices that figured in the case were prop erly issued.

title: APOLLO SPEEDING ON MOON COURSE
description: HOUSTON, Friday, Dec. 8 Apollo 17, despite its tardy launching early yesterday, is expected to make up all of the lost time and reach an orbit of the moon on schedule at 2:48 P.M., Eastern standard time, next Sunday.

title: Yankee Inc., Buys Magazine
description: DUBLIN, N. H., Dec. 8 (AP) New Englander magazine, owned and published by the Walsh Publishing Corporation of Portsmouth, has been sold to Yankee, Inc., of Dublin, pub lisher of the Old Farmer's Al manac.

title: Dance: Debut for 8 Mice
description: Informed sources let it be ?? before the 578th New fork City, performance of George Balanchine's produc tion of The Nutcracker on Thursday night at the State Theater that eight white mice would be added to the battle scene between the seven headed mouse king and the nutcracker. This turned out to be true.

title: 61 Are Arrested in Florida As Agents Stage Drug Raid
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 8 (UPI)  Federal and state agents, attempting to stem the flow of drugs into this col lege town, surprised dozens of sleeping youths in a predawn raid today, making at least 61 arrests.

title: 7 Hijackers Killed on Ethiopian Airliner
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Seven hi jackers, two of the women, were killed by Ethiopian secur ity guards in a midair gun battle aboard a crowded Ethio pian airliner today.

title: Jamaica Savings Elects
description: Howard J. Dirkes Jr., presi dent of LoTemp Sales Corpo ration, has been named a trus tee of the Jamaica Savings Bank.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Dec. 8 (AP)The Southern Con ference gave its endorsement today to the National Colle giate Athletic Association's withdrawal from the United States Olympic Committee, but decided to retain its own membership in the U.S.O.C.

title: Shutdown of Life, Despite Final Costs of $7Million, Improves Health of Time Inc.
description: The demise of Life magazine, which will ?? Time Inc. about $7million in reverence pay, un expired printing contracts and other closing costs, nonetheless improves the financial health of the company, Andrew Heiskell, the Time Inc. chairman, said yesterday.

title: Connecticut Welfare Chief Quits; Says Red Tape Frustrated Him
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 8  Henry C. White, Connecticut's Welfare Commissioner, resigned today, asserting that he had been continually frustrated by bu reaucratic red tape.

title: U.S. Banknote to Write Off Uncollectable Debts
Gros Triumphs in His First Ski Cup Event
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 8 Piero Gros, a young Italian skier, whose main problem has been broken arms rather than broken legs, won today the first World Cup race he en tered.

title: U.N. Asks Partial Ban on Aid to Israel
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8The General Assembly in a resolution today asked governments to avoid giving assistance that could help Israel consolidate her control of Arab territories occupied since the 1967 war.

title: Triple Bend Is Retired
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 8 (AP)  Frank McMahon's Triple Bend, winner of 10 races in 28 starts, with earnings of $365, 516, has been retired from rac ing and will stand at stud next season at Leslie Combs 2d's Spendthrift Farm here.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, elec trical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: Teachers to Be Unpaid
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8 (AP)More than 1,200 school department employes must go unpaid the last two weeks of the year, Mayor Kevin H. White told the Boston School Committee. He also ordered an immediate halt to the hiring of substitute teachers. The Mayor charged the school committee with maintaining a $1.4million defi cit and accused it of being fis cally irresponsible.

title: J. Douglas Colman Dies at 62; Headed New York Blue Cross
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Dec. 8 J. Douglas Colman, president of the Associated Hospital Service, Greater New York's Blue Cross, died today at his home, 59 Drake Road, after a brief illness. He was 62 years old.

title: DRUG ARREST STEMS FROM MURDER CASE
description: The arrest of a 30yearold man who allegedly was carry ing more than 35 pounds of heroin in Queens was announced yesterday by District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx.

title: BOTH SIDES FIRM IN L.I.R.R. STRIKE
description: Negotiations in the Long Is land Rail Road walkout re mained stalled for the ninth day yesterday as strikers pre pared to begin filing applica tions today for unemployment benefits.

title: Prof. Klaus Pringsheim Of Tokyo Music Academy
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8 (UPI)Prof. Klaus Pringsheim of the Musa shino Academy of Music in Tokyo, died of a heart attack at his residence here yesterday. He was 89 years old.

title: EAST HARLEM ENDS SCHOOL BOYCOTT
description: East Harlem parents an nounced yesterday that they would end their twoweek boy cott of 14 schools and send their children back to classes on Monday.

title: Siege Reported Lifted
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 8 (AP)Government reinforce ments reportedly smashed to day through a ring of enemy troops around the garrison of Trapeang Kraleng, 37 miles southwest of Pnompenh, lifting a dayold siege that had trapped two battalions.

title: A HALFWAY HOUSE FIGHTS LONELINESS
description: Living in a welfare hotel gets to you, the young man declared earnestly. The place is unbelievable. You can't even call it an existence. But the worst thing is just being alone, just being ignored completely.

title: Cowboys Hope to Beat Redskins and Clinch 2d in Division
description: DALLAS, Dec. 8 (AP)The game tomorrow between the Redskins and the Cowboys won't be for the National Foot ball Conference's East Division championship as everyone once figured it would be. But Dallas still needs to clinch a spot in the playoffs, and no one's tell ing Coach George Allen of Washington he doesn't have to win.

title: MRS. M. E. ORNSTEIN
description: Mrs. Henrietta K. Ornstein, a teacher and the wife of Dr. M. E. Ornstein, the medical di rector of the Millinery Workers Union, A.F.L.C.I.O., died Thursday evening. She was 79 years old and lived at 303 West 66th Street.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  A new instrument reveals whether a person is alive or dead by disclosing the pres ence or absence of electrical activity in the brain. E. Roy John, director Or the brain re search laboratory in the depart ment of psychi atry at New York Medical College, and Robert Laupheimer, an electrical engineer, will receive Patent 3,076,308 on Dec. 19. Accord ing to Dr. John, the presence of life is conventionally determined by heartbeat or breathing, but sometimes when both are absent the person may still be alive. Or lifesupport equipment may continue heartbeat and breathing although the per son is not capable of survival. Various medical groups have recommended that the defini tion of death be modified to include the absence of de tectable electrical brain ac tivity.

title: IRISH VOTE TO END FAVORED STATUS FOR THE CHURCH
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 8Irish voters have decided overwhelmingly to abolish the special posi tion of the Roman Catholic Church in the Constitution.

title: ISLANDERS TO HOST RANGERS TONIGHT
description: only five of the Islanders due to take to the ice tonight did any playing in the N.H.L. last season.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NATO SESSION ENDS ON A HOPEFUL NOTE
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 8North Atlantic Treaty Organization members ended their meeting here today, expressing confi dence that they had made some progress in facing the challenge to their unity posed ?? the EastWest negotiations that will take place during the coming year.

title: ARGENTINA REJECTS PERON'S CANDIDACY
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 8 (UPI) The ruling military Govern ment formally denied today a petition by Argentina's major political parties to revoke a residency requirement that pre vents former President Juan D. Pern from being a presiden tial candidate in elections sched uled for next March.

title: Syracuse Gains in MixUp
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 8The city of Syracuse, which yesterday thought it was going to lose $1.9million in Federal revenue sharing funds it had expected, found out today that it will probably get the money after all.

title: MOSCOW PURGING GEORGIA REPUBLIC
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8One of the most sweeping Soviet purges of recent years appears to be under way in the Geor gian Republic in an attempt to bring the normally nonconform ist residents of that Caucasian state into line with proclaimed Soviet policies.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: NEW JERSEY

title: Southern Pacific Disputes I.R.S. Claims in Tax Court
description: The Southern Pacific Com pany, a railroad holding com pany, announced that since September it had filed two petitions in the United States Tax Court in Washington chal lenging Internal Revenue Serv ice deficiency claims totaling $86.6million in back taxes.

title: Exemplary Peacemakers
description: The army chiefs of India and Pakistan have eliminated a small but critical obstacle to peace on the subcontinent with their agreement on the last disputed segment of a Kashmir ceasefire line.

title: Music
description: Listening to Verdi's I Lombardi in Carnegie Hall on Thursday night seemed an unusual experience, on re flecting that this was the first Verdi opera to be performed in New York and perhaps the United States.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 27 editorial Scribner Should Stay indicates why The Times desires a renewal of the Chancellor's contract. It is obvious that The Times bases its decision to retain Dr. Scrib ner on generalities and not specifics.

title: DR. STANLEY E. DORST
description: CINCINNATI, Dec., 8  Dr. Stanley E. Dorst, dean of the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine from 1940 until his retirement in 1962, died at Holmes Hospital Wednesday. He was 73 years old.

title: Johnson Feared War At Kennedy Death, Earl Warren Says
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) President Johnson was con cerned in 1963 that the assas sination of John F. Kennedy might lead to a nuclear war, according to former Chief Jus tice Earl Warren.

title: N.E.A. Aide Scores Nixon
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 8 (UPI) Dr. Helen Wise, the president elect of the National Education Association, said last night that the Nixon Administration had demonstrated it had no real commitment to public education in the United States.

title: Railroad's Closing Banned
description: NEWARK, Dec. 8 (AP)A United States District Court request by creditors of the bankrupt Central Railroad of New Jersey to shut the line down, was denied yesterday by Judge Anthony T. Augelli. The judge said that there were in dications the railroad's finan cial situation might show improvement and that it was not as dismal as the creditors feared. The line is losing $600, 000 a month.

title: Bucks Trim Warriors
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 8 (AP) Kareem AbdulJabbar scored 19 tonight, and his 17 rebounds fueled an awesome fast break that gave the Milwaukee Bucks a 124.91 victory over the Golden State Warriors.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 8 (Reuters)The Bank of England today raised its minimum lending rate by onequarter of a percentage point to 8 per cent.

title: TRUMAN'S HEART SHOWS SLIGHT GAIN
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8 Doctors reported today that Harry S. Truman had shown slight improvement in his struggle with lung congestion and heart irregularity, but em phasized that he remained critically ill.

title: Jersey RevenueSharing Funds Being Tagged for Varied Uses
description: TRENTON, Dec. 8  Civic projects ranging from more po licemen, aid for the elderly, drainage facilities and new fire engines are among those that New Jersey communities intend to finance with their Federal revenuesharing proceeds.

title: Sprint Destroys Nose Cone
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) A Sprint missile, one of two rockets in the Safeguard anti ballistic missile system, de stroyed a nose cone in a simu lated test over the midPacific today, the Pentagon announced.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: DEARBORN, Mich., Dec. 8 (AP)The Ford Motor Com pany will increase 1973model prices by an average of $62.55 on Monday, officials said to day.

title: MESKILL SETS PLAN TO CUT ROAD NOISE
description: HARTFORD. Dec. 8 (UPI) Gov. Thomas J. Meskill today announced a set of proposed regulations to reduce the noise of highway traffic by as much as half in the next three years.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 8 (AP)The Big Eight Conference severed relations with the United States Olympic Com mittee today and reduced the probationary period of Kansas State University. Big Eight Commissioner Charles M. Neinas announced the action of the faculty representa tives, the conference's governing body, at a late afternoon news conference.

title: Mundine Knocks Out Harris
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 8 (AP)  Tony Mundine of Au stralia, 160 pounds, the British Commonwealth middleweight champion, knocked out Lonnie Harris, 156, of Bakersfield, Calif., in the fifth round of a 10round bout tonight.

title: 4 PRESSING KARPOV IN CHESS TOURNEY
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 8 (AP)Four grandmasters were within striking distance today of the frontrunner, Anatoly Karpov, in the nexttolast round of Church's international chess tournament.

title: A.B.A. Board to Meet
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 8 (AP)The American Basket ball Association board of trus tees will meet here Monday and Tuesday to discuss expan sion, the merger bill with the National Basketball Associa tion, national television, labor negotiations, management pen sion plan and playoff proce dures.

title: Parsons School to Redesign Klein's 14th Street Image
description: S. Klein Department Stores, one of New York's oldest re tail chains, has given a grant to the Parsons School of De sign to develop a new front and environmental concept for Klein's 14th Street store in Manhattan.

title: Miss. State Still Unbeaten
description: STARKVILLE, Miss., Dec. 8 (AP)Mississippi State defeat ed Sewanee, 8365, tonight and remained unbeaten after four games. Rich Knurr, a freshman, sparked the Bulldogs with 22 points.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The recent decision by the Federal Communications Commission to au thorize a $395million increase in in terstate phone charges by American Telephone and Telegraph Company over a twoyear period (news story Nov. 23) again demonstrates the in adequacy of the F.C.C. as an effective regulatory agency. Once more, the F.C.C. has abdicated its responsibility to the telephoneusing public.

title: What Allende Left Out
description: President Salvador Allende did a clever job at the United Nations General Assembly this week of depicting Chile as an innocent victim of serious aggression, a target for a cunning new imperialism, practiced by giant American corporations with the connivance and support of the United States Government. He drew enthusiastic if automatic applause from a body domi nated by representatives of small, struggling nations, many of which face problems of development and con trol of resources similar to those of Chile.

title: Charles B. Walling Dead; With Daily News 42 Years
description: Charles B. Walling, a report er and writer for The New York Daily News for more than 42 years, died Thursday evening in the Elmhurst City Hospital in Queens. He was 75 years old and lived at 3561 92d Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: 3 College Games Listed
description: New York City fives are in volved in each event of the threeforone collegiate triple header. Manhattan, an easy winner of its first two games, challenges Temple in the open er; Long Island University faces Oregon State at 2 P.M., and Fordham plays the Univer sity of Florida at 4.

title: $5Million Loan to Walston
description: Walston & Co., Inc., has ar ranged a $5million senior sub ordinated longterm loan from the National Security Bank. Daniel J. Cullen, chairman of the board, said the loan had been approved by the board of the New York Stock Exchange and that it initiated a program of additional longterm capital for further growth and expan sion.

title: City's Private Schools Face Uncertain Futures
description: Seats are not going un filled, but New York City's private schools are growing ever more anxious about the future as applications dwin dle and the exodus of middle class families to the suburbs continues.

title: SILVER FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Extending Thursday's late advance, silver futures prices tacked on almost 1 cents an ounce in early trading on The Commodity Eschange here.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TOMS RIVER, Dec. 8 (UPI) A suspended state trooper was given a sixmonth suspend ed jail term today for a mis conduct  in  office conviction stemming from the alleged branding of a longhaired youth last February.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Court Bars Ouster Of Union Reformer

title: Ellsberg Judge Planning To Dismiss Jury Monday
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8The judge in the Pentagon papers case said today that he planned to declare a mistrial on Monday because a higher court had said it was foolish to proceed with the current jury in the case.

title: EXUNION LEADER FOUND SHOT IN CAR
