Those little holes in the volcanic pillars, those staring eyes, which, on closer inspection, turn out to be pigeon cotes, are more than nest ing places and more than a setting for midnight murder by Turks in search of pigeon meat. They are also collec tion centers for pigeon dung.

title: Harvard Six Routs Penn as Corkery Nets 3 Goals, 9 to 1
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 9 Bill Corkery scored the three goals and Randy Roth scored twice to lead Harvard's un beaten team to a 91 Ivy League victory over Pennsylvania to night.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, elec trical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: Miss Gimpel, Teacher of Deaf, Wed
description: WELLESLEY HILLS, Mass., Dec. 9  Miss Betsy Alice Gimpel and Danilo Jos Mena of New York were married here this after noon, The Rev. Dr. Frank O. Holmes performed the ceremony in the Wellesley Hills Unitarian Church.

title: Clara Ward, Singer. III
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9 (AP) Clara Ward, the lead Gospel singer and pianist for the Clara Ward Singers, was reported to be in serious condition at the U.C.L.A. Medical Center today. Hospital officials would give no details about the nature of her illness, A family friend said that the 48yearold Miss Ward was accompanied to the hospi tal by her mother, Gertrude, 71, who founded the group in the nineteenthirties.

title: Cost of Sunday Dinner Down Here in October
description: The average cost of pre paring a chicken or roast beef Sunday dinner in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area dropped, several cents between September and October, a Federal statisti cian reported yesterday.

title: Jane Fonda Says She Will Wed Tom Hayden
description: ROROS, Norway, Dec. 9 (UPI)Actress Jane Fonda, a harsh critic of the war in Vietnam, said today that she would marry Torn Hayden, one of the members of the radical Chicago Seven anti war group.

title: Miss Quarles, Edward Douglas Plan Marriage
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 9  Miss Marjory Elizabeth Quarles, a teacher at the North Hunterdon High School, and Edward Curtis Douglas, a research scientist at the R.C.A. David Sarnoff Research Center here, will be married late in June. Their engagement has been an nounced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Richard Wingfield Quarles.

title: Boone Is Back, Meaner Than Ever
description: HE rode away into the sunset after six golden seasons as Paladin, the flamboy antly dapper, Keatsquoting, gunsling ing nemesis of evildoers on the im mensely popular series, Have Gun, Will Travel. Now, nine years later, Richard Boone is back, this time as Hec Ramsey, out West again, but transformed into a crumpled, rumpled gunmanturnedlawman with a penchant for new fangled criminology and a vinegary contempt for fancy ways.

title: La. Tech Conquers Tenn. Tech, 350, In Rice Bowl Game
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 9 (AP)Denny Duron passed for 227 yards and Glen Berteau scored two touchdowns today as Louisiana Tech smothered Tennessee Tech, 350, in the Grantland Rice Bowl football game.

title: Littering Hurts Drivers
description: PIKESVILLE, Md., Dec. 9 (UPI)The state police said this week that 241 Maryland drivers had received a point against their driving records in the first three months of a new law that holds the car owner responsible for anything thrown out of his vehicleeven if it was tossed by a small child.

title: Miss Kolburne Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Russell Kol burne of Brooklyn have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marjorie Elise Kolburne, to Stephen Gary Feinman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Feinman of Manhasset, L. I. Miss Kol burne and her timed, attended Hofstra University. Her fa ther is president of Russel Kolburne, Inc., New York advertising agency.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISAndr Malraux, the famous French novelist, wartime Resistance hero and Gaullist leader, is convinced the conception of Europe as an effec tively united group of nations doesn't yet exist and therefore these culti vated old countries are losing the competition with the superpowers, Russia and the United States.

title: Civil Defense Takes Over Role in Natural Disasters
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The old Office of Civil Defense has a new name, new tasks and a new sense of mission.

title: 22 IN HOUSE GIVEN 100% MARK BY A.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) Americans for Democratic Action listed today 22 House members, all but one of them Democrats with perfect lib eral voting records in this year's session. But not a single Senator scored 100 per cent.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PARAMUS  What will probably be the last of the vast trafficoriented shopping malls to be situated in this rather large Bergen County borough is the $25million Abraham & StrausSears Roe buck complex now under construction at the conflu ence of Route 17 and the Garden State Parkway.

title: Princeton Tops Davidson
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 9 Princeton built a 22point lead then fought off a late Davidson rush tonight to defeat the Wild cats, 8278, before a crowd of 3,500 in Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: Mel Gussow's review of Eric Bentley's Are You Now or Have You Ever Been puzzled me in its failure to confront the basic issues posed by the play. Based wholly on the record, the play does concern itself with important issues: it sees and reads us as much as we it.

title: Letters:
description: Albany's retail downtown is indeed in a desperate state since the closing of the two larger department stores, but the announcement of the Univer sity Administrative Facilities' settling in the Delaware and Hudson building, which was not mentioned by Miss Pem brook and is one of Albany's most at tractive facades, plus the return of many thousands of workers to the new State South Mall cannot help but bring about a recovery.

title: Menetrey Keeps Ring Title
description: GRENOBLE, France, Dec. 9 (UPI)  Roger Menetrey of France retained his European welterweight title today when his challenger, Sandro Lopopolo of Italy, was forced by his managers to withdraw after the 13th round because of a cut eyebrow.

title: Shop Run by Elderly Aids Hospital
description: LAKEWOODAbout two years ago, a group of senior citizens here decided to start a campaign to raise funds for a local hospital. The drive took the shape of a shop.

title: State a Candidate for Oil Port
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Army Corps of Engineers, after a yearlong survey of the northeastern United States, has narrowed the search for a deepwater port site at which huge oil tank ers could unload their cargoes for New Jersey and Delaware.

title: Brooklyn Lobstermen Take Living From Sea
description: There are Maine lobster men, Long Island lobstermen and Brooklyn lobstermen. Most of the few remaining lobstermen in Brooklyn work out of the placid waters of Gerritsen Creek, a few hun dred yards from the Belt Parkway in Sheepshead Bay. There, five of the seven lob ster boats in Brooklyn are moored, while the lobster men fix their pots and hope for good catches.

title: Western interpretations of Eastern arts
description: The arts of the Orient porcelains and ceramics, enamel and lacquer, carved woods and silkshave long been a source for the decorative arts of the West. When Europeans first enthused over Chinese porcelain (the ancestor of today's fine china) in the 17th century, they freely adopted its forms and patterns (it took them a century to achieve literal copies). De signs inspired by the Orient again cap tured the imagination of the West in the early 19thcentury after the Prince of Wales built the Brighton Pavilion, that fantasy palace and princely sum mer residence. Today's thaw in com munications between East and West has again spawned an interest in Oriental designs, interpreted in a rash of patterns for wallcoverings and fab rics. As in earlier revivals, the quali ties that make these new designs so fresh and vital are the Eastern themes, the mythical dragon and phoenix, stylized blossoms, waves and clouds coupled with the Western flair for composition and color. Some of these new Oriental designs are juxtaposed here with antique art objects to point up the characteristics they shareand the ways they dare to differ.

title: DOCTOR'S AWARD TO GO TO RESEARCH
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 9  A physician who was awarded $16million by a jury in a dam age suit last week plans to use the money, if and when he gets it, to resume fulltime cancer research and to set up an insti tute for researchers with un usual ideas.

title: Letters
description: Dr. Michael Baden's [Deputy Chief Medical Exami ner, City of New York] ar gument that it is not the neophyte, but rather the ex perienced addict that dies is reasonably explained by the caution neophytes take in avoiding toxic doses, versus the carelessness of experi enced addicts who might take a dose now toxic to them be cause of tapered tolerance, but which they were well able to handle only a short time be fore.

title: About Pro Football
description: The issues surrounding the selection of the National League's eight playoff candi dates will be further resolved today with vital games in Minnesota, San Francisco, St. Louis, Houston and Buffalo. The most vital will be in Bloomington, Minn., where the Vikings confront the Green Bay Pack ers, and in San Francisco where the 49ers are host to the Atlanta Fal cons. The Pack ers lead the Vikings by one game in the National Confer ence's Central Division and the Falcons are half a game up on the 49ers in the N.F.C.'s Western Division. Both home teams are favor ites.

title: Canadian Skater Ahead
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9 (Reuters) Cathy Lee Irwin of Canada led after the compulsory pro gram in the annual Moscow Skates figureskating tourna ment today. She had 83.4 points after the three compulsory fig ures.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: A graceful memoir of his first two decades by the Poet Laureate of Nebraska. Neihardt, born in 1881, is a historian, journalist and scholar of the American Indian; this book is a vivid evocation of the natu ral setting and the folklore that shaped his career.

title: Union County: European Blend
description: Union County has such a rich mixture of European na tionalities that all of its mu nicipalities except one can re port that at least 25 per cent of their total population is of foreign stock.

title: Body of Retarded Youth To Be Exhumed in Inquiry
description: ATHENS, Pa., Dec. 9The body of a 15yearold retarded child who died almost 10 years ago will be exhumed at Tioga Point Cemetery, near here, Monday.

title: Mrs. Belles Has Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Arnold R. Belles of St. George, S. I., on Nov. 27 at the Staten Island Hos pital in Tompkinsville. Mrs. Belles is the former Miss Susan D. Aronstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry H. Aronstein of West Brighton, S. I. The child, the couple's second, is named Nancy Beth. Her father is a certified pub lie accountant with M. J. Stillman & Co.

title: Miss Curtis Fiancee of Michael Wayne
description: CHELSEA, N. Y., Dec. 9 Miss Winifred Parker Curtis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Huntington Woodman Curtis of Chelsea and South Free port, Me., plans to be married in May to Michael Richard Wayne, son of Mrs. Stanley R. Wayne of Mount Kisco and Manchester, Vt., and the late Mr. Wayne.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: It's been a year since I bought a dress, said a secre tary who works in midtown. Recently I saw a dress that I liked, but I didn't want to spend $70. So I settled for a blouse and a skirt, both of which cost under $30 and which I can wear in combi nation with other things.

title: Antiques Auction Brings Record $2.2Million Here
description: Harms Weinberg of the Antique Porcelain Company helped yesterday to break several records, but not the expected one, at the sale of Mr. and Mrs. Deane Johnson's collection of period French furnishings and decorations at Sotheby Parke Bernet.

title: JUDGE SAYS E.P.A. MUST TELL IMPACT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The issue of whether the Environ mental Protection Agency, like every other Federal agency, should prepare statements on the potential environmental impact of its proposed actions was further ensnarled this week by a Federal District Court rul ing in Denver.

title: Indictments Issued in an Inquiry On Suffolk Oceanfront Purchase
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 9 A special grand jury investigat ing Suffolk County's purchase of 295 acres of ocean frontage and wetlands at Tiana Beach for $7million handed up sev eral indictments last night to County Judge Pierre G. Lund berg.

title: 2 Asian Refugees Here Recall the Tension and Harassment of Their Last Days in Uganda
description: Ramesh Tara pushed back his chair, smiled at his wife and his host and said: I am very, very relaxed. It is the first time I have been able to relax since it began.

title: 3 Killed as Blast Damages Office Building in Missouri
description: CLINTON, Mo., Dec. 9 (UPI) An explosion ripped through a twostory office building in the downtown area of this west central Missouri city tonight, killing at least three persons.

title: If You Go
description: to Greenland, make sure you have advance reservations, or you might wind up sleeping on the floor, as some tourists have in summers past. New hotels are starting to rise on the island, but not nearly fast enough to ac commodate the rising tide of tourism.

title: HOW CHINESE FACE SHORTAGE OF FUEL
description: PEKING, Dec. 9Three com munes in different parts of China have come up with to tally different answers to the nation's fuel shortage.

title: Miss Stewart Bride in Maine
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 9 Miss Pauline Elizabeth Stew art was married here this afternoon to Geoffrey Reed Stern. The Rev. Carl Russell performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church.

title: PENTECOSTALISM SURGES IN BRAZIL
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Dec. 9 (AP)  A Pentecostal revival is taking hold in Brazil, the country with the largest num ber of Roman Catholics.

title: SHOP TALK
description: BUTLER  Housewives Row is not the name on the sign, but that's the way a lot of people think of a small, delightful shopping center here on Route 23.

title: Senate Panel Studies Area Transit System
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) A rail and water transpor tation system to link Wash ington, Annapolis and the Yorktown  Williamsburgh Norfolk areas of Virginia is under consideration by a Senate subcommittee.

title: Barbara Lane Plans an April Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. George W. Lane Jr. of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Irene Lane, to Thomas Jo seph Dangieri, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Dangieri of Poughkeepsie. An April wed ding is planned.

title: Loosely, loosely
description: The craze is on for the caftan, or djellaba, burnoose or whatever you care to call it. This loose, floorlength coverup was originally protection from the sun, wind and sand of the desert. Now it is well on the way as fashion's next big darling. Easy to wear and slip into (up with your arms and you're in), comfortable and glamorous, it's a natural for women who don't want to be confined.

title: Life could have been, should have been, better
description: As much as anyone who has ever written about the Civil War, Bruce Catton made it real. Catton not only told us how and why it happened, he made us feel it. He brought to his writing an extraordinary combination of scholarship, lit erary skill and intimate con cern. To read him was to sense passions in the service of the intellect and, as the anguish of battle declined and political complexities overwhelmed the human drama, one occasionally wondered about the person do ing the writing. What was go ing on inside Bruce Catton? Not the exnewspaperman, not the press agent for F.D.R.'s War Production Board and Depart ment of Commerce, but the in ner Catton, the emotional cen ter focused on reconstructing a national disaster. What led a nonacademic to become one of the neargreat Civil War his torians? What commanded him to write what he wrote, and how he wrote?

title: Art Notes
description: IT'S not quite the super colossal, citywide show envisioned last spring when women artists dem onstrated at MOMA, demand ing a simultaneous exhibition at our six major art museums. But Women Choose Wo men, opening January 11 at just one museum, the New York Cultural Center on Columbus Circle, will do for starters.

title: State's Professional Aides Vote to Retain Association
description: A count of mailed ballots re vealed yesterday that the Civil Service Employes Association won the right to continue to represent 34,000 professional, scientific and technical em ployes in state institutions.

title: Buying Better
description: Out of the consumer move ment have come two basic kinds of books: those that tell us what is wrong with our food, automobiles, utilities and regulatory agencies, and those that tell us what we can do about it.

title: Rhodena Dalsemer Wed to Classmate
description: Miss Rhodena Ann Dal semer and George Lauder Greenway 2d, seniors at the University of California at Los Angeles, were married yesterday afternoon. The Rev. M. H. Rohn performed the Episcopal ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Dalsemer of Lyford Cay, Nassau, the Bahamas. Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert C. Greenway of Washington are the parents of the bride groom.

title: St. Mary's Rallies to Beat Army's Quintet, 63 to 56
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 9 Earl Brown, held scoreless the first half, tossed in 11 points in the last nine minutes to pace St. Mary's of California to an uphill 6356 victory over Army in basketball tonight. The loss was the third this season for the victoryless Cadets.

title: Drake Bows in Pioneer Bowl
description: WICHITA FALLS, Tex., Dec. 9 (AP)Larry Dorsey returned a punt 82 yards for a touch down today to start Tennessee State on its way to a 297 Pioneer Bowl victory over Drake University before more than 10,000 fans in Memorial Stadium.

title: F. W. Arnold 4th Weds Joan Potter
description: MANHASSET, L.I., Dec. 9Miss Joan Louise Potter was married here this even ing to Frederick William Arnold 4th. The Rev. Ray mond A. Fenner performed the ceremony in the Con gregational Church.

title: Brustein in London
description: THE GREAT AMERICAN DISASTER is the name of a small restaurant in the Chelsea district of London whose menu consists entirely of milk shakes and quarterpound hamburgers. Patron ized by overseas visitors and expatriates, it offers a decent approximation of American food to the indecent accom paniment of overamplified music. But more startling than its sound effects or bill of fare is its decor.

title: Canarsie School District Proposes a Plan for Integration
description: The community school board of District 18, which covers the East Flatbush and Canarsie sections of Brook lyn, made public its proposed school rezoning plan last week and, to no one's sur prise, immediately touched off a new controversy.

title: PROGRESS IS HELD SLOW WITH LOCAL 1
description: Efforts to settle the last of a series of strikes that have seriously delayed $2billion in building construction here were proceeding very slowly last week, according to a Federal mediator involved in the nego tiations.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: Walter Kerr's pronounce ment that Mourning Be comes Electra Doesn't Work does violence to both O'Neill's masterpiece and to the current Joseph E. Levine Circle in the Square revival. It is strange that Mr. Kerr, who so admirably made the transition from drama profes sor to drama critic, has chosen to approach O'Neill's play as an academic, stress ing its verbal limitations rather than its theatrical power, and singling out in dividual lines and scenes which now occasion a titter instead of the oldfashioned Freudian frisson.

title: Aria Ready for a Broadway Carmen?
description: WE'VE had the plays into musi cals (Hello, Dol ly!, Mame, My Fair Lady). We've had the movies into musicals (Car nival; Sugar and that great classic, Donny brook). We've had the short story into musical (Caba ret, Fiddler on the Roof, Apple Tree). So what is left to tap for that all draining mother, the musical stage? You, over there read ing The National Lampoon, you say TV shows. You sug gest a nice S & M musical entitled Beat the Clock! John Simon would love it, but that's about all (and no one reads New York maga zine east of Third Avenue).

title: New Lives for Four Matrons
description: ENGLEWOOD  Mrs. Wil liam K. Mettler, a woman in her 40's, the mother of four children and the wife of a sales executive, leaves her 13room house at 7:10 five mornings a week for classes at Bergen Community Col lege, 10 miles away. Next June, fulfilling a longstand ing ambition, she will be graduated as a nurse.

title: Music; Interpretation: What Is It?
description: IN the current issue of Opera News, James Levine, one of our more talented and voluble young conductors, has something to say about interpretation in general and the inter pretation of Verdi's Otello in particular. Otello because Levine is going to conduct it for the first time Tuesday night at the Metro politan Opera.

title: TV Networks Schedule Apollo Moon Coverage
description: The three major television networks plan live coverage of the Apollo 17 moon land ing tomorrow with variations in their time schedules.

title: Two Olympians Voted Kirby Sportsmanship Awards
description: Reggie Jones and Ken Shelley will receive the Gus tavus Town Kirby Olympic Sportsmanship Award at a luncheon Thursday at the Plaza Hotel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Dr. Henry M. Wriston argues in his Dec. 3 letter that the scholar, far from having a right to protect his sources, has a duty to reveal them. That may be true of historians, phi lologists or theologians, but it cannot be true of social scientists, such as economists or political scientists deal ing with contemporary problems.

title: Pistons' Rally Topples Bucks, 107 103
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 9 (AP) The Detroit Pistons squandered an 18point firsthalf lead, then stormed back for a 107103 Na tional Basketball Association victory over the Milwaukee Bucks today.

title: Miss Schwartz Fiancee
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 9 Mr. and Mrs. William G. Schwartz have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Donna Lynn Schwartz, to Paul Rapisardi, son of Ralph Rapisardi of West End, N. J., and the late Mrs. Rapisardi.

title: LINCOLN G. SMITH, PHYSICIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Smith was distinguished for his work in the field of spectroscopy and was respon sible for devising methods of obtaining accurate measure ments of atomic masses. He de signed and constructed a highly sophisticated mass spectrom eter that produced measure ments of significantly greater precision than previously at tainable.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Oswald Train, Box 1891, Phil adelphia, Pa. 19105, is an en thusiast. He collects longforgot ten, long out of print editions of trailbreaking mysteries, and wants others to enjoy them. Thus, he reissues them under his own imprint, at $4.50 a vol ume. The two latest in his series are short story collections: Ar nold Bennett's THE LOOT OF THE CITIES and Clifford Ash down's THE ADVENTURES OF ROMNEY PRINGLE.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The Miami Dolphins are unbeaten, but one of them, Jim Kiick, is uncomfortable. Until this season he and Larry Csonka were the Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid of the National Football League, but Eugene (Mercury) Morris has joined them, intruding on Kiick's role as if he were Deadwood Dick, the most prominent of the black cowboys. Before the Dolphins sought their 13th victory today against the New York Giants at Yankee Sta dium, the 5foot 10  inch Morris, with biceps like huge baked potatoes, had darted for 807 yards. If he joins Csonka in the 1,000yard category, the Dolphins will be the first team to have two 1,000yard runners in the same season. Not that Kiick has been discarded. He has run for 447 yards, Over the season, according to Coach Don Shula's charts, Kiick has lined up for more offensive plays than Morris, 390 to 375, but Morris has run the ball more often, 146 times to 125, making the most of the opportunity afforded him by Shula in the shuttle system.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: A pleasant ramble with a former Times science writer, starting at the North Sea, then following a 1,400mile itinerary through France, Germany and the Alpine passes to Italy and the Mediterranean. Mr. Hillaby, a zoologist and conservationist, gives a complete bird's and man's eye view of his terrain, from the nightingale's song he heard on a Belgian canal to the ironmineshafts of Lorraine, from Alpine flower fields to the pollutions of Mare Nostrum. A book for both the rucksack and armchair traveler.

title: STRAUSS ELECTED DEMOCRATS' HEAD AND VOWS UNITY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Rob ert Strauss of Texas was elected chairman of the Demo cratic National Committee here this afternoon and immediately pledged to reconcile his oppo nents And to preserve reforms that had broadened participa tion in the party.

title: Accuracy of Recent Reports on Bormann Challenged
description: A number of questions have been raised in recent days about the accuracy and authen ticity of the information in the recent series of articles on Martin Bormann published by The Daily Express of London and other newspapers.

title: Lips Schneblin to Toot for Milwaukee in K.C. Deal
description: ONE remains endlessly astonished at the mon umental interest the public displays in ath letes and in the amount of detailed information that is so readily available about them. Every pulled muscle, scab, bruise and hangnail is soberly reported in the sports pages; offseason trades and new acquisitions are offered with the kind of gravity that normally goes with top politi cal appointments or the sign ing of treaties.

title: The Past Is Epilogue, Too, In Tunisia
description: THE traveler in Tunisia enters a civilization that began in Carthage and retains its unique character, largely uncompromised by 20thcentury modern ism. A hotel under construction mimics ancient caves nearby that are still home to local Berbers. The inseparable bond between people and environment is unmistakable: A rug seller sits tableaulike, as much a pattern as the rug he sells. This harmony echoes the passive pace of villages where men watch life, even centuries, go by. And oases, like mosques, retain their mystical significance, at once sustainer and refuge.

title: Phyllis Diller Separated
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 9 (UPI)Phyllis Diller, the co medienne, announced yesterday that she separated from her actorhusband, Warde Donovan. Miss Diller, 55 years old, said she and Mr. Donovan, 56, each had custody of his or her own children from previous mar riages. They were married in 1955.

title: The Guest Word
description: A recent book, the title of which escapes me for the moment, a bundle of confession which I trust will escape others, too, happens to describe me by name as a fag, an alcoholic, and a friend of S. I. Hayakawa of San Francisco State College.

title: In London, a Boutique That Only the Wealthy Can Afford
description: LONDON  Five years ago Joan and Sidney Burstein were broke. Faced with bankruptcy, they lost their home, their businessevery thing. Today they own Browns, the choicest (and perhaps most expensive) bou tique in London.

title: Back to Brooklyn Benefit
description: Nostalgia will be the theme and entertainment the me dium Tuesday night at a Back to Brooklyn Gala Ben efit in the Opera House of the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: AID PACT RENEWED BY NORTH VIETNAM AND SOVIET UNION
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9The So viet Union and North Vietnam concluded today a new agree ment for economic and military aid to Hanoi.

title: Sally Lethbridge Plans June Bridal
description: DUANESBURG, N.Y., Dec. 9Mr. and Mrs. George M. Lethbridge Jr. have made the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sally Ann Lethbridge, to Peter Alan Hunsdorfer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Hunsdorfer of West Sand Lake. The wed ding will take place in June.

title: Hole Closes West Side Lane
description: One of the three lanes of the downtown side of the West Side Highway from 12th to 13th Street was closed yesterday afternoon because of a large hole in the pavement of the elevated road. A police car was stationed at the 3by3by3foot hole, which penetrated to the supporting grids. The Depart ment of Highways was asked to repair temporarily the hole in the lane nearest the Hudson Rover with a steel plate, the police said.

title: The Jethro Tull Sound Fills the Garden
description: Jethro Tull, for those who aren't up on such things, is really Ian Anderson. The original Jethro Tull was an 18thcentury English agrono mist after whom Ian Ander son named his rock group, Mr. Anderson writes most of the quintet's songs, colors its sound with his flute playing, unashamedly steals the spot light with his antics and pos sesses enough magnetism to attract some 20,000 Tullo philes to Madison Square Garden on Friday night.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: GORDON LIGHTFOOT: Old Dan's Records (Reprise MS 2116). It seems so easy when Gordon Lightfoot does it  writes songs that just flow out in his warm, mellow tones. Yet, it's the rare talent who can approach Lightfoot's class and a rarer one who achieves the taste that marks every one of Lightfoot's re cordings. You know that Lightfoot's effortless style comes from hard work: here is a mind that can sort out the feelings all of us share and convey them in music that is perfectly expressive of their meaning.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: Foster Hirsch's Fan Let ter to Tuesday Weld tempts me to paraphrase that old chestnut, With him for a fan what does Tuesday need with an enemy? He admired her work way back when in Rock, Rock Rock and all those notsohot movies like Sex Kitten Goes to College, High Time, Rally Round the Flag and Soldier in the Rain, wherein she played variations on her own dis tinctive Lolita. He points out that Lord Love a Duck, in which she was again assigned the role of sexy childwoman, high school temptress, was his favorite Weld. He also praises Pretty Poison, in which Tuesday Weld starred as what he terms a psychotic seductress.

title: Guard Will Help in Cleanup
description: National Guard units are developing plans to start a massive citywide cleanup program and also to provide health diagnostic facilities for neighborhood residents.

title: Connecticut Plans DriveIn OTB Shops, TV Tracks
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn.  Without benefit of a horse or starting gate or even a bale of hay, Connecticut's Gaming Commission magi cians are confidently prepar ing to pull a multitrack rac ing operation out of their new parimutuel hat.

title: Bronx Gang Members Compete In Talent Show at High School
description: Touch of Satan, The Good Foot Dancers, The Sons of Dark ness and more than 20 other singing groups, most of which have gang members in them, competed at a talent show in a Bronx high school last week.

title: NORTH CAROLINA DEFEATS FLORIDA
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 9 (AP)Sammy Johnson smashed for three touchdowns behind the blocking of Ron Rusnak today as North Carolina scored a 2824 football victory over the Florida Gators.

title: World News Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9  Chaos threatened the European Com mon Market on the eve of British entry as representatives of 8,000 European civil servants decided to strike Monday fol lowing the failure of pay talks.

title: The quasiPrime Minister of the World
description: Henry Kissinger once referred to Metternich as the Prime Minister of Europe; his recent global peregrina tions now suggest that Kissinger is himself acting as quasiPrime Min ister of the World. Metternich, the Austrian architect of the Congress of Vienna in 1815 which tried to restore the world of the anciens regimes, has become, if not a house hold word, at least a handy model for discussing our own Henry Kissin ger. In an irritatingly uneven study of Kissinger, David Landau con tributes mightily to this myth; and, for good measure, adds a dose of dubious psychohistory.

title: Swedish King, III, to Miss Nobel Prize Ceremonies
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 9 (Reu ters)  Sweden's 90yearold King Gustaf Adolf VI today canceled traditional plans to present the 1972 Nobel Prizes Sunday because of a cold.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The solution to New York's housing crisis proposed by Charles J. Urstadt [For City Housing, Build on Big Scale, Nov. 26] is not workable.

title: AIR FORCE ACADEMY ACCUSED OF RACISM
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Dec. 9 A group of MexicanAmeri cans will ask a Senate subcom mittee to investigate alleged institutionalized racism at the Air Force Academy.

title: Kerr on Via Galactica
description: IALWAYS thought that Oklahoma! had the simplest plot I knew: would a cowhand ever get to take his girl to a pic nic? But Via Galactica, the space musical which has just opened and closed at the ample new Uris Theater, had a simpler one: would a space sanitation man ever take his hat off to a lady?

title: Carl Golob Fiance Of Shirley Broder
description: OCEANSIDE, L. I., Dec. 9 Mr. and Mrs. Morris Broder have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Shirley Elaine Broder, to Carl Golob, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Golob of Toms River, N. J.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Season's Greetings to all our wonderful friends! And for those who don't believe in seasons, a great big endofthe year hi!

title: Bonn's Lower House to Get Its First Woman President
description: BONN, Dec. 9 (AP)Chancel lor Willy Brandt's Social Dem ocratic party has nominated Annemarie Renger to be the first woman president of the Bundestag, the lower house of the West German parliament.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 9In Alaska, people view flying in small planes as part of life, rather like cold winters, the Northern Lights or the mid night sun.

title: New Signals for Counting Cars
description: EAST NORTHPORT, L.I.  Traffic signals so sensi tive that they can count cars at intersections will be in stalled here as part of a new project to eliminate conges tion on Larkfield Road.

title: Korvettes Planning A Store In Flushing
description: A new Korvettes depart ment store, several commer cial establishments and a 17 story apartment house are scheduled to be erected on site on Flushing, Queens, that has been vacant for a num ber of years.

title: East Eleven Triumphs
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 9 (UPI)Joe Schwartz, a Toledo tailback, rushed for 127 yards and a touchdown today to lead the East to a 207 victory over the West in the first Ohio Shrine Bowl football game at Ohio Stadium.

title: A Holiday Factory Bustles in Bergen
description: ENGLEWOODThe spirit of Christmas lives 365 days of the year in the home of Mrs. Walter Barklage of Englewood.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: An indictment of the auto mobile. Manufacturers con centrate on production and profit, and the cost accountant rules supreme. As a result, cars are technologically faulted and gimmickedup, cause pol lution, congestion and aliena tionas if you didn't know. The author writes knowledge ably about styling changes, in novations like power steering and automatic shift, and about the golden era which he says began in 1955, when cars be came, among other things, sex symbols. His title is premature; he claims that the auto is be coming so harmful socially that it will have to be put to sleep. Mr. Jerome is a lively writer (he has worked on auto ad vertising accounts and in auto motive journalism), but his arguments lack organization.

title: Child to Mrs. Mandel
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Stephen B. Mandel of Hoffman Estates, Ill., on Nov. 20 in La Grange, (Ill.) Community Hospital. Mrs. Mandel is the former Carol Francine Hoexter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter M. Hoexter of Man hattan. The child, the couple's second, has been named Caryn Beth. Her father is a chemist.

title: Gardens
description: Mulch down and cleanup for winter. If canes on climbing rosebushes are long and unwieldy, some pruning back can be done to prevent their tearing in winds. Keep up bird feeding. Store greens outdoors for making trims and trimmings.

title: The Forgotten Cities
description: When Federal revenue sharing was still only a political dream of tax money flowing back to the areas of greatest need, urban reformers were convinced that the hard pressed cities would reap the greatest benefits. It was not an unreasonable hope. The details of the urban crisis had been spelled out for years at every political symposium. The extent of that crisis was unmistakable to anyone who had ever walked through innercity slums or had measured the escalating costs of urban govern ment for education, welfare, housing and policing.

title: Work Plan Gives Elderly New Life
description: CLINTON  Putting aside his green hard hat and his carpentry tools for a mo ment, Arnold Philhower ad mits that, if it were not for the Green Thumb program, he would be just sitting around.

title: FRANCK IS HAILED ON ANNIVERSARY
description: Today is the 150th anni versary of Cesar Franck's birth, and Rollin Smith is going to celebrate it by doing something no one has done before. He is going to play all 12 of Franck's major organ works in one recital.

title: An innocent defense of power
description: In this, his ninth book, his first since the highly popular Love and Will, Rollo May has written an apology for power and a critique of innocence. By power he means primarily psychological power: the ability to assert oneself, to exercise influence, even to enlarge one's au thority at the expense of others. By innocence he understands a failure to acknowledge the reality of power. Just as the reasonable assertion of power leads to selffulfillment, so the indulgence of innocence leads to vic timization or, paradoxically, to vio lence. In the case of Melville's Billy Budda central symbol for May innocence encompasses both of these fates: Billy's childlike unwillingness to recognize the presence of evil in the world results in an outburst of murderous violence and eventually in his own death.

title: Col. Roger E. Brunschwig Dies; French Hero in 2 Wars Was 81
description: Col. Roger E. Brunschwig, a muchdecorated French hero of the two world wars, died Thursday at the New York Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 444 East 57th Street.

title: Miss McEwan, Piano Teacher, Fiancee of John E. Underwood
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9Miss Georgia McEwan, a piano teacher at the Chapin School in New York, plans to be married here in the spring to John Edwin Underwood, a partner of a private in vestment concern in London.

title: Antigone Takes Honors
description: READINGTON, N. J., Dec. 8 Mac Cone, the junior member of the United States Equestrian team, rode Antigone to the open jumper championship tonight at the Four Seasons Farm Horse Show. Antigone, which is owned by Four Seasons, scored 6 points on two second place ribbons.

title: MISS BEHR FIRST IN SLALOM RACE
Molloy Captures 3 Events In School Relays Mee
description: Archbishop Molloy of Queen won three of its six open event yesterday in a Catholic high school polar bear relay meet on Mount St. Michael's all weather track in the Bronx.

title: Chicagoan Slain in Brisbane
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 9 (AP)  Chicago businessman, Thomas Patrick Enright, 45, was killed yesterday when a bomb blew up his car, the police reported. The car was parked outside an apartment building occupied by Mr. En right's son and next to the Ser bian Orthodox Church, which a member said had been threat ened twice in the last two months.

title: The World
description: SYDNEY  We are not going to turn the country upside down, the new Prime Minister of New Zealand reassured his countrymen.

title: Social Announcements
description: Weddings

title: Service Center Is Helping Troubled Families
description: ORANGE  He commutes to New York, is alternately aggravated by traffic and taxes and, at the age of 42, has doubts about his future in the executive suite. She is a wife, mother and family chauffeur, and is frustrated in a conveniencefilled home society.

title: CITY ACTS TO END DAYCARE DISPUTE
description: The city's Agency for Child Development has begun efforts to integrate a daycare center in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, attended only by Hasidic Jewish children, to re solve a controversy over its use.

title: Letters:
description: I read the superficial, misleading es say on Albany with much irritation. It is the typical New York City view of Albany and it fails to capture the quality of life there. As a native, I took for granted that Albany was a drab, unsophisticated place next to really metropolitan centers like Pittsburgh, Houston, Dallas, Baltimore, etc.

title: Education
description: During a strategy meeting of pro testing parents in East Harlem last Week, a mother of five children sug gested that a parent delegation visit United Nations headquarters to appeal for international aid to the underdeveloped schools in East Harlem, a heavily Puerto Rican and black community.

title: Welfare Mothers Perform Well on Jobs
description: NEWARKYes, can do seems to have become the motto of an experimental Federal project in which nearly 1,400 mothers on wel fare have demonstrated since last April that, given the chance, they can hold down a job like the next wage earner.

title: Rand Corporation Names Two Women as Directors
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Dec. 9 (AP)The Rand Corporation, a nonprofit think tank en gaged in problems of national security and domestic affairs, has named women to its board of directors for the first time.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  What happens to a company with sales of less than $10million a year when the Federal Gov ernment finds that it has raised prices illegally under the wageprice controls pro gram?

title: Mobile Lab Goes to Workers
description: JERSEY CITY  Several New Jersey labor unions and employers are working with a giant in the pharmaceutical and healths products indus try to give workers complete medical tests in a mobile laboratory.

title: Pamela Piech Wed on L.I.
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Dec. 9 Miss Ramela Anne Piech, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Michael Piech of Dix Hills, and James Christopher Sampson, son of Mrs. Ruth C. Sampson of Deal, N. J., and Harry O. Sampson of Allenhurst, N. J., were mar ried here this afternoon by the Rev. Malcolm M. Mooers in the Congregational Church.

title: AMAZON PRIESTS MEET RESISTANCE
description: BELEM, Brazil, Dec. 1 Roman Catholic churchmen who have preached against social injustice in the Amazon jungle are meeting mounting problems with the authorities. Several priests and bishops who have taken up the cause of small landholders against big ranch ers have been accused of sub version.

title: Paper in Hong Kong Buys Far East Economic Review
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 9 (AP) The South China Morning Post, one of Hong Kong's major Englishlanguage newspapers, announced yesterday that it was taking over the weekly Far Eastern Economic Review, which circulates throughout Asia and Australia.

title: Fordham Five Wins, Manhattan, L.I. U. Bow
If You Go
description: to Iceland it is a good idea be forehand to read W. H. Auden and Louis MacNeice's Letters From Iceland, published in 1935 and re issued in paperback in 1965 (Faber & Faher Ltd., London). Aside from its literary interest, the volume is full of still relevant practical ad vice and contains, tucked away, a good bibliography. There is also a guidebook, Iceland in a Nutshell, published in 1971 by Iceland Travel Books, Reykjavik. It tells just about everything worth telling.

title: Missouri Beats Ohio State
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 9 (AP)  Missouri scored 10 straight points in the last three minutes tonight for a 6962 basketball victory over Ohio State. The Tigers overturned a 6259 Buck eye lead with 3 minutes to play.

title: A Palace of Art
description: Mr. Stewart's new novel is one of those country  house storiesa wonderful species that start with a bang and end with a whisper. The house is Nudd Manor, a mansion in the Cotswolds stuffed to the roof beams with a collection of fine art. When the mistress of the house drops dead during an afternoon showing, her daugh ter Gloria is left with a for tune and two suitors too many: a clandestine art dealer, a local farmer, a distant cousin.

title: TV Maibbg
description: JOHN J. O'CONNOR's Chronicle of public tel evision's financial and political difficulties Above All, Let's Not Be Rude to the White House was curiously unsatisfying, although basically accurate. Certainly public television is in trouble and the great hopes of 1968, after passage of the Public Broadcasting Act of 1967 and the creation of the Corporation for Public Broad casting (CPB), are tarnished.

title: Barbara Davis to Wed
description: The engagement of Miss Barbara Ellen Davis to Ste phen Weinberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Saul Weinberg of Cedarhurst, and Copake, N. Y., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Myron Davis of Livingston, N. J. Miss Davis, a graduate of Penn sylvania State University, teaches in the special educa tion department of the Wood bridge, N. J., school system. Her fianc is office manager in Maspeth, Queens, with the Embassy Grocery Corpora tion.

title: Medicine
description: A New York physician repeatedly injects hundreds of patients  among them some of the nation's most talented actors, writers and artistswith a combination of drugs, including the dependencyforming amphet amines (speed). His pa tients include the late John F. Kennedy. Everyone in New York's jetset knows ?? the man, Many of New York's physicians know of him.

title: Barbara Spring Hunter Bride of Peter Eaton Guernsey Jr., Banker
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Dec. 9Miss Barbara Spring Hunter and Peter Eaton Guernsey Jr., graduates of Lake Forest College, were married here this afternoon in the First Congregational Church by the Rev. J. Thom as Leamon.

title: Counterattack Parried
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 9 (AP)Laotian irregulars were said to have repelled a North Vietnamese counterattack yes terday in Saravane, 280 miles southeast of Vientiane, accord ing to a United States military spokesman.

title: Louella Parsons, Gossip Columnist, Dies
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Dec. 9 (Reuters)Louella Parsons, one of the great gossip queens of the golden age of Holly wood, died here today in a rest home.

title: LETTERS
description: Prof. Louis H. Pollak's impassioned defense of for mer Attorney General Nicho las deB. Katzenbach's per sonal and professional integ rity [Letters, Dec. 3] fails to confront the underlying prob lem created by the ever increasing exodus of high level public officials to pri vate life.

title: Music
description: IT wasn't supposed to be that way, but Adriana Mali ponte has become one of the Metropolitan Opera's busiest leading sopranos this season (substitution for the indisposed Mirella Freni is part of the reason). After appearing as Micala in the new production of Carmen, a role she had sung previously with the company, she turned to Juliette in Gounod's opera, Pamina in Zauberflote and Euridice in Gluck's opera. Tomorrow night she sings Marguerite in Faust and later there will be Violetta in Traviata. These are all parts she has not sung here before. There is also Mimi in Bohme. This makes seven operas, involving three languages, when, as Miss Maliponte herself says, Ameri cans think Italians can't speak or sing anything else but Italian.

title: R.P.I. Five Trounces Brooklyn Poly, 11350
description: TROY, N. Y., Dec. 9 (AP) Rensselaer Polytechnic In stitute scored a 11350 vic tory over Brooklyn Poly to day, a record point total for an R.P.I. basketball team.

title: SYRIA REPORTED TO CURB RAIDING
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 9 Syria has ordered Palestinian commandos to halt their raids into Israel, Arab diplomatic sources said today.

title: Law
description: The Korova Milkbar, which had no license for selling liquor, was a setting for much of the sexuality and violence in the movie A Clockwork Orange. And milk bars may well be the wave of the future as a result of the Supreme Court's 63 decision last week holding that certain types of nude entertainmentsome of which the Court acknowledged to be pro tected by the First Amendmentmay be banned where liquor is sold.

title: A soldier ahead of his time
description: This distinguished volume from the prolific pen of Sir Arthur Bryant is the most re cent of a long line of works on the age of the Duke of Welling ton that have appeared over the span of a generation. Sir Arthur Bryant's own earlier trilogy, The Years of Endur ance, Years of Victory and The Age of Elegance (Harp er, 19401943, out of print) is one of the brightest stars in the firmament dealing with the wars of Napoleon. Its author matches that high standard with his current book.

title: A DRAFT REFUSER WINS A REVERSAL
description: A black writer who went to prison for refusing to serve in the Army has won an un usual decision in the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Movie Mailbag; Does Tuesday Need This Fan?; MISHMASH
description: Why is Trotsky Dying? Vincent Canby asks apropos of the sudden demise of Jo seph Losey's The Assassina tion of Trotsky. The film barely made it through a threeweek firstrun at the Coronet. Canby describes it as a film of style, intelli gence, originality and histor ical interest. I have found it a mishmash of thoroughly disorganized and unhinged episodes, poor characteriza tions and wrong history. In this instance, the public seems to me to have been right.

title: Two Bills to Be Offered Soon To Protect Antiques Buyers
description: BROOKSIDE  Consumer protection for buyers of an tiques may be coming to New Jersey, thanks to the efforts of a young Morris Country woman.

title: Stores in Garb for Holiday
description: Long Island's shopping centers are again decked out for the holiday season with the traditional lights and dec orations. For some of them, however, their 1972 Christ mas displays top anything they've done before.

title: The World
description: HELSINKI  After shadowboxing for years over whether to hold a conference on European security and cooperation, East and West have finally come togetherand find them selves sparring over the meaning of dtente.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: Perhaps your Mel Gussow should have studied the Are You Now Or Have You Ever Been program notes on opening night, instead of ogling Zero Mostel. In that program, Eric Bentley states that every word of dialogue is taken directly from the written testimony of the HUAC hearings.

title: Apollo Near Moon Orbit; Two to Walk Tomorrow
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 9The as tronauts of Apollo 17, coast ing closer to their destination today, were set to rocket into lunar orbit tomorrow afternoon and to land and walk on the moon Monday afternoon.

title: SIXTYFIRST ANNUAL APPEAL
description: 0N behalf of the needy of New York City, The New York Times today opens its 61st annual ap peal. The stories on this page have been drawn from the confidential files of the city's major private social agencies, which every year provide help and guidance for the thousands of un fortunates who have nowhere else to turn. These are the stories of abandoned children, of old people in failing health, without friends or adequate funds. These are the stories of the physically handicapped, and of povertystricken families broken by desertion or death.

title: Deborah Marion Young Affianced
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 9Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Young have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Deborah Marion Young, to John W. Claghorn 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Claghorn Jr. Both families are of Princeton, where the wedding is planned for June.

title: Homosexual Literature
description: Emerson once remarked that people would stare to know on what slight single observations those laws were inferred which wise men promulgate and which society re ceives later and writes down as canons. After months of reading the scientific and movement litera ture on homosexuality, I'm convinced that no one is in possession of suf ficient knowledge at this point in time (though almost no one concedes this) to warrant the confident gen eralizations heard on all sides  and especially on the scientific side. I write as one who has not only read the literature, but lived the life.

title: Bruins Beat Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8 (UPI)Phil Esposito scored a goal and added an assist to night as the Boston Bruins beat the Philadelphia Flyers, 43.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: We've got a drug problem in America. It's called tele vision.

title: Fake Firs for Guatemalans
description: GUATEMALA, Dec. 9 (AP) President Carlos Arana Osorio decreed that no traditional Yule trees could be felled this year, leaving Guatemalans with noth ing hut fake firs for Christmas.

title: jazz
description: I know nothing about elec tronics at all, Chick Corea apologized to his listeners at Carnegie Recital Hall on Fri day evening, as he attempted to control feedback from the various amplifiers he brought on stage with his trio. There were times when one wished that he were not even aware of electronics, because this very able jazz pianist spent most of his program, the first of this season's series called Jazz: The Personal Dimen sion, hammering away on an electric piano producing shrill, hollow; empty sounds accompanied by the scratchy, surface noise effect pro duced by turnedon amplify ing equipment.

title: Feminist Press Creating What It Couldn't Find
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I.  With the women's liberation movement demanding that schools and libraries and bookstores provide literature to strive by, an informal group on Long Island has be gun the work of creating the books.

title: SQUIRES SET BACK ROCKETS 101 TO 98
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 9 (UPI) Julius Erving, Virginia's super forward, scored 30 points to night to lead the Squires to a 10198 American Basketball As sociation victory over Denver.

title: The Nation
description: The main New York City victim of the peculiar crackdown on welfare payments announced last week by Washington earns $44,500 a year, lives in a comfortable home in Forest Hills, is an architect by training and has no trouble at all making his own way in the world. His name is David A. Gross man and he is New York City's budget director.

title: The Witches Of Worm; By Zilpha Keatley Snyder. Illustrated by Alton Raible. 183 pp. New York: Atheneum. $5.25. (Ages 9 to 12)
description: In a succession of distinguished books, Zilpha Keatley Snyder has been exploring the nature of magic, not only for the benefit of children, one feels, but to satisfy herself which is, of course, how all good books are written. Invariably at the center of her magic is an oddball a highly individual, nonconforming, compelling character, so inventive (like April Hall in The Egypt Game and Ivy Carson in The Changeling) as to suggest that magic lies within the power of imagination itself.

title: Turkey Hash
description: Craig Novaas his new novel Turkey Hash demon stratesis a strong, serious (and shocking) young author. Granted, he also needs criti cism. Not the shortshrift con descension Martin Levin grant ed him.

title: SOVIET PLANNING RUNS INTO A SNAG
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9The 30 yearold mother had been on a waiting list for an apartment for three years. She and her husband wanted to have a third child, but their cramped one room quarters in a communal apartment did not seem to make this an attractive pros pect.

title: Westchester Courts Try Plan To Speed Up Criminal Trials
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 9 Westchester County has be come the testing ground for a court experiment designed to bring swifter justice to persons accused of crimes.

title: Dobbs Ferry Priest Elected Maryknoll Superior General
description: The Rev. Raymond A. Hill of Dobbs Ferry, N. V., has been elected superior general of the Catholic Foreign Mission So ciety of America.

title: If You Go
description: you'll be on a carrier that, to qualify under the rules of the Civil Aeronautics Board, must publish schedules that include service between at least two points at least five times a week. The commuter airlines, of which there are about 130 in the United States and the Caribbean area, should not be confused with air taxi operators, who fly on de mand and do not post schedules. There are more than 3,000 of those.

title: 53 Illegal Aliens Held
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9 (Reu ters)  Federal immigration agents arrested 53 illegal alien workers yesterday at a food products plant formerly owned by Mrs. Romana Benuelos, United States Treasurer, and now headed by her son. It was the seventh time that raids on the plant have netted illegal workers. On the previous occa sions the plant, Romanas Mexi can Food Products, Inc., was held in Mrs. Banuelos's name.

title: 96 Law Officers Killed In 11 Months, F.B.I. Says
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) Ninetysix law enforcement officers were killed in the first 11 months of this year com pared with 112 during the same period in 1971, the Federal Bu reau of Investigation says.

title: Diana Westneat, a Librarian, Marries
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 9 Miss Diana Westneat was married here this afternoon in the First Presbyterian Church to Leonard Witt by the Rev. Douglas E. Nelson.

title: Westchester Makes Deal To Regain $600,000 Art
description: District Attorney Carl A. Ver gari of Westchester County yesterday announced the re covery of most of $600,000 worth of stolen art works, in cluding a Cranach painting.

title: the traveler's world
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev.Most of the 16 million people who each year visit Las Vegas as tourists never get to see Las Vegas. They get as far as The Strip, their hotel room, pool, tennis court and golf club, and no mat ter how they try they cannot miss the gambling casinos nor the extravagant shows in the clubs up and down The Strip. But no matter how long they stay or how often they drive out to Hoover Dam and its Lake Mead or just out onto the desert, they never get to see the other, the real Las Vegas, the city wherein live rather sedately a couple of hundred thousand people, 300,000 if you include Boulder, Henderson, North Las Vegas and other outlying communities.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It is not a situation that demands a 21gun salute, That would be overdoing it to an excessive degree. However, the modest firing of just one salvo should suffice, Bang! Consider it done. The salute is aimed in the direction of Alex Webster for the surprisingly solid coaching job he has achieved with the New York Giants this year. Since the Giants will probably be poleaxed by unbeaten Miami in the Yankee Sta dium today and then hog tied by the Cowboys in Dallas a week later, the salaam to Big Red should be made while he is still ahead.

title: John Worster Fiance Of Margaret Brennan
description: CRANFORD, N. J., Dec. 9 Mr. and Mrs. John Leo Brennan have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Margaret Mary Brennan, to John Phillip Worster, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Worster. Both families are of Cranford. The wedding is planned for May 19.

title: Communities Draw on Municipal League Information Bank
description: TRENTONI take office as Mayor in January, said the voice on the telephone, and I will have to tackle some big problems im mediately. Do you have sample ordinances on provid ing sewage facilities, noise control and the licensing of cats?

title: An Operatic Odyssey Into the Past
description: ODYSSEY, the budget di vision of Columbia, has already set spinning many worthy jogs to our memory of voices from the pastrestrospectives of the art of Sayao, Steber, Pons, Garden, Lehmann, We litsch and Pinza come to mindand now the company has added six more disks to its rich library.

title: Shoplifting Is Fought In Queens
description: A largescale campaign Against shoplifting  which Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell said cost the borough's retailers $123 million last yearhas been started by a civic group that is devoted to preventing crime.

title: Boston Writers Pick Triant
description: BOSTON, Dec. 9 (AP)  Luis Tiant, a righthander who spent most of the first four months of the 1972 season in the bull pen, was named the Boston Red Sox most valuable pitcher today by the Boston baseball writers.

title: Cincinnati Is Eliminated, 2724, by Cockroft's Late Field Goal
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 9 With less than a minute to play to day, it seemed that the Bengals were on the way to a stirring victory over the Cleveland Browns.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Vice President Agnew has warned the Republican governors not to abuse the revenuesharing funds the Federal Government now is shipping out to 35,000 local and state jurisdic tions. He said there were those in Congress still dubious about the pro gram, and well there might be; the fact is that revenue sharing is an experi ment and not a guaranteed method of making things better.

title: McCloskey Quits Marines
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 9 (AP)United States Represent alive Paul N. McCloskey Jr. says he is giving up his com mission as a colonel in the Marine Corps because of a court ruling that Congressmen should not hold military status. Ap nearing on a local television program Tuesday, the Repub lican Representative said he had decided to resign because or a United States Court of Ap peals decision upholding the ruling of a judge in Washington that it was unconstitutional for members of Congress to hold reserve commissions in the armed forces.

title: Views of Review
description: In The Week in Review, Dec. 3, among the Headliners is Philippine President Ferdinand E. Marcos who explained why he proclaimed martial law. He said he consulted God: I asked for a sign, and He gave me sev eral signs It seems as if I was being led and guided by some strange mind above me.

title: Little Lyne Rodeo's Biggest Man
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 9 Rodeo, a sport started by man's pride in his working skills, is winding up its best year at the 14th annual Na tional Finals Rodeo in the Fair Grounds Sports Arena.

title: Industrial America Booms Again
description: CLEVELANDFinally it is happening. Five days a week, three shifts a day, the steel workers are surging over silted roads leading into Cleveland's Valley. There a congestion of smokebelch ing mills are operating full tilt to help meet the nation's swelling demand for steel.

title: Lafayette Five Defeats Seton Hall, 8558, for 4th in Row
description: EASTON, Pa., Dec. 9 (UPI) Walt Kocubinski scored 30 points to raise his college bas ketball career total over 1,000 today as he led Lafayette to an 8558 victory over Seton Hall.

title: Princeton Undergraduate a Film Star
description: PRINCETON  Every fall, Princeton University refers to its undergraduates as a re pository of uncommonly di verse talent and experience. Although often regarded as a mere formality, this claim bore an authentic tone when Parker Stevenson entered the school in 1971.

title: Golf Club Slayings and Other Murders in Virgin Islands Raise Fears and Demands for Law and Order
description: ST. CROIX, V. I., Dec. 9 Three months have passed since eight persons were gunned down on the breezeswept ter race that overlooks the Foun tain Valley Golf Club, a St. Croix attraction that now draws as many sightseers on some days as golfers.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: When Mel Gussow re viewed Eric Bentley's Are You Now or Have You Ever Been, he said he was put in the position of evaluating life as well as art. Now, this is not at all a bad position for a critic to be put in. Life, too, is a theater critic's prov ince. In discussing the play and, separately, the behavior of the witnesses (defend ants?) before the brutal House UnAmerican Activi ties Committee, a critic has every right to notice and mention distinctions between history and stage perform ance, but these distinctions do not necessarily work to the detriment of the per formance.

title: B. F. Cheatham 4th to Wed Miss Slack
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 9Dr. and Mrs. Lewis Slack have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Wyman Slack, to Benjamin Franklin Cheath am 4th, son of Mrs. Cheath am 3d of Richmond, Va. and the late Mr. Cheatham.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your lead editorial of Nov. 21, en titled After Cold War, refers to the Conference on European Security and Cooperation (C.E.S.C.) without any specific mention of its possible useful ness, although you do make such ref erences in regard to the two other conferences covered in the editorial.

title: Nancy F. Blanchard Is Fiancee Of Dr. William Stanley Lewis
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 9 Mrs. Mary Fairbank Blanch ard and William Stokes Blanchard, both of Westport, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Nancy Franklin Blanchard, to Dr. William Stanley Lewis of Fairfield, son of Mrs. Jacques Melvin Lewis of New York and the late Dr. Lewis, who was professor of pediatrics at New York University Col lege of Medicine.

title: Media
description: It was sometime between 10:30 and 11 A.M. last Friday and Hedley Dono van, EditorinChief of all Time Inc. publications, had just finished reading the announcement of Life magazine's death. In the stunned silence that fol lowed, Frank Kappler, the editor who's been straightening out my copy (and not occasionally my self) for seven years, turned to those near him in the company's eighth floor auditorium and began what for a lot of us will be a long period of summing up: Gee, that's the strongest rumor I've heard yet.

title: The Stranger In Shakespeare
description: Eminence is the one thing the authors of these books have in com mon: they are both celebrated pro fessors of literature, but the time when that trade imposed common characteristics on its practitioners is long past, and in the present instance one has sometimes to remind him self that Reuben Brower and Leslie Fiedler are actually talking about the same author. Mr. Brower belongs to a scholarly species that ought to be protected like whales and koala bears, the kind that possesses an easy familiarity with the Greek and Latin tongues, and can apply its knowledge of the classics to English texts without the slightest indication of strain, or of having worked it all up for the occasion. Mr. Fiedler is the evangelist of a cultural mutation that will abolish the past altogether. Since he is himself a historian  of the Western psychehe isn't alto gether happy about such extremes but he wouldn't claim, either, to have much time for conventional scholar ship.

title: Education
description: The early 1960's were the Came lot of educational innovators who believed that inventive genius and the new technology would solve all learning problems. With more money, more buildings and more teachers, the nation's schools could make adjustments and produce a better society, the thinking went.

title: Stimulus of U.S. Budget May Taper
description: WASHINGTONThe Fed eral budget will provide mas sive stimulus to the economy in the present ninemonth period from October to next July, but the stimulus will then decline rapidly.

title: Government Calls Glue On Stamps Safe to Lick
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI)The Government says that no matter how many stamps you lick for your Christmas cards they won't harm you.

title: Fraternity Assists Vietnam Veterans
description: MAHWAHThere is only one fraternity on the new campus of Ramapo College, and most of its members went through their initia tions in places like Vietnam and Cambodia.

title: Israeli Aide Says Nation Plans To Absorb a Million Soviet Jews
description: Yigal AIIon, the Deputy Prime Minister of Israel, said last night that his nation was developing her economy and absorptive capacity to inte grate no less than one million Soviet Jews in the next 10 years.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: DALLAS, Dec. 8 (AP)James Silas, a rookie, hit a pair of free throws with four seconds left tonight, giving the Dallas Chapparals a 129128 victory over the Indiana Pacers.

title: LETTERS
description: The issue of stockholder guardianship is an important discussion and I welcome the focusing of new attention on the subject of the role of out side directors.

title: Miss Linda Lewis To Be Wed Feb. 10
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 9Mr. and Mrs. William H. Lewis have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Linda Lee Lewis, to Donald Shriver Lovelace, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clarence S. Love lace of Greenwich, Conn., and Nantucket, Mass. The wedding is planned for Feb. 10.

title: Harding Hogties Langston
description: LAWTON, Okla., Dec. 9 (UPI) Tom Ed Gooden hooted a 41 yard field goal with two sec onds retaining to give Harding College a 3027 victory over Langston today in the second annual Cowboy Bowl. Gooden, who tossed three touchdowns for the Bisons, engineered the winning drive from his team's 35 to the Langston 24yard line with three consecutive passes.

title: The Nation
description: A turquoise lamp flashes brightly on a metaldetector as passengers board a United Air Lines Boeing 727 at Chicago. An airline agent po litely asks one passenger to step aside.

title: MRS. BINH RAISES CEASEFIRE ISSUES
description: PARIS, Dec. 9The talks on a Vietnam ceasefire continued today with only a sharp state ment from the leader of the Vietcong delegation here to break the public silence.

title: Death Penalty Issue Is Revived
description: TRENTON  Despite com plex legal obstacles, there is considerable sentiment in the State Legislature to reinstate capital punishment in New Jersey.

title: Learning about death
description: Several months ago, a friend of mine died, leaving her husband and 5yearold son, Mark. As the weeks passed, Mark became very depressed. He grew more and more silent. He would sit for hours just staring out the window. He picked at his food. And then he began re fusing to go to school.

title: GOOD TASTE SHOWN BY JAHODA, PIANIST
description: Competency and good taste prevailed at Fritz Jahoda's pro gram at Carnegie Recital Hall Thursday night. Although the pianist is not a demon virtuoso, he gets over the keys efficient ly and smoothly, even if there is rarely a suggestion of tech nique in excess.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 9 San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit, the nation's first real test of one of the modern transit systems contemplated in a dozen cities, has sud denly found itself in trouble on all sides.

title: Parent and Mrs. Courson Victors in Veterans Dance
description: Mrs. Dixie Courson of West New York, N. J., and Don Par ent of New York City took time out from their service duties at the North Atlantic figure skat ing championships yesterday to win the final event, the veter ans dance, at the Sky Rink.

title: Arculeo Expects to Regain His Council Minority Post
description: Encouraged by the City Council's Democratic leaders, Angelo J. Arculeo, Brooklyn Republican, expects to regain next month the Council minor ity leadership post he previ ously held for seven years.

title: Inquiry Criticizes Police In Killings at Southern U.
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 10 Members of a biracial com mission investigating the deaths of two Southern University stu dents said today they disputed the official version of the inci dent that occurred last month on the school's campus.

title: McClain, in Surprise Return, Bolsters Jets' Hopes Against Raiders Tonight
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 10 The New York Jets re gained part of their running attack today with the un expected return of Cliff Mc Clain. But the surprise was diluted by predictions that a muddy field would await them tomorrow night when they played the Oakland Raiders in the Oakland Sta dium.

title: Cairo Parliament Assails Cabinet in Harsh Terms
description: CAIRO, Dec. 10 (Reuters) Egypt's Parliament has made an unprecedented attack on a major policy statement by the Government and questioned the nation's preparedness for war with Israel.

title: Trends in Chicago Indicate Deterioration of the Daley Machine
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10This city, ruled from its beginnings by an interlocking alliance of businessmen, politicians and hoodlums so intricate that their roles shade into one another, once again is facing the pos sibility of a wave of reform.

title: Mrs. Swarzman Is Bride of R. J. Levine
description: Mrs. Abby Beth Levingson Swarzman of New. York, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Al fred Levingson of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Robert Jona than Levine. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Alexander Levine of Brooklyn.

title: Sharks Win by 53
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 (AP) Three goals by Mike Byers led the Los Angeles Sharks to a 53 W.H.A. victory over the Alberta Oilers tonight. Garry Veneruzzo added two goals for the winners.

title: 3 Goals for Dornhoefer
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10 (UPI)Gary Dornhoefer scored three goals tonight as the Phil adelphia Flyers defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 52. Dorn hoefer's first goal put the Fly ers ahead, 10, at 4:27 of the first period.

title: Buses From L.I. to City
description: Following is a list of bus services available to Nassau and Suffolk County commuters to subway stops in Queens:

title: Betsy Norden, Singer, Weds
description: GREENS FARMS, Conn., Dec. 10Miss Elizabeth A. Norden, who is Betsy Nor den, the Metropolitan Opera coloratura, was married here this afternoon to Robert L. Haley, a member of the Met ropolitan Opera orchestra's trumpet section. The Rev. William Bryant performed the ceremony at the Greens Farms Congregational Church.

title: VITAL POSTS OPEN UNDER PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  President Nixon has filled his secondterm Cabinet, barring confirmation battles, and public interest in the new Nixon Administration has diminished, but there are still significant decisions to be made about people and positions below the Cabinet level.

title: The Berk Foundation Gives Its Berg Award to Founders
description: The David and Minnie Berk Foundation, which each year presents the Max Berg Award for achievements in prolonging or improving the quality of human life, found its winners close to home this year and last night honored Mr. Berk and his wife.

title: AUSTRALIANS GET SWIFT REFORMS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 10 A short time ago, most Aus tralians would have thought that having an ambassador from Peking in Canberra next year was as unlikely as seeing an uncensored version of Port noy's Complaint on the coun try's sanitized movie screens.

title: Food Prices Rise
description: For most American families the most meaningful measuring rod of success or failure in the battle against inflation is what happens to the price of food at the checkout counter. On that basis, consumers are likely to take a more apprehensive view than does the Adminis tration of last month's 1.4 per cent rise in the index of wholesale food prices.

title: SIHANOUK SAYS PACT WON'T END FIGHTING
description: TIENTSIN, China, Dec. 10 (Agence FrancePresse)Prince Sihanouk, the former Cambo dian chief of state, who main tains close relations with Premier Chou Enlai of China, believes that sooner or later Vietnamese and Laotian pa triots will have to return to combat whether they want to or not, after an Indochina ceasefire.

title: Ozark Editor's Attacks Arouse Fear and Anger
description: CAVE CITY, Ark.Joseph Harry Weston, 61 years old, is a oneman terrorist band. His weapon is a weekly news paper and he runs it on the creed that all the outrage he can muster is fit to print.

title: New Strategy Mapped by Car Maker
description: WOLFSBURG, West Ger many, Dec. 10  The giant Volkswagen Company, once the prototype of West Germany's economic strength, is still sail ing troubled waters but its new captain, Rudolf Leiding, is con vinced that dramatic improve ment will come by 1974 at the latest.

title: COLLEGES ASSIST RURAL BRAZILIANS
description: PICOS, BrazilThe women who do their laundry in the Guaribas River as it flows through this important market town have just learned that the innocent snails in the river bed can carry dangerous para sites.

title: 2 From Jersey Shot in Fight With Staten Island Youths
description: Two New Jersey youths were shot and slightly wounded after a fist fight with a group of Staten Island youths Satur day night in the Huguenot sec tion of Staten Island, the po lice of the Tottenville station reported.

title: PBW MOVE IS DUE ON CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 10 With other states, other stock ex changes, the Securities and Ex change Commission and the big brokerage houses watching ner vously from the wings, Con necticut's bid for a seat on the PBW Stock Exchange in Phila delphia is due to be acted on this week.

title: Soviet Repression Leaves The Dissidents in Disarray
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10As the Soviet Union has moved toward improved relations with the West this year, its secret police have mounted a determined cam paign of repression against the domestic dissident movement that has left some dissenters feeling weaker, more vulner able and more on the defensive that at any other time since the midnineteensixties.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 10At what we hope is the brink of success for Henry Kissinger in his long search for peace in Vietnam, it is fascinating to look back at the paper in which he roughed out his approach to the negotiations. That was his article of January, 1969, in Foreign Affairs.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: HAPPY BIRTHDAY R.G.

title: Jason Robards Injured
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Dec. 10 (UPI)  Jason Robards, 49 years old, the actor, suffered major facial injudies yesterday when his car crashed through a guard rail in the Malibu Mountains.

title: 8 KILLED IN BLAST AND 5HOUR BLAZE
description: CLINTON, Mo., Dec. 10 (AP) Eight persons were killed last night in an explosion and fire in a twostory building on the town square here. Five of the victims had been trying to free a mother and her daughter from the rubble.

title: Target Area Might Yield Oldest Rocks Yet Studied
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10 The area of tomorrow's moon land ing is a museum selected to of fer a maximum number of re vealing exhibits including what scientists hope will prove to be the oldest rocks ever brought into a laboratory.

title: 6TH LANDING NEAR
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10Apollo 17 rocketed into an orbit of the moon today and was set for the sixth landing of men on the earth's desolate satellite world.

title: Color TV Broadcasts From Moon Scheduled
description: Live color television trans missions from the surface of the moon today are sched uled from 7:43 P.M. to 1:30 A.M., according to the Apollo 17 mission timetable.

title: Watergate Figure's Dead Wife Had $10,000 to Invest, He Says
