description: POTOMAC, Md., Dec. 10E. Howard Hunt, whose wife, Dorothy, was killed in the United Air Lines crash near Midway Airport in Chicago on

title: KISSINGER'S AIDE TALKS WITH NIXON ON TRUCE PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  President Nixon conferred for 75 minutes today with Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., key aide to Henry A. Kissinger at the secret Paris talks with the North Vietnamese. But the White House continued to pro vide no information on how close the two sides had come to concluding an Indochina settlement.

title: TOP POLITICIANS FEAR FOR ITALY
description: PERUGIA, Italy, Dec. 10 Italy is in the throes of a crisis and needs drastic re forms to do away with parasit ism and unjust privilege, but social reforms are impossible unless Italians work harder or more efficiently.

title: Wings Tie Canucks, 33
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (AP) A defenseman, Ron Stackhouse, tallied for Detroit with just 2:36 remaining tonight, gain ing a 33 tie for the Wings with the Vancouver Canucks. Marcel Dionne, Detroit's leading scorer with 34 points, was not in uniform and the team an nounced he had been suspend ed indefinitely for not appear ing for the game.

title: TAX MEN TO STUDY MIDTOWN SEX SPOTS
description: The City Finance Adminis trator, Richard Lewisohn, said yesterday he had established a special task force to ensure that the city was receiving its full share of taxes from adult bookstores, Peepshow theaters, masage parlors and hotels in the midtown area used by prostitutes.

title: Retaliation Hinted in Slaying of a Black
description: FAIRFAX, S. C., Dec. 10 The 1970 shotgun slaying of an 18yearold black youth has attracted new interest here after reports that it may have been a random ambush in re taliation for the wounding of a white man.

title: 2 Soviet ABlasts Recorded
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Dec. 10 (AP)Two underground nuclear tests within 11 seconds in the Semipalatinsk nucleartesting area in Siberia were recorded here early today by the Seis mologic Institute of Uppsala. The second blast, registering 7 on the Richter scale, was one of the strongest recorded in re cent years.

title: British Soldier Killed in Belfast Handling Rocket Found in Street
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 10 (UPI)A rocket found in a Belfast street by a patrol blew up inside an army post today, killing a sergeant and wounding two soldiers, one of them seriously, a military spokesman said.

title: FILIPINO ASSAILANT WAS SHY ENGINEER
description: MANILA, Dec. 10 (UPI)  The Philippine Government to day officially identified the man who attacked President Ferdinand E. Marcos's wife, Imelda, as a shy geodetic engineer who apparently was out to kill President Marcos.

title: Rangers Beat Islanders 2d Straight Time, 4 to 1
description: Peter McDuffe, who knows what being a fifth wheel is like, finally got his chance last night to play for the Rangers.

title: Soviet Repression Leaves The Dissidents in Disarray
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10As the Soviet Union has moved toward improved relations with the West this year, its secret police have mounted a determined cam paign of repression against the domestic dissident movement that has left some dissenters feeling weaker, more vulner able and more on the defensive than at any other time since the midnineteensixties.

title: Andrew Tisch And Miss Fiat Married Here
description: Miss Susan Ellen Hiat, daughter of the Rev. Dr. Philip fiat, spiritual leader of Mount Neboh Congrega tion, and Mrs. Hiat of New York, was married here yes terday evening to Andrew H. Tisch. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Laurence A. Tisch of Scarsdale, N. Y. Mr. Tisch's father is chairman and chief executive officer of the Loews Corporation.

title: TRADE BILL BACKED IN ADMINISTRATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A new kind of trade legislation, including a system of safe guards for industries and workers damaged, by steeply rising imports, has strong backing within the Administra tion.

title: TRADE BILL BACKED IN ADMINISTRATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A new kind of trade legislation, including a system of safe guards for industries and workers damaged by steeply rising imports, has strong backing within the Administra tion.

title: Drive to Pacify Southern Philippine Moslems Is Begun
description: MANILA, Dec. 10 A new effort began here this weekend to settle without further blood shed the problem of dissidence among the three million Fili pino Moslems of western Min danao and the Sulu archipel ago.

title: Target Area Might Yield Oldest Rocks Yet Studied
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10 The area of tomorrow's moon land ing is a museum selected to of fer a maximum number of re vealing exhibits including what scientists hope will prove to be the oldest rocks ever brought into a laboratory.

title: New Jersey Notes
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 10A history and status re port on birds introduced in New Jersey by nostalgic im migrants has been prepared by Dr. Charles F. Leck, as sistant professor in the De partment of Zoology of Rut gers University.

title: Admiral to Testify Today
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 10 (UPI) Adm. Bernard Clarey, Com mander in Chief of the United States Pacific Fleet, will lead off testimony tomorrow before a Congressional subcommittee investigating racial conflict on two Navy aircraft carriers. Ad miral Clarey, who has ultimate authority for all vessels in the Pacific, including the carriers Kitty Hawk and Constellation, was expected to be asked about misunderstandings that the committee head said appeared responsible for rioting aboard the Kitty Hawk in October.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 16 editorial Subs and SALT suggests that the coming stra tegic arms limitation talks (SALT) should strive for an agreement permit ting each side to deploy a specified number of nuclear submarines in cer tain waters, thus providing a cheaper and more dependable nuclear deter rent than exists at present.

title: Kennedy Seeking Curb
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Dec. 10 (UPI)  A motion by Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Demo crat of Massachusetts, to block construction of homes near his Squaw Island summer residence is to be heard in Barnstable Superior Court tomorrow. Sen ator Kennedy and other resi dents want to block the con struction of four homes, planned by Thomas Callahan, an attorney, and William Cur ley, a real estate broker, both of Marlboro.

title: Businessmen Oppose Proposal To Require Profit Projections
description: A survey of American busi ness leaders, released here yesterday, disclosed that four out of five top executives would be opposed to a decision of the Securities and Exchange Commission that companies be required to tell investors how much money they expected to earn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: According to recently reported disclosures by Ladislas Farago in The London Daily Express and re printed in United States newspapers, it appears that history may again be subverted to the cause of sensational ism. I refer to Farago's claim that Martin Bormann arranged for trans shipment from Germany to Argentina of a treasure for his personal account which amounted to $200 million. Al legedly, the loot was sent by German surface ship and submarine, naturally without the knowledge of Hitler.

title: Randolph Leads a Complete Messiah
description: The performance of Handel's Messiah by the Masterwork Chorus and Orchestra at Phil harmonic Hall yesterday after noon went at that splendid work in an essentially Victor ian way, with chorus of more than 200 voices, but it steered clear of the worst excesses of the hearty roastbeef style.

title: 4 Israelis Accused as Spies for Syria
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 10Four Israeli Jews have been accused of being members of a Syrian espionage and sabotage ring operating in Israel, it was an nounced here today. The sus pects were among 21 people who were rounded up by the police last week.

title: Coffee Nations Stop Clock
description: LONDON, Dec. 10 (UPI) Members of the 62nation Inter national Coffee Organization worked past their midnight deadline tonight for fixing a formula to market the com modity during the last nine months of the coffee year. The I.C.O. council stopped the clock at 11:50 P.M., then took under consideration a lastminute pro posal by 16 consumer nations that would establish a quota of 33.4 million bags for the three quarters beginning Jan. 1.

title: Peronist Candidate Slain
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 10 (Reuters)  Dr. Francisco Vic torino Ripoll, Peronist candi date for Governor in the north ern province of Misiones in elections next March, was shot to death today after an argu ment by a member of the local party leadership, the national press agency Telam reported.

title: Arthur C. Wheeler Dead; Connecticut Realty Man
description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 10 Arthur C. Wheeler, former man ufacturer and real estate man, died Friday while visiting in San Diego, Calif. His age was 78.

title: Port Notes
description: Computers are being put to work in an effort to make a dent in the $6.5billion it costs the American transpor tation industry a year for its paper work.

title: 115 Explore Library Behind the Lions
description: Ann Kandel, a Queens school librarian in gray pants and a red turtleneck, looked up yes terday at the great bronze chandeliers and the carved, tar nishedgold ceiling of the New York Public Library's main reading room.

title: Navy May Scrap Ship That Struck U.S. Mines
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The destroyer War rington, which was damaged by American mines off North Vietnam last July 17, may be scrapped, the Navy said to day.

title: Miss Ning Wed to A. P. Brody
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 10 Miss Pauline Ning, a senior chemist in chemical evalua tion for the Xerox Corpora tion here, was married this afternoon to Dr. Adrian Parker Brody, a member of Xerox's research depart ment.

title: MONEY MARKETS SEE HIGHER RATES
description: The prospect of higher inter est rates confronts the nation's money markets this week.

title: James Nicholson, Producer Of Movies for TeenAgers
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 (AP) James H. Nicholson, who pro duced dozens of movies for teenage audiences, died at the U.C.L.A. Medical Center today, in the aftermath of surgery for a brain tumor in October. He was 56 years old.

title: TANAKA'S PARTY WINS DECISIVELY IN JAPANESE VOTE
description: TOKYO, Monday, Dec. 11 Premier Kakuei Tanaka's Lib eralDemocratic party has been returned to power with a solid, although unspectacular, victory in nationwide elections.

title: Maltz Offers Funds to Solzhenitsyn
description: Albert Maltz, the screen writer convicted in the 1950's for refusing to say before a Congressional committee whether he was a Commu nist, has offered to turn over his considerable royalties in the Soviet Union to Aleks andr I. Solzhenitsyn, the banned Russian novelist who is reportedly in financial dif ficulties.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Columbia Broadcasting System, struck six weeks ago by technicians, reported today that cables used to televise football games from Candlestick Park had been cut. The network said that the damage had been repaired in time to televise today's key Atlanta FalconsSan Francisco 49ers game in the National Football League.

title: Ashkenazy Traces Life Of Scriabin Musically
description: In working up a program of music by Alexander Scri abin, Vladimir Ashkenazy decided to give a cross sec tion of the composer's work, and to give it chronological ly. This was a good idea. There has been a major Scri abin renaissance in the last few years, but most attention has been focussed on the problematic, mystical late works. The earlier works, with their pronounced influ ence of Chopin, are by and large neglected.

title: Black Minister Released On Bail in North Carolina
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Dec. 10 (AP) The Rev. Ben Chavis, a black activist, has been released from North Carolina's Central Prison under $50,000 bond, pending appeal of his conviction on charges stemming from racial violence last year in Wilming ton, N.C.

title: Thousands Finding Meditation Eases Stress of Living
description: William E. Hickey is a 32 yearold executive vice presi dent of a small manufactur ing company in Bloomfield, Conn. Every morning he awakes at 6:30, props him self up on his bed and spends 20 minutes letting his mind dwell on a meaningless sound known as a mantra.

title: Camden to Seek State Aid To Ward Off Bankruptcy
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 10  If Newark carries out its de clared intention to ask the new session of the New Jersey Leg islature for financial help to avert bankruptcy, it will not be alone.

title: Thousands Finding Meditation Eases Stress of Living
description: William E. Hickey is a 32 yearold executive vice presi dent of a small manufactur ing company in Bloomfield, Conn. Every morning he awakes at 6:30, props him self up on his bed and spends 20 minutes letting his mind dwell on a meaningless sound known as a mantra.

title: New Policy Will Seek More Women as Yalies
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 10  Yale University announced today a recruitment policy that will eventually achieve a threetotwo ratio of men to women in its undergradu ate college.

title: Shubert Empire Fighting a Financial Crisis
description: The coasttocoast Shubert empire, for decades the most powerful force in the nation's legitimate theater, is trying to fight its way out of a crisis that may greatly alter show business along Broadway and throughout the country.

title: Advertising: Life Magazine's PostMortem
description: It was like watching an old uncle succumb, inevi table but shocking and sad when the end comes, said John E. O'Toole, president of Foote, Cone & Belding, commenting on the demise of Life magazine.

title: Mrs. Court Turns Back Miss Goolagong, 63, 62
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Mrs. Margaret Court took only 50 minutes to crush Evonne Goolagong, 63, 62, in the final of the West Australian tennis championship today. The top prize was $720.

title: Dolphins Top Giants, 2313, for No. 13
description: The Miami Dolphins, created only seven years ago as an ex pansion team in an expansion league, tied a 38yearold Na tional Football League record yesterday by making their wonlost record 130 with a 2313 victory over the New York Giants at Yankee Stadium.

title: German Booters Post 40 Victory Over Ukrainians
description: By beating Clarkstown, 41, last week and losing, 40, to the GermanHungari ans yesterday, the New York Ukrainians have proved themselves the most incon sistent team in the German American Soccer League.

title: MRS. GUY E. NOYES
description: Mrs. Patricia Hartnett Noyes, wife of Guy E. Noyes, a senior vice president and chief econo mist of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, died Saturday in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 55 years old and lived at 200 East End Avenue.

title: ENEMY ATTACKS DECLINE IN SOUTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Dec. 11 (AP)Enemy attacks across South Vietnam declined sharply, the Saigon command reported yesterday.

title: Lyle Stops Middleton in 3d
description: DENVER, Dec. 10 (UPI} Undefeated Ron Lyle of Denver knocked out the fourthrated heavyweight, Larry Middleton of Baltimore, in the third round last night. It was Lyle's 19th victory and his 11th straight by a knockout. Middleton suf fered his third loss against 20 victories and a draw.

title: Food After Splashdown
description: ABOARD THE U.S.S. TICON DEROGA, in the Pacific, Dec. 10 (UPI)Nutritionists who will cook for the Apollo 17 Astro nauts after they return to earth say they will get ordinary Food, like filet or prime rib, said Dr. Charles K. La Pinta, who heads the space agency's medical team from Houston for the Dec. 19 splashdown.

title: Soviet Arrests 3 Protesters
description: ROME, Dec. 10 (AP)Three foreign demonstrators from Eu rope distributing humanrights leaflets in Red Square in Mos cow were arrested by the So viet police, an Italian organiza tion announced tonight.

title: BARRY SCORES 36 AS WARRIORS WIN
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 10 (AP) Rick Barry, who scored all 36 of his points in the last three quarters, hit two foul shots in the closing minute to give the Golden State Warriors a 103 100 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight in a National Basketball Association contest.

title: Engineer Heads Tolstoy Fund
description: The election of Plato Maloze moff as chairman of the board of directors of Tolstoy Foun dation, a charitable organiza tion, was announced yesterday at the foundation's annual meeting at its headquarters, 250 West 57th Street. Mr. Malozemoff, a mining and metallurgical engineer, is presi dent and chairman of the Newmont Mining Corporation.

title: 3 Jazz Styles Give A Colorful Pattern To Bill at Beacon
description: Three contemporary strains of jazz were woven together in a concert Saturday evening at the Beacon Theater, Broadway at 74th Street.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 10Lieut. Edward Lee Kerr, Mayor Ken neth A. Gibson's choice to be this city's first black Police Director, showed up at the West District station house at 7 A.M. today in the chilly rain to work his eighthour shift.

title: GEORGE V. HOLTON, MOBIL CHAIRMAN
description: George V. Holton, formerly chairman of the Mobil Oil Cor poration and president of the Commerce and Industry Asso ciation of New York, died yes terday of heart failure at Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital in Haniwer, N.H. He was 82 years old.

title: Father and Son Enlist In Jersey National Guard
description: BURLINGTON CITY, N. J., Dec. 10 (AP)  A man who was discharged from the Army in 1955 after eight years of service enlisted in the New Jersey National Guard today along with his son.

title: Border Clash Reported
description: Chinese intruders killed five Soviet soldiers in a bor der clash last month, accord ing to a confidential Soviet document that was described yesterday by Western diplo mats in Moscow. Page 7.

title: EUROPEANS LOOK TO U.S. INVESTING
description: PARIS, Dec. 10The Miche lin Tire Company, which has just announced a $200million investment in the United States, is not alone among the Euro pean companies that want to set up American production facilities, now that the dollar is healthier.

title: Doll Devotees Make History Come Alive
description: For doll collectors, doll makers, doll menders and doll curators, make be lieve and reality merge in the flutter of fake lashes, the pursing of painted lips.

title: Scribner Rejects Plan to Keep Tilden Pupils From District 18
description: Harvey B. Scribner, chancel lor of the city school system, said last night that he would not permit minoritygroup pupils from the Tilden Houses project in Brooklyn to be ex cluded eventually from junior high schools in Canarsie and in East Flatbush, as the local board for that Brooklyn dis trict has proposed.

title: 11 Nobel Laureates Get Medals and Checks for $100,000
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 10 (UPI) To the blare of trumpets, eight Americans, two Britons and a West German author re ceived 1972 Nobel Prizes today from Crown Prince Carl Gustaf of Sweden.

title: The Forgotten People
description: LA BELLE, Fla.I haven't written in quite a while, but I have been wait ing to see if things would improve here. I am sorry to say things have changed very little; there is less work here than ever before.

title: HAPPY IS VICTOR AT MIDDLE ISLAND
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L.I., Dec. 10Ann Snyder, one of the leading junior riders of the country three years ago, re turned to the show ring today and rode Happy to the regular working hunter championship at the Middle Island horse show. The event was held at the Mid Island arena.

title: NEW TACK IS TRIED TO HELP 8TH AVE.
description: There was a time, according to Paul Bitetzakis, when you could drop a nail off the roof above his Acropolis restaurant at the corner of Eighth Avenue and 47th Street, and it would never hit the sidewalk.

title: Ozark Editor's Attacks Arouse Fear and Anger
description: CAVE CITY, Ark.Joseph Harry Weston, 61 years old, is a oneman terrorist band. His weapon is a weekly news paper, and he runs it on the creed that all the outrage he can muster is fit to print.

title: SAMUEL I. OHRINGER OF CRIMINAL COURT
description: Samuel J. Ohringer, who re tired as a judge of the New York City Criminal Court last year, died yesterday in St. John's Hospital, Elmhurst, Queens, after surgery. He was 68 years old and lived at. 611 West 239th Street, the Bronx.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Union democracy is a stranger throughout the ranks of organized labor, not just in the United Mine Workers union as your editorial of Nov. 30 states. Dictatorial control is so pervasive that what few changes take place are usually the result of palace revolt among incumbent lead ers. The unseating of David McDonald by I. W. Abel in 1965 was one in stance, as was the Yablonski chal lenge in the miners' union.

title: Dunk Wins in New Zealand
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 10 (AP)Bill Dunk of Aus tralia won the $12,000 Caltex golf tournament today with a finalround 66 for a total of 273.

title: CLASH REPORTED ON SOVIET BORDER
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10Western diplomats said tonight that a confidential Soviet document reported that Chinese intruders killed five Soviet soldiers last month. This was the first report of a clash along the Chinese Soviet border since 1969.

title: NORBERT D. WOODS
description: SCOTCH PLAINS, N. J., Dec. 10Norbert D. Woods, execu tive vice president of Keefe, Bruyette & Woods. Inc., New York, bank securities special ists, died today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 53 years old.

title: EDWARD A. MALANEY
description: Edward A. Malaney, vice president of the New York of fice of James T. Barnes & Co., mortgage bankers, died Satur day at his home, Chatsworth Garden Apartments in Larch mont, N. Y. His age was 67.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A clincher may be added to Anthony Lewis' Nov. 27 column criticizing Daniel Bell's thesis supporting meri tocracy.

title: LITTON'S MEETING MARKED BY GLOOM
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Dec. 10When last year's annual meeting of Litton Industries ad journed there was at least one stockholder who had not been given a promised chance to be heard.

title: Theater: Phoenix Revives The Great God Brown
description: We are grown so used to Eugene O'Neill as an excava tor of his past and so aware of the heightened naturalism of his final plays, that we forget that quite a lot of his playsespecially during the twentieswere avowedly ex perimental. One of the most famous plays of this style is The Great God Brown, Which was chosen to open a repertory season by the New Phoenix Repertory Company now again luckily reborn it the Lyceum Theater last night.

title: The 61st Neediest Cases Appeal Starts With $331,146 on Hand
Parent and Mrs. Courson Victors in Veterans Dance
description: Mrs. Dixie Courson of West New York, N. J., and Don Par ent of New York City took time out from their service duties at the North Atlantic figure skat ing championships yesterday to win the final event, the veter ans dance, at the Sky Rink.

title: Nixon Hails Ripon Society
description: BOSTON, Dec. 10 (AP)The liberal Republican Ripon Society has received the congratulations of President Nixon on the or ganization's 10th anniversary. A telegram from the President was read at the group's anni versary dinner last night.

title: Sabres Defeat Canadiens
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 10 (AP)Jim Lorentz and Rick Martin scored in the third period tonight, carrying the Buffalo Sabres to a 42 victory over the Montreal Canadiens. The triumph gave Dave Dryden, the Sabres' goalie, his first N.H.L. victory over his younger brother, Ken, who was in the nets for Montreal.

title: 6% Rise in G.N.P. Seen
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (AP)The Ford executives also said they saw no sign of a slowing in economic recovery in the United States and that they ex pected the gross national pro duct to show a real gain of about 6 per cent next year.

title: Pope Asks Prayer for Peacel
description: ROME, Dec. 10 (UPI)Pope Paul VI today appealed to Christians everywhere to offer a special prayer at Christmas for peace in Vietnam. Christ mas is the day of the declara tion of peace on earth, he said in his weekly noon blessing in St. Peter's Square. Will we have it at least in Vietnam? Or is it still far off?

title: Six Top H.D.A. Officials Out in Agency ShakeUp
description: In a major shakeup of his agency, the city's Housing and Development Administrator an nounced yesterday the resigna tions of five top officials, the dismissal of another, the promo tion of four executives and the appointment of four others, in cluding a new chief investigator with a mandate to root out corruption.

title: Kitty Segal Marries
description: Miss Kitty Segal, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Segal of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Stuart Sugarman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman Sugarman of Brooklyn. Rabbi Edward Sandrow performed the cere mony at the Hampshire House. Mr. Sugarman, a grad uate of City College, is computer engineer with the Brooklyn Union Gas Com pany.

title: Test on Terrorism
description: The United Nations faces another critical test of cred ibility today when the Sixth (Legal) Committee is ex pected to vote on proposals for curbing international terrorism.

title: Advertising:
description: Benton & Bowles has been named to do broadcast ad vertising for Robert Hall Clothes.

title: Author Terms Argentine's Statements On Bormann False in Their Entirety
description: The author Ladislas Farago said in an interview yesterday that statements by an Argen tine, Juan Jose Velasco, casting doubt on his recent report that Martin Bormann had been found alive were false in their entirety.

title: Moscow And The Moon
description: Apollo 17 ends for the foreseeable future the era of intensive American preoccupation with lunar exploration. This country has no firm plans for sending either manned or unmanned rockets to the moon. NASA's lunar planning after Apollo 17 focuses pri marily on further study of the rocks Apollo crews have brought back, as well as following the reports radioed back by instruments placed on the moon by astronauts.

title: Day Care Centers For Elderly Offer Many Advantages
description: WASHINGTONIn a pleasant white frame house in Bethesda, Md., a handful of senior citizens gathers every day around the living room fireplace to play games, work at crafts, nibble on snacks. Or just to wander around.

title: Swimmer Crosses Bay
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10 (UPI)Kenneth Crutchlow, 28 years old, swam from Alcatraz Island to San Francisco today in 35 degree weather to publicize his forthcoming attempt to set a record for a running, swim ming and biking trip from Lon don to Dundee, Scotland.

title: 6TH LANDING NEAR
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10Apollo 17 rocketed into an orbit of the moon today and was set for the sixth landing of men on the earth's desolate satellite world.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Dr. Kenneth Clark's about face on decentralization (news story Nov. 30) represents an unfair impatience and a familiar but regrettable lack of stay ing power. The centralized bureauc racies have had many decades to prove that their inefficiency is impregnable against all attempted improvements with inevitable rapidly increasing costs.

title: ExMadison Player Scores 42 in College
description: Jim (The Fly) Williams, a 19yearold freshman at Austin Peay of the Ohio Val ley Conference, projected himself into national prom inence Saturday night with a 42point performance in his team's 10742 rout of Pan American at Clarksville, Tenn.

title: Fighting Saints Win
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Dec. 10 (AP)The Minnesota Fighting Saints scored a 43 overtime victory over the Cleveland Cru saders in a W.H.A. game to night. Ted Hampson's winning shot came on a rebound of an attempt by Bob MacMillan that the Cleveland goalie, Bob Whidden, had kicked out to his right.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: DALLAS, Dec. 10 (UPI)Successful knee surgery was conducted last night on Dallas's linebacker, Chuck Howley, who was injured during the Cowboys' 3424 victory earlier in the day over Washington. Howley tore ligaments and cartilege in his left knee when he was hit on a block during the third quarter.

title: Running Attack and Viking Errors Spur 23to7 Victory
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 10  On a cold afternoon in Minnesota the Vikings lost their cool in the second half while the Green Bay Packers did not. The result, a 237 victory for the Packers, changed the power structure in the National Foot ball League as Green Bay re placed Minnesota as the top team in the Central Division of the National Conference.

title: Prostitution in a Luxury Midtown Apartment Building Stirs Tenant Revolt and Court Action by the City
description: Tim Boxer, a showbusiness photographer, recalled being ac costed by a prostitute who solicited him a few doors away from his own apartment in a corridor of the luxury apart ment building where he lives.

title: BRONZEAGE CITY IS FOUND IN IRAN
description: Dispatch of The Times, London

title: Very Little Hope Is Seen For Early L.I.R.R. Pact
description: The head of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said yesterday that he saw very little hope for service in the immediate future on the struck Long Island Rail Road.

title: Very Little Hope Is Seen For Early L.I.R.R. Pact
description: The head of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said yesterday that he saw very little hope for service in the immediate future on the struck Long Island Rail Road.

title: Students' Voice
description: The threatened demise of The Columbia Daily Spectator ought not be shrugged off as the curtailment of just another extracurricular activity. The nation's leading undergraduate newspapers have combined the functions of training ground for future journalists and forum for the expression of student opinion. These publications provide faculty, administration and outside community with a barometer of the student mood.

title: Radziwills to Be Divorced After 14 Years' Marriage
description: Prince Stanislas Radzwill confirmed last night reports that he and his wife, Lee, sis ter of Mrs. Aristotle Onassis, are ending their marriage of 14 years.

title: Steelers Win and Gain Playoffs for First Time
A Touch of Home Abroad
description: No message is more impor tant to those in the service away from home than one that says they are missed, loved and not forgotten. This year the Unit ed Service Or ganizations are celebrating their 31st anniversary, and they continue to provide a touch of home to mem bers of the armed forces in distant lands.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: May I refer to your news story of Nov. 18: Steady streams of opium and hashish flow over the unpatrolled and porous borders of Afghanistan, aided by a largely indifferent Gov ernment and many of its officials and employes.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Heckscher Reports Arson Damage

title: FRANCIS M. BASIL
description: Francis M. Basil, son of Frank M. Basil, former pres ident of the New York Racing Association and currently its financial adviser, died yester day of a heart attack. He was 42 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Dec. 4 editorial on America's selfdisenfranchised voters partially answers the question of who these dropouts from the democratic proc ess are.

title: City Is Rich in Colorful Political History
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10When Father Jacques Marquette, the Jesuit missionary and explorer, came to these shores to preach among the Indians in the winter and spring of 1675, the area's first bootlegger, Pierre (The Mole) Moreau, already had a thriving business.

title: '72 Dolphins Tie '34 Bears
description: By winning yesterday, the Miami Dolphins tied the 1934 Chicago Bears' record of 13 consecutive victories from the start of the season. However, the Bears actually won 17 consecutive regularseason games, counting their last four regular games in 1933, the year they defeated the New York Giants, 2321, in the league title game. They lost to New York, 3013, in the 1934 title game.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: It is the old story about the landlord knocking and the impecunious tenant who is about to be sent out into the cold, and it may even ?? the kindly rescuer arriving in the nick of time with the rent. But that de pends upon public response to a jazz ballet.

title: Psychoanalysts Urged to Widen Role in Easing Urban Problems
description: The American Academy of Psychoanalygis urged its mem bers yesterday to play a wider, vital role in alleviating such urban problems as ad diction to drugs, drinking and gamblingpersonal and social problems, the academy said, that psychoanalysts have not fully concentrated upon.

title: Saigon Reign of Terror Doubted
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 7Despite daily assertions by the Communists that the Saigon Government is planning a campaign of mass arrests and assassination of political prison ers, a series of interviews with sources in close touch with the national police as well as with Vietnamese opposition political figures has disclosed no evi dence to support the charges.

title: Lakers 137101 Victors
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 (AP) Jim McMillian and Gail Goodrich led a blistering at tack as the Los Angeles Lakers clobbered the Portland Trail Blazers, 137101, tonight.

title: Sonics on Top by 110102
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 10 (AP)Bud Stallworth and Spencer Hay wood combined for 53 points to lead the Seattle SuperSonics to a 110102 victory over the Phoe nix Suns tonight.

title: Parsons Rites Wednesday
description: There will be a requiem mass on Wednesday for Louella Par sons, the retired film gossip columnist who died on Satur day, in the Roman Catholic Church of the Good Shepherd in Beverly Hills, Calif. Miss Parsons, who used the name of her first husband who died in 1911, was the widow of Dr. Harry Martin, a physician for the 20th CenturyFox studio, who died in 1951.

title: That New Streak Is Vanderbilt
description: Vanderbilt, unranked and for gotten in the preseason polls, and Jan van Breda Kolff have gained early national college basketball prominence. The Commodores have won five straight games, including two on the road against Louisville and Kansas. The streak could grow even larger before the Commodores get involved in the tough Southeastern Con ference race against Tennessee, Alabama, Georgia and Ken tucky, the principal contenders.

title: San Francisco Gets Western Lead With 1 Game to Play
Books of The Times
description: Do children even care about pictorial excellence in the books they look at? I sometimes wonderespecially on the oc casions when my 3yearold becomes insep arably attached to the most visually trite books available to her. The presence of familiar objects and the ritual of repeating stories seem the only criteria that matter to small children, and there is really no use trying to explain to them the wonders of Maurice Sendak, Arthur Rackham, or Wilhelm Busch. Nevertheless, since it is still the grown ups who do the buying  here is a roundup in no particular order of what struck me as the best children's picture books to be published this year. (By picture books I suppose I mean books in which the illustrations seem at least as important as the text. A forthcoming col umn will cover the best of the children's books that depend primarily on words to tell their stories.)

title: TANAKA'S PARTY WINS DECISIVELY IN JAPANESE VOTE
description: TOKYO, Monday, Dec. 11 Premier Kakuei Tanaka's Lib eralDemocratic party has been returned to power with a solid, although unspectacular, victory in nationwide elections.

title: Archibald Scores 41
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 10 (AP) Nate Archibald scored 41 points as the Kansas City Omaha Kings broke a four game losing streak with a 130115 triumph over the At lanta Hawks tonight. The total was a season high for the Kings. Lou Hudson scored 43 for Atlanta.

title: Pasarell Is Victor Over Gonzales In Tourney Final Here, 46, 62, 62
description: With his legs unable to sum mon the instant movement that had characteized his earlier tennis tournament vic tories, Richard (Pancho) Gon zales bowed to topseeded Charles Pasarell yesterday in the final of the $75,000 Clean Air Classic, 46, 62, 62.

title: Essen Concern Gets Expert as Adviser
description: BONN, Dec. 10Fried, Krupp, Gmbh, the vast and renowned West German concern based in Essen, is apparently having financial and leadership trou bles again, for the second time in six years.

title: Border Clash Reported
description: Chinese intruders killed five Soviet soldiers in a bor der clash last month, accord ing to a confidential Soviet document that was described yesterday by Western diplo mats in Moscow. Page 10.

title: Standings in Tourney
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 10 (UPI)Standings after the incomplete 15th and final round:

title: News Analysis
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10  Immo bilized on the left by Governor Cahill's liberal Republican rec ord and inspired by what they perceive as a conservative swing in New Jersey, a number of potential Democratic candi dates for Governor have begun a race to the right for their party's nomination in the June Democratic guber natorial primary election. However, a proliferation of conservatively minded Democrats does not necessarily mean that the nominee will ultimately emerge from the party's right wing.

title: Portisch, Petrosian and Karpov Tie for First in Chess Tourney
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 10 (AP)  Two Soviet grandmas ters, Tigran Petrosian and Ana toly Karpov, whisked through draws with their opponents to day and settled for a threeway lie for first place with Hun gary's driving Laior Portisch in the final standings of the Church's Fried Chicken inter national chess tournament.

title: Camden, Like Newark, to Seek State Aid to Avert Bankruptcy
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 10  If Newark carries out its de clared intention to ask the new session of the New Jersey Leg islature for financial help to avert bankruptcy, it will not be alone.

title: Library Demolition Begun
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10 (AP)  Workmen have begun de molishing the remains of Tem ple University's law library, which was ruined by fire in July. The blaze destroyed about 200,000 books.

title: Bombers Skate to Victory
description: Charley O'Connell led the San Francisco Bay Bombers to a 4644 victory over the Chiefs in a Roller Derby game at Madi son Square Garden yesterday. Tony Roman scored 14 points for the winners. The Chiefs, the New York area team, took an early lead but the Bombers went ahead in the sixth period. Mike Gammon, the Chief high scorer, was held to 9 points. Attendance was 11,398.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Hanoi Adamant, Lam Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Dec. 11 (AP)Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam said to day that North Vietnam was insisting that its troops remain in South Vietnam after a cease fire. He did not rule out the possibility of the United States and Hanoi signing a ceasefire lagreement without Saigon's concurrence, but he said: It's hard to believe there will be a separate settlement.

title: Levitt Says City School Board Broke Law in $1.2Million Deals With Company ExEmploye Had Joined
description: State Controller Arthur Lev itt charged the City's Board of Education yesterday with a variety of legal violations, in cluding conflict of interest, while paying $1.2million in three years to a computer com pany processing certain pay rolls.

title: MRS. ANDREW BURDEN
description: Mrs. Meta Craig Paumgarten Burden, wife of Andrew White Burden, active in the develop ment of Aspen, Colo., was killed by an avalanche there on Friday while skiing. She was 32 years old.

title: Hawks Take over First
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (AP)  The Chicago Black Hawks took over first place in the West Division with a 51 victory over the Minnesota North Stars to night.

title: Screen: Fun and Gadgetry of Sleuth
description: Andrew Wyke (Laurence Olivier), the rich, snobbish author of mystery fiction that has apparently outsold both S.S. Van Dine and Agatha Christie, strides about the study of his magnificent 16thcentury English coun try house, sounding an inex haustible supply of rolled r's and s's so sibilant they could cut tunnels through fog. Listening to him with some amazement is Milo Tindle (Michael Caine), the owner of two beauty shops, a man who, not long ago, was him self giving perms, and who is the current lover of An drew's wife, Marguerite.

title: Blue Collar, White Collar: I
description: Carl Dorian is a young apprentice electrician. Quiet and recently married, he feels his life has no great drama in it. In trade school he did well enough to know his craft but was not out standing. Outside of school he made friends with a group whose members still see each other and still all live in the Charlestown district of Boston where they grew up.

title: EARTHPOWER USE PUSHED BY HICKEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  Forecasting that a whole new energy frontier lies before us, former Interior Secretary Wal ter J. Hickel has proposed that the United States invest $684.7 million in a 10year research and development program on geothermal energy.

title: News Analysis
description: Toward the end of a two week strike hi 1967 against the Columbia Broadcasting System and the other major networks, the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) called on other unions in broadcasting to lend the per formers' union active support by honoring AFTRA picketlines. Among unions quick with wholehearted re sponse was Local 1212 of the Radio and Television Broadcast Engineers, Interna tional Brotherhood of Electri cal Workers. AFTRA pledged reciprocity for the favor.

title: Barracks Burns in Germany
description: NEU ULM West Germany, Dec. 10 (AP)A United States Army barracks burned down in this southern German town this morning as West German firemen waited 20 minutes to answer the alarm, policemen reported. The firemen were re luctant to answer the alarm because of an incident last August in which about 50 soldiers injured a German fire fighter, the police added. The firemen then were attacked with stones, bottles and iron bars.

title: KISSINGER'S AIDE TALKS WITH NIXON ON TRUCE PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  President Nixon conferred for 75 minutes today with Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., key aide to Henry A. Kissinger at the secret Paris talks with the North Vietnamese. But the White House continued to pro vide no information on how close the two sides had come to concluding an Indochina settlement.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Arculeo Seeking To Head Minority

title: Christmas Eve Mass Set in Peking Church
description: PEKING, Dec. 10 (Agence FrancePresse)  A midnight mass is to be celebrated here on Christmas Eve for the first time since the Cultural Rev olution of the nineteensix ties.

title: Personal Finance
description: The United States Govern ment, applying some of the hoopla of a patent medicine peddler, is auctioning some 2.3 million oldtime silver dollars, and some coin deal ers contend the public is be ing duped.

title: Bridg: Discussion of Bidding Helps In Avoiding Many Ambiguities
description: Regular partners who take the trouble to discuss their bidding procedures have a good chance of avoiding the many ambiguities that can arise in standard methods. Consider, for example, the plight of the player who raises his strange partner from one of a suit to two, and then hears a bid of three in the same suit. Is this an invitation to bid game? Or a mild preemptive action aimed at keeping the opposi tion out of the bidding?

title: Police as Provocateurs
description: The use of attractive policewomen to encourage over tures by male patrons may be the stuff that titillates viewers of television copoperas. Applied to the streets of New York, however, the practice is an abuse of police power and, if not an outright violation of the Statutes, then at least clearly an affront to the spirit of the laws.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Margot Johnson has arrowstraight brows, a strong profile and centerparted dark hair. People are always asking her if she has American Indian blood, particularly when she wears her beaded braid ornaments to parties. Actually, her ancestry is Icelandic, but when she was growing up in North Da kota, she invariably found herself cast as the Indian in her playmates' games.

title: Young Man and Woman Die In Car From Asphyxiation
description: The bodies or a young man and a young woman who had died of asphyxiation during the night were found at 8:30 yes terday morning in the Verra zanno parking field beneath the Verrazano Bridge, alongside the Belt Parkway in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. The discovery was made during a routine check of the field by a cruising police car.

title: Report Urges Continued Work On Nonatomic Energy Sources
description: A staff report to the state's Public Service Commission warns that nuclear energy is not the answer to all our prob lems and urges the develop ment of nonatomic sources of electrical energy to meet the present shortage.

title: Truman Taken Off Critical List, but Weak Heart Keeps Condition Serious
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 10 Former President Harry S. Truman was taken off the crit ical list today after a fiveday bout with lung congestion, but a weakened heart kept him in serious condition.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: VENICE, Italy. Dec. 19 Thieves broke into the cathe dral of Castelfranco Veneto, northwest of here, last night and stole Giorgione's paint ing The Madonna With SS. Liberalis and Francis. The disappearance of the cele brated workone of the few attributed with certainty to Giorgione and believed to date from 1504.caused con sternation throughout Italy.

title: Batsheva Dancers Offer Work From a JetAge Choreographer
description: An admirable and unusual aspect of the current repertory of Israel's Batsheva Dance Com pany is its inclusion of works by both unknown company members and internationally rdcognized choreographers. Yet it would be a shame for Bat sheva to become the dumping ground for the secondrate ef ?? of those with internation al reputations.

title: Unemployment Drops
description: The unemployment rate has finally moved down from the 5.5 per cent plateau where it had stood frozen for half year. The substantial reduction in joblessness re corded in November renews hope that those on the idle list will not remain shutouts in the nation's economic boom.

title: Blues Down Flames, 54
description: Atlanta, Dec. 10 (AP)Phil Roberto scored twice tonight, once in the final minute, in leading the St. Louis Blues to a 54 triumph over the Atlanta Flames. Roberto's second goal came after the Flames had pulled the goalie with 1:28 re maining and sent in a sixth forward in an attempt to over come a 43 deficit. Atlanta scored after his goal

title: DEMOCRATIC CHIEF GATHERS SUPPORT
description: Robert Strauss, the newly elected Democratic national chairman, reported yesterday that he had assurances of his acceptability to Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy, while New York State's party chairman predicted that Mr. Strauss would bring people together.

title: Shubert Empire Fights a Financial Crisis
description: The coasttocoast Shubert empire, for decades the most powerful force in the nation's legitimate theater, is trying to fight its way out of a crisis that may greatly alter show business along Broadway and throughout the country.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Robert Schwarz Strauss, the new chairman of the Demo cratic National Committee, comes out of the classic tra dition of bright, likable small town boys who made it big because they could not bear to look back. Growing up through tough times in a small town is a wonderful experi ence, his de voted younger brother, Ted, re marked today. But it spawns driving men because they have good memories and want some thing better.

title: West Virginia Race Cost $2.2Million
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 10Final expense statements show that a total of more than $2.2million was spent in the race for Governor last month in which Arch A. Moore Jr., the Republican incumbent, defeated Secretary of State John D. Rockefeller 4th, his Democratic challenger.

title: Raucous Roads
description: For the first time, New York State agencies plan to hold a public discussion on the question of reducing highway noiseincluding noise on highways already in existence. What prompted the Departments of Environ mental Conservation and of Transportation jointly to call this conference was the protest of Westchester and Putnam County residents against the intolerable screech ing and rumbling of trucks on a tenmile stretch of Route Interstate 684 between Armonk and Katonah.

title: Six Top City Housing Officials Out in Superagency ShakeUp
description: In a major shakeup of his agency, the city's Housing and Development Administrator an nounced yesterday the resigna tions of five top officials, the dismissal of another, the pro motion of four executives and the appointment of four others, including a new chief investi gator with a mandate to root out corruption.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the 60th minute of the 13th football game of his 18th season as a professional, compassion softened the flinty old heart of Earl Morrall yesterday. The Miami Dolphins had the New York Giants whipped, 2313, and were in possession 2 yards short of another touchdown with time for one last play. Massed around the hog wallow that rains had left in Yankee Stadium, 62,728 witnesses looked on moodily, waiting for the final blow to fall. All through the raw and foggy afternoon they had seen the home forces attack and fall back, attack and fall back, attack and fall back again, frus trating their own admirable efforts by giving up the ball on fumbles and interceptions.

title: MRS. CHARLOTTE BODEN
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 10  Mrs. Charlotte Meinecke Boden, a life member of the 20th Century Club of Rich mond Hill in Queens, died last night in Hempstead General Hospital after a long illness. She was 85 years old.

title: Mrs. Houghton, 72, Founded Orphanage in South France
description: Mrs. dermaine Pasquet Houghton, who with her hus band, Seymour Houghton Jr., formerly a lawyer here, oper ated an orphanage at Hyeres, on the French Mediterranean, died Friday in a hospital there. She was 72 years old.

title: Armed Robbers Take $5,000 From a Church
description: Two young men armed with a knife and a pistol forced their way into the rectory of St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Rego Park, Queens, yesterday afternoon, ordered five church workers, including a woman, to lie on the floor, then made off with $5,000 that had been donated by parishoners, the police said.

title: Sally Beckerman Bride of Lawyer
description: Miss Sally Louise Becker man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Beckerman of Philadelphia, was married here yesterday afternoon to Joseph L. Forstadt of New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman Forstadt of New York.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Marginalia: Chekhov's The Cherry Orchard has post poned its opening at the Pub lic Theater from Thursday to some time after the holidays. The New York Shakespeare Festival is producing it with a black cast.  The Fan tastics, the 13yearold mu sical that has raised the cur tain on 5,242 performances at the Sullivan Street Play house, is now raising it at 8 P.M. Tuesday through Fri day nights as of next week.  Myron Cohen, the comic raconteur, will be the host of The Grand Music Hall of Israel, when the 36mem ber company opens in the Felt Forum of Madison Square Garden on Jan. 4 for a notquitetwoweek run.

title: Nationals Overtime Victors
description: OTTAWA Dec. 10 (UPI) After 23 seconds of a sudden death overtime. Wayne Carl ton scored to give the Ottawa Nationals a 76 victory over the Quebec Nordiques in a World Hockey Association game tonight. The goal was Carlton's second of the game and the 19th of the season.

title: PATHET LAO LEADER RETURNS TO PARLEY
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 10 Gen. Phoune Sipraseuth, leader of the Pathet Lao delegation negotiating a peace settlement with the Vientiane Government, returned here tonight after an absence of eight days.

title: Inquiry by Nadjari Focuses on a Lawyer Who Boasted He Knew Corrupt Judges
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the spe cial prosecutor appointed to investigate corruption in the criminaljustice system, has begun an investigation of a lawyer who said he was close to State Supreme Court judges he indicated were corrupt, ac cording to a source close to the inquiry.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: ITT Continental Resumes Baking

title: East Bloc Travel Is Slowed By FootandMouth Disease
description: VIENNA, Dec. 10 (Reuters) An outbreak of footandmouth disease brought tourist travel on land to a virtual standstill in Eastern Europe today after some Communist countries sealed their borders.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 10 (AP)The roster of United States collegians was completed last night for the World Cup hockey tournament against the Soviet Union, Czechoslovakia and Canada.

title: Sophia Ames Boyer Dies at 65; Author of Books for Children
description: Mrs. Sophia Ripley Ames Boyer, author of books for children and the wife of Rich ard O. Boyer, a former news paperman and writer, died of leukemia yesterday in Me morial Hospital. She was 65 years old and lived at Finney Farm, CrotononHudson, N.Y.

title: Inquiry Criticizes Police In Killings at Southern U.
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 10 Members of a biracial com mission investigating the deaths of two Sbuthern University stu dents said today they dispute the official version of the inci dent that occurred last month on the school's campus.

title: Superb Marriage of Figaro by Fresh Young Voices
description: Is it possible, in a few words, to explain why the John Brownlee Opera Theater production of Mozart's The Marriage of Figaro at the Manhattan School of Music Sat urday night was the most com pletely satisfying this reviewer has ever experienced here or abroad?

title: U.S. ProfitMargin Curb Assailed by Henry Ford
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (UPI) The Ford Motor Company's chairman, Henry Ford 2d, warned over the weekend that continued reliance on a profit margin ceiling to control prices in 1973 could hold back sus tained longterm growth of the nation's economy.

title: WILLIAM E. STEWARDSON
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 10 William E. Stewardson, presi dent of the Stewardson & Dougherty Real Estate Associa tion here, died today, appar ently of a heart attack. He was 37 years old and lived at 635 Snowden Lane.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Dec. 10Al LoBalbo listens to the critics' complaints: The F.D.U. offense is as exciting as watching grass grow, like watching paint dry.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The troubles that have dis figured Ireland lately have been recorded and reported, but now, according to the Architectural League of New York they will be the sub ject of an exhibition called The Troubles: An Artist's Document of Ulster. It will open to the public at 5 P.M. tomorrow at the Finch Col lege Museum of Art, 62 East 78th Street.

title: 100 Inmates Put Up Barricades In Protest at Prison in Jersey
description: BORDENTOWN, N. J., Mon day, Dec. 11About 100 in mates of the New Jersey Correctional Institution, a me diumsecurity prison, were bar ricaded in two dormitories early this morning.

title: Mistrial Is Declared in the Ellsberg Case
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11 The trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. was officially declared a mistrial to day and the Pentagon papers case was back to arguing over jury selection.

title: Canarsie Hearing Becomes Melee As Tempers Flare on Zone Issue
description: A raucus public hearing last night on the District 18 school board's tentative proposal for rezoning three Brooklyn junior high schoolstwo in Canarsie and one in East Flatbush flared into a 10minute free forall as members of the audi ence turned on each other with flaying fists and attacked a television camera crew.

title: ENEMY HITS HARD AT LAOS POSITIONS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 11 Communist forces mounted heavy attacks on Laotian Gov ernment positions near the for ward base supporting opera tions on the Plaine des Jarres over the weekend in what may be the start of a new drive to overrun the base.

title: Pornography and Pirated Stereo Tapes Seized in Raid onMobLinked Operation
description: Pornographic films and pirated stereo tapes were seized in police raids early yesterday in Brooklyn, where two men linked by District Attorney Eu gene Gold to organized crime in New Jersey were taken into custody.

title: Elks Lose Maine Case
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 11  The State Supreme Court ruled 5 to 0 today that Elks lodges that practice racial discrimina tion may not be granted state liquor licenses.

title: Chess: Even Dirty Doubled Pawns Can Have Redeeming Value
description: Doubled pawns, that is pawns standing one behind the other on a file, constitute a weakness, although there are ways in which they can earn their keep. As Nimzo vitch pointed out more than 40 years ago, doubled pawns can often be useful defen sively. In zigzag patterns, with an adjacent pawn serv ing as the middle link, they are no easier to attack than any other trio of pawns.

title: Irina Kavalevska And Lowry Offer Joint Song Recital
description: Kenneth Wesley Lowry and Irina Kavalevska sang in a joint benefit recital Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, and both appeared most at home in idiomatically congenial repertory.

title: The Theater: Don Juan' Sparkles at the Lyceum
description: Moliere's Don Juan is comparatively little known in the Englishspeaking thea ter, which is both surprising and a pity. Perhaps its potential popularity has been damaged by the Mozart opera but whatever the rea son this is not among Mo litre's most familiar plays. All the more reason then to he grateful for the Phoenix production of the play, which last night entered the reper tory at the Lyceum Theater.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  Manufacturers' shipments of general aviation aircraft continued at a record pace in November with a 152 per cent increase in dollar value and a 71 per cent rise in units over November, 1971, the General Aviation Manufacturers Association re ported today. The association said 894 aircraft valued at 844.4million were shipped in November against 522 units worth $17.6million a year beforethe best November billing on record.

title: Space Program's Cost Is $26Billion So Far
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The United States has spent more than $26.657billion on the manned space program in the last 15 years and plans to spend about $8.85billion in the next five years, a Na tional Aeronautics and Space Administration spokesman said today.

title: City Charter Commission Told Decentralization Fails Uptown
description: City Charter Commission membeers yesterday heard the Lindsay administration's neigh borhood government experiment in upper Manhattan severely criticized as something that lo calize red tape instead of de centralizing authority.

title: MAOIST DRIVE IN U.S. REPORTED BY F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation said today that the Revolutionary Union, a coali tion of Maoist groups, was now operating in 10 states and was dedicated to destroying the Government and creating a Communist society.

title: MAYOR OF DANANG OUSTED IN SCANDAL
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Dec. 11The Mayor of Danang, Col. Nguyen Ngoc Khoi, was relieved of his duties today, a month after the South Viet namese Cabinet demanded his dismissal for his part in a refu geeaid scandal here.

title: Australian Yacht Sets Pace In Rough One Ton Sailing
description: SYDNEY, Tuesday, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  The Australian yacht Pilgrim, skippered by Graham Evans, was reported today to be leading in the world One Ton yachting cham pionship after sailing through gale during the night.

title: General Dynamics Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Supreme Court agreed today to examine the Government's claim that the General Dynamics Corpora tion's acquisition of United Electric Coal Companies illegally lessened competition.

title: Telecasts Planned Today Of Second Day on Moon
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The second lunar exploration tomorrow by Capt. Eugene A. A. Cernan of the Navy and Dr. Harrison H. Schmitt, the Apollo 17 astronauts, will be telecast to Mission Control here from 5:21 P.M. to 11:52 P.M., Eastern standard time.

title: Videocassettes for du Pont
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, Inc., announced yes terday that it had received a nonexclusive, worldwide li cense from the Sony Corpora tion granting du Pont the right to make, use and sell Sony's patented UMatic videocassettes for video recording and play back systems.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Marginalia: Fiscal 1972 was a peak exhibition period for the Whitney Museum of American Art, which notes in its justpublished annual report that it offered 33 exhi bitions between July 1, 1971, and June 30, 1972, compared with 22 the previous year.  Peter Falk and Liza Min nelli have been named Stars of the Year by the Holly wood Women's Press Club, receiving its Golden Apple awards. The club neglected however to pass out Sour Apples for the least cooper ative actor and actress this year Sol Hurok, Arthur Judson, Frederick Schange and Kurt Weinhold will be honored Sunday by the Inter national Association of Con cert and Festival Managers at its 25th annual conven tion at the New York Hilton Hotel. They will receive awards for their years of outstanding service to both the artists and public in pre senting the finest in classical companies and performers.  Jim Brown has been signed to star in I Escaped From Devil's Island, a film that Roger and Gene Corman will produce in Mexico for United Artists.

title: Brooklyn 8652 Victor
description: Brooklyn College, taking a 3218 lead at halftime, went on to trounce Pdatt Institute, 18652, last night at the winner's court.

title: 9th Prison Escapee Seized
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The ninth of the 14 convicts who escaped from the state prison at Concord during a riot the night of Nov. 21 was captured at gunpoint by state policemen at Logan International Airport Saturday. He is Francis X. Waugh, 21 years old.

title: PACT IS TERMINATED BY PAPER HANDLERS
description: Timothy Hunt, president of Paper Handlers Local No. 1, laid yesterday that his union was notifying the city's four Major daily newspapers that it was terminating its contract with them.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: About 2,400 penraised mal lard ducks will be living targets this winter in a test ing program aimed at ending the annual death toll of water fowl by lead poisoning.

title: Warning on Employe Gifts
description: The public was warned yes terday that it was a misde meanor, punishable by a maxi mum of one year in jail, to give a gift of gratuity to a city em ploye, The annual warning was issued by Nicholas Scoppetta, Investigation Commissioner. Mr. Scoppetta said it was also a violation of the law for a city employe to solicit or accept a a gift or gratuity to a city em money and other gifts, such as liquor.

title: KISSINGER MEETS THO FOR 4 HOURS
description: PARIS, Dec. 11Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho met for more than four hours today and scheduled three separate sessions for tomorrow in the negotiations for a ceasefire in Vietnam.

title: THIEU PROPOSES A HOLIDAY TRUCE, P.O.W. EXCHANGE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 12  President Nguyen Van Thieu proposed to day an indefinite truce between South and North Vietnam to begin before the Christmas holi day.

title: MRS. JULIA GROSSO
description: Mrs. Julia Amoroso Grosso, widow of Joseph Grosso, a real estate man, and mother of Mi chael B. Grosso, executive vice president of the Fifth Avenue Association, died Saturday in Syosset (L. I.) General Hospital. She was 80 years old and lived at 535 Riverdale Avenue, Yon kers.

title: Business Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 11 (AP)Four Persian Gulf oilproducing nations and major Western operators were reported to have scheduled a new round of talks in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, this week to try to overcome the last obstacle in their tentative participation agreement.

title: IN THE NATION
description: After a sufficiently stimulating lunch hour, or at practically any other time, Pat Moynihan can be one of the world's most engaging men and his is not the kind of temperament to be intimidated by the vastness and com plexity of the world East of Suez. So sending this imaginative and energetic Irishman as Ambassador to India may be the best idea President Nixon has had; Mrs. Gandhi had best look to her neutralism and her wine cellar.

title: Efforts to Find Accord On Coffee Quotas Fail
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (Agence FrancePresse Talks con cerning a fiveyear interna tional agreement on coffee export quotas collapsed when the International Coffee Council failed to reach a compromise between pro ducer and consumer countries here tonight after 13 days of prolonged negotiations.

title: Tati Gloriously Brings Back Mr. Hulot
description: During one of those weeks when all the television sets show men being rocketed to the moon, the ALTRA man ufacturing company of Paris prepares to send off its own pride and joy, a customized compact station  wagon camper, to promote at the Amsterdam auto show. The camper goes in a small truck together with its designer, Mr. Hulot; the firm's public relations girl drives her own sports car; and an ordinary station wagon carries a tape recorder full of bird calls and a load of phony birch trees for the display.

title: Dance:
description: It may have been mere coincidence that Harry Chapin was celebrating his 30th birthday, but that fact of life made his first major concert appearance at Alice Tully Hall, Sunday evening, even more of a goodhumored celebration.

title: Caribbean Cruise Attempts To Seek Meaning of Apollo
description: ABOARD THE S.S. STAT ENDAM, in the Caribbean SeaIn the ship's theater, Norman Mailer was hypothe sizing the existence of what he called the thanatosphere, a home for the souls of the dead out beyond the bios phere, and wondering Wheth er space exploration might not be upsetting its delicate vibrations.

title: In Quangtri, the Truce Is a Remote Fantasy
description: QUANGTRI, South Vietnam, Dec. 10while world leaders struggle over ceasefire terms in Paris, in this desolate and warravaged region of South Vietnam, men continue to spend their days killing and being killed.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Vince Clements reached the Giant clubhouse after the game he had a black eye and a look of content ment. The black eye resulted from a freakish collision with Nick Buoniconti, the elegant middle linebacker of the Miami Dolphins. The look of contentment came from a surge of inner satisfaction at a job well done, a superior effort at fullback in the first starting assignment of his pro career. It softened the sting of a Giant defeat as they fumbled away all chances of victory over an unbeaten team they had not been expected to stop anyway.

title: EXPANSION IS SET BY TOYOTA, NISSAN
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 11 Two major Japanese Auto mobile makers, Toyota and Nis san, announced plans today for a major expansion in their Australian enterprises.

title: STUDY STRESSES U.S. FUEL NEEDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)The United States can handle its energy requirements through this century, but only with a more sympathetic Gov ernment policy and a public will ing to pay more, the National Petroleum Council said today.

title: THIEU PROPOSES A HOLIDAY TRUCE, P.O.W. EXCHANGE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 12  President Nguyen Van Thieu proposed to day an indefinite truce between South and North Vietnam to begin before the Christmas holi day.

title: U.S. JUDGE ISSUES I.O.S. FUND ORDER
description: Federal Judge Charles E. Stewart, at the request of the Securities and Exchange Com mission, signed an order over the weekend attempting to stop four I.O.S., Ltd., mutual funds from being converted into closedend investments funds pending trial of a current suit.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WAYNE, Dec. 11With only 11 shopping days left until Christmas, stores across the state are bracing for the final onslaught of shoppers and shoplifters.

title: Narcotics Smuggler Tells Court Ricord Hired Him for Scheme
description: A Frenchman who had been a waiter on ocean liners testi field in Federal District Court here yesterday that Auguste Joseph Ricord had recruited him as part of complex mech anism that transferred a ship ment of heroin from Paraguay to the corner of Broadway and 22d Street in the fall of 1970.The former waiter, Pierre Gahou, who is serving a seven year term for narcotics smug gling, said that he had stayed in Ricord's house in Asuncin and that at one point Ricord had sent him to stay in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel in New York with instructions to call a Mr. Nick.

title: 2 Die in Nursing Home Fire
description: BEREA, Ky., Dec. 11 (UPI) Two residents of a small home for the aged near here died last night in a fire believed to have been caused by an over heated coal stove. Embry Cur ry, the Madison County coroner, identified the victims as J. C. Terrill, 85 years old, and Grace Frazier, 84, both of Paint Lick, Ky.

title: KUHN CALLS OWNERS FIRM ON 2 POINTS
description: Commissioner Bowie Kuhn said yesterday that baseball club owners are unwilling to yield on the two key demands of the players in current con tract negotiationsfree agent status and binding arbitration of salary disputes. These are two areas where the owners show no inclination to give ground, Kuhn said. They are willing to make some modifi cations in the reserve clause, as already publicly outlined. But I can see no yielding on these two important points.

title: Abortion Foes on L. I. Berate Governor
description: Governor Rockefeller agreed yesterday to meet soon with opponents of the state's abortion law who have repeatedly attacked him in the last month at his Town Hall meetings across the state.

title: Harvey Swados, Novelist, Dies; Wrote Widely on Social Scene
description: Harvey Swados, the novelist and social critic who plumbed the frustrations of American life and portrayed those futile ly seeking a better day, died yesterday of a brain hemor rhage in Holyoke (Mass.) Hos pital. He was 52 years old.

title: Merger News
description: Esso Europe, Inc., a unit of the Exxon Corporation, said yesterday in London that it had sold 17 of its motor hotels in Western Europe to Bass Char rington, Ltd., of Britain for about $58million. The sale is effective Jan. 1.

title: Providence Triumphs
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 11 (UPI)Ernie Di Gregorio, a 6 foot senior, scored 37 points to lead Providence to a 9357 vic tory over Fairfield tonight.

title: Step Toward Irish Unity
description: By a majority of more than five to one, the voters of the Irish Republic have built a modest first section of a framework in which the reunification of Ireland might one day become possible. They have repealed a section of their 1937 Constitution that conferred a special posi tion on the Roman Catholic Church, to which 95 per cent of the citizens of the Republic belong.

title: Blue Collar, White Collar: II
description: In a class society, laborers are con fronted with the fact that they are treated as a mass, as nobody special, that they are runofthemill Ameri cans. These definitions are the ones that people who do manual work make of themselves. If being nobody special is not awarded much prestige in this society, however, it is a condition which all the nobodies have learnea to share. In contrast to the situation for someone closer to the top, a man near the base of the pyramid who gains approval from those above faces a loss of real respect from his peers. Will he be tempted by his suc cess to act as though his peers not so singled out are no longer worthy of him? If he puts on airs, he will lose the friends of lifetime.

title: Canadian Commission
description: TORONTO, Dec. 11 (Ca nadian Press)Canadian stock exchanges proposed today a complete restructuring of their commission rate schedules that would increase the commission income of security dealers by about 5 per cent.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND OTC DECLINE
description: Stocks finished lower yester day in slower trading on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market.

title: Long Rail Strike Forecast If Neither Side Budges
description: Commuters left without their regular means of transportation by the Long Island Rail Road strike began another week of improvised travel arrangements yesterday as again no nego tiations were held.

title: FUTURES ATTAIN CONTRACT HIGHS
description: At least a dozen commodities set new lifeofcontract highs yesterday in futures trading.

title: Scientific Tools Set Up For Moon Experiments
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 11The Apollo 17 astronauts began setting up on the lunar sur face tonight a variety of sci entific tools to measure the moon's pulse, take its tem perature, probe its interior and carry out several other experiments, including one that seeks clues to the essen tial nature of gravity.

title: BroomHandle Bomb Defused at Bronx Bank
description: Policemen who rushed to a Bronx bank after an anony mous caller demanded all its money and told a clerk that dynamite had been planted inside discovered yesterday that the explosives were pieces of broom handles taped together.

title: City Sees a Pattern of Violence Against Minorities
description: The City Commission on Human Rights wanred yester day that a dangerous pattern of arson and vandalism against blacks and Purto Ricans had developed in several white neighborhoods of the city. The commission charged that in some instances the Police De partment had been inadequate in its efforts to prevent and in vestigate the violence.

title: 100 Years for Mercantile Exchange
description: The New York Mercantile Exchange, where futures in Maine potatoes, platinum, United States silver coins, imported boneless beef and palladium are traded, cele brated its 100th anniversary yesterday.

title: Hospital Unit Says Provisionals Are Down in Total Percentage
description: Dr. Joseph T. English, presi dent of the Health and Hospitals Corporation, testified yesterday before a City Council commit tee that the total percentage of provisional employes in the corporation had been signifi cantly reduced from that of twoandahalf years ago, under the Department of Hospitals.

title: Food Stamp Test Planned
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent signed to day a $70,000 grant agreement with the Federal Government to develop an experimental statewide distribution program for food stamps. Food stamps are now available in limited areas.

title: BLACKS TAKE OVER STATE HEALTH UNIT
description: About 50 members of a black selfhelp organization took over the midtown offices of the State Health Department yes terday and, after ousting vir tually the entire staff, vowed to remain until the state agreed to pay $800,000 in dis puted Medicaid payments to Interfaith Hospital in Queens.

title: Strong Legal Action to Combat Terrorism Is Rebuffed at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 11The nations that had called upon the United Nations for strong international legal action against terrorism suf fered a stunning defeat here this afternoon.

title: Santa Claus Goes Picketing
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 11 (UPI) Santa Claus walked on a downtown picket line today. The department store Santa at the Higbee Company joined some 500 other unionists in oneday demonstration in front of the store to dissuade shop pers from buying garments made by the Farah Manufac turing Company of El Paso, Tex.

title: Injunction on C.B.S. Newsmen Upheld
description: The Appellate Division yes terday upheld unanimously a State Supreme Court injunction forbidding newsmen at the Col umbia Broadcasting System to honor picket lines of striking C.B.S. technicians.

title: FRESHMAN RULE STIRS DISUNITY
description: The policy that permits fresh men for the first time to play varsity basketball is causing disunity on many college teams throughout the country. The cure won't be easy to find.

title: Big British Bank Raises Lending Rate to 7%
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  The National Westminster bank  second biggest of Britain's clearing banksannounced that its basic lending rate is to rise to 7 per cent from 7 per cent. The increase applies as of to morrow. Overdrafts will be  per cent dearer.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today Dec. 12, 1972
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 3 P.M. on Cyprus. GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Michigan Aide Named Head Coach of Arizona
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 11 (AP)Jim Young, an assist ant at the University of Mich igan, was named today head football coach at the Univer sity of Arizona.

title: Australian Yacht Sets Pace In Rough One Ton Sailing
description: SYDNEY, Tuesday, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  The Australian yacht Pilgrim, skippered by Graham Evans, was reported today to be leading in the world One Ton yachting cham pionship after sailing through a gale during the night.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11  Offi cials of the Port of New York and New Jersey Authority told a Senate hearing today that the $650million mass transit im provements pending in the Leg islature would be selfsupport ing and they urged that final approval be given to the pro posals.

title: Bridge: South Africa Offers Example Of Strong Defensive Playing
description: Almost all the leading bridge playing countries around the world publish a specialist magazine giving a mixture of national news, interna tional news and purely tech nical material. One of the best is the South African Bridge Bulletin, which re cently reported the dia gramed deal as an example of good defensive play.

title: Withdrawals Begin
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Withdrawal of occupation forces of India and Pakistan from each other's cap tured territory began today simultaneously with the adjust ment of troop positions in Kashmir, a senior Pakistani of ficial said here tonight.

title: Westchester Budget Critics Ask For Spending Instead of Tax Cut
description: Speaker after speaker at the standingroomonly hearing urged the County Board of Legislators to appropriate more money for such programs, as day care, prison reform and family planning. The 17mem ber board will vote on the $245 million budget in a few weeks.

title: Soviet Declines Comment
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (Reuters) The Soviet Foreign Ministry today declined comment on re ports of a clash on the border with China last month in which five Soviet soldiers were said to have been killed.

title: I.C.C. Rescinds Approval Of Florida Railroad Plan
