description: The Interstate Commerce Commission announced yester day it had withdrawn its April 25 approval of a plan by the Florida East Coast Railway Company to exchange stock for bonds.

title: Navy Unrest Laid to Communication Gap
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 11  The commander of the Pacific Fleet told Congressional investigators today that racial disorders such as those aboard the aircraft carriers Constellation and Kitty Hawk had resulted mainly from a breakdown of communication between commanding officers and enlisted men.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Robert Strauss's gestures at reconciliation do not disguise the fact that his election to head the Democratic National Committee extends a fiveyear factional fight. Warring in the party, dating from the 1967 start of Senator Eugene J. Mc Carthy's campaign against Pres ident Johnson's re nomination, begins to look chronic. After their Gold water debacle in 1964, the Republicans found a political techni cian from Ohio, Ray Bliss, to head their national committee.

title: Fluor Earnings Dropped in Quarter and the Year
NIXON WON STATE B1,241,694 VOTES
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The Nix onAgnew ticket carried New York State by 1,241,694 votes in the Nov. 7 election, the State Board of Canvassers said today, in certifying election results.

title: State University Pressed By Women's Rights Caucus
description: OSWEGO, N. Y., Dec. 11 (AP)The Caucus on Women's Rights of New York met here over the weekend and called for more women's studies and greater job opportunities for women throughout the state university system.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 11 (UPI)  Gov. Edwin W. Ed wards said today the former executive editor of The Times, Turner Catledge, might have leaked a dispatch that said members of a commission were critical of the police and the Governor.

title: Dance:
description: It may have been mere coincidence that Harry Chapin was celebrating his 30th birthday, but that fact of life made his first major concert appearance at Alice Tully Hall, Sunday evening, even more of a goodhumored celebration.

title: Bench's Lung Surgery Is Termed Successful
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 11 (UPI) Doctors at Christ Hospital expressed satisfaction that a lesion removed from the right lung of Johnny Bench today was not malignant and said the Cincinnati Reds' star catcher should have no trou ble returning to his base ball career.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The 197172 George Jean Nathan Award for Dramatic Criticism has gone to Jay P. Carr, 36yearold theater and music critic for The Detroit News. The prize, the largest in the American theater, is $5,000.

title: New Voice in Debate on Breast Surgery
description: Two years ago, Mrs. Rosa mond Campion found a lump the size of an olive pit in her left breast. She entered a Manhattan hospital for a biopsy, and the lump was diagnosed as being cancerous.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11 (AP)Japan's trade surplus with the United States is expected to exceed $4billion in the fiscal year ending March 31, 1973, despite an earlier Japanese Government promise to cut it down to $2billion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article entitled Amphetamine and Accidental Addicts, which accom panied your Dec. 4 news story on the use of amphetamines, contains some statements that are incomplete and others that are misleading. Lest some patients who are taking the medication for proper indication and in proper amounts be unsettled by these opin ions, I should like to record a respon sible dissent.

title: Tanaka Disappointed as Leftists Make Unexpectedly Large Election Gains
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11  Premier Kakuei Tanaka expressed dis appointment today over the re sults of yesterday's national election, in which the Socialist and Communist parties made unexpectedly large gains and in which his own LiberalDemo cratic party was returned to power, but with a reduced mar gin.

title: Advertising:
description: The American Medical Association, already a mini publishing empire, is prepar ing to bring forth still another magazine in April.

title: TRUMAN'S HEART STILL IRREGULAR
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 11 (AP)Former President Harry S. Truman rested quietly with out pain today, hut doctors said that his condition still is seri ous and will continue to be so for an indefinite period.

title: Body Found in Spain Thought to Be American Once Jailed by Prague
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A badly decomposed body was discovered in September in a gully in the southern Spanish countryside, thus apparently bringing to an end the life story of a Cambridge, Mass., travel agent once accused of espio nage by Czechoslovakia.

title: EXHARTFORD AIDE FINDS H.E.W. LAGS
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 11 (AP) Reminded that he once sug gested the Federal Department of Health, Education and Wel fare be burned to the ground, former State Welfare Commis sioner Henry White said yester day he hoped to see new leadership from H.E.W. under a new administration.

title: 17 More Detained By Police in Israel In Spying Inquiry
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 11Seven teen more people were detained last night in connection with a police investigation of what was termed a proSyrian espionage and sabotage ring.

title: Bordentown Inmates End Revolt As Policemen Prepare to Attack
description: BORDENTOWN, N. J., Dec. 11Threatened with a mas sive teargas attack by nearly 100 state troopers, 90 inmates of the State Youth Correctional Institution here dismantled their barricade of beds, mat tresses and furniture early this afternoon and ended a 16hour rebellion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is always amusing to read letters such as the one by Mrs. Harriet S. Hart which appeared Dec. 1 on the unfairness of forced busing.

title: U.S. Bars Price Increase By Grumman for F14's
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Dec. 11 The Department of Defense an nounced today that it would hold the Grumman Corporation to its contract for 48 more F14 aircraft and would permit no increase in price.

title: Price Changes
description: The Price Paper Corporation, a subsidiary of the Price Com pany, Ltd., of Quebec, said yes terday that it planned to in crease its newsprint prices by $5 a ton, effective Feb. 1.

title: A Study Finds Half Of Cuban Refugees Are Outside Florida
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11 (AP)More than half of the 612,648 Cu ban refugees in the United States have been resettled out side Florida, according to a study financed by the United States Government.

title: Music
description: A mass based entirely on Christmas carols made more sense in 17thcentury France than it would today, when a composer might be tempt ed to set the Kyrie to the tune of Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer or the Sanc tus to Jingle Bells. For his Messe de Minuit (Mid night Mass for Christmas Eve), which the Collegiate Chorale sang at Carnegie Hall on Sunday night, Marc Antoine Charpcntier (1634 1704) could draw on a rich tradition of melodious car ols, and did. The result, a disarmingly sweet bit of Christmas candy, is certain ly no masterwork but re viving it at this time was a merry idea.

title: DOROTHY JENKINS, GARDEN EDITOR, 65
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 11  Dorothy H. Jenkins, former garden editor of The New York Times and author of many books on gardening and an tiques, died yesterday at her home, 218 Grumman Avenue. She was 65 years old.

title: Blind Pickets Here Say National Unit Discriminates
description: For the second day, pickets protested the policies of the National Accreditation Coun cil for Agencies Serving the Blind and Visually Handi capped as it conducted its semiannual board meeting yesterday in the Prince George Hotel at 14 East 28th Street.

title: BIRTH CURB PILL IS TERMED RISKY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) Many university health cen ters are prescribing morning after birth control pills with out warning coeds of the pos sible risks involved, Ralph Na der's Health Research Group reported today.

title: BOMBING IS HEAVY OVER SAIGON AREA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 12 (UPI)Heavy raids, by United States B52's were flown yesterday in the Saigon area.

title: Balkan Train Crash Kills 26
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Dec. 11 (AP) A passenger train crashed into a stationary freight train yesterday, killing 20 passengers and injuring 10, the Bulgarian press agency, B.T.A., reported. The agency said the accident occurred as the SofiaTolbult hin train was passing through Venchan in the Varna district.

title: About Pro Football
description: George Allen, the Wash ington coach, has complained about the Dallas crackback blocks, one of which cost Allen the services of his de fensive captain, Jack Pardee, in the RedskinCowboy game last Saturday. Lance Al worth, the Dallas wide re ceiver, made several blocks on the unsuspect ing outside line backer, who was trying to follow the flow of the play. It's some thing designed to hurt a player and I don't think it has any place in football, said Allen yesterday. It's il legal and vicious.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Warning on Employe Gifts
description: The public was warned yes terday that it was a misde meanor, punishable by a maxi mum of one year in jail, to give a gift of gratuity to a city em ploye. The annual warning was issued by Nicholas Scoppetta, Investigation Commissioner. Mr. Scoppetta said it was also a violation of the law for a city employe to solicit or accept a a gift or gratuity to a city em money and other gifts, such as liquor.

title: Mortimer W. Hall Marries Mrs. Wilson
description: Mrs. Penelope Coker Wil son, author of books for chil dren, was married here last Friday to Mortimer W. Hall, son of Mrs. Dorothy Schiff, publisher of The New York Post, and greatgrandson of the late Jacob Schiff, the banker. Judge M. Marvin Ber ger of the Criminal Court per formed the ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. James Hilary Ryan.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The courtappointed trustee of the bankrupt Central Railroad of New Jersey asked a Federal judge to allow the line to end its passenger service, saying commuter trains ran at an annual $2million loss.

title: Australia and New Zealand Set Final Withdrawal
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 11 (AP)The new Labor party Governments of Australia and New Zealand today announced details of their military with drawal from South Vietnam.

title: High Court Bars Moose Lodge Plea on Negro Ban
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Fraternal organizations may discriminate in choosing their members but not in deciding whether to serve food and drink to guests, under a Su preme Court action today.

title: India and Pakistan Finish Work on Truce Line
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 11 (Reu ters)  India and Pakistan to day completed demarcation of a new truce line in divided Kashmir, paving the way for a withdrawal of troops elsewhere along their frontiers.

title: Eximbank Approves Loan To Lufthansa for Boeings
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (Reu ters)The United States Ex portImport Bank authorized to day a loan of $19.7million to Lufthansa to finance 35 per cent of the purchase costs of isix Boeing 727 jets.

title: HOME LOAN COSTS RISE QUIETLY HERE
description: Major commercial banks in New York City have quietly raised their lending rates on home mortgages to 7 per cent from 7 per cent.

title: U.S. Satellite Sending Data
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Dec. 11 (AP) Nimbus 5, the largest and most sophisticated of the United States weather satellites, began sending data to researchers to day, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration re ported. The 1,600pound craft, launched last night, was said to be on a nearperfect orbit to pass every point on the globe twice a day.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, elec trical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: Lefkowitz Aide Asks Help For BillCollector Victims
description: Calling debtcollection agen cies the bane of the consum ers in this state for 12 years, a representative of Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday urged the Legislature to pass new laws curbing abuses by bill collectors.

title: Michigan Aide Named Head Coach of Arizona
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 11 (AP)Jim Young, an assist ant at the University of Mich igan, was named today head football coach at the Univer sity of Arizona.

title: Chain Crashes Kill 4 in Italy
description: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 11 (Reu ters)Some 140 vehicles piled up in two multiple crashes along a foggy Italian highway today, causing at least four deaths and many injuries. The four deaths occured 20 miles north of here in the worse of the two smashups, in wihch 80 cars were involved and at least 30 persons injured.

title: Eritreans Admit Hijack Role
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 11 (UPI)The separatist Eritrean Liberation Front said in a statement today that it was re sponsible for the attempted hi jacking of an Ethiopian Airlines plane Friday in which the hi jackers, five men and two wo men, were shot to death. The guerrilla organization said the seven would have taken the plane to a friendly country and held the passengers hostage for the freedom of members of the front detained in Ethiopia.

title: Business Briefs
description: U. S. S. Engineers, Inc., and EisenwerkGesellschaft Maximilianshuette m.b.H. (Maxhuette) announced yester day the formation of a new company, USS Maxtech, to market the QBOP steelmaking process. The joint an nouncement said the new company would facilitate the adoption and use of the process that is known in Europe as OBM.

title: Pentagon Complexes
description: Since the formation of the Department of Defense in 1949for that matter, since the establishment of the War Office in 1781earnest efforts have been directed at finding the optimum mix of civilian and military re sponsibilities in promoting American national security.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Firemen rescued six persons, including two small children, from a burning apartment building in the Bush wick section of Brooklyn early yesterday and revived the children, who had stopped breathing, with mouthtomouth resuscitation, fire officials said.All six were recovering from smoke inhalation at Wyckoff Heights Hospital, where Michael Vulbis, 75 years old, and Cindy Torrella, 1, were listed in serious condition. The others were listed as in fair condition. Six firemen, including two who collapsed after making rescues, were treated and released at the hospital for smoke inhalation.The fire engulfed a threestory brick building at 617 Hart Street. A neighbor ran to a nearby firehouse to turn in the alarm.

title: Fine Imposed for Theft Of Computer's Secrets
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11 Hugh J. Ward, 30 years old, was sentenced to three years on probation and fined $5,000 today for the theft of busi ness secrets from a competi tor's computer.

title: Man in the News
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11George Bush, Pres ident Nixon's choice for Re publican National Chairman, says he regrets that politics has come to be regarded widely as some kind of shady, grubby business.

title: Strong Legal Action to Combat Terrorism Is Rebuffed at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 11The nations that had called upon the United Nations for strong international legal action against terrorism suf fered a stunning defeat here this afternoon.

title: Mark Van Doren, 78, Poet, Teacher, Dies
description: Mark Van Doren, the poet and critic and retired Columbia professor, died Sunday night two days after undergoing sur gery for circulatory problems at the Charlotte Hungerford Hospital in Torrington, Conn. He was 78 years old.

title: CRAFT ON TARGET
description: HOUSTON, Tuesday, Dec. 12 Two American astronauts landed in a valley of the moon yesterday, set up a network of scientific instruments and be gan man's last explorations of the cratered lunar surface in the Apollo Project.

title: Milca VargasManchon Is a Bride
description: Miss Milca Maria Vargas Manchon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ignacio Guido Var gas of Mendoza, Argentina, was married Saturday in Mendoza to Richard Allan Aronson. The Rev. Fernando Plozas performed the cere mony in the Roman Catholic Church of Nuestra Seora de las Merced.

title: Burglary Victim Weighs Suit Over Westchester D.A.'s Deal
description: A woman in Rye, N. Y., is considering charging District Attorney Carl A. Vergari of Westchester County with mal feasance for agreeing not to prosecute two men who alleged ly robbed her home and then returned some of the stolen items along with $600,000 worth of missing art works.

title: Annual Gift to the Neediest Maintains 50Fear Record
description: A $15 check from Melvin J. Hahn of 1036 Park Avenue was among the 50 contribu tions recorded yesterday by The New York Times Need iest Cases Fund.

title: Chou Talks of Accord
description: PEKING, Dec. 11 (Agence France Presse)Premier Chou Enlai said tonight that there was a passibility that an Amer icanVietnamese peace agree mnt would be concluded in the next two or three days in Paris.

title: Advertising:
description: Goody, goody yelled the gang at Carl Ally, Inc., We got some Tonka toys for Christmas.

title: Freedom Flights Resume
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11 (UPI)The freedom flights bringing Cuban refugees to this country resumed today with a planeload of mostly elderly people.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Pornographic films and pirated stereo tapes were seized in police raids early yesterday in Brooklyn, where two men linked by District Attorney Eu gene Gold to organized crime in New Jersey were taken into custody.

title: DEFENSE IN BRAZIL CHARGES TORTURE
description: RECIFE, Brazil, Dec. 11 (Reu ters)  Twentyone students, including five women, who had been held in jail for eight months on charges of subver sion were freed today after the defense asserted that both they and witnesses had been tor tured by the police.

title: Abortion Foes on L.I. Berate Governor
description: Governor Rockefeller agreed yesterday to meet soon with opponents of the state's abortion law who have repeatedly attacked him in the last month at his Town Hall meetings across the state.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 10  Thomas Gangemi Jr., who ran second behind Dr. Paul T. Jor dan in the race for Mayor a little over a year ago, said to day he would make another bid for the office in the elec tions scheduled for next May.

title: Presumptive Death Hearing On Begich Opens in Alaska
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 11The state began presumptive death proceedings today in the case of Representative Nick Begich, Democrat of Alaska, who has been missing since Oct. 16.

title: Board Agrees to Sale
description: The board of directors of the Midwestern Financial Corpora tion announced it had executed a letter of agreement by which the Security Pacific Corporation would acquire all the outstand ing shares of Midwestern common. The two companies announced earlier this month that they were considering such an agreement.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A NEW MARAVICH COMES TO GARDEN
description: In his third pro basketball season, Pete Maravich has A mustache, his hair is browner and he has matured as a player. He is no longer the Louisiana State University shooter who endeared himself to the ticket holders with his shooting.

title: Liske of Eagles Injured
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 (UPI)The Philadelphia Eagles said today that a quarterback, Pete Liske, suffered a fracture of a rib in yesterday's loss to the Chicago Bears, but will probably play in the season finale next Sunday against the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Unhallowed Tower
description: New York State's Environmental Protection Bureau has rolled up its legal artillery in support of the Common wealth of Pennsylvania's lawsuit to prevent the construc tion of a tower overlooking the Gettysburg Battlefield. This friendofthecourt brief by the Attorney General's office is a sound example of interstate cooperation to protect the historic and natural heritage, without regard to boundaries.

title: China Assails Moscow Reports of Clash
description: PEKING, Dec. 11A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman said today that Moscow reports of a border clash between the two countries were sheer fab rication and malicious slander.

title: Gasoline Truck Out of Gas
description: BROOKFIELD, Mo. (AP)A Missouri highway patrolman stopped to aid a big transport truck stopped on a highway near here and asked if he could be of help. The driver said he was out of gas, The vehicle was a 6,500gallon gasoline trans port truckentirely out of gas.

title: Doctor Tells West German Jury Visiting Warsaw About Life After the Gestapo Imprisoned Him in '41
description: WARSAW, Dec. 11Dr. Fe licjan Loth was a 28yearold Warsaw doctor in 1941 when the Gestapo arrived at his home one February night to take him off to Pawiak prison. He was accused of underground activi ties.

title: 2 Seized at Erotic Fete, But Film Show Goes On
description: In an apparent attempt to shut the Second Annual Erotic Film Festival, the police yes terday arrested the manager and assistant manager of Cin ema Village at 22 East 12th Street for operating a movie house without a license.

title: People and Business
description: Stanley Marcus, one of the nation's bestknown retailers at one of the nation's best known stores has moved from the presidency of Neiman Marcus of Dallas to chairman. His 34year old son Richard moved from executive vice president to succeed him as president.

title: Shippers to Cuba Are Bombed Here, in Miami and in Montreal
description: Bombs went off yesterday in New York, Miami and Montreal at the offices of companies en gaged in shipping goods to Cuba.

title: Raiders End Jets' Playoff Hope, 2416
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11 The New York Jets' last chance to back into the playoffs as the wildcard disappeared tonight when they were defeated by the Oakland Raiders, 2416.

title: U.N. Approves University
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11 (AP)The United Nations General Assembly voted today to establish an international university, which was proposed three years ago by former Sec retary General Thant. The United Nations University will be made up of centers around the world offering postgraduate education and doing research. The vote was 101 to 7 with 4 abstentions.

title: ExPrime Minister Averts Party Clash In Northern Ireland
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Brian Faulk ner, former Prime Minister of Northern Ireland, today steered his Unionist party away from a headon clash between mod erates and hardliners that could have shattered the or ganization.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I take issue with a number of points in Robert B. Johnson's The Unknown Soldiers [OpEd Nov. 29].

title: NIXON'S TRADE ROLE DEBATED AT PARLEY
description: Representative John Brade mas, Democrat of Indiana, told a gathering of steel importers here last night that it was time for the Nixon Administration to act in foreign policy.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: William Styron, whon won a Pulitzer Prize for his novel about the 1831 slave uprising in Virginia, The Confessions of Nat Turner, has written his first play, In the Clap Shack.

title: People in Sports: Keino's Pro Bid
description: Kip Keino may be matched against Jim Ryun in the mile run again if Michael O'Hara, the president of the new World Track Association, can convince the Kenyan to turn professional. Keino has indicated he would retire as an amateur runner after par ticipating in the Africa Games next month.

title: Wisconsin Player Quits
description: MADISON, Wis., Dec. 11 (UPI)  Gary Watson, a senior on the Wisconsin basketball team, said today he was quit ting school and would seek to finish his college career in the East. The 6foot7inch player from La Salle Academy in New York said the main reason for leaving was that Coach John Powless had removed him from the starting lineup. Powless said last week that Watson had quit because of personal prob lems.

title: Dole Quits as G.O.P. Head; Bush Named as Successor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Senator Robert J. Dole an nounced today that he was re signing as Republican National Chairman and that George H. Bush, United States represent ative to the United Nations, had been chosen to replace him.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the long piece about Dr. Max Jacobson [Dec. 4] I have been singled out among the many persons men tioned as patients of hisand in manner which is very embarassing and damaging to my character.

title: U.S. Bars Price Increase By Grumman for F14's
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Dec. 11 The Department of Defense an nounced today that it would hold the Grumman Corporation to its contract for 48 more F14 aircraft and would permit no increase in price.

title: General Dynamics Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Supreme Court agreed today to examine the Government's claim that the General Dynamics Corpora tion's acquisition of United Electric Coal Companies illegally lessened competition.

title: Metreveli to Join Pro Net Tour
description: In another apparent move to expand its international sports scope, the Soviet Union has agreed to allow its topranking tennis player, Alex Metreveli, to join a professional tour owned and operated by a Unit ed States organization.

title: Whalers Defeat Jets by 43 For 9th Straight Triumph
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (AP)Mike Hyndman and Kevin Ahearn scored in a threeminute span in the third period to snap a 22 deadlock and power the New England Whalers to a 43 World Hockey Association vic tory over the Winnipeg Jets tonight.

title: America's Very Own Disraelis
description: When Richard Nixon and Henry Kissinger entered the White House together in January, 1969, only one of them was professedly a Disraeli conservative. It wasn't Mr. Nixon.

title: Bordentown Inmates End Rebellion As State Troopers Prepare to Attack
description: BORDENTOWN, N. J., Dec. 11Threatened with a mas sive teargas attack by nearly 100 state troopers, 90 inmates of the State Youth Correctional Institution here dismantled their barricade of beds, mat tresses and furniture early this afternoon and ended a 16hour rebellion.

title: G.M. Recalls 6,000 Cars To Change Defective Parts
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (UPI) The General Motors Corpora tion announced today recall campaigns involving 6,000 cars, including 2,100 currentmodel Chevrolet Camaros that need new parking brake assemblies.

title: Getting on With Life After a Mastectomy
description: PRINCETON, N. J.The smiling women exercising and swimming every Thursday morning at the Y.M.C.A. have more in common than a desire for physical fitness. Each of them has undergone a mastectomy. In a program developed and organized by Mrs. Helen Kohut, an articulate, slender former Public Health nurse in her forties, the women are regaining physical and emotional strength and confidence after an ordeal that saps both.

title: Japanese Insurance Set
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11 (UPI)The American Life Insurance Com pany of Delaware was author ized today by the Finance Min istry as the first foreign con cern after the end of World War to sell life insurance poli cies to Japanese. The company has been operating its business here since 1954, but its cus tomers had been limited to nonresidents, such as United States military personnel and their dependents.

title: U.S., in Test Case, Holding 3 Who Fled Cuba in Boat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  United States officials said to day that three Cubans who had taken a fishing boat to Florida from Cuba last week are in a Miami jail, facing possible kid napping charges carrying a maximum sentence of life im prisonment.

title: Saints' Abramowicz Hurt
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 11 (UPI) Danny Abramowicz, who has caught at least one pass in 76 consecutive games with the New Orleans Saints, missed practice today and was listed as questionable for the season finale against Green Bay next Sunday. Abramowicz who has played in every game for the Saints since New Orleans joined the National Football league in 1967, suffered torn ligaments in his left knee dur ing yesterday's 1710 loss to the New England Patriots.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: DENVER  Ron Lyle. Denver, knocked out Larry Middleton, Baltimore, 3 rounds, heavyweights.

title: Market Rise Paced by Glamour Issues Volume Slips
description: Some of Wall Street's glamour stocks boomed ahead yester day, while popular averages continued last week's habit of posting record highs.

title: Civil Rights Leaders of the 1960's Call Upon Nixon to Lead a New Movement
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 11  What is left of the civil rights establishment of the nineteen sixties gathered here today to celebrate the opening of for mer President Johnson's rights papers and to urge President Nixon to assume in his second term the leadership of a re newed movement for minority rights.

title: Petrosian, Karpov And Portisch Tie For Chess Victory
Vertee, From Good Barn, 9Length Big A Victor
description: The Hobeau Farm, with two successive victories in the fea ture race at Aqueduct last week, extended its good works by taking the main event at the Big A yesterday. Allen Jerkens, who trains for Hobeau, sent Vertee into the $9,500 allow ance race of one mile against six rivals, and Vertee sped to a 9length victory.

title: Big Schools Held to Invite Trouble
description: Crime and the impact of schools on communities became dominant themes yesterday at the opening of the City Plan ning Commission's capital budget hearings on public edu cation.

title: City Agency Sees a Pattern Of Violence Against Minorities
description: The City Commission on Hu man Rights warned yesterday that a dangerous pattern of arson and vandalism against blacks and Puerto Ricans had developed in several white neighborhoods of the city, The commission charged that in some instances the Police De partment had been inadequate in its efforts to prevent and investigate the violence.

title: Library Demolition Begun
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 (AP)Demolition work on the Temple University Law Library began over the weekend. A fire last July heavily damaged the building and destroyed half of the 400,000 volumes on the shelves.

title: Notes on People
description: For the first time in the family history of President and Mrs. Nixon, neither of their daughters, Tricia and Julie, will be with them at Christmas, The White House said that Tricia and Edward F. Cox, her husband, and Julie and Lieut. David Eisen hower, her husband, would spend the holiday as a four some in Athens. Lieutenant Eisenhower's ship is on Mediterranean duty. The Coxes will be stopping in Greece on a threeweek va cation that began in London yesterday and will also take them to Rome and Moscow. On the trip, they are using commercial airlines at their own expense, but they may spend a few nights at United States ambassadorial resi dences. And Mrs. Nixon dis closed that she and the Pres ident would spend the Christ mas holiday in Key Biscayne, Fla. She also said she would ride in the Rose Bowl parade on New Year's Day in Pasa dene, Calif.

title: India Would Limit Execution
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 11 (AP) The Government of India today introduced a bill that would sharply curtail the death pen alty. Capital punishment, now mandatory for murder except in extenuating circumstances, would be limited to the slayings of policemen, members of the armed forces and public serv ants charged with keeping order, or would be imposed in cases of brutal, premeditated murder.

title: Man of La Mancha Comes to Screen
2 Macmillans Agree on Use of Name
description: Two publishing companies named Macmillan have averted a threatened identity crisis. Macmillan, Ltd., of London yes terday dropped its legal action to bar Crowell Collier and Mac millan, Inc., from changing its name to Macmillan, Inc., on Jan. 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 18 editorial Sweet on Sweethearts, pointing up Amalga mated Local Union 355's long history of entering into collusive or sweet heart agreements with a segment of unscrupulous automobile dealers in the metropolitan area, was applauded by those forces, including Local 259, United Automobile Workers, who over the years have waged a continuing campaign to uplift and improve work ing conditions of auto dealership employes.

title: Scientific Tools Set Up For Moon Experiments
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 11The Apollo 17 astronauts set up on the lunar sur face tonight a variety of sci entific tools to measure the moon's pulse, take its tem perature, probe its interior and carry out several other experiments, including one that seeks clues to the essen tial nature of gravity.

title: 9DAY STRIKE BEGINS AT COMMON MARKET
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 11About 10,000 employes of the Com mon Market in Brussels and other European cities began a planned nineday strike today.

title: Booklet by Two Parents Gives Updated Advice on Children
description: If you have a child in school and the child's friend is using drugs, what do you do? If you are a divorced mother who goes out on dates, how much do you tell young sons and daughters?

title: Mark Van Doren, 78, Poet, Teacher, Dies
description: Mark Van Doren, the poet and critic and retired Columbia professor, died Sunday night two days after undergoing sur gery for circulatory problems at the Charlotte Hungerford Hospital in Torrington, Conn. He was 78 years old.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11Assem bly Speaker Thomas J. Kean testified here today that New Jersey's coastal areas were threatened with an environmen tal and ecological disaster un less some form of development protection was instituted to pre serve the areas.

title: Moynihan to Be Named Ambassador to India
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The White House announced today that Daniel Patrick Moynihan, the sociologist and former White House counsel or, would be named Ambas sador to India.

title: Music: In Country Style
description: The music that the New Lost City Ramblers have been playing and singing for the last 14 years is usually de scribed as oldtime country music. But the way. Mike Seeger, John Cohen and Tracy Schwarz present their songs, they manage to turn almost everything they of fer into goodtime music. Which helps to explain why the group is still flourishing and why it has proved to be the most popular attraction presented by the Bluegrass Club of New York during the last year.

title: Austria Is Finding That Her Booming Economy Has Sown a Bitter Crop of Social Tensions
description: VIENNA, Dec. 7Can Au stria really afford to give $650 in cash to every newlywed cou ple or, for that matter, to offer free textbooks and free street car rides to all students?

title: HOME LOAN COSTS RISE QUIETLY HERE
description: Major commercial banks in New York City have quietly raised their lending rates on home mortgages to 7 per cent from 7 per cent.

title: Strikebound Paris Calls Troops to Garbage Duty
description: PARIS, Dec. 11 (Reuters) The French Army began today to clear up mountains of gar bage that have been rising in the streets of Paris since the city's garbage workers went on strike five days ago.

title: TV: Dance and Carols Bolster Christmas Shows
description: Yesterday afternoon on Fifth Avenue one of the side walk Santas was being ad mired by a group of children. One youngster asked if he could ring Santa's bell for a while. Without losing a crin kle in his smile, the merry gentleman muttered, Get the hell out of here. After sit ting through several holiday specials concocted for tele vision, I sympathize thor oughly with the old guy.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Am I ex cited about the changes in the Presi dent's Cabinet?

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 11 (UPI)Muhammad All will meet the European heavyweight boxing champion, Joe Bugner of England, in a 12round bout here Feb. 14, pro moters announced today.

title: Giants Count Blessings In a Promising Outlook
description: The New York Giants en tered the final week of their season yesterday in a position to count their blessings.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: DENVER  Ron Lyle, Denver, knocked out Larry Middleton, Baltimore, 3 rounds, heavyweights.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: About 1,000 welfare fami lies were reported by inform ants in the Human Resources Administration to be living illegally in single rooms. The city is reluctant to do any thing about the situation, the informants said.

title: KUHN CALLS OWNERS FIRM ON 2 POINTS
description: Commissioner Bowie Kuhn said yesterday that baseball club owners are unwilling to yield on the two key demands of the players in current con tract negotiationsfree agent status and binding arbitration of salary disputes. These are two areas where the owners show no inclination to give ground, Kuhn said. They are willing to make some modifi cations in the reserve clause, as already publicly outlined. But I can see no yielding on these two important points.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Shooting of the third film in the Shaft series, Shaft in Africa, is to begin here to day. The two stars, Vanetta McGee and Richard Round tree, were received by Em peror Haile Selassie in a pal ace audience Saturday.

title: ACCOUNTING CHANGE ON LAND SALES SEEN
description: The Accounting Principles Board announced yesterday that a substantial majority of its 18 members would approve stiffer accounting rules for land development companies. By fol lowing this course, the board would decide not to accept even tougher standards favored by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: OFFICIAL COMMENTS ON INQUIRY REPORT
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 11 (AP) Louisiana's Attorney General, William Guste, acknowledged today that some members of the biracial commission investi gating the deaths of two South ern University students had concluded that both were killed by a single shotgun blast, but he denied reports that identifi cation of the person who fired the fatal shot was near.

title: Vote Due Tomorrow on Membership for the State
description: The State of Connecticut is expected to be accepted for membership on the PBW Stock Exchange in Philadelphia to morrow when the exchange's board of governors votes on the matter.

title: No. Carolina Beats Kentucky, 78 to 70, For Fifth Straight
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 11 North Carolina, utilizing its four corner offensive stall late in the game, defeated Ken tucky, 7870, tonight, before 16,000 fans in Freedom Hall.

title: Dole Quits as G.O.P. Head; Bush Named as Successor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Senator Robert J. Dole an nounced today that he was re signing as Republican National Chairman and that George Bush, United States represent ative to the United Nations, had been chosen to replace him.

title: AIDE SCORES RISES IN DAYCARE FEES
description: Georgia MacMurray, commis sioner of the city's Agency for Child Development, said yester day that statemandated in creases in fees for daycare services would negate the work ethic and selfhelp con cepts frequently commended by President Nixon.

title: Caribbean Cruise Attempts To Seek Meaning of Apollo
description: ABOARD THE S.S. STAT. ENDAM, in the Caribbean SeaIn the ship's theater, Norman Mailer was hypothe sizing the existence of what he called the thanatosphere, a home for the souls of the dead out beyond the bios phere, and wondering wheth er space exploration might not be upsetting its delicate vibrations.

title: New YoYo Champion
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Dec. 11 (AP)Bruce Brenda of Weirton, an 18yearold fresh man at West Virginia Univer sity, said today that he had broken the world's yoyo record by yoyoing for eight hours and 50 minutes.

title: Fast Bounce
description: The rules governing conflict of interest seem to sit lightly on Charles W. Colson, who is quitting next March 1 as President Nixon's special counsel and labor liaison. The union with which Mr. Colson has been chummiest through his years at the White House is the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, and that union has now made known its intention to switch its lucrative legal account to the law firm the President's aide is expected to join.

title: Challenger Has Landed
description: For the sixth and last time in Project Apollo, a lunar module carrying two American astronauts landed safely near its target area on the moon yesterday afternoon. This was in many respects the most difficult site men have tried to reach on the lunar surface. The problems to be surmounted included the nature of the mountain ous terrain over which the approach had to be made, and the fact that the TaurusLittrow is so far from the center of the moon as seen from the earth. Even at the time of Apollos 11 and 12 three and more years ago, it would have seemed incredible that astronauts could land at so inaccessible a point as that which the Chal lenger crew reached smoothly yesterday.

title: Rutgers Beat Lehigh
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Dec. 11 (UPI)  Phil Sellers scored 26 points and pulled down eight rebounds tonight for Rutgers in an 8673 victory over Lehigh. The Scarlet Knights went in front early, scoring the first 11 points, and were ahead at half time, 4535.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: On another busy, strange hockey weekend filled with misdeeds and heroics, the Islanders established them selves as the least successful firstyear team since the Na tional League began broaden ing its base in 1967.

title: Sequence of Three Traverses on Moon
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 11The first of three traverses across the lunar surface on the Apollo 17 mission was de signed to make the most of the limited time available after installation of the vari ous observing instruments to be left on the moon.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: FRANK H. RILEY
description: Frank H. Riley, who retired in 1955 as a deputy chief inspector of the Police Department, died Saturday at his home, 14227 Barclay Avenue in Flushing, Queens. He was 80 years old.

title: Delegates at Helsinki Agree To Recess Talks for 30 Days
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 11 (AP)  The 34 nations meet ing to discuss the possibility of a European conference on se curity decided today to have a 30day recess starling Friday.

title: Body Found in Room Afire
description: A 55yearold man was found dead in his bedroom at 373 92d Street, in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn, shortly after 7 A.M. yesterday after firemen put out a blaze in the room. The police identified the man as James Cunningham. The cause of the fire was not im mediately learned.

title: CRAFT ON TARGET
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 11  Two American astronauts landed in a valley of the moon today and, for the last time in the Apollo project, began setting up an array of scientific instruments and exploring the cratered world.

title: Annual Gift to the Neediest Maintains 50  Year Record
description: A $15 check from Melvin J. Hahn of 1036 Park Avenue was among the 50 contribu tions recorded yesterday by The New York Times Need iest Cases Fund.

title: CHANGES POSSIBLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 President Nixon disclosed to day his decision to continue wage and price controls in 1973, possibly in modified form.

title: Truck Hijacked in Queens
description: A trailer truck with $100,000 worth of finished pieces of tex tile goods was hijacked at 7:30 A.M. yesterday by three armed men at 49th Street and 56th Road, Maspeth, Queens. The driver, whose name was with held by the police at his re quest, was let out unharmed at Pennsylvania Avenue and Shore Road near the Belt Parkway in Brooklyn. The truck is owned by Friedman Express, Inc., of Maspeth, the police reported.

title: Trial Judge Withdraws In H. Rapp Brown Case
description: Supreme Court Justice George M. Carney withdrew from the H Rapp Brown trial yesterday and was replaced by Justice Myles J. Lane.

title: U.S. Puts Troop Strength In Vietnam Now at 25,200
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 11 (AP)United States troop strength in Vietnam dipped slightly last week to 25,200 men, the United States command announced today. This was a decrease of 300 from the previous week.

title: Montclair State Wins
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 11  Montclair State gained its first basketball vic tory in the New Jersey State Conference tonight, downing Newark State, 9670. Tom Dux and Chuck Holland shared scor ing honors for the winners with 15 points each.

title: Russian Trawlers Blamed In Fishing Boat Damage
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Dec. 11 (AP)Two Cape dod fishing boats reported over the week end that Russian trawlers had destroyed part of their lobster gear last week.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., Dec. 11Jerry Molloy doesn't like to speak at dinners and other social functions, but he does it anyway. As Hoboken's ambassador at large, he wants to get a message across.

title: Vote in the U.N. On Terror Issue
Coast Scientists Oppose Texts Using Biblical Creation Theory
description: STANFORD, Calif., Dec. 11 Nineteen California Nobel lau reates asked the State Board of Education today to reject a recommendation that would put the Biblical explanation of man's origins on an equal footing with Darwin's theory of evolution in all science textbooks of the California public schools.

title: 2 Safe as Carrier Jet Falls
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 11 (AP) The aircraft carrier Constella tion has returned to port after a fighter jet failed to stop on deck and dropped over the side, suspended in air by a cable. Both pilots escaped from the F4J when the incident occurred Saturday 35 miles out at sea, a Navy spokesman said.

title: Nixon Sends Congratulations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) President Nixon sent his con gratulations today to Premier Tanaka and expressed hope for continued close cooperation be tween the leaderships of the two countries.

title: Anaconda Elects Director
description: Richard L. Knight has been elected a director of the Ana conda Company. He joined Anaconda last June 1 as senior vice presidentfinance.

title: MARIO G. REMO DIES; AD AIDE AT MAYS, 60
description: Mario G. Remo, vice presi dent for advertising and public relations of Mays Department Stores, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 245 East 72d Street.

title: Helge Brilioth Puts Warmth Into Song In 1st U.S. Recital
description: Helge Brilioth's song recital at Hunter College Sunday night, his first in this country, had its ups and downs. But taken al together, the tenor's easy stage manner, communicative warmth and unaffectedly direct inter pretations gave a great deal of pleasure.

title: Norwegian Student Seized As a Spy for Soviet Union
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 11 (AP) A 25yearold Norwegian stu dent who was an assistant watchman at the Norwegian Embassy in Moscow has been arrested and charged with es pionage for the Soviet Union, the Norwegian Government an nounced today.

title: Books of The Times
description: LOG OF THE S.S. THE MRS. UNGUENTINE. By Stanley G. Crawford. 110 pages. Knopf. $3.50.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Boyce Rensberger's Dec. 4 news story on the use of amphetamines by famous patients affected me the same way the Black Sox scandal of years past affected the little boy who pleaded: Say it ain't so, Joe.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Duke Power Company yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 3 million common shares for sale through Merrill Lynch and the First Boston Corporation. The com pany's stock closed at 23, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: DOMINICANS REAP BIG GAIN IN SUGAR
description: SAN LUIS, Dominican Re public, Dec. 8  Usually they show up for work just after dawn. Most of them are quite young. Their clothes are ragged, many are barefoot and all carry the sharp mocho, which is what Dominicans call the machete.

title: World of Howard Hunt In Ruins After Six Months
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Six months ago, E. Howard Hunt Jr. was seemingly on top on the world, proud of his ex ploits during a long career with the Central Intelligence Agency, of his job as a highly paid White House consultant, of his family and expensive home, of his modest reputation as a writer and novelist.

title: Final Decree Issued
description: Federal Judge Martin Pence signed yesterday in San Fran cisco a final judgment order ing the General Telephone & Electronics Company to divest itself of the Hawaiian Tele phone Company and other prop erties.

title: KARL A. BICKEL, 90, LED NEWS SERVICE
description: SARASOTA, Fla., De. 11 (UPI)  Karl A. Bickel, pres ident of United Press for 12 years and a pioneer and in novator in global news gather ing, died today at Sarasota Memorial Hospital. He was 90 years old.

title: Harlem Pupils Return, but Brooklyn Boycott Goes On
description: Most pupils returned to their public schools in East Harlem yesterday, ending a twoweek boycott, but parents continued the boycott in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn that has shut three schools there.

title: CHANGES POSSIBLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 President Nixon disclosed to day his decision to continue wage and price controls in 1973, possibly in modified form.

title: Whereas, a Nonlawyer Could Be a Judge
description: The late Justice Hugo Black sug gested that the President appoint a nonlawyer to the Supreme Court. Justice Black was absolutely right. Lawyer chauvinismthe notion that lawyers know things ordinary people can't understandhas obscured the fact that the most important ques tions to come before the Supreme Court raise social and political issues. These issues are called legal because it is the Supreme Court that decides them; and because they are called legal only lawyers are appointed to the Court. The result of this reasoning is that nonlawyers are excluded from participating in the resolution of many fundamental issues.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11Gov ernor Cahill announced to day that he would nominate William E. Marfuggi, a New ark businessman, to succeed Joseph M. McCrane Jr. as State Treasurer.

title: SHOP TALK
description: From Its sugarfrosted turrets and candied spires down to its nutframed doorways and chocolate cooky founda tions, Tjasa Sprague's fantasy town is definitely the most traditional creation in Design Research, that bastion of modernity at 53 East 57th Street.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 11 (UPI)  Commissioner Robert Carlson said today that the American Basketball Association's format for the postseason playoffs would be changed this season to match the division's firstplace team against the fourthplace club and the secondplace finisher against the thirdplace team.

title: LOUIS P. ROCKER, 78, BROKER AND ZIONIST
description: Louis P. Rocker, a retired member of the New York Stock Exchange long active in Zionist causes, died yesterday in Jeru salem, where he had been liv ing since 1960. He was 78 years old.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Superior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmel man refused today to consider further restrictions on picketing at the embattled Kawaida Towers construction site until the contractor makes a good faith attempt to bring in men and equipment.

title: Market Place Swift Net Aided By Accounting
description: Haw well is Swift & Co. doing in the profits derby? Quite well, it would seem. The company's earnings re port was carried by the financial wire services last Thursday with trading in progress on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Specific Changes in the Controls Program Unclear
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The 13monthold program of mandatory wage, price and rent controls will be continued during the broad review an nounced today by Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz, assuming that Congress gives its approval.

title: WELFAREFAMILIES IN SINGLE ROOMS
description: About 1,000 welfare families are illegally living in single rooms here, informants in the Human Resources Administra tion said yesterday. They as serted that not only was the city reluctant to do anything about it, but also that in many cases it was unaware of just where the families were.

title: Parleys Resumed As Elevator Union Turns Down Offer
description: Negotiators for the striking elevator constructors and the Elevator Manufacturers Associ ation resumed bargaining talks yesterday after the union turned down a management proposal calling for a return to work and submission of the dispute to a factfinding board.

title: Dance:
description: Two solo concerts and a company dance performance turned up in likely and un likely nooks and crannies of the East and West Village during the weekend. Albert Reid showed his friendly, spritely company at the new ly refurbished, Exchange Theater on Sunday at West beth. The previous evening, Charles Stanley created a mysterious fable in St. MarksintheBouwerie and William Dunas assaulted the mind and ears at the Blue Dome Rehearsal Hall on the Bowery.

title: More Assassination Plots Against Marcos Reported
description: MANILA, Dec. 11  A Gov ernment spokesman said today that further questioning of per sons detained under martial law regulations had disclosed information about many more attempts on the life of Presi dent Ferdinand E. Marcos than had previously been reported.

title: JUSTICES TO WEIGH HATCH ACT CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The Supreme Court agreed to day to review the constitu tionality of Federal and state laws that prohibit public em ployes from engaging in po litical activity.

title: Cincinnati 7674 Victor
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 11 (UPI) Dan Murphy dropped in two free throws with three seconds left to give Cincinnati a 7674 victory, over Arizona State to night.

title: CHARLES PRIMOFF
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Charles Primoff, a staff official with the Office of Emergency Preparedness who had been in Government service for 32 years, 25 of those in defense and emergency planning activi ties, died yesterday at George Washington University Hospital here. He was 54 years old.

title: Symposium on Public TV Will Take Place Today
description: A symposium debating the future of public television will be presented free to the public by Fairleigh Dickinson Univer sity and the Institute of Man and Science of Rensselaerville, N. Y., today at 8:30 P.M. at the New York Cultural Center, 2 Columbus Circle.

title: Highlights of Apollo Lunar Flight Plan
description: Following are the high lights of the revised Apollo 17 flight plan. The timetable is subject to change at any time during the mission. Times are Eastern standard.

title: Film of Transit Workers Asleep Assailed by Ronan as Rigged
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority, asserted yesterday that film shown on television last Tuesday; alleged ly showing Transit Authority workers sleeping on the job, was rigged and contrived.

title: Thieu's Speech Is Viewed As Bid for Better Terms
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 12President Nguyen Van Thieu's call for a Christmas truce and an exchange of prisoners left many South Viet namese and American officials here today with the impression that Mr. Thieu was once more trying to forestall a ceasefire accord he dislikes by offering new terms of his own.

title: We announce with deep sorrow the death of our
4 Indicted in Suffolk in Connection With Sale of Land for a Park
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 12 The Suffolk County Attorney, the deputy presiding officer of the County Legislature, his brother, who is a realestate broker, and the former Super visor of the Town of South ampton haye been indicted on charges of official misconduct and grand larceny in connection with the county's purchase of waterfront land.

title: Philippine High Court Asked To Halt Jan. 15 Referendum
description: MANILA, Dec. 12 (AP)The president of the Philippine Na tional Press Club has filed a petition to stop a referendum Jan. 15 on the proposed consti tution for the Philippines.

title: PANEL RULES BEGICH IS PRESUMED DEAD
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 12A special sixmember jury ruled today that Representative Nich olas J. Begich, Democrat of Alaska, and two other men who disappeared with him on a flight from here Oct. 16 were presumed dead.

title: Regional Attorney Named By National Labor Board
description: Mrs. Winifred Morio yester day was appointed regional at torney for the National Labor Relations Board here in this capacity she will serve as the chief legal officer for the board in New York, Bronx, Orange, Putnam, Rockland and. West chester Counties in New York and Fairfield County in Con necticut, The appointment was announced by Peter G. Nash, general counsel of the N.L.R.B.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12  While some numbersgame operators have begun to use the daily New Jersey lottery for their payoffs, a random sampling shows that they are few and far between.

title: Germans Confer on Treaty
description: BONN, Dec. 12 (AP)  West Gerthan and East German of ficials met for eight hours to day to discuss arrangements for the signing of a good neighbor treaty in East Berlin on Dec. 21.

title: Stocks Decline as a Surge In. Glamour Issues Fades
description: Stock prices turned lower on profit taking yesterday as Mon day's surge of glamour issues suddenly played out.

title: Villanova 9056 Victor
description: NORTH ANDOVER, Mass., Dec. 12 (AP)Tom Ingelsby scored 30 points as unbeaten Villanova breezed lo a 9056 victory over Merrimack tonight.

title: Spahn, Ford Among 44 Eligible for Hall of Fame
description: Eight new eligible players headed by Warren Spahn, Whitey Ford and Robin Rob erts appear on the Hall of Fame ballots placed in the Mail yesterday to members of the Baseball Writers As sociation of America.

title: TRUMAN'S PULSE IN NORMAL LIMITS
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dee. 121 (AP)Former President Harry S. Truman, hospitalized for a week with congestion of the lungs and related complica tions, showed improvement to day, doctors said, but re mained in serious condition.

title: 65 Haitian Refugees in Florida After Journey in Leaking Boat
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., Dec. 12 (AP)  Hungry but happy, 65 Haitian refugees drifted ashore today after sailing to Cuba and the Bahamas in a threeweek journey aboard a leaking 56foot sailboat.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PEARL RIVER, N. Y., Dec. 12 (UPI)The wife of a New York City police captain was found dead last night in the garage of her home here, apparently the victim of accidental carbon mon oxide poisoning.

title: My Son the President Stirs a Retailer's Pride
description: When Bea Traub, Bonwit Teller's bouncy supersales woman and personal shop per, casually and invariably mentions my son the presi dent, she is referring to Marvin S. Traub, the presi dent of Bloomingdale's.

title: OPPOSITION GROUP SET IN PORTUGAL
description: LISBON, Dec. 12 (AP)The outline of an opposition party in the 1973 parliamentary elec tions, emerged over the week end as leaders of the group, called the Democratic Opposi tion, met to plan its congress for sometime next spring.

title: MRS. MADELEINE HERZOG
description: Mrs. Madeleine Schafer Her zog, former wife of Paul M. Herzog, former chairman of the National Labor Relations Board and more recently presi dent of the Salzburg Seminar in American Studies in Cam bridge, Mass., died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. She was 66 years old and lived at 100 Park Avenue.

title: Excess Verbiage
description: These days, when teachers are no longer needed or when there is not enough money in the budget to keep them on the local table of organization, they are not transferred or laid off or dismissed; they are excessed.

title: Memorial for Mrs. Stetten
description: A memorial meeting for Mrs. Alice Stetten, who was liaison officer of the International Council of Women at the Uni ted Nations, will be held to morrow at 3 P.M. on the sec ond floor of the Carnegie Building at 345 East 46th Street.

title: Residents Fight Bank's Closing Of Branch at 81st and Columbus
description: Despite strong community protests, the Chemical Bank said yesterday that it would go ahead with plans to close its branch office at 441 Columbus Avenue, at the corner of 81st Street.

title: Hermine Bartee, Soprano, Makes Recital Debut Here
description: Hermine Bartee made a pre mature New York recital debut late Sunday afternoon at Car negie Recital Hall. The soprano was born in Mississippi, grew up in Texas and studied here. She showed a commendable feeling for most of the music she sang, looked attractive and boasts a warmly pleasant quali ty to her middle register. But she still has innumerable tech nical problems to iron out.

title: Extortion Suspect Seized
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Dec. 12 (AP)Alton Cyril McCorquo dale, 21 years old, of Windsor, Ont., has been jailed here on a charge of attempting to extort $100,000 from the Fontaine bleau Hotel with a bomb threat.

title: Senate Minority Leader Seeks To Run for Governor in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12  The State Senate's minority leader, J. Edward Crabiel, announced his candidacy today for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: Notes on People
description: There's no business like show business, they say. Take, for example, the per formance at the Royal Alex andra Theater in Toronto Monday night of a revival of the 1919 musical comedy Irene, starring Debbie Reyn olds. A few hours before the curtain, Miss Reynolds dis closed that she had lost her voice. But no star was to be born, as her understudy, Janie Sell, said she wasn't ready to fill in. So Miss Reynolds, speechless, walked and danced through her part. John Gielgud, the Shake spearean actorturneddirec tor of Irene, provided an impromptu synopsis of the plot. The show is scheduled to open Sunday in Philadel phia.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your editorial of Nov. 22 describing the Indian occupation of the Bureau of Indian Affairs bore little resem blance to descriptions of that incident as reported in various newspapers.

title: BIG BOARD STUDIES OPPENHEIMER DATA
description: The New York Stock Ex change disclosed yesterday that it was investigating the cir cumstances under which a con fidential research report prepared at Oppenheimer & Co. may have enabled certain investors to capitalize on a sell off in hospital stocks.

title: 3 YOUTHS ARE SEIZED IN PROJECT SLAYING
description: A 51yearold man was found slain, his body mutilated, early yesterday in a 16thfloor stair well in the John Purroy Mitchel publichousing project in the Mott Haven section of the Bronx.

title: Agency Announces BoliviaU.S. Accord On Land TakeOver
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Government agency that insures United States corporate invest ments in lessdeveloped coun tries announced today an un usual settlement of a problem arising from the nationalization by Bolivia in 1971 of a United Statesowned lead and zinc property.

title: Murphy Frees Policemen From Arraignment Duty
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yes terday that beginning March 1 neither policemen nor complainants would be required to appear in court at the arraignment of defendants. The move, the authority for which was given the Police Department in 1970, would be a fundamental change in the way cases are processed in New York. City.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Knowlton Trial Delayed by Motion

title: ASTRONAUTS DRIVE ROVER TO FOOT OF A LUNAR PEAK, REPAIR FENDER WITH MAPS
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12  The Apollo 17 lunar explorers set out tonight on a bouncing ride among the boulders and craters to the foot of a steepwalled mountain southwest of the valley landing site.

title: Official Reports 2,000 Bengalis Held in Pakistani Jails
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 12 (AP)An official of the International Rescue Com mittee says that more than 2,000 Bengalis are in jail in Pakistan without charge and have none of the normal rights of prisoners. His report describes growing distress and deepening despondency in community forbidden to leave for Bangladesh.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In a frontpage story on Nov. 30 The Times reported that the Federal Power Commission stated this winter's shortage of natural gas would be twice as great as last winter's. Because the present curtailments by the natural gas industry are a complete reversal of its history of increased annual gas de liveries, the nation's gas users should question the reasons for this sudden cutback.

title: CANCER TEST SLATED FOR NEUTRON BEAMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Neutron beams will be used at the Naval Research Labora tory in an experimental pro gram to treat cancer patients, researchers announced today.

title: 70 Jailed in Kurdish Area
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  Seventy people were sentenced to jail today for separatist activities in Di yarbakir Province of southeast ern Turkey.

title: XEROX MONOPOLY ON OFFICE COPIERS CHARGED BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Government accused the Xerox Corporation today of illegally monopolizing the $1.7billion market for office copying ma chines.

title: Deck Officer Pact For the East Coast Reported Reached
description: An accord covering desk officers employed by 15 steamship companies based on the East and Gulf Coasts was announced yesterday by Capt. Thomas F. O'Callaghan, presi dent of the International Or ganization of Masters, Mates and Pilots.

title: All That Glitters Is Subtler Now
description: The backtonature movement has hit the florists this Christmas. Gone is most of the glitter and tinsel, the sequins and gold braid. In their placeon trees, wreaths, centerpieces and incidental decorationsare fruits, berries, nuts, pine cones, tree bark, roots, herbs, sea shells and flowers, Many of these are frankly fake, but the natural effect is there. Even the papier mch angels have been treated to look like wood.

title: Mayoralty for Sale?
description: If New York City's mayoralty contest develops into a crowd scene, as early indications suggest that it might, it will ?? be because the ticket of admission conies cheap. On the contrary, at least three of the prospective candidates for the nation's second toughest job frankly plan to spend more than $1 million apiece on their elec toral campaigns and no serious contender believes he can get by on less than $500,000 or so.

title: Foster E. Goodrich Dies at 64; Headed Stanley Home Products
description: CAMBRIDGE, N. Y., Dec. 12 Foster E. Goodrich, board chairman of Stanley Home Products, Inc., of Westfield, Mass., died today at Mary Mc Clellan Hospital. He was 64 years old.

title: Highway Inspector Indicted In Alleged Extortion Here
description: A 56yearold inspector for the city's Department of High ways who had been accused of trying to shake down a demoli tion contractor was indicted yesterday by a Bronx grand jury on charges of extortion and receiving unlawful gratui ties.

title: Spahn, Ford Among 44 Eligible for Hall of Fame
description: Eight new eligible players headed by Warren Spahn, Whitey Ford and Robin Rob erts appear on the Hall of Fame ballots placed in the mail yesterday to members of the Baseball Writers As sociation of America.

title: Pilgrim, Australian Entry, Captures Lead in Sailing
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 12 (AP)  The Australian yacht, Pilgrim, beat Germany's Ydra by 4 minutes 59 seconds today to win the second race in the One Ton Cup series and take a narrow overall points lead. The 130mile race carried 1.5 bonus ?? to give Pilgrim a total of 36.875 to Yara's 36.250.

title: Fishing Boat Is Sunk
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Dec. 12 (AP)A New Bedfordbased fishing boat, the Nautilus, sank in Buzzards Bay early today after a collision with a barge towing tug from Wilmington, Del. There were no injuries and apparently no leakage of cargo, the Coast Guard said.

title: SUIT ASKS OUSTER OF SCHOOL CHIEF
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12 Three New Jersey mothers of students at Girard College here asked a Federal District Court today to order the school's pres ident removed from office in favor of a receiver.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: BORDENTOWN, Dec. 12 Officials at the State Youth Correction Institution here said today that they had segregated 12 inmates as the possible in stigators of a prisoner uprising that was put down yesterday. Normal precedures were re stored today in the dormitory Qtyle institution that houses 661 inmates.

title: High School Bonds Voted
description: THIELLS, N. Y., Dec. 12 Voters in the North Rockland Central School District by a vote of 1,537 to 1,0133 passed a $4,965,0000 bond issue today to add a threestory structure to the high school.

title: Arms Talks Last 2 Hours
description: GENEVA, Dec. 12 (AP)  United States and Soviet nego tiators met for two hours to day, their longest meeting to date in the three weeks of the current phase of their talks on limitation of strategic arms.

title: Neediest Cases
description: Today's article on the 61st annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund appears on Page 65.

title: PENN CENTRAL ASKS TO DELAY ON RAISES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12 (AP)The bankrupt Penn Cen tral Transportation Company, worried that it might run out of cash next February or March, asked a Federal district judge today to delay wage increases for 44,000 employes until busi ness conditions improve in the spring.

title: LAURA PIERPONT
description: Latira Pierpont, a character actress whose last Broadway appearance was in Archibald MacLeish's J.B. in 1958, died Monday in a nursing home in New Canaan, Conn. The widow of Taylor Granville, an actor, she was 91 years old.

title: N. Y. Dean Named Head Of Community Service Unit
description: Alvin L. Schorr, dean of the New York University Graduate School of Social Work and a former deputy assistant secre tary of United States Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare, will become general director for the Community Service Society, one of the city's oldest and most influen tial social work agencies.

title: TEN PEEP SHOWS SEEKING PERMITS
description: Ten sexfilm peep shows about half the number believed to be operating in the midtown area have submitted applica tions for city permits under new licensing requirements. However, most of the required financial disclosures have not been provided by the applicants.

title: Dallas Curbs Religious Sect
description: DALLAS, Dec. 12 (UPI)The City Attorney, Alex Bickley, contending that the chanting and fingercymbalplaying fol lowers of Hare Krishna are dis turbing Christmas shoppers and businessmen, said today he had ordered the police to clear the religious group front a down town mall. Members of the sect, who wear robes and have their heads shaved and faces painted, chant and solicit funds from passersby.

title: Calcium Chloride Is Cited As Cause of Player Burns
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 12 (AP) Burns and bruises suffered by players in the St. Louis Cardi nalsLos Angeles Rams foot ball game at Busch Stadium Sunday were caused by cal cium chloride, a spokesman for the company that makes Astro Turf playing surfaces said to day.

title: JOHNSON MEDIATES A RIGHTS DISPUTE
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 12For mer President Lyndon B. John son, in a sudden and emotional return from retirement, re verted to his old role as mediator today as he quelled dispute between divided civil rights leaders.

title: In Defense of the Secretary: Truth Is We're Not Unhappy
description: Mrs. Margaret Dillon is a softspoken Alabaman with a gracious manner, a South ern drawl and an easy smile that makes one think she is a Complete stranger to anger.

title: Stage: Prideaux Last of Mrs. Lincoln
description: Julie Harris, pale, gaunt and gallant, received a stand ing ovation at the ANTA Theater last night. She was starring, indeed largely sup porting, a new play by James Prideaux called The Last of Mrs. Lincoln. The play is slightly oldfashioned some will find it none the worse for thatits texture is decidedly episodic, even patchy, yet it has spotlit mo ments of valid melodrama.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Routines Are Normal at Bordentown

title: $25 Sent to the Neediest In Lieu of Gift for Relatives
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Schaefer of New Hyde Park, L. I., sent $25 yesterday to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund in lieu of a material Christmas present for their son and daughterin law.

title: RISE IN GAS PRICE REFUSED BY F.P.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Federal Power Commission in a unanimous decision said today that it does not want to raise ceiling prices for natural gas already flowing to the inter state market. It also said that it does not want to impose a price ceiling on new gas sup plies.

title: Broadway Greets New Movie Theater
description: At 6:30 last night Mayor Lindsay stood on a red carpet on the sidewalk of Broadway between 43d and 44th Streets and pulled the switch that lit up the marquee that marked the opening of the National Theater.

title: Music: Berizi, a Stylish New Leader
description: The Metropolitan Opera is introducing an exceptional number of new conductors this season. The latest is Roberto Benzi, who made his debut here leading the sea son's first performance of Faust Monday night. A for mer prodigyhe conducted public concerts at the age of 10 in 1949he is French trained despite his Italian parentage, and he has con ducted at the Paris Opera.

title: McGovern Calls Eagleton Affair Saddest Part
description: Senator George McGovern last night called the Thomas Eagleton affair the saddest part of his unsuccessful Pres idential campaign and ques tioned the Missouri Senator's decision to accept the Vice Presidential nomination with out first divulging his serious medical history.

title: Rockefeller Calls a Fusion Race For Mayor Virtually Impossible
description: Sounding what is likely to be the death knell for a proposed fusion candidate for Mayor, Governor Rockefeller said yes terday that a multiparty coali tion behind a candidate would be virtually impossible next year.

title: Adelphi Wins, 7155
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. L. Dec. 12Don Galloway scored 24 points to lead Adelphi to a 7155 victory over New York Tech tonight. Bill Johnson added 15 points for the Pan thers, who raised their record to 42.

title: People in Sports: 2 Old Timers Step Down
description: Two longterm professional playing careers have appar ently come to an end. Hoyt Wilhelm, the knuckleball pitcher who, over 21 years, made more major league ap pearances than any other pitcher, has switched to man aging. Larry Wilson, the only member of the football Car dinals remaining from the team that started in St. Louis 13 years ago, has announced his retirement as a defensive back.

title: PARIS
description: PARIS, Dec. 12 Henry Kissinger has been living during the critical last days of the Vietnam peace talks in the old Rothschild house, now the Ameri can Embassy, at No. 41 Rue du Fau bourg St. Honore, down this glittering street from where President Pompidou of France resides in the Elysee Palace.

title: Business Briefs
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 12 (AP)State Treasurer Robert I. Berdon today invited the New York Stock Exchange's board of directors to meet in Connecticut.

title: NIXON HAD 2 AIDES FIGHT NEWS LEAKS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  The White House confirmed today that a twoman investi gative team, known jokingly as the White House plumbers, worked during 1971 at trying to plug news leaks concerning national security affairs and had a private telephone.

title: Villanova Paper's Funding Cut Off Over an Editorial
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12 Funding for the Villanova Uni versity student newspaper was canceled yesterday by the school's president, after the paper printed an editorial criti cal of a high university official.

title: Papp Much Ado Coming to TV On C.B.S. for 3 Hours on Feb.
description: Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival produc tion of Much Ado About Nothing will be presented in three hours of prime evening time over the Columbia Broad casting System television net work on Feb. 2, with the Inter national Business Machines Corporation the sole sponsor.

title: AIRLINES ASSAILED BY STEWARDESSES
description: The airline hostess who tells the departing passenger, It was nice to have you aboard, sir, may be, behind her smile, a closet feminist on the verge of adding: And you acted like a male chauvinist pig.

title: Orbiting Craft Is Probing Moon's Interior by Radio
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12While two astronauts are carrying out the final moon walks of the Apollo program, their colleague, Comdr. Ronald E. Evans, is probing the moon from orbit with a radio sounding system that, it is believed, can pene trate threequarters of a mile or more into the lunar interior.

title: Italian Government Aides Walk Off Jobs in 2 Areas
description: ROME, Dec. 12 A series of strikes troubled Italy today.

title: New Leader of Midshipmen
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 12 (AP)  Charles P. Voith of San Antonio, Tex., has been named commander of the brigade of midshipmen at the United States Naval Academy. He takes over the top leadership position among the 4,200 mid shipmen from Charles L. Munns, also of San Antonio, who served as brigade comman der from Sept. 11 to Dec. 4.

title: Park Board Commissioner Upset in Great Neck Voting
description: GREAT NECK, L.I., Dec. 12 Richard Winston upset Mrs. Florence J. Mangan, the in cumbent, in a Park Board Commissioners' election here today.

title: That Is Orange, Jack
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Following are excerpts from comments tonight between Mission Control here and Capt. Eugene A. Cernan and Dr. Harrison H. Schmitt on the moon as the astronauts encountered orange soil on the rim of the crater Shorty:

title: Weicker Offers Broad Bill to Guard News Sources
description: A detailed bill aimed at pro tecting newsmen's confidential sources was offered yesterday by Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut, who said he had written the measure to satisfy the objec tions voiced against the 20 or more bills submitted in the last session of Congress.

title: Suffolk Shelves Plan For Park at Montauk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 12 The Suffolk County Legis lature, at the recommenda tion of County Executive John V. N. Klein, voted today to postpone indefinitely the taking of 980 acres of land at Montauk for a county park.

title: Man in the News
description: One of the six men present at the formation of the Grum man Corporation in 1929, a year when the nation was in deep economic trouble, was Edwin Clinton Towl, Today he is chairman and chief ex ecutive of that disturbed company, surrounded by the affluence of its Long Island home.
