Mr. Towl (pronounced toll) is now 67 years old. He was just out of Cornell, with two years of Wall Street experience at the W. E. Burnett Company, when he joined the team that launched Long Island's larg est business, a giant of the defense and aerospace indus try.

title: 2,500 IN JAIL HERE TO GET HEARINGS
description: All 2,500 defendants who are in jail awaiting action in State Supreme Courts in Manhattan and the Bronx are to be given special hearings this Month so they can make any requests they want on any subject con cerning their cases.

title: Senate Hearings Set
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 A Senate subcommittee is plan ning hearings when Congress meets in January to look into the Grumman Aerospace Cor poration's refusal to proceed on its contract to build fighter planes for the Navy.

title: Massachusetts U. Students Leave Building After Order
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 12 (AP)An interracial group of students who had occupied the University of Massachusetts School of Education since Fri day obeyed a court order to night and vacated the building without incident.

title: VATICAN FOCUSES ON NEW CARDINALS
description: ROME, Dec. 12The talk in the highvaulted corridors of the Vatican these days is about new Cardinals.

title: 23 Food Outlets Cited for Violating City's Health Code
description: The Health Services Admin istration cited 23 more food processing establishments yes terday for failure, without valid reason, to correct violations of the city's Health Code found on two subsequent visits by health inspectors.

title: Fanny May Commitments Issued at Higher Yield
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (Reu ters)  The Federal National Mortgage Association said to day it had issued $42.4million of fourmonth mortgage com mitments at an average yield of 7.863 per cent. The average price was 95 for the 7 per cent FHAVA home mortgages.

title: ALBANY CRITICIZED ON CONTRACTING
description: ALBANY, Dec. 12 Private contractors do work for the City of Albany that clearly could be performed by city personnel, an accountant for the, State Commission of In vestigation testified today.

title: Pathet Lao Side Proposes a New Peace Package and the Vientiane Government Terms It Interesting
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 12 Pathet Lao negotiators today offered a new draft for a peace agreement in Laos that, a Com munist spokesman asserted, could end the war immediately if accepted by the Vientiane Government.

title: Newspaper Editor Named
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 12 (AP)William B. Smart, execu tive editor and assistant general manager of the Deseret News, was named today as its editor and general manager.

title: Peeping Tom Law Valid Despite SexBias Plea
description: JACKSON, Miss, Dec. 12 (UPI)  The State Supreme Court ruled yesterday that Mississippi's peeping torn law is valid even though it applies only to males.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 12 (UPI) A Superior Court judge ordered a North Bergen ceme tery today to restore at its own expense gravestones and monu ments it had knocked down or buried.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mistrial Disappoints the Ellsberg Jury
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 It was Daniel Ellsberg's be lief that the long delay in his trial had caused the jury to become prejudiced against him. Today he tested his theory in the courthouse corridor.

title: GULF & WESTERN SEES SHARP RISE IN PROFIT
description: Earnings of Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., will reach at least $1 a share for the second fiscal quarter ending Jan. 31, a new high for any quarter and 27.2 per cent above a year earlier, Charles G. Bluhdorn, chairman, told some 500 share holders at yesterday's annual meeting of the diversified in dustrial company.

title: Policeman in Belfast Killed
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Wednesday, Dec. 13 (UPI) Gunmen fired 25 bullets into a policeman as he stepped out of a Belfast hotel early today, killing him in the latest wave of killings in Northern Ireland, the British Army said.

title: Puerto Ricans Here Strive to Create a Culture of Their Own
description: In Culture with a capital C and in culture, lower case, young Puerto Ricans here are groping toward a new identity.

title: Lombardi's Mother Dies
description: HAZLET, N. J., Dec. 12 (AP)  Mrs. Matilda Lombardi, mother of the late professional football coach Vince Lombardi, died today in the King James Nursing Home in Middletown. She was 81 years old. Mrs. Lombardi, widow of Harry Lom bardi, lived here with a daugh ter, Mrs. Claire Brandshagen. She leaves also another daugh ter, Mrs. George Werner, and two sons, Harold and Joseph J.

title: NO U.S. COMMENT ON THIEU'S SPEECH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Nixon Administration refused any public comment today on President Nguyen Van Thieu's speech setting forth Saigon's objections to the Paris peace talks and his own proposals for ending the Vietnam war.

title: PREGNANCY TESTS HEED UNRELIABLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  The Food and Drug Admin istration announced today that thousands of do  it  yourself pregnancy detection kits were being recalled because the agency had found that they were unreliable.

title: Harrison Schmitt Day Slated
description: SILVER CITY,. N.M., Dec. 12 (UPI)Mayor Kenneth Wallin says his small New Mexico town will celebrate Apollo 17's return with a Harrison Schmitt Day. Mr. Schmitt, born at near by Santa Rita, was reared in Silver City and his mother still lives here. Mr. Wallin said that the day of the celebration would be announced later.

title: Ricord's Lawyer Calls Him a Sick Man
description: The defense lawyer for Au guste Joseph Ricord painted a picture of him yesterday as a sickly man interested only in his motel and restaurant busi ness ness in Latin America instead of the international heroin traf ficker portrayed by the Govern ment.

title: Books of The Times
description: On Monday, this column briefly de scribed nine children's picture booksthe best of all those published in 1972 that I looked at. Here now is a roundup of the best of those children's books published this year that depend primarily on words to tell their stories or make their points. They are ordered roughly according to their degree of so phistication, with the simplest first. Frog and Toad Together, writ ten and illustrated by Arnold Lobel (Harper & Row, 64 pages, $2.50). Looking back, I could kick myself for not having recommended two years ago Mr. Lo bel's Frog and Toad Are Friends, a won derfully simple and funny series of episodes about a droll friendship, whose charm has only increased with the passage of time. (I think what scared me off originally was the book's being labeled An I CAN READ Book and my disincli nation to debate whether beautiful and laughed are really ICANREAD words.) Anyway, as penance for that failure of nerve I must hereby recommend Mr. Lo bel's sequel, which like most sequels it not as good as the original, but which, on the other hand, is vastly superior to Dick and Jane and Hop on Pop.

title: Proper Staffing for All the Courts
description: WASHINGTONThis is a good oc casion to pause and look back over some of the developments in recent years in the area of our common concernthe administration of justice.

title: L. I. Republicans Act
description: Four Long Island Republicans said yesterday they would take action in the next Congress to reverse Monday's Defense De partment move to hold the Grumman Corporation to the original contract price for 48 more F14 Navy fighter planes.

title: CRABIEL PLANNING GOVERNORSHIP BID
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12  Thel State Senate's minority lead er, J. Edward Crabiel, an nounced his candidacy today for the Democratic nomina tion for Governor.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)Soaring wheat prices this year, plus Government payments, have made the crop worth a record $3.4billion, shattering the old mark $3.1billion set 25 years ago.

title: State Applying for Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  While the Lindsay administra tion went to court today to try to block the Nixon Administra tion from cutting back on funds for wastetreatment plants, the Rockefeller administration took a more direct approach to the problem.

title: Ground Is Broken for TennesseeTombigbee Channel
description: LIVINGSTON, Ala., Dec. 12 Gov. Geoge C. Wallace pressed a lever on a speaker's platform here today and deto nated a 100pound dynamite blast at Gainesville, Ala., break ing ground for the longde layed Tennessee Tombigbee Wateways.

title: CITY'S HOSPITALS ATTRACT INTERNS
description: By the time Edgar Milford reached his senior year at Har vard Medical School two years ago, his immediate career choice was clear to him: He would go to Harlem Hospital Center as an interne.

title: People and Business
description: What's in a name? Well, one of the provisions in the agreement between Macmil lan, Ltd., of London and Cm wellCollier and Macmillan, Inc., permitting the Ameri can company to change its name to Macmillan, Inc., on Jan. 1 forbids it to use cer tain words in connection with its British subsidiary.

title: G.A.O. Says Heroin Smuggling Is Too Sweeping to Halt at Borders
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (Reu ters)  Government auditors ended today a yearlong inves tigation into heroin smuggling by concluding that traffic in the drug was too big to stop at United States borders.

title: Advertising:
description: Murray B. Hirsch, the 41 yearold certified public ac countant who two months ago became president of Bond Stores, is going to lead the 63yearold apparel chain into its firgt extended broadcast advertising effort.

title: Rise in Radiation Prompts Restriction at Atomic Plant
description: VERNON, Vt., Dec. 12 (AP) For the second time in five weeks, the Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Corporation re stricted access to its generating plant site today because of higher than normal levels of radiation in the area of the turbine building.

title: Miranda Granted Parole
description: PHOENIX, Ariz. Dec. 12 (AP) Ernest A. Miranda, whose 1963 kidnapping and rape con viction was overturned by the United States Supreme Court in one of its most celebrated rul ings, has been granted a parole from State Prison. After the Supreme Court ruling, he was retried and sentenced again on both charges.

title: LANDSALE PRESSURE ON G.I.'S ALLEGED
description: BONN, Dec. 12 (UPI)  A United Slates servicemen's newspaper said yesterday that American real estate concerns were using high pressure sales tactics and unethical gimmicks to sell land sightunseen to overseas soldiers.

title: Screen: Weird Pupils of Child's Play
L. I. Republicans Act
description: Four Long Island Republicans said yesterday they would take action in the next Congress to reverse Monday's Defense De partment move to hold the Grumman Corporation to the original contract price for 48 more F14 Navy fighter planes.

title: Laird Asks for Exemptions From Ban on Promotions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that he was asking that prisoners of war and the missing in action be exempted from a White House ordered freeze on promotions.

title: About Pro Football
description: The loss of a playoff posi tion and their division title as a consequence of the de feat by the Green Bay Pack ers was a bitter blow to the Minnesota Vikings, although there had been plenty of hints earlier that this was not to be their season. After all, Bill Malinchak of Washington blocked the Vi kings' first punt last Sept. 18 and turned it into a touchdown for the victorious Redskins. The Vikings lost in the last minute to Miami. The reliable Fred Cox missed a winning field goal against St. Louis and a tying field goal against Chicago and equally reliable Bill Brown lost fum bles that led to winning scores by Pittsburgh and Green Bay.

title: Wilson Seeks G.O.P. Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Representative Bob Wilson of California announced today that he would seek reelection as chairman of the National Republican Congressional Com mittee.

Evans is probing the moon from orbit with a radio sounding system that, it is believed, can pene trate threequarters of a mile or more into the lunar interior.

title: 15 to Die for Clove Smuggling
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania Dec. 12 (UPI)  Fifteen persons have been sentenced to death for clove smuggling, the Zan zibar Government announced today. The announcement said that the defendants  11 Ken yans and four Tanzanianshad pleaded guilty. A mandatory death sentence was introduced for clove smuggling in an ef fort to stop the traffic, which is estimated to cost the Govern men $2.3million a year.

title: LEAKING OF REPORT ON INQUIRY IS DENIED
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 12 (UPI) A spokesman for the state commission investigating the killing of two Southern Univer sity students said today that no member of the commission had leaked an article concern ing the group's findings. He also said the 12member bi racial panel would return to work tomorrow in hopes of completing its interim report this week.

title: TENTATIVE PACT MADE IN STRIKE OF LIQUOR UNIONS
description: A tentative agreement was reached last night aimed at ending the sixweekold strike by warehousemen, clerks and drivers that has reduced the supply of namebrand liquors in the city and a 50mile ad joining area in New York State.

title: Dean Named at Labor School
description: Prof. Lois S. Gray has been named assistant dean for Ex tension and Public Service at the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations at Cornell University. Profes sor Gray has also been named associate director of the school's extension division.

title: Scenario for Tragedy
description: The emerging script at Southern University sounds depressingly familiar. After an extended period of stu dent unrest, the climactic confrontation with Louisiana state police and local sheriff's deputies last month ended with the death of two students. Lawenforcement officers quickly denied responsibility for the tragedy and offered evidence that none of their men had used firearms. Stories about shots fired by students or snipers were intended to show how the peace forces had merely defended their lives.

title: Kicking Around Corporal Punishment
description: SOUTH DEVON, EnglandI want kids to sit up and pay attention before we start. I'm a bit formal about this. And they were sitting around all over the place not paying much attention, so I said: Right, sit up, face the front. They got around to it and were sitting up facing the front, except for this one boy that was obviously dif ferent to the rest.

title: FLU CASES REPORTED IN 5 BIG U.S. CITIES
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 12 (UPI) Isolated cases of an influenza closely resembling the new type English flu for which there is no specific vaccine have been confirmed in five major Ameri can cities.

title: Japan Eases Embargoes
description: TOKYO, Dec. 12 (AP)The Japanese Government decided today to reduce or relax em bargoes on exports of 68 indus trial products to Communist countries, effective Jan. 1.

title: Ideological Wall Is Target in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Dec. 12When a man phoned the internal rev enue office in West Berlin's Charlottenburg borough about a tax problem the other day, the operator told him the entire staff was away for the day.

title: Firm Is Penalized for Role hi. Marketing Pennsy Stock
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday Washington ordered Butcher & Sherrerd, a Philadelphia brokerage firm, to suspend solicitation of retail sales for 10 business days, beginning Jan. 8, 1973.

title: Neediest Cases
description: Today's article on the Gist annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund appears on Page 65.

description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 12 (AP)  The Danish De fense Ministry said today that an unidentified submarine was believed to be operating deep inside Greenland's fiords under cover of the long polar night.

description: State Senator John D. Caem rnerer, chairman of the Joirtt Legislative Committee on Transportation, proposed arbi tration yesterday as a way of settling the strike of 5,000 non operating employes of the Long Island Rail Road.

title: Even in the Hospital, Bench Is Still Breaking Records
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 12 (UPI) Johnny Bench of the Cincin nati Reds, recuperating from lung surgery at Christ Hospital is receiving an average of 2,000 letters a day. The catcher is receiving the most mail of any patient we've had here at the hospital since I've been on the job, Joe McCarthy, supervisor of the hospital's mail room, said today.

title: U.S. Funds Barred for Road to Montana Resort
description: BUTTE, Mont., Dec. 12A Federal judge ruled yesterday that Federal funds could not be used to build a road into the center of the Big Sky re sort.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12A group of black Newark residents who pitted themselves against the Newark police and won $1,250 in punitive damages from an allwhite jury went back to court today to ask for more. Charging that their apartments were illegally ransacked by the police in searches for bank robbers who were not there, they are seeking a new trial, for compensatory damages.

title: ISRAELI TRIAL OPENS IN '42 POLISH DEATH
description: HAIFA, Israel, Dec. 12 (AP) After a 30year search, an American businessman has opened court proceedings against a man he accuses of killing his grandfather while collaborating with the Nazis.

title: Esther C. Stamats, ExHead Of Episcopal Unit on Aging
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Esther C. Stamats; from 1961 to 1963 director of services for the aging  in the Protestant Diocese of New York, died yes terday at her home in Alexan dria, Va, Her age was 79.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Albany Waste Seen In Contract Work

title: 100 Seagulls Found Dead
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 12 (AP) About 100 dead seagulls were found today on the Langley Air Force Base golf course, and autopsies were being per formed to determine what killed them.

title: Modified Controls Are Favored By Labor and Business Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  Leaders of organized labor indi cated today that they were amenable to President Nixon's decision to extend wage and price controls but only if some changes were made.

title: House Panel Ends Study of Disorders On Ships in Pacific
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 12A Congressional subcommittee in vestigating racial disorders aboard ships of the Pacific Fleet ended a twoweek inquiry here today with testimony from three crew members of the air craft carrier Kitty Hawk.

title: Coast Man Leaps to Death
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Dec. 12 (AP)  A 65yearold man was fatally injured when he jumped from the top floor of the burning Carmel Hotel here. Two persons were hospitalized and 35 others, most of them el derly, were evacuated safely. The coroner's office said Walter Neumann leaped from the build ing's fourth floor last night and died about three hours later. Two women residents, Diane Leeka, 38, and Lucille Farmee, 69, were hospitalized for treat ment of smoke inhalation.

title: Gambling Odds
description: The numbers racket is a form of gambling that thrives on the nickels and dimes of the poor. How it feeds organized crime at the expense of the most deprived of New York's citizens has been indicated in a recent study financed by the Department of Justice. It shows a sustained sevenyear growth in the policy take in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, where slum dwellers bet $26 million on the numbers in 1970 alone.

title: Advertising:
description: Considering that Mazda Mo tors was only in 20 states at the time, it was interesting to note that the company ranked 83d among users of spot television during the third quarter, What does that portend for the future?

title: SAIGON REPORTS HANOI UNIT FLEES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 13 (AP) Ground action in South Viet nam was reported at a low level yesterday, and infiltrat ing North Vietnamese troops who had come under strong attack northwest of Saigon were said to be fleeing back to Cambodia.

title: SUGAR FUTURES HIT TRADING PEAK
description: In hectic trading on the New York Coffee and Sugar Ex change yesterday a record 11, 261 world sugar contracts changed hands, making It the blisiest day on the exchange since December 15, 1971, when 11,110 contracts traded.

title: Live Grenade in Mail
description: SALINA, Kan., Dec. 2 (AP) A live hand grenade mailed Ito a secretary for the South western Bell Telephone Com pany, was deactivated today by a bomb squad about two hours after the package was received. Company officials, who declined to identify the secretary, said that she real ized as the package was behig unwrapped that it contained grenade with the pin pulled and the detonator held in place by a short piece of string.

title: Screen: 'Poseidon Adventure' Arrives:Liner Disaster Opens the National Theater Hackman, as Minister, Leads Group to Safety
description: Someone else's disaster is nearly always fascinating from a reassuring distance. And the maritime cataclysm in "The Poseidon Adventure," which last night opened Broadway's newest showcase, the National Theater (the film is also at the Beekman), is that kind of comforting catastrophe. Most of us are happily far removed from the rare personal experience of having been trapped in a capsized liner. But though tensions slacken and credibility is strained here, realistic technical effects make the stricken ship and the efforts of its survivors to escape a fairly spellbinding adventure.If the likes of "Titanic" and "Airport" come to mind, it's due to Ronald Neame's workmanlike direction, which accents the script's physical aspects. The "Poseidon," headed for Greece and a wrecking yard on her final, trans-Atlantic voyage is obviously a doomed, seagoing Grand Hotel. And, even when she's overturned by that 90-foot wave, the ship is just as interesting as the terrified, sodden few who desperately struggle upward through a vast, mechanical labyrinth toward her exposed hull and freedom.The authentic opulence of a stately liner has been caught in scenes shot abroad the Queen Mary now permanently berthed in Long Beach, Calif. But the film's constructions of an 'inverted' main dining room, a barber shop, a bathroom and flooded staterooms and engine rooms are equally striking. And simulated terror is given impact by such sequences as the overturning of that dining room and the beleaguered survivors' scrambling and swimming through frighteningly claustrophobic, burning or flooded interiors.The script's simplistic message about the necessity of clinging to life is somewhat less than original, but Gene Hackman is fairly convincing as the stridently physical, militantly liberated minister who forcibly leads the group to safety. An amazingly fat Shelley Winters and Jack Albertson, as a couple en route to Israel, and their grandchildren, contribute a touching vignetta or two in a big cast largely seen in bit roles.Ernest Borgnine, constantly at odds with Hackman, is muscular and earthy as a detective married to Stella Stevens, who plays a refreshingly outspoken, decorative exprostitute.They dominate the merely adequate portrayals of the others clutching for life, including Carol Lynley, as a fear-chilled pop singer; Red Buttons, as a bachelor haber-dasher who aids her; Roddy McDowall, as a wounded steward; and a teen-ager. Pamela Sue Martin, and Eric Shea as her self-sufficient kid brother.Who does or doesn't survive here is, in short, a good deal less gripping than the graphic way it's done.

title: State Gain of $97Million Gets Off to a $11,300 Loss
description: ALBANY, Dec. 12  The State of New York was $11, 300 poorer today and $97 million richer thanks to Fed eral revenue sharing and a Chaplinesque rush by air and land to obtain the signature of Governor Rockefeller on the back of a check.

title: U.S. SUED BY CITY ON POLLUTION AID
description: The city yesterday sued the Federal Government, charging that President Nixon's $6bil lion slash in Federal antipollu tion funds for the next, 18 months was unconstitutional. The suit demanded that the money be restored.

title: ASTRONAUTS, ON 2D DAY, FIND ORANGE LUNAR SOIL; COLLECT ANCIENT ROCKS
description: HOUSTON, Wednesday, Dec. 13The Apollo 17 astronauts completed their second explora tion of the lunar surface early today after gathering ancient rocks at the foot of a mountain and discovering some orange soil, the biggest scientific sur prise thus far in the mission.

title: PRISONERS LEARN TO TRAIN ANIMALS
description: CHINO, Calif., Dec. 12  Gerald Gindcr was a longtime convict, a threetime loser. To day he is curator of Sarasota Jungles, a bird sanctuary in Florida.

title: Denny Stolz Gets Michigan State Post
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Dec. 12 (UPI)  Michigan State's defensive coordinator, Denny Stolz, was named head football coach today, suc ceeding Duffy Daugherty, who retired after 19 years as coach.

title: St. John's Stays Unbeaten
description: Unbeaten St. John's turned; back stubborn Rhode Island, 8575, before 2,617 at the Red men's Jamaica campus.

title: Raiders Lose Morenz; Injury Is Not Serious
Mistrial Disappoints the Ellsberg Jury
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 It was Daniel Ellsberg's be lief that the long delay in his trial had caused the jury to become prejudiced against him. Today he tested his theory in the courthouse corridor.

title: Stink Bombs Are Set Off At the Moscow Circus
description: Thirty stink bombs were set off at last night's per formance of the Moscow Cir cus at Madison Square Gar den's Felt Forum, the police said, but the show was not disrupted.

title: BRITISH SET PLAN ON BIRTH CONTROL
description: LONDON, Nov. 12  Britain is to extend family planning services to include free con traceptives for all with special social or financial needs.

title: U.N. Defaults
description: When the United Nations shelved proposals to launch effective machinery against world terrorism, the real loser was the United Nations itself.

title: Giuffre Trio Back With a Difference: A Drummer Added
description: Jimmy Giuffre was consid ered one of the oddballs of the jazz world in the nineteen fifties because he insisted on forming trios without that seeming essential of any jazz group, a drummer. Now, after several years without a regular group, Mr. Giuffre is back in the trio business again and this time his threesome in cludes a drummer  Randy Kaye, who is described by Mr. Giuffre as the kind of drum mer I wanted all those years when I didn't have a drummer.

title: Rockefeller Calls a Fusion Race For Mayor Virtually Impossible
description: Sounding what is likely to be the death knell for a proposed fusion candidate for Mayor, Governor Rockefeller said yes terday that a multiparty coali tion behind a candidate would be virtually impossible next year.

title: 2 Harlem Political Groups Form Legislative Coalition
description: Jesse Gray, newly elected Assemblyman from the 70th Assembly District, and Charles L. Taylor, a Manhattan City Councilman, announced yester day the merging of their polit ical organizations to form a coalition dedicated to satisfy ing the needs and aspirations of grassroots people.

title: FUND CHIEF GIVES TAX CREDIT PLAN
description: Alan Pifer, president of the Carnegie Corporation of New York, has proposed a consider able enlargement of the tax savings that many individuals can realize when they make contributions to charity.

title: Jordanian Tax on Imports From West Bank Disputed
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 12 A Jordanian Government deci sion to impose a 12 per cent tax on all imports from the Israelioccupied West Bank has stirred a dispute between Am man and West Bank business men.

title: Equity Financing
description: A secondary offering of 247,300 beneficial shares of First Mortgage Investors at 27 was offered and completed yesterday by underwriters managed by Goldman Sachs, Blyth Eastman Dillon and Paine Webber. First Mortgage Investors closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 27, down .

title: Forman Plans End Of Its White Whisky
description: The BrownForman Distillers Corporation plans to discontin ue making its white whisky, Frost 880, introduced only two years ago, it was announced yesterday.

title: Former Navy Secretary Heads Airline Association
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)  Paul Ignatius, former Sec retary of the Navy, was named today president of the Air Transport Association, a trade organization representing the major scheduled airlines.

title: Jersey Mail Facility Stirring Controversy
description: KEARNY, N. J., Dec. 12  The world's biggest, most com plex and largely automated bulk mail facility, which opened June 1 and is weathering its first Christmas mailing season by processing double its daily capacity, had its hectic routine disturbed today by a series of planned confrontations be tween postal workers union of ficials and postal authorities.

title: Air Pollution Units Pose Conflict lssue
For Basques, the FrenchSpanish Border Is an Affront
description: AZPEITIA, Spain, Dec. 8 Basque nationalism is increas ingly ignoring the border be tween France and Spain  a border that Basques deem an affront to their divided and un sovereign nationand is posing related problems to Spain and France.

title: Nassau Corrections Officer Found Guilty of Misconduct
description: MINEOLA, LI., Dec. 12  Arthur J. Scherl, a Nassau County correction officer, was found guilty today of official misconduct and of promoting prison contraband for alleged ly smuggling two miniature bottles of brandy into the jail for Charles Diumberto, an in matc.

title: PREMIER'S POLICY BACKED IN EGYPT
description: CAIRO, Dec. 12 (Reuters) The Egyptian Parliament to day approved a major Govern ment policy statement, but only after two days of debate dur ing which there was unusual criticism of Premier Aziz Si sky's Government.

title: XEROX MONOPOLY ON OFFICE COPIERS CHARGED BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Government accused the Xerox Corporation today of illegally monopolizing the $1.7billion market for office copying ma chines.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The photograph of Prof. Samuel L. Popkin, handcuffed (your front page of Nov. 22) has brought again most vividly to my mind what I and many others have repeatedly felt. Perhaps the law of the country made it impos sible to dismiss the charges against Professor Popkin. Nevertheless, his prison sentence will be cited in later descriptions of this historical period among the examples of the persecu tion of scientists.

title: S.P.C.A. Takes Wild Dog Chase
description: Roundup time has come in the city's parks for packs of stray dogs, most of them lean, hungry, unlicensed or abandoned and many just lost.

title: Britain, East Europe Report Outbreak of Cattle Disease
description: LONDON, Dec. 12 (AP)  Outbreaks of footandmouth disease were reported today in Britain and Eastern Europe.

title: U.F.T. PLANS GROUP TO PRESS FOR FUNDS
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, said yesterday that his union would seek to form a coalition of citizens groups to press for restoration of money lost to school budget cuts.

title: Police Chief Killed And Second Is Shot In Vermont Robbery
description: MANCHESTER, Vt., Dec. 12 (AP)  One police chief was killed and another was wound ed tonight during an attempted robbery of a drugstore in this southwestern Vermont town.

title: AXEL G. JENSEN, LED BELL TV RESEARCH
description: Axel G. Jensen, who retired in 1958 as director of visual and acoustics research at the Bell Laboratories in Murray Hill, N. J,. died Monday in a hospital in Mountain View, Calif. He was 75 years old and had been living in Sunnyvale, Calif.

title: Rites Mark Crossing Of Equator by Carrier
description: ABOARD U.S.S. TICON DEROGA, Dec. 12 (AP)The Apollo 17 primary recovery ship crossed the equator to day, marking the occasion with a highspirited initiation for those making the cross ing for the first time.

title: J. P. MORGAN CITES FOREIGN PROFIT RISE
description: Sharply rising profits from international banking have ac counted for all of the gain in earnings that J. P. Morgan Re Co., Inc., parent company of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, has reported so far this year, the company told & meeting of security analysts yesterday.

title: STOCK MARGIN DEBT ON BIG BOARD RISES
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that stock margin debt at mem ber organizations had risen $90million to a record $7.39 billion at the end of November. Stock margin debt is the money owed by customers who buy stock on margin, or with loans.

title: Bus Plunge in Java Kills 45
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 12 (AP)Fortyfive persons were killed and 13 were injured yes terday when a bus fell 23 feet off a road and caught fire in Slogoimo, in central Java, the newspaper Berita Buana re ported today.

title: Market Place: The 3d Market And Investors
description: There are no doubt many investors who are consider ing dealing with nonmember brokerage firmsfirms that buy and sell in the overthe counter market stocks that are listed on the exchanges and other secuirties.

title: Thais Said to Order Curbs On ExChinese Nationalists
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 12 (Reuters)The ruling National Executive Council has ordered the armed forces to clamp down on former Chinese Nationalist troops that are reported to have taken control of remote areas in northern Thailand, informed sources said today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISJack Lynch, the spry, ath letic Taoiseach or Prime Minister of the Irish Republic, has confounded those critics who called him too weak and easygoing by now giving Dublin the most vibrant display of political leadership it has seen in years.

title: Scribner Orders a New Canarsie SchoolZoning Plan
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner yesterday ordered the local school board for the East Flatbush and Canarsie sections of Brooklyn to come up with a new zoning plan that would bring more nearly equal inte gration at three junior high schools in the district.

title: Bartenders in Milwaukee Almost Double in 2 Years
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 12 (UPI) The number of bartenders here has almost doubled since 1970.

title: Stocks Decline on the Amex and OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Eyclirmae or in ?? overthecounter market took a beating yesterday as ?? clines outnumbered advances by about 21.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Helmut Wakeham states in his Dec. 2 letter that cigarette smoke in air planes is not detrimental to the health of the nonsmoker because airplanes are exceptionally wellventilated. He forgets, however, that concentrations only mildly annoying to nonsmokers can have serious effects on a con siderable number of people allergic to tobacco smoke.

title: Conviction of Jack Upheld In Case of Harlem Union
description: The conviction of Assembly man Hulan E. Jack and two co defendants was upheld here yesterday in a case involving illegal payments from employ ers to union representatives in Harlem.

title: 5.7% at Pentagon Get Pay and Pensions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) A Civil Service Commission study shows that 5.7 per cent of the Defense Department's work force is made up of re tired military personnel who collect pensions as well as reg ular paysomething retired ci vilians are not allowed to do.

title: DRUGABUSE FILMS TERMED HARMFUL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  Richard M. Earle, president of the National Coordinating Council on Drug Education, said today that the majority of currently available films on drug abuse are doing more harm than good.

title: 3 Major British Banks Raise Prime Lending Rate
description: LONDON, Dec. 12 (AP)  Britain's three other major banks today followed the ex ample of National Westminster in raising their prime rate for interest charged on loans to their most creditworthy cus tomers.

title: THEODORE L. BRONSON
description: Theodore L. Bronson, a re tired stockbroker, died Monday at Doctors Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 140 East 56th Street.

title: JOHNSON MEDIATES A RIGHTS DISPUTE
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 12For mer President Lyndon B. John son, in a sudden and emotional return from retirement, re verted to his old role as mediator today as he quelled a dispute between divided civil rights leaders.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Remember the Jerry Grant hassle in the Indianapolis 500 last May? Grant finished sec ond, but race stewards bumped him to 12th because he had illegally refueled from the storage tank of his team mate, Bobby Unser. The rul ing made a difference of about $70,000 in Grant's share of the purse. Grant's car own er, Dan Gurney, contended the re fueling was an innocent error during a pit stop for a tire change and that Grant had enough fuel on board to fin ish. In the same race Mario Andretti and Dick Simon failed to finish because they had run out of fuel.

title: Cedric R. Lane, ExOfficer Of First National City Bank
description: Cedric Raymond Lane, who retired as a vice president of The First National City Bank in 1970, died Sunday in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L. I. He was 65 years old and lived in Plandome, L. I.

title: Merger News
description: Seaboard Coast Line Indus tries, Inc., announced yesterday that it had entered into discus sions whereby its subsidiary, the Seaboard Coast Line Rail road Company, would acquire the Carolina, Clinchfield & Ohio Railway.

title: ARABS'ARMY CHIEFS WARNED ON DISUNITY
description: CAIRO, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Egypt's War Minister, Gen. Ahmed Ismail, warned today that the lack of unified Arab military action would enable Israel to perpetuate her occu pation of Arab lands.

title: U.S. SUED BY CITY ON POLLUTION AID
description: The city yesterday sued the Federal Government, charging that President Nixon's $6bil lion slash in Federal antipollu tion funds for the next 18 months was unconstitutional. The suit demanded that the money be restored.

title: BIG BOARD DECRIES FORECASTS PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dce. 12 The New York Stock Exchange spelled out today a number of dangers that it sees in any plan permitting or requiring corpo rations to publish internal fore casts of sales and earnings.

title: Few Numbers Men Found to Use Jersey Lottery
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12  While some numbersgame operators have begun to use the daily New Jersey lottery for their payoffs, a random sampling shows that they are few and far between.

title: CURRENT PEACE SESSION NEAR END; THIEU'S SOVEREIGNTY BID AT ISSUE; U.S. LIKELY. TO SEND AIDE TO SEE HIM
description: PARIS, Wednesday, Dec. 13 The current phase of the Vietnam peace negotiations is coming to an end here with one difficult unresolved ques tion.

title: Sports of The Times
description: George Foreman, heavyweight champion of the 1968 Olympics, was already in the Overseas Press Club when Joe Frazier arrived with his bodyguards. The heavyweight champion of the world, who will defend his title against Foreman Jan. 22 in Kingston, Jamaica, has been training at the Playboy Club in McAfee, N. J., and the bodyguards he wore, one on each arm, were bunnies of provocative design, complete with long ears, cottontails and other accoutrements. On each of Frazier's pinkies gleamed a 100kilowatt diamond, but it wasn't these baubles that brought envy into Foreman's eyes. I want a bunny for myself, George would say later, explaining why he covets the championship, Not that the challenger lacks company now, Besides Dick Sadler, his manager, to keep him from getting lonesome, he has in his entourage Archie Moore, the old Mongoose who held the lightheavyweight championship into his dotage, and Sandy Saddler, the former featherweight champion. The old Mongoose wears graying muttonchop whiskers these days, which make him look even more the benevolent patriarch than he was as champion.

title: CASTRO FOES WARN OF MORE BOMBINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)An antiCastro organiza tion calling itself the Cuban Secret Government says It placed the bombs that dam aged a travel agency and three offices that handle packages for Cuba.

title: William Blackburn, Taught Writing Classes at Duke U.
description: William M. Blackburn, pro fessor emeritus of English at Duke University, died at the hospital there Saturday after long illness. He was 72 years old and lived in Durham.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NEW JERSEY
description: KEARNY, Dec. 12  The world's biggest, most complex bulk mail facility, which is weathering its first Christmas season by processing double its rated daily capacity, had its hectic routine disturbed today by a series of planned confron tations between postal workers, union officials and postal au thorities.

title: Blue Collar, White Collar: III
description: A Russian streetsweeper, an ardent believer in Communism, tells an in terviewer he does not personally mat ter as much as a party member; German office workers are reported often to feel humiliated by their clothes; American construction work ers tell a team of researchers they feel they have to give their sons cars in order to be respected as fathers. Without his possessions, every man walks with pride, preached the Abb de Sieys in 1790, but these working men and women of the modern world are not so sure. Just being a human being seems to them a state in which they are vulnerable. I suppose I am not as dignified, the Russian remarks, as people with more power and influence.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12  Despite maintaining his own pri vate practice and holding numerous other medical positions, Dr. Sam D'Ambola has found enough spare time to coach Essex Catholic High School to eight consecutive New Jersey State scholastic fencing championships.

title: 4 INDICTED ON L.I. IN PARKLAND SALE
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 12 The Suffolk County Attorn'ey, the deputy presiding officer of the County Legislature, his brother, who is a realestate broker, and the former Super visor of the Town of South ampton have been indicted on charges of official misconduct and grand larceny in connection with the county's purchase of waterfront land.

title: Firm Is Penalized for Role In Marketing Pennsy Stock
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday in Washington ordered Butcher & Sherrerd, a Philadelphia brokerage firm, to suspend solicitation of retail sales for 10 business days, beginning Jan. 8, 1973.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)Repre sentatives of the Geneva group of coffeeproducing countries met here tonight and agreed to fix the global quota of coffee exports for the coming three months at 11 million bags.

title: Another Jones Stars
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 12 (AP)Led by James Jones's 25, points, the Utah Stars whipped the Virginia Squires, 123104, tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: There is a solution to the crime emanating from the singles welfare hotels. It is roundtheclock surveil lancestructured housing.

title: Don Maynard: From Reject to a RecordBreaker
description: He will be 36 next month, an age when most wide re ceivers have become exwide receivers, but Don Maynard, who now has caught more passes than any other player in National Football League history, intends to continue his remarkable career with the New York Jets next sea son.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The State Division of Con sumer Affairs announced to day that a Burlington auto dealer had been fined $350 for misrepresenting the year of a used car sold to a Willingboro man.

title: U.N. Retains Cyprus Force
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 12  The Security Council voted, 14 to 0, today to extend for six months the stay of the United Nations peacekeeping force on Cyprus. The United Nations has had a force on the island since 1964 to prevent a renewal of fighting between the Turkish and Greek com munities and routinely extends its mandate every six months.

title: Charter Panel Is Told City Hall Controls Local Neighborhoods
description: The head of the neighbor hood government experiment in upper Manhattan told the commission to revise the City Charter yesterday that despite the decentralization theory all major decisions had to be made on high downtown.

title: HardRock Sextet, Rare Earth, Offers Energy and Cliches
description: The ads promised an eve ning with Rare Earth, and the unsuspecting might have anti cipated some genteel geologists' convention. No such luck. The ecologically fashionable name actually denotes a hardrock sextet from Detroit by way of Los Angeles that manages to forcefeed every heavy in strumental clich imaginable down the willing throats of its audiences.

title: CURRENT PEACE SESSION NEAR END; THIEU'S SOVEREIGNTY BID AT ISSUE; U.S. LIKELY TO SEND AIDE TO SEE HIM
description: PARIS, Wednesday, Dec. 13 The current phase of the Vietnam peace negotiations is coming to an end here with one difficult unresolved ques tion.

title: AmericanFlag Passenger Liners Have Almost Disappeared
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 Set in the concrete side walk at, the end of the Em barcadero Freeway is a foot worn plaque commemorating the arrival in 1846 of 237 Mormon colonizers on the sailing ship Brooklyn.

title: Knicks Vanquish Hawks, 114 to 93
description: Scoring 33 points off 31 At lanta turnovers, the New York Knicks walloped the Hawks, 11493, at Madison Square Gar den last night and hastened to Atlanta to play the Hawks again tonight.

title: Rangers Put Tickets To 20 Games on Sale
description: A limited number of New York Ranger tickets for the final 20 games of the National Hockey League sea son will go on sale tomorrow at the Felt Forum box office and at Ticketron locations.

title: Derailed Car Leaks Gas
description: JACKSBORO, Tenn., Dec. 12 (AP)Fourteen cars of a freight train derailed near here today, and toxic liquid gas leaked out of one of them. There were no reports of any injuries.

title: Double Jeopardy Is Ruled Out; Napoli Faced With New Trial
description: The Appellate Division ruled in a 32 decision yesterday thatl James Napoli, a 60yearold re puted Mafia leader, would have to face a new trial on charges of perjury and contempt de spite the contention by his yer and the dissenting justices that the second proceedini would subject him to double jeopardy.

title: SAMUEL LISS IS DEAD; ECONOMIST, REALTOR
description: Samuel Liss, who was a sen ior economist with the Farm Security Administration in the Roosevelt Administration, died Monday evening of a heart at tack while taking part in Democratic party meeting in East Hampton, L. I., where he had a summer home and car ried on a real estate business. He was 66 years old and lived at 229 West 78th Street.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 12 (AP)While he was growing up, 19yearold John Murphy of Morristown wanted to be a policeman. He will get his chance Jan. 1.

title: Chinese at Industrial Park
description: STANFORD, Calif., Dec. 12 (UP1)Chinese scientists visit ed Stanford Industrial Park to day to observe American tech nological advances. As part of a tour of American science facilities, the eight scientists visited the Hewlett  Packard Electronic Manufacturing Com pany, Varian Associates, the Zoecon Corporation and the Alza Corportion. The group re turns to China on Friday, end ing a fourweek United States tour.

title: CAMBODIA UNEASY OVER TRUCE PLANS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 12The attitude of the Cam bodian Government toward the Indochina ceasefire now being negotiated seems to have changed from one of wishful ness and plaintive optimism to more realism and worry.

title: Music Wakes Astronauts
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  The strains of Wagner's Ride of the Valkyries, radioed from earth, woke Capt. Eugene A. Cernan and Harrison H. Schmitt, the astronauts, on the moon today. The Manned Spacecraft Center in Houston said that the music was appro priate because Mr. Schmitt used to rouse his roommates at the California Institute of Tech nology each morning when he played it on his record player.

title: Australian Predicts Altered British Tie
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 12 A prediction that Australia would eventually become a re public and no longer acknowl edge Queen Elizabeth II as sov ereign was made here today by the newly appointed Australian envoy to Britain.

title: Rioters and Police Clash in Italy as Leftists Stage Civil Rights Protests in Several Cities
description: ROME, Dec. 12The Gov ernment put on a show of strength, deploying huge po lice forces, as left  wing groups, mostly students, pro tested in several cities today, charging violations of civil rights by state authorities.

title: Coast Psychologist Sought in Abortions Filmed by TV Crew
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (UPI) ALos Angeles psychologist was arrested here yesterday on a warrant from Philadelphia charging him with performing illegal abortions and practicing medicine without a license.

title: Jet Hijacker Who Got $500,000 Is Found Guilty by St. Louis Jury
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 12 (UPI)A Federal court jury today found Martin J. McNally guilty of air piracy in the hijacking of an American Airlines 727 jetliner in which $500,000 was demand ed, paid and later recovered in an Indiana farm field.

title: MONSANTO RESTATES ITS PROFIT MARGINS
description: The Monsanto Company said yesterday that the Price Com mission had permitted the com pany to restate its base period profit margins beginning Jan. 1.

title: I. T. T. Expected to Name 2dinCommand to Geneen
description: Francis J. Dunleavy, an ex ecutive vice president of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, is ex pected to be named president of the big conglomerate at an early date, according to reliable industry sources.

title: KENNEDY PREDICTS ACCORD WITH NIXON
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (AP) Members of Congress will extend the olive branch to President Nixon in the coining session, Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massa chusetts, said last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: You have finally published a letter defending the poor misunderstood dope pusher as the least culpable in a tragic chain of events leading to death through overuse of narcotics. Michael R. Putnam (letter Dec. 1) is to be congratulhted as the man who has crystallized the AliceinWonder land logic so popular among apologists for the drug culture.

title: U.S. Begins Counting Mine Union Votes
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Dec. 12  Under tight security, Labor Department tellers be gan tabulating ballots here to day in a Governmentcontrolled rerun of the disputed 1969 mine union election.

title: Guyana Official Says Four Have Recognized Havana
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 12Foreign Minister Shridath S. Ramphal of Guyana an nounced in Parliament today that his nationas well as Bar bados, Jamaica and Trinidad and Tobago  had established diplomatic relations with Cuba.

title: Camp David: Secluded Retreat for Presidents
description: THURMONT, Md.Among the displays in a corridor showcase in a Thurmont res taurant are what appear to be three pitted billiard balls on a skewer and a faintly yellowed bellpush. They are identified as a fishing float and bedroom buzzer used by President Franklin D. Roose velt at Camp David.

title: Antipoverty Aide Is Accused
description: The director of a cityrun Lower East Side antipoverty program was arrested yester day on charges of stealing more than $4,500 in city funds. Car los Albino, 57yearold director of the Committee of Welfare Families, a program with head quarters at 195 Stanton Street, was charged with larceny and forgery in allegedly placing the name of a fictitious employe on his agency's payroll and cashing the fraudulent pay checks.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Better Education In Arts Urged

title: Rent Increases for 425,000 Tenants In Controlled Apartments Due Jan. 1
description: Rent Commissioner Nathan Leventhal announced yesterday that 425,000 tenants in rent controlled apartments could ex pect rent increases Jan. 1.

title: Kawaida Worker Will Sit Out Protest
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12  John Morrone, a construction work er, took one look at the 150 pickets walking in front of the Kawaida Towers construction site today and another at the handful of policemen standing by to escort him past the dem onstrators  and decided to take the day off.

title: Camp David: Secluded Retreat for Presidents
description: THURMONT, Md.Among the displays in a corridor showcase in a Thurmont res taurant are what appear to be three pitted billiard balls on a skewer and a faintly yellowed bellpush. They are identified as a fishing float and bedroom buzzer used by President Franklin D. Roose velt at Camp David.

title: 12 CHARGED HERE IN A WORLD PLOT TO IMPORT HEROIN
description: Four Frenchmen, three Ar gentines, two Uruguayans, a Belgian, a Chilean and an American were charged in Fed eral indictments unsealed here yesterday with conspiring to import and distribute 383 pounds of heroin and 25 pounds of cocaine between August, 1970, and Nov. 30, 1972.

title: Bridge: Idle Bid Has Special Import For Two Experts in Tourney
description: A problem for bridge ex perts is how to put the idle to work, An idle bid is one that cannot profitably be em ployed in a natural sense, and may with advantage be given a specialized meaning.

title: Murphy Frees Policemen From Arraignment Duty
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yes terday that beginning March 1 neither policemen nor complainants would be required to appear in court at the arraignment of defendants. The move, the authority for which was given the Police Department in 1970, would be a fundamental change in the way cases are processed in New York City.

title: An Offer of Nomination to Peron Reported, and Refusal Is Hinted
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 12 (UPI)Former President Juan D. Pern was reportedly offered last night a nomination for the Argentine presidency by a coali tion of his Justicialist party and smaller allied groups.

title: REINS TO MISS JETS LAST GAME Placed on Move List, Top Rusher Must Sit Out the Contest With Browns
description: The New York Jets not only will have to wait until next season to get their second trip to the Super Bowl but also may have to wait until then, or longer, to get their first 1,000 yard rusher.

title: Teachers Ousted Over Hair
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 12 (UPI) Four teachers at St. Ignatius High School have been dis missed for refusing to enforce the school's hair code.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: C. W. Post Victor
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dee. 13 Ed Miller sank two free throws with six seconds left to night to give C. W. Post a 4542 victory over Sacred Heart University. The triumph was the fourth in a row for Post, which now has a 42 wonlost record. The loss was the third in six outings for Sacred Healt.

title: Keogh, Former Aide to Nixon, Is Chosen as Head of U.S.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  President Nixon announced to day the nomination of James Keogh, a former White House speechwriter who has criti cized news coverage of Mr. Nixon, to head the United States' Information Agency.

title: City's Christmas Tree Is Lighted by Lindsay
description: Mayor Lindsay threw a switch yesterday to light the official City Hall Christmas tree, a 57foot balsam fir in City Hall Park.

title: OFFICIAL SCORES BAY STATE PRISON
description: WALPOLE, Mass., Dec. 13 (AP)Convicted crime figures are making their presence known in the main security prison In Massachusetts, Fed eral and state officials say, ex erting influence on the every day life of prisoners and even determining whether they live or die.

title: Cornell Top Scorer Dismissed
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Dec. 13The University of Rochester took advantage of a Cornell cold spell early in the second half, then hung on to defeat the Big Red in basketball, 8579, tonight. Cornell's new coach. Tony Coma, announced after the game that he had removed the leading scorer, Brian Wright, from the team follow ing a postgame locker room confrontation.

title: Vikings Agree to Lease
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 13 (AP)The city of Minneapo lis and the Minnesota Vikings of the National Football League reached agreement today on a lease contract for a domed stadium to be constructed in downtown Minneapolis. The agreement is pending approval by the Minneapolis City Coun cil, Mayor Charles Stenvig and the Board of Estimate and Taxation.

title: CITY TO BROADEN TAX ON EMPLOYES
description: A bill requiring all future New York City employes who reside in the suburbs to pay the full city resident income tax was passed unanimously yesterday by the City Council.

title: Notes on People
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger won a battle in his war against smoking. After receiving a written complaint from the Chief Justice, Am trak has banned cigar and pipesmoking, but not ciga rettes, in the firstclass club car of the Metroliner, which runs between New York and Washington. Mr. Burger had complained that during re cent Metroliner trips he was annoyed to find that cigar smoking was allowed in the firstclass car. The only re course open to the firstclass nonsmokers, the Chief Justice said, was to move to a no smoking car in tourist class.

title: COURT REINSTATES OUSTED POLICEMAN
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 13 (AP) The Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court has or dered Police Chief Thomas J. Sardino of Syracuse to re instate a policeman dismissed for firing his revolver from a window of the city's Public Safety Building 2 years ago.

title: Libyans' 50% Oil Demand Rejected by Bunker Hunt
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 12 Negotiations of industrywide interest, between Libya and Nel son Bunker Hunt, the independ ent American oil company, were broken off here last Sat urday after the company re jected a Libyan request for 50 per cent participation and other major Libyan demands.

title: Anita O'Day Does Some Rearranging With Song Lyrics
description: If Anita O'Day could be an orchestra or even just a saxo phone section, she would prob ably, be quite happy. As it is, she manages to sound like Woody Herman's entire saxo phone ensemble when she vo calizes her way through the Herman arrangement of Four Brothers, bouncing brightly along beside Roland Hanna's piano line.

title: KISSINGER LEAVES FOR U.S. AS ROUND OF TALKS CLOSES
description: PARIS, Dec. 13Henry A. Kissinger flew home tonight, ending an arduous round of Vietnam ceasefire talks with out having solved the central problempolitical control of South Vietnam.

title: Bucks Overture Victors
description: Seatle, Dec. 13 (AP)  The Milwaukee Bucks blew an 18 point lead in the third quarter tonight but held on to top Seatle, 104103, in overtime.

title: People and Business
description: Eugene A. Catlero, group vice presidentNorth Ameri can automotive of the Chrysler Corporation, has for some time been regarded as a man on the rise at the big auto maker. Yesterday the 46yearold executive, the No. 3 man in the Chrysler hierarchy, was given an addi tional responsibility as chair man of an important new groupa board committee on public responsibility.

title: Woman in the News
description: BONN, Dec. 13The wo man newly chosen to preside over the Bundestag is pic tured in photographs from the early postwar era stroll ing arminarm with Kurt Schumacher, who emerged from a Nazi concentration camp to head the Social Democratic party. Annema rie Renger  Lon carevic, now 53 years old, was Mr. Schumacher's secretary from 1945 until his death in 1952, and since then she has stressed that she considers herself his politi cal heir.

title: Music
description: Bach did not, contrary to popular belief and some pro gram annotators, invent the equaltemperament system of tuning keyboard instruments, although his WellTempered Clavier served to dramatize its feasibility early in the game. Brilliant though the equal  temperament solution to tuning turned out to be, most keyboard music written in the 17th century used, the meantone system, which pro duced purerpitched tones in a few keys but increasing dis sonance in keys with more than a couple of sharps or flats in the signature.

title: Man Dragged by Hair
description: BOSTON, Dec. 13 (UPI) James Taylor's long hair got caught in the transmission of his truck as he was working beneath the vehicle yesterday. The parked truck accidently began rolling downhill and dragged him 200 feet. He re ceived minor injuries.

title: Pompidou Wants to Clarify U.S.European Relations
description: PARIS, Dec. 13President Pompidou is new in favor of consultations at the highest level to clarify United States European monetary, trade and political relations in the com ing year.

title: Zambia Completes Action To Outlaw Opposition Party
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 13 (AP)Zambia became a one party state today when Presi dent Kenneth Kaunda signed constitutional amendment ap proved last week by Parliament.

title: TEAMSTER AIDE EXPECTS OUSTER
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13Harold J. Gibbons, head of the power ful 13state central conference of the International Brother hood of Teamsters, said today that he expected Frank Fitz simmons, president of the union, to succeed in a move to oust him.

title: Flames Beat Wings, 20
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13 (UPI) Billy Macmillan fed Curt Ben nett twice for scores tonight and Dan Bouchard posted his first N.H.L. shutout as the At lanta Flames won, 20, from the Detroit Red Wings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your editorial in the Dec. 12 issue concerning management at the Penta gon totally misleads your readers.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 13I guess I always had a longing to be a judge, Irwin I. Kim melman said this afternoon during a lunchhour respite from his duties in Superior Court.

title: Petrograd, $7.40, Wins at Big A
description: Petrograd, a horse that had to forgo racing last year be cause of a leg injury, indicated to the 16,009 customers at Aqueduct yesterday that he was a betterthanfair 3year old. The Floridabred son of Petare carried the silks of Mrs. Thomas Walsh to a convincing victory in the sixfurlong Sport Page for his fifth triumph in his ninerace career.

title: Caso Urges Nonstop Bargaining in L.I.R.R. Impasse
description: The Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso, urged yester day that officials of the Long Island Rail Road and the strik ing unions resume bargaining talks and continue roundthe clock negotiations until an agreement was reached.

title: JAMES LEE, 72, DEAD; A HUTTON PARTNER
description: James J. Lee, a partner in W. E. Hutton & Co., investment bankers, died Tuesday in Glen Cove (L.I.) Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived on Mutton town Road in Syosset, L.I.

title: Insurgent Leads in Mine Vote; About 25% of Ballots Counted
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Dec. 13The insurgent reform fac tion in the United Mine Work ers held a narrow lead tonight over the slate of the incumbent president, W. A. Boyle. The La bor Department is continuing its aroundtheclock tally of bal lots in the Governmentsuper vised coal union election.

title: Alleged HeroinRing Chief Named in a 2d Indictment
description: Michel Nicoli, who was in dicted last month as an alleged leader of an international heroinsmuggling ring, was named in a second indictment yesterday. He was ordered held in $2.5million bail, the same figure as in his previous indict ment.

title: Canuck in Fair Condition
description: NEW WESTMINSTER, Brit ish Columbia, Dec. 13 (Cana dian Press)A spokesman for the Vancouver Canucks of the National Hockey League re ported today that Wayne Maki is resting in the intensive care unit at Royal Columbian Hos pital and the hospital staff lists his condition as fair. The Canuck left wing underwent a fourhour emergency operation Sunday for removal of a brain tumor.

title: 6 Japanese Concerns Seek StainlessSteel Output Curb
description: TOKYO, Dec. 13 (AP) Six Japanese manufacturers have filed an application with the Fair Trade Commission seeking approval on a ?? of 30 per cent of their total stainless steel production capacity for six months beginning Jan. 1, the Nippon Stainless Steel Com pany said today.

title: City Council Introduces a Bill Adding Six Seats
description: A reapportionment bill was introduced in the City Council yesterday that would add six Council districts under a plan designed to increase minority group representation.

title: Thieu Bid Reported Rejected
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 13A wellinformed source said today that he had been told by President Nguyen Van Thieu that a plan that would have opened the way for Saigon's endorsement of a peace accord had been rejected at the secret talks in Paris.

title: KNICKS DEFEATED IN LAST 2 SECONDS
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 13 Even though the Knicks played to night without Earl Monroe and Walt Frazier, who were side lined with leg injuries, it took a higharching shot from the corner by Pete Maravich with two seconds left to give the Atlanta Hawks a 121120 vic tory at the Omni.

title: MRS. OLA H. UPHAUS, WIFE OF PACIFIST, 75
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 13Mrs. Ola Hawkins Uphaus, wife of Dr. Willard Uphaus, director emeritus of World Fellowship, Inc., died yesterday at their home, 66 Edgewood Avenue. She was 75 years old.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13 (AP) Governor Cahill and his family have again decided to limit their list of Christmascards recipients. Instead, Mr. Cahill said today, he and his wife, Betty, will contribute to charity the money they would have used for cards and postage.

title: STATE REGISTERS WELFARE DECLINE, ITS FIRST IN YEARS
description: A sharp drop in welfare rolls upstate, notably in rural areas, has led to a statewide decline in relief rolls averaging 2,151 persons a month in the JulyAugustSeptember quarter compared with the previous quarter. This was the first such decline in many years.

title: Apartment Complex for 42d St. Draws Mixed Views at Hearing
description: The plan to build a 46story apartment house on 42d Street west of Ninth Avenue was hailed yesterday as a means of rejuvenating the midWest Side and attacked as a scheme for quick profit by real estate speculators that would drive the poor out of the area.

title: Bridge: Thoughtful Defender's Clue Can Help Rescue His Partner
description: Many players scream loudly whenever their partners com mit defensive errors but fail to consider that they them selves are sometimes to blame, A thoughtful defender can sometimes prevent his partner from having the op portunity to make a mistake, or can at least give him the clue he needs to solve the problem correctly.

title: U.S. Wins Move in U.N. To Reduce Contribution
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 13The United States to night won its uphill fight to re duce its contribution to the United Nations budget.

title: Boston College Wins, 7865
description: BOSTON, Dec. 13 (UPI) Boston College rallied in the final minutes to down St. Bona venture to night, 7865, The Eagles, who led at the half, 3227, saw their margin evap orate in the second half as Carl Jackson and Howie Har rison led the Bonnie's to within points at 6460.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New Park Squads To Fight Vandalism

title: I.T.T. ANNOUNCES DUNLEAVY CHOICE
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation yes terday formally announced the election of Francis J. Dunleavy as president and chief operat ing officer, effective Jan. 1.

title: Ollers Top Aeros, 32
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13 (UPI) Rusty Patenaude slapped in a goal 47 seconds into the final period tonight and Jim Benze lock, a teammate, scored unas sisted five minutes later to give the Alberta Oilers a 32 triumph over the Houston Aeros.

title: Laotian Troops Capture an Important Town Near the Ho Chi Minh Trail After MonthLong Campaign
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 13 Irregular troops fighting for the Laotian Government have com pleted the capture of an im portant town on the western approach to the Ho Chi Minh Trail network adjoining South Vietnam, a military informant reported today.

title: Teachers Who Opened Their Own Alternative School
description: Between the ground floor office of the Felco Trucking Corporation on one side, and Artisan Organs on the other, is the entrance to an ordi nary commercial building at 8 West 19th Street.

title: Government Delays Withholding of Welfare Funds for 3 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)  The Government gave the states a threemonth extension today before it puts into effect its plans to withhold nearly $700million in matching wel fare funds.

title: LABORITES WIDEN SPLIT ON MARKET
description: LONDON, Dec. 13  The Labor party's split over joining the Common Market was deep ened today when a shrunken majority of Labor M.P.'s fol lowed the party leadership in voting to boycott the Assembly of Europe, an institution allied with the Market.

title: Chou Is Said to Have Given Japan Military Assurances
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  American officials.

title: Refund for Fifth Ave. Coach
description: Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., reported yesterday that its previously announced tax refund application regarding an overpayment of about $2.5 million, plus accrued interest, has been approved by the Joint Congressional Committee on Taxation.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 13 (AP)Japan and the United States are leading industrial countries upward in a surge of pro duction that looks as if it will continue through next year, an authoritative British research institute said today.

title: ROLE ON INSURERS ASSERTED BY F.T.C
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 The Federal Trade Commission asserted today for the first time that it had the authority to attempt to block the merger of two insurance companies.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13 (AP) Apple production in New Jer sey hit a 20year low this year, according to statistics released by the state Department of Agriculture. William Dowdy, department statistician, dis closed yesterday that 95 mil lion pounds of apples were har vested this year, compared with last year's 110 million pounds.

title: American Electric Plans Substantial Stock Offer
description: The American Electric Power Company expects to make a substantial offering of common stock sometime in the first half of next year, Donald C. Cook, chairman and president, said yesterday at a luncheon meet ing of the New York Society of Security Analysts.

title: G.M. Sets Plant Expansion
description: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 13 (AP)A multimilliondollar ex pansion and modernization pro gram_ adding almost 1.4 million square feet of floor space to two G.M. assembly plants here will begin soon, according to the company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Ernesto C. Pineda's Nov. 27 letter was quite informative, but I noticed a few inaccuracies and flaws in his arguments in favor of President Mar cos.

title: DANES TO SEEK A SUB REPORTED IN FJORDS
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 13 (AP)The Danish De fense Ministry decided today to send a naval inspection vessel and a helicopter to the Disko Bay area of western Greenland after new reports of sightings of an unidentified submarine in a system of narrow fjords.

title: New Train to Florida Starts Run Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 The National Railroad Pas senger Corporation has an nounced that beginning Friday there will be a new train running from New York to Florida for the winter season.

title: Indians Begin Withdrawal Of Troops From Pakistan
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 13India announced today that she had begun withdrawing troops from the occupied areas in Pakistan.

title: Personal Finance: Buying Term Life Insurance
Music: Vibrant Messiah
description: In his program note for the three performances of Han del's Messiah given by Musica Sacra at the Central Presbyterian Church this week, Richard Westenburg indicated that much time and money had gone into the preparation and rehearsal of the old oratorio that has been done almost to death in this country for generations.

title: Arab Life in Territories Vastly Improved, Dayan Says
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 13De fense Minister Moshe Dayan as serted today that a tremen dous social, economic and tech nological revolution is under way in the Arab territories oc cupied by Israel since the 1967 war.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: An overflow audience in the Science Hall Auditorium of Mount St. Vincent College in Riverdale learned last week that the Hudson River might produce 80 per cent or more of the striped bass along the midAtlantic coast.

title: PRICES ON AMEX AND COUNTER DIP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market declined yes terday for the third consecu tive day in slower trading.

title: Mumford, a Native Son, Calls City Horror and Monstrosity
description: For four decades, Lewis Murford, the writer and critic, has been living outside Amenia In Dutchess County, but he was on East 42d Street yesterday, accepting the National Medal for Literature with resonant thanksand viewing his home city with emotions that he summed up softly as horrid.

title: 50 Groups Form Coalition To Push for House Reforms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP) A coalition of 50 organizations announced today that it would lobby against secrecy and the seniority system in the House of Representatives.

title: MARCOS REGIME SPURS PLEBISCITE
description: MANILA, Dec. 13The mar tiallaw administration of Presi dent Ferdinand E. Marcos is mobilizing all its resources in a huge publicity campaign to persuade the 12,500,000 voters that they should approve a new parliamentary constitution in a national plebiscite scheduled for Jan. 15.

title: Marginalia: Notes From the Stage
description: James Earl Jones, who was to have made his directorial debut with the allblack New York Shakespeare Festival production of The Cherry Orchard, has withdrawn from the assignment. He has been replaced by Michael Schultz. Mr. Jones, however, will take over the role of Lopakhin in the Chickhov clas sic, succeeding J. A. Preston. The play is scheduled to open Jan. 11 at the Public An spacher Theater Laurence Olivier and Constance Cum mings have been named best actor and best actress of the year by the London critics. They were cited for their performances in Eugene O'Neill's Long Day's Journey Into Night. Please Don't Cry and Say No, a bill of three oneacters by Town send Brewster, closes on Sun day at the Downtown Circle intheSquare Theater after 15 performances.  1776 has racked up $1,119,294 in its first four weeks at the Radio City Music Hall, set ting an openingmonth record for the 40yearold film house.  Ann Miller, danc ing star of more than 40 Hollywood movies, and two dancers from the New York City Center Joffrey Ballet will represent the United States at a gala for the bene fit of UNICEF to be held at the Paris Opera on Dec. 20. The ballet dancers are Starr Danias and Dennis Wayne, who will do the pas de deux After Eden, composed by Lee Hoiby and choreographed by John Butler.  A Little Night Music, the new mu sical comedy by Stephen Sondheim and Hugh Wheeler, has been scheduled to open at the Shubert Theater Feb. 25.

title: Cabinet Studies Truce Offer
description: VIENTIANE, Dec. 13 (UPI) Prince Souvanna Phouma, the Laotian Premier, met with his Cabinet today to discuss a new Pathet Lao proposal described by the Government as a pos sible step toward ending the fighting.

title: S.E.C. Staff Urges Reporting Change At Big Board Firms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The staff of the Securities and Ex change Commission urged the New York Stock Exchange to day to convert its member firms to a new form of report ing their income and expenses. The conversion should take place as soon as possible, according to a letter from G. Bradford Cook, chief of the commission's division of mar ket regulation, to John J. Mul cahy Jr., secretary of the ex change.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The White House announced today that Presi dent Nixon has accepted the resigna tion of Santa Claus.

title: VAN DOREN RITES ATTENDED BY 600
description: CORNWALL, Conn., Dec. 13 More than 600 people gath ered in this small village today to attend a funeral service at the First Church of Christ in Cornwall for Mark Van Doren educator and literary critic, who died Sunday night at the age of 78. Local children and dairy farmers, mechanics and merchants mingled with the Ivy League intellectual elite to pay homage to the Pulitzer Prize poet and former Colum bia professor.

title: PAYMENTS DEFICIT WIDER IN QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  Two important measures of the nation's balance of international payments moved in opposite directions in the third quarter, the Commerce Department re ported today.

title: CAHILL WOULD GIVE RULL FUND REPORT
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13Gover nor Cahill said today that if he ran for reelection next year he would make a full public dis closure of all campaign funds and would expect other Re publican candidates in New Jersey to follow suit.

title: College Enrollment Is Expected to Show 2% Rise
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 13En rollment for all college students in the nation this year is ex pected to show a 2 per cent increase over last year's total, according to an annual survey made under auspices of the University of Cincinnati.

title: Paris Garbage Strike Ends
description: PARIS, Dec. 13 (UPI)Strik ing Paris garbagemen agreed today to go back to work to morrow but labor leaders called a yearend strike of bank clerks.

title: '72 Growth Rate Lowest In 10 Years, Kosygin Says
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin, in his second major pronouncement on the economy this fali, has disclosed that the Soviet Union's rate of growth in 1972 was the lowest in the last 10 years.

title: Tall Story: F.B.I. Finds A 7Foot Hijack Suspect
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 13 (AP)  The Los Angeles Lakers center, Wilt Chamberlain, got into a squabble with Trans World Airline officials and Fed eral agents in Chicago today after making a remark about a gun.

title: L. P. HARTLEY DIES; ENGLISH, NOVELIST
description: LONDON, Dec. 13  L. P. Hartley, the English novelist, shortstory writer and critic, died today at his London home. He was 76 years old.

title: Bergdorf Goodman Joins Gimbel's European Offices
description: Bergdorf Goodman, the Fifth Avenue store recently acquired by BroadwayHale Stores, Inc., has joined the European Buy ing Offices of Gimbel Brothers, Inc. Bergdorf has previously been represented in various European markets by commis sionaries or buying agents.

title: 10DAY CAR SALES DISPLAY A 2% LAG
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13The new car sales rate in early Decem ber fell 2 per cent from a year ago, with the four automakers reporting dealers having de livered 180,638 Americantype automobiles Dec. 1.10, down from 207,369 a year earlier.

title: Who's Winning What?
description: President Thieu is, naturally, still trying to win at the negotiating table what his armed forces and those of the United States have failed to win on the battlefield.
