That is the simple meaning of the condition which he required Mr. Kissinger to press upon the North Viet namese negotiators in the most recent round of Paris talks: a formal and unequivocal statement from Hanoi that the Saigon Government is the sole sovereign author ity over South Vietnam.

title: Denver Rockets Are Sold To Group From San Diego
description: DENVER, Dec. 13 (AP)The Denver Rockets, a charter fran chise of the fiveyearold Amer ican Basketball Association were sold today to five San Diego businessmen.

title: 2 Iranians Accused of Molesting A Stewardess on Flight Here
description: Two Iranians were arraigned in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday, accused of molest ing an American Airlines stew ardess on a flight Tuesday night from Washington to La Guardia Airport.

title: Family Tradition: A Gift to Neediest
description: The New York Times Need iest Cases Fund received a check for $30 yesterday with this covering letter:

title: First U.S. Fiction Sold for $22,000
description: A manuscript of the first known work of fiction cre ated in this country was auc tioned Tuesday for $22.000. The rarity, in a sale of Eng lish and American literature at Sotheby Parke Bernet, 980 Madison Avenue, was won by the House of El Dieff of New York.

title: Rangers 43 Victors
description: Ten goals, two fights on the ice, a fracas behind the Quebec bench and another fight with an irate fan behind the penalty boxall that marked the New York Raiders' 91 victory over the Nordiques in a World Hoc key Association game last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: United to Cut Fares June 1 Under New Charter Rules
description: In the first domestic applica tion of a radical new charter fare concept, United Air Lines announced yesterday plans to slash fares up to 65 per cent on several major routes, effective June 1. However, travelers must buy their tickets 90 days in ad vance to qualify for the bargains.

title: Opera: Brilioth's Siegfried One of Best
description: Is there such a category as a lyric heldentenor? Helge Brilioth sang his first Sieg fried at the Metropolitan Opera on Tuesday evening, and he would fit into the category. In any case, his was the finest impersonation of that killing role New York has seen since the postwar days of Set Svanholm. (We won't talk about Lauritz Melchior, who was in an all time class by himself.)

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 13An Olympic breast stroker, fifth in the 100 meters in Munich last summer, is swimming for the Rutgers varsity this winter but will have difficulty placing second, let alone first, in any of the meets. That's because there still is quite a difference between the times of men and women.

title: Jack J. Dreyfus Sr. Is Dead; Investment Broker Was 88
description: A funeral service was held yesterday at Temple EmanuEl for Jack J. Dreyfus Sr., retired investment broker, who died Monday at the Carlyle Hotel. He was 88 years old.

title: South Atlantic Title Skating Set for Philadelphia Today
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 13 Skaters from the Metropolitan area will be in the battle for titles as the South Atlantic figure skating championships start tomorrow at the Wissa hickon Skating Club.

title: What Is Light Blue With 2Tone Siren? It's New Police Car
description: To comply with the city's new noisecontrol law and en hance visibility, the Police De partment has decided to start changing the sound and sight of its fleet of patrol cars.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Inmates Locked Up for Weapons Hunt

title: RCA Aerospace Elects
description: Stanley S. Kolodkin was named yesterday division vice president and general manager of the RCA Aerospace Systems division at Burlington, Mass. He succeeds John R. McAllis ter, who died on Oct. 28.

title: DRIVE TO CUT COST OF FOOD IS PUSHED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  A simple food like an orange is handled 17 times from tree to table.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In looking at the poorer areas where graffiti have had their greatest impact, I say bravo to the kids who are changing an otherwise depressing, dank environment into something which at least has association, color and vitality. Some of the other pos sibilities for release of this aggression could be a great deal worse than a little spray paint and a marking pen.

title: SABRES TRIUMPH OVER BRUINS, 73
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 13 (AP)  Gilles Perreault scored two goals tonight as Buffalo rallied to defeat the Boston Bruins, 73, in a fightfilled National Hockey league game. The vic tory stretched the Sabres' un beaten home streak to 16 games.

title: U.S. ASSAILS 3 LANDS ON NEW TIES TO CUBA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (Reu ters)The United States criti cized four Caribbean mem bers of the Organization of American States today for establishing diplomatic rela tions with Cuba despite hemis pheric sanctions against the Government of Premier Fidel Castro.

title: 2 Doctors Ordered to Pay $200,000 to a Blinded Girl
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 13 (AP)  A Superior Court jury ordered two Bridgeport pedi atricians yesterday to pay a 4 yearold Stratford girl $200,000 because she allegedly was blinded by excessive oxygen following her premature birth.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When baseball men were batting around the conver sational ball during a World Series interlude many years ago, the discussion one night got around to the frequency with which umpires took too much for granted. Specifically mentioned was the automatic out that was often called on tag plays around second base. Being a mischiefmaker by nature, Eddie Brannick of the Giants pounced on the opportunity to jab the needle into his old buddy, Frank Frisch, the Hall of Fame second baseman.

title: CASTER LAMENTS PASSES HE MISSED
description: Rich Caster agreed that Joe Namath had one of his better games passing against the Oak land Raiders last Monday night, but the Jets' tight end didn't think much of his own game receiving.

title: News Analysis
description: The soaring price of land, particularly land on the fringe of suburban development, has been blamed by planning offi cials for the land and zoning scandals that over the last 20 years have involved many of Suffolk County's leading public officials in grandjury indict ments and even long prison terms. The poten tial for tremen dous profits, grow ing, pushing out to the rural areas, have evidently proved temptations too diffi cult to resist for some politi cians and private citizens privy to what will happen to these lands.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The death this week in Cambridge of John Carter Vincent marks the passing of one of the last of that small group of brilliant Foreign Serv ice officers who spent most of their professional lives representing their country in China and who, because they tried to tell their Government the truth about that complex country, were shabbily dismissed as disloyal and probably Communist, their ca reers ruined, in the Joe McCarthy John Foster Dulles time. John Paton Davies and 0. Edmund Clubb remain.

title: Rust on the Moon
description: A new element of excitement has been injected into the study of the moon by Apollo 17. The orange or reddish dustapparently resembling the rust on a piece of ironfound by astronauts Cernan and Schmitt has astonished the scientific world. Nothing similar had been previously seen on the moon. It is premature, though tempting, to conclude that this is evidencein geological termsof relatively recent volcanic activity.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 13 (AP)The Minnesota North Stars dazed a rookie goalie, Michel Belhumeur, with 32 firstperiod shots and three goals, two by Danny Grant, and raced to 72 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers tonight.

title: POMPIDOU FAVORS U.S.EUROPE TALKS
description: PARIS, Dec. 13President Pompidou is now in favor of consultations at the highest level to clarify United States European monetary, trade and political relations in the com ing year.

title: Election Recount Refused
description: MINEOLA, L. L, Dec. 13A proceeding brought by Assem blyman Stanley Harwood, Dem ocrat of Levittown, asking for a recount of the vote in the 13th Assembly District, was dismissed today by State Su preme Court Justice Robert Meade. Mr. Harwood was de feated by Assemblyman Milton Jones, Republican of Merrick, by a margin of 250 votes.

title: OSTROW'S DIVERSITY REFLECTED IN SONG
description: Ron Ostrow is mixed media personified, a performer of such diverse talents that you never know which one will sur face next. In his formal New York debut Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, he sang more than a dozen songs of his own composition, played more than half a dozen different in struments, often simultaneous ly, and cheerfully bestowed upon his listeners conglomerate poetic and musical messages of love, peace and humanity.

title: CITY TO BROADEN TAX ON EMPLOYES
description: A bill requiring all future New York City employes who reside in the suburbs to pay the full city resident income tax was passed unanimously yesterday by the City Council.

title: Javits Expects Congress To Enact Pension Reforms
description: Enactment of pension reform legislation in the 93d Congress seems highly likely, Senator Jacob K. Javits told a meeting of the New York Society of Security Analysts here yester day.

title: A Commodity Futures Unit Is Organized by Cargill
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 13 (AP) Cargill, Inc., Minneapolis grain company, announced today formation of a subsidiary, Cargill Investor Services, Inc., a commodity futures brokerage company with worldwide head quarters in Chicago and opera tions in many markets.

title: Hostess Gives Office Parties In Her Home
description: Christmas office parties, which too often have turned into dismal drunken revels anyhow, with cold food spread out on dirty desks and left uneaten, are bad enough for those who attend them, but for those who stay at home  housewives or househusbands and children  such mournful festivities kick off the holiday season with loneliness and jealousy. The home cook who is willing to prepare more than a hang over remedy for the fam ily's working parent can solve this problem. Do as Joan Lorring does and en tertain the office staff at home.

title: Business Briefs
description: Scudder, Stevens & Clark, a major investment coun seling firm, acknowledged yesterday that one of its research analysts had obtained a copy of a negative research report prepared by Oppenheimer & Co. on the hospital management industry.

title: 3Man Units Are Formed To Fight Park Vandalism
description: A small playground between dreary tenements on 17th Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenues had succumbed to multiple assaults by vandals who ripped out the plumbing in rest rooms, tore out park bench slats, put graffiti on the walls and even chipped away at stone play animals.

title: News of Skiing
description: ?? FALLS, Mich., Dec. 13  When Everett Kircher first came to this rolling up state country 25 years ago, he found abandoned farms, decaying logging camps and A railroad line that served passengers only in the sum mer. I was looking for a suitable place to establish a ski resort, Kirch er said today while resting from an hour's skiing on his Boyne Mountain stopes. I had learned that the high est piece of real estate in this region was located just a short schuss from the local Boyne River, I wanted to see it.

title: Extending Controls
description: President Nixon has acted wisely in making known now his intention that wageprice controls be continued beyond their present April 30 expiration date. With col lective bargaining agreements covering five million work ers scheduled for negotiation in 1973, any uncertainty about the continuation of mandatory antiinflation re straints would have unleashed insistent pressure for breakthroughs on both the wage and price side.

title: PENN'S LATE SHOT BEATS ST. JOSEPH'S
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 13 (AP)Ron Haigler sank a 10 foot jump shot as time ran out to give ninthranked Penn a 5453 victory over St. Joseph's tonight.

title: 3 OPERATIONS CUT BY FOOTE MINERAL
description: EXTON, Pa., Dec. 13 (Reu ters)The Foote Mineral Com pany said today it had decided to terminate certain operations in 1973, which will result in a $9million extraordinary charge, net of tax effects, in the fourth quarter of 1972.

title: Ricord Takes Stand and Denies Any Role in Heroin Trafficking
description: Auguste Joseph Ricord denied In Federal District Court here yesterday that he had ever had anything to do with interna tional heroin traffic, but he was later forced to retract or modify at least eight statements as new documents or witnesses were brought forward.

title: Welfare Hotels Tarnish Character of West Side Neighborhood
description: I hate it when the man ager sends me act for tea, because I hate to go in there for it, said Carlos, the tick ettaker at Brandt's Beacon Theater, on the east side of Broadway between 74th and 75th Streets.

title: Drug Agency Acts to Restrict Use of Diet Pills and Vitamins
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 The Food and Drug Adminis tration announced moves to day to restrict unnecessary and potentially harmful use of diet pills and vitamins.

title: Cuba's Revolution On the Plus Side
description: LONDONBoth Cuba and the Unit ed States are going to have to change their policies toward each other if there are to be even the beginnings of fruitful negotiations on anything but hijacking.

title: Brazil Frees Seven of Eight Held as Communist Leaders
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 13 The Brazilian police have re leased seven of the eight per sons arrested a week ago as leaders of the illegal Commu nist party. The report of the release came from sources close to police officials.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The Judge also scored the perior Court Judge Irwin I Kimmelman today enjoined construction work and picket ing at the Kawaida Towers housing project until Jan. 2 so workmen can finish shoring up the foundations of two near by apartment buildings.

title: LIQUOR DELIVERY IS SET TO RESUME
description: Liquor delivery trucks were to begin rolling today after warehousemen and truck driv ers voted to end their sixweek strike against the wine and whisky wholesalers here.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Paramount Pictures has bought the rights to Ladislas Farago's forthcoming book about the purported postwar lives of Martin Bormann and other Nazis and will begin a film based on the book next summer. It is to be called Aftermath: the Fourth Reich.

title: PICKETS ENJOINED AT KAWAIDA SITE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 13  ?? perior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmelman today enjoined construction work and picket ing at the Kawaida Towers housing project until Jan. 2 so workmen can finish shoring up the foundations of two near by apartment buildings.

title: NonOperating L.I.R.R.
description: With both sides stalled as badly as expressway traffic during the rush hour, State Senator John D. Caemmerer's suggestion for compulsory arbitration in the Long Island Rail Road dispute makes sense. The strike by the line's nonoperating personnelmachinists, electricians, sheet metal workers, clerks and othershas entered its second week. The 90,000 commuters now jamming the express ways as well as the 80,000 or so additional daily oneway riders deserve some relief. The L.I.R.R. should roll as arbitration proceeds.

title: COPPER RANGE SET TO CLOSE FACILITY
description: The Copper Range Company announced yesterday plans for disposing of its Anderson, Ind., plant of the Hussey Metals di vision, and a writeoff in the present quarter of the remain ing unamortized cost of two prototype boring machines in its White Pine Mine.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PRIVATE LIVES H. P. Kraus collects rare books for a living but he and his wife collect miniatures from Is lamic culture for a hobby. Mr. and Mrs. Kraus have happily intruded their private collection into their business premises. H. P. Kraus, 16 East 46th Street (MU 74808), for an exhibit that will run through Dec. 23.

title: United to Cut Fares June 1 Under New Charter Rules
description: In the first domestic applica tion of a radical new charter fare concept, United Air Lines announced yesterday plans to slash fares up to 65 per cent on several major routes, effective June 1. However, travelers must buy their tickets 90 days in ad vance to qualify for the bargains.

title: In Search of a Majority
description: Finally, in 1972, it has become clear that the 1960's are history rather than present. The great pendulum of change and idealism that set in motion the Peace Corps, the War on Poverty, the peace movement and black power first passed through the political center and is now swinging back. There is no question yet of reversing its direc tion; first the backward swing must be dampened. The crucial question is whether those of us who are ?? cated to making a better world can break the habit of talking more and more stridently to fewer and fewer disciples and begin to listen, with as much love and compassion as we have finally managed for the most dis possessed among us, to that great, anxious, proud, insecure, relatively af fluent, American middle.

title: Bryant Gives Columbia an Assist
description: Early yesterday Emmette Bryant took time out from his duties as guidance coun selor, dean and special assist ant at Paul Lawrence Dunbar Junior High School in the South Bronx to play some oneonone basketball with youngsters in the gym class.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, elec trical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: Drug Agency Acts to Restrict Use of Diet Pills and Vitamins
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 The Food and Drug Adminis tration announced moves to day to restrict unnecessary and potentially harmful use of diet pills and vitamins.

title: '72 Growth Rate Lowest In 10 Years, Kosygin Says
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin, in his second major pronouncement on the economy this fall, has disclosed that the Soviet Union's rate of growth in 1972 was the lowest in the last 10 years.

title: TROOP MOVEMENT BY FOE REPORTED
description: SAIGON, South Viettam, Thursday, Dec. 14 (AP)Amer ican sources reported yester day that almost 100 tanks and several thousand North Viet namese troops had moved through mountain passes from North Vietnam to the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos and were heading southward.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONIt was just like the old days, There was President Johnson, declaring that we shall overcome. There were some of the great names of the civil rights movementRoy Wil kins, Earl Warren, Hubert Humphrey, Clarence Mitchell. But this is almost 1973, not 1954 or 1965, and nothing made that quite so clear as Mr. John son's speech to a symposium at the library that bears his name on the University of Texas campus.

title: Stolen Paintings Found in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Dec. 13 (UPI) The West Berlin police an nounced today the recovery of two paintings stolen from the Museum of Fine Arts in Tours, France. They said a Czechoslovak student con fessed he had stolen them and brought them here to sell. They are Rembrandt's Flight of the Holy Family to Egypt and Van Goyen's Seascape.

title: Morgan Library Shows Mozart MS.
description: A Christmas gift for the library that has everything? The autograph manuscript of a Mozart opera, that's what. Recently the Pierpont Morgan Library acquired the manuscript of Mozart's comic opera, Der Schauspieldirek tor. It will be on exhibit from today until Feb. 17.

title: STATE REGISTERS WELFARE DECLINE, ITS FIRST IN YEARS
description: A sharp drop in welfare rolls upstate, notably in rural areas, has led to a statewide decline in relief rolls averaging 2,151 persons a month in the JulyAugustSeptember quarter compared with the previous quarter, This was the first such decline in many years.

title: Rheingold Unit Expands
description: Modernization of the brew house at the Brooklyn plant of Rheingold Breweries, Inc., a unit of the Rheingold Corpora tion, is nearing completion and the automated facility is ex pected to be in operation by mid1973. This will complete threeyear modernization plan costing $8million, which is ex pected to increase efficiency at the plant markedly.

title: Walter Sullivan of Times Gets Science Writing Prize
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  Walter Sullivan, science editor of The New York Times, has been named one of three win ners of the 1972 science writ ing awards sponsored by the American Association for the Advancement of Science and the Westinghouse Education Foundation. It is the third time Mr. Sullivan has won the award.

title: HIGHS ARE ERASED BY SOYBEAN MEAL
description: Rumors that price controls might be applied to soybean meal shook the market in soy bean meal futures yesterday. However, before the decline the price for December meal soared to $200 a ton, erasing Tuesday's historic high of $186.50 a ton.

title: Brazilian Accuses Petrosianof Playing Dirty Pool at Chess
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 13 (Reuters)Tigran Petrosian of the, Soviet Union, a former World chess champion, was ac cused here today of using a coin, a spoon, his elbow and his hearing aid to upset an op ponent in the recent Church's Fried Chicken International tournament in San Antonio, Tex.

title: YOUNGHILL KANG, WRITER, 69, DIES
description: Dr. Younghill Kang, noted Korean author who came to this country at 19 and became an educator, died Monday at his home in Satellite Beach, Fla. He was 69 years old.

title: Chess: The Isolated Central Pawn A Character Seeking a Role
NEW DEPOSITS DROP FOR SAVINGS BANKS
description: The flow of new deposits into the nation's mutual savings banks dropped in November for the first time in six months, the National Association of Mutual Savings Banks reported yester day.

title: Penguins Wallop Islanders, 91; Spray 55 Shots at Des jardins
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 13 (AP) The Pittsburgh Penguins, fir ing almost at will, blasted 55 shots at the New York Island ers' goalie, Gerry Desardins, as they rolled to a 91 victory in a National Hockey League game tonight.

title: Books of The Times
description: ALL CREATURES GREAT AND SMALL. By James Herriot, 442 pages. St. Martin's Press, $7.95.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and atmosphere, serv ice and decor (four triangles to none.)

title: Saving of $1Million Per Year Seen by State Treasurer
description: The State of Connecticut to day won a seat on the PBW Stock Exchange in Philadelphia, becoming the first public body to gain membership on a stock exchange.

title: Beautiful Here Today
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13 (AP) Following are excerpts from the conversations of Capt. Eugene A. Cernan and Dr. Harrison H. (Jack) Schmitt as they made their third and last tour of the moon's sur face:

title: Some Navy Pilots Praise Plane Involved in Grumman Dispute
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 13Some Navy pilots call the contro versial F14 Tomcat fighter su perior to any aircraft in the world, describing it as a quan tum jump in design and performance.

title: Man Seeks to Cut His Control Over SexOriented Businesses
description: Martin J. Hodas, one of the leading suppliers of peepshow machines here and the landlord of two massage parlors, said yesterday that he intended to divest himself of direct control of his operations.

title: Italian Spoken on Moon
description: ROME, Dec. 13 (AP)Italian is spoken on the moon, front page headlines in Italian news papers said today after Dr. Harrison H. Schmitt, the astro naut, used the expression Mama min! in a conversation describing an unusual rock sample he had found on the lunar surface. Italians use the expression to denote surprise or exasperation.

title: 2,000 at a Back to Brooklyn Concert
description: Walt Whitman didn't make it and neither did Barbra Streisand but nearly 2,000 other natives, onetime resi dents and sympathetic friends turned out for a Back to Brooklyn benefit concert on Tuesday night in the bor ough's historic Academy of Music. They shmoozed in the lobbies, remembered old times and raised $75,000 for the Academy, which needs it. Before the show began, the executive director of the 112yearold institution, Har vey Lichtenstein, disclosed that the Academy is in dire financial circumstances, with a record deficit of between $350,000 and $400,00.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Wolfe Seeks Meeting
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 13 Representative Lester L. Wolff said today he did not think an act of Congress is necessary to renegotiate the Grumman F14 contract and said he would request all Long Island Congressmen to meet later this week to arrange a meeting with officials of Grumman and the Department of Defense to re solve the situation.

title: Bonn Legislators Pick 1st Woman Chief
description: BONN, Dec. 13West Ger many's lower house of Parlia merit elected Annemarie RengerLoncarevic as its Presi dent today, making her the first woman to preside in Parlia ment in the nation's history.

title: 2 Soviet Aides Visit a Dissident In Hotel Here and Lift Passport
description: Valery N. Chalidze, a leader of Soviet dissidents who has been lecturing in this country on the Soviet human rights movement, was visited in his East Side hotel yesterday by two Soviet officials who con fiscated his passport and told him that he had been deprived of his citizenship.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)Sales, aftertax profits and profit margins of the nation's manufacturing companies all declined in the third quarter after secondquarter in creases, the Federal Trade Commission reported today.

title: Suit on Water Funds Backed
description: CONCORD, N. H. Dec. 13 (AP)The New Hampshire Wa ter Supply and Pollution Com mission voted today to join a suit against the Federal Gov ernment seeking to obtain full funding of projects under the Water Pollution Control Act. The commission instructed As sistant Attorney General Donald Stever to join in a suit filed by New York State seeking the $5billion Congress authorized.

title: Israel Terms Citizenship 99% Certain for Kahane
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 13 (UPI) The Israeli Interior Ministry said today that it was 99 per cent certain that Rabbi Meir Kahane, head of the militant Jewish Defense League, would be granted Israeli citizenship.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: CHERRY HILL, Dec. 13 (AP)Muhammad Ali has put his sprawling home here up for sale because he says his wife is homesick.

title: Paris Garbage Strike Ends
description: PARIS, Dec. 13 (UPI)Strik ing Paris garbagemen agreed today to go back to work to morrow but labor leaders called a yearend strike of bank clerks.

title: Mass for Louella Parsons Attended by Stars on Coast
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Dec. 13 (UPI)A requiem mass was offered today for Louella Par sons, the Hollywood columnist who died Saturday at the age of 91, in the Good Shepherd Roman Catholic Church. The services, conducted by Msgr. Daniel Sullivan, lasted 45 minutes.

title: S.E.C. SETS HEARING ON DU PONT MERGER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13.  The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that it would hold hearings early next year on the proposal of the Christiana Securities Company to merge with E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co.

title: McNickle Sparks Lehman
description: Unbeaten Lehman College won its fifth game last night by defeating Paterson State, 6655, on the victor's court in the Bronx. Nick McNickle was high scorer for Lehman with 24 points. The game was tied, 2828, at halftime.

title: Misuse of Policemen Is Charged at a Charter Hearing
description: Deputy Inspector James Dicks of the Midtown South Precinct said yesterday that the de ployment of young, aggressive patrolmen on school crossings and traffic details was demoral izing and wasteful.

title: 12 OUTLETS CITED ON THE HEALTH CODE
description: Twelve food establishments said to have violated the city's health code are on the latest list Made public yesterday by the Health Services Administra tion. Six places previously cited for violations have corrected them.

title: Keogh, Former Aide to Nixon, Is Chosen as Head of U.S. I. A.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  President Nixon announced to day the nomination of James Keogh, a former White House speechwriter who has criti cized news coverage of Mr. Nixon, to head the United States Information Agency.

title: Customs Guard Is Indicted In Shooting of Bronx Youth
description: A 56yearold employe of the Bureau of Customs, who was accused of shooting a 15year old boy after an exchange of words outside his Bronx home, was indicted yesterday on charges of attempted murder, assault and felonious possession of a weapon.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 13The Public Service Electric and Gas Company said today that one of its major suppliers had curtailed deliveries of natural gas by 19 per cent.

title: Air Pilots Promise Strike If Hijacking Continues in 1973
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 13 (Reu ters)The International Feder ation of Airline Pilots Associa tions announced here tonight that it would call a worldwide strike If there were more air liner hijackings next year.

title: Collection Sends Father Of Evans to Houston
description: BIRD CITY, Kan., Dec. 13 (UPI)Modern science sent Comdr. Ronald Evans and his two companions from the earth to the moon, but Com mander Evans's father is grateful to human generosity for getting him from Bird City to Houston.

title: Advertising:
description: As the economic pulse of the nation beats stronger the number of newproduct in troductions increases. They go together. Martin J. Fried man, a senior vice president of Dancer Fitzgerald Sample, who is charged with keeping track of such things, says that new products will be up anywhere from 5 to 7 per cent this year. Up to Novem ber, there were 705, com pared with 695 in the first 11 months of 1971.

title: Killer of Gallo Identified as 4 Are Indicted After Inquiry on Slaying
description: A Manhattan grand jury yesterday identified a member of the reputed crime family of Joseph A. Colombo Sr. as the man who killed Joey Gallo in the firstand perhaps the last indictments to be handed up in connection with its four month investigation into the gangland chieftain's slaying.

title: Baroque Creche Sculptures Adorn Christmas Tree at Museum
description: The Christmas tree on dis play in the Medieval Hall at the Metropolitan Museum is not an everyday Yuletide evergreen with conventional ornaments. This tree is a kind of splendid museum un to itself, a dazzling array of miniature baroque sculptures, many of them masterpieces of their time.

title: Market Place: The Expanding Cost of Dissent
description: It is possible that the age of corporate dissent can turn expensive for the gad fly shareholder?

title: CAHILL WOULD GIVE FELL FUND REPORT
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13  Gov ernor Cahill said today that if he ran for reelection next year he would make a full public disclosure of all his campaign funds and would expect other Republican candidates in New Jersey to follow suit.

title: M.I.T. Fills Energy Post
description: BOSTON, Dec. 13 (AP)Dr. David C. White, Ford Professor of Engineering at Massachusetts Institute of Technology, has been named director of the institute's new Energy Labora tory. Dr. Albert G. Hill, vice president for research, an nounced the appointment and a $100,000 grant for the lab oratory from the New England Electric System.

title: U. S. INDICTS SIX ON SEX IN PRISON
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13 Allegations that sex partners were provided both in and out of prison to two wealthy in mates on Federal prison farms were made yesterday in indict ments returned by a Federal grand jury here.

title: RushHour Traffic On L.I. Is Delayed By Stalled Truck
description: A stalled tractortrailer truck under contract to the United States Postal Service blocked one lane of the Long Island Expressway and caused a traf fic jam throughout the height of the rush hour yesterday morning. Slow moving traffic was backed up past the Nassau County line, nearly 10 miles away.

title: Cougars Top Whalers, 63
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 13 (AP)Jan Popeil scored three goals to night to pace the Chicago Cou gars to a 63 victory over the New England Whalers. The loss snapped a sixgame winning string for the Whalers.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 13 (AP)John Havlicek scored 8 points late in the fourth quar ter tonight to help Boston win its sixth straight National Bas ketball ketball Association game by defeating Phoenix, 105100.

title: U.S. Wins Move in U.N. To Reduce Contribution
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 13The United States to night won its uphill fight to re duce its contribution to the United Nations budget.

title: POLL SAYS NIXON WON LABOR VOTE
description: More than half of all voters in labor union families voted for President Nixon rather than for Senator George Mc Govern last month, according to a Gallup poll released yes terday.

title: Police, Aided by Roadblock, Capture 2 After Bar Holdup
description: The police used roadblocks yesterday to capture two men who allegedly commandeered a taxicab after holding up 16 patrons in an East Village bar.

title: Plan to Merge Cox Cable And American TV Backed
description: Shareholders of the American Television & Communications Corporation and Cox Cable Communications, Inc., at sepa rate meetings approved yester day a previously announced plan to merge the two com panies.

title: Jury in Obscenity Case Sent to See Sex Film
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Dec. 13A City Court jury was taken to the Strand Theater today to view a sex film, Deep Throat, before delib erating charges of obscenity against the exhibitors.

title: Halfway Houses Proposed In SingleRoom Buildings
description: A plan for reducing crime in the city by converting single roomoccupancy buildings into halfway houses for addicts and others was submitted yester day by William vanden Huevel, chairman of the city's Board of Correction and the city's Com mission on StateCity Relations.

title: The Talk at Okemah, Okla.
description: OKEMAH, Okla.  Out on the eastern edge of this little farming and ranching town, where the streets run to yel low clay and the yards are littered with brokendown cars on cinder blocks, there is a crumbling hillside shack with a high porch that com mands the best view in Okemah. A per son can stand on this porch and take in a lot of what Oklahoma is all aboutoil pumps rhythmically nodding like so many giant praying mantises, fat Black Angus cattle grazing in a pasture of frostcrumpled prairie grass, and wind, always the wind, rattling willows down in the bottom, flapping blue denim overalls on a galvanized line, kicking up a puff of dust on a distant tabletop butte.

title: Geologists Eagerly Await Colored Soil From Moon
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13  Few, if any, specimens collected on a geologic field trip have been awaited with such expectation as those to be brought home from the moon in sample bag 509 and core tubes 35 and 44, for they contain the brightly colored lunar soil that has ex cited geologists here.

title: Maurice Eisenberg, Cellist, Dies While Teaching Juilliard Class
description: Maurice Eisenberg, the noted cellist, collapsed and died, ap parently of a heart attack, while giving a lesson yester day at the Juilliard School in Lincoln Center. He was 72 years old and lived at 119 Cypress Street, Millburn, N. J.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I would like to point out an error in M. L. Stein's Nov. 25 OpEd col umn.

title: Greek Finds a Sphinx From 7th Century B.C.
description: ATHENS, Dec. 13 (AP)A smiling marble sphinx from the seventh century B.C. was uncovered by a farmer near the market place of ancient Corinth, the American School of Classical Studies an nounced here today.

title: Advertising:
description: Both Waring & LaRosa and Smith/Greenland have some new business.

title: 8 Western Colleges Quit U.S. Olympic Committee
description: DENVER, Dec. 13 (UPI)The eightcollege Western Athletic Conference Council announced today it would end the league's membership in the United States Olympic Committee. The W. A. C. commissioner, Stan Bates, said, It is perfectly clear that, while we strongly support the Olympic Games, we do not wish to continue our member ship in the U.S.O.C. as it is presently structured.

title: Santa Fe Railway to Raise Outlays
description: The Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway, a unit of Santa Fe Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it plans capital expenditures next year of about $125million compared with an estimated $100million outlay in 1972.

title: ASTRONAUTS END WALKS ON MOON AFTER UNVEILING PLAQUE TO PEACE AND DEDICATING A ROCK TO YOUTH
description: HOUSTON, Thursday, Dec. 14 The Apollo 17 astronauts completed man's last lunar trek for years to come with a cere mony last night dedicating moon rock to the youth of the world, the promise of the future.

title: Hairston Strains Knee
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13 (AP) Happy Hairston of the Los Angeles Lakers has a strained right knee, but a team spokes man said today, It's possible he will play Friday night against Boston.

title: A Quarterback Wants Work
description: If Randy Johnson wants to write the story of his 1972 football season, Pete Athas, his teammate, has a good title for it: How to Make Fifty Grand in Six Months and Hate Every Minute of It.

title: ASTRONAUTS GAUGE MOON GRAVITY IN LAST WALK OF APOLLO PROGRAM; FAIL TO DISCOVER VOLCANIC TRACES
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12  The Apollo 17 astronauts, on man's last lunar trek for years to come, examined tonight the cracks, bluegreen crystals and glassy veins of huge boulders resting at the base of a steep sloped mountain of the moon.

title: 6 Decline to Testify at Inquiry on Racketeers' Link to Pier Concern
description: Four reputed Mafiosi with long criminal records and two other persons took the Fifth Amendment yesterday when called before the Waterfront Commission to testify in an investigation of whether two known labor racketeers had in filtrated a legitimate Port Elizabeth, N. J., stevedore com pany.

title: News of Dogs
description: England is known as the land of the terriers and Mrs. Mollie Harmsworth, from Somerset on this scept'red isle, is known as the owner of the famous Bengal Ken nels of Airedales.

title: Stage: White America
description: Racially, much has hap pened on the stageand in lifesince Martin Duber man's 1963 play, In White America, with a cast of blacks and whites dramati cally stitching together ex cerpts from records, diaries, letters, speeches and other documents. These flowing vignettes spanned black his tory in this country, from a slave ship to the steps of Central High School in Little Rock.

title: Experts Caution on Using Radials With Other Tires
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13. With the approach of winter, consumerprotection and safe ty advocates are busily offer ing advice on the selection and use of snow tires. This year, the main emphasis is on the hazards of mixing conventional snow tires with radial tires on the same car.

title: GEORGE H. ARRIS
description: PROVIDENCE, Dec. 13 (AP) George H. Arris, financial editor of The Providence Jour nalBulletin for 25 years, died today at the age of 72.

title: Truman's Condition Is Termed Weaker
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 13 Former President Harry S. Truman, hospitalized for lung congestion and an irregular heartbeat, was reported to night to be weaker and less responsive than he was yester day.

title: David Berks, an Executive Of Ohrbach's, Is Dead at 71
description: David Berks, who was execu tive vice president of the Ohr bach's department stores from 1940 until his retirement two years ago, died last evening in University Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 20 Fifth Avenue.

title: Warriors Stop Pistons
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13 (AP)The Golden State Warriors out scored the Detroit Pistons 194, in a fiveminute span in the middle of the second half to night on the way to a 110107 victory. The loss snapped a Piston threegame winning streak.

title: New India Hand
description: There is a touch of whimsy in President Nixon's choice or Daniel Patrick Moynihan, the former White House urban affairs counselor, to fill the toolongvacant post of Ambassador to India.

title: Writers Name Gamble As No. 1 Coach in East
description: Pennsylvania's football team nearly made the big leap from the depths of the Ivy League to the championship in one year, losing out in a thrilling finale to Dartmouth on Nov. 25. As a result the New York Football Writers Association voted yesterday to award Harry Gamble of Penn the annual Joseph M. Sheehan Memorial Trophy for the outstanding coaching job in Eastern major college com petition.

title: Sales of New Homes Rose At 10% Rate in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (Reuters)  Sales of new one family homes in October were at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 853,000 units, 10 per cent above September and 30 per cent above October, 1971, the Commerce Department re ported today.

title: DOW RAISES PRICES OF TWO CHEMICALS
description: Price changes were an nounced yesterday in a variety of chemicals.

title: Early Winter Weather Brings Midwest Propane Gas Crisis
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 13  Un usually early winter weather and an unusually late harvest have combined to cause a se vere shortage of propane heat ing gas in many parts of the Midwest.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Milton Sutton writes [letter Dec. 4] that because of his experience in the electronic field he urges the public to support C.B.S.'s right to assign work roles for its employes.

title: $28Million Offered By British Makers Of Thalidomide Pill
description: LONDON, Dec. 13The Brit ish manufacturer of thalidomide offered today to set up a $28.5 million trust fund for 342 chil dren born deformed as a result of the pill.

title: A Cozy Clutch of Shops in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  It looks like a village marketplace, but instead of fish and vege tables there are stalls of Gucci bags, Finnish sauna soap and Tiffany silver.

title: Number of Heroin Addicts Rises 12Fold in Decade
description: ATLANTA, Ga., Dec. 13 (AP) The estimated number of heroin addicts in the United States has multiplied 12 times in the last 10 years, an official of the Justice Department's Of fice of National Narcotics In telligence said yesterday.

title: 26 Cars Derailed
description: LOCK HAVEN, Pa., Dec. 13 (AP)Twentysix cars of a 112 car Penn Central coal train were derailed here today, dam aging a house and eight auto mobiles. No injuries were re ported.

title: President Sees Kissinger On Truce Outlook Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 The White House said today that President Nixon would confer with Henry A. Kissin ger first thing tomorrow morning to review Mr. Kis singer's justconcluded round of talks in Paris and to dis cuss the outlook for a nego tiated settlement of the Viet nam war.

title: NHITE HOUSE AIDE NEW PARKS CHIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  he Administration broke a Dngstanding tradition today in taming an assistant to Presi ent Nixon as director of the lational Park Service.

title: Soccer Draft Set Jan. 11
description: The annual collegiate player draft of the North American Soccer League will be held here Jan. 11, Commissioner Phil Woosman announced yesterday.

title: Metreveli 64, 61 Victor in South Australian Tennis
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Dec. 13 (UPI)Alex Metreveli, the Russian who just signed a con tract to play on the World Championship Tennis tour, breezed through the third round of the South Australian, cham pionship, today with a 64, 61 victory over Bill Durham. Me treveli has won the tournament the last two years.

title: Canarsie Yields to Scribner; Delays Action on Zoning Plan
description: The members of the com munity school board for the East Flatbush and Canarsie sec tions of Brooklyn  complying with a directive by School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner voted last night to postpone adoption of a new zoning plan that he said would not bring about better racial distribution at three junior high schools in the district.

title: Apollo 17 Coverage Gets Little Viewer Response
description: In case you're interested, this is how it ended:

title: KISSINGER LEAVES FOR U.S. AS ROUND OF TALKS CLOSES
description: PARIS, Dec. 13Henry A. Kissinger flew home tonight, ending an arduous round of Vietnam ceasefire talks with out having solved the central problempolitical control of South Vietnam.

title: BLAZERS TRIUMPH OVER JETS BY 74
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 13 (AP) The Philadelphia Blazers un leashed a fourgoal barrage dur ing the first 4 minutes of the final period tonight to chalk up a 74 World Hockey Associa tion triumph over the Winnipeg Jets.

title: MitchellLama's Rents Termed Bane for MiddleIncome Housing
description: The need to charge high rents in middleincome MitchellLarne housing projects is limiting their location to socalled better neighbor hoods in which tenants paying luxury rents are willing to live, Charles J. Urstadt, the State Housing Commission, told a leg islative committee here yester day.

title: Leafs Defeated by Fairbairn's Late Score
Crash Kills Jersey Couple
description: BAMBERG, S. C., Dec. 13 (UPI) A New Jersey couple was killed in a headon collision about five miles south of here on U.S. 301 this morning. The victims were identified as An tonio Alvarez, 70 years old, and his wife Rose, 67, of Elizabeth.

title: Kawaida Controversy
description: The decision to build a highrise apartment tower for lowincome blacks and other poor families in Newark's predominantly white North Ward has inevitably inflamed racial passions. In Newark as in New York City and else where, official bumbling and highlevel obduracy have threatened to become a community wreckingball.

title: CURBS ARE EASED BY SOUTH KOREA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 13 President Park Chung Hee tonight lifted the martial law regulations that he imposed 57 days ago to allow him to amend the Constitution and to clear the way for him to stay in power indefinitely.

title: Settlement at GAF Of Complex Suits Is Cleared by Judge
description: A comprehensive settlement of lawsuits involving stockhold ers of the GAF Corporation was approved yesterday by Judge Milton Pollack in Federal Court here.

title: Apollo Flight Highlights
description: Following are the high lights of the revised Apollo 17 flight plan. The timetable is subject to change at any time during the mission. Times are Eastern standard.

title: S.E.C. Halts Vipont Trading
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (Reu ters)The Securities and Ex change Commission announced today the suspension for 10 days of overthecounter trad ing in the common stock of the Vipont Mining Company and the Vipont Chemical Company because of the alleged dissemi nation of false and misleading information concerning the companies. Vipont Mining owns 42 per cent of ils Vipont Chem ical subsidiary.

title: The Dance: Transition
description: For its second New York season, the first under its new director, William Louther, the Batsheva Dance Company of Israel has con centrated on a new reper tory, offering New York many works it has not pre viously seen. Yesterday after noon, at the New York City Center, the company gave the last premiere of its New York engagement.

title: State Investigates NursingHome Rates
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yes terday that he had begun statewide investigation into allegations that private pa tients in nursing homes were being charged excessive rates.

title: Air New Zealand, 14, 2d in Westbury Finale
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 13 Air New Zealand, a Down Under gelding who will be 15 years old Jan. 1, finished second tonight in the final Roosevelt Raceway race of his career.

title: Lindsay Aide Attacks Governor In Gibe at Fading Fusion Move
description: The apparent demise of the fusion mayoral movement was greeted with jeers at City Hall yesterday.

title: Truman's Condition Is Termed Weaker
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 13 Former President Harry S. Truman, hospitalized for lung congestion and an irregular heart beat, was reported to night to be weaker and less responsive than he was yester day.

title: 9 in a Row for Colonels
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 13 (AP) The Kentucky Colonels roared to a 4220 firstquarter lead and withstood a late rally by the Carolina Cougars to post a 119112 victory tonight. The Colonels converted 78 per cent of their fieldgoal attempts in the first quarter.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PATERSON, Dec. 12Though this city will get about $200,000 less in Federal revenue sharing for 1972 than it anticipated, Mayorelect Thomas C. Rooney Jr. said there would still be enough margin in his budget to cut real estate taxes here by 10 per cent.

title: Equity Financing
description: W. R. Grace & Co. yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a secondary offering of 1,389,781 common shares. The registration covers shares that may be sold by certain shareholders who received them during the course of Grace & Co. acquisitions in recent years. The company's stock closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 28, down .

title: Adm. Thomas Robbins, 72, Dies; Aviator Led Naval War College
description: STONINGTON, Conn., Dec. 13Rear Adm. Thomas H. Rob bins Jr., retired, a leader in Naval aviation and former head of the Naval War College, died yesterday in Lawrence Me morial Hospital in New London. He was 72 years old and lived at 2 Cannon Square.

title: Music
description: When Lynn Harrell was principal cellist of the Cleve land Orchestra and James Levine its assistant conductor they used to give recitals to getherthe latter in the role of pianist. Now the cellist is on his own as a concert solo ist and Mr. Levine is with the Metropolitan Opera. Some how they found time to get together on Tuesday night and give a program in Town Hall as part of the Great Artist Series.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and Amer ican Stock Exchanges yester day issued their latest reports on changes in stock owner ship by leading stockholders, directors and officers of listed companies. The reports in clude the following:

title: Organization Created to Assess Corporate Role in Social Issues
description: The creation of a new organ ization to help college endow ment funds and other institu tional investors assess issues involving corporate social re sponsibility was announced yesterday.

title: Both Profit Taking and TaxLoss Selling Cited
description: A combination of profit tak ing in recently strong issues and taxloss selling of disappointing investments sent the stock market into a modest decline yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Meatcutters' Raises Approved

title: People in Sports: Blanda on Top
description: Quarterbacks never die, and some hardly ever fade away. George Blanda is a prime example. The Oakland Raiders' star will set a record Sunday as the oldest player in modern majorleague pro fessional football history when he will be 45 years 3 months old. The age will beat Ben Agajanian's mark when that kicking specialist per formed at 45 years 2 months 11 days in his last game in 1954. Blanda winds up his 23d pro season when the Raiders play the Chicago Bears, the team he started with in 1949.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Donald J. Checki's Oct. 31 OpEd article and its caption, President Marcos: Another Pacific Dictator, are disgraceful examples of journalistic license.

title: The Dedication Remarks
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13 (AP)Following are remarks made tonight by the Apollo 17 astronauts Eugene A. Cernan and Harrison H. Schmitt as they dedicated a moon rock to the youth of the world and a plaque to pcuces: Following is a text of the statements made today by Apollo 17 astronauts Eugene A. Cerman and Harrison H. Schmitt as they dedicated a moon rock to the youth of the world:

title: Britain Faces a Problem
description: LONDON, Dec. 13  Britain spent overseas $73million more than she earned last month, opening the prospect that balanceofpayments dif ficulties once again are ahead for this country.

title: State Investigates NursingHome Rates
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yes terday that he had begun a statewide Investigation into allegations that private pa tients in nursing homes were being charged excessive rates.

title: Suit Is Filed to Prevent Life Magazine Closing
description: A Hazelton, Pa., attorney has filed a suit in the Lu zerne County Court against Time Inc. to halt its plans to cease publication of Life magazine after the Dec. 29 issue.

title: NEWS SSOURCE BILL PASSED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 14A bill described by its sponsors as the strongest in the country in protection of news sources won final legislative approval this evening.

title: One U.S. Death Reported In Vietnam War Last Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 14 (AP)The United States command reported today that one American was killed in action in Indochina last week, the first in three weeks.

title: Admiral Corp. Elects
description: Ross D. Siragusa Jr., presi dent of the Admiral Corpora tion, Chicago, has been named to succeed his father, Ross D. Siragusa, as chief executive officer of the consumer elec tronics and appliance manu facturing company. The elder Mr. Siragusa, who founded the company in 1934 with $3,400 in borrowed funds, continues as chairman.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Princeton University's 79 yearold Triangle Club put on a onenight stand of its new musical production Blue Genes at Alice Tully Hall in Lincoln Center in Manhattan last night, with a record num ber of women13in a cast of 27.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso yesterday said that he would ask the State Legislature to prevent New York City from imposing the full city resident income tax on all future city employes who reside in the suburbs. A bill requiring full taxation was passed unanimously by the City Council on Wednesday.

title: Technical Session Today
description: PARIS, Dec. 14All four delegations to the regular for mal Vietnam negotiations pub licly recorded their explana tions today of why almost a month of private talks had failed to result in agreement.

title: Car Sales Seen Firm
description: Auto and truck sales in the United States next year should at least match and possibly ex ceed this year's record of near ly 13.5 million vehicles includ ing trucks and imports. Jahn J. Riccardo, president of the Chrysler Corporation told the conference.

title: News Analysis
description: CAIRO, Dec. 14President Anwar elSadat has emerged from an unprecedented four days of free debate in the Na tional Assembly with his rep utation as a political master juggler intact and his freedom of maneuver widened at least in the short run. This is the view of politically sophisticated Egyptians recover ing from the star tling experience of seeing members of Parliament public ly accuse the Gov ernment of such varied mis deeds as leading the public to believe that the country was ready for war, taxing the poor rather than the rich; and keep ing the truth out of the news papers.

title: Business Inventories Rise For Third Month in Row
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Total business inventories, un til recently a sluggish element in the expanding economy, rose substantially in October for the third consecutive month, the Commerce Department repot ed today.

title: 19 Accused in Carrier Riot Ordered Held Until Trials
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 14 (AP) Nineteen black sailors charged with assault and rioting aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk should remain in the brig here until their courtmartial trials, a Navy officer has ruled.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Traffic engineers concerned with the reduction of high urban pedestrian fatality rates will not welcome the revival of automobile hood decorations. (News story Dec. 5.)

title: Cambodians Still Rely on Buddhism's Timeless Signs
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 14There are nearly 70,000 monks and priests in Cambodia, and only 400 doctorsa good indication of the importance that Buddhism, with its mysti cism and fortunetelling and magic omens, plays in the everyday life of the Khmer people.

title: Mine Vote Appears to Back Insurgent Candidates
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Dec. 14Working coal miners ap peared today to have thrown their support strongly, and per haps decisively, to Arnold R. Miller in the voting for presi dent of the United Mine Work ers of America.

title: People and Business
description: Robert Price, who spent a year as Mayor Lindsay's Dep uty Mayor in 1966 and who many still consider an im portant politician in this po litical city, is joining Lazard Frres & Co. as vice presi dentcorporate finance. The 40yearold New Yorker, who managed campaigns for both Mayor Lindsay and Governor Rockefeller has already been on Wall Street for the last six years.

title: RESERVE OIL PLANS WESTERN MERGER
description: The Reserve Oil & Gas Com pany and Western Crude Oil, Inc., of Denver jointly an nounced yesterday that direc tors of both companies had agreed in principle to a merger of Western Crude Oil into Re serve Oil through an exchange of stock valued at about $26 million.

title: Sculptor Thanks the City in Steel
description: Louise Nevelson offered a four and half ton bouquet to the City of New York yester day in appreciation of a half century of artistic hospitality and inspiration.

title: U.S. Auto Production Seen Down 1,000 for the Week
description: DETROIT, Dec., 14 (Reuters) United States auto plants are scheduled to assemble 214,459 cars this week against 215,532 last week and 178,731 in the comparable week last year, ac cording to Automotive News to clay. The trade paper said thus far this year, plants have turned out 8,600,066 cars against 8,440,460 in the com parable 1971 period.

title: U.S. AGENCY TO TEST AN ELECTRIC VEHICLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14An electricpowered vehicle, re sembling an enclosed golf cart, was delivered to the Federal Government today for testing and possible future use.

title: Labor Meets Managers on Steel Output
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 Topranking labor and manage ment met today in what was described as a historic joint conference on productivity and both sides agreed that increased productivity must be achieved to meet foreign competition.

title: State Moves to Clean Up SingleRoom Chamber of Horrors' on West Side
description: In a continuing campaign to end the role of singleroom occupancy buildings as centers of crime, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz obtained a court order yesterday directing the owners of West Side Tow ers. 230 West 76th Street, to show why they should not be restrained from operating the 600room premises for illegal purposes.

title: Plans to Add More S.D.R.'s Put Off
description: PARIS, Dec. 14The major Western countries, reflecting conflicting approaches, are quietly letting this year pass without creating any more Spe cial Drawing Rights, the paper gold designed to serve as the linchpin of a future monetary system.

title: 3 Doctors, at Senate Hearing, Despair of Turning Public Away From Pills in Efforts to Lose Weight
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Three medical experts openly despaired at a Senate hearing today that the public would ever believe the truth about obesity: It is food that makes one fat, not pills that make one thin.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (Reuters)President Nixon's chief trade negotiator, William D. Eberle, has canceled his scheduled trip to Tokyo, a spokesman for his office said today.

title: Advertising:
description: The first full DKG, Inc., campaign for the Dollar Savings Bank will break on Monday and it will mark the Bronxbased institution's de but on TV.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISMaurice Schumann, present tenant of the Quai d'Orsay, by nature an optimist, is also one of the most energetic of France's Foreign Minis ters. He seems to see this country as a kind of swingman, initiating ideas or diplomatic contacts between dis puting parties around the world. He certainly has no illusions that this old nation remains a superpower but obviously doesn't feel it therefore con demned to intellectual or political stagnation.

title: BIG BOARD APPOINTS NEW VICE PRESIDENT
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that Gordon L. Calvert was joining its staff as vice presi dent and general counsel, based in Washington. Mr. Calvert is 51 years old and has been ex ecutive vice president and gen eral counsel of the Securities Industry Association.

title: Gypsies' Queen in Coma; Followers Keeping Vigil
description: For the last 10 days and nights, gypsy men and wom en have been encamped in a board room at St. Vincent's Hospital, keeping a vigil for Mary Mitchell, a 70yearold woman they consider their queen.

title: Technical Session Today
description: PARIS, Dec. 14All four delegations to the regular for mal Vietnam negotiations pub licly recorded their explana tions today of why almost a month of private talks had failed to result in agreement.

title: Rail TonMileage Up 7%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The Association of American Rail roads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week was an estimated 15.7 billion tonmiles, 7 per cent above the corresponding 1971 week. Car loadings in the same week totaled 516,523, an increase of 6.7 per cent above last year.

title: Prostitutes Ineligible for Aid
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 14 (UPI)Policemen who arrested four persons on charges of op erating a prostitution ring with women on welfare told the girls today that their income made them ineligible for fur ther welfare benefits.

title: Llanelli Rugby Victor
description: LLANELLI, Wales, Dec. 14 (Reuters)Llanelli beat Bath by 41 points to 10 in the only Rugby Union match in Britain tonight.

title: Adelphi Upsets C. C. N. Y.
description: Adelphi University upset City College, 6854, last night in the losers' gym. Bill Johnson of Adelphi was the game's high scorer with 25 points. John Makuch led City College with 10.

title: Music: Lyricism Anew
description: About five years ago the players of the Evenings for New Music programs headed by Lukas Foss would stride grimly on stage and engage some complicated serial mu sic. Times have changed. Now Evenings for New Music make dulcet sounds and are all but romantic in nature. One of two things therefore suggests itself: (a) Mr. Foss has undergone a major con version, or (b) academic se rialism is a thing of the past.

title: 2 Die in Navy Weapon Test
description: CHINA LAKE, Calif., Dec. 14 (AP)  Two specialists at the Navy's weapons center here have been killed in an explo sion at a test site in the upper Mojave Desert. Richard Plau son, a 36yearold research physicist and Walter LaDassor. 47, an engineering technician, died yesterday when explosives they had prepared for a test exploded prematurely, the authorities said, The accident occurred in a remote area of the weapons center.

title: The searchee is not being deprived of his right to travel.
description: BOSTONOne day in the spring of 1958 Robert Frost, in his eightyfourth year, left his grey Victorian house on Brewster Street in Cambridge and went down to Washington. At Back Bay station in Boston his secretary, Kay Morrison, saw him aboard The Senator, which would bring him into the capital at supper time.

title: OLD GLORY SALES TO START TODAY
description: YONKERS, Dec. 14  Wanna buy a horse?

title: Stocks Fall a Third Day; Airline Issues Show Drop
description: The stock market was hit with further selling yesterday, making its cumulative threeday loss the biggest pullback since midOctober, when a massive rally began.

title: Business Inventories Rise For Third Month in Row
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Total business inventories, un til recently a sluggish element in the expanding economy, rose substantially in October for the third consecutive month, the Commerce Department report ed today.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Duquesne Light Company yesterday offered through underwriters managed by First Boston Corporation 1.5 million common shares at $23.875 per share. Proceeds will be used to pay shortterm indebtedness incurred for construction programs. The utility's stock closed at 23, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: 24 Die in Philippine Crash
description: MANILA, Dec. 14 (UPI)A timber corporation's service bus plunged off a cliff into a river, in the central Philippines today, killing 24 persons and injur ing 31.

title: CERNAN AND SCHMITT BLAST OFF AFTER THREE DAYS ON THE MOON AND LINK UP WITH COMMAND SHIP
description: HOUSTON, Friday, Dec. 15 Apollo 17's moon explorers blasted off from the surface and rejoined their orbiting command ship last night in the Apollo project's final departure froth that desolate cratered world.

title: JOHN STAUFFER, 74, OF CHEMICAL WORKS
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 14 John Stauffer, director emeri tus of the Stauffer Chemical Company of Westport, Conn., died yesterday. He was 74 years old and had homes here and in Palm Springs.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Sculptor Gives Bouquet to City

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Although snowbelt states prohibit the chasing of wild animals by snowmobile op erators, the practice still continues to varying degrees in some areas, as acknowl edged by the Colorado Wild life Division's recent an nouncement that it might have to tighten its restric tions against the abuse.

title: PARIS
description: PARIS, Dec. 14The Vietnam peace talks in Paris are still going on, but the point of decision is really back in the White House, where it has been from the start. The question now is whether President Nixon is prepared to make a separate peace with Hanoi and the South Vietnamese Commu nists, and so far he has held back.

title: Lewis Conducts a 1917 Operatic Rarity
description: As its music director for the last few years, Henry Lewis has built the New Jer sey Symphony Orchestra into a firstrate ensemble. Since its base is Newark, he likes to bring it across the river to Carnegie Hall with some regularity. When he does so, he offers not just another program of standard works, but some outofthe way items. Whether they are liked or not, their perform ance enriches the musical life of this city.

title: Manhattan Parking Found 45% Illegal
description: Fortyfive per cent of all private cars parked in Man hattan are parked illegally, an organization of 18 business groups reported yesterday as it presented a 14point plan to deal with the problem.

title: Jordan Says 3 Are Convicted Of Plotting Hussein Overthrow
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 14 (AP)A palace spokesman said today that a military tribunal had convicted three Jordanians, among them a royal guard com mander, of having plotted to overthrow King Hussein. The spokesman did not announce the sentences.

title: DOCTOR FOUND DEAD, TIED UP IN OFFICE
description: A 74yearold physician, bound and gagged in an appa rent robbery, was found dead in the bedroom of his Upper West Side officeresidence yes terday.

title: Clark Wins Morocco Golf
description: RABAT, Morocco, Dec. 14 (UPI)Clive Clark of Britain posted a threeunderpar 70 to day to win the Morocco inter national grand prix golf tour nament. Tom Jacobs and Ron Cerrudo, of the United States, shared second spot with 71's.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SUNLIGHT DIALOGUES. By John Gard ner. Illustrated by John Napper. 673 pages. Knopf, $8.95.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: President Nixon is employing a quite misleading phrase when he states that throwing money at social prob lems does not solve them. It takes little study to determine that if one raises Old Age Assistance payments from $100 to $200 a month the prob lem of elderly poverty is alleviated. Similarly, one can readily understand that if it costs $20,000 to fund a Head Start class for a year for twenty chil dren, the expenditure of $40,000 will fund two such Head Start classes.

title: Courage and Conviction
description: On Dec. 5 this year, the day honoring the Constitution of the Soviet Union, Valery N. Chalidze wrote an article on The Times OpEd Page describing unconstitutional repressions bearing down on his Soviet colleagues in dissent. Will the movement in defense of human rights live on, or will the participants in this movement be imprisoned, exiled, intimidated, broken? he asked.

title: W. TEXAS STATE TOPS ST. PETER'S
Store Settles a Case Of Mistaken Delivery
description: A dispute involving the re lentless flow of unwanted mattresses, headboards and bed frames delivered to the threeroom apartment of Mrs. Ralph Spinner at 268 East Broadway was resolved yes terday in Civil Court in Man hattan.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 14 A Lebanese newspaper said today that the Soviet Union was providing Syria with ad vanced weapons that had been denied to Egypt. The daily An Nahar quoted informed sources in Damascus as saying that the arms were not available out side the Warsaw Pact coun tries.

title: Downgrading the U.N.
description: In nearly two years of hard work, George Bush had become a widely respected and uncommonly wellliked United States representative to the United Nations. He was not invariably successful because some Administra tion policies he had to defend were strongly opposed by a majority of U.N. members; but his effectiveness increased steadily and his efforts unquestionably cut United States losses in the Security Council and the General Assembly.

title: WHEAT FUTURES SHOW ADVANCES
description: Trading was a little less hectic yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade after record volume on Wednesdays.

title: TURCO BIDS GIBSON DROP KERR CHOICE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 14  City Council President Louis M. Turco today called Mayor Ken neth A. Gibson's nomination of Police Lieut. Edward L. Kerr to be the city's first black police director another Eagleton af fair.

title: $10Million Heroin Stolen From a Police Office Vault
description: Fiftyseven pounds of heroin with an estimated street value of $10million to $12mil lionhas been stolen from the Police Department, Commis sioner Patrick V. Murphy an nounced yesterday.

title: ITALIANS GETTING 13TH MONTH'S PAY
description: ROME, Dec. 14  Italians are collecting their Christmas bonuses these days, and the price of steak has gone up to the equivalent of $5 a pound.

title: Gracie Mansion Is Picketed By 30 From Hospital Staff
description: About 30 people, most of them nurses and doctors from Metropolitan Hospital picketed Gracie Mansion yesterday to protest the quality of care pa tients were receiving and the dismissal of a registered nurse.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Press reports and Washington ru mors continue to fuel speculation that the Foreign Service and the Depart ment of State will be vitalized, However worthy this objective, it will not he easy to achieve.

title: Lincoln Garage Fumes Termed Too Heavy for Safety Nov. 23
description: A specialist in heart and lung diseases estimated yesterday that while 300 idling cars were backed up inside the Lincoln Center garage on Thanksgiving Day, carbon monoxide levels reached between 300 and 500 parts per million.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Forum Theater Plans Repertory

title: BadgeCarrying Surgeon and Hippies Report to the Mayor
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday met a surgeon, who in his light green cottons looked, as though he was fresh from the operat ing room; a telephone line man with tools bulging from his kit, and assorted hippies.

title: Prime Rate Rise Forecast
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 14 (Reuters) Gaylord Freeman, chairman of the First National Bank of Chicago, today predicted a modest and acceptable in crease in the prime rate to 6 per cent within 90 days and to 6.25 per cent by mid1973.

title: Teamsters End a Truce With Chavez's United Farm Workers
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., Dec. 14 The teamsters union ended a truce today with the United Farm Workers union of Cesar Chavez in a longsimmering dis pule over control of organized labor in agriculture.

title: People in Sports: Expansion Vice Presidents
description: The National Basketball Association, which has ex panded from nine teams to 17 since 1966, has taken note of the increased complexities and problems of its opera tion. Yesterday it named three vice presidents to aid Walter Kennedy, the com missioner, in handling the league's business.

title: Alice Stockfleth Gains Lead In Seniors' Figure Skating
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 14  Alice Stockfleth of Wilmington, Del., led the senior women's event after the compulsory school figures today at the South Atlantic figure skating championships at the Wissa hickon Skating Club. Laurie Johnson, also of Wilmington, was second.

title: BIG ATOMIC ORDER AWARDED TO G.E.
description: The Tennessee Valley Au thority awarded yesterday to the General Electric Company what is believed to be the lar gest nuclear order ever in terms of generating capacity.

title: Alice Stockfleth Gains Lead In Seniors' Figure Skating
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 14 Alice Stockfleth of Wilmington, Del., led the senior women's event after the compulsory school figures today at the South Atlantic figure skating championships at the Wissa hickon Skating Club. Laurie Johnson, also of Wilmington, was second.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ALBANY, Dec. 14 (AP)New York State authorized today the Schenectady offtrack betting system to accept bets on races at Laurel and Calder, two outofstate tracks, beginning Monday.

title: Newport News Going Home
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 14 (AP) The world's largest heavy cruiser, the Newport News, wracked on Oct. 1 by an explo sion that killed 19 sailors, will return home to Norfolk from Southeast Asia Dec. 24, the Navy announced yesterday.

title: Bruins, on 55 Shots, Beat Rangers, 42
description: BOSTON, Dec. 14The New York Rangers could hardly have chosen a less auspicious time for their first appearance of the season in Boston Garden. They ran into the pentup fury of the Boston Bruins, who bombarded them with four goals in the sec ond period, a total of 55 shots on goal and a final score of 42 tonight.

title: Manhattan Parking Found 45% Illegal
description: Fortyfive per cent of all private cars parked in Man hattan are parked illegally, an organization of 18 business groups reported yesterday as it presented a 14point plan to deal with the problem.

title: DR. JACOB HARTMANN
description: Dr. Jacob Hartmann, an in ternist, died Tuesday in the Bronx Hospital at the age of 69. He lived in Yonkers and his office was at 1507 Popham Avenue in the Bronx.

title: Lunar Nap Inspires A Seasonal Parody By AstronautPoet
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 14  The moon has been walked on, impacted with thirdstage boosters, littered with lunar excursion modules and lunar rovers, and today, about noon, near the edge of the Sea of Serenity, in the beautiful valley of TaurusLittrow, it inspired its first geologistastronaut poet, Dr. Harrison H. Schmitt.

title: Fender Work Brings Honor
description: NEPTUNE CITY, N. J., Dec. 14 (AP)Capt. Eugene A. Cer nan and Harrison H. Schmitt have been granted honorary lifetime membership in the Auto Body Association of America in recognition of fender repair work on the lunar Rover while the Apollo 17 astronauts were on the moon. Reg Predham, president of the group, announced the award at his repair shop here.

title: LEGISLATORS SEE HOPE FOR TAX CUT
description: ALBANY, Dec. 14The Re publican and Democratic lead ers of the Assembly, in sepa rate auguries concerning the 1973 Legislature, said today that they hoped to provide some relief for heavily taxed homeowners.

title: Government Discloses 2d Tap in Ellsberg Case
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 14The Government revealed today that it had a second wiretap involving a member of the de fense team in the Pentagon papers case, and a Federal judge set Tuesday morning for a hearing on the matter.

title: Ship Cracks in Half Near Puerto Rico; 19 Seamen Missing
description: SAN JUAN, P. R, Dec. 14 (Reuters)  Nineteen seamen were reported missing tonight after a Panamaregistered mer chant marine vessel cracked in half in heavy Atlantic seas, the United States Coast Guard re ported.

title: Essex Going to WABCTV
description: Gary Essex, who became the weather reporter for WCBSTV last Jan. 1, has resigned to join the Eyewitness News staff at WABCTV. Mr. Essex, who is 39 years old, will be the week end weather forecaster on Channel 7, and will also report on the environment. Tex An toine will continue as the Mon day through Friday weather re porter. At Channel 2, the nightly weather forecaster for the time being will be Alan Kasper, weekend ??

title: OFFICIALS OPPOSE NIXON PLAN TO CUT TAX ON PROPERTY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  A group of Federal, state and local government officials re jected today President Nixon's idea that the Federal Govern ment provide the financial aid that would permit local govern ments to reduce property taxes.

title: GENEVIEVE CAULFIELD
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 14 (AP) Genevieve Caulfield, who es tablished schools for the blind in Thailand and Hong Kong, died Tuesday in Bangkok. She was 83 years old.

title: U.S. Shoe Corporation Raises Earnings 28.6% in Fourth Quarter
S.E.C. Asks Bias Advice
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The Securities and Exchange Commission, in an unusual action, asked the public today for advice on whether it should issue rules forcing non discriminatory employment practices on stock exchanges, stock brokerages and other organizations in the securities business.

title: Stars Rout Tams
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 14 (AP)Zelmo Beaty scored 23 points and Ron Boone came off the bench and hit for 26 to night as the Utah Stars routed the Memphis Tams, 14797.

title: Rene Mayer, a Former Premier And French Cabinet Aide, Dies
description: PARIS, Dec. 14Former Pre mier Ren Mayer died here last night at the age of 77.

title: CarBomb Rips Bar In Ulster
description: BELFAST, Dec. 14 (UPI)A bomb laden car exploded out side a crowded bar near the border with the Irish Republic last night, killing a woman and injuring six other people, the British Army said.

title: Advertising:
description: They were lifting their glasses at both S S C & B and Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborne yesterday. That which runneth over, however, was different.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 14 (AP)  Complaints about sex discrimination have ex ceeded complaints about ra cial discrimination, the di rector of the state's Division on Civil Rights said today.

title: West Side Residents Oppose Mormon Project, Charging Racism
