description: MEDFORD, Mass., Dec. 19 (AP)The faculty at Tufts Uni versity voted yesterday to es tablish an AfroAmerican studies program at the school, to begin possibly next September.

title: Notes on People
description: At the Invitation of Presi dent Nixon, former Premier Elsaku Sato of Japan will visit the United States on Jan. 17, according to the Kyodo news service in Tokyo. Mr. Sato was reported to have a strong desire to thank Mr. Nixon for the re turn of the Island of Okinawa to Japan last May, Mr. Sato, who resigned as Premier in July, will be accompanied by his wife, Hiroko, and by Toshio Kimura, former direc tor of the Economic Planning Agency.

title: Thuy Statement Denied
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19. (Reuters)The White House, Itook issue today with the statement by Xuan Thuy, chief of the North Vietnamese dele gation in Paris, that the United States had insisted on introduc ing 126 modifications to the tentative ceasefire accord of Oct. 20.

title: 10 STATES CAN ISSUE POLLUTION PERMITS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency granted interim author ity today allowing 10 states to issue permits for waste dis charge into waterways. The au thority expires next March 18 under a limitation imposed by the water pollution law Just passed by Congress.

title: Bruins Edge Penguins, 32, As Esposito Tallies Twice
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 19 (UPI) Phil Esposito scored two goals to lead the Boston Bruins to a 32 victory tonight over the Pittsburgh Penguins in the might's only scheduled National Hockey League game.

title: THREE IN CALIFORNIA INDICTED FOR FRAUD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP) Three California men have been accused of alleged fraud ulent buying and selling of se curities that resulted in a loss of about $1.2million for the brokerage firm of Hornblower & Weeks, Hemphill, Noyes, the justice Department disclosed today.

title: Federal Mediator Hopeful Of Talks Soon on L. I. R. R.
description: The Federal mediator in the Long Island Rail Road dispute said yesterday that he hoped to bring management and union negotiators together today for a joint bargaining session.

title: Manhattan Easy Victory
description: Manhattan, paced by Bill Campion and George Bucci, humbled Wagner, 10155 last night at Sutter Gymnasium on Staten Island. Campion scored 22 points and hauled in 10 re bounds. Bucci had 20 points. Wagner's Joe Jones paced all scorers with 26 points.

title: Expanded Auditors' Role Urged by S.E.C. Official
description: The chief accountant of the Securities and Exchange Com mission yesterday called upon auditors to take joint responsi bility with management for thel way financial statements are written. Corporate executives now are the chief persons answerable for what is dis closed.

title: Dolphins to, Start Morrall In Playoff With the Browns
description: MIAMI, Dec. 19 (UPI) Coach Don Shula named Earl Morrall today as the starting quarterback for the Miami Dol phins against the Cleveland Browns in Sunday's American Conference playoff game in the Orange Bowl.

title: Haig Avoids Press
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 19General Haig met with President Lon Nol today to bring him up to date on the impasse in the Vietnam nego tiations and presumably to reaf firm Washington's support and encouragement for Cambodia's struggle against North Vietna mese and local insurgent troops.

title: SteelersRaiders: Matchup in Youthful Vim
description: Will there be a Super Bowl team on the field in Pitts burgh this Saturday when the Steelers take on the Oakland Raiders in the first of the National Football League's four playoff games? The win ner there can expect to take on next the undefeated Mi ami Dolphins, heavily favored (12 points) over Cleveland on Sunday, for the American Confer ence champion ship Dec. 31 and a Super Bowl berth. Bear in mind that the Dolphins beat only two teams that ended the season with winning rec ords: the Giants and the Kan sas City Chiefs.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19In the aftermath of the break down of the Paris negotiations, and the renewed bombing of Hanoi and Haiphong, some diplomats, officials and news men are wondering aloud whether any possible strains have developed between Presi dent Nixon and his chief nego tiator and foreign policy ad viser, Henry A, Kissinger. The speculation is based on both rea sonable deduc lions and inlangi ble evidence. The rumors have been magnified by the current con fusion in Washington about almost everything dealing with Vietnam. Despite Mr. Kissin ger's news conference on Saturday, there is uncertainty about the reasons for the col lapse of the Paris talks, and the brief White House an nouncement yesterday about the bombing fell short of an explanation of why it was or dered.

title: Phil Esposito Is Honored
description: TORONTO, Dec. 19 (Canadian Press)Phil Esposito of the Boston Bruins, threetime Na tional Hockey League scoring champion and leading figure in the Team Canada victory over the Soviet Union, was named today as the 1972 winner of the Lou Marsh trophy. The award was instituted in 1936 to com memorate the late sports editor of The Toronto Star and is given Ito the outstanding Canadian athlete of the year.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: LONDON, Dec. 19 (AP) The National Gallery today put on show Henri Rous seau's Tropical Storm With a Tiger, acquired with the help of a large donation by the United States Ambassa dor, Walter H, Annenberg.

title: Bucks Wallop Sonics 12177
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 19 (AP) The Milwuakee Bucks, spark ed by Kareem AbdulJabbar and Oscar Robertson, moved to a 6129 halftime lead tonight and rolled to a 12177 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Detective's Widow Argues He Was a Murder Victim
description: Mrs. Anna Nunziata, widow of a detective whose name ap peared on the Police Depart ment's propertyroom record for the release of some $10 million to $12million worth of heroin seized 10 years ago in the socalled French Connec tion case, contended in State Supreme Court yesterday that her husband did not commit suicide but was a murder victim.

title: Plastic Vies With Pines In ChristmasTree Sales
description: With the strains of O Tan nenbaum filling the air in department stores and Christ mas tree lots across the coun try, millions of Christmas shoppers this week are pon dering a vexing holiday question: Should they join the 30 millionorso tradi tionalists who will drive or tramp to the nearby tree lot, shake a few scotch pines or douglas firs to see if the needles are intact, and then shell out $5 to $50 for a nat ural Christmas tree?

title: 12 CONGRESSMEN SEE SPLASHDOWN
description: ABOARD THE TICONDERO GA, Dec. 19 (AP)Senators and Representatives aboard this Apollo 17 recovery ship called today for renewed Unit ed States emphasis on space research.

title: Australia in Talks With East Germany
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 19 Gough Whitlam, Australia's new Prime Minister, said today that his country had opened negotiations with East Ger many aimed at establishing diplomatic relations.

title: NEW COURT URGED FOR U.S. APPEALS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Creation of a national court of appeals that would screen out and dispose of nearly 90 per cent of the Supreme Court's present heavy caseload was recommended today by a blue ribbon committee named by Chief Justice Warren E. Burger.

title: Monticello Crowd Is Small, but Bets Are Big
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Dec. 19  Any coward can bet with On in New York City and then watch his money at home on television.

title: Prices Decline on the Amex and OTC
description: The breakdown in the Viet nam peace talks announced on Saturday continued to have a depressing effect on prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday.

title: Bridge: When Bidding Shows Misfit, Three NoTrump Can Fail
description: When the bidding shows a misfit, most players settle in three notrump, hoping for the best. They rarely get the best, because misfits do not play well in notrump. A sevencard fit in a major will often be more productive, especially if the suit has some internal solidity.

title: Taiwan Warns Candidates on Mudslinging
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 19 One of the words heard most frequently in Taiwan's current election campaign for national legislative and local offices is curse. The Chinese term, in one of its usages, takes on the connotation of mudslinging.

title: Ahmet Yalman, Turkish Writer And Political Journalist, Dead
description: ISTANBUL, Dec. 19 (UPI) Ahmet Ernin Yalman, a leading author and journalist, died to day of a heart attack. He was 84 years old.

title: Yale Subdues Brown
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 19Tim Reams and Scott Ferguson led Yale to a 9988 Ivy League vic tory over Brown tonight. Fer guson, a 6foot9inch junior, had career highs of 21 points and 17 rebounds. Kearns led all scorers with 28.

title: Agency Has Spaceships And Rockets Left Over
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 19 (UPI) The space agency ended Project Apollo today with surplus rockets and space ships worth $705million. The leftover equipment includes two Saturn 5 rockets, five smaller Saturn 1B first stages, one Saturn 1B second stage, one Saturn instrument unit and three Apollo com mand ships.

title: Man Carrying Rifle Robs 2 Women in Subway Car
description: A man wielding a sawedoff rifle took $225 from two wom en on a Queens subway train yesterday morning.

title: Man Sentenced to 18 Years In Killing of Father of Four
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 19 (AP)A man accused of fatally shoot ing a father of four before sev eral witnesses has been given an 18year prison term. Muhammed Najuib, 37, of nearby Lackawanna was sen tenced yesterday by Justic Nor than A. Stiller of State Supreme Court.

title: Nixon Statement on Apollo 17's Return
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Following is the text of Presi dent Nixon's statement on the successful completion of Apollo 17:

title: Hunter's Swimmers Win
description: Joseph White made his home debut as Hunter College coach a successful one last night as Hunter defeated Jersey City State College, 6048. It was Hunter's first victory after four defeats in swimming.

title: To Tiffany, Citibank's Tree Is Vulgar
description: In an elegant burst of pique, Tiffany & Co. has accused the First National City Bank of hav ing put up a loud and vulgar Christmas tree in front of the bank on Park Avenue at 53d Street and of polluting the es thetic atmosphere of Park Ave nue.

title: 4 Firemen Hurt as Blaze Damages 6 S. I. Dwellings
description: A smoky fouralarm fire raced last night through six threestory woodenframe resi dential and commercial build ings in the New Brighton sec tion of Staten Island, causing extensive damage to two of the dwellings and injuries to four firemen.

title: Truck Hijacked on Thruway
description: YONKERS, Dec. 19 (UPI) Three men hijacked a tractor trailer loaded with electrical kitchen appliances and cook ware at the Yonkers Avenue entrance to the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway last night. They kidnapped the truck driver and held him at gun point for three hours before releasing him in Fort Lee, N. J., the state police reported.

title: Woman, 65, Is Found Slain In Her Bronx Apartment
description: A 65yearold woman was found dead in her ransacked apartment in the West Farms area of the Bronx last night. The police said she was appar ently killed in a robbery at tempt.

title: BRUINS WIN, 32, FROM PENGUINS
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 19 (UPI) Phil Esposito scored two goals to lead the Boston Bruins to a 32 victory tonight over the Pittsburgh Penguins in the night's only scheduled National Hockey League game.

title: Nixon Goal Held a Fantasy
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 19North Vietnam accused the United States today of premedi tated intensification of the Viet nam war and termed the action insane.

title: Saints Sink Whalers, 75
description: ST. PAUL, Dec, 19 (AP) Wayne Connelly scored his 18th and 19th goals of the sea son tonight to lead the Minne sota Fighting Saints to a 75 triumph over the New England Whalers.

title: Life Jacket Found in Gulf
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Dec. 19 (UPI)A life jacket was found today in the area of the Gulf of Mexico where a Coast Guard helicopter went down Saturday night with eight per sons aboard. Officials said it was not known if the jacket was from the aircraft. The heli copter was airlifting four men from a sinking shrimp trawler.

title: Expos Trade Hermosa
description: MONTREAL, Dec., 19 (Cana dian Press) The Peninsula. Whips, Class AAA farm club of the Montreal Expos, have ob tained Michael Carruthers, a first baseman, from the Cleve land Indians' organization, the Expos announced today. In re turn the American League Indi ans obtained Angel Hermosa, an infielder.

title: Massachusetts Blood Plea
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)The Massachusetts Red Cross issued an emergency appeal for blood today when the statewide sup ply slipped to 300 pints. The state uses 1,000 pints a day for operations and emergencies. Pints are down to 300 across the state, the Red Cross said, and in oBston not more than 75 exist.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: A man might be a very great liberal in political life, and he might be equally as conservative in judicial process, because they're entirely dif ferent. You see, in the political process, the legislative bodies have the oversight, within constitutional limits, of everything in their jurisdiction. And if they see something they don't like, something that needs to be remedied, they can single that out, and bring it in and try to legislate on it. And they can; they're in what you might call freewheeling to advocate anything they want to accomplish, that accomp lishes that purpose. And if they can't get a whole loaf, why, they settle for a half loaf, and if they can't get a half loaf, they may settle for a quarter, and if they can't get that, maybe they'll bypass the whole thing and let it go another time.

title: Leasco Is Planning Cash Acquisition Of Far West Corp.
description: The Leasco Corporation an nounced yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire the Far West Financial Corpo ration, a Los Angeles savings and loan holding company, for about $33,685,000 in cash.

title: StateSuffolk Unit Set Up On Mental Patients' Needs
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 19 The establishment of a joint statecounty committee on mental hygiene, with a full time staff to evaluate all prob lems related to the discharge of patients from state mental institutions, was agreed on to day by the state's Commis sioner of Mental Hygiene and the Suffolk County Executive.

title: Raiders Trounce Blazers With Early Flurry, 7 to 2
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 19 (AP) The New York Raiders drove seven straight goals past Bernie Parent, the Philadelphia goalie, in the first two periods tonight and then coasted to a 72 World Hockey Association vic tory over the Blazers.

title: EUGENE HAMPSON, 63, EDITOR IN PLAINFIELD
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Dec. 19 (AP)Eugene F. Hampson, who retired in 1968 after 41 years with The Plainfield Courier News, died today at Muhlen burg Hospital here. His age was 63.

title: Redskins' Brown Unanimous Choice As N.F.C. AllStar
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:Dr. William J. Welch's weakly re pressed frustration with the changing of medical practice is quite apparent from his broad and vague pronounce ments of a new generation of doctors . . . trained . . . by hospitalbased in structors who themselves know little of the daytoday necessity of other than the catastrophically ill. The im plication that doctors in training are concerned wholly with diagnosis and are ignoring patient care is unfair and in no manner founded in fact.

title: LAOS COMMUNISTS ASSAIL PEACE PLAN
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 19 The Communistled Pathet Lao spoke out today against a new proposal by the Vientiane Gov ernment for ending the war in Laos. The Pathet Lao charged, that the United States was still committed to fight and that its Vientiane ally must therefor fight also.

title: Peron in Lima on Way To Spain for Christmas
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 19 (Reu ters)Juan D. Pern, accom panied by his wife and 10 aides, arrived in Lima last night from Asuncin, Para guay, where he had spent four days.

title: Business Briefs
description: The nation's major airlines should receive $225million to $250million in aftertax income this year and profits should continue to rise next year, according to Secor D. Browne, chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board.

title: STUDENT FISTFIGHTS IN CAIRO REPORTED
description: CAIRO, Dec. 19 (Reuters) Fistfights broke out between rival groups of students on the campus of Cairo University to day as a conflict continued be tween antiGovernment and proGovernment factions, in formed sources said.

title: Mine Union Board Acts to Bar Purge by New Leader
description: In a move to circumscribe the power of the incoming head of the United Mine Workers Union, Arnold R. Miller, to re place current officeholders, the union's executive board voted yesterday to assert its supreme authority over hirings, firings and suspensions within the union.

title: Virgin Islands Asks If Its Tourist Industry Can Live With a 2d Oil Refinery
description: ST. CROIX, V.I., Dec. 19 The legislature will meet here tomorrow to decide if tax con cession and other subsidies shall be granted to the pro moters of a second giant oil refinery on this troubled island.

title: SHIPS POUND COAST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 20Two B52 heavy bombers and an F111 swingwing fighterbomber have been lost since the United States resumed fullscale bomb ing of North Vietnam Monday, an American military spokes man said last night.

title: Long Beach, Jacksonville Win on Coliseum's Court
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 19  Jacksonville had to work hard for its spot in tomorrow night's final of the Nassau Classic and Long Beach State went through the motions of a scrimmage, and not a good one at that, for its berth.

title: Welfare Help Challenged
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19 (UPI) Massachusetts paid $25,872 to help a welfare recipient lose weight, State Auditor Thaddeus Puczko reported yesterday. He said that the recipient was in perfect health, and that his weight problem had been caused solely by excessive eating.

title: 4 Dead, 3 Wounded in Shooting In Cleveland Horne
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 19Four persons were killed tonight and three others wounded in what the police described as a drug related shooting in an east side residence.

title: JULES TEPPER DIES; JERSEY LAWYER, 77
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Dec. 19Jules E. Tepper, a lawyer, died last night at Beth Israel Hospital in Newark. He was 77 years old and lived at 53 White oak Drive.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The New York Public Li brary's Theater on Film and Tape Archives has established a Stanley Prager Memorial Fund to videotape dialogues between renowned figures in American comedy and mu sical comedy. The fund is named after the Broadway di rector and comic actor.... The American Place Theater, at 111 West 46th Street, has invited the Little Theater of the Deaf of the Eugene O'Neill Memorial Theater Center, to appear there Dec. 26 to Dec. 31..... Lincoln Center will light its Christ mas tree and invite its friends and neighbors to sing carols around the Lincoln Center fountain tomorrow at 6:30 P. M.... Ferenc Mlnar's The Play's the Thing will open at the Roundabout The ater Company's playhouse on West 26th Street Jan. 9. Hugh Franklin, Neil Flana gan, Elizabeth, Owens and Humphrey Davis will star in the comedy.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19Who is the best sophomore on Southern California's undefeated football team, Anthony (Touchdown Tony) Davis or Richard (Batman) Wood?

title: Indiana Detergent Curb Near
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 19 (AP) Allphosphate detergents will be taken off grocery shelves in Indiana on Jan. 1 to implement the nation's toughest anti phosphate law. The Indiana Stream Pollution Control Board today upheld the January ban on use and sale of household detergents that contain phos phates and the April 30 ban on commercial use of the cleansers and their use in home dish washers.

title: Wooden Leg Yields Cocaine
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec, 19 (AP) Customs agents said today that they had arrested a Colom bian national after finding $30, 000 worth of pure cocaine stowed in a hollow peg leg. Thomas J. Dean, chief customs agent, said the arrest was made at New Orleans International Airport after the Colombian, Angel Maza, 26 years old, was reluctant to offer the wooden leg for inspection.

title: LAKERS SET BACK BRAVES BY 126100
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 19 (AP)I The Los Angeles Lakers, play ing without two injured start ers, Jerry West and Happy Hairston, outscored Buffalo, 23 5, in the last 5 minutes of their National Basketball Asso ciation game tonight and beat the Braves, 126100.

title: CURCI WILL COACH KENTUCKY ELEVEN
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 19 (AP)Fran Curci, the head football coach at the Univer sity of Miami for the last two years, accepted a fiveyear con tract today for the same job at the University of Kentucky.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the matter of relations between Israel and Jordan (editorial Dec. 8), religion occupies a special place in the lives of us all not excluding atheists; theirs in a negative way. Shrines, churches, synagogues, mosques, tem piesall have a deep significance for their adherents.

title: Navy Aide Asserts MilitaryIndustrial Complex Has Invaded Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19A high ranking civilian in charge of Navy defense contracts tes tified today that the military industrial complex had invaded the executive branch and that the appointment of the Indus trialist Roy L. Ash as chief budget officer for the President was a mistake.

title: 27th U.N. Assembly Ends; Results Prove to Be Mixed
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 19The 27th annual ses sion of the General Assembly ended tonight with a mixed sense of accomplishment and failure.

title: MRS. LEON FRADKIN, LED U.N. SUPPORTERS
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 19 Mrs. Elvira Kush Fradkin, a past president of the New Jersey branch of the American Associ ation for the United Nations, died yesterday in Community Hospital. She was 82 years old and lived at 101 Gates Avenue. She was the widow of Dr. Leon H. Fradkin, a dentist.

title: Peking Pledges Support
description: TOKYO, Dec. 19 (AP) China's Acting President, Tung Piwu, and Premier Chou En lai have promised the Vietcong that so long as the United States does not stop its war of aggression, the Chinese people will, as always, resolutely sup port and assist the just struggle of the Vietnamese people.

title: Manhattan Easy Victor
description: Manhattan, paced by Bill Campion and George Bucci, humbled Wagner, 10155 last night at Sutter Gymnasium on Staten Island. Campion scored 22 points and hauled in 10 re bounds. Bucci had 20 points. Wagner's Joe Jones paced all scorers with 26 points.

title: 1859 Cooper Union Building Shut for 2Year Renovation
description: Cooper Union has closed and vacated its landmark Foundation Building on Coop er Square for a twoyear, $15million interior renova tion, the first major moderni zation since the historic structure was opened by Peter Cooper in 1859.

title: Apollo 17 Splashes Down Accurately In Successful Finale to Moon Project
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 19The Apollo exploration of the moon, one of the great achievements of all time, came to a success ful conclusion today with the splashdown of the Apollo 17 astronauts in the waters of the Pacific Ocean.Nothing is impossible in this world, when dedicated people are involved. And it's a funda mental law of nature, that ei ther you must grow, or you must die. Whether that be an idea, whether that he a man, whether that be a flower or country, I thank God that our country has chosen to grow.

title: Raiders Trounce Blazers With Early Flurry, 7 to 2
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 19 (AP) The New York Raiders drove seven straight goals past Bernie Parent, the Philadelphia goalie, in the first two periods tonight and then coasted to a 72 World Hockey Association vic tory over the Blazers.

title: Radakovich Reverses Field
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 19 (AP) The University of Cincinnati announced today that Dan Radakovich, a University of Colorado assistant coach who last week was named head coach at Cincinnati, had backed out of the job.

title: NOTRE DAME TOPS ST. LAWRENCE, 85
description: Notre Dame broke away from persistent St. Lawrence University in the final period last night, scoring five goals en route to an 85 victory in the second game of the Eastern College Athletic Conference Holiday Hockey Festival.

title: Providence Conquers Oregon By 7360 as Barnes Sparkles
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 19 (UPI)Marvin Barnes, a 6foot 8inch junior center, scored 23 points and grabbed 18 rebounds in leading the Providence Col lege basketball team to a 7360 victory over the University of Oregon tonight.

title: New U. S. Raids on North Are Denounced by Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19The Soviet Government today de nounced the resumption of widescale United States air raids over North Vietnam and said it was giving the develop ing situation its most serious consideration.

title: CAIROMOSCOW TIE IS STRAINED ANEW
description: CAIRO, Dec. 19A new Soviet refusal to supply Egypt with offensive weapons has report edly strained relations between the two Governments anew and induced President Anwar el Sadat to abandon any plans for a visit to Cairo by one of the three top Soviet leaders.

title: Hanoi Displays 6 Prisoners
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 19 (Agence FrancePresse)Six United States airmen, sonic of whom were said to be crew, members of a B52 bomber, were presented to the press here today. They were said to have been captured last night.

title: Wilson Named Card Scout
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 19.(UPI) Larry Wilson, who ended his career as a defensive hack with the St. Louis Cardinals last Sunday, was named today to a new post of scouting profes sional teams and personnel. Wilson's new duties will begin immediately, the club said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Willowbrook Care Denounced at Trial

title: Bishops Urge Further Studies On Ordination of Women Priests
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPD) A study committee of Ro man Catholic bishops said to day that the question of ordina tion of women to the priest hood had been insufficiently. researched. The panel offered little hope that the allmale priesthood would be changed in the near future.

title: NEW COURT URGED FOR U.S. APPEALS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Creation of a national court of appeals that would screen out and dispose of nearly 90 per cent of the Supreme Court's present heavy caseload was recommended today by a blue ribbon committee named by Chief Justice Warren E. Burger.

title: Hanoi Displays 6 Prisoners
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 19 (Agence FrancePresse)Six United States airmen, some of whom were said to be crew members of a B52 bomber, were presented to the press here today. They were said to have been captured last night.

title: People in Sports: Paterno's Bid
description: Although he turned down offers in the past from the Pittsburgh Steelers and the Green Bay Packers, Joe Pa terno, Penn State's highly successful football coach is, still in heavy demand by the pros. The Philadelphia Eagles and the New England Patri ots were reported yesterday to he seeking the services of Paterno, whose Nittany Lions will meet Oklahoma in the Sugar Bowl on Dec. 31, The Patriots were said to be ready to offer him a five year contract amounting to $1million. The Penn State elevens have won 63 games while losing 12 and tying one during Paterno's seven years the helm.

title: People in Sports: Paterno's Bid
description: Although he turned down offers in the past from the Pittsburgh Stealers and the Green Bay Packers, Joe Pa terno, Penn State's highly successful football coach is, still in heavy demand by the pros. The Philadelphia Eagles and the New England Patri ots were reported yesterday to be seeking the services of Paterno, whose Nittany Lions will meet Oklahoma in the Sugar Bowl on Dec. 31. The Patriots were said to be ready to offer him a five year contract amounting to $1million. The Penn State elevens have won 63 games while losing 12 and tying one during Paterno's seven years at the helm.

title: Walter Brown, Engineer, Dead; Art Inventor of a Radar Tube, 72
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 19 Walter John Brown, an elec tronics engineer who invented a radar tube in the 1920's, died yesterday in a hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 71 Gurley Road.

title: Newsman Jailed in Refusal To Yield Watergate Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19  A Los Angeles newspaperman was found in contempt of court and was briefly jailed today when he refused to surrender tape recordings of an interview with a principal witness in the alleged bugging of the Demo cratic party's headquarters.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 19A Fed eral grand jury has indicted 35 alleged members of five inter locking autotheft rings ac cused of stealing more than 500 luxury cars on order over the last two years in New York State, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: Vikings' Player Chasing A MillionDollar Lode
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 19 (AP)  John Beasley, the Minnesota Vikings' tight end since 1967, says he plans to obtain a milliondollar corpor ate loan and start mining silver in Nevada next spring.

title: Strikers and All Idled Can Get Jobless Aid
description: Strikers against the Long Island Rail Road, as well as nonstrikers out of work be cause of the walkout are qualified to receive unem ployment benefits under rules of the Railroad Retire ment Board, Robert A. Rus sell, regional director of the agency, said yesterday.

title: In the Godly Game It Isn't Cricket
description: In this holy season it is reassuring to note that Ladbrokes, the reliable London house that caters to Britain's bettors as Howard Samuels would like to service the sporting gentry of New York, has been declared persona non grata on British golf courses, not to say nux vomica. After a brief flirtation with the bookmakers, the Royal and Ancient Club and the Professional Golfers' Association have concluded that gambling on the greens is not cricket. From now on, anybody who wishes to risk a few quid on Tony Jacklin or Bob Charles will have to phone his bookie up in town. There'll be no more investment counselors setting up their slates beside the 18th fairway. The decision will gratify godly golfers such as Arnold Palmer and Gary Player, who were scandal ized when they saw Ladbrokes doing business in a tent at Turnberry, Scotland, during the $134,750 John Player tournament last September.

title: Vikings' Player Chasing A MillionDollar Lode
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 19 (AP)  John Beasley, the Minnesota Vikings' tight end since 1967, says he plans to obtain a milliondollar corpor ate loan and start mining silver in Nevada next spring.

title: U.S. Complaint Under Study
description: GENEVA, Dec. 19A four man panel is to study a United States complaint that Britain is contravening her internation al commitments by giving a trade advantage to British com monwealth countries in the Caribbean at the expense of other nations.

title: Kerner Denied Trial Delay
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 19 (AP) Judge Robert L. Taylor of Fed eral District Court refused today to delay the Jan. 3 start of the trial of former Gov. Otto Kerner of Illinois on charges of bribery, conspiracy and income tax evasion.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: A plaque commemorating the revolutionary 1913 Ar mory Art Show, which brought modern art to the American public's attention at the time, was unveiled yesterday at the Old 69th Regiment Armory, the site of the show almost 60 years ago.

title: Providence Conquers Oregon By 7360
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 19 (UPI)Marvin Barnes, a 6foot 8inch junior center, scored 23 points and grabbed 18 rebounds in leading the Providence Col lege basketball team to a 7360 victory over the University of Oregon tonight.

title: Texas Continues 100% Output
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 19 (UPI) The Texas Railroad Commis sion, responding to record de mand for crude oil, today set the state's oilproduction al lowable for January at 100 per cent, marking the 10th straight month of capacity pro duction.

title: Con Edison Moves to Prevent SteamHeat Shortage
description: The first of a threestep emergency plan to prevent a shortage of steam heat in major office buildings, hospitals and housing developments in Man hattan was put into effect Sun day, the Consolidated Edison Company disclosed yesterday.

title: Bronx Assemblyman Indicted as Taxi Riot Inciter
description: Assemblyman Armando Mon tano of the Bronx has been indicted for allegedly inciting a riot during a gypsycab dem onstration last September.

title: Court Delays Certification Of Vote to Retire Judges
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19 (AP)A threejudge Federal court panel issued a temporary restraining order today barring Secretary of State John F. X. Davoren from certifying the results of the Nov. 7 referendum approv ing mandatory retirement for state judges at 70.

title: OFFSHORE OIL BIDS REACH NEW HIGH AT $1.6BILLION
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 19 Oil companies, scrambling for new drilling areas in the rich Gulf of Mexico sea bottom, submitted bids totaling a rec ord of more than one billion, six hundred million dollars on 119 tracts today.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Concern about the impact of population and industrial growth on the environment and limited resources of Spaceship Earth is causing some economists to reexamine their first principles.

title: G.O.P. SENT BACK $50,000 FOR DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19  The Nixon campaign sent back $50,000 in unreported donations from C. Arnbalt Smith, San Diego banker and baseball club owner, earlier this year while he was facing three Govern ment investigations.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Mia Farrow has been cast in the role of Daisy in a Da vid Merrick production of The Great Gatsby for Para mount Pictures.

title: YugoslavAmerican on Trial In Montenegro on War Charge
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 19 (UPI)A YugoslavArner lean went on trial today on charges of war crimes com mitted in collaboration with Italian Fascist occupying forces in World War II, United States Embassy officials said.

title: 4 Hurt as Roof Caves In
description: WATERVLIET, Mich., Dec. 19 (AP)  Heavy snow caved in the roof of an old twostory building in Watervliet today, sending tons of snow, bricks land debris crashing through the second floor and injuring at least four persons in a bar on the ground level.

title: Crusaders Beat Cougars, 61
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 19 (AP)Jan Popiel scored twice and Bob Sicinski picked up a goal and three assists, as the Chicago Cougars defeated the Cleveland Crusaders, 61, tonight.

title: Next U.S. Space Shot Will Be Skylab in April
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) The next American space venture will be Skylab, an earthorbiting laboratory set for launching April 30 to see how well man can live and work in space for weeks at a time.

title: 4 in Dublin Get 7Year Terms For Effort to Free I. R. A. Chief
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 19Four men who attempted to free Sean MacStiofain on the day follow ing his conviction as an official of the illegal Irish Republican Army were jailed today for seven years.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 19A law termed the strongest of its type in the state went into effect here today with the aim of stemming an increasing crime rate by making parents responsible for the delinquent acts of their children.

title: Hopes for Peace Dashed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 19The United States bombs that fell on Hanoi and Haiphong today brought gloom to many American officials here and jubilation to members of the South Vietnamese Govern ment.

title: Distribution Is Cut Of Some TV Sets By National Union
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 19 (AP)The National Union Elec tric Corporation announced to day that it was discontinuing its unprofitable Emerson and Dumont television and other homeentertainment distribu tion operations and had set aside about $7million after taxes to cover estimted losses.

title: ROYAL DUTCH PLANS ACCOUNTING CHANGE
description: The directors of the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company an nounced yesterday they would make changes in their 1972 ac counting policies because of the alteration in exchange rates be tween the British and Dutch currencies in recent years.

title: Two Left With Brother, 5. Die Following Bronx Fire
description: Two infant girls died yester day from burns and smoke in halation after a fire in their fourthfloor Bronx apartment, where they had been left alone with their 5yearold brother, police and fire officials re ported.

title: Suns Out score Knicks, 190, On Way to 11784 Triumph
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 19  After taking a 2212 lead in the first 10 minutes, the New York Knicks came apart and were practically blown out of the Memorial Coliseum tonight by the Phoenix Suns, who raced off with a 11784 victory. It was New York's worst defeat of the season.

title: Shopkeeper on L.I. Dies After Being Shot at Store
description: NEW CASSEL L. I., Dec. 19 (UPI)The owner of a dry cleaning store here, was shot twice in the chest at his place of business last night and later died in surgery, the Nassau County Police said.

title: 1859 Cooper Union Building Shut for 2Year Renovation
description: Cooper Union has closed and vacated its landmark Foundation Building on Coop er Square for a twoyear, $15million interior renova tion, the first major moderni zation since the historic structure was opened by Peter Cooper in 1859.

title: INSURANCE SALES TIED TO AUTO CLUB
description: The New York branch of the American Automobile Associa tion acknowledged yesterday that its five top officers, its general counsel and two retired directors were also principal stockholders in the private auto insurance agency to which the club referred its members.

title: Credit Markets
description: Prices of corporate bonds were easier again yesterday but dealers reported some recover ies in lateafternoon trading. Moderate declines were also registered in taxexempts and Treasury issues were mixed. The Federal Reserve reportedly bought $100million in coupon issues maturing 1975 to 1979, helping intermedi ate issues add 1/32 to 2/32. In new financings, underwriters led by Paragon Secu rities and Schweickart & Co. won $20million of Newark variouspurpose bonds on a bid of 100.039 for 5 coupons. The bonds are rated Baa by Moody's and BBB by Standard & Poor's.

title: Racial Violence Is the Theme of 'Across 110th Street'
description: A few years ago Barry Shear made a movie about the generation gap. It was called "Wild in the Streets," and it managed at once to be unfair to kids, vicious towards adults and insulting to anyone concerned with the problems (real enough) of reconciling the anxieties and interests of young and old.Yesterday a new Barry Shear movie opened at neighborhood theaters. It is called "Across 110th Street," and it deals withor inviolence between New York City blacks and whites. It manages at once to be unfair to blacks, vicious towards whites and insulting to anyone who feels that race relations might consist of something better than improvised genocide.The film concerns a band of Harlem toughs who hold up a transfer of drug money to the mob downtown, steal a few hundred thousand dollars and shoot everyone involved. The mob, led by Anthony Franciosa, seeks revenge. And the police, led by Anthony Quinn and Yaphet Kotto (one old, the other young; one white, the other black; one about to retire, the other bucking for his job), begin an investigation. By the time it is over virtually everybody has been killedby various means, but mostly by a machine gun that makes lots of noise and splatters lots of blood and probably serves as the nearest substitute for an identifiable hero.People don't fare so well. When they aren't being killed, they are being torturedeither by the rest of the cast or by the director, who tends to observe life as if through a distorting lens or in extreme close-ups that reduce faces to nervous twitches, tense lips, and the like. Shear's style runs very close to genre parody. But about personal violence it is almost hysterically serious, and audiences for whom hatred is enough may turn "Across 110th Street" into a very popular movie indeed.So much, and so much nonsense, has been written about the black exploitation film, that I hesitate to point out what may be the one perfect example of the type. But "Across 110th Street" (produced, written, and directed by whites) really does exploit its situations and its actors and even its violence, in a desperate rip-off of the latest news about the death of our cities.Such filmmaking goes where current events take it. A new Barry Shear project has been announced for the Middle East: A violent band of Arab terrorists is being hunted by a force led by an Arab and and Israeli police officer. Anthony Quinn will play the Arab police officer. I don't know whether anyone is bucking for his job.

title: Two Charged in the Theft Of $1.4Million in Stocks
description: The Manhattan District At torney's office announced yes terday the arrest of two men in connection with the theft of $1.4million in stocks issued by the International Business Ma chines Corporation and the Xerox Corporation.

title: In the Godly Game It Isn't Cricket
description: In this holy season it is reassuring to note that Ladbrokes, the reliable London house that caters to Britain's bettors as Howard Samuels would like to service the sporting gentry of New York, has been declared persona non grata on British golf courses, not to say nux vomica. After a brief flirtation with the bookmakers, the Royal and Ancient Club and the Professional Golfers' Association have concluded that gambling on the greens is not cricket. From now on, anybody who wishes to risk a few quid on Tony Jacklin or Bab Charles will have to phone his bookie up in town. There'll be no more investment counselors setting up their slates beside the 18th fairway. The decision will gratify godly golfers such as Arnold Palmer and Gary Player, who were scandal ized when they saw Ladbrokes doing business in a tent at Turnberry, Scotland, during the $134,750 John Player tournament last September.

title: TIME MAGAZINE SETS EUROPEAN EDITION
description: Time Magazine announced yesterday that it would begin a separate European edition, while its rival, Newsweek, said it planned a major expansion of its existing international edi tion.

title: Nixon's Sincerity Doubted
description: PARIS, Dec. 19The Soviet Ambassador to France, de nouncing the renewed bombing, today questioned the sincerity of American peace pledges de livered during President Nix on's visit to Moscow in the spring.

title: Democrats Meet on PostElection Unity
description: The annual postelection at tempt to unify the New York Democratic party got under way last evening at a meeting of 16 leading Democrats at the Manhattan Club.

title: Kings Lose at Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 19 (UPI) The Atlanta Hawks held off a thirdquarter bid by the Kansas CityOmaha Kings tonight and took a 119102 victory in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Stage: A Series Begins
description: A Meeting by the River, a new play by Christopher Isherwood and Don Bachar dy, opened and closed Mon day night at the Edison, but that was according to plan.

title: Judge Denies Injunction To Halt Closing of Life
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Dec. 19 Lawrence M. Klemow, 28 years old, of Hazleton, lost his bid in Luzerne County Court yesterday in his fight to block Time Inc. from suspending the publication of Life magazine with the Dec. 22 issue.

title: N.B.C. Protests A. B. C.'s Olympic Pact
description: The National Broadcasting Company has protested to the International Olympic Commit tee in Lausanne, Switzerland, against what it calls an attempt to dispose of the United States television rights to the 1976 Olympic Gaines through secret and noncompetitive proce dures.

title: BOWATER WILL RAISE PRICE OF NEWSPRINT
description: Bowater, Inc. a subsidiary of one of the world's largest newsprint manufacturers, an nounced yesterday an increase of newsprint by $5 a Lon, effec tive Feb, 1. The increase will bring the price of newsprint to $170 a ton, and follows the ac tions of the Great Northern Paper Company, and the Price Paper Corporation, which earli er this month raised prices by a similar amount. Newsprint manufacturers in British Co lumbia also raised prices yes terday, but in the case of the largest producer the increase will affect customers only in western Canada.

title: A Black Will Be Promoted To Deputy Police Inspector
description: A black police captain with 18 years on the force will be promoted to deputy inspector on Friday, the Police Depart ment said yesterday.

title: A Brooklyn Diocese High School Will Close
description: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn will close one high school, phase out another and increase tuition in its high school system to $800 a year beginning next September, Bishop Francis J. Mugavero an nounced yesterday.

title: Bucks Wallop Sonics, 12177
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 19 (AP) The Milwuakee Bucks, spark ed by Kareem AbdulJabbar and Oscar Robertson, moved to 6129 halftime lead tonight and rolled to a 12177 victory over the Seattle Super Sonics.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 19 (AP) Billy Cunningham hit 12 points in the fourth period to lead the Carolina Cougars to a 116111 victory over the San Diego Conquistadors tonight.

title: FUTURES PRICES OF COCOA TUMBLE
description: Cocoa futures prices tumbled yesterday on news that the Soviet Union planned to cut down consumer goods alloca tions. In recent years, the So viet has been a major buyer of cocoa from Ghana and Nigeria, the world's major producers.

title: ZWILLING IS FIRST IN GIANT SALUM
description: MADONNA DI CAMPIGLIO, Italy, Dec. 19 (AP)  David Zwilling of Austria swooped to victory in the men's giant slalom today and took the lead in the 1973 World Cup standing as the only competitor to pick up points in the season's first three events.

title: Harlem Pupils Get Early Start on Kwanza
description: Kwanza, a black celebra tion of harvest, fertility, revi talization and first fruit, was marked in Harlem yesterday at the Studio Museum.

title: British Condemn Uganda's Seizure of Concerns
description: LONDON, Dec. 19The Brit ish Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, told the House of Commons today that Ugan da's seizure of 34 British com panies and tea estates yester day was a violation of inter national law.

title: TV: What Price Health? Is Presented on N.B.C.
description: Last night the National Broadcasting Company pre sented an hourlong docu mentary titled What Price Health? Produced for N.B.C. Reports by Lucy Jarvis, writ ten by George Lefferts and narrated by Edwin Newmn, the program examined three broad areas of health care in the United States: the mal distribution of medical serv ices (at least 5,000 American communities are without doctors); the inadequacies of insurance coverage and the astronomical costs of medical care.

title: 2 AREAS SEEKING SCHOOL DISTRICTS
description: The Board of Education was asked at a public hearing yes terday to create two new com munity school districts in the city, one in southeastern Queens and the other in Brook lyn's Bushwick area. There are now 31 local districts.

title: CONTINUED TALKS EXPECTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 The White House said today that it expected lowlevel tech nical talks on details of a set tlement in Vietnam to continue as scheduled this week in Paris despite the resumption of full scale bombing and mining of North Vietnam.

title: Books of The Times
description: In 1961, Barbara No man and her hus band bought a house in an obscure agri cultural village on the northeast coast of Spain. She was a freelance writer and he was a concert violinist: they could live anywhere they chose, that dream that is reaching almost obsessive proportions in cosmopolitan people, It used to be only the retired who thought of moving to some out of the way utopia, but today more and more people of all ages are yearning for a retired place, some native or foreign retreat where they can put aside the distractions of modernity or technology and turn their attention to themselves.

title: Head of Chrysler Sees Record Sales
description: DETROIT, Dec. 19  Lynn Townsend, chairman of the Chrysler Corporation, predicted today that sales of cars and trucks would total about 13.6 million units next year, sur passing this year's record of 13.5 million.

title: Army Wins By 7350
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 19 Army swamped the Merchant Marine Academy, 7350, to night. The Cadets connected on only two of their first 18 shots but wound up shooting 48 per cent.

title: Harvard 9180 Victor
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 19 (AP)Lou Silver hit for five baskets in the last seven min utes to propel Harvard to a 9180 victory over Holy Cross tonight.

title: Quebec Legislature Backs Sale of Power to Con Ed
description: Quebec's provincial legisla ture has approved a bill that would permit HydroQuebec, the provincial utility, to sell up to 800,000 kilowatts of electrical power to Consolidated Edison for use during Con Edison's peak summer months starting in 1977.

title: Jazz Scene
description: Gil Evans's Orchestra, one of the most vital but elusive of the city's big jazz bands, played at the Village Gate Monday evening in what is planned as a continuing series of appearances there on al ternate Mondays. Mr. Evans is known primarily for his big band orchestrations for Miles Davis in the nineteen fifties, for his arrangements for Mr. Davis's precedentset ting cool nonet in 1948 and, before that, as an arranger who was highly in fluential in setting the un usual style of Claude Thorn hill's orchestra.

title: Harvard 9180 Victor
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 19 (AP)Lou Silver hit for five baskets in the last seven min utes to propel Harvard to a 9180 victory over Holy Cross tonight.

title: CURCI WILL COACH KENTUCKY ELEVEN
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 19 (AP)Fran Curd, the head football coach at the Univer sity of Miami for the last two years, accepted a fiveyear con tract today for the same job at the University of Kentucky.

title: Museums Decked for Holidays
description: While the city sparkles outdoors with the latest in Christmas displays, within its museums dwells the spirit of Christmas past.

title: Plan for a Larger Council Is Fought by Varied Foes
description: A proposed reapportionment plan for the City Council, de signed to increase minority group representation by adding six new districts, ran into a solid wall or opposition at a public hearing yesterday.

title: OFFSHORE OIL BIDS REACH NEW HIGH AT $1.6BILLION
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 10 Oil companies, scrambling for new drilling areas in the rich Gulf of Mexico sea bottom, submitted bids totaling a rec ord of more than one billion, six hundred million dollars on 119 tracts today.

title: Miss Proell Cup Leader
description: SAALBACH, Austria, Dec. 19 (AP)  Annemarie Proell fought off a bout with the flu and sped to victory today in the women's downhill ski race marked by spectacular spills after crossing the finish line.

title: PenskeDonohue Team Adding Another Porsche
description: That mutually profitable relationship between Porsche and the Roger PenskeMark Donohue racing team gets better all the time.

title: White House News
description: The Federal Communications Commission is the agency responsible for regulating radio and TV stations under the law, but the White House is elbowing it aside in a crude effort to call the signals on what can reach the American people.

title: ALEXANDER DREIBAND
description: Alexander Dreiband, a trial lawyer and former assistant dis trict attorney, died Monday, at St. Vincent's Hospital, S. I. He was 67 years old and lived at 128 Dutchess Ave, S. I.

title: The Theater: Trials of OZ Arrives
description: There are few things more absurd than an Establishment court engaged in an obscenity charge. The court is placed in a position of talking about matters of taste as if they were matters of morals, and the court cannot win. It is bound to sound ridiculous, if only because it is attempting to maintain community stand ards of taste without really knowing the new community.

title: Elliott Replaces Curci
description: MIAMI, Dec. 19 (AP)Pete Elliott, a former head coach of Nebraska, California and Illi nois, was named today to re place Fran Curci as head foot ball coach at the University of Miami.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19 (AP)  Dickinson Debevoise, a Newark lawyer, was selected today as chairman of the New Jersey Workmen's Compensation Study Commission, which was created last week by Governor Cahill to study the system and make recommendations for changes.

title: L.I. Class Sends $15.43 To Neediest After a Sale
description: Mrs. Nina K. Kimball's class of fourth, fifth and sixthgraders in Room 101 at the John H. West Puhlic School in Bethpage, L. I., sent $15.43 to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday.

title: Maoist ExProfessor Is Arrested on Coast
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Dec. 19 Eight persons, including H. Bruce Franklin, a Maoist who is a former Stanford University professor, were arrested today in California and Arizona on charges growing out of the slay ing of a prison guard Oct. 6.

title: Deere & Co. Raised Profit in Quarter
Succession Rule Favored For Picking Chief Judge
description: The jockeying has begun in earnest for the powerful job of chief judge of the state, embroiling politicians, judges and lawyers in a scramble for power as well as a debate over the role of the chief judge and the manner in which he is chosen.

title: Neve Indictments Name 7 Attica Inmates
description: WARSAW, N. Y., Dec. 19 Seven men who were inmates of Attica prison during the 1971 uprising there were taken to court here today, accused of crimes including kidnapping a guard, slashing the throat of a hostage and assaulting a hos tage who later died as a result, of state troopers' gunfire dur ing the crushing of the rebellion.

title: Truck Hijacked on Thruway
description: YONKERS, Dec. 19 (UPI) Three men hijacked a tractor trailer loaded with electrical kitchen appliances and cook ware at the Yonkers Avenue entrance to the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway last night. They kidnapped the truck driver and held him at gun point for three hours before releasing him in Fort Lee, N. J., the state police reported. There was no estimate of the value of the goods stolen.

title: Yale Subdues Brown
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 19Tim Kearns and Scott Ferguson led Yale to a 9988 Ivy League vic tory over Brown tonight. Fer guson, a 6foot9inch junior, had career highs of 21 points and 17 rebounds. Kearns led all scorers with 28.

title: SIX SUITS SETTLED BY BOISECASCADE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 19 (UPI)In a $58.5million set tlement of six lawsuits, the Boise  Cascade Corporation agreed yesterday to refund pur chase costs on demand and to make promised improvements on 20 recreational subdivi sions in California and Nevada.

title: Special Illinois Elections Set
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Dec. 19 (AP)Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie called today for special elec tions to fill a Congressional vacancy caused by the death of Representative George W. Col lins a Democrat, on Dec. 8 in a Chicago plane crash.

title: Cahill and Legislature to Weigh Action in Jersey Central Crisis
description: NEWARK, Dec. 19Gover nor Cahill said today that he would meet in Trenton tomor row with legislative leaders to discuss the threatened termi nation of passenger service by the Jersey Central Railroad.

title: Experts at Trial Decry Neglect at Willowbrook
description: Two expert witnesses said yesterday that the care and treatment of residents at the Willowbrook State School for the Mentally Retarded was thoroughly inadequate and led to mental and physical de terioration.

title: Trail Blazers 109100 Victors
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 19 (UPI) Sidney Wicks and Geoff Petrie combined for 55 points tonight to lead the Portland Trail Blazers to a 109100 victory over the Chicago Bulls.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police investigating the theft of 81 pounds of im pounded heroin seized in the French Connection case talked yesterday with Deputy Chief Inspector Edward F. Carey, retired, who was head of the Narcotics Bureau when detectives made the seizures in 1962. The loss of 81 of the 97 pounds seized and placed in the police prop erty storage room was disclosed last week.

title: LeMoyne Appoints Cooney
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 19 (AP) When Tom Niland ends a 26 year career as head basketball coach at LeMoyne College next spring, his successor will be Toni Cooney, assistant coach since 1968. Cooney, 29 years old, is a former LeMoyne player and currently serves as college sports information director in addition to coaching.

title: Johnstown Picks Lanyon
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa., Dec. 19 (AP)The Johnstown Jets of the Eastern Hockey League named Ted Lanyon, a 33year old defenseman, as their new playercoach today. Lanyon succeeds Tom McVie, who re signed.

title: Thief and Wife in 'Getaway'
description: Some movies, like Elaine May's "The Heartbreak Kid," are about confusion. Some movies exploit confusion to their advantage and our amusement. Joseph L. Mankiewicz's "Sleuth," for example. Then there are films that are simply lost in confusion  aimless enterprises that run on and on, sometimes with the sort of dazed looks you might expect, but often with expressions of deceptively intense purpose.The last pretty well describes Sam Peckinpah's new film, "The Getaway," the story of an Ivy League-looking ex-con (Steve McQueen), his remarkably chic wife (Ali McGraw) and some double- and triple-crossing associates who, early on, hold up a bank in San Antonio and then spend the rest of the film trying to get away from the cops and from one another. More or less.That qualification is necessary because if you take the characters at face valuewhich is what one usually does in this kind of filmthen certain key decisions they make reflect on their sanity, which is otherwise unquestioned. From where any critic sits, it's impossible to tell whether this confusion is the result of the writing, the direction or the editing.In concentrated bursts, "The Getaway" occasionally comes to vivid, melodramatic life, as in a sequence in which McQueen hunts down a small-time thief who has stolen his valise containing $500,000, probably under the notion that it contains some hockable jewelry or traveler's checks.A subplot (actually more interesting than the main plot) details the easy decline and fall into whoredom of a veterinarian's dim-witted wife (enthusiastically played by Sally Struthers of "All in the Family"), when she and her husband are kidnapped by one of the bank robbers.The film depends mostly on simpler, stickier sorts of sensation, such as the curious spectacle of Steve and Ali surviving inside the stuffed bowels of a garbage truck. Upon emerging, or being dumped, Ali does have one small scratch on her forehead and some smudges on her frock, but I doubt whether she'd be turned away from the door of "21."For all his reputation as a director of action and violence ("The Straw Dogs"), Peckinpah is most effective and most eloquent when dealing with themes of love and loss, which are as apparent in the super-bloody "The Wild Bunch" as in the quieter "The Ballad of Cable Hogue" and this year's ruefully comic "Junior Bonner." The action and the violence of "The Getaway" are supported by no particular themes whatsoever. The movie just unravels.

title: City Councilman Killed
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 19 (AP)Three men kid napped a Protestant city coun cilman in Armagh during the night and killed him with two shots in the head.

title: Eberle Assays Move
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 William D. Eberle, the Presi dent's special representative for trade negotiations, termed re grettable today the reported decision of the European Com mon Market Council of Min isters not to extend further the agreement involving the Amer ican selling price.

title: A Connecticut Death Sentence Reduced to Follow U.S. Ruling
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 19  The Supreme Court of Connecticut today reduced the death sen tence of a convicted murderer to life imprisonment, in keep ing with the state court's under standing of the United States Supreme Court's ruling on capi Aal punishment last June 29.

title: Nelson Is Lost to Celtics
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19 (AP)  Don Nelson of the Boston Celtics will he out of action for at least three weeks because of a badly sprained ankle. Frank Challant, trainer for the Na tional Basketball Association team, said Nelson would return to Boston tomorrow from the West Coast where the Celtics are currently on a road trip.

title: Anderson to Coach Brown
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 19 John W. Anderson, whose Middlebury College elevens thrived in the last two years, was named head football coach at Brown University today. The new mentor is an alumnus of Ursinus, class of '54.

title: Wooden Leg Yields Cocaine
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 19 (AP) Customs agents said today that they had arrested a Colom bian national after finding $30, 000 worth of pure cocaine stowed in a hollow peg leg. Thomas J. Dean, chief customs agent, said the arrest was made at New Orleans International Airport after the Colombian, Angel Maze, 26 years old, was reluctant to offer the wooden leg for inspection.

title: CLARKSON BEATEN BY ST. LOUIS SIX
description: St. Louis University, making its first appearance in the tour nament, walloped Clarkson, 105, in the opening game of the 12th annual Eastern College Athletic Conference Holiday Hockey Festival at Madison Square Garden last night, Notre Dame, last year's winner, met St. Lawrence in the sec ond game.

title: Director of Telecommunications
description: Well, I suppose everyone would like to have everyone love them, Clay T. White head said yesterday. But you just can't make effective change in something as im portant and controversial as communications without mak ing some people unhappy.

title: Wilson Named Card Scout
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 19 (UPI)  Larry Wilson, who ended his career as a defensive back with the St. Louis Cardinals last Sunday, was named today to new post of scouting profes sional teams and personnel. Wilson's new duties will begin immediately, this club said.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 19Gover nor Cahill said today that the new $160million College of Medicine and Dentistry under construction here could lead to a rejuvenation of the city.

title: 2 SAILORS KILLED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 20  Three heavy B52 bombers and two smaller fighterbombers have been lost since the United States resumed fullscale bomb ing and mining of North Viet nam Monday evening, an Amer ican military spokesman said today.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: I am no expert on the problems of prisons or corrections, but since I first became a United States judge 17 years ago, I have been deeply concerned at the recall rate, which, in American industry, is the rate at which products found defective are returned to the manufacturer for further processing and repair. The recall rate for the American penal system varies over the years but for present purposes it is safe to use the figure of twothirds. By that I mean, at any given time, twothirds of the persons found in prisons have prior criminal records. There is very little evidence that we have improved this situation in the last thirty or forty yearsindeed it has become worse with the passage of time.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 19 A group of 11 students and fac ulty members of the Princeton Theological Seminary today es tablished a defense fund for five antiwar activists arrested yesterday for allegedly sabotag ing railroad equipment outside a defense plant in York, Pa.

title: To Tiffany, Citibank's Tree Is Vulgar
description: In an elegant burst of pique, Tiffany & Co. has accused the First National City Bank of hav ing put up a loud and vulgar Christmas tree in front of the hank on Park Avenue at 53d Street and of polluting the es thetic atmosphere of Park Ave nue.

title: DOW INDEX DROPS 4.07 MORE POINTS
description: The stock market sustained a secondand more modest decline yesterday in the wake of the breakdown in Vietnam peace talks made public by American officials over the weekend.

title: Louis E. Lamborn Is Dead; Headed McDonogh School
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 19Louis E. Lamborn, headmaster at the McDonogh School here from 1926 to 1952, died yesterday. He was 82 years old.

title: Nixon and Kissinger and the Collapse of the Paris Peace Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19In the aftermath of the break down of the Paris negotiations, and the renewed bombing of Hanoi and Haiphong, some diplomats, officials and news men are wondering aloud whether any possible strains have developed between Presi dent Nixon and his chief nego tiator and foreign policy ad viser, Henry A. Kissinger. The speculation is based on both rea sonable deduc tions and intangi ble evidence. The rumors have been magnified by the current con fusion in Washington about almost everything dealing with Vietnam. Despite Mr. Kissin ger's news conference on Saturday, there is uncertainty about the reasons for the col lapse of the Paris talks, and the brief White House an nouncement yesterday about the bombing fell short of an explanation of why it was or dered.

title: Brooklyn Diocese High School To Close, 2d to Be Phased Out
description: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn will close one high school, phase out another and increase tuition in its high school system to $800 a year beginning next September, Bishop Francis J. Mugavero an nounced yesterday.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19 (AP) The Boston Museum of Fine Arts has purchased and put on display a John Singleton Copley painting of the Nativ ity that was lost for more than a century in England.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: For Billy Baldwin, the Goal Is Constant: Simplify, Simplify
description: Every year Billy Baldwin pares more away from the rooms he devises. Every year he simplifies. There's one less period table, one less pattern, one less ... well, just about anything he deems superfluous.

title: Erickson Wins Texas Golf In SuddenDeath Playoff
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 19 (UPI)Bob Erickson, 44year old veteran from Winter Park, Fla., parred the second extra hole of a suddendeath playoff today to defeat Tommy McGin nis and win the $5,000 first prize in Professional Golf Management's seventh $30,000 tournament. They had tied at 192 over 36 holes.

title: Mrs. Morris Wed To Richard DeVoe
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla., Dec. 19Mrs. Ruth McDowell Morris, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James H. McDowell of Delray Beach and Katonah, N. Y., was married this morn ing to Richard Michael De Voe, son of Raymond Forsyth DeVoe of New York and Boca Raton and the late Mrs. Madeleine Fagan DeVoe. The Rev. Mary L. Kupferle per formed the ceremony at Unity of Delray, a nonde nominational church.

title: City Aides and Consumer Units Voice Dismay at Phone Rate Plea
description: Top city officials and con sumer groups reacted with an ger and dismay yesterday at the New York Telephone Com pany's request for a $306mil lion rate increase, and some said they would go to court if necessary to prevent approval of the request by the State Public Service Commission.

title: Suspension of U.S. Aid Hinted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (Reu ters)The United States indi cated today that it might sus pend aid to Uganda if a seized United States concern there was not paid compensation.

title: Yale Club Gets Portrait of ExSquash Racquets Pro
description: A portrait of the late Eddie Standing, a Scottish born for mer Yale Club squash rac quets professional, was pre sented to the Yale Club by a group of his friends yester day in a brief ceremony at the midtown Manhattan club.

title: Grade A New York
description: The A rating given to the City of New York's credit by one major investment service is just recognition of this metropolis improved financial conditions.

title: Rizzo Yields in Drug Case
description: Vincent Rizzo, 41 years old, has surrendered to the Man hattan District Attorney's of fice to face charges of cocaine smuggling, extortion, usury and sale of counterfeit money. Rizzo has been described as a lieutenant in the socalled crime family of the late Vito Geno vese.

title: Screen:
description: If Christmas time yields a sweeter, wiser and more tenderly amusing movie about children than Goodbye, Stork, Goodbye, a quiet ar rival from Spain, it will sur prise me. And how's this for a plot?

title: Hanoi Reports 3 Ships Hit
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, Dec. 20 (AP)The Hanoi radio said to day that three American war ships were set ablaze Sunday night off the port city of Thanh, Hoa.

title: NEW LAW MAKES PARENTS LIABLE
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Dec. 19A law termed the strongest of its type in the state went into ef fect here today with the aim of stemming an increasing crime rate by making parents respon sible for the delinquent acts of their children.

title: Newsman Jailed in Refusal To Yield Watergate Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19  A Los Angeles newspaperman was found in contempt of court and was briefly jailed today when he refused to surrender tape recordings of an interview with a principal witness in the alleged bugging of the Demo cratic party's headquarters.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 19 (UPI) Thomas Gallo, a member of the Hoboken Commission, will he the Democratic candidate in a special Jan. 8 election to fill the Assembly seat left vacant by the slaying in Neptune last September of Silvio Failla.

title: New U.S. Raids on North Are Denounced by Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19The Soviet Government today de nounced the resumption of widescale United States air raids over North Vietnam and said it was giving the develop ing situation its most serious consideration.

title: Kidnapped Briton Freed After 10 Days in Argentina
description: LONDON, Wednesday, Dec. 20 (AP)Ronald Grove, a 64 yearold businessman kidnapped in Brazil, has been released, his employers said early today.

title: City Cites 16 Places In Its New Listing Of Health Violators
description: Sixteen rstaurants, super markets and other food estab lishments are on the latest list of places having failed two con secutive inspections for compli ance with the city's Health Code.

title: Mood at Life Muted as Last Issue Goes to Press
description: A few extra advertisements were squeezed in, a few last minute changes made, a few more captions written, a few more reminiscences retoldand then the last issue of Life mag azine was sent out to be printed.

title: L.I. Class Sends $15.43 To Neediest After a Sale
description: Mrs. Nina K. Kimball's class of fourth, fifth and sixthgraders in Room 101 at the John H. West Public School in Bethpage, L. I., sent $15.43 to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday.

title: Apollo 17 Splashes Down Accurately In Successful Finale to Moon Project
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 19  The Apollo exploration of the moon, one of the great achievements of all time, came to a success ful conclusion today with the splashdown of the Apollo 17 astronauts in the waters of the Pacific Ocean.

title: Army Wins By 7350
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 19 Army swamped the Merchant Marine Academy, 7350, to night, The Cadets connected on only two of their first 18 shots but wound up shooting 48 per cent.

title: Hopes for Peace Dashed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 19The United States bombs that fell on Hanoi and Haiphong today brought gloom to many American officials here and jubilation to members of the South Vietnamese Govern ment.

title: Business Briefs
description: The nation's two leading nuclear manufacturersthe Westinghouse Electric Corporation and the General Elec tric Companyannounced plans today for separate re search centers aimed at improving power supplies.

title: People and Business
description: Donald C. Cook, the 63 yearold chairman, president and chief executive officer of the American Electric Power Company, has relinquished the presidency of the nation's largest investorowned elec tric power company as part of a topmanagement expan sion plan. Mr. Cook, who also held the same titles at the American Electric Power Service Corporation, A.E.P.'s management and technology subsidiary, took the same step there.

title: Percussion Given A Dominant Role In Concert Pieces
description: Percussion and orientalism of one sort or another were the dominant themes at Monday evening's concert of the Group for Contemporary Music at the Manhattan School of Music. Lee Eugene's YuhWoon and Andrew Thomas's The Death of Yukio Mishima, both writ ten this year, concern them selves overtly with the filtering of Eastern attitudes and esthe tics through Western musical means, and both give percus sion a central role, as do Pierre Boulez's Improvisation sur Mallarme I and II and Charles Wuorinen's Chamber Concerto for Tuba.

title: ALEXANDER MUSS, BUILDER, WAS 65
description: Alexander Muss, builder and developer of condominiums, died Monday night at Lenox Hill Hospital, while on a visit to New York from his home in Miami Beach. His age was 65.

title: Hunter's Swimmers Win
description: Joseph White made his home debut as Hunter College coach a successful one last night as Hunter defeated Jersey City State College, 6048. It was Hunter's first victory after four ??.

title: PenskeDonohue Team Adding Another Porsche
description: That mutually profitable relationship between Porsche and the Roger PenskeMark Donohue racing team gets better all the time.

title: E.E.C. Drops an Accord With U.S. on Chemicals
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 19  The European Common Market Council of Ministers decided to day not to extend a longpend ing package agreement under which the United States would end the American selling price system of protection against certain chemical im ports and the Common Market in return would reduce certain trade barriers.

title: Vario Is Fined $500 For Drunken Driving
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 19 (UPI) Paul Vario Sr., an un derworld figure, was fined $500 and his driver's license was revoked after he pleaded guilty to a drunken driving charge.

title: Miss Proell Cup Leader
description: SAALBACH, Austria, Dec. 19 (AP)  Annemarie Proell fought off a bout with the flu and sped to victory today in the women's downhill ski race marked by spectacular spills after crossing the finish line.

title: Other War Developments
description: The Soviet Union denounced the resumption of heavy American bombing of North Vietnam but did so in statement whose tone appeared to reflect embarrassment among Soviet leaders at the latest turn of events. The statement, by Tass, the official press agency, said that the Soviet people demanded that the raids be halted promptly and that an agreement be quickly signed end the war. [Page 14.]

title: NIXON APPOINTS AIDE FOR LIAISON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19  President Nixon announced to day that he would appoint Wil liam J. Baroody Jr., a longtime aide of Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, as a special assistant to the President to succeed Charles W. Colson as the person responsible for liaison with outside groups.

title: Advertising:
description: Jane Trahey, president of Trahey Advertising, has taken the trouble of categorizing advertising directed at wom en or using women. And, as far as she's concerned, most of it is bad.

title: Expos Trade Hermosa
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 19 (Cana dian Press)  The Peninsula Whips, Class AAA farm club of the Montreal Expos, have ob tained Michael Carruthers, a first baseman, from the Cleve land Indians' organization, the Expos announced today. In re turn the American League Indi ans obtained Angel Hermosa, an infielder.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HACKENSACK, Dec. 18 There are three major shop ping centers within a five mile radius of this once bustling commercial center, and the fate of the old Ar nold Constable building helps to explain part, but only part, of what has been happening to downtown stores.

title: Nixon Goal Held a Fantasy
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 19North Vietnam accused the United States today of premedi tated intensification of the Viet nam war and termed the action insane.

title: NightVision Gear Foils $100,000 Truck Hijacking
description: Using a helicopter and sophisticated nightvision para phernalia, the police and mem bers of the Queens District Attorney's staff broke up an alleged attempt to hijack a tractortrailer laden with $100, 000 worth of electronic equip ment last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CITY DEBT RATINGS SCORED BY MAME
description: Controller Abraham D. Beanie of New York City estimated yesterday that reduced credit ratings during the last seven years would result in $150mil lion in additional, unneces sary interest costs to city tax payers by the time the bonds came due.

title: Order Voided for I.B.M. To Give Papers to Court
description: In the continuing tugoflaw between the Government and the International Business Ma chines Corporation, the United States Court of Appeals sided with I.B.M. yesterday.

title: Trend Toward Merger Is Accelerating Among Labor Unions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Frank E. Fitzsimmons, presi dent of the International Broth erhood of Teamsters, and Harry Bridges, president of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, dined together tonight, and their table conversation could lead to a merger of the two unions.

title: Anderson to Coach Brown
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 19 John W. Anderson; whose Middlebury College elevens thrived in the last two years, was named head football coach at Brown University today. The new mentor is an alumnus of Ursinus, class of '54.

title: 2 Boys Seized, One Shot, In a Book Store BreakIn
description: A policeman seized two teen age burglary suspects in an East Side medical bookstore early yesterday after shooting one of the youths.

title: Tests of Controversial Report on Gravity Waves Described Here
description: Experiments in various parts of the world to test a contro versial report that gravitational waves of great intensity are flowing through the universe were described here yesterday.

title: FOUR CHAINS AGREE TO CUT BEEF PRICES
