description: GDANSK, Poland, Dec. 21 Two years after riots by ship yard workers here forced a change in the Polish leadership, many problems remain un solved, and a measure of ten sion exists just below the sur face.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: RIDGEWOOD, Dec. 21I opposed certain aspects of the New Deal because of the infla tion it caused. I made it an issue in 1936, saying that infla tion was like a whirlpool, it kept growing bigger and bigger all the time. No one benefited from inflation except the nimble speculators, and that's still an issue today.

title: TV Review
description: Within a halfhour, Harry Reasoner gives the business of pets, primarily city pets, a sharp, intelligent appraisal. The program, titled Who Do You Think You Are?Man and Beast, is being shown tonight at 10:30 by the American Broadcasting Com pany.

title: Nixon Is Good Dancer, 11YearOld Girl Finds
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 21 (AP)  President Nixon went dining and dancing to night and took a startled 11 yearold girl for a spin around the dance floor.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 21 (UPI) The State Board of Agriculture has approved the appointment of William E. Kenny of Trenton as Assistant Secretary of Agri culture, it was announced to day. Mr. Kenny will assume the post Jan. 1, marking the first time the state has had an assistant agriculture secretary since 1967.

title: COMMUNISTS QUIT SESSION IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Dec. 21The North Vietnamese and Vietcong dele gates walked out of the formal Paris conference today to pro test the intensive United States bombing. But they called for another regular meeting next Thursday.

title: Rain Halts Hunt for Plane Missing in Adirondacks
description: SARANAC LAKE, N. Y. Dec. 21 (AP)Freezing rain forced a temporary halt today to the air search over the rugged Adi rondacks for a light plane miss ing since Tuesday with two men aboard.

title: Times Columnist Elected Head of Bridge Academy
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 21 (AP) Members of the International ridge Academy have elected Alan Truscott as their new president, it was announced to day. Mr. Truscott, bridge col umnist for The New York Times, succeeds Jean Besse, who had presided since the the academy was founded in 1965. Mr. Truscott was elected yesterday. title: Star and Pulsar Discovered Waltzing in Distant Constellation
description: Through observations with an earthorbiting satellite rock ets and various groundbased telescopes it has been discov ered that an ordinary star and a pulsar, or pulsing object of extreme density are waltzing together through space far out in the constellation Hercules.

title: RAIDERS DOWNED BY CRUSADERS, 62
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 21 (AP) Gary Jarrett scored two goals, including the goahead goal in the second period, to lead the Cleveland Crusaders to a 62 victory over the New York Raiders tonight in a World Hockey Association game. The victory moved Cleveland into second place in the Eastern Division, ahead of New York.

title: "The Sandbox," With Streisand, Is a Joy
description: Can a nice young Manhattan matron daydream up some happy independence? What's the harm in a little round-the-clock fantasizing, with the ties to a loving husband, the nursery and the kitchen loosened but not unbroken? No harm, and "Up the Sandbox" is a joy.Even with a few arid patches and fantasies that unwind a bit methodically at times, Barbra Streisand's sixth film is her sixth hit. Yes, think of it. An hour after seeing the new one, which is ripe, yeasty fun, it's hard not to think of this extraordinary young woman, perfectly wedded to the camera with her instant Modigliani face and timing.She's the picture, true, but the teamwork is admirable. Nearly everything works and meshes, starting with an adroit script by Paul Zindel, the playwright, based on Anne Richardson Roiphe's novel. Fortunately and even when they're way out, the vignette musings generally miss blandness and strain because our heroine is a bright, likable girl, not a pinhead.Furthermore, Irvin Kershner has paced the picturein which Miss Streisand plays a nonsinging role  with a kind of take-it-or-leave-it verve that nimbly enhances the sharp dialogue, the more thoughtful passages and the performances. As Miss Streisand's college-professor husband, a young film newcomer named David Selby is excellent.My favorite episode is a happily cacaphonous family dinner, an anniversary celebration of the heroine's parents, that the daydreamer shifts into a catfight with her smothering mother, nicely played by Jane Hoffman This is by far the funniest thing in the picture. Another one, off to a good, brash start, gets a bit bulky, as Miss Streisand and some black activists invade the Statue of Liberty with dynamite.Another, which lands the star and an anthropologist squarely in the middle of Africa and some hostile Africans, seems forced  unless you watch Miss Streisand closely.The slyest portion, certainly with the star at her gamiest, is her verbal squelching of visiting Fidel Castro at a local rally, with a bold postscript that reportedly earned the film, which is as harmless as buttermilk, its "R" rating. As for taste, neither is there anything jarring about her imagined check-in at a hospital for an abortion as her young spouse lunges in, protesting.Finally, cementing the occasional lapses and gaps is a striking, luscious score by Billy Goldenberg that is the real pulse of the movie. Otherwise it's Barbra's baby and her sixth bouncer.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:Every single day my friend Teddy had to steal $200 worth of merchan dise to get $60 to buy 20 cents' worth of drugs. The strain was just too great. He died two clays ago in a cellar in the Bronx; an old man at 28.

title: Veedem Leaves Racing Post
description: BOSTON, Dec. 21 (AP) Thomas J. Veedem is stepping down as general manager of Suffolk Downs, the track's own ers announced today. Joseph E. Cresci, the president of Ogden Recreation Corporation and Suf folk Downs, said Veedern would be succeeded by Edward J. Sull ivan. Cresci said Veedem would slay on in a consulting capacity.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)American oil companies, including one headed by Wil liam P. Clements Jr., negotiated contracts with the Argentine Government in a frame of profound immorality and cor ruption, Argentine legislative investigators said in a 1964 report.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 21 (AP) The Philadelphia Flyers, shak ing off the effects of an allday trip, smothered the Los Angeles Kings, 63, tonight. The victory pulled the Flyers within 3 points of secondplace Minnesota in the West.

title: Marcor Unit Set for Japan
description: Montgomery Ward, Chicago, a subsidiary of Marcor, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it would set up a subsidiary in Japan, primarily for trading, but would not open any stores in that country. The new Ward sub sidiary, Montgomery Ward Nip pon Ltd., will be headquartered in Tokyo. Sears, Roebuck & Co. announced earlier this week that it has arranged for dis tribution of selected Sears cata logue merchandise through the Seibu group of Japanese stores.

description: The stalemated peace in Vietnam continued to cast its shadow over Wall Street yes terday as the DowJones in dustrial average slipped 4.82 to close at an even 1,000.

description: TOKYO, Dec. 22 (Reuters) The Japanese cabinet formally resigned today, clearing the way for Premier Kakuci Tanaka to form a new Government. He is expected to retain key men, including Foreign Minister Ma sayoshi Ohira.

title: CityBacked Private Drive on Midtown Crime Opens
description: Business executives and union leaders, strongly backed by Mayor Lindsay and police officials, opened a drive yesterday against mid town crime that is designed to involve thousands of workers and residents as an auxiliary police army. With walkietalkies and code num bers, the policetrained volun teers will watch streets, lobbies, corridors, offices and elevators, and report imme diately to the police any in dication of a crime. The start of the campaign against crime, to which a coalition of 100 prominent businessmen has pledged an open check book, was announced at a news conference in the West 35th Street police station, where a wide assortment of locks was displayed. Mayor Lindsay, in praising the cam paign, which may be extended to other parts of the city, said, The war on crime can only be effective if we have the strong involvement of the public in every way.

title: Union Fights Fire Department Cuts
description: Citing the 14th Amend ment, the firemen's union has brought suit in Federal court here to keep the city from redeploying some units in a move the Fire Depart ment says will improve effi ciency and productivity.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (Reuters)  Representative Wilbur D. Mills, the chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said today that trade would have to be dealt with by his committee in the new Congress after taxes and tax reform. Trade legislation, the Arkansas Democrat stated, would be considered after about a three month consideration of the taxreform issue. It could be, he added, that trade would not be considered until after the committee dealt with something else.

title: Pottinger Will Move
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (UPI) The shakeup in the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare continued today with the confirmation of reports that J. Stanley Pottinger, direc tor of the Office for Civil Rights, will move to the Jus tice Department and that Ed ward Newman will resign as commissioner of Rehabilita tion Services Administration.

title: Mrs. Bache Is Married To William Zeckendorf
description: Mrs. Alice Odenheimer Bache, widow of Harold L. Bache, who built Bache & Co., Inc., into one of the world's largest securities concerns, was married here yesterday to William Zeckendorf, the real estate developer. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman per formed the ceremony at Tem ple EmanuEl. The couple scheduled their wedding for 8:30 A.M. so they could com fortably catch a noon flight to Hawaii, where they will spend their honeymoon.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here are two Inviting novels that almost got away from this department in the hurlyburly of fall books. It would have been its loss. For these are books one hopes to encounter when hunting for something to read: wellmade and well written, contemporary in tone and feel, close to modern dilemmas, yet sufficiently distant to look at them with a humorous though sometimes tough eye. Each is funny in its own way: Mr. Rosten's is an old country humor, rueful, bittersweet, self deprecatory. Miss Rossner's is more out landish, goofy, exaggerated, but deadly serious. Both are books a man will remem ber very pleasantly in the years to come. In fact, if you are searching for a very lastminute gift for a literate colleague or member of the family, you can do very well with either or both of these titles.

title: Policy Asked on News Releases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (Reu ters)An advisory panel of the Securities and Exchange Com mission said today that corpor ations should distribute their news releases directly to stock brokers if the financial press declines to publish them.

title: Namath Is Quarterback of Conference Team
description: The Miami Dolphins, the first team ever to go through a 14 game National Football League season unbeaten, and the Oak land Raiders each had five play ers named yesterday to the 1972 United Preis International American Conference allstar team.

title: 50 Die in Sri Lanka Slide
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Dec. 21 (UPI)Fifty people, most of than workers on tea planta tions, were killed today in a landslide in the central part of this country, the former Ceylon, police officials reported, The landslide, the results of heavy rains, struck a plantation coop erative shop where people had gathered to buy their weekly rations, the police added.

title: Terror From the Skies
description: Asked whether civilian centers would not inevitably be hit during the resumed massive air assault on North Vietnam, a Pentagon spokesman replied: No. We don't strike civilian targets. He then amended his comment to say: We do not target civilian targets.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISEven Charles de Gaulle dis ctvered that in democratic countries statesmen have to be successful politi cians to attain and hold positions of power. He also discovered that politics can be dirty. De Gaulle's successor as President, Georges Pompidou, is keen ly aware of both these facts as all important French parliamentary elec tions loom in early March.

title: Laotian Victory Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 21 (UPI)Informed sources said today that Government troops, supported by AC47 gunships, repelled a North Vietnamese at tack last night on positions half a mile south of the southern Laotian town of Saravane.

title: 2 Germanys Sign Their Treaty; Reshaping of Border Next Step
description: BERLIN, Dec. 21The two Germanys signed their treaty on basic relations today, for mally ending more than two decades of mutual enmity.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The excellent interest rate New York City received on its recent sale of bonds is indeed a bullish omen for the city regardless of the credit rat ings. This rate, though, is more re flective of the shortterm outlook of the city rather than the longterm as certain aspects of the city's finances have been improving. Also, the recent public relations program sponsored by the city aimed at the investor has been beneficial.

title: JOHN LLOYD WRIGHT
description: LaJOLLA, Calif., Dec. 21  John Lloyd Wright, a son of Frank Lloyd Wright, died yes terday at Scripps Memorial Hospital here. He was 79 years old and lived in Del Mar.

title: Peronists Are Uniting Behind Candidate
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 21  Argentina's Peronist movement has begun closing ranks around its presidential candidate, Dr. Hctor J. Compora, apparently because his years of uncondi tional loyalty make him little more than a standin for Juan D. Peron.

title: Cosmos 539 in Orbit
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 21 (AP) The Soviet Union reported it launched another Cosmos satel lite today, the 539th in the secret series. The press agency Tass said that Cosmos 539 was orbiting in a circle far from the earth. Its parameters were about 870 miles and 840 miles at an angle of 74 degrees to the Equator. The time of its first obrit was 113 minutes, the agency reported.

title: Soviet Lends Chile $30Million To Purchase Food and Cotton
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 21 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union has granted a credit of $30 million to Chile for food and cotton and has agreed to rene gotiate Chile's debt payments, Foreign Minister Clodomiro Al meyda said yesterday.

title: ST. JOHN'S IS LOSER IN OVERTIME, 9695
description: Boston College defeated St. John's, 9695, in overtime Thursday night before 2,830 people at Alumni Hall on the St. John's campus.

title: Haig Briefs Thai Leaders On Status of Peace Effort
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 21 (Reuters)  Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., President Nixon's en voy, today met with the Thai Premier, Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn, and other Thai leaders and explained develop ments in the recent negoti ations between the United States and North Vietnam.

title: Jorgensen Enrolled In School for Drivers
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., Dec. 21 (AP)  The Prince Georges County state's attor ney's office agreed today not to prosecute Sonny Jurgen sen, injured Washington Red skins quarterback, on charges of drunken driving after he said he would attend a spe cial class set up for persons arrested for driving and drinking.

title: Letter to Thieu Confirmed
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 21 (UPI)  The President's personal envoy, Gen. Alexan der M. Haig Jr., carried a let ter from Mr. Nixon to Presi dent Nguyen Van Thieu the White House confirmed today, declining to disclose its con tents.

title: Injuries Befall Hadfield and Gilbert Here
description: The Atlanta Flames, a first year expansion club of tough young hustlers, manhandled the tired and injuryriddled New York Rangers, 52, last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: After Dark, Financial District Takes on Special Glow
description: It is midnight and the brokers are snug under elec tric blankets in their sub urban homes, Across the blackness from the Battery, Lady Liberty stands unseen in a pool of cold green light.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 21 (UPI)Ohio State, led by Al lan Hornyak with 33 points, registered a 11280 victory over Ohio University tonight.

title: O.P.I.C. Repays Kennecott For Seized Chilean Mine
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration said yesterday that it had received a payment of $66.9million from the Overseas Private Investment Corporation in settlement of O.P.I.C.'s insur ance covering the company's debt investment in the El Ten iente Copper mine in Chile. The mine was expropriated in 1971.

title: CITYSTATE PANEL RELEASES REPORT
description: The Commission on State City Relations set up by Mayor Lindsay criticized governments up and down yesterdayFed eral, state and suburban municipalfor not adopting a regional approach to problems besetting the New York metro politan area.

title: Gallagher Pleads Guilty to Tax Evasion
description: TRENTON, Dec. 21  Repre sentative Cornelius E. Gallagher pleaded guilty in United States District Court here this after noon to willfully and know ingly evading the payment of $74,000 in Federal income taxes in 1966.

title: 'Last House on Left'
description: In a thing (as opposed to a film) titled "Last House on the Left," four slobbering fiends capture and torture two "groovy" young girls who airily explore the bad section of a town and more or less ask for trouble.When I walked out, after 50 minutes (with 35 to go), one girl had just been dismembered with a machete. They had started in on the other with a slow switchblade. The party who wrote this sickening tripe and also directed the inept actors is Wes Craven. it's at the Penthouse Theater, for anyone interested in paying to see rpulsive people and human agony.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Eight of the topranked schools in the New York area will he matched in the first annual High School Basketball Classic, sponsored by Elmcor Youth and Adult Activities, Inc.., that gets under way tomorrow at St. John's University, Hillerest, Queens. The favorites are Andrew Jackson of Queens and DeWitt Clinton of the Bronx.

title: MORE DRUG LOSSES EXPECTED IN TALLY
description: Law enforcement officials said yesterday that far more drugs had been stolen front the New York Police Department than the 169 pounds of heroin and 131 pounds of cocaine reported to date.

title: State Jobless Rate Up To 5.2% in November
description: The state's unemployment rate rose to 5.2 per cent In November compared with 4.8 per cent in October, the State Labor Department re ported yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: Following in the treads of articles etarlier this week, it can be reliably reported that a major tire manufacturer commissioned a study last year that showed that more consumers were aware that Goodyear made steelbelted radial tires than of other companies that made them. There is nothing quite so im portant as an aware con sumer.

title: Patish Case Slated Jan. 4
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 21 (UPI) Don Parish linebacker of the Denver Broncos, was ordered today to appear in Superior Court Jan. 4 on a charge of possessing cocaine. Parish was arrested at Los Angeles Inter national Airport Nov. 13 after a search of his possessions al legedly turned up a vial con taining 13 grams of cocaine valued at $1,170.

title: One of Grande Cuisine's Last Haunts
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and de cor (four triangles to none).

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Dec. 21  When Bernie Ockene, the St. Peter's basketball coach, talks about referees he simply blasts them.

title: PENN CENTRAL CUT IN CREW ALLOWED
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22 (UPI)  A Fedetal judge, in a ruling expected to stir a contro versy with the United Transpor tation Union, authorized the Penn Central Transportation Company today to cut the size of its train crews.

title: Mine Closed as Gas Builds
description: HERNDON, W. Va., Dec. 22 (AP)The Eastern Associated Coal Corporation announced last night the temporary clos ing of its Herndon No. 2 mine in Wyoming County because of a potentially dangerous increase in levels of explosive methane gas. The mine is several miles south of the Itmann Company's No. 3 mine, where five men died and three were severely burned in a methane gas ex plosion last Saturday. The It mann mine is operated by the Consolidation Coal Company.

title: 14 Draw Bola, Favorite, In Irish Sweepstakes Race
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 22 (AP)If Bula, the 45 oddson favorite, should win the Irish Sweep stakes hurdle race next Wednes clay, 14 people will collect 50,000or around $120,000 each.

title: DONALD ROBERTS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 22 Donald Roberts, a missionary of the Episcopal Church who taught for almost 45 years in China and Lebanon, died of a heart attack here Wednesday. He was 83 years old and lived here.

title: 2dRanked Maryland Wins
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 22 (AP)Secondranked Mary land, paced by Tom McMillen's 25 points shook off stubborn George Washington late in the first half and scored an 8879 victory tonight.

title: Fashion Dream Voted No. 1
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP) Fashion Dream, winner of 11 races this year, was voted the New England trotter of the year today by the New Eng land Harness Writers Associa tion. Mountain Skipper was named New England pacer of the year for the second con secutive time.

title: BOARD PONDERS SCRIBNER ISSUE
description: The Board of Education is considering buying up the balance of Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner's $53,000 annual contract so that his successor can take over before the con tract's June 30 expiration date.

title: Exchanges and Banks Plan To Close on Christmas Day
description: Most businesses, as well as securities and commodities mar kets, banks and givernment of fices, will be closed Monday, Christmas Day, and will reopen for business Tuesday, Dec. 26.

title: Hectic Shopper, Relax Zero Hour Is Later Than You Might Think
description: Panic it inevitably accom panies Christmas in New York.

title: I.M.F. Clears Revaluation Of the Australian Dollar
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (Reu ters)The International Mone tary Fund announced today that it had approved a revalua tion of the Australian dollar.

title: 117 Young Offenders Freed For Christmas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 22 A state appellate court has furloughed 117 juvenile de linquents from Texas correc tional institutions for the Christmas holiday.

title: CONNECTICUT GETS JURY AMENDMENT
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 22  The Fourth Amendment to Connect icut's Constitution was signed into effect today, empowering the General Assembly specifi cally to cut Superior Court juries in criminal cases from 12 members to six.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Richard Eberhart, the Pu litzer and Bollingen prize winning poet, has been named honorary president of the Poetry Society of Amer ica, a title left vacant since the death of Robert Frost in 1963 ... The Metropolitan Museum of Art, which plans to open its new American Museum in 1976 on the occa sion of the nation's bicen tennial celebration, has re ceived official recognition of the protect by the American Revolution Bicentennial Com mission in Washington. Along with this goes the right to display the official Bicenten nial symbola red, white and blue star surrounded by the legend American Revolution Bicentennial, 17761976.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 22When the Lord told Abraham that He was going to destroy Sodom for its sins, as it is said in Genesis, Chapter 18, Abraham asked, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked? The Lord agreed that if there were ten righteous men In Sodom, then I will spare all the place for their sakes. But there were not ten.

title: DEFENSE FILES SUIT IN ST. CROIX DEATHS
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V. I., Dec. 22 (AP)Defense attorneys for the five men charged in the Fountain Valley murder case. filed a $3million damage suit yesterday against the United States Virgin Islands Governor, Melvin Evans, the territorial Department of Public Safety, and the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Florida State Stopped
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Dec. 22 (AP) Alabama, paced by Wendell Hudson and Ray Odums, beat. Florida State, 7468, tonight in the first round of the Dayton invitation tournament. Florida State missed 8 of its first 9 shots in the first half and 10 of its first 14 shots in the second half.

title: FRANCIS H. SLOAN 2D
description: Francis Henry Sloan 2d, vice president of Rhodia, Inc., 600 Madison Avenue, American affiliate of the French firm RhonePoulenc, a leading chem ical producer, died Thursday at his home on Singer Island, near West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 63 years old and formerly lived at 25 Sutton Place and in Plandome, L. I.

title: State's $50,000 Stipend Cut Upsets Superteachers...
description: A mood of disquiet and un certainty has set in among the renowned occupants of the state's 10 Albert Einstein and Albert Schweitzer super professorships since the State Legislature halved the stipend for each chair from $100,000 to $50,000 a year.

title: So. Carolina Upsets Indiana
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Dec. 22 (AP)Kevin Joyce scored 41 points tonight and led South Carolina from a 14point deficit to an 8885 upset victory over ninthranked Indiana.

title: Narcotics Corruption Appears Easy and Common
description: The narcotics traffic of to day, which is destroying the equilibrium of our society, could never be as pervasive and open as it is unless there was connivance between authorities and criminals.

title: 100YearOld Building Housing 2 Papers Burns
description: SCHUYERVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 22 (AP)Fire destroyed the 100yearold brick building housing The Wise Shopper and The Schuyerville Standard last night in this rural Saratoga County village east of Saratoga Springs.

title: Plane Collision Hearing Set
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22 (AP) Public hearings will be held in January into the cause of the collision on Wednesday of a North Central Airlines plane and a Delta Airlines jet at O'Hare International Airport that killed nine persons, the National Transportation Safety Board said today.

title: PAYMENTS BALANCE IN CANADA WEAKENS
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 22 (Reuters) Canada's current account balance in the 1972 third quarter weakened considerably to a seasonally adjusted deficit of $355million after showing some strength in the second quarter.

title: A Sixth Day of Big Raids
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 23As the United States continued its heavy bombing of North Viet nam today for the sixth day, the officially reported losses of American planes and crewmen mounted still higher.

title: Groppi Agrees to Pay $1,500 For Demonstration Damage
description: MADISON, Wis., Dec. 22 (AP) The Rev. James E. Groppi has settled out of court the state's suit for damages caused by welfare protesters during a September, 1969, takeover of the Assembly chambers in the State Capitol.

title: 16 Survivors of Oct. 13 Plane Crash Found in Andes
description: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 22Two survivors from a plane that crashed more than two months ago in the Andes climbed down from the moun tains today and led rescuers to the site of the wreckage.

title: Dr. Virginia Uterrnohlen Married
description: Dr. Virginia Utermohlen, an assistant physician at Rockefeller University, was married last evening to Richard Van Evera Lovelace, assistant professor in the Graduate School of Applied and Engineering Physics of Cornell University.

title: White House Said to Plan Freeze on Public Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The National Housing Confer ence said today that it had learned that the Nixon Admin istration was planning ah 18month moratorium on all new construction under the public housing and interest subsidy programs adminis tered by the Department of Housing and Urban Develop ment.

title: HENRIK M. MAYER
description: ESSEX, Conn., Dec. 22Hen rik M. Mayer, an artist and former director of the Hartford Art School at the University of Hartford, died Tuesday at the Yale New Haven Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived on River Road here.

title: Kidnappers Free Texas Woman After $250,000 Is Paid
description: DALLAS, Dec. 22  Mrs. Amanda Dealey, a bride of six weeks, was freed unharmed to day by kidnappers who had kept her bound and masked for more than two days and col lected $250,000 in ransom from her family.

title: Film: Knowing a Hip From an Elbow
description: Sometimes, when counting up the advantages of film, we fail to appreciate the marvelous vicariousness of the experience it offers. Earlier arts and entertain ments have encouraged pas sive spectators. But none have gone so far in letting you watch other people track the vampire, push the heroin, fight the FuzzyWuzzies and dig the Suez Canalwhile you sit in a darkened movie theater, nibbling your non pareils maybe, but basically doing nothing at all.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We have a continuing problem con cerning the proper communication to the voters of the meaning of proposed constitutional amendments and prop ositions. This was brought to my mind this fall when one newspaper writer in explaining various constitu tional amendments and propositions stated with regard to one of them that he could not even understand it him self, let alone explain it to the public.

title: U. S. to Continue Bombing; Says Next Move Is Hanoi's
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The White House said today that the United States would con tinue its heavy bombing of North Vietnam and that the next step to end the Vietnam war was totally up to the North Vietnamese.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 22 (Reuters)Effective mort gage rates for new homes in November rose to 7.65 per cent from 7.62 per cent in October, but were below the November 1971, rate of 7.79 per cent, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today.

title: Manila Golf Set for Feb. 22
description: MANILA, Dec. 22 (UPI) The 1973 Philippine open golf championship, the opening leg of the ninenation Asia circuit, will be held Feb, 22 through 25 at the 7.078yard Wack Wack Golf and Country Club. Leon ardo (Skip) Guinto, the presi dent of the Republic of the Philippines Golf Association, said today the association would put up a $15,000 prize $9,375 less than the 1972 pot.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EAST ORANGE, N.J., Dec. 22Before the match the tennis player sat quietly, eyes closed, a study in concentra tion, His coach murmured to him: Think of being tenacious, of winning. You will be relaxed at the critical point, you will bring off the shot, Your muscles will do what you want them to do.

title: Galbreath Group's Purchase Of Hialeah Is Made Final
description: MIAMI, Dec. 22 (AP)The sale of Hialeah Race Course to a group headed by John W. Gal breath of Columbus, Ohio, was consummated today when a check for $21.5million was turned over to stockholders of the old corporation.

title: Villanova Keeps Rolling
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22 (UPI) Villanova's zone defense held Detroit to the astonishingly low total of 8 points in the first half tonight and the Wildcats rolled on to a 5441 victory. The Titans made 2 of 22 firsthalf shots and trailed 298, at the intermission. Villanova won its sixth without a loss. Tom Ingles by led the Wildcats with 29 points.

title: U.S. Library in Rumania Attracts 4,000 Members
description: BUCHAREST, Dec. 22In less than a year since its open ing, the American Library has become a sort of intellectual salon for Rumanians, who crowd the avantgarde center as if it were a watering hole in the Sahara.

title: Life Goes On
description: HARBORSIDE, Me.The snow falls gently on our quiet meadow sloping down to Penobscot Bay, with spruce trees back against the gray of the water. A raven croaks from a nearby treetop. Two gulls sail over the house and squawk unintelligibly together. The only other sounds are the wood fire snapping, the kettle steaming on the stove and Pusso purring.

title: PLANE CONTRACT HEED VITAL TO L.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The New York Congressional dele gation today joined the lobby ing effort to win a $1billion Air Force fighterbomber con tract that it believes could be the salvation of Long Island's aerospace industry.

title: MINE CHIEF OUSTS PROBOYLE GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Insurgent leaders took full con trol of the 200,000member United Mine Workers of Ameri ca today and swiftly dismissed a score of hostile officials of the former regime of W. A. Boyle.

title: Soviet Dancer Suffers a Private Exile
description: LENINGRAD, Dec. 19In a modest but comfortable apart ment virtually papered with ballet photos, Valery Panov does gymnastic exercises for 80 Minutes a day and then another hour of ballet exercises at a bar especially installed in his 10by 16foot living room. The ceiling is too low for him to practice the leaps that made him one of the Kirov Ballet Company's leading dancers.

title: Brown Triumphs, 77 to 71
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 22 (AP)Eddie Morris scored 23 points, 6 in the last 2 minutes, to lead Brown to a 7771 bas ketball victory over New Hamp shire tonight. Wayne Morrison's 23 points and Erie Ferange's 22 lied New Hampshire.

title: Whites Shunning University of Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 22 (Reuters)A trend toward Africanization of the multi racial University of Rhodesia is worrying the university ad ministration and the Govern ment so much that ways are being considered to lure white students back to the campus.

title: Cuozzo Lauds East Team For Shrine Game Workout
description: LOS ALTOS, Calif., Dec. 22 (UPI)The East football team completed its second day of practice today for the Dec. 30 EastWest Shrine football game. Head Coach Carmen Cuozzo of Yale called it a good one.

title: Memories of the Country Life
description: STAUNTON, Va.Every year near Christmas time my father took mother and all of us children to the county seat, about twelve miles from our farm, to buy winter clothing, shoes, and certain other things that couldn't be had at Ellis's General Store at the crossroads. I remember one trip when I rode to town on the twohorse wagon driven by my oldest brother Fred who was a wagoner for Mr. Ellis, the owner of the crossroad store was to meet the rest of the family when we got to town, and was chosen to go along with Fred (a high privilege) just to keep him company on the way down.

title: Russians, Sated With Speeches, Look to Holidays
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22What, still another meeting? a Rus sian woman exclaimed this morning as the second day of speech  making from the Kremlin flashed on the home television screen.

title: People and Business
description: Meridian Industries, Inc., an automotive parts manu facturer based outside De troit, made two announce ments yesterday. First, it said that Joseph J. Bokan had resigned as president. Then; Meridian said that in a completely unrelated matter it is considering writeoff of notes receivable ranging from $700,000 to $1.4million.

title: Business Briefs
description: The St. Joe Minerals Corporation announced yesterday that It had received approval from the Price Commission raise prices on all zinc products, As a consequence, the company posted price increases of 2.91 per cent on all grades of zinc metal, and of 2.34 per cent on all grades zinc oxide, effective as of last Thursday.

title: Urge End to War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Fortyone religious leaders in the United States have issued a pastoral letter assailing United States bombing of North Viet nam, it was announced today.

title: JOHN C. ATTLE HAS A WAY WITH A SONG
description: The number of graduates of the cast of Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris who have turned up on the tiny stage of the Down stairs at the Upstairs has reached the point where one loses track of them. But the current Brel graduateinresi dence at the Downstairs, John C. Attie, is not the sort of per former who gets lost in a crowd.

title: Council Creates 6 Districts For City Minority Groups
description: The City Council voted 28 to 7 yesterday to create six new councilmanic districts, with the avowed purpose of increasing the representation of blacks and Puerto Ricans on the city legislative body. The change would raise the number of Councilmen to 43 from 37.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Dec. 22The P.A.F. Playhouse, Long Island's only yearround professional theater, will be able to continue operations, at least over the short term, despite a $50,000 deficit.

title: LARGEST HOSPITAL IN HANOI REPORTED DAMAGED IN RAID
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 22Ha noi's largest hospital, one mile west of the city center, was damaged by American planes early today, according to the Swedish Foreign Ministry.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Dec. 22Tokyo stock prices climbed sharply to a record today, exceeding 5,000 yen for the first time the stock market opened in 1949. The market, which began its week with the Tokyo DowJones average at 4,925 yen on Monday, started a widerange surge on Wednesday.

title: 65 Young Women Presented At the 37th Debutante Cotillion
description: The Waldorf  Astoria's Grand Ballroom, East Foyer, Astor Gallery and Starlight Roof were taken over last night by the New York In firmary so that 65 debutantes and hundreds of their rela tives and friends could be comfortably accommodated at the formal presentations, the dancing, the preparty dinners and the general frol icking at the infirmary's 37th annual Debutante Cotillion and Christmas Ball.

title: Housing Project for Elderly Gets a $74,838 State Loan
description: ALBANY, Dec. 22 (AP)The State Housing Development Fund has loaned the sponsor of a seniorcitizens housing proj ect in Poughkeepsie $74,838 in seed money, the State Divi sion of Housing and Community Renewal announced today.

title: Navy's Cost Cutter Gordon Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 Gordon's an old trouble makerjust the kind of civil servant we need. This de scription came from an old friend of Gordon Rule. The Navy, which transferred Mr. Rule today, is likely to agree with the first part of it but not at all with the second. Mr. Rule appears to be, in fact, the sort of civil serv ant who delights in being a mav erick, or at least has no objection to being seen as one if he feels he is right. The 65yearold former as of todaydirector of the procurement and clear ance section of the Naval Matriel Command was re portedly reassigned uncere moniously as a result of his criticism of the appointment of Roy L. Ash, president of Litton Industries, as director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: SYRACUSE BEATS YALE FIVE, 7872
description: STORRS, Conn., Dec. 22(AP) Syracuse wasted a 12point firsthalf lead but still managed a 7872 victory over Yale in the opening game of the Con necticut backetball tournament tonight.

title: San Francisco Victor
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 22 (AP)The University of San Francisco scored a comeback victory over Utah tonight, 7863.

title: Art: Surprising Show by Miss Bieser
description: Among several rewarding shows down in SoHo just now, Natalie Bieser's at the Nancy Hoffman Gallery, 429 West Broadway, is the most surprising.

title: Laos Drug Curb Hailed But Outflow Continues
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 22 As part of a recently initiated campaign by the United States and Laotian Governments to crack down on narcotics traf fic in and through Laos, Pre mier Souvanna Phouma and the American Ambassador opened a new addict detoxifica tion center here today.

title: 4 Injured in an Explosion At Jersey Chemical Plant
description: MANCHESTER TOWNSHIP, N. J., Dec. 22Four persons were injured, one critically, ini an explosion followed by a fire today at a magnesiumproduc ing plant, the Reade Manufac turing Company, in this Ocean, County community.

title: Special Christmas Wish Expressed by Lindsay
description: Asked yesterday if he had a personal Christmas wish, Mayor Lindsay, wearing a rain  soaked raincoat and rumpled felt hat at the Rocke feller Center skating rink, replied: I'd like to send a lot of politicians in this town to the North Pole.

title: MRS. RALPH A. DEJUR
description: Mrs. Frances Luboue DeJur, the wife of Ralph A. DeJur, board chairman of the DeJur Amsco Corporation, died Thurs day at her home, 925 Fifth Ave nue. She was in her early 70's.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LE5 CONTAMINESMONTJOIE, France, Dec. 22 CAP) France's young skiers scored a sweep of the honors today in the women's special slalom. Fabienne Serra had descents of 44.27 and 44.58 seconds for a winning total of 1 minute 28.85 seconds. Patricia Emonet was second and Christiane Ray third.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The tradition of respecting picket lines sterns from the time manage ments fought their employes' establish ment of a union. Those who were sympathetic toward the laboring class helped them along by not crossing the lines.

title: ENERGY USE SEEN UP 4FOLD BY 2000
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  A Department of the Interior study forecast today that the per capita consumption of electric ity would quadruple by the year 2000.

title: 2 POLICEMEN SHOT AFTER. AUTO CHASE
description: Two policemen were shot and wounded, neither seriously, aft er a fiveblock automobile chase in the South Bronx last night, that ended when a car, carry ing several youths, crashed into an abandoned building at 770 East 165th Street, the po lice said.

title: MRS. CHARLES LITEL
description: Mrs. Pearl Ettman. Litel, who had been a concert pianist and dramatic soprano under her maiden name, died in the Hark ness Pavilion of the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center on Wednesday. The wife of Charles Litel, a lawyer, she was 59 years old and lived in Pleasant ville, N. Y.

title: 2dRanked Maryland Wins
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 22 (AP)Secondranked Mary land, paced by Toni McMillen's 25 points, shook off stubborn George Washington late in the first half and scored an 88.79 victory tonight.

title: I. R. A. DECLARES CHRISTMAS TRUCE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, Dec. 23The Pro visional wing of the Irish Re publican Army announced here yesterday that it would observe a 72hour Christmas truce be ginning last midnight.

title: PROJECTS ACCUSED BY KERR ARE CITED
description: Andrew P. Kerr, head of the Housing and Development Ad ministration, accused residents of 28 publicly aided projects here yesterday of being cal loused to the needs of fellow tenants who are elderly and entitled to rent subsidy.

title: AUSTRALIA GRANTS CHINA RECOGNITION
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 22  The new Governments of Australia and New Zealand an nounced the establishment of diplomatic relations with Com munist China today.

title: Bridge: Pratfalls Can Be Precluded By Standing on One's Head
description: Few bridgeplayers prac tice yoga, but in tournament play a declarer may have to stand on his head in a purely technical sense. A player who finds himself in a highly in ferior contract at matchpoint scoring cannot afford to sit back and curse his partner's biddinghe must snatch at any faint chance to equal the scores likely to be achieved at other tables.

title: ExAerialist in Hospital
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 22 (UPI)Steven Wallenda, a for mer member of The Great Wallendas, the aerialist team, was hospitalized today with back injuries suffered in a fall. He slipped Wednesday off the top of an Army vehicle he was getting ready for shipment to his employer, FMC Corporation. He had quit the life of an aerial ist, fearing the fate of many members of his family, death falling from the wire.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PARAMUS, Dec. 22When Richard Schaefer was grow ing up here 40 years ago, part of the fun on summer weekends was to watch the traffic on Route 17 back up all the way to the New York State line.

title: C.B.S. and Union Complete Work on Drafting Accord
description: Negotiators for the Columbia Broadcasting System and its striking technicians' union fin ished work yesterday on a new contract proposal that could presage the end of a strike that hit the network seven weeks ago.

title: SYRACUSE BEATS YALE FIVE, 7872
description: STORRS, Conn., Dec. 22 (AP) Syracuse wasted a 12point firsthalf lead but still managed a 7872 victory over Yale in the opening game of the Con necticut backetball tournament tonight.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 22  After hundreds of hours of painstaking investigation, the police say they are no closer today to a solution to the mysterious disappearance of Miss Karen Levy of Cherry Hill, N. J., than they were on Nov. 10.

title: COLONELS DEFEAT COLONELS, 128116
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 22 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels continued their homecourt jinx over the Denver Rockets to night with a 128116 victory. A 160 surge that started in the final minute of the third quarter turned a tight game in to a rout.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 22 (AP)The city of Rochester has agreed to purchase Aquinas Stadium for $750,000, Mayor Stephen May said today.

title: A Dud Forces Evacuation
description: More than 200 occupants of offices in the 12story Federal Government Building at 201 Varick Street, near Houston Street, were evacuated yester day while the police bomb sec tion removed a dud grenade. A maintenance man spotted the grenade at 10:05 A.M. on a stairwell between the eighth and ninth floors.

title: LovetLorski Sculpture Is Revived
description: Search the histories of modern sculpture, and you will find no mention of the name of Boris LovetLorski. Yet here is the Finch College Museum of Art, 62 East 78th Street, mounting an exhibi tion of work produced by Mr. LovetLorski in the nine teentwenties and thirties. Will the histories have to be revised, or is the attention currently being lavished on this particular sculptor one of those sports of taste that every shift in fashion inevi tably brings in its wake?

title: India Protests Damage
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 22 (Reuters)  Indian diplomatic quarters in Hanoi were dam aged by American bombing yes terday and India has delivered a strong protest to the United States, parliament was told to day.

title: Church Art Going to Museum
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 22 (AP)Religious paintings from the 57yearold Holy Cross Ro man Catholic Church here will be given to the Smithsonian In stitution in Washington when the church is torn down by the city's Redevelopment Agency, according to a spokesman for the agency.

title: STANDSTILL HOLDS IN L.I.R.R. TALKS
description: There was no development yesterday in the Long Island Rail Road strike pointing to ward an early settlement as Long Island commuters strug gled in and out of town through a cold drizzle as well as a preChristmas crush of traffic.

title: So Carolina Upsets Indiana
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Dec. 22 (AP)Kevin Joyce scored 41 points tonight and led South Carolina from a 14point deficit to an 8885 upset victory over ninthranked Indiana.

title: PROBATION TERM SET FOR S.E.C. VIOLATION
description: CINCINNATI Dec. 22 (UPI) The cofounders of a travel study company whose bank ruptcy two years ago stranded more than 3,000 American stu dents abroad were placed on three years probation yester day for securities violations.

title: ...Where It's Possible to See Redskins
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) A Federal District judge re fused today to lift the local tele vision blackout of Sunday's Na tional Football League playoff game between the Green Bay Packers and the Washington Redskins.

title: Airport Guard Dies After Melee At Gate of a Crowded Jetliner
description: A private security guard died of a heart attack yesterday after scuffling with several persons who allegedly tried to incite a riot because they could not get aboard a crowded Pan Ameri can World Airways jetliner bound for San Juan, P. R.

title: Box 557
description: In this season of goodwill, glance for a moment at the catalogue of human sorrows and yearnings repre sented by The New York Times Neediest Cases, The child of eight who is institutionalized, her world depend ing on the kindness of strangers. The mother confined by a back injury to life in a body cast, afraid to be an added burden to her husband and youngsters. The couple struggling to keep their children instead of send ing them to foster homes. The widow in a lonely room, wondering if a human voice exists above the cries of the street.

title: Price Unit Accuses Woolworth Of Violations and Orders Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The Price Commission accused the F. W. Woolworth Company to day of violating control regu lations and ordered it to reduce prices and not to raise any without prior written permis sion from the commission.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New Bombing Revives Antiwar Protests
description: Scattered protests, expres sions of outrage and signs of a reanimated antiwar movement have surfaced here and in cities across the country this week in response to the renewed American bombing of North Vietnam.

title: 15 Bombings in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 22 (Reu ters)Fifteen bombs exploded in Argentina today, damaging buildings used by the armed forces, labor unions, political parties, banks and businesses, but causing no casualties, police spokesmen said.

title: Gaily Bedecked Seville Gloomy at Heart Beca use Growth Is Lagging
description: The Talk of Seville

title: Bulls Beat Blazers
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 22 (AP)Bob Love and Norm Van Lier triggered a secondquarter burst that lifted the Chicago Bulls to a 12797 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers to night.

title: F.C.C. Denies Black Caucus TV Time to Answer Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission denied today a Congressional Black Caucus re quest that the three TV net works be ordered to give the caucus free broadcast time to answer President Nixon's State of the Union Message of last Jan. 22.

title: Fire Kills Queens Couple; Man Also Dies in Hotel Blaze
description: A Rosedale, Queens, man and his wife burned to death yester day morning in a fire that ex tensively damaged their home, fire officials said. The victims were identified as John and Jellie Metallo, both in their 40's, of 22607 147th Avenue. Mr. Metallo's body was found in the bedroom, and his wife's in a hallway. The cause of the fire was not immediately deter mined.

title: CONSUMER PRICES UP 0.370 IN MONTH; FOOD MAIN FACTOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Consumer prices rose once again in November at a rate little higher than the Nixon Ad ministration had hoped but well below the pace of the 196971 period, the Labor Department reported today.

title: NATIONALS HURRY TO A LATE DEFEAT
description: The New York Raiders bounced back from a Thursday night loss to Cleveland by beat ing the travelweary Ottawa Nationals, 75, in a World Hockey Association game be fore 3,002 patient fans at Madi son Square Garden last night.

title: Post Downs Wagner
description: C. W. Post won its sixth game in a row, defeating Wagner, 7457, at the losers' court last night. Ed Miller led the Pioneers with 19 points. Jo Jo Jones of Wagner had 20 points.

title: Gov. Lucey's Mother Dies
description: LA CROSSE, Wis., Dec. 22 (UPI)Mrs. Ella J. McNamara Lucey, mother of Gov. Patrick J. Lucey of Wisconsin, died to day at the age of 83.

title: Whitmore RapeRobbery Case Reopened by District Attorney
description: The Brooklyn District At torney has reopened the case in which a conviction was ob tained against George Whitmore Jr., whose coerced confessions to a series of crimesinclud ing the WylieHoffert rape murderscaused one of the big gest legal scandals of the nine teensixties.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WEST ORANGE, Dec. 22  A 15yearold youth has tak en legal action to try and have his name placed in nomination for a seat on the Board of Edu cation here.

title: 2 Blasts Reported
description: BELFAST, Dec. 22 (UPI)A bomb blast badly damaged a bus company depot in Belfast today and a second bomb dam aged a pub in Omagh, 25 miles south, the police said. No in juries were reported in either explosion, both of which were preceded with telephoned warn ings.

title: Lanier's 33 Rebounds Set Record for Pistons
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22 (AP) Bob Lanier set a Detroit Piston onegame rebounding record with 33 tonight in leading his team to a 10997 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics in National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Fornes Gets Tarleton Posts
description: STEPHENVILLE, Tea., Dec. 22 (AP)James (Buddy) Fornes, McMurry College head football coach for the last seven years, was named athletic director and head football coach today at Tarleton State College.

title: Remote Blackboard Is Devised
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Words written on a black board can be transmitted over ordinary telephone lines for immediate display on a screen many miles away.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE PERSIAN BOY. By Mary Renault. 419 pages. Pantheon. $7.95.

title: A Sixth Day of Big Raids
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 23  As the United States continued its heavy bombing of North Viet nam today for the sixth clay, the officially reported losses of American B52 bombers rose to 10 and the number of missing airmen rose to at least 55.

title: Phillips Sets Gas Deal; B. P. Negotiates a Sale
description: The oil industry around the world was active on the last working day before Christmas.

title: AUSTRALIA GRANTS CHINA RECOGNITION
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 22  The new Governments of Australia and New Zealand an nounced the establishment of diplomatic relations with Com munist China today.

title: Padres Reject a Capital Idea and Stay in San Diego ...
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 22 (UPI) The San Diego Padres killed speculation today that they would move their National League baseball franchise to Washington or anywhere else.

title: Connecticut Co. Supervisors Denied Jobless Benefits
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Dec. 22 (UPI)  Supervisors of the strike  affected Connecticut Company have been told they are ineligible to receive un employment compensation, it was reported today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Boston Celtics avenged one of their four losses this season, using a 42point third quarter to destroy the Kansas City Omaha Kings 11890 tonight. In the third quarter the Celtics made 18 of 26 shots to build a 9667 lead.

title: People in Sports: Bobick Hopes Again
description: Duane Bobick, the Olympic disappointment, is hoping to launch a professional boxing career next March or April.

title: CAR MAKERS SET NEW SALES MARK
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22The four car makers reported sales of 256,966 Americantype automo biles for the Dec. 1120 period, a record for midDecember and up from 180,727 a year ago.

title: Antique Toys in a Jersey Couple's Home
description: PRINCETON, N. J.  Just how many Christmases, how many shouts of joy are rep resented in the history of those chiming, twirling, kick ing, centuryold toys crowd ing the shelves of Edith and Bernard M. Barenholtz's favo rite room even they can only guess.

title: Two Gas Tankers Planned
description: The Natural Gas Pipeline Company of America, a subsid iary of the Peoples Gas Com pany of Chicago, said it had signed a letter of intent with the Newport News Shipbuilding and Drydock Company for two 125,000cubic meter liquefied natural gas tankers.

title: 49ers Hosts to Cowboys
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 22 The Dallas Cowboys will be gin defending their champion ship of the National Football League when they face the San Francisco 49ers at Candlestick Park tomorrow. The game is scheduled to be televised in New York on Channel 2 at 4 P.M.

title: At Chemical Bank, It's Laurel and Hardy
description: Hit Man and House on the Left, the latter billed on the blazing marquee as sheer terror, are playing this week at the RKO 86 Theater on 86th Street be tween Park and Lexington Avenues.

title: High School Drops IndianHead Mascot
description: POCATELLO, Idaho, Dec. 22 (UPI)  Pocatello High School has given in to pres sure from the Native Ameri can Student Association at Idaho State University and has agreed to drop its Indian Mascot head, known as Oske.

title: N. Y. C. vs. E. P. A.
description: Last July the Federal Government brought suit against the City of New York for not moving fast enough to clean up its surrounding waters. Thanks to President Nixon's November order slashing the antipollution funds already voted by Congress, the city has now brought suit against the Environmental Protection Agencyand with excellent reason.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: RENO, Nev., Dec. 22 (UPI)An official bid to hold the 1976 Winter Olympic Games in the RenoLake Tahoe area has been submitted to the United States Olympic Committee.

title: U.S. Postal Regulations Set For Turtles and Terrapins
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) State health departments will have to certify that small tur tles, terrapins and turtle eggs are free of salmonella and Ari zona bacteria before they can be sent through the mails, ac cording to new postal regula tions.

title: Jimmy Wallington Dies at 65; Top Radio Announcer of 30's
description: Jimmy Wallington, a well known radio announcer for the National Broadcasting Compa ny, died yesterday at his home in Arlington, Va. He was 65 years old.

title: Hanoi Identifies 5
description: SAIGON, Saturday, Dec. 23 (UPI)  The Hanoi radio gave the names today of five more Americans it said had been cap tured after bombing raids over North Vietnam.

title: F.T.C. REMOVES BAR TO SATELLITE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)The Federal Communica tions Commission today with drew its objections to a joint domestic satellite venture in which the Communications Sat ellite Corporation would pro vide a satellite solely for the American Telephone and Tele graph Company.

title: Nixon Names Irwin Envoy to France
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 22President Nixon announced today that, as expected, he would nominate John N. Irwin 2d, the outgoing Deputy Secre tary of State, to be United States Ambassador to France.

title: 100th Boston Homicide
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP)The police reported today the 100th homicide of the year in Boston with the finding of the body of an unidentified man in an alley adjacent to the Massachusetts Historical Society.

title: U. S. to Continue Bombing; Says Next Move Is Hanoi's
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The White House said today that the United States would con tinue its heavy bombing of North Vietnam and that the next step to end the Vietnam war was totally up to the North Vietnamese.

title: Saigon Plans OneDay Christmas Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Dec. 23 (AP)The South Vietnamese Government today announced a 24hour ceasefire for Christmas.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)Irving Berlin has given the Smithsonian Institution the upright piano on which he composed the songs White Christmas and Eas ter Parade.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Market Place:
description: Perhaps it is unreasonable, but small investors, if they buy, do hold their brokers responsible for aggressively recommending stocks if the issue drops immediately thereafter.

title: CONNECTICUT GETS JURY AMENDMENT
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 22  The Fourth Amendment to Connect icut's Constitution was signed into effect today, empowering the General Assembly specifi cally to cut Superior Court juries in criminal cases from 12 members to six.

title: Japan Gets a New Cabinet; Tanaka to Continue Policy
description: TOKYO, Dec. 22  Premier Kakuei Tanaka formed a new Cabinet tonight to continue his assertive foreign policy and to meet potentially tough chal lenges in domestic politics dur ing 1973.

title: La Salle, St. Joseph's Win
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22 (AP) Jim Crawford scored 20 points, all in the first half, as La Salle blasted west Chester, 9252, tonight in the second game of a basketball double header at the Palestra. Lou Peltzer hit 11 shots in a row and Pat McFarland eight as St. Joseph's sashayed past San Jose State, 9076.

title: TV DRAFT SCORED BY TRIAL LAWYERS
description: The Nixon Administration's proposed new legislation re lated to the content of televi sion network programs has come under attack from several organizations with interests in broadcasting and First Amend ment guarantees of free speech.

title: Philip Berrigan Will Spend The Holidays in Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 22 (AP) The Rev. Philip Berrigan, re teased from a Federal prison on Wednesday, after serving 39 months for antiwar activ ities, is spending the Christmas holidays in privacy in his home town of Syracuse.

title: Disappearance of Jersey Coed Nov. 10 Baffles Police
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 20 After hundreds of hours of painstaking investigation, the police say they are no closer today to a solution to the mysterious disappearance of Miss Karen Levy of Cherry Hill, N.J., than they were on Nov. 40.

title: 54 Policemen Promoted
description: Fiftyfour members of the Police Department were pro moted in a brief ceremony yesterday in the Police Acad emy, at 235 East 20th Street. The promotions included one to assistant chief inspector, six to inspector, 15 to deputy inspec tor, 15 to captain and 17 to lieutenant.

title: Donald Mawhinney Is Dead; ExDistrict Attorney Upstate
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 22Donald M. Mawhinney, District Attor ney of Onondaga County from 1938 to 1944, died yesterday at his home here. He was 74 years old.

title: Abundant Deuterium Found in Cloud Beyond Orion
description: Deuterium, a heavy form of hydrogen, has been discovered in unexpected abundance in a giant cloud of dust and gas lying beyond the filmy Orion Nebula. The constellation of Orion, hunter of the winter skies, is formed of stars within the Milky Way Galaxy.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Insurer to Rebate PhantomCar Costs

title: Miss Millorizi Has Nuptials
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 22Miss Elizabeth Jane Mil lonzt and Richard A. Levin son were married here this evening in the Appleton Chapel of the Memorial Church of Harvard. University by the Rev. Ralph N. Helver son of the First Parish (Uni tarian) here.

title: Federal Court Acts to Clear Massachusetts Referendum
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP)A threejudge Federal court panel yesterday dissolved a tempor ary injunction barring the state from certifying results of the referendum that established 70 years as the mandatory retire ment age for state judges.

title: Watched 2 of Family Die
description: SAN FERNANDO, Dec. 22 (Reuters)One of the 16 survi vors of a Uruguayan plane that crashed in the Andes 10 weeks ago said today that he had had to watch helplessly as his mother and sister died.

title: Questions Painful Delay
description: ROME, Dec. 22  Pope Paul VI said today that the reasons for the break in the Vietnam peace talks were not suffi ciently apparent.

title: Maker of Birth Pill Sued In Death of Woman at 24
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 22 (UPI)An $11million damage suit was filed yesterday against a subsidiary of the Warner Lambert Company by a man who said his wife had died from taking contraceptive pills.

title: MAN CAUGHT IN DOOR IS KILLED BY SUBWAY
description: A 26yearold visitor from Ireland was killed last night when he fell beneath a subway train that started while his leg was caught in the door.

title: 7 Alleged Crime Figures Released for Holiday
description: TRENTON, Dec. 22Seven alleged underworld figures serving indefinite terms at the Yardvillle Youth Recep tion and Correction Center were ordered released to spend the Christmas weekend with their families.

title: Braves' Rally Just Misses
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 22 (UPI)  Lou Hudson scored 25 of 33 points in the second half tonight as the Atlanta Hawks hung on for a 110109 victory over the Buffalo Braves. Hudson's free throw with three seconds left provided the margin of Atlan ta's fourth straight victory and ninth in the last 11 games. The Braves scored 8 points in the last 20 seconds.

title: Diana Edelman Wed To Fred Scott Kleiner
description: Miss Diana Elizabeth Edel man and Fred Scott Kleiner, who have received master's degrees in art history and archeology from Columbia University, were married here yesterday by Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman in his study at Temple EmanuEl.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: GREENSBORO, N. C. (AP) The Carolina Cougars got good help from their bench as they downed the San Diego Con quistadors, 121102, in an American Basketball Associa tion game tonight.

title: Christmas Spirit Wilts in California Sun
description: CANOGA PARK, Calif., Dec. 21It's trite to call Christmas commercial, but in a place like Topanga Plaza it's hard to say anything else. Here in this Temple of Trade, this Mecca of Merchandising, more than 100 stores are clustered under one roof in two  tiered, air  conditioned comfort. The only time that nature ever intruded into this windowless world was the day of the great Califor nia earthquake, when the sprinklers went off.

title: CITY SAYS IT ACTED ON TICKET FIXING
description: Mayor Lindsay's office said yesterday that important changes had been made in the Parking Violations Bureau last year following a study of the bureau by the city's Investiga tion Department.

title: Pentagon May Deny Objectors Release
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 The Pentagon has proposed a revision of military directives to do away with the practice of granting honorable dis charges to servicemen because of religious or philosophical beliefs.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Dec. 22The P.A.F. Playhouse, Long Island's only yearround professional theater, will be able to continue operations, at least over the short term, despite a $50,000 deficit.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP)Harvard's high scoring line of Bob McManama, Dave Hynes and Bill Corkery, barred by the Ivy League from playing in the World Cup hockey tournament in Colorado, is going to get a shot at the Czechoslovak national team.

title: CHARTERS STRAND MANY IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Dec. 22 (Reuters) More than 300 Christmas air travelers to New York were stranded in London today after the cancellation of two trans Atlantic charter flights.

title: Britain Facing Problems In MoneySupply Control
description: LONDON, Dec. 22There is broad agreement in Britain that the growth of the money sup ply must be slowed If Inflation is to be slowed, but this agree ment comes just as the Govern ment has completed a series of moves that have weakened its control over the money supply.

title: Post Downs Wagner
description: C. W. Post won its sixth game in a row, defeating Wagner, 7457, at the losers' court last night. Ed Miller led the Pioneers with 19 points. Jo Jo Jones of Wagner had 20 points.

title: Tough Willie and the Tree
description: Every Christmas my wife will ask me, Are you to get a tree for the children, Jack! And every Christmas I will answer, Not this time Ruth, but next year, perhaps.

title: Pentagon May Deny Objectors Release
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 The Pentagon has proposed revision of military directives to do away with the practice of granting honorable dis charges to servicemen because of religious or philosophical beliefs.

title: Smithsonian Museum Head
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) Dr. Porter M. Kier has been appointed director of the Smith sonian Institution's National Museum of Natural History, the Smithsonian's secretary, S. Dil lon Ripley, announced today. Dr. Kier will succeed Dr. Rich ard S. Cowan, the director since 1965, who will resume his work as a senior scientist on the mu seum staff.

title: White House Is Urged To Admit a Reporter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)The Washington Eve ning StarNews say that if reporters of The Washington Post are barred from White House events, we should take our fair turn in the cold.

title: Filipino Tenant Farmers Receive Deeds to Land
description: MANILA, Dec. 22President Ferdinand E. Marcos invited 431 tenants to the carpeted hall of the presidential palace today and handed out certifi cates gradually transferring to them the titles over lands they have tilled.

title: Chicago Hails China Troupe
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22 (AP) Members of the Shenyeng Acro batic Troupe from China were made honorary citizens of Chi cago at a City Council meeting today. Mayor Richard J. Daley presented the troupe, which has been appearing at the Opera House here, with a medallion and three stuffed pandas.

title: Arizona State's Fast Backs To Test Missouri Tonight
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 22 (AP)The Missouri Tigers, the upset kids of the Big Eight, will be tested tomorrow night by the strong running backs of Arizona State University. They will meet in the second annual Fiesta Bowl football game at neighboring Tempe.

title: Poland to U.S. and Back: How to Live Like a King
description: WARSAW, Dec. 22Polish Americans who return here to settle have a saying: Earn it there, spend it here. It rhymes in Polish, and for an increasing number of these people, it makes sense.

title: Ragged Knicks Win, 9887, From Troubled Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 22The Knicks are still struggling on the National Basketball Asso ciation road, but this station stop is almost always a pleas ant one for Coach Red Holz man's crew. Despite an over all ragged performance, the Knicks were good enough to post a 9887 victory tonight over the sinking Cavaliers.

title: Urge End to War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Fortyone religious leaders in the United States have issued a, pastoral letter assailing United States bombing of North Viet nam, it was announced today.

title: Gun Rack Gift Fatal
description: ALBANY, Ga., Dec. 22 (UPI) A young mother apparently shot herself while placing a gun in a gun rack that she was giv ing her husband as a Christmas gift, officials said yesterday. The body of Terah G. Hamilton, 27 years old, was found under the Christmas tree by her motherinlaw. The Lee County Coroner W. K. Culpepper, ruled the death accidental.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MIDDLETOWN TOWNSHIP, Dec. 22  Meeting only cau tious neutrality from top New Jersey officials and thousands of protests from residents along the shores, the Army Corps of Engineers is moving ahead with plans for a deep water oil port where super tankers could unload off the New Jersey coast.

title: Bush, Leaving U. N. Post, Is Fearful of Bloc Voting
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 22George Bush said to day that he felt that the great est danger to the United Na tions lay in blind bloc voting and in the strident voices pre vailing in those votes.

title: Hartford Seeks Takeover Of the Excess Insurance Co.
description: LONDON. Dec. 22 (Reuters) The Hartford Fire Insurance Company tonight announced $17million takeover bid for the British Excess Insurance Company.

title: Music: Shorter Score
description: Whatever Pierre Boulez is, he is no profound respecter of the textual verities. Nearly every conductor today, seri ous and dedicated, would sooner go on stage without pants than truncate a Mozart score. But Mr. Boulez, in pro graming Mozart's Serenade in D (K. 320), better known as the Posthorn Serenade, had no hesitation playing only four of the seven move ments. And then, at the end of the Thursday evening Phil harmonic program, he con ducted only eight of the 12 pieces that make up Prokof Suite.

title: Mrs. Binh Assails U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22 (Reuters) Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, the chief Vietcong delegate to the fourparty peace talks at Paris, charged today that the United States was demanding revision of major points in the tentative ceasefire agreement reached with North Vietnam.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Ford Motor Company announced yesterday that it had raised $60million in Japan through a foreign sub sidiary, a private placement that represented the biggest dollardenominated debenture issue ever made in that country and the first such convertible issue sold entirely within the Japanese capital market. Goldman, Sachs Inter national Corporation and four Japanese investment bankers arranged the placement.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Bell Helicopter division of Textron, Inc., received a $63 million Army contract for 287 model 214A helicopter trans ports destined for Iran, it was announced yesterday.

title: Pentagon Aide to Leave
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Dec. 22 (AP)G. Warren Nutter, As sistant Secretary of Defense for International Security Affairs, will return to the University of Virginia faculty early next year, the university announced today. Mr. Nutter, who has been on leave from the university since February, 1969, will resume teaching when the spring se mester begins on Jan. 30.

title: Pleasant Street First
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22 (UPI)Dan Lasater's Pleasant Street raced to an impressive victory today in the Bristol Purse at Liberty Bell, beating I Want You by six lengths in the 1mile race.

title: Common Market Fines 2 Concerns In Antitrust Move
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 22 (Reuters) The old European Common Market Commission went out with a trustbusting flourish today, fining two American controlled groups almost $300, 000.

title: Navy Critic of Ash Refuses to Resign; Put in Minor Job
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  The United States Navy said today that it had tried to force the retirement of an outspo ken senior civil servant, Gor don Rule, and when he re fused, transferred him to a minor job as a consultant to a supply school.

title: U.S. Indicts Seven In Plot to Smuggle Arms to Mexico
description: ALEXANDRIA, La., Dec. 22 (UPI)  A Texas banker rancher, a former United States immigration official and five other men have been in dicted by a Federal grand jury on charges of conspiring to smuggle arms to Mexico for further shipment, presumably to Cuba.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service, and decor (four tri angles to none.)

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The year 1973 will be ushered in at a New Year's Eve party in Central Park, the sixth such festival to be sponsored by the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Af fairs Administration.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Carl Garrett Is Divorced
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) Sheila Garrett, wife of Carl Garrett, New England Patriots running back, was granted a divorce today in Suffolk Coun ty Probate Court. Mrs. Garrett received the divorce on grounds of cruel and abusive treatment. The Garretts were married in October, 1969, and have been separated since the spring of.

title: Navy Critic of Ash Refuses to Resign; Put in Minor Job
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  The United States Navy said today that it had tried to force the retirement of an outspo ken senior civil servant, Gor don Rule, and when he re fused, transferred him to minor job as a consultant to supply school.

title: Peter Stone Weds Claudia G. Young
description: FLORENCE, S. C., Dec. 22 Miss Claudia Gray Young, daughter of Representative elect Edward Lunn Young, Republican of South Caro lina, and Mrs. Young, was married here today to Peter Howard Stone, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey Stone of Maplewood, N. J.

title: Message for the Media
description: The White House message to American broadcasters commercial, public and educationalis coming through louder and clearer every day. That message is blunt: Stay away from controversial subjects. If you behave yourself, we will renew your license for a longer term. If you get Government funding, we will determine the kind of programs you will air.

title: 3 Bank Robbers Elude Queens Dragnet
description: Three bank robbers who were forced to abandon their getaway car yesterday when they drove into a flooded area managed to elude about 50 Nassau County and New York City policemen as they fled on foot in a marshy, junkstrewn area just north of Kennedy In ternational Airport in Queens.

title: SCHOOLS TO SEEK CRIMEFIGHT AID
description: Mayor Lindsay and Board of Education officials agreed yes terday at a meeting on vio lence in the public schools to explore the possibility of seek ing Federal funds and using Model Cities community of ficers as school guards.

title: Profits Decline at Grand Union Company in 3 and 9 Months
RAIDERS' MOORE HIT IN A POLICE MIXUP
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 22 (AP) A reserve tight end Bob by Moore of the Oakland Raid ers, received five stitches to night after he was struck on the back of the head by a pa trolman as a result of a mis understanding during a pep rally in honor of the Pittsburgh Steelers, police said.

title: Council Creates 6 Districts For City Minority Groups
description: The City Council voted 28 to 7 yesterday to create six new councilmanic districts, with the avowed purpose of increasing the representation of blacks and Puerto Ricans on the city legislative body. The change would raise the number of Councilmen to 43 from 37.

title: Longshoremen's Union Reports Tentative Pact With Teamsters
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 22 (AP)The West Coast long shoremen's union said today that its president and two top teamsters' union officials had reached a tentative agreement to merge their unions.

title: Miss Blee Is Bride of R. L. Ashe Jr.
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 22  Miss Kathleen Marie Bloc, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Myron Roy Blee, was married here today to Robert Lawrence Ashe Jr., of At lanta, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ashe of Knoxville and Hobe Sound. The ceremony was performed in Trinity United Methodist Church by the Rev. Edward Norman and the Rev. Austin Hollady.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your editorials about the Chicago 7 trial have been consistently fair. But there are some points in your most re cent one The Chicago Debacle [Nov. 24] that merits correction.

title: Questions Painful Delay
description: ROME, Dec. 22 Pope Paul VI said today that the reasons for the break in the Vietnam peace talks were not suffi ciently apparent.

title: Record Wheat Crop Seen As Prices Spur Planting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) Winter wheat farmers, encouraged by the highest cash prices in a decade, will produce a record crop next year of 1,277,848,000 bushels, the Agriculture Department forecast today.

title: Transistor's Birthday
