description: Twentyfive years ago today, at the Bell Laboratories in Murray Hill, N.J., the transistor was invented by three researchers, John Bardeen, Walter H. Brattain and Wil liam Shockley. Few technological developments have had such enormous impact on civilization in so short a time. The transistor is the central device in instruments as different as the pacemakers that regulate malfunctioning hearts, the radios with which Apollo 17's astronauts and Houston kept in such close touch, the bandheld mini calculators that have just appeared on the market, and the giant computers that are now at the core of so much business management and scientific research.

title: Messiah
description: The veteran Oratorio Soci ety of New York, which will celebrate its centennial next year, has been giving Han del's Messiah annually al most since it was organized. This season's performance was sung in Carnegie Hall on Thursday night, under the di rection of its current leader, T. Charles Lee, and it found the large chorus at its best.

title: Chaps Top Pacers, 147142
description: DALLAS, Dec. 22 (AP)Rich Jones hit a career high of 39 points to lead the Dallas Chap parrals to a 147142 double overtime victory over the Indi ana Pacers tonight.

title: More Food Outlets Named by the City As Failing Checks
description: Twentyone food establish ments said to have seriously violated the city's Health Code are on the latest list made pub lic yesterday by the Health Services Administration.

title: 7 Alleged Crime Flores Released for Holiday
description: TRENTON, Dec. 22,Seven alleged underworld figuret, serving indefinite terms at the Yardvillle Youth Recep tion and Correction Center were ordered released to spend the Christmas weekend with their families.

title: HEALTH UNIT SCORES CURBS ON ABORTION
description: The American Public Health Association has called for the elimination of all state laws that restrict abortion.

title: Policeman Hurt, 2 Arrested At Rally by Steelers' Fans
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 22 (UPI) One policeman was injured and two persons were arrested tonight when a rally by Pitts burgh Steeler fans in front of the Hilton Hotel got out of hand.

title: Hanoi Says Normal Life Goes on Despite Bombs
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 22 (Reu ters)North Vietnam said to day that American bombing had not disrupted the normal life of Hanoi.

title: A Present That's Taken Years to Make
description: By the time Lucie Porges had been working with Pauline Trigere for 15 years, the problem of what to give the fashion designer for Christ mas had become vexing. She already had everything, or so it seemed to Mrs. Porges.

title: Steelers to Meet Raiders
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 22  Art Rooney, the 71yearold team president waited 39 years for his team, the Steelers, to win.

title: Detroit Police Graft Not Major
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22  Police Commissioner John F. Nichols declared today that corruption was not a major problem in his department and that consider ably less than 25 officers had been implicated by an investi gation into police involvement in the city's narcotics trade.

title: 76ers Lose 8th In Row
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 22 (AP) The Houston Rockets, led by Jack Marin's 28 points, de feated the hapless Philadelphia 76ers, 116103 tonight. The 76ers have lost eight straight.

title: LARGEST HOSPITAL IN HANOI REPORTED DAMAGED IN RAID
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 22Ha noi's largest hospital, one mile west of the city center, was damaged by American planes early today, according to the Swedish Foreign Ministry.

title: Joint Attack in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 22 (Reuters)The Cam bodian command said today that an unspecified number of its troops began an operation with South Vietnamese troops yesterday, with the aim of clear ing a Communistoccupied area of Cambodia 55 miles south of here.

title: Medieval Cantigas Given by Waverly Consort
description: From a musical standpoint, the Waverly Consort's produc tion of Las Cantigas de Santa Maria Thursday evening at the Central Presbyterian Church sounded perfectly delightful.

title: MRS. SUZANNE ORR
description: Mrs. Suzanne Kenyon Orr, a past president of the National ShutIn Society, died Wednes day at her home, 25 Parkview Avenue in Bronxville, N. Y. She was 61 years old.

title: Students on Hunger Strike In Nicaraguan Cathedral
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 22 (UPI)About 100 university students led by a Roman Cath olic priest began a hunger strike today in the atrium of the cathedral against poverty, political prisonersand Santa Claus.

title: TRUMAN ENDURES DANGEROUS PHASE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 22  Former President Harry S. Truman, battling for his life after 18 days of hospitalization, went through what doctors termed a dangerous period this morning when his heart suddenly fluttered and his blood pressure dropped.

title: EXAIDE CHANGES ARMCO TESTIMONY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) A former high Justice Depart ment official has contradicted his testimony of a year ago and concedes that the White House, in effect, dictated how he was to soften a Federal court anti pollution order against the Armco Steel Corporation.

title: Spanish Cafe Owner $19Million Winner In Christmas Lottery
description: VICH, Spain, Dec. 22 (UPI) A 64yearold cafe owner and a group of his customers won the top prize of $19million to day in the Spanish state Christ mas lottery, the world's rich est.

title: More Food Outlets Named by the City As Failing Checks
description: Twentyone food establish ments said to have seriously violated the city's Health Code are on the latest list made pub lic yesterday by the Health Services Administration.

title: MOVE UP BEGINS IN PRIME RATES
description: The prime rate  the most visible and politically sensitive of all bank lending rates  started to move to 6 per cent yesterday, despite pressure from Washington to hold down this key minimum charge on business loans.

title: Equity Financing
description: Guardian Mortgage Investors said yesterday that the Securities and Exchange Commission declared effective a registration statement relating to 375, 400 shares of beneficial interest which may be offered by or on behalf of certain shareholders. Guardian Mortgage closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 45, down .

title: Ham Operators Sue F.C.C., Charge Search and Seizure
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 22 (UPI)  A suit on behalf of six million ham radio station oper ators charged the Federal Com munications Commission today with illegal search and seizures and asked $900million dam ages.

title: Nuclear Device Tested
description: YUCCA FLATS, Nev., Dec. 22 (AP)An underground nuclear device with a force of 20 to 200 kilotons detonated at the Nevada Test Site produced no sign of surface radiation, the Atomic Energy Commission re ports. The device was set off yesterday at a depth of 2,260 feet at the Yucca Flats area 85 miles northwest of Las Vegas.

title: SANTA IS WARNED OF MORE DRIZZLE
description: A steady drizzle that is ex pected to continue intermittent ly through Christmas Day marked holiday preparations here yesterday as New Yorkers, driven by the holiday impera tives of shopping, traveling and office partying, clogged city streets, highways, train stations and airports.

title: ... but for City U.'s Distinguished Professors, Enthusiasm Prevails
description: The 25 freshmen in Dr. Louis Auslander's basic mathematics course at Voor hees Technical Institute, a part of the City University of New York, regard Dr. Auslander as a teacher who knows what he's talking about.

title: Levy: A Rewarded Lindsay Worker
description: Norman A. Levy, the $25,000 ayear, parttime president of the New York City Tax Com mission and Mayor Lindsay's key political coordinator for Brooklyn, was asked last year what kind of people belonged to those modern versions of old fashioned political clubhouses, the John V. Lindsay Associa lions.

title: GALLAGHER DENIES OFFERING ANY DATA
description: Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher, Democrat of Bay onne, N. J., who has pleaded guilty to evading the payment of $74,000 in Federal income taxes in 1966, took issue yes terday with a statement made by the United States Attorney, Herbert J. Stern, on Thursday.

title: MRS. JOHN CASHMORE
description: Mrs. Edythe Tenney Cash more, widow of John Cash more, a Borough President of Brooklyn, died Thursday in New Rochelle Hospital. She was 74 years old and lived at 16 Chatsworth Avenue, Larch mont, N. Y.

title: STARS ROUT NETS FOR 10TH IN ROW
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 22 In losing to the Utah Stars tonight, 9784, the Nets built a good case for refunding the ticket price to their customers. At times they played as if they had turned back the clock to the early days of the American Basketball Association and were again wearing the uni forms of the New Jersey Amer icans.

title: Shanker Group Expels Two As Dissidents in the U.F.T.
description: The Unity Caucus, Albert Shanker's party within the United Federation of Teachers, has expelled two of its mem bers because of their public support of Representative Bella S. Abzug in last November's election.

title: DEEP THROAT JUDGE CUTS LAWYER SHORT
description: Criminal Court Judge Joel J. Tyler recessed the Deep Throat obscenity trial yester day and dismissed a prosecu tion witness, charging that crossexamination of the wit ness by the defense attorney had become repetitive and irrelevant.

title: WILLIAM P. REILLY
description: MAHWAH, N. J., Dec. 22 William P. Reilly, vice presi dent and general manager of the Paterson division of the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, died Wednesday at his home here. He was 62 years old.

title: Taiwan's Election Campaign Is Lively and Loud
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 22  The election campaign for na tional legislative and local of fices is, a lively and colorful spectacle. When the candidates, wearing identifying sashes across their chests like bathing beauty contestants, approach the microphone at outdoor meetings, their campaign work ers often set off so many fire crackers that the rostrum dis appears for several minutes in haze of smoke.

title: Ford Recalls School Buses
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Ford Motor Company an nounced today the recall of 233 school buses with Ford chassis because of a possible parking brake defect. Ford said the de fect was suspected on only 23 of these vehicles, produced in the 1972 and 1973 models.

title: Miss Petschek, '70 Debutante, Wed in France
description: Miss Nicole Marie Burke Petschek, who was presented to New York society at the 1970 Debutante Cotillion and Christmas Ball, was married in St. JeanCapFerrat, France, yesterday to Joseph Gian Luca de Francisci, a broker in Paris.

title: U.S. and Chile Finish Talks, Agree to Meet Next Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 The United States and Chile to day concluded a threeday round of negotiations on their financial and political problems and agreed to resume talks here early next year.

title: Workmen's Compensation Held to Apply to Migrants
description: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 22 (UPI)  The Michigan Supreme Court today ruled unconstitu tional a law excluding migrant workers from workmen's com pensation coverage.

title: Heath Due in U.S. In Early February To Meet With Nixon
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 22 (AP)Prime Minister Heath of Britain will visit Washington Feb. 1 and 2 in the first of a series of meetings that Pres ident Nixon plans with Euro pean leaders, the White House announced today.

title: Man Slain and Another Injured In Separate Broadway Shootings
description: Two men were shot, one fatally, in separate incidents on Upper Broadway yesterday afternoon.

title: Reporter Gets Albany Post
description: ALBANY, Dec. 22 (AP) Charles Dumas, Albany corre spondent of The New York. Daily News, has been named director of communications for incoming Senate Majority Lead er Warren M. Anderson, Repub lian of Binghamton, Mr. Ander son's office announced today. He will be paid $35,000 a year.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 22 (AP) The number of persons em ployed in New Jersey in November rose to 2.66 mil lion, a record, according to the State Department of Labor and Industry.

title: PRICES FOR AMEX AND COUNTER GAIN
description: The American Stock Ex change and the overthe counter market started the holi day season in a bullish manner yesterday as both lists regis tered their first advances In five sessions.

title: Notes on People
description: Returning to Spain after five weeks in Argentina, Juan D. Peron, the former Argen tine President, sounded some what cautious about his plans. The 77yearold Mr. Peron went to Buenos Aires to assess the possibility of a political comeback after 17 years of exile. On the way back to his home in the Ma drid suburbs, he said, I have come back to Spain because I can live here better and in more tranquility than in Argentina. As to gaining the Presidential nomination of his former political party, Mr. Peron said, There are thousands of candidates.

title: March of Dimes Month Set
description: As Christine Petrilli, 5 years old, sat in her wheelchair, and John Ball, 3, stood on tiny crutches yesterday, Mayor Lind say signed a proclamation des ignating January as March of Dimes Month in the city. Christine and John, both from Queens, are this year's March of Dimes poster children.

title: 16 Survivors of Oct. 13 Plane Crash Found in Andes
description: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 22Two survivors from a plane that crashed more than two months ago in the Andes climbed down from the moun tains today and led rescuers to the site of the wreckage.

title: U.C.L.A. Wins No. 50
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (AP) Undefeated and topranked University of California, Los Angeles, wth Keith Wilkes scoring 20 points, posted an 89.76 triumph over Pittsburgh as the Bruin coach, John Woo den, returned to the bench to night after a week's hospitaliz ation for a heart ailment. It was the Bruins' 50th straight victory.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York State's Congres sional delegation joined the lobbying effort to win a $1 billion contract for a new Air Force fighter plane that it says could be the salvation of Long Island's aerospace industry.

title: Lakers Are Beaten
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (AP) The Phoenix Suns, led by Neal Walk and Charlie Scott, defeated the injuryplagued Los Angeles Lakers, 118110, to night.

title: COSUMER PRICES UP 0.3% IN MONTH; FOOD MAIS FACTOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Consumer prices rose once again in November at a rate little higher than the Nixon Ad ministration had hoped but well below the pace of the 196971 period, the Labor Department reported today.

title: TV: 2 Holiday Treats
description: Two separate hours of viewing today over the Co lumbia Broadcasting System and WNET/Channel 13 are worth anybody's time. One program is a rounded, suc cinet wrapup of the recent moon project, Challenger Has Landed!The Adven tures of Apollo 17, on C.D.S. at 1 P.M. As for Wilkie Col lins's classic teaser, The Moonstone, it's time who dunit fans got with this five chapter, British adaptation on Channel 13. It's not too late, with part two repeated tonight at 7:30 and part three beaming in tomorrow night at 9.

title: Tenants Flee 2Alarm Blaze
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 22A twoalarm fire in a fashionable apartment building forced 40 tenants to flee the fivestory building shortly after 5 A.M. Morristown Fire Chief George Nixon said that the blaze, which apparently started in a doctor's office, caused quite a bit of water damage to the basement, the doctor's office and three suites in the building at 181 South Street, There were no injuries reported.

title: Fashion Dream Voted No. 1
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP) Fashion Dream, winner of 11 races this year, was voted the New England trotter of the year today by the New Eng land Harness Writers Associa tion. Mountain Skipper was named New England pacer of the year for the second con secutive time.

title: General Giap Says Hanoi Will Win Despite Rombing
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 22Gen, Vo Nguyen Giap, North Vietnam's Defense Min ister and leading military stra tegist, has declared that Hanoi and Haiphong may be erased by United States bombs, but that in the end the North Viet namese will win the war.

title: CITY SAYS IT ACTED ON TICKET FIXING
description: Mayor Lindsay's office said yesterday that important changes had been made in the Parking Violations Bureau last year following a study of the bureau by the city's Investiga tion Department.

title: BLACK HAWKS DOWN JETS
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22 (AP) Butch Barber, a defenseman, scored early in the final period to give the Chicago Cougars a 3.2 victory over the Winnipeg Jets in a World Hockey Associ ation game tonight.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)Irving Berlin has given the Smithsonian Institution the upright piano on which he composed the songs White Christmas and Eas ter Parade.

title: Prosecutors Score Exclusion in DrugTheft Inquiry
description: The District Attorneys of Manhattan and the Bronx yes terday protested the decision of the special state prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, to exclude them from the investigation of the thefts of heroin and co caine from the Police Depart ment.

title: Nixon's Reorganization
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 22 Day after day, the announce ments of personnel changes have kept on flowing out of the Nixon Administration in no evident order and with no sur face coherence. But a strong underlying theme is becoming increasingly apparent. The Pres ident is bound and determined to run the Gov ernment. On the evidence of past experience, such an effort is lauda bly, but almost laughably, optimistic. Other Ad ministrations have sought to harness the mixed allegiances of the vast department bureauc racies, answerable in fact to Congress and their own special constituencies as well as the White House

title: Reporter Loses in Attempt To Be Freed for Birthday
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (AP) William T. Farr, reporter for The Los Angeles Times, lost a lastminute effort to be re leased from jail today, his 38th birthday, and resigned himself to remaining in prison over Christmas.

title: 4 LAUREL WINNERS RIDDEN BY HAWLEY
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 22 (UPI) Sandy Hawley, on his way to winning the 1972 national riding championship, booted hope four winners today at Laurel, including Peppermint Lassie in the $7,500 allowance feature.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: High Car Output Seen
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22 (AP)The domestic auto industry will end its 1972 production this week with its third highest assembly total in history, the Automotive News reports in its Dec. 25 issue.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Supreme Court justice in Manhattan granted writs of habeas corpus yesterday and set bail or paroled 11 women suspected of being prostitutes who had been sent to Bikers Island to await tests to determine if they had venereal disease.

title: CONSUMER PRICES RISE HERE BY 0,3%
description: Consumer prices rose only slightly in the metropolitan area in November, mainly as a result of unexpectedly costly fruits and vegetables, the Unit ed States Bureau of Labor Sta tistics reported yesterday.

title: Kidnappers Free Texas Woman After $250,000 Is Paid
description: DALLAS, Dec. 22  Mrs. Amanda Dealcy, a bride of six weeks, was freed unharmed to day by kidnappers who had kept her bound and masked for more than two days and col lected $250,000 in ransom from her family.

title: White House Said to Plan Freeze on Public Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The National Housing Confer ence said today that it had learned that the Nixon Admin istration was planning an 18month moratorium on all new construction under the public housing and interest subsidy programs adminis tered by the Department of Housing and Urban Develop ment.

title: Mr. Gallagher's Guilt
description: After months of protesting his innocence, Representa tive Cornelius E. Gallagher has now entered a plea of guilty to charges of evading income taxes and has pledged his cooperation with law enforcement officials investigating widespread corruption in New Jersey.

title: WINE TALK
description: The stunning business deal that put Pepsi Cola into the Soviet Union grabbed na tional headlines a few months ago, but almost unnoticed, down in the fine print, was the quid pro quo, the other side of the ruble, so to speak. Pepsico Inc. must import variety of Russian wines into this country.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Richard Eberhart, the Pu litzer and Bollingen prize winning poet, has been named honorary president of the Poetry Society of Amer ica, a title left vacant since the death of Robert Frost in 1963 . . . The Metropolitan Museum of Art, which plans to open its new American Museum in 1976 on the occa sion of the nation's bicen tennial celebration, has re ceived official recognition of the project by the American Revolution Bicentennial Com mission in Washington. Along with this goes the right to display the official Bicenten nial symbola red, white and blue star surrounded by the legend American Revolution Bicentennial, 17761976.

title: 28 Hurt on Tampa Monorail
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 22 (UPI) An automated monorail shuttle at Tampa International Airport stopped suddenly today, hurling 100 passengers forward and in juring 28 of them. A spokesman said engineers from the West inghouse Corporation, which de signed the shuttle, began an im mediate investigation into the cause at the accident.

title: 100YearOld Building Housing 2 Papers Burns
description: SCHUYERVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 22 (AP)Fire destroyed the 100yearold brick building housing The Wise Shopper and The Schuyerville Standard last night in this rural Saratoga County village east of Saratoga Springs.

title: POTATO FUTURES REACH NEW HIGHS
description: Soaring cash prices in Maine and Long Island influenced new contract highs for potatoes yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange. The key May delivery made a new con tract high of 6.53 cents a pound and then was nudged down at the close to 6.52, compared with its close on Thursday of 6.40. Its previous high was 6.45.

title: Prices of Stocks Rebound In Day of Light Trading
description: The stock market rebounded yesterday from the selling that occurred early in the week, but trading was light, reflecting early departures from Wall Street for the Christmas holiday weekend.

title: Park Is Named to a Third Term By Electoral Body in Seoul
description: SEOUL, Saturday, Dec. 23 President Chung Hee Park was reelected to a new six year term as the head of state and chief executive of South Korea today. He was the only candidate and will operate un der a new Constitution that in creases his authority.

title: Dave Anderson
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Dec. 22In the outer office, a guard in a blue shirt looked up.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The year 1973 will be ushered in at a New Year's Eve party in Central Park, the sixth such festival to be spohsored by the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Af fairs Administration.

title: Marine Killed
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 22 (UPI) Officials at Camp Smith Marine Base said that Sgt. Henry J. Griffin, 25 years old, of Mount Holly, N. J., was shot in the head yesterday when a pri vately owned pistol fell from a file drawer and discharged when it hit the floor. He died alter being taken to a hospital. When an officer went to notify Sergeant Griffin's wife, Laura, he found her suffering labor pains. She was taken to a hos pital where she gave birth to it buy last night.

title: 2 GUILTY IN '71 THEFT OF RIFLES FROM U.S.
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 22 (AP) Two Cranston, R. I., men face jail terms after being convicted in United States District Court here of charges involving the theft of 30 rifles from the Westerly, R. I., armory in No vember, 1971.

title: The World
description: The Kremlin's top leader, Leonid Brezhnev, personally broke the bad news last week: The Soviet Union's grain harvest this year was only 168 million tons, almost 30 million tons below target. But even as he spoke at a gathering of Soviet and foreign Communist bigwigs in Moscow, an American ship was unloading at the Soviet Black Sea port of Odessa, de livering part of the $2billion worth of grain Moscow has bought abroad this year. Between the confession of agricultural shortage and the depend ence on American grain to make up for that shortage may lie some expla nations of current Soviet policy to ward the West.

title: CITY AIDE ENDING 51 YEARS' SERVICE
description: After 51 years in city govern ment under nine Mayors, Sam uel Becker, retiring chairman of the city's Board of Stand ards and Appeals, is still en joying a love affair with the greatest city in the world  New York.

title: Notes: Williamsburg Ends Its Free Ride
description: THE glories that were Colonial Williamsburg are going to cost a little more for those who are interested in the reincarnation of those gloriesand each year about million people are.

title: Music
description: WHAT a nice Christmas present came to the Pierpont Morgan Library! The other week, on Dec. 14, the Library un veiled its latest musical acquisitionthe manuscript score, all 75 pages of it, of Mozart's singspiel, Der Schauspiel direktor. The Morgan people were nice enough to let me take a close look at it, while they looked even closer at me as my nervous and clumsy hands were turning the pages. All I had to do was tear a page by accident, or do something equally horrible.

title: Vietnam
description: WASHINGTONThis was to have been the week when Henry A. Kis singer's peace pledge of Oct. 26 would be translated into agreement, making Christmas truly joyous for all those in this country and the world who direct ly or indirectly have borne the burdens of the Vietnam war. Instead, Wash ington this Christmas was steeped in gloom. Even the official Government spokesmen did not seem to have their hearts in their work. For instead of peace they could only project more war.

title: Somerset to Get New Juvenile Center
description: SOMERVILLEA juvenile detention center that has stirred controversy since its conception two years ago is scheduled to be opened early next year in a wing of the Somerset County Jail here.

title: Finding The Center
description: When anthropologists bring to us what is made and done in other cul turesmasks, pots, weapons, songs, rituals, historieswe are apt im mediately to put what is brought us to our own uses, abstracting what is given from its context so that it may bear the meaning that we need it to have rather than be what it is and what it means in the context of its own culture. We use the exotic to charm our fatigued imaginations. We invoke what is alien and what is past to express the guilts or the hopes of our own present.

title: Canadiens Down Penguins, 63
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 23 (UPI) Two goals each by Frank Ma hovlich and Guy Lapointe paced the Montreal Canadiens to a 63 victory tonight over the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: Education
description: The nation's 2.1 million teachers constitute one of the largest special interest groups. But it has been only in the last decade that the teachers have become fully aware of their potential power through or ganized action. The turning point came with the first bigcity col lective bargaining agreements with the teachers unions in the 1960's.

title: Cumberland Count A Familiar Pattern
description: Cumberland County has a small population, as com pared to the metropolitan area counties in the northern part Of the state, but its ethnic variety is similar to theirs.

title: Radio Ham Gave World Quake News
description: MIAMI, Dec. 23 (AP)When an earthquake shattered Man agua, the capital of Nicaragua, today, amateur radio operators from Chicago to Venezuela were kept informed by an oper ator who for many hours was one of the city's few links with the outside world.

title: Mrs. Yurdin Has Child
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Dec. 23A daughter was born Dec. 1 to Mr. and Mrs. Carl R. Yurdin at the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset. Mrs. Yurdin is the former Miss Irene P. Atney, whose husband is a partner of Levow Yurdin Industrial De sign, Inc., of Woodbury. The child has been named Laura.

title: Fireman Slain by Robber
description: MICHIGAN CITY, Ind., Dec. 23 (AP)A Michigan City fire man who would have retired after today's shift was shot to death early this morning in a tavern robbery. Capt. Russ Pleus, 57 years old, was fatally shot when he apparently recog nized one of two robbers who entered the tavern, where he was sitting with friends. The gunmen then robbed patrons and the bartender of $380.

title: Christmas is for children
description: Children from the United Nations In ternational School and their friends came together for a treetrimming party. There were Eugenie Campagne, of the Netherlands, who didn't forget the wooden shoes that go with the tra ditional striped skirt and black vest; Christine Sang, who was born in the U.S., and looks like a Chinese princess in her best red silk dress, and Christina Dailo of Hawaii who forgot about winter and wore a halter top and grass skirt. Sait Halman of Turkey, wore an embroidered vest with panta loons; his turban is striped silk. Kevin Tarrant, part Scot, part Indian, per plexed by it all, stuck to his blue jeans, but did wear a handembroidered vest and fur hat. Dianne Hargrove repre sented early America in a black and white check dress from Saks. Anita Riihiaho of Finland was festive in the traditional striped skirt and starched white apron of her native land. Defne Halman of Turkey wore the traditional dress of the Aegean with a multicolored silk tunic held up with a jeweled \belt revealing star  printed pantaloons. Judy Tarrant was all in suede. Stephen Smith sported the bright feathered cos tume of the first Americans.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: The death of Life was in evitable.

title: Kerr on The Children and The Contrast
description: MICHAEL McGUIRE'S The Children, now on view at the tiny experimental theater in the Public complex, looks lik4, an attempt to render a Wyeth painting, perhaps Christina's World, in speech. It sounds, inside the cracked gray walls under a north light, like a convocation of drugged parakeets.

title: 3 Road Races Scheduled For Central Park in January
description: The Road Runners Club, with the cooperation of New York City Department of Recreation, has scheduled three road runs for January.

title: Moliere Wins, Mary Loses
description: YOU have until the matinee of Jan. 21 to catch up with Moliere's Don Juan, which is sharing the Lyceum stage these days and nights with The Great God Brown. Holidays or no holidays, repertory or no repertory, you'd be a fool to miss it.

title: Art Notes
description: SAM FRANCIS, not exact ly a troper toward the spotlight, was in town for a look at his Whit ney Museum retrospective and back in his native Cali fornia before you could say Untitled, the title of a number of Francis paintings.

title: 4 Universities Plan To Create Courses About FundRaising
description: A new program to develop fundraising as a profession and train people in fundraising for Jewish communal agencies is being organized jointly at four schools Yeshiva University's Wurzweiler School of Social Work, Brandeis University's Florence Heller Graduate School for Advanced Studies in Social Welfare, the University of Maryland's School of Social Work and Community Planning, and Case Western Reserve Uni versity's School of Applied So cial Sciences.

title: The World
description: Annie's Bar is on the fringes of the Protestant sector of Northern Ire land's second largest city, London derry, but it is frequented mostly by Roman Catholics. Last Wednesday night it was packed with customers watching a soccer game on television when two masked gunmen burst in and sprayed the crowd with machine gun fire. Four customers died instant ly, another later. All but one were Catholics.

title: Metropolitan Bronze Horse Proves to Be Ancient
description: The Metropolitan Museum's famous bronze horse, which the museum's vice director for op erations, Joseph Noble, dra matically designated as a 20th century fraud and forgery in 1967, has been declared an Irrefutably genuine work of antiquity by four Metropoli tan experts and will soon be put back on exhibition. Once known as one of the finest bronzes of classical Greece, the sculpture was taken off dis play in 1961 for routine study purposes.

title: SECRECY IS TIGHT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Dec. 24Heavy Amer ican bombing of North Vietnam continued for a seventh day to day while the United States military command drew even tighter its curtain of secrecy over the operation.

title: Airport Reported Hard Hit
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 23 A flight that was to have brought Soviet Cosmonaut Ger man Titov to Hanoi and to have departed with four Americans who have been there for the past week has been postponed.

title: CELTICS DEFEATED BY BUCKS, 104 TO 98
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 23 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks, fired by a fight between Bob Dand ridge and Boston's Dave Cow ens, rolled up a 21point lead and held off a strong Celtics' comeback for a 10498 victory tonight. John Havlicek and Jol Jo White paced Boston's rally, which twice cut Milwaukee's lead to 2 points.

title: One Hearing Slated By the City Council
description: Because of the holidays only one public hearing by the City Council is scheduled for this week at City Hall.

title: New York
description: Grain by grain, ounce by ounce, on rare occasions pound by pound, the heroin and cocaine had been taken from the junkies and dealers of Harlem, the south Bronx and Bedford Stuyve sent. The cost of the operationmeas ured in blood, pain and even in the salaries of the thousands of policemen assigned to narcotics during the last decadewas incalculable.

title: Art
description: THE Sam Francis retro spective, which is cur rently at the Whitney Museum of American Art (through Jan. 14), is the first major exhibition of the artist's work to come to New York. There has been no shortage of gallery exhibitions of the artist's workthe latest is running concurrently at Andre Em merich's but New York's museums can certainly not be accused of any haste in mounting a large survey of his accomplishment. The cur rent show was organized by Robert T. Buck Jr., for the AlbrightKnox Art Gallery in Buffalo, and comes to. New York as part of a national tour. Mr. Buck is also re sponsible for the catalogue, which contains a good deal of useful information and many plates along with a heavy admixture of uncriti cal praise.

title: Theory Holds That Sun's Cycles May Account for the Ice Ages
description: Although the sun has shone steadfastly throughout recorded history, it may in fact be a variable star whose cyclic be havior accounts for the ice ages, according to a theory dis cussed here Friday by leading astrophysicists.

title: TV, or Not TV?
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 23 (AP)An instant television re play of the unusual scoring play that gave. Pittsburgh a 137 victory over Oakland today was not used by the ref eree in making his decision, that the play was legal, said the National Football League's executive director.

title: Wings at Ranges Today
description: The Detroit Red Wings make their first New York visit of the season this afternoon to meet the Rangers at Madison Square Garden. Game time is 1:05. It is the first Sunday matinee of the season at the Garden.

title: Storer Building Dynasty For U.C.L.A. in Soccer
description: A group of Ethiopians at the University of California, Los Angeles is determined to bring as much soccer fame to the Bruins as the Walton Gang in basketball, but Howard Univer sity, Cornell and St. Louis Uni versity have other ideas, es pecially The Killer at How ard.

title: Setting the Stage for Trade Talks
description: GENEVA  Sometime next year, the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, the in ternational fairtrade charter known as GATT, will become the center of a new mound of negotiations to liberalize world trade.

title: GIFTS FROM AFAR AID THE NEEDIEST
description: Checks from former New Yorkers now living in distant places were recorded yesterday by the New York Times Needi est Cases Fund.

title: Dr. Paul Brodsky Weds Miss Ferguson
description: LAWRENCE, L.I., Dec. 23 Miss Carole Jane Ferguson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rob ert S. Ferguson of Woodmere, was married here tonight to Dr. Paul David Brodsky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brod sky of Flushing, Queens. Rabr bi Abram Vossen Goodman performed the ceremony at Temple Sinai of Long Island.

title: Arch of Triumph, U.S. Style
description: SEVERAL cities west of the Alle ghenies insist they are the Gate way to the West. The title has been claimed by Pittsburgh, Chi cago, Cincinnati, Louisville, Sioux City. But St. Louis is where the formal transfer of the vast. Louisiana territory from France to the United States took place, opening the way to westward expansion. And it is St. Louis that was the starting point the same year, 1804, for the exploration of the territory by Meriwether Lewis and William Clark.

title: Deborah Stephen Wed to Bennett Green
description: AUBURN, N. Y., Dec. 23 Miss Deborah Lynn Stephen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur E. Stephen of Auburn, was married here this eve ning to Bennett Donald Green, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Green of West Hemp stead, L. I. Rabbi Bernard Bloom performed the cere mony at the Springside Inn.

title: Karen A. McBrien To Wed in August
description: CLIFTON PARK, N. Y., Dec. 23The engagement of Miss Karen Anne McBrien to James David Burchetta, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph L. Burchetta of Carmel, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William F. McBrien Jr. of Clifton Park.

title: John Wynne Weds Susan S. Snodgrass
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Dec. 23 Miss Susan Stribling Snod grass, daughter of Capt. C. Stribling Snodgrass Jr., U.S.N., and Mrs. Snodgrass of Virginia Beach, was married here tonight to John Oliver Wynne, son of Mr. and Mrs. Oliver Wynne Jr. of Norfolk.

title: Television
description: All week long on Sixth Avenue, where the giant TV networks live, there was much anger and not a little panic. The ceasefire between the Nixon Administration and the televi sion industry  declared during the election campaign  had been abrupt ly terminated on Monday noon.

title: Brooklyn Routs Yeshiva
description: Brooklyn College won its ninth game in 11 starts by crushing Yeshiva University, 7039, last night in the winners' gym. Ed Middleton paced the Kingsmen with 22 points and 15 rebounds.

title: Which America?
description: In the same week that American astronauts fired their spacecraft home from the moon, American pilots fired bombs that broke through the heavens over a peasant nation in Asia. America the ingenious and America the vengeful had both struck.

title: the traveler's world
description: PATERSON, N.J., is not the last place in the world you would send a traveler seeking the beau ties of nature but it ranks pretty far down the list, farther than it should, for deep in the shabby heart of Paterson there thunders the Passaic River Falls.

title: New Novel
description: The ears of the jungle are a sophisticated network of sen sors designed by the American forces to pick up the sounds of truck convoys on the Ho Chi Minh Trail. But the foreign devils have reckoned without the resourcefulness of Aunt Ngha, the intelligence chief for Uncle Ho, President of the Democratic Republic of North Vietnam.

title: NIXON AND KISSINGER TIME'S MEN OF YEAR
description: President Nixon and Henry Kissinger, national security ad viser, have been chosen by Time magazine as its Men of the Year.

description: To the Editor:

title: CITY JAIL SCORED ON TRANQUILIZERS
description: Two Bronx Officials yester day criticized as unregulated and slipshod the manner in which more than a dozen vari eties of tranquilizers were le gally dispensed to many in mates at the Bronx House of Detention and called for an in vestigation of allegations by inmates that narcotics are illegally available in the facil ity.

title: Art Notes
description: THE two shows of new realist art currently at the New York Cul tural Center  The Realist Revival, put togeth er by Scott Burton, and Realism Now, organized by Mario Amayahave already been reviewed on this page by Hilton Kramer. The extraordinary measure of a second review is justified, I think, by the fact that the issues raised by these shows are extraordinarily numer ous, thorny and interesting. Moreover, some time may pass before a better occa sion presents itself for hav ing one's own say about the nowrampant realist re vival.

title: Lynn Golden Betrothed To Edward I. Dolnick
description: LOOKOUT MOUNTAIN, Tenn., Dec. 23Mr. and Mrs. A. William Holmberg Jr. of Scenic Highway, Lookout Mountain, have announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Lynn Iphi gene Golden, to Edward Ishmael Dolnick of Marble head, Mass. Miss Golden and Mr. Dolnick are juniors at Brandeis University, His parents are Dr. and Mrs. Arthur Aaron Dolnick of Marblehead.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: John Robert Meyer, 45 years old, of 445 Humphrey Street in New Haven, is an economist. He is a professor at Yale, a member of a goodly number of learned societies, director of a few large cor porations, and  most im portantpresident of the Na tional Bureau of Economic Research.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters: Fare Is Foul
description: From the very beginning of Mary Rubinstein's article (How Fair a Fare, Travel Section, Nov. 26), I knew he was doomed. I have worked as an air line reservations agent and I could see that he was chasing his tail. What he could not have known was that no one he spoke to on the phone had any power whatsoever to grant his wish. The giants with the authority to ac tually change or waive rules are inac cessible to customer and agent alike.

description: Investors and stockbrokers inevitably talk about tax selling and tax losses at this time of year. Indeed, such trading can have an im pact on yearend stock mar kets  and on the taxes in vestors pay.

title: Art
description: THE southern corner of Central Park West and 77th Street, with the Museum of Nat ural History on its northern extremity, is hardly so removed from the centers of New York life that you have to get there by dog??ed carrying emergency rations of pemmi can But you would think it was if you took a survey of local artlovers to discover when they had last visited the NewYork Historical So ciety, which is at that location.

title: Sao Paulo Cleric Expresses Worry On Rising Crime
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Dec. 21 The true spirit of Christmas has been disfigured in this cruel city, according to the Archbishop of Sao Paulo.

title: White House Silent
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 23Gerald Warren, the deputy White House press secretary when asked tonight about the ABC report of charges by Xuan Thuy, said: We'll have no comment on that.

title: Why is it the most popular 90 minutes in nighttime TV?
description: Voice Over: From New Hope, Pennsylvania, soap ball capital of the worldit's the Johnny Jack Show! Johnny's guests to night are Joan of Arc, Michel angelo, Dick Burbage, and Judas Iscariot, author of How To Live Forever on Thirty Pieces of Silver. And now  heeeeere's Johnny!

title: Colorado Court Closes Data On Vital Statistics to Public
description: DENVER, Dec. 23 (AP) The Colorado Court of Appeals has ruled that state vital sta tistics records of births and deaths are not open to the pub lic.

title: More than 50,000 Americans killed in Vietnam, more than 300,000 wounded or injured, more than 1,600 P.O.W.'s or M.I.A.'s
description: The issue generates strong emotions across the country. How, some ask, can amnesty be offered to those who fled when others fought? But, others assert, how can amnesty not be offered to those who were right about the war before the rest of us?

title: Music
description: THIS is a piece about a third music theater. It is not going to be an easy article to write because this kind of music theaterneither opera nor musicalis in the process of finding itself; it is the works that define the genre, not the other way around.

title: Life was no joke with this funny man
description: By Arthur Marx. Illustrated. 357 pp. New York: David McKay Co. $7.95.

title: Stone Linked to Grave Of Discoverer on Coast
description: MENLO PARK, Calit., Dec. 23A crudely inscribed stoat that may have marked the grave of Juan Rodriguez Ca brillo, known as the dis coverer of California, has been found by a University of California anthropologist.

title: First L.I.R.R. Strike Aid Is Sent Out
description: The 5,000 striking employes of the Long Island Rail Road began receiving checks yester day under the Railway Retire ment Act, and next Thursday the striking carmen expect to get allowances for picketing duties to tide them over the Christmas and New Year holi days.

title: While Husband Is Collecting Art, She Makes Own
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  When Mrs. Joseph Hirsh horn, wife of the multimil lionaire financier and art col lector, was at the Hirshhorn place on the California de sert near Palm Springs  It was actually at La Quinta  she eventually became bored with playing tennis.

title: ORT PLANS STUDY ON SCHOOL IN U.S.
description: A team of experts who will study the possibility of estab lishing a vocational training school for povertystricken and unskilled American Jews is be ing sent to tile United States from Geneva by ORT, the or ganization that has carried out similar programs for Jews the world over.

description: ROME, Dec. 23 (UPI)Pope Paul VI expressed his sorrow to the victims of the Nicaraguan earthquake today in a cable to the Archbishop of Managua.

title: Vermont Letter: Glad You're Not Here
description: SOMEWHERE IN VERMONTIt is mid winter; the sun rises high. There is no rush at dawn to start a stubborn car coughing in the cold, no forest of ski poles to fall over on the way to the back door, no bumper to bumper trip over icy roads to the base lodge. Midwinter in skiless Vermont.

title: TV Mailbag
description: If The Man Who Came to Dinner was not the suc cess it should have been blame should not be Iaid at the door of Orson Welles Blame director Buzz Kulik for the camera plotting; blame producers Bill Persky and Sain Denoff for updating the George S. KaufmanMoss Hart play, and blame the Hall mark Hall of Fame's idiot habit of squeezing threeact plays into less than 90min ute time slots (Look Home ward, Angel and Inherit the Wind were similarly crippled). Obviously with such treatment, it's unlikely the play will be wellserved.

description: And Other Stories. By Dalton Trevisan. Translated from the Portuguese by Gregory Rabassa. 267 pp. New York: Alfred A. Knopf. $7.95.

title: Fireman Slain by Robber
description: MICHIGAN CITY, Ind., Dec. 23 (AP)A Michigan City fire man who would have retired after today's shift was shot to death early this morning in a tavern robbery. Capt. Russ Pleus, 57 years old, was fatally shot when he apparently recog nized one of two robbers who entered the tavern, where he was sitting with friends. The gunmen then robbed patrons and the bartender of $380.

title: The Nation
description: A prominent civil liberties lawyer recently raised an uncharacteristic ob jection about the search procedures prior to a flight that he was about to take: he complained that the searches were not thorough enough. In the conflict between the threat to his own personal safety that a highjacking might entail, he was will ing to see the Constitution's restriction on unreasonable searches bent a bit.

title: Elizabeth Preis, L.S. Drivier Jr. Plan Marriage
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Preis of Forest Hills Gardens, Queens, and Candlewood Knolis, Conn., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Jean Preis, to Lawrence Sebastian Driever Jr., Slaty of Mr. and Mrs. Driever of Upper Montclair, N. J.

description: Critics call it Greenberg's Folly, but other horsemen refer to it fondly as a Golden Chariot, a Magic Single or, simply, The Bike.

title: Music
description: THIS being Christmas Eve and the season stressing peace on earth, it seems appropriate to dwell briefly on an excursion into international friendship in which music is the medium. The story goes back to 1968, the year Harry Morgan fell in love with Czechoslovakia. He kept going back there. Czech friends who were interested in American music, in its Broadway, folk and jazz manifestations, suggested he bring over some American high school and college kids who could perform. No one knew where the money would come from.

title: Pont Leaves Indiana Post To Coach at Northwestern
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Dec 23 John Pont, head football coach at Indiana University, has agreed to become head foot ball coach at Northwestern University, it was announced today.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23The State Department has recom mended the virtual elimination of the Defense Department's role in pacification efforts in South Vietnam.

title: Chicago Tribune Changes
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23 (UPI)  William Jones, a Pulitzer Prize winning reporter, has been named city editor of The Chi cago Tribune, Clayton Kirkpat rick, the newspaper's editor, an nounced yesterday. Mr. Kirkpat rick also announced the ap pointment of Casey lianas as Sunday city editor and Neil Mehler as political editor of The Tribune. Mr. Jones, 33 years old, won a Pulitzer Prize in 1971 for a series of articles on ambulance company abuses.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 23 (UPI)Phil Hankinson scored 17 points and Ron Haigler 16 tonight as unbeaten Pennsyl vania rolled to its fifth straight victory, defeating a crosstown rival Temple, 5944.

description: Once upon a time, my daughters, there was a boy who beheld the earth with a wonder much like yours.

description: I can't believe its Christ mas, said Max Feltz, as sistant superintendent of the Forest Hills Post Office. Eight of his people were working the counters taking care of fairly long lines of people who wanted to buy stamps or mail parcels. But apparently it was nothing compared to what it once was.

description: WEST CALDWELLFrom sunset on during the Yule tide season, New Jersey is a fantasy of color and light. From Sussex County to the tip of Cape May, floating an gels bear glittering trumpets aloft, reindeer twinkle their way across the sky and me dieval minstrels pluck at lute and lyre in shimmering gold and silver against a darken ing sky.

title: Writers Honor Pellagrini
description: BOSTON, Dec. 23 (AP) Eddie Pellagrini, who broke in at shortstop with the Boston Red Sox in 1946, will receive the Sox's alumnus award at the 34th annual dinner of the Boston Baseball Writers on Jan. 25 at the StatlerHilton Hotel.

title: Blues Rout Flyers, 61
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 23 (UPI) Gary Sabourin scored two goals and assisted on a third tonight to lead the St. Louis Blues to a 61 triumph over the Philadel phia Flyers.

title: Ma Bell
description: Since 1970, the New York City resident's average monthly telephone bill has gone up by more than 22 per centfrom $12.60 to $15.40. The latest increase came last February, in the midst of the President's price stabilization program, when the New York Telephone Company won a $160 million rate increaseand raised the hackles of many a phone user.

title: To salvage troubledarkened lives.
description: Johnny G. is 9, Phillip F. 11, and William T. 14. Despite the difference in their ages, they have much in common. All come from neighborhoods where pov erty, violence and despair are part of everyday reality; the schools they at tend are chaotic, and none of them lives with his real parents. Although they receive good care in foster homes, where they were placed by the Brooklyn Bu reau of Community Service, this has not been enough to erase bitter memo ries, a sense of isolation, hidden fears.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  The airline passenger who pictures himself as a man about town and a sophisticated air traveler may be a Putorius foetidus to the airline stewardess. That's a polecat.

title: New Novel
description: Just as the distillers tooled up before Prohibition was re pealed, so Madison Avenue might hot up an ad campaign for marijuana before it is legal ized. This assumption is the basis for a set of mock blue prints detailing the production and promotion of a commercial weed grown secretly in Mon tepo Bay and known by the code name of C900. After dis carding 22 other brandname possibilities like Head Start and Top (Pot spelled back ward), Mike Evans and his creative group at Morton, Keyes & Cooper decide on Acapulco Gold and are off to spend the client's money.

description: DEARBORN, Mich., Dec. 23 (AP)A film on one of the more successful rehabili tation programs for drinking drivers in the nation is avail able for release to television stations and citizens groups, the Ford Motor Company has announced.

title: Revised Vote Totals Give Nixon 18 Million Margin
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP) A revision in the certified vote totals of two states to day gave President Nixon a final margin of nearly 18 mil lion votes in his landslide re election.
