description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP)  The Heisman Foundation will be established in Wash ington to sponsor and award college scholarships to high school students who have dis tinguished themselves through athletic achievements, academ ic skills and civic contributions.

title: Gloom at Turtle Bay
description: The 27th session of the United Nations General As sembly ended as it began, on a note of despair voiced by the Assembly President over the persisting war Southeast Asia. That intransigent conflict undermines the principles and purposes of a world organization that was created to preserve the peace and is a major cause of its dangerously diminished prestige.

title: She almost always gave her best performances offstage
description: The people who gave that wonderful party for Cole Porter last year are back again this holiday season to give another one for Tallulah Bankhead. Brendan Gill has again written the text. Holt, Rinehart & Win ston has published it in the same format, at the same $25 price. But this time the party is a bust. For one thing, in spite of an extended narrative and many illustrations, the guest of hon or never really shows up. Which is just like Tallulah, As Brooks Atkinson once wrote, she al most always gave her best per formances offstage.

title: Reporting From Paris
description: The great sociopolitical crisis of the season developed rapidly after the dean of the faculty of medicine at Peucdan (IleetVilaine) dis patched a letter to this newspaper warning the public that the wrong enzyme is being used in the manu facture of noodles. It so happens that boiled noodles served in a pool of tepid water, sprinkled with grated cheese, constitutes the evening meal of some 78 per cent of all residents in this gastronomicallyminded capi tal. Many persons, therefore, were directly concerned by the dean's cry of alarm. As this wrong enzyme is soluble in cold water, the dean ad vised soaking or washing noodles before cooking them. (Boiling solidi fies the enzyme and makes it un pleasant.) Rats, hamsters and tor toises fed unwashed noodles for sup per lost their sparkle and leadership qualities, whereas mice, pigs and squirrels fed on washed noodles lost their teeth.

title: Miss Miller Is Betrothed
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 23 Wayne D. Miller, general manager of the Milwaukee Country Club, and Mrs. Mil ler have annouced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Carole J. Miller, to Ber tram F. French, executive vice president of Cushman & Wakefield, Inc., realtors in New York. He is the son of Mrs. Edith S. French of New York and Southampton, L.I., and the late Charles F. French. The wedding is planned for the middle of next month.

title: N. C. State Triumphs
description: ATHENS, Ga., Dec. 23 (AP) A sophomore, Terry Thomp son, scored 26 points and Tom Burleson added 24 to lead fourthranked North Carolina State to a 9783 victory over Georgia tonight. It was unbeat en North Carolina State's eighth victory and Georgia's first defeat after two triumphs.

title: TECHNICAL TALKS BREAK OFF IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Dec. 23A meeting of delegates who are assigned to discuss technical aspects of the Vietnam peace negotiations was adjourned abruptly today.

title: TV Mailbag
description: The abortion episode on Maude was a pleasure to watch and listen to and a bit of relief in a time of an in credibly large quantity of incredibly lowquality Ty programs. In a time when people can be only too seri ous over issues, I'd probably flip out without laughter and so would many others. I say, on with the show.

title: Youths Rejecting Heroin, But Turn to Other Drugs
description: A combination of lawen forcement pressttres, therapeu tic efforts, differing rates of availability of certain drugs and subtle changes in community moods and youthful fads ap pears to have slowed the spread of heroin addiction in New York.

title: DROP IN HIJACKINGS REPORTED BY VOLPE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23In a review of the accomplish ments of the Department of Transportation in 1972, John A. Volpe, the outgoing Secre tary, said this week that suc cessful hijackings of United States aircraft were reduced from 83 per cent in 1969 to 32 per cent in 1972. Forty planes were hijacked in 1969 and 31 in 1972.

title: A Bit of Yule Cheer At State Institutions
description: TRENTON  The melodic strains of Feliz Navidad echoed through the bleak cor ridors of New Jersey's prisons last week, as officials tried to provide some Christmas cheer for inmates.

title: Battle Looms for Yachtsman of Year
description: News of Boating

title: They'll Run for Money
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 The spotlight will be on the runners, not the passers in tomorrow's National Confer ence playoff game here be tween the Washington Red skins and Green Bay Packers.

title: Hog Prices Reach Record, Portending Consumer Rise
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23  In the long history of this nation, no common hog ever brought a price as high as was paid Thursday at the stockyards in Peoria.

title: Italian Law Would Treat Addictions as a Sickness
description: ROME, Dec. 23 (Reuters) The Italian Government has ap proved a law under which drug addicts would be treated as sick people rather than crim inals.

title: Quarterback Comes Off Bench to Throw for Two Late Tallies
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 On the strength of two touch down passes in the last 90 sec onds by Roger Staubach, who came off the bench late in the third quarter, the Dallas Cow boys defeated the San Fran cisco 49ers today, 3028, and refused to be dethroned as champions of the National Football League for at least an other week.

title: Olympics
description: In the mind of Mrs. Olga Connolly, as she held the American flag as high as I could, the 20th Olympic Games were a symbol of brotherhood and peace.

title: RESTLESS JET, $10.20, TRIUMPHS AT CALDER
description: MIAMI, Dec. 23 (AP)Elk wood Farm's Restless Jet won the $20,000added Miami Beach Handicap today by half a length at Tropical Park's meet ing at Calder Race Course.

title: Shivers by Shaffer
description: ANTHONY SHAFFER, the, mischie vous British author who gave Al fred Hitchcock a large hand in chilling us in Frenzy and mystified us so niftily with both the stage and film versions of Sleuth," is determined to have us biting our nails once again. He has just joined producer Samuel Goldwyn Jr. in Hollywood and is probably at this very moment, dis cussing how he will bring Goldwyn's Goshawk Squadronbased on Derek Robinson's spinetingling novel about the perilous exploits of a band of World War I Royal Air Force pilotsto the screen.

title: Steeler Touchdown With 5 Seconds Left Is Confirmed by TV
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 23Tele vision helped decide a pro foot ball game today, the cameras reenforcing a decision made on the field by the referee about a 60yard touchdown play that won the game for the Pittsburgh Steelers over the Oakland Raiders, 137, with five seconds left.

title: Reports by Soviet Indicate A Wide Lag in Production
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 23Official reports on the Soviet economy made public this week have indicated an acrosstheboard slowdown in areas ranging from consumer goods to high priority industries such as oil and gas, which are some of the nation's major earners of for eign exchange.

title: SUIT SEEKS TO VOID MAINE ABORTION LAW
description: AUGUSTA, Maine, Dec. 23 (AP)  A Bangor woman and a Bar Harbor physician have filed a suit in United States District Court in Portland to overturn Maine's abortion law.

title: Quake Hits Hawaii
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 23 (AP) A small earthquake tremor shook much of Hawaii today, causng minor glass breakage. A spokesman for the volcano observatory said the tremor had occurred about six miles be neath the village of Captain Cook on Hawaii Island's west ern coast. It registered 4.8 on the Richter scale. The only damage was reported in the immediate area of the earth quake where glass items tum bled from shelves.

title: Which Should You See?
description: IN the last seven days, 18 new films have opened. On the outside chance that not everyone will want to see all of them, I offer the following as a sort of consumer's guide to some of them this being the time of year when, ac cording to statisticians, even people who never go to movies go at least once. The order in which the films are listed is more or less the order in which they opened in New York:

title: New Concorde Due
description: PARIS, Dec. 23 (AP)  The fourth FrenchBritish Concorde supersonic jet airliner will go into service early in January, the French builders have an nounced. They said the latest model would emit less smoke and noise than the earlier Con cordes.

title: Carol Jean Hehre Is the Bride Of Lieut. Walter Scott Slocum
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 23  Miss Carol Jean Hehre, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Frederick William Hehre of Hamden, was married here this noon to Lieut. Walter Scott Slocum, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Ware Slocum of Gladwyne, Pa.

title: Release of Klansman, Jailed for Killing Black Leader, Is Decried in Mississippi
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss., Dec. 23 Gov. William L. Waller has angered many blacks and some whites in Mississippi by releas ing from the state penitentiary a Ku Klux Klansman convicted of murdering a black leader here in 1966.

title: SERVICES BELIEVE DISCIPLINE HOLDS
description: Discipline in the United States armed forces remains ef fective despite the impact of hundreds of thousands of volun teers from what military men regard as a permissive society and widespread reforms in military life, officers and non commissioned officers assert.

title: Open Holiday Festival Opens Here Tuesday
description: Who do you likeMichi gan, because of its 61 won lost record and its super players, Henry Wilmore and Campy Russell? Villanova, which opened with five straight victories? Tennessee, a challenger for the South eastern Conference title? Maybe South Carolina, since its coach, Frank McGuire, is a New, Yorker and so are most of the Gamecocks? Grambling because you are a Knick fan and Willis Reed attended college there?

title: NATIONALISTS WIN IN TAIWAN VOTING
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 23 The governing Nationalist party won nearly all the contested seats in national and local leg islative elections today but sev eral of its nominees were de feated by critics of the Govern ment running as independents.

title: New Round of Cairo Diplomacy To End Mideast Conflict Seen
description: CAIRO, Dec. 23  Recent statements by Egyptian offi cials and publicists have been interpreted by foreign diplo mats here as an effort to pre pare the Egyptian public for another round of diplomatic maneuvering to end the Middle Eastern conflict.

title: A Queens Toy Plant Looks to Christmas 1973
description: Christmas decorations gar land the singlefamily homes in the Queens neighborhood and the glow of anticipa tion of tomorrow's surprises shines on children's faces, forming a counterpoint to their parents' relief that the last day of shopping has passed.

title: PENSION BENEFITS AND COSTS TO RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI) The first 1973 paychecks of American workers will contain a note from the Government explaining that their takehome pay is smaller because of high er deductions for Social Secur ity65 cents more for each $100 of your wages.

title: Klein Fights Urban Tide
description: Winding up his first year as Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein said last week that his major goal for the next three years would be to slow the tide of urban ization sweeping in from New York City and Nassau County.

title: Hanoi Says Friedheim Lied
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 23 (AP)The Hanoi radio said today that the American De fense Department spokesman, Jerry W. Friedheim, was lying when he said that American bombers were not targeting any areas in which the Penta gon believed that United States prisoners of war were being held.

title: Pilgrim or tourist: The Hunger Remains
description: A YEAR or two ago a trendy under graduate at Cambridge suggested that the King's College Chapel should be knocked down because it wasn't of use to anyone. Outrage was the natural response. But outrage aside (and he probably cared more about destroying academic smugness and smug academics than the chapel itself) he touched a raw wound.

title: Jane Claytor Is Betrothed
description: ROANOKE, Va., Dec. 23 Miss Jane Gordon Claytor plans to be married in the summer to Samuel Johnson Webster, a mathematics teacher at the R. C. Lee High School in New Haven.

title: Religion
description: The image of the American nun has changed in recent years. For example, Roman Catholics have become accus tomed to seeing nuns in picket lines. Now, if a situation in Texas is a har binger, nuns may soon be seen in picket lines at welfare offices as well.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  With discreet tenacity, the Na tional Commission on Produc tivity is trying to nudge busi ness, government and labor to change some of their cost lier ways.

title: That Holy Night
description: Now we come to the festival of the Nativity, and all over this country, over much of the world, are the glow and glitter of holiday, the trappings of festivity, the tokens of friendship and goodwill, the innocent trust of childhood. Of all our holidays, this one lies, somehow, closest to the heart, wreathed in the warmest emotions.

title: Starting all over
description: LONDON: She rises in the dawn darkness. Quickly, she puts on her sari and a sweater and then walks into the kitchen to heat up a kettle for tea. By 7 A.M. she steps into the two bedrooms and living room on Thurlby Road, flicking on the lights and murmuring: Utho  Utho  wake up . . Utho, Her husband and six of her seven children wake up and rapidly dress. Mrs. Kasumben Rao returns to the kitchen to warm herself and prepare purl fried whole wheat bread, for the family.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 23 Claude S. Brinegar would like to have people stop referring to him as a big oilman and think of him as an economist and management specialist whose credentials entitle hint to be called Dr. Brinegar, or even professor.

title: Sag Harbor: A Suspense Setting
description: SAG HARBOR L. I. It is small wonder that Velda Johnston, a mystery writer, has used this former whaling village as the setting of her latest novel, The Late Mrs. Fonsell.

title: Australia Swelters at 104
description: SYDNEY, Dec. 23 (AP)Aus tralians prepared for Christmas today as the temperature soared to 104 in downtown Sydney. Six major brushfires raged in the eastern part of the country and two infants were reported killed in a fourdayold heat wave.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISNumerous words are ap plied to, groups of differing species including a school of fish, an ostenta tion of peacocks, a pride of lions, a swarm of bees and a shrewdness of apes. In considering the contemporary Kissinger Phenomenonwhich exists in other countries besides the United StatesI have decided that perhaps the most apt word applicable to this particular species is shrewdness; not because they are in any way apish but they have to be unusually astute.

title: And Then There Were None
description: The war on Southeast Asia and the ecology crisis recall our coun try's formative experience destroy ing native Americans, or children of nature as they used to be called. History written from present con cerns can distort the past, but it can also, as Wilbur Jacobs and Vir gil Vogel show, help make the past accessible. Jacob's essays draw mainly on northern, colonial frontier experience. His best reflect a deep understanding of the ecological, eth nohistorical character of the white Indian struggle, and are powerful indeed. Jacobs's Dispossessing the American Indian is written from the perspective of nature, Vogel's This Country Was Ours from that of radical politics. Vogel's source ma terial and commentary, marred only by a weak, final catchall section, provide one of the best available in troductions to the entire sweep of whiteIndian history.

title: World News Briefs
description: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 23  Two helicopters to day picked up the remaining eight persons from the site of a plane wreckage high in the frozen Andes where 16 sur vivors had clung to life with meager rations.

title: Recordings
description: IN the case of a musical work as mammoth as Wagner's Der Ring des Nibelungen, we almost take it for granted that the availability of assorted re cordings is a Good Thing. When the first integral Ring on disksGeorg Solti's dy namic, richly contrasted, gen erally well sung, and sumptu ously recorded cyclewas Completed in 1966, we were grateful enough; it had been a long time coming. Since then, the sleek Karajan set, With its emphasis on velvety sonorities, has offered a pal pably different but obviously thoughtful alternative view, and the dimsounding, imper fectly played 1953 Italian radio performances resurrect ed by Seraphim earlier this Shear enable us at least to in fer the breadth and Weight of Wilhelm Furtwnglees leg endary conception.

title: College Basketball
description: The University of California, Los Angeles was the host team at the Na tional championships and the guests went away with hangovers.

title: CRACK RULER WINS IN MUD AT LAUREL
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 23 (AP) Crack Ruler, a courageous 8yearold, defeated seven ri vals at Laurel Race Course to day in winning the $23,950 Monumental Handicap.

title: CHRISTOPHER SINGS IN MET'S SIEGFRIED
description: Add the name of Russell Christopher to the list of Amer ican singers who are starting to get their second wind at the Metropolitan Opera. Mr. Chris topher came to the company in 1963 as a winner of the National Council auditions, but he has rarely been able to press beyond minor roles like Yama dori in Butterfly, Sciarrone in Tosca and the Wigmaker in Ariadne.

title: Letters to the Editor.
description: That was an excellent arti cle on the pigeon problem [Pigeons Seize a Balcony and Gain a Foe, Dec. 10]. I live opposite the planetarium. Thomas J. Dalton, a wonder ful man, tried for years to get the city to clean out the dangerous nests of parasite ridden pigeon feces under the airconditioners at the win dows of the museum. He tried to get money to trap the hun dreds of pigeons who befoul the grounds right where the children come to play and eat their lunch, and old people sit on the benches. The old and the young are vulnerable to pigeon diseases, as well as to the parasites in the dogfeced ground. At night the rats come out looking for food so we have a nice hosting all around.

title: Saigon Still Demanding Hanoi Pullout, Aide Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 23Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam reiterated today his Gov ernment's demand that all North Vietnamese troops must be withdrawn from South Vietnam before a peace accord would be acceptable to Saigon.

title: Dita Beard Reassigned To Sales Research Job
description: DENVER, Dec. 23 (AP) Dita Beard, the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation lobbyist who was a central figure in a Senate subcommittee investi gation earlier this year, con firmed yesterday that I.T.T. had reassigned her to sales research.

title: Trenton Awaits 2 Major Rulings
description: TRENTON  Conventional political wisdom in New Jersey would have the Gov ernor and both major parties assume a low legislative pro file in an election year, but there were clear signs this weekend that the 1973 ses sion of the Legislature may be forced to deal with a number of highly controver sial issues.

title: Press and Court
description: WASHINGTONThe Government's case against seven men charged with illegal eavesdropping on the offices of the Democratic National Committee re lies greatly on the testimony of an eyewitness named Alfred C. Bald win 3d.

title: 72 MISS REBOUND SCORES BY A NECK
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 23 Moving into the lead from the outside leaving the backstretch, Donald R. Bailey's Miss Re bound went on to score a neck victory today in the fourth run ning of the $28,500 Poquessing Handicap at Liberty Bell Park.

title: Jacksonville Stops Furman
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 23 (AP)  Jacksonville University downed 16thranked Furman, 8666, tonight.

title: Said JeanPierre Gorin: We have no answers. Said friend JeanLuc Godard: Only questions.
description: JeanLuc Godard sat in the warm sun outside Alice Tully Hall in Lincoln Center, playing chess with his friend, JeanPierre Gorin. Godard bore little resemblance to photographs of the welldressed, sardonic young director who helped launch France's nouvelle vague a dozen years ago; he re sembled, instead, Peter Sellers por traying Kropotkin. He was unshaven, wearing soiled jeans and a fatigue jacket with the U.S. Army insignia ripped away. The fat Boyard cigarette harsh tobacco rolled in corn paper had gone out, but still dangled from his lips; he habitually smoothed strands of black hair over his bald spot and adjusted his ambertinted glasses.

title: Giants' Statistics Add Up to Good Year
description: The final statistics are in on the 1972 New York Giants, and an 86 wonlost record that would have been rated. glorious in the pa nicky atmosphere of last winter, is still pretty good now that it's been achieved.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Six Die in Collision in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 24 (AP) Six persons died yesterday in a headon truckcar collision be tween Jerusalem and. Tel Aviv.

title: British Amateurs To Box U.S. Team At Forum Jan. 15
description: Amateur boxing will be fea tured at the Felt Forum in Madison Square Garden on Jan. 15 when an 11man squad from Britain will oppose a squad from the United States.

title: MALCOLM MERRITT JR.
description: Malcolm Merritt Jr., editor of the American Newspaper Publishers Association's Re search Institute Bulletin, died Friday of lung cancer in Uni versity Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived here and in Easton, Pa.

title: She Teaches Others Who Are Blind to Run Their Homes Safely and Efficiently
description: WASHINGTON  Several years ago, when her sight began seriously failing, Mrs. Ernest Loeb almost served her family pineapplevege table soup for supper.

title: East German Trade Tie To Bonn Upsets E.E.C.
description: PARIS, Dec. 24Ten cases of ball bearings that a Swedish exporter sold to East Germany actually wound up in the Netherlands. The. Dutch were angered because they collected no duties, the shipment had come via Weft Germany, their partner in the Common Market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Services in Peking
description: PEKING, Monday, Dec. 25 (Reuters)Foreign residents in Peking joined Chinese Chris tians last night and early to day in the first Christmas services here for six years.

title: Bob Hope Performs For G.I.'s and Says It's His Final Tour.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 24  Bob Hope, a substitute Santa for two decades of G.I.'s, gave what he said was his last annual Christmas show in Viet nam today, adding that he had originally thought that he might be able to perform it in Hanoi for American prisoners.

title: Santa Anita Opens With King of Cricket Favored Tomorrow
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 24 (AP)Santa Anita's 36th and most lucrative horse racing sea son opens Tuesday for a 75day meet with $2,215,000 in prize money for 45 stakes races.

title: Truman Unconscious
description: Former President Harry S. Truman was unconscious and grew progressively weak er yesterday at a Kansas City hospital. Page 11.

title: Kings Down Sabres, 20
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif. Dec. 24 (UPI)  Mike Corrigan and Ralph Backstrorn scored in the second period last might as the Los Angeles Kings snapped a toutgame losing streak by blanking the Buffalo Sabres,20.

title: FIRE BOMB IGNITES AT GIMBELS EAST
description: An incendiary table tennis ball believed to have been plant ed by leftist activists ignited yesterday morning in Gimbels East at 125 East 86th Street, resulting in considerable dam age to the department store.

title: Nixon Ignores Protesters
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 24 (UPI)President Nixon ig nored antiwar demonstrators outside his vacation home today and settled down for a quiet holiday with his wife.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Maine Clam Industry Reported In a Recovery From Red Tide
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 24 Maine's clam industry has come back quite well, despite last fall's invasion by a minute marine organism known as the red tide, a spokesman for the Maine Sea and Shore Fisheries Department reports.

title: RESTAURANTS AIM TO BAR PRICE RISES
description: The executive vice president of the Restaurant League of New York says that most mem bers of the 90member organi zation will resist raising prices to meet higher costs resulting from recent contract settle ments with three labor unions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Quiet Crackdown by Navy Aimed at Dissident Blacks
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 24While attention has focused on in vestigations into racial inci dents, the Navy in recent weeks has quietly begun a crackdown on dissident black sailors.

title: No Room on the Bus
description: 'Twas the week before Christmas, and the driver the bus we had been waiting for in the rain took ad vantage of the fact that a bus of a different number was already parked at the stop. He passed us by. The next driver did let us in, but a few blocks up Madison Avenue engaged in a lengthy shouting match with a wouldbe passenger who stood six feet beyond the ill marked bus stop. You're not at a bus stop, he screamed through doors that were to remain shut; and the stranger could only surmise that for him there was no room on the bus.

title: Books of The Tines
description: HOW TO READ A BOOK. Revised and Updated Edition. By Mortimer J. Adler and Charles Van Doren. 426 pages. Simon & Schuster. $8.95.

title: CHRISTMAS OPERA IS SUNG AT HUNTER
description: The production of Humper dinck's Hansel and Gretel at Hunter College Saturday after noon provided a good deal of Christmas charm, and it was almost as interesting a concept as it was a performance.

title: A Political Backfire
description: News Analysis

title: 2 IN FOG JUST DROP IN ON SUSPICIOUS HOSTS
description: ENFIELD, Conn., Dec. 24 (AP)It was foggy aloft and we sighted a large open field and your buildings, thinking it was a school, explained the two balloonists who dropped in yesterday on the Osborne State Prison Farm.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Princeton University, one of the many universities that have been the scene of student pro test, is now facing an alumni assault.

title: Santa Anita Opens With King of Cricket Favored Tomorrow
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 24 (AP)Santa Anita's 36th and most lucrative horse racing sea son opens Tuesday for a 75day meet with $2,215,000 in prize money for 45 stakes races.

title: An American in Hanoi
description: Telford Taylor, the Colum bia professor who was chief United States prosecutor at Nuremberg, reports from Hanoi that essential services are being maintained despite the heavy bombing. His dis patch appears on Page 3.

title: Mrs. Meir to Visit France
description: JERUSALEM, Dec 24, (AP) Premier Golda Meir will visit France next month to attend a meeting of Socialist leaders and possibly to hold political talks that could help ease the five yearold strain In FrenchIsraeli relations. Mrs. Meir informed the Cabinet of her decision to day and it was then officially announced.

title: Financial Difficulties Confronting Kennedy Center
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24A sleigh filled with greenbacks would be a most appreciated gift for the Kennedy Center. the huge culture palace here whose financial problems ap pear as certain as death and taxes.

title: Quiet Crackdown by Navy Aimed at Dissident Blacks
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 24While attention has focused on in vestigations into racial inci dents, the Navy in recent weeks has quietly begun a crackdown on dissident black sailors.

title: Businesses and Markets Closed Today for Holiday
description: Most businesses, as well as securities and commodities markets, banks and government offices, will be closed today for the Christmas holiday and will reopen tomorrow.

title: CHARTER AWAITED IN PHILIPPINES
description: MANILA, Dec. 24Like Pres ident Ferdinand Marcos who is backing it, American business interests in the Philippines have a big stake in voter approval next Jan. 15 of the New Philip pines' constitution.

title: A Tale of Christmas Is Told in Oratorio At Judson Church
description: Al Carmines's Christmas Rappings employs an extraor dinary beautiful blend of folk simplicity and worldly sophisti cation to tell the story of Christmas according to the Gospels. Concluding its fourth annual season Saturday night at Judson Church, the produc tion sparkled and glittered with both familiar and new elements.

title: Southern Air Says Cuba Offers Return Of Hijacking Funds
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 24 (AP)  A Southern Airways spokes man said today that the air line had received an assur ance from the Cuban Govern ment that the $2million ran som the airline paid to three hijackers in November would be returned.

title: West Virginia Farmers Tighten Security Against Cattle Rustlers
description: CHARLES TOWN, W. Va., Dec. 24In West Virginia's eastern panhandle, less than 100 miles from the nation's capital, farmers are strengthening secur ity measures against gangs of rustlers who for three months have been stealing cattle at night.

title: Reno Player Is Honored
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 24 (UPI) Pete Padgett, a University of Nevada at Reno freshman, was named West Coast Athletic Conference player of the week today. Padgett, a 6foot8inch forward, scored, 47 points and grabbed 54 rebounds in three Wolfpack victories last week.

title: Rangers Shut Out Wings And Giacomin Gets Gift
Honey Jay's Finishing Kick Pays Off at Fair Grounds
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 24 (AP)  Honey Jay, running third with an eighth of a mile to go, closed with a rush and won the $15,000 Christmas Handicap by 2 lengths at the Fair Grounds today as the track resumed Sunday racing for the first time since 1940.

title: Japan Plans Pollution Fight
description: TOKYO, Dec. 24 (AP)Japa nese industries and the Gov ernment will spend at least $34.7billion in the next 10 years to combat pollution in Tokyo. Osaka, Nagoya and nine other major cities, Gov ernment officials have re ported. The officials said the 12 cities had submitted a plan of joint action by Government agencies and private corpora tions. Major targets are air pollution, contaminated water, excess noise, offensive odors and sinking of the ground.

title: Northern Ireland Is Quiet On 2d Day of Holiday Truce
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 24 (AP)The second day of a Christmas truce passed peacefully in Northern Ireland today, without a shot being fired or a bomb exploding by nightfall.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ... and Give Us Peace
description: Christmas is the most durable of holidays. It has de fied the spoilsports and the ideologues. Oliver Cromwell ordered the heathen practice banned and sent out town criers with the message: No Christmas! No Christmas! In the American colonies, too, the Puritans scorned the joyful revels and in 1659 passed a law imposing a fine of five shillings on anyone found observing any such day as Christmas . . . whether by forbearing labor, feasting, or any other way. . . . But in America as well as in England the edicts were quietly defied.

title: Watch This Tiger
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 24Nobody has accused Princeton of being a training ground for professional football players, but one member of the 1972 Tiger team is expected to be a high selection in the coming professional draft.

title: PRINCETON ALUMNI SCORE LIBERALISM
description: Princeton University, one of the many universities that have been the scene of student pro test, is now facing an alumni assault.

title: SHARKS HALT SKID, DEFEAT WHALERS
description: BOSTON, Dec. 24 (AP) Gary Veneruzzo and Mike Byers put in two goals apiece today as the Los Angeles Sharks whipped the New England Whalers, 53, in a World Hock ey Association game and halt ed a sixgame string Without victories.

title: UNCOMMON BIRDS FOUND IN REGION
description: The growing popularity of providing winter feeding for birds has resulted in a greater population in the Northeast of cardinals, titmice and other un common species, ornithologists report.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 24The only bless ing we can really hope for on Christ mas is selfperception. Miracles are not to be expected: only the chance of seizing on the symbol of Christmas to look within and see who we are. That was what the Spirits did for Scrooge in done night.

title: Supreme Court Refuses To Lift Football TV Ban
description: A petition seeking to lift the television blackout of the RedskinPacker football play off game in the Washington area was rejected yesterday by the United States Supreme Court only hours before game time.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, elec trical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HACKENSACK, Dec. 24  About noon on Christmas Day a blue station wagon will pull up at 38 Clarendon Street and a piping hot Christmas dinner will be delivered to the walk up apartment of John Feeley, who is alone and will be 90 yobs old in February.

title: On the Border, Where Martinis and Talk Are Small
description: The Talk of Eagle Pass

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, Dec. 24 (AP)Rick Miller, a Red Sox utility outfielder, will receive the Unsung Hero award Jan. 25 at the 34th annual Boston Baseball Writers dinner.

title: In New Haven, Too
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 24 (AP) Seven city businesses were given misdemeanor citations today for violating the state blue law, which forbids most businesses from opening on Sunday, the police said.

title: Greece Will Curb Economy
description: ATHENS, Dec. 24The mil itarybacked Greek Government imposed today a major credit squeeze on the economy cou pled with tighter wage and price controls, to curb inflation.

title: Upstate Blue Law Arrest
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Dec. 24 (AP)The manager of a su permarket was arrested today and charged with violating the state's blue laws, sheriff's depu ties said.

title: City Gets a Touch Of Bali for Holiday
description: The Dancers and Musicians of Bali, a handsomely exotic ensemble of 50 of that pic turesque island's leading per formers, opens a twoweek engagement tomorrow night at the City Center on West 55th Street, with a full suit case of classical and modern dances and songs just slight ly tailored for the tourists.

title: 2 Infants Die in Heater Fire
description: SUSQUEHANNA, Pa., Dec. 24 (AP)Two infant girls died to day in a fire that swept through a bedroom in their home. The Victims were Tabatha Jeane Seagrave, 18 months old, and her sister Tina Marie, 10 months. Police chief Willard Collier said the fire had started in an electric heater from an overloaded circuit.

title: HAWKS WIN, 51 HULL NETS PAIR
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 24 (AP)  Dennis Hull scored his 18th and 19th goals of the season today to pace the Chicago Black Hawks to a 51 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs a Na tional Hockey League game.

title: Laurence D. Kieran Dies; Specialized in Estate Law
description: Laurence D. Kieran, a law yer who specialized in wills, trusts and estates, died yester day in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 285 Riverside Drive.

title: Supreme Court Refuses To Lift Football TV Ban
description: A petition seeking to lift the television blackout of the RedskinPacker football play off game in the Washington area was rejected yesterday by the United States Supreme Court only hours before game time.

title: Mr. Jet Moore Is First
description: LOS ALAMITOS, Calif., Dec. 24 (UPI)Mr. Jet Moore rallied to beat Kaweah Bar last night in the $50,000 Champion of Champions quarterhorse race at Los Alamitos. The 3yearold colt, ridden by Terry Lipham, increased his career earnings to more than $340,000. Mr. Jet Moore paid $6 for $2 to win and was clocked in 21.86 sec onds for 440 yards.

title: Books of The Times
description: I had it in mind to amuse you today. What I was going to do was this. Having never actually read the original (1940) edi tion of Mortimer J. Adler's How to Read a Book, but having nonetheless been steeped most of my life in cogent ridicule of its premises, I thought I'd use the occa sion of the book's publication in a revised and updated edition to serve up something appropriate to the season's gaietysome thing on the order of the parody, How to Read Two Books, that was written years ago in response to the original version of Dr. Adler's brainchild; and something, too, that would get me revenge for all those glossy mailing pieces proffering the Syn topicon and Great Books of the Western World, with which Dr. Adler has been cluttering my mailboxes these many years.

title: GAME UNIT TESTS FOREIGN ANIMALS
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Dec. 24 Game animals from Asia and Africa that had never before rim wild on the North Ameri can continent are now roaming the remote mountains and desert plateaus of New Mexico as part of an experiment by the State Game and Fish Department to determine how imported exotic species get along in a trans planted natural environment.

title: Artisans Restoring Splendor of Leningrad
description: LENINGRAD, Dec. 19 In a land where constant comparisons are made be tween the backward Czarist past and the progressive Communist present, one of the most impressive before andafter stories is the res toration of Czarist palaces from the destruction of World War II.

title: Redskins Hail Quarter Strategy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (UPI)'I guess the players felt sorry for me. They must have said it's about time George Allen won a playoff, said the Washington Redskin coach today after his first playoff victory.

title: Savage Nickname Kept By Washington College
description: CHENEY, Wash., Dec. 24 (UPI)Eastern Washington State College teams will con tinue to be called the Sav ages despite protests that the nickname was defaming to Indians.

title: Rhoda Jo Williams, Student, Weds
description: ROSLYN, L. L, Dec. 24 Miss Rhoda Jo Williams was married here this afternoon to Louis G. Alexander 3d, son of Mr. Alexander of Chicago and the late, Mrs. Alexander. The Rev. Dr. George Lawrence, pastor of the Antioch Baptist Church in Brooklyn, performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Charles T. Wil liams, parents of the bride.

title: Headaches Linked to Nitrites In Hot Dogs and Cured Meats
description: A medical student and a neu rologist have solved the mys tery of why a California man experienced headaches shortly after he ate hot dogs and cured meat products.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NORTH OUT TO TIE CHARITY RIVALRY
description: MIAMI, Dec. 24 (UPI) With the rushes of Wisconsin's Rufus Ferguson and the passes of Purdue's Gary Danielson, the North team hopes to even the score against the. South to morrow night in the Shrine AllStar football game.

title: Dancing Dan's Christmas
description: ow one time it comes on Christmas, and in fact it is the evening before Christmas, and I am in Good Time Charley Bernstein's little speakeasy in West FortySeventh Street wish ing Charley a Merry Christmas and having a few hot Tom and Jerrys with him.

title: JAMES A. FOLGER 3D, HEADED COFFEE FIRM
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 24 (AP)James A. Folger 3d, for mer president of J. A. Folger & Co., the coffee concern founded by his grandfather, died Friday at the age of 72.

title: FIESTA BOWL WON BY ARIZONA STATE
description: TEMPE, Ariz., Dec. 24 (AP) TEMPE, Ariz., Dec. 23 (AP) Arizona State University's 16th ranked Sun Devils, led by Woody Green's four touch downs, defeated the Missouri Tigers, 4935, to capture the second annual Fiesta Bowl last night before a record crowd of over 51,000.

title: Bridge:
description: The standards for certain bids tend to change with the passage of time. A bid that is not all that it used to be occurs when the rebid is two notrump without a jump, fol lowing a twolevel response, as shown in the diagram.

title: Warfield Stars In Late Drive for Score
description: MIAMI, Dec. 24After trail ing in the fourth quarter today for the first time since the second game, of their unbeaten regularseason schedule, the Miami Dolphins defeated the Cleveland Browns, 2014. The victory came on a touchdown positioned by Paul Warfield, their, sleek wide receiver, and scored by Jim Kiick, their for gotten running back.

title: How Fort Duquesne Repelled Raiders
description: Sports of The Times

title: Bernier Gets 4, Kings Win
description: OAKLAND, Dec. 24 (AP) Serge Bernier scored four goals tonight to lead the Los Angeles Kings to a 53 victory over the California Golden Seals.

title: Defense Excels for Washington in 16.1 Victory
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24  George Allen squeezed every drop he could out of the Wash ington Redskins today and he will have to wring them out once more next Sunday if the darlings of the nation's capital are to reach the Super Bowl.

title: A Political Backfire
description: News Analysis

title: Quake Off Western Hawaii Briefly Alarms Islanders
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 24 (UPI) A moderate earthquake, cen tered off the Kona coast in western Hawaii, rattled dishes, flipped over tables and shook fences yesterday in the state's islands. It also alarmed many who besieged police depart ments and news agency offices with telephone calls,

title: J. Paschal Dreibelbis Dies; A Bankers Trust Director
description: J. Paschal Dreibelbis, who re tired in 1965 as senior vice president, head of the banking department and a director of the Bankers Trust Company of New York, died Saturday of a heart attack in Mission, Tex. He was 73 years old and lived in McAllen, Tex.

title: Bed Linens That Help Save on Laundry Bills
description: LOS ANGELES  Polly Bergen has her cosmetics company, Dinah Shore is on the board of directors of a major mercantile chain, Rhonda Fleming keeps busy off screen checking on exten sive landholdings in Austra lia. And now, partly because her laundry bills were too high and her husband was too angry, Suzanne Ple shette has joined the parade.

title: TEMPORARY HALT IN RAIDS ON NORTH BY U.S. REPORTED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Dec. 25Informed American military officers said this morning that the United States had at least temporarily halted the bombing of North Vietnam.

title: West Virginia Farmers Tighten Security Against Cattle Rustlers
description: CHARLES TOWN, W. Va., Dec. 24In West Virginia's eastern panhandle, less than 100 miles from the nation's capital, farmers are strengthening secur ity measures against gangs of rustlers who for three months have been stealing cattle at night.

title: TRUMAN WEAKER AND UNCONSCIOUS
description: ICANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 24 Former President Harry S. Truman grew progressively weaker tonight in the 20th day of his lifeanddeath struggle against a series of medical problems.

title: TALENT GENERATED BY FLEETWOOD MAC
description: Fleetwood Mac is a British bluesbased rock band that has undergone some rather radical reshufflings of personnel since its founding in 1967. Of the current six members, only Mick Fleetwood, the drummer, and the bass guitarist are originals. All the others are more or less new, and one is an American.

title: Decorating for Christmas Is Their YearRound Fun
description: WARWICK, N. Y.Christ mas decorating, for most peo ple, is the work of a night or two. But for three families here, who make their own decorations, it is an activity that goes on all year.

title: Carol Kaplow Is Bride Of James E. Gumpert
description: OCEANSIDE, L. I., Dec. 24 At the Oceanside Jewish Center this afternoon, Miss Carol Lee Kaplow, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Kaplow, was married to James E. Gumpert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Gumpert of North Miami Beach, Fla. Rabbi Gilbert Rosenthal per formed the ceremony, assist ed by Cantor Yitzhak Lefkovitz.

title: Hanoi Is Reported Scarred But Key Services Continue
description: The following dispatch, which was delayed in trans mission, was written by Telford Taylor, professor of law at Columbia University, who is visiting Hanoi with group of Americans. Mr. Taylor, a retired brigadier gen eral, was chief prosecutor at the Nuremberg war crimes trials and is the author of several books, including Nurem berg and Vietnam: An American Tragedy.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24Al though eight of the 15 mem bers of the New Jersey Con gressional delegation have rel atively few yearseight or lesson the seniority ladder, the state will provide the new House of Representatives with some high  ranking committee members and the first commit tee chairman from New Jersey in 20 years.

title: 128Mile R.O.T.C. Hike Set
description: EDMOND, Okla., Dec. 24 (UPI)A group of 15 Reserve Officers Training Corps stu dents and three teachers are planning a hike next month 128 miles through sunscorched Death Valley. Maj. Ralph Dunn, professor of military science at Central State University, said that the walk across the desert and sand dunes, to start Jan. 4, would be a test of endurance. Brief flashes of courage are not enough, he said, you, must endure to succeed.

title: Israel to Shut 2 Embassies
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 24 (UPI) Israel will close its embassies in Niger and the Congo Repub lic, the Foreign Ministry said today. The decision came sev eral weeks after Chad broke off diplomatic relations with Israel. Niger borders Chad on the west. At the same time, Israel will upgrade her relations with Rwanda, Swaziland, Botswana and Lesotho, the spokesman said.

title: FLOOD TOOK TOYS, BUT HOPES REMAIN
description: MAN, W. Va., Dec. 24 (AP) Included in Marleen Collins's requests to Santa Claus this year is one for replacement of her toy forks, knives and dishes.

title: An American in Hanoi
description: Telford Taylor, the Colum bia professor who was chief United States prosecutor at Nuremberg, reports from Hanoi that essential services are being maintained despite the heavy bombing. His dis patch appears on Page 3.

title: Robber Sprayed Away
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 24 (AP) Mrs. Mary Muszynski squirted a holdup man in the eyes with ammonia as he held a gun to her husband's head in their delicatessen, and the man ran out screaming, the police said today.

title: Christmas Also Brings Tears
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 24 The tension began to build before Thanksgiving. Even in the best of times it is diffi cult for the children, but Christmas is the most diffi cult time of all.

title: Thuy Rejects Peace Talks While U.S. Raids Continue
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24  Xuan Thuy, North Vietnam's negotiator at the regular Paris talks on Vietnam, said in an interview made public today, that his Government would not resume negotiations with the United States as long as the Nixon Administration con tinued bombing north of the 20th Parallel.

title: RANGERS SUBDUE RED WINGS, 5 TO 0
description: With the New York Rangers holding a 50 lead over the Detroit Red Wings, a full house of 17,500 fans in Madison Square Garden began chanting, De ense, Defense!

title: Christmas Eve Crowds Throng Central Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 24  For several hours this evening vehicular traffic was barred in the heart of Saigon as thousands of resi dentsyoung couples, fami lies with small children and swarms of teenage boys  strolled through the streets in their best clothes.

title: Lebanon Releases a List of New Arms
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 24 The Lebanese Government has released a full list of the new weapons it purchased within the last year amid a na tionwide argument about the country's defense policy.

title: RELIEF WORKERS FLY TO MANAGUA FROM MANY LANDS
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 24Relief workers from many nations worked today to evac uate the injured and bury the dead in this capital city, much of which was destroyed by a series of earthquakes yesterday.

title: LEONARD B. PATTEN
description: Leonard B. Patten, former coach of the West Point hockey team and a founder of the Metropolitan Amateur Hockey League, died Friday of a heart ailment on a visit to Newport News, Va. He was 84 years old and lived at 90 Fairview Avenue, Port Washington, L. I.

title: Enclave in Cambodia Again Enjoying Peace
description: PHUM KANDAL, Cambodia, Dec. 12We live now in con stant calm, said Keo Im, an elder in this village. It was a remarkable statement in rav aged Cambodia, where Commu nist troops have seized three quarters of the territory, but a true one, nevertheless.

title: U.N. Sets Women's Year
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec, 23 (AP)The General Assembly has declared 1975 International Women's Year, and has asked Secretary General Waldheim to prepare a program aimed at promoting sexual equality.

title: Maine Clam Industry Reported In a Recovery From Red Tide
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 24 Maine's clam industry has come back, quite well, despite last fall's invasion by a minute marine organism known as the red tide, a spokesman for the Maine Sea and Shore Fisheries Department reports.

title: Bishop Sends $150 to Neediest
description: The Most Rev. Francis J. Mugavero, Bishop of the Ro man Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, gave $150 yester day to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Christmas Also Brings Tears
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 24 The tension began to build before Thanksgiving. Even in the best of times it is diffi cult for the children, but Christmas is the most diffi cult time of all.

title: Sadat Calls Special Meeting Of Top. Security Officials
description: CAIRO, Monday, Dec. 25 (UPI)President Anwar el Sadat has summoned the Na tional Security Council to an emergency session tomorrow to consider the military prepara tions against Israel and ways of preserving the unity of the domestic front, Cairo news papers said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Dec. 24 (AP)The Shamrock Racing Association has been barred from using Pocono Downs Raceway in 1973 because of debts, the track presi dent, Larry Vansat, said.

title: New Park Ave. Tunnel Lights Will warn of Carbon Monoxide
description: Lights that will warn motor ists when the carbonmonoxide level reaches a critical point are being installed in the 110 yearold Park Avenue Tunnel, which runs from 33d to 40th Street.

title: RELIEF WORKERS FLY TO MANAGUA FROM MANY LANDS
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 24Relief workers from many nations worked today to evac uate the injured and bury the dead in this capital city, much of which was destroyed by a series of earthquakes yesterday.

title: Nationals Rout Nordiques
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 24 (AP) Wayne Carleton's 24th and 25th goals of the season led the Ottawa Nationals to a 62 vic tory over the Quebec Nordiques tonight before a sparse. Christ mas Eve crowd of 1,702.

title: Soviet Is Publishing Its First Consumer Magazine
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 24The So viet Union, in an unusual break with the past, has begun pub lishing its first consumerre search magazine in an attempt to bridge a widening gap be tween the production of goods that no one wants and a thirst for products not being supplied, by the Govermentrun economy.

title: 128Mile R.O.T.C. Hike Set
description: EDMOND, Okla., Dec. 24 (UPI)A group of 15 Reserve Officers Training Corps stu dents and three teachers are planning a hike next month 128 miles through sunscorched Death Valley. Maj. Ralph Dunn, professor of military science at Central State University, said that the walk across the desert and sand dunes, to start Jan. 4, would be a test of endurance. Brief flashes of courage are not enough, he said, you, must endure to succeed.

title: Ailing Frazier Gets Fill of TV Football
description: Walt Frazier spent most of yesterday in his East Side penthouse apartment apply ing ice packs to the muscle injury above his right knee and watching the pro foot ball games on television.

title: Lumbering in Park Contested in Maine
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 24  Environmentalists in Maine are going to court to challenge an agreement between a state agency and a major paper com pany with a suit that could al ter the traditional relationship between the state and its larg est landowners and employers.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Dec. 25Informed Anterican military officers said this morning that the United States had at least temporarily halted the bombing of North Vietnam.

Dr. Walter Dyk, Studied The Ways of the Navajo
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 24Dr. Walter Dyk, an anthropologist and educator who specialized in the Navajo Indians, died yes terday at the age of 73.

title: PATHAN LEADER, 80, IS BACK IN PAKISTAN
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 24 Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan, the 80yearold frontier Gandhi whose Pathan tribal followers used nonviolence in their struggles against the British, returned today to Paki stan from neighboring Afghani stan after a selfimposed exile of eight years.

title: EXECUTIVE HIRING EXPECTED TO RISE
description: Prospects are looking up for the employment of highly paid exect;tives, a study among lead ing search firms showed yes terday. The hiring outlook for 1973 appears to be more op timistic than at any time in the last five years, although there were some reservations ex pressed regarding the employ ment of college graduates look ing for their first post in com merce and industry.

title: HAWKS WIN, 51; HULL NETS PAIR
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 24 (AP)  Dennis Hull scored his 18th and 19th goals of the season today to pace the Chicago Black Hawks to a 51 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs in a Na tional Hockey League game.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 24  It's like I have two new eyes, it's a miracle  it's a beautiful work they are doing, said Mrs. Elsie Evans of East Or ange.

title: Daley Announces New Lakefront Plan
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 24  An ambitious new development plan that would create 10 miles of new parks and beaches along Lake Michigan and limit the construction of highrise buildings beside the lakefront has been announced by Mayor Richard J. Daley.

title: Judge Assures Drinkers Of a Holiday at Home
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 24 (AP)Judge Frank L. Harlor of Municipal Court had pres ents for 26 persons who ap peared before him on drinking charges.

title: Hussein Divorced and Remarried
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 24 (Reuters)King Hussein has divorced his. Britishborn sec ond wife, Princess Muna, and today married a Jordanian from the Israelioccupied West Bank, the Cabinet an nounced. The bride, Alia Tou kan, who will celebrate her 24th birthday tomorrow, be comes Queen of Jordan.

title: Neumann Will Face His Toughest Test In Quarry Battle
description: Randy Neumann of Cliffside Park, N. J., faces the biggest test of his fouryear pro career Jan. 5 when he takes on Jerry Quarry in a 10round heavy weight bout at Madison Square Garden.

title: OntheJob Discontent
description: That millions of American workers feel economically trapped, socially scorned and just plain bored with their jobs scarcely ranks as a startling discovery. A taskforce report submitted to President Nixon in mid1970 by George P. Shultz, as Secretary of Labor, warned that bluecollar blues were undermining industrial effi ciency and social stability. Now another task force set up by Secretary Richardson of Health, Education and Welfare concludes that ennui is just as pervasive among whitecollar workers and middle management.

title: MAN AWAITING BUS FATALLY STABBED
description: An unidentified man was fatally stabbed by two assail ants yesterday as he waited for a bus at 72d Street and Broad way. On Friday, just one block away, a Bronx man carrying a payroll was robbed and shot as he got into his car.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 24 (UPI) Police Director John L. Red den has revised a report that the city's crime rate dropped 16 per cent this year. He said it really had dropped only 6.9 per cent.

title: Casper, TwoTime Winner, Enters Los Angeles Open Golf
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 24 (UPI) Billy Casper, twotime Los Angeles open winner, has en tered the 47th annual event at the Riviera Country club in Pacific Palisades Jan. 4 through 7. Casper, 41 years old, cap tured the tournament, in 1968 and 1970.

title: End of an Era
description: The chilling sadness of the recent civil rights sym posium at the Lyndon Baines Johnson Library in Austin was that it marked the burial of an era that died before reaching maturity. It was an era of high hopes and unassailable principles. The courage and compassion of the nineteensixties are part of an age that now seems devastatingly long agothe days when a Southern Pres ident led the nation's march toward racial equality, days now replaced by the sleazy opportunism of the Southern strategy.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton yesterday called the theft of 169 pounds of heroin and 131 pounds of cocaine from the Police Department property room the most deplorable situation . . . we in City Hall have encountered in the period that the Mayor has been in office.

title: Bethesda Nuptials For Miss Landay
description: BETHESDA, Md., Dec. 24 The marriage of Miss Su san Landay to Peter Scott Kinimel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Kimmel of Bedford, N. Y., took place here this afternoon. Rabbi Daniel Lie fer performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Don ald Malcolm Landay.
