description: An unidentified man was fatally stabbed by two assail ants yesterday as he waited for a bus at 72d Street and Broad way. On Friday, just one block away, a Bronx man carrying a payroll was robbed and shot as, he got into his car.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 24Nobody has accused Princeton of being a training ground for professional football players, but one member of the 1972 Tiger team is expected to be a high selection in the coining professional draft.

title: Spirit of Goodwill Ushers In Christmas
description: In city towers and shabby tenements, in lightstrung sub urban homes and in prisons, hospitals and churches across the metropolitan area, families and friends gathered on an overcast eve of Christmas last night to exchange gifts and thoughts of goodwill.

title: Amish Man Is Searching For an Even Plainer Life
Albuquerque Program Gives Drinkers a Lift
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 24Holiday drinkers who have drunk too much can get free rides home from now until Jan. 2 through a test program being carried out by taxi companies, university students and a local alcohol safety organization.

title: REV. WILLIAM B. M'ALPIN
description: The Rev. Dr. William B. Mc Alpin, pastor since 1955 of the ParkWest Presbyterian Church and a past moderator of the New York Presbytery, died Saturday at his home, 151 West 86th Street. He was 59 years old.

title: As Quakes' Shocks Go On, Managuans Assess Human and Property Losses
Winnipeg Exchange Drawing Gold Traders
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 16  Wheat is still king in Winnipeg, but buyers from many parts of the world are looking at a more glamorous commodity that has just come to the market in this wind swept farming capital.

title: Spirit of Goodwill Ushers In Christmas
description: In city towers and shabby tenements, in lightstrung sub urban homes and in prisons, hospitals and churches across the metropolitan area, families and friends gathered on an overcast eve of Christmas last night to exchange gifts and thoughts of goodwill.

title: Quiet Dolphin Creates Biggest Noise in Miami
description: MIAMI, Dec. 24Usually one of the quietest members of the Miami Dolphins' offen sive unit, Paul Warfield emerged today as the subtle spark of their winning touch down drive in the 2014 vic tory over the Cleveland Browns in the American Conference playoffs.

title: Medical Institution Here Aids Pupils From High School Minority Groups
description: Each weekday, 17 highschool seniors gather in the basement classrooms and the laboratories of the Mount Sinai School of Medicine for fulltime academic study.

title: GREEKS ADVANCE TO SOCCER FINAL
description: Despite a poor offensive per formance, the New York Greek Americans managed a 21 vic tory over Doxa yesterday and reached the New York final of the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer.

title: Ship With 30 Aboard In Distress Off Alaska
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Dec. 24 (UPI)A 570foot cargo ship with 30 men aboard was reported sinking in heavy seas tonight 800 miles south of Kodiak, Alaska.

title: Homage Paid to Rabbi Heschel By 500 at a Traditional Service
description: Leaders of New York's Jewish community joined yesterday with prominent figures of other faiths to pay homage to Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel, the philosopher and theologian, at funeral services in the Park West Memorial Chapel, 115 West 79th Street.

title: Italians Divided on Their Constitution
description: ROME, Dec. 24  Italy is celebrating the 25th anniver Isary of her Constitution in a Mather perfunctory way these days as leftwing parties de mand that it be at last enacted in its entirety while rightists want to revise it on author itarian lines.

title: 39 Dead in Norway Crash
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 24 (Reu ters)The death toll in a do mestic air crash near here last night rose to 39 today when a woman died of her injuries and three people listed earlier as missing were confirmed as dead. The airliner, carrying 42 passengers and a crew of three, had crashed in fog in a forest about 12 miles from here.

title: FIRE BOMB IGNITES AT GIMBELS EAST
description: An incendiary table tennis ball believed to have been plant ed by leftist activists ignited yesterday morning in Gimbels East at 125 East 86th Street, resulting in considerable dam age to the department store.

title: Patriarch Visits Jerusalem
description: BETHLEHEM, Israeli  Occu pied Jordan, Dec. 24 (Reuters) Church bells pealed out over the Judean hills today as the Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem made his way in solemn pro cession to Bethlehem for the traditional Christmas celebra tions in the little town where Jesus was born.

title: Game Times Listed Far Title Clashes
description: The National Football League announced yesterday that next Sunday's Pitts burghMiami American Con ference title game would be gin at noon, Eastern Stand ard Time, at Pittsburgh.

title: Amish Man Is Seeking an Even Plainer Way of Living
description: PORT TREVORTON, Pa., Dec. 24Down on the main highway, the plastic Santa Claus bids a merry electric Christmas to the automobiles that whiz by, their radios blaring the latest seasonal jingles.

title: TOURNAMENT TIME BEGINS TUESDAY
description: It's tournament time and col lege basketball teams are on the move. This is the season recruiters make good on the promises of trips around the nation they had dangled as re cruiting bait.

title: Transit Policeman Killed
description: BREWSTER, N. Y., Dec. 24 (AP)  Harvey Cormier, 36 years old, a New York City transit policeman, was struck and killed in an auto collision this morning near his home in Putnam take the state police reported. The driver of the other car, George Hill, 26, of Brewster, was charged with drunken driving. He was re ported in good condition at Northern Westchester Hospital in Mount Kisco with a frac tured nose and contusions.

title: EAST BERLIN HOLDS YULE FAIR AGAIN
description: BERLIN, Dec. 24  The East Germans thisyear brought Ber lin's traditional Weihnachts markt, the Christmas fair, back to the heart of the old city, to a square they razed more than 20 years ago to make room for shows of their politi cal and military might.

title: COURT WILL HEAR A RELIGIOUS ISSUE
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 24  A dozen persons who were or dained as ministers by mail have been ordered to appear in a Richmond court Jan. 4 for a hearing to determine if they may continue to perform marriages in Virginia. The case could wind up in the United States Supreme Court.

title: POPE SAYS MASS AT A TUNNEL SITE
description: SANTORESTE, Italy, Mon day, Dec. 25Pope Paul VI prayed for peace at a midnight mass that he said tonight for workers a tunnelconstrue tion project at the foot of Mount Soracte, 25 miles north of Rome.

title: In Managua, Turmoil Is an Old Story
description: Managua, Nicaragua's prin cipal city and capital, had a population of more than 300,000 out of the nation's 1,900,000, basically people of mixed European and Indian antecedents.

title: Honey Jay's Finishing Kick Pays Off at Fair Grounds
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 24 (AP)  Honey Jay, running third with an eighth of a mile to go, closed with a rush and won the $15,000 Christmas Handicap by 2tlengths at the Fair Grounds today as the track resumed Sunday racing for the first time since 1940.

title: L.I.R.R. Walkout, in 26th Day, Equals Previous Record Strike
description: With no settlement in sight, the strike on the Long Island Rail Road was 26 days old to day  equaling its previously longest strike, which shut down the line between July 10 and Aug. 5, 1960.

title: First Black Legislator in Maine to Fight Subtle Bias
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 24  Gerald Talbot, a newspaper compositor, decided to run for the State Legislature after he stopped by the State Capitol one day last year and listened to debate on a bill that later became Maine's human rights act.

title: Cornell Five Bows, 9088
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 24 (AP) Kevin Brennan scored 24 points last night to lead the University of MissouriSt. Louis to a 9088 basketball victory over Cornell University.

title: SHARKS HALT SKID, DEFEAT WHALERS
description: BOSTON, Dec. 24 (AP) Gary Veneruzzo and Mike Byers put in two goals apiece today as the Los Angeles Sharks whipped the New England Whalers, 53, in a World Hock ey Association game and halt ed a sixgame string without victories.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: 3 Killed When Car Overturns

title: GemStone Hunters In Maine Discover Tourmaline Trove
description: NEWRY, Maine, Dec. 24 (UPI)Three gemstone hobby ists, searching in the rolling hills of western Maine, have un earthed possibly the richest trove of tourmaline ever found in New England.

title: Mrs. Stuart Symington Is Dead; Wife of Senator From Missouri
description: WASHINGTOINN, Dec. 24 (AP) Evelyn Wadsworth Syming ton, wife of Senator Stuart Symington and mother of Representative James W. Symington, both of Missouri, died today at Georgetown Uni versity Hospital, apparently of a heart attack. She was 69 years old.

title: Hazards Cited in Ship Delivery of Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24  Delivery of large volumes of liquefied natural gas by ship, expected to begin in New York City in 1973, poses a fire haz ard to nearby residential areas, according to two scientists.

title: BLACKS ACQUIRE CAPITAL TV PERMIT
description: WASHINGTONA group of investors here recently pur chased the right to apply for transfer of the construction per mit for television Channel 50, moving this city a step closer to having the first predomi nantly blackowned station in the country.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mt. Sinai Helps High School Pupils

title: Grand Funk Railroad Stearns Into the Garden at Full Throttle
description: The parents were easy to recognizethey were the ones With the fingers in their ears. They were giving a Christmas treat to their youngest but were not prepared for the sound volume of a Grand Funk Railroad concert.

title: Ann Fertig and Robert Freedman Marry
description: Miss Ann Louise Fertig, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Felix C. Fertig of Scarsdale, N. Y., was married here yes terday to Robert Lawrence Freedman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert J. Freedman of Rockville Centre, L.I. Rabbi Jack Stern performed the ceremony at the Regency Hotel.

title: Closer Look at Packaging Is Taken by Toy Industry
description: Six months ago, in the mid dle of the toy industry's Christ mas rush that of necessity predates the retail crush just ended by a half year, the Fed eral Trade Commission cited six of the largest toy and game manufacturers in the country for deceiving the consumer into thinking he was buying more than he was getting.

title: WALTER G. PETERSON
description: ELONIA, N. J., Dec, 24 Walter G. Peterson, a former New York stockbroker, died yesterday in Englewood Hos pital. He was 75 years old and lived at 129 Van Orden Avenue.

title: East Seniors Victors, 20, In Tangerine Soccer Bowl
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 24 (UPI) Dennis Wit of Loyola of Bal timore and Andy Rymarczuk of Penn State each scored goals to give the East a 20 victory lover the West in the first Tangerine Senior Soceer Bowl yesterday.

title: Syria Gets a New Cabinet; Leftist Coalition Is Retained
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 24 (AP)President Hafez alAssad of Syria today announced the formation of a 31man Cabinet.

title: Mr. Jet Moore Is First
description: LOS ALAMITOS, Calif., Dec. 24 (UPI)Mr. Jet Moore rallied to beat Kaweah Bar last night in the $50,000 Champion of Champions quarterhorse race at Los Alamitos. The 3yearold colt, ridden by Terry Lipham, increased his career earnings to more than $340,000. Mr. Jet Moore paid $6 for $2 to win and was clocked in 21.86 sec onds for 440 yards.

title: JOSEPH GIARDINA SR.
description: Joseph Giardina Sr., secre tarytreasurer of the Mason Tenders District Council of Greater New York and of its welfare and pension fund, died Thursday in St. Vincent's Hos pital. He was 78 years old and lived at 8820 15th Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: West Virginia Faces N.C. State In Peach Bowl Friday at Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 23 (AP) West Virginia and North Caro lina State, a pair of football teams with explosive offenses, meet Friday night in the fifth annual Peach Bowl. But both coaches predict that defense will determine the winner.

title: FLOOD TOOK TOYS, BUT HOPES REMAIN
description: MAN, W. Va., Dec. 24 (AP) Included in Marleen Collins's requests to Santa Claus this year is one for replacement of her toy forks, knives and dishes.

title: Thieu Orders 93 Released
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 24 (UPI)  President Nguyen Van Thieu ordered the release of 93 convicts and commuted the sentences of 137 others in his annual Christmas clemency, message today, the Govern ment announced. None granted clemency were political pris oners.

title: Amazon Area Drawing Many Settlers
description: BRASIL NOVOThe first harvest was slot generally up to expectations, the Work was hard and living conditions were difficult, but for moat settlers the Amazon dream remains in tact.

title: Electoral Gift Wrapping
description: Like crumpled Christmas wrapping, once so important and so promising, the nation's Electoral College system for selecting Presidents and Vice Presidents now stands ready for dis card. In fact, this legacy of a Colonial Christmas Past only gets in the way of modem representative government.

title: PATHAN LEADER, 80, IS BACK IN PAKISTAN
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 24 Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan, the 80yearold frontier Gandhi whose Pathan tribal followers used nonviolence in their struggles against the 1British, returned today to Paki stan from neighboring Afghani stan after a selfimposed exile of eight years.

title: PAUL HEINECKE, 87, AIDED COMPOSERS
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 24 (AP) Paul Heinecke, founder and president of SESAC, Inc., a com posers' copyright organization, died last night at Holy Name Hospital here. He was 87 years old and lived in North Bergen, N. J.

title: Government to Buy Reef and Pork Soon For School Lunches
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP)  Millions of schoolchildren, after months of turkey hash and stewed chicken, will soon be getting Governmentdonated ground beef and pork for lunch.

title: Personal Finance: Selling Stock Short
description: If a person thinks stock market prices will rise he buys stock. But if he thinks the market or a particular stock might fall what does he do?

title: JOB AID PRESSED IN ARMS CUTBACK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 24In a small suite on the third floor of the Pentagon, 13 people are trying to help the thousands of Americans who have lost jobs in defense cutbacks by seeking new sources of employment for the affected communities.

title: U.S. Aid for Massachusetts Gets Conditional Approval
description: BOSTON, Dec. 24 (AP)The Department of Transportation has given conditional approval to a $19.5million loan for pur chase of Penn Central Railroad rightsofway by the Massachu setts Bay Transportation Au thority, officials said today.

title: Community Trust Kept Busy
description: The cheerful business of giving away millions of dol lars' worth of other people's money is being carried out with gusto on the 15th floor of 415 Madison Avenue, near 46th Street, in the offices of the New York Community Trust.

title: TV: Berle Rescues a Holiday Special
description: It's anybody's guess as to who thought of packaging Debbie Reynolds, Sammy Davis Jr., Milton Berle and the 5th Dimension (singers) in openingnight perfor mances and backstage mus ingsas a Christmas Night television treat. Obviously the Columbia Broadcasting System deemed the idea fes tive. Some viewers who tune in for an hour at 8 may wish the network had settled for an old movie with the An drews Sisters.

title: Dolphins Save the Best for Last
description: MIAMI, Dec. 24 (UPI) The Miami Dolphins may have looked bad today in the first three quarters, but they did what had to be done in the last period. To Coach Don Shula, that's what makes his team great enough to win the Super Bowl.

title: NORTH OUT TO TIE CHARITY RIVALRY
description: MIAMI, Dec. 24 (UPI) With the rushes of Wisconsin's Rufus Ferguson and the passes of Purdue's Gary Danielson, the North team hopes to even the score against the South to morrow night in the Shrine AllStar football game.

title: Truman Unconscious
description: Former President Harry S. Truman was unconscious and grew progressively weak er yesterday at a Kansas City hospital. Page 11.

title: City's Evacuation Ordered
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 24 (Reu ters)The authorities in Ma nagua today ordered the total evacuation of the city.

title: Tragedy in Managua
description: One of the major natural disasters of modern times has devastated Managua, Nicaragua. In the wake of last weekend's earthquakes, much of the city is in ruins, while thousands have been killed and other thousands are injured. Fire and the lack of safe drinking water have added to the travail of the survivors, who have now been ordered to evacuate the city for fear of further convulsions of the ground on which the city is built. Extensive aid from abroad is being rushed to help the victims, and even old political grudges are being forgot ten in this essential humanitarian effort.

title: U.S. Speeds Aid to Nicaragua Aboard Air Force Transports
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 Widespread efforts were under way today to provide aid for the victims of the earthquake in Managua, Nicaragua.

title: Thuy Rejects Peace Talks While U.S. Raids Continue
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24  Xuan Thuy, North Vietnam's negotiator at the regular. Paris talks on Vietnam, said in an interview made public today that his Government would not resume negotiations with the United States as long as the Nixon Administration con tinued bombing north of the 20th Parallel.

title: L.I. STORES GIVE IN TO THE BLUE LAWS
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 24 With a police tractortrailer standing ready to haul away seized merchandise, merchants backed down today from their advertised intention of remain ing open in defiance of Sunday blue laws.

title: 29 Victims in Andes Crash To Receive Common Burial
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 25 (UPI)The 29 victims of the Uruguayan military plane crash in the Andes in which 16 other persons survived will be buried in a common grave near the snowcovered wreckage, a Uru guayan diplomat said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SAN JUAN, Dec. 25 (UPI) The search for survivors of a plane that crashed off St. Martin was suspended to night, the Coast Guard said, adding that one of its heli copters had picked up debris but had seen no signs of sur vivors.

title: JOSEPH E. ROKAW
description: Joseph E. Rokaw, retired Eastern sales manager of Ludo wiciCeladon Company, Inc., of Chicago, roofing tiles, died yesterday in Rheinbeck, N. Y. He was 82 years old and lived in Poughkeepsie, N. Y.

title: School Use of Sex Pamphlet Stirs Angry Debate in French Town
description: BELFORT, France, Dec. 21 The sexual revolution has broken out, belatedly, in this tranquil garrison town near the junction of France, Ger many and Switzerland, dis closing passions its 60,000 citizens were unaware of.

title: AbdulJabbar Paces Bucks
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 25 (UPI) Kareem AbdulJabbar scored five straight points tonight after Kansas CityOmaha had rallied to tie the game with five min utes left, as the Milwaukee Bucks defeated the Kings, 10499. AbdulJabbar scored 10 of his team's last 17 points. He led all scorers with 32 points.

title: Antelope From Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 25 (UPI)Ja pan will give China a pair of rare antelope and 2 pair of pen guins for the Peking Zoo in re turn for two giant pandas sent from China to Japan last au tumn, it was disclosed today.

title: Reardon of Baltimore Six Removes Himself as Coach
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 25 (UPI) Terry Reardon, general man ager of the Baltimore Clippers of the American Hockey League, resigned as coach today and named Jim Morrison, a defense man, as coach.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MIAMI, Dec. 25 (AP)The Lucky Irish Stable's Prince of Truth won the $25,000 added Christmas Day Handicap at Calder Race Course today, holding off the late charge of Rastaferian by a nose.

title: JOYCE GOES HOME FOR THE HOLIDAY
description: Kevin Joyce of South Caro lina will have a homecoming tonight at Madison Square Garden and he prepared for it yesterday by going home to Long Island. He ran, shot bas kets and played oneonone with Bob McKillop, the junior varsity basketball coach at Holy Trinity High School in Hicks ville, L. I.

title: 3 Shooting Incidents In Ulster Interrupt I. R. A. CeaseFire
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 25 (AP)  Gunfire in terrupted an uneasy Christmas peace in Northern Ireland to day. But no one was hit.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 25 A student group at Rutgers University, adapting the tactics of Ralph Nader, is seeking to combat consumer fraud in the New Brunswick area.

title: AbdulJabbar Paces Bucks
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 25 (UPI) Kareem AbdulJabbar scored five straight tonight after Kansas CityOmaha had rallied to tie the game with five min utes left, as the Milwaukee Bucks defeated the Kings, 10499. AbdulJabbar scored 10 of his team's last 17 points. He led all scorers with 32 points.

title: PAUSE IN BOMBING OF NORTH VIETNAM SAID TO CONTINUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 26  Informed American military officers said early today that the pause in bombing of North Vietnam that began on Christmas eve re mained in effect past midnight. They added that they had re ceived no indication of when the air raids might be resumed.

title: A Commune Thrives in Berlin
description: BERLINSohn, a 17year old boy with a history of narcotics addiction, had just been released from pretrial detention.

title: ... Blocking Overruns
description: Although the militaryindustrialexecutive branch com plex is not a conspiracy in the criminal sense, it does operate, almost unrestrained, to swell the costs of national defense. The best way to prevent defense waste would, of course, be for the Government not to buy vast, unneeded, goldplated defense systems in the first place, but to do this means establishing broadergauged Congressional control over the entire budgeting process.

title: Fire in Queens Leaves Girl, 4, Dead and 50 Homeless
description: Nine families totaling 50 per sons were forced from their apartments early yesterday morning by a fire that killed a 4yeariold girl and destroyed five twostory houses in South Jamaica, Queens.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 25 (UPI)City Magistrate John Chapas has fined 14 persons on charges of ticket scalp ing. The suspects were arrested Saturday prior to the American Football Conference playoff game between Pitts burgh and Oakland.

title: 11,000 Gallons of Oil Spilled as Barge Hits Bridge
description: ATLANTIC BEACH, L. I., Dec. 25A 240foot oil barge rammed the Atlantic Beach Bridge today, spilling 11,000 gal lons of light heating oil into Reynolds Channel.

title: China Leads So Far in Exports As Trade With U. S. Shows Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (Reu ters)The Chinese are out selling the Americans so far in trade between the two coun tries, which has opened up in the wake of their improved dip lomatic relations.

title: People in Sports: Wottle, Milburn, in K. of C. Field
description: Rod Milburn, who tied the world record of 13.2 seconds in winning the 1972 Olympic gold medal for the 110meter high hurdles, and Dave Wat tle, 800meter gold medalist, have agreed to compete in the Knights of Columbus track meet on Jan. 13 at the Nassau (L.I.) Coliseum.

title: Big Business Spurs Labor Toward a World Role
description: PARIS, Dec. 25  The in ternationalism of big business has, in a curious return of things, strengthened the inter nationalism of labor, says Dan Gallin, general secretary of the Food and Allied Workers Fed eration.

title: A Class Aids Neediest
description: The New York Times Need iest Cases Fund got a Christ mas present yesterday from Class 44 at P.S. 164 in Flush ing.

title: Cambodians Under Attack
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 25 (UPI)The Cambodian command today reported fight ing less than two miles from the center of Kompong Thorn late yesterday as the enemy tightened a hold around the northern provincial capital.

title: Chakravarti Rajagopalachari, Noted Indian Statesman, Dies
description: MADRAS, India, Dec. 25  Chakravarti Rajagopalachari, Governor General of India from 1948 to 1950 and one of the foremost leaders in the nation's struggle for independence from the British, died today. The Government proclaimed seven days of mourning.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 New York and New Jersey residents planning to rush to the New York harbor beaches next summer to enjoy the benefits of the first national park in a major metropolitan center need not hurry.

title: Alcoholics to Use Billy Rose Mansion
description: Roosevelt Hospital is plan ning to purchase the former Billy Rose mansion, once one of the city's most elegant town houses, for use as an alco holism therapy center.

title: Chess: Midgame Play Determined, Usually, by Kind of Opening
Trail Blazers Triumph
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 25 (AP)Sidney Wicks and Geoff Petrie combined for 66 points tonight as the Portland Trail Blazers defeated the Seattle SuperSonics, 116113.

title: BURGER TO OFFER ADVICE ON BILLS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP) Chief Justice Warren E. Bur ger says he considers it part of his job to let Congress know what kind of legislation he thinks would be good for the courts.

title: Concert
description: If 18 years can qualify some thing for institutional status, then Alexander Schneider's Christmas  Eve  at  midnight concerts are now a New York institution, and a most laud able one at that. Sunday evening's (actually yesterday morning's) installment at Car negie Hall was a bracing ex perience.

title: PUERTO RICAN UNIT War IN BLASTS
description: The search for suspects in the weekend incendiary bomb ing of three Manhattan depart ment stores focused yesterday on members of M.I.R.A., a revolutionary group seeking independence for Puerto Rico.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. UNDERCOUNTED RELIEF CASES HERE BY 40%, H.R.A. SAYS
description: A study commissioned by the city's Human Resources Admin istration charged yesterday that the 1970 Federal census had undercounted the city's welfare cases by 40 per cent.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Washington Recrosses Delaware

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Roosevelt Hospital is plan ning to buy the former Billy Rose mansion for use as an alcoholism  therapy center. The building is owned by the Popular and Democratic Gov ernment of Algeria and is at 56 East 93d Street in Man hattan.

title: GISELA RICHTER, ART CURATOR, DIES
description: ROME, Dec. 25Dr. Gisela M. A. Richter, former curator of Greek and Roman art at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York and a preeminent authority in her field, died here in her sleep last night. Miss Richter was 90 years old, and since her retirement had been living alone in a small apart ment on Rome's Janiculum hill.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Dec. 25 (AP)A group of col lege hockey players who have never skated together as a team will represent the United States in the World Cup tournament, which begins here tomorrow night, against the Soviet Union, Czechoslovakia and Canada.

title: Christmas Is Deplored As Ritual From Pagans
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 25 (UPI) Acting Prime Minister Goh Keng Swee deplored Christ mas today as a pagan ritual Christians had inherited.

title: Curbs on Press Stir Fleet Street
description: LONDON, Dec. 25Some four weeks ago, at 10:30 in the morning, two Scotland Yard men walked into the offices of the obscure Railway Gazette, a monthly publication with a cir culation of 12,000. After pro ducing a search warrant, they proceeded to spend nearly three hours opening filing cabinets and desks for clues concerning a leak of a Government docu ment on proposed changes in the country's railway network.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TENAFLY, Dec. 25When football fans from coastto coast tune in on the Rose Bowl game on New Year's Day and catch a glimpse of the Tenafly High School band, it will be because of a community fund raising effort by the band that yielded more than $50,000 in less than six weeks.

title: Success Is Breeding Resentment For Japanese in Southeast Asia
description: TOKYO, Dec. 25 (UN)  Japan is experiencing a rising tide of resentment in Southeast Asia against its goods and its investments.

title: MRS. BELLE SPEAR
description: Mrs. Belle Kazin Spear, di rector of the Great Neck (L. I.) Community School, a nursery school, and wife of Dr. Paul W. Spear, director of medicine at Morrisania Hospital, died Sunday of cancer in Montefiore Hospital. She was 51 years old and lived in Manhasset, L. I.

title: More Women Defy Risks of Hitchhiking
description: They take to the highway, America's increasingly inde pendent young women, cloth bag slung over their shoulders and thumbs cocked in the air, perhaps with a James Taylor or Art Garfunkel song about the open road humming in their ears.

title: Two Are Killed in El Paso In a Dispute Over Drugs
description: EL PASO, Dec. 25 (UPI)  Two men were killed by shot gun pellets in a dispute over drugs and their bodies hidden in a shallow desert grave by members of a motorcycle gang, the police said today.

title: IN THE NATION
description: HAMLET, N. C., Dec. 25The bar baric bombing we Americans are in ??ting on a faraway nation of Asia does not echo loudly here in this small Southern town, where few see the Eastern liberal press that President. Nixon so disdains. Television news on the local channel provides more of the natural devastation in Managua than of the Americanmade havoc in Hanoi.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: BELLEVILLE, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Michael R. Duganier, 31 years old, was held without bail here today on a charge of murdering his wife, Patricia, 33, and stabbing his 3yearold daughter on Christmas Eve. The child, Michelle Lee, was in fair condition at Clara Maass Hospital here.

title: JOYCE OS HOME FOR THE HOLIDAY
description: Kevin Joyce of South Caro lina will have a homecoming tonight at Madison Square Garden and he prepared for It yesterday by going home to Long Island. He ran, shot bas kets and played oneonone with Bob McKillop, the junior varsity basketball coach at Holy Trinity High School In Hicks ville, L. I.

title: FULL AID ORDERED FOR NICARAGUANS
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 25 (AP)The Florida White House said today that President Nixon had ordered his Cabinet to make an allout effort to provide all needed help to Nica ragua, whose capital, Mana gua, was devastated by an earthquake Saturday.

title: Soviet Lifter Sets Mark
description: SOCHI, U.S.S.R., Dec. 25 (Tass)  Pavel Pervushin set a world heavyweight weight lifting record of 175.5 kilo grams (about 385 pounds) for the snatch, 0.5 kilogram (1.1 pounds) more than his old mark.

title: Guest at St. Regis Subdued by Police After Jump Threat
description: A guest at the St. Regis Ho tel was subdued by the police last night after threatening for several hours to jump to the street from his 17thfloor room.

title: NO REVALUATION SEEN BY TANAKA
description: TOKYO, Dec. 25 (UPI)Pre mier Kakuei Tanaka said today that he would not revalue the yen but would try to ease pres sure for increasing its value by limiting exports.

title: Professor Sees a Shortage Of Experts on Gas and Oil
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa. Dec. 25 (AP)There is not only an energy crisis impending, but also a critical shortage of ex perts to deal with it, a Penn sylvania State University pro fessor contends.

title: Rabbit Plant to Open
description: WARRENVILLE, S. C., Dec. 25 (UPI)South Carolina's first rabbit processing plant will have its grand opening next Saturday. The plant, operated by the Palmetto Rabbit, Coop erative, is expected to have an initial processing capacity of about 1,000 rabbits a week.

title: England Wins in Cricket
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)  England won the first test against India to day by six wickets. The final scores were India 173 and 233, England 200 and 208 for four.

title: U.S. RENEWS RAIDS IN NORTH VIETNAM AFTER LULL ENDS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 26  United States bombers resumed at tacks in North Vietnam above the 20th Parallel this afternoon after a 36hour suspension of strikes for Christmas, the United States command an nounced.

title: Bridge: Bidding for TwoSuit Hands Often Proves DoubleEdged
description: The difficulty of bidding twosuited hands after the opponents have opened has led to the development of a variety of conventions to de scribe such handsnotably the, unusual notrump to show minor suits, and the Michaels Cuebid, showing major suits after a minor opening, or a major and an unspecified minor after a major opening.

title: Paterno Is Ready or Not To Make Mark in Pros
description: College Sports Notes

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BLAZERS ROUTED BY CRUSADERS, 80
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 25 (AP)  The Cleveland Crusaders peppered two Philadelphia Blazer goalies with 50 shots en route to an 8.0 World Hock ey Association victory, today.

title: F.B.I. Special Agent Who Smashed Klan Resuming Old Post
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 25 Roy Moore, the special agent of the Federal Bureau of Investi gation who is credited with smashing the Ku Klux Klan in Mississippi in the nineteensix ties, is coming back from Chi cago to head the bureau's big contingent in Mississippi, which is based here.

title: Running Against the Twelfth Man of History
description: AUSTIN, Tex.I watched the panel this morning and got great satisfaction and com pensation, in my own way, in feeling that all is not lost, all has hot been in vain. We can't overcome all the injustices or make this a perfect world overnight. But we are on our way and we are going to do just that before it's over.

title: Drizzle Dampens the City But Fails to Dull Its Spirit
description: Despite dark skies and patch es of wet sidewalk, only one hundredth of an inch of drizzle was added yesterday to the month'as accumulation.

title: Troubled Intra Bank Heads for Solvency
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 25 The salvage operation that has been underway for five years to stabilize the Intra Bank, which collapsed in an interna tional financial scandal in 1966, appears to have succeeded.

title: Capsized Lifeboats Found in Hunt for Freighter
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Dec. 25 (AP)  Wreckage thought to be part of a missing Liberian freighter, including four over Iturned lifeboats, a large oil slick and debris, was discovered today in the North Pacific, a Coast Guard spokesman said.

title: Appraisal of the Arts
description: Nine critics for The New York Times assessed the year in art and culture at a re cent roundtable discussion. A page of excerpts from the discussion, Page 44.

title: S.I. Village Restoration Beset by Split
description: Disagreements over the present operations and fu ture scope of Richmondtown, the 300yearold village being restored on Staten Island, have caused a rift between the, original sponsor, the Sta ten Island Historical. Society, and Richmondtown Restora tion, Inc., the corporation set up by the society as a fund raising arm.

title: NORTH WINS, 1710 IN SHRINE CONTEST
description: MIAMI, Dec. 25 (AP)  Bob McCall, an Arizona speedster, raced 13 yards for a touchdown the fourth quarter tonight and gave the North AllStars a 1710 victory over the South in the annual Shrine charity foot ball game in the Orange Bowl.

title: Redskin Coach to Use No Risk Plan And Wait for the Cowboys' Mistakes
description: The George Allen policy with regard to playoff games, one of no risktaking whatso ever, will again be in force on Sunday when Allen's Wash ington Redskins take on the Dallas Cowboys for the Na tional Conference champion ship in the nation's capital. Allen will attempt to exercise the dream of every coach, complete control of the game throughout its 60 minutes.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Detectives seeking to solve the weekend bombings at Bonwit Teller, Bergdorf Good man and Gimbels are seek ing members of M.I.R.A., the Puerto Rican revolutionary organization. The type of in cendiary devices used and the way they were set were said to be typical of the tactics of the M.I.R.A.the Armed Re volutionary Independence Movement. No arrests have been made so far. Damage at Gimbels was estimated at about $2,000.

title: ANTHONY SZAPARY, LED SPORTS GROUP
description: Count Anthony Szapary, a founder of the Hungarian Na tional Sports Federation, died yesterday at his home, 1 East 66th Street. He was 66 years old.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Woodcock Is Good Hunting in South
description: NEW HOPE, N. C.Lock ing on point, then moving forward as we closed in be hind her, Hanson Carroll's pointer quickly unraveled the spoor left by a woodcock along the bank of a small creek and a few minutes later the bird was flushed and shot.

title: Proposal to Control Repairs Tightened
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Department has tightened its proposed regulation to curb shady practices by television, auto and appliance repairmen.

title: CHRISTMAS CASTS A SPELL OVER CITY
description: In a mood of relaxation and quiet, as pervasive as the mist and drizzle, the city's millions put aside tensions and fears yesterday to celebrate Christ mas with feasts, gifts, visits, prayer and sightseeing.

title: Advertising:
description: It is apparently easier to terminate a 36yearold maga zine than it is to turn off a computer. On Dec. 8, the top command of Time Inc. announced the end of Life. On Dec. 20, Philip Dorf of Manhattan received a Dear Subscriber computerized let ter telling him that even though he is a regular sub scriber and friend, of Life, we now have to drop your name from our weekly deliv ery rolls.

title: Marcos Pardons 327
description: MANILA, Dec. 25 (UPI)  President Ferdinand E. Marcos pardoned 327 prisoners today on recommendation of the Board of Pardons and Parole, the Department of Public In formation announced. The an nouncement said that he also issued a decree under which a government fund would finance the payment of farm lots ac quired under a proclamation Oct. 21 that extended agricul tural credit supports.

title: CHRISTMAS CASTS A SPELL OVER CITY
description: In a mood of relaxation and quiet, as pervasive as the mist and drizzle, the city's millions put aside tensions and fears yesterday to celebrate Christ mas with feasts, gifts, visits, prayer and sightseeing.

title: Silent Protest in London
description: LONDON, Dec. 25 (AP) Two hundred legislators, cler ics, union leaders and actors lined the pavements outside the American Embassy in London today in silent protest against the renewed bombing.

title: Bridgeport Never Like This
description: Gene Sarazen, golf director at the Marco Island, Fla., Golf Club, began his professional career as a shop assistant at Brooklawn Country Club, Bridgeport, Conn.

title: Boy Drowns in Excavation
description: THOMPSTOWN, Pa., Dec. 25 (UPI)  A 7yearold boy drowned yesterday when he fell into a sanitary sewer excava tion filled with water in this Juniata County community. He was identified as Carl Reichen bach.

title: Damper on Detente
description: The Basic Treaty between East and West Germany opens a new era in the relations between the two Ger man statesalthough some of the euphoria that origi nally greeted conclusion of the treaty has now largely, and with good reason, evaporated.

title: Chakravarti Rajagopalachari, Noted Indian Statesman, Dies
description: MADRAS, India, Dec. 25  Chaltravarti Rajagopalachari, Governor General of India from 1948 to 1950 and one of the foremost leaders in the nation's struggle for independence from the British, died today. The Government proclaimed seven days of mourning.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fire on Barge Put Out
description: PORT ALLEN, La., Dec. 25 (UPI)Firemen used foam to smother a gasoline fire aboard a Mississippi River barge to day, ending a 24hour blaze that had defied all other at tempts at extinguishing it. Offi cials have not learned why the 10,000 gallons of unleaded gas oline ignited. River pollution was minimal, the Coast Guard said, and no injuries were re ported.

title: State Audit Accuses City Health and Hospitals Unit
description: The New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation has been accused of deficient ac counting and control practices in a state audit report of its budget and financial operations covering the period from July 1, 1970 to Dec. 31 1971.

description: To the Editor:

title: Basketball Ratings COACHES' POLL
description: The top 20 teams, with points awarded on a 10987654 321 basis (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost rec ords and total points.

title: Northeast Taxpayers Get Forms This Week
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Dec. 25 (AP)  The Internal Revenue Service Center here has a de layed Christmas present for 11.2 million residents of the Northeast,. New York and New England.

title: Sadat Grows More Democratic, His Supporters Say
description: CAIRO, Dec. 23The Egyp tian Government's handling of six days of student agitation at the University of Cairo is being cited by supporters of President Anwar elSadat as evidence that he has adopted a new, relative ly more democratic style of government.

title: Security in Pittsburgh Troubles N.F.L.
description: National Football League officials will consult today with the Pittsburgh police regarding stricter security for the players before and dur ing the American. Conference championship game there Sunday between the Steelers and the. Miami Dolphins.

title: STATE STUDY FINDS ALBANY FLEECED BY MACHINE'S RULE
description: ALBANY, Dec. 25After a year of investigating municipal purchasing practices here, the State Commission of Investiga tion has charged the local Dem ocratic political machine with exercising paralyzing control over virtually every aspect of life in Albany at a cost to tax payers of millions of dollars in irregularly diverted revenues.

title: Rome: Treasures Face Many Perils
description: Arts Abroad

title: ENVOY APOLOGIZES FOR JOKES BY HOPE
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 25 (AP)The United States Am bassador, Leonard Unger, has apologized for jokes by Bob Hope that two local newspapers said insulted Thailand.

title: Protest in Hartford
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 25 (AP) About 200 people gathered at the Federal Building here today to protest the bombing.

title: Briefs on The Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP) The Far North; 2000 Years of American Eskimo and In dian Art, an exhibition opening at the National Gal lery of Art on March 8, has received 26 ancient Alaskan works of art from Leningrad's Museum of Anthropology and Ethnography. Gallery officials say the Russian loans are among the best in the show, which will include about 350 items lent by sources in this country and several others.

title: Markets Reopening Today
description: Securities, commodities mar kets and banks that were closed yesterday, Christmas Day, will reopen today. In Canada and Britain, most exchanges and markets will remain closed to day in observance of Boxing Day, a postChristmas holiday.

title: Steelers' Noll Is Honored
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 25 (UPI) Chuck Noll, Steelers' coach was named today as pitts burgh's most outstanding sports figure for 1972, by the Post GazetteDapper Dan club. Noll finished just ahead of his rookie star, Harris, in the voting.

title: Crozier of Sabres Admitted To a Hospital in Toronto
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 25 (UPI) Roger Crozier of the Buffalo Sabres of the National Hockey League has been hospitalized in Toronto for what appears to be a flareup of pancreatitis, an illness that has affected the 30yearold goaltender for sev eral years, the Sabres said to night.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 4yearold girl died early yesterday morning in a fire that destroyed five row houses in South Jamaica and left nine families, totaling 50 persons, homeless.

title: Dayan Proposal for a City In Sinai Divides Cabinet
description: JERUSALGM, Dec. 25  A proposal by Defense Minister Moshe Dayan to build a new Israeli city of up to 250,000 people on the rolling sand dunes of northeastern Sinai has aroused a controversy here and has split the Cabinet.

title: BULLS DEFEATED BY SUNS, 115108
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 25 (AP)  Neal Walk sparked the Phoenix Suns in the last five minutes to a 115108 vtctoty today over the Chicago Bulls in a nation ally televised National Basket ball Association game.

title: March in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Dec. 25 (UN)  Several hundred demonstrators shouting Nixon murderer marched down the Kurfrsten damm, West Berlin's main street, today to protest United States policy in Vietnam. A police spokesman said five persons had been arrested for carrying stones.

title: 12 Missing in Crash In Eastern Caribbean
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 25 (AP)  Twelve persons are missing in the crash of a small plane in the eastern Caribbean, the Coast Guard said today.

description: Sports of The Times

title: Bradford Computer in Pact
description: Bradford Computer and Sys tems, Inc., which performs a variety of financial record keeping and securitiesprocess ing services, has reached an agreement to acquire all the shares of Securities Process ing Services, a securitiesclear ance business, for an unspeci fied sum. Certain partners of W. E. Hutton & Co., a broker age firm, hold stock in Securi ties Processing.

title: U.S. UNDERCOUNTED RELIEF CASES HERE By 40%, H.R.A. SAYS
description: A study commissioned by the city's Human Resources Admin istration charged yesterday that the 1970 Federal census had undercounted the city's welfare cases by 40 per cent.

title: Soldiers Halt Looting
description: MANAGUA, Dec. 25 (Reuters)  Soldiers fired warning shots in the air today to halt looting at a supermarket. Before the shots were fired, Nicaraguans hauled away bales of food, bags of rice, loaves of bread, and clocks, from the damaged market.

title: KNICKS HOLD OFF PISTONS, 113 TO 110
description: The Knicks' scoring machine, torrid in the first half, slowed to almost a halt in the second half last night and the Detroit Pistons made a game of it be fore losing, 113110, at Madison Square Garden.

title: Nicaraguans Cut Off Food To Get Victims to Quit City
description: Nicaraguans Cut Off Food To Get Victims to Quit City MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 25  A Red Cross official said today that the Nicaraguan Government had cut off food supplies to force survivors to leave this earthquakeshattered city before decaying bodies buried under the rubble caused an epidemic.

title: SHOP TALK
description: What better way to start a New Year than with some of the jewelry designed by Yves Saint Laurent and shown with his current col lection?

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25If anybody out there still reads the news from Washington, he will have noticed an eerie development. There is an awful lot of itnews, that is; or, more pre cisely, printed matter which fills news paper spacebut practically none of it comes from people any more.

title: U.S. Advice on Donations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP) Persons wanting to help earthquake victims in Nica ragua should channel their do nations through established re lief organizations rather than send unsolicited goods to Nica ragua, the United States Agency for International Development has advised.

title: Panel of Times Critics Appraises 1972 as a Year of Settling Down in the Arts
description: It was a year of settling down in all the arts but television, which launched a conscious drive for more quality programing and a more per missive approach to sensitive themes. It was a time when avantgarde movements lost their dominance, when a pluralism of possibility emerged and artists who painted, composed or performed in realistic modes gained the respect that had been withheld from them in recent years was a year when jazz returned to the scene.

title: People of Nicaragua Show Graciousness in a Troubled Time
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 24As their city died and their families died; and as they saw all their belong ings destroyed, the people of Managua had about them an uncommon gentleness.

title: Briefs on The Arts
description: Russian movies, compara tively rare here, will receive largescale exposure with the opening at 8 P.M. Thursday at the Museum of Modern Art of a monthlong series of 23 Sovietmade feature films produced in the last years.

title: WAR PROTEST HELD NEAR WHITE HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (UPI) Chanting Stop the bomb ing, Lord, about 200 people took Christmas communion in an interfaith service for peace today across the street from the White House.

title: TV: 2 Talk Shows Bubble Up Amid Soap Operas
description: Are the guests interesting? Do they get a chance to talk? Yes to both questions on the Joe Franklin Show, yes to the first question only on Joanne Carson's VIRs.

description: LAKE TAHOE, Nev., Dec. 25 (AP)  Harrah's Tahoe Race book made the Miami Dolphins and Washington Redskins fa vorites today to win their Na tional Football League con ference championships.

title: Garden Track Tickets Go on Sale Tomorrow
description: Tickets will go on sale to morrow at the Madison Square Garden box office for the 1973 indoor track season. The program features the Wanamaker Millrose Games Jan. 26, the United States Olympic Invitational Feb. 16 and the National Amateur Athletic Union champion ships Feb. 23.

title: Six Robbed in Coast Church While Singing Is Continued
description: FRESNO, Calif., Dec. 25 (UPI) The small congregation for a Christmas Eve service couldn't stop singing their hymn, even for three young men who burst into the church and robbed six worshipers at gunpoint.

description: BERLIN, Dec. 25 (UPI)Tens of thousands of West Berliners and West Germans spent the day with relatives in East Ger many today.

title: 500 Hail Carrier on Return
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Dec. 25 (UPI)About 500 relatives and friends and one Santa Claus were on hand in the morning fog today to offer a holiday greeting to the men of the attack carrier U.S.S. Oki nawa, returning from a nine month tour in the Western Pa cific and off Vietnam.

title: The Earlier Reports
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 26  Informed American military officers said early today that the pause in bombing of North Vietnam that began on Christmas Eve re mained in effect past midnight.

title: Legends of Law West of Pecos Keep Texas Ghost Town Alive
description: LANGTRY, Tex.  The judge gazed at the man's body laid out in the sunlight for an official inquest. There was a fresh bullet hole in the middle of the man's forehead.

title: LAWRENCE BROWN, 79, COMPOSER, IS DEAD
description: Lawrence Brown, composer, vocalist and pianist, who had been an accompanist for Paul Robeson and Roland Hayes, died yesterday in Harlem Hos pital. He was 79 years old and lived at 188 West 135th Street.

description: Nine critics for The New York Times assessed the year in art and culture at a re cent roundtable discussion. A page of excerpts from the discussion, Page 44.

title: No Word of 3 Americans
description: WILMINGTON, N. C., Dec. 25 (AP)A professor and two stu dents on a scientific expedition in Nicaragua have not been heard from since the earthquake struck, University of North Carolina officials said today.

title: Soviet Sale May Be Start Of TurbineExport Drive
description: TORONTO, Dec. 24  The Soviet Union has just sold five turbines to the Manitoba Hydro Commission in a deal that some experts here see as the possible start of a major Soviet program to sell highquality turbines in North America.

title: American Force in Vietnam Now 24,200, a Drop of 700
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 25 (UPI)  American military strength in Vietnam declined to 24.200 last week, a drop of 700 men from the previous week and the lowest total in almost eight years, the United States command said today.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N. J., Dec. 25A year to the day after the New Jersey State Senate voted unanimously to change the name of the Atlantic City State Marina, the 19yearold yacht basin became the Frank S. Farley Marina.

title: Advertising:
description: To help you overcome the firstdaybackaftertheholi day blues, here's a happiness word from the heads of the four major media associations growth.

title: TRUMAN REPORTED TO BE NEAR DEATH
description: KANSAS CITY; Mo., Dec. 25 Doctors treating former Pres ident Harry S. Truman said to night that his condition was de teriorating hour by hour and that he was near death.

title: 5 Flee West Virginia Prison
description: HUTTONSVILLE, W. Va., Dec. 25 (UPI)  Five convicts escaped from the Huttonsville mediumsecurity prison during the early hours, of Christmas Day, officials said. The warden, Lloyd E. Hanes, said the prison ers had knocked out a window bar and climbed down a rope.

title: Hussein's ExWife Is Given Her 4 Children and Palace
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 25 (AP)  Princess Muna, whom King Hussein has divorced, is retaining custody of their four children and was given Humar Palace, 15 miles west of Am man, a palace spokesman an nounced today.

title: FuelOil Rationing Feared
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., Dec. 25 (UPI)Representative Silvio O. Conte, Republican of Massa chusetts, said here yesterday that fuel oil in the East and Midwest might be rationed within the next year. Mr. Conte said that the solution to ending fuel shortages would be the removal of all import quo tas on No. 2 heating oil. There is no doubt, he said, that President Nixon and past administrations have kept oil quotas on to protect the Texas and Oklahoma oilmen.

title: Red Cross Makes Contact
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (UPI)  The American Red Cross made its first direct con tact with Nicaragua today and immediately dispatched four disasteraid experts to Managua.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 The resumption of sustained bombing by the United States throughout North Vietnam has revived the debate here and abroad over the efficacy of the bombing strategy.

title: Ronald Ngala, Kenyan Leader, Dies
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 25 (AP)Ronald Ngala, who led Kenya's coalition Government in the early 1960's before inde pendence from Britain, died to day. He was 49 years old.

title: PONTIFF GREETS HOLIDAY CROWD
description: ROME, Dec. 25  Pope Paul VI. in a Christmas message to the world, urged men of goodwill today not to fear to be known as Christians.

title: Orders for Machine Tools Set a Record in November
description: The machine tool industry continued to set records with November orders of $163.7 million the highest for any month this year. The year's previous high was $141.8mil lion in October. Orders amounted to $78million in No vember, 1971.

title: Whalers Beat Sluggish Raiders, 8 to 2
description: The New England Whalers were in good spirits at Madison Square Garden yesterday and no wonder  they defeated the New York Raiders, 82.

title: 7, Including 3 Children, Die in Fires Around Country
description: Seven persons died yes terday in home or industrial blazes around the country, United Press International re ported.

description: A Criminal Court judge last night for the second time in two days released on $500 cash bail a suspect in the critical wounding of a policeman. He acted despite revocation of the bail by a fellow judge and over the protests of Mayor Lindsay and the police.

title: Mission Aim Is Not Just Conversion
description: Though sermon and stew remains as it has for the last 100 years, a mainstay of res cue mission work on skid rows, a new look  utilizing the techniques of psychiatry and social work  is becoming more and more noticeable.

title: TAXES IN U.S. PUT AT 27.9% OF G.N.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25  Total Government tax collec tions in the United States are a smaller proportion of the gross national product than in any other industrial country except Japan and Switzerland, new international comparisons have revealed.

title: Hanoi Reports Heavy Toll
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)  The North Vietnamese press agency reported today that American planes killed or wounded thousands in the Hanoi and Haiphong raids be tween Dec. 18 and Dec. 24 and that 40,000 tons of bombs were dropped on North Vietnam.

title: Finally, He Couldn't Get on Top of the House
description: TORONTOOn sunny afternoons we would sit on the green benches and talk about whiskey. All of the whiskey we had drunk and all of the glorious things we had done.

title: 5 KILLED AND 3 HURT IN FIRE NEAR ALBANY
description: SCHODACK LANDING, N. Y., Dec. 25 (AP)A house fire here today killed three children in one family and a young couple engaged to be married, the police said.

title: SAYINGS UNITS POST GAIN OF $1.8BILLION
description: The nation's savings and loan associations showed a net sav ings inflow of $1.8billion in November, a record for the, month, the United States Sav ings and Loan League reported over the weekend.

title: Stage: Capital's Folger
description: WASHINGTONOne of the most remarkable happenings in American theater over the last four or five years has been the way Washington has become the nation's sec ond theatrical city. Apart from New York, there is more theatrical activity in the cap ital than anywhere else in the country. Yet only a few years ago, apart from the Arena Stage, the National Ballet and the sporadic Washington Opera Society, Washington was pretty much a cultural desert.

description: ONTARIO, Calif., Dec. 25 (AP)The harsh male voice on the other end of the line spoke rapidly, relating information about a drug pusher.

title: MiniMansion in Poughkeepsie Restored to Former Grandeur
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y. On an icy knoll, shrouded in fog and seen through a mesh of gnarled branches, Tara North seemed less like a setting for Gone With the Wind than one for Wuth ering Heights.

description: If nothing else, the Long Is land Rail Road strike has given some people a chance to get to know their friends and relatives better.

description: MOUNTAIN LAKES, N. J., Dec. 25 (AP)The home of Harry L. Sears, the New Jersey campaign chairman for Mr. Nixon, was picketed here this morning by about 75 Morris County peace activists.

title: 6TH FLEET ENJOYS HOME IN ATHENS

title: Worried San Franciscans Take New Look at Quake Forecaster
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 25 Last week it was all dif ferent. Then most of those who live here in this city that was once destroyed by an earthquake ignored the pre diction. Those who did not ignore it chose to laugh at it. And the few who took it seriously kept their concern mostly to themselves.

title: Suspect in Police Attack Freed Twice in $500 Bail

description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 25 (AP)  The Cleveland Crusaders peppered two Philadelphia Blazer goalies with 50 shots en route to an 80 World Hock ey Association victory today.

title: Service for Mrs. Symington
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP) A memorial service for Mrs. Evelyn Wadsworth Symington, wife of Senator Stuart Syming ton and mother of Representa tive James W. Symington, both of Missouri, will be held Thurs day afternoon at the Washing ton Cathedral.

title: Albert S. Noble Dead at 73; Directed Ad Agency Here
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 25Albert Sidney Noble, pro prietor of the New York adver tising agency of his name, spe cializing in the agricultural and chemical industries, died yes terday at his home, 487 Lake Avenue. He was 73 years old.

title: Police as Pushers
description: The theft of huge quantities of narcotics from the storage rooms of the New York Police Department bespeaks an incredible mixture of venality and ineffi ciency. With the final tally not yet in, more than 300 pounds of heroin and cocaine are now reported missing. The disclosure that the department has thus been acting as a major distributor of this deathdealing contraband severely undermines confidence in the very organization locally entrusted with curbing the hard drug menace.

title: DODGE MANSION SOLD TO MIDWEST BUILDER
description: DETROIT, Dec. 25 (UPI)De velopers announced plans to day to turn the Dodge mansion on Lake St. Clair into a dozen condominium apartments while maintaining the original integ rity of the grounds as closely as possible.

description: To the Editor:

title: Army Woos Volunteers With School
description: FORT LEWIS, Wash.  What the soldiers here call Old Reliable University Is developing without ivy or alumni into a symbol of the educational opportunities the new Army offers volunteers.

description: PANAMA CITY, Dec. 25 (AP)A fire in a slum district last night destroyed 21 houses, leaving some 1,200 people homeless.

description: SAIGON, Dec. 25 (AP)The South Vietnamese command to day reported 58 violations dur ing overlapping 24hour cease fires set by the Vietcong and the Saigon Government. Each side blamed the other for the violations.

description: RAHWAY, Dec. 25  A long line of adults and children stood anxiously along the wall of the reception area corridor of Rahway State Prison yes terday waiting for their names to be called so that they could bring a little of the spirit of Christmas inside.

description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 25 Doctors treating former Pres ident Harry S. Truman said to night that his condition was de teriorating hour by hour and that he was near death.

description: MIAMI, Dec. 25 (UPI)Some of the Miami Dolphins may have taken the Cleveland Browns lightly yesterday, but Paul War field knew better. Lucky for the Dolphins he did. Warfield en abled Miami to score its 15th straight victory here, a 2014 lastquarter conquest of the Browns.

description: CAIRO, Dec. 23  The Egyptians are making head way at last after long delays on their project for a 200 mile double pipeline capable of carrying at least 80 mil lion tons of crude oil an nually from the Red Sea to the Mediterranean.

title: Junius P. Wilson, a City Legal Aide, Dead at 98

description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (AP)Six major Japanese steel makers have signed a contract with China to export 1.4 million metric tons of steel products valued at $217million.

description: All stock exchanges in the country, Federal offices, the Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mercantile Ex change will be closed tomor row, which has been declared a national day of mourning for former President Harry S. Tru man.

description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26  Alek sandr A. Sizov, the Mayor of Leningrad, who played a promi nent role in rebuilding that city after World War II, died today after long illness. He was 59 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pay Board Cuts Teamster Raise 5 Cents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reu ters)The Pay Board today re duced the pay increase due Jan. 1 for 400,000 teamsters by an average of 5 cents an hour.

title: Japan Helping Oil Industry Invest in Mideast Venture
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26  The Jap anese Government decided to day to help a consortium of Japanese companies invest in Abu Dhabi Marine Areas, Ltd. The Abu Dhabi concern, a Per sian Gulf oil exterprise, is cur rently owned twothirds by the British Petroleum Company and onethird by France's Com pagnie Franaise des Ptroles.

title: Hatfield to Act on Press
description: SALEM, Ore., Dec. 26 CAP) Senator Mark O. Hatfield, Re publican of Oregon, said today he would introduce a bill that would help newsmen protect their sources. Legislation to en sure freedom of the press, Mr. Hatfield said, must be a top priority item when Congress reconvenes next month. For nearly 200 years a free, press has served this country as a balance to government. Its un bridled, voice is as vital today as it was in '76. He said the First Amendment freedoms are threatened by recent court ac tions eroding the ability of newsmen to present informa tion to the American public.

title: Secretariat Is Horse of Year, Topping La Prevoyante in Poll
description: In a rare ballotbox battle between 2yearolds, Meadow Stable's Secretariat was named horse of the year yesterday.

title: Retirement Home Evacuated
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 26 (UPI) A highrise retirement home, scene of a fire last month that killed 10 people, was evacuated briefly tonight after smoke be gan billowing up into the build ing from the basement. Fire men said that an overheated clothes dryer in the basement of the Baptist Towers home had sent the smoke up through the 11story building. Officials said only one elderly resident, an unidentified woman, had to be hospitalized. The cause or ex tent of her injuries was not immediately known.

title: RAIDERS DEFEAT NORDINES BY 52
description: QUEBEC, Dec. 26 (AP) Norm Ferguson scored two goals and assisted on a third tonight and Pete Donnelly turned aside 41 Quebec shots, leading the New York Raiders to a 52 World Hockey Asso ciation victory over the Nor diques.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MIAMI, Dec. 26 (AP)Howard and St. Louis univer sities, finalists in last year's National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer tournament, square off in the N.C.A.A. semifinals tomorrow night in the Orange Bowl. The win ner will face the victor of tomorrow's first gamebe tween Cornell and the University of California, Los Angeles. The final is Friday.

title: Manila Says Thousands Flee as Fighting Increases in the South
description: MANILA, Dec. 26Army headquarters said today that thousands of civilian residents in the Sulu Archipelago, the southernmost part bf, the Philip pines, had fled their homes as fighting between rebel bands and troops increased in the last week.

title: Comments Made by Truman in and Out of Office
description: Following is a selection of quotations of former Presi dent Harry S. Truman:

title: RUTGERS DEFEATS FLORIDA, 81 TO 79
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 26 (AP)  Speedy Rutgers battled to an 8179 overtime victory over Florida tonight and entered the Gator Bowl basketball tournament cham pionship game against the hometown favorite, Jackson ville.

title: From Missouri Farm to Fame
description: MY first memory is that of chasing a frog around the backyard in Cass County, Missouri. Grandmother Young watched the performance and thought it very funny that a 2yearold could slap his knee and laugh so loudly at a jumping frog.

title: Major Section of Managua To Serve as Mass Grave
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 26 (UPI)A major section of this shattered city was de clared a contaminated area today, and a fire department official said it would be leveled and covered with lime to serve as a mass grave for the un known number of people who died in it in the earthquakes Saturday.

title: Rural Westchester Town Torn by Housing Plan
description: SOUTH SALEM, N. Y., Dec. 26The rural northern West chester County town of Lewisboro will end the year engaged in the painful proc ess of planning for a future that may bring major changes in the size and composition of its population.

title: Gus Hall Sees Swindle
description: Gus Hall, general secretary of the Communist Party, U.S.A., said yesterday that President Nixon was guilty of political treachery without precedent and never intended to sign the Vietnam peace agreement. The President's adviser, Henry A. Kissinger, added to Mr. Nix on's swindle, Mr. Hall de clared, when he said the North Vietnamese wanted to change the agreement, The Associated Press reported.

title: Rockets Win in Final Seconds
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 26 (AP)  Dave Robish of Denver hit two free throws with 22 seconds remaining tonight to lead the Rockets to a 103101 victory over the San Diego Conquista dors.

title: Unofficial JapanTaiwan Link Set Up
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 26 The Japanese and the Chinese Nationalists signed an agree ment between private organi zations today to carry on con tacts now that their diplomatic relations are officially broken.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Monthly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Yields on United States Treas ury bills rose in the Govern ment's monthly competitive sale today of these short term securities.

title: Bachler of Austria Wins Swiss SkiJumping Contest
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Dec. 26 (AP)  Reinhold Bachler of Austria defeated elite entries from nine nations today to win the traditional Christmas skijumping competi tion on the Olympic Hill.

title: Gifts Exchanged at Sea
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., Dec. 26 (UPI)The crews of an Ameri can Coast Guard cutter and a Russian oceanographic ship exchanged gifts and goodwill on Christmas Day in the At lantic ocean 250 miles off the Maryland Coast. A spokesman for the Fifth Coast Guard Dis trict headquarters here said that the cutter Gresham, out of Little Creek, Va., had been in volved in the exchange with the Russian ship Ernst Krenkel.

title: PROXMIRE IN PLEA FOR NIXON'S CRITIC
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reu ters)  Senator William Prox mire, Democrat of Wisconsin, today called on Defense Secre tary Melvin R. Laird to stop any further harassment of Gor don Rule, a Government official who criticized President Nixon.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Dec. 26Monmouth Col lege seems to have the holiday spirit on a yearround basis. This private shore college offers its facilities to the surrounding community through all seasons. The latest move in this neighborly approach will be the first Mon mouthOcean County girls's scholastic basketball tourna ment in the college's Memorial Gymnasium tomorow, Thursday and Saturday.

title: SOVIET STARTS UP ANOTHER REACTOR
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26The So viet Union announced today the startup of a fourth reactor at biggest nuclear power ta tion, increasing the station's total electrical capacity to 1.5 million kilowatts.

title: Circus: Kelly's Troupe
description: Such distractions as uncer tain weather and overly energetic, vacationing young sters notwithstanding, this is still the time to be merry. And the Emmett Kelly Jr. Circus, which began a week's stand yesterday at the Brook lyn Academy of Music, may do nothing about a gray win ter but it certainly spreads some bright cheer among the local, subvoting set.

title: Paper to Shorten Its Name
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The Hearst Corporation's newspaper in this city will shorten its name to the Boston Herald American on Jan. 1, 1973. The paper has carried one of the na tion's longest titles for a daily, The Boston Herald Traveler and Record American, since two publications merged last June.

title: Market Place: Specialist's View Of Skyline Halt
description: The Skyline Corporation, the largest producer of mobile homes, took a dive in Big Board trading yesterday following a negative earnings report that led to a trading halt in the issue on Friday.

title: LAOTIANS REPEAT VIEWS AT TALKS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 26 The Communistled Pathet Lao and the Vientiane Government held their 11th weekly peace negotiating session today with no progress reported and in an atmosphere of marking time.

title: PHILIP HARRIGAN, 79; LED COAL COMPANY
description: Philip Braham Harrigan, who was president of the Sunrise Coal Co., Inc., of Lynbrook, L. I., for more than 20 years until his retirement in 1966, and who had been its chairman since then, died yesterday at the home of his daughter, Mrs. Stuart Sheedy, in Syosett, L. L, after a long illness. He was 79 years old.

title: How Much Bail? Judges Here Find No Easy Answers
description: The talk at judges' luncheon tables downtown yesterday was of Judge Bruce McMarion Wright and the growing con troversy over the $500 cash bail he had set for a man ac cused of shooting a policeman.

title: Boston Rail Loan Set
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (UPI)The Massachusetts Bay Transporta tion Authority has obtained a $19.5million Federal loan to purchase 145 miles of rights of way of the bankrupt Penn Cen tral, railroad in the Boston area. They are used by commuter trains on the New Haven divi sion. The loan will run for 10 years.

title: How's 1972 Business? U.S. Is Taking Its Pulse
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)  The Bureau of the Census began distributing today question naires to the nation's 2.1 mil lion largest companies, the first step in an accounting of the national economic health taken by the Government, every five years.

title: Auto Union Official Gives Plan to Reduce Boredom
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (UPI)A vice president of the United Au tomobile Workers has a plan for reducing boredom on the assembly line. He says it could become a big bargaining issue when contract talks with the Ford Motor Company open in July.

title: Nixon Leads Truman Tributes From U.S. and World Leaders
description: Following are tributes to former President Harry S. Truman that were expressed yesterday:

title: Asians in a British Mill Striking for Right to Better Jobs
description: LOUGHBOROUGH, England, Dec. 22Dennis Parkin, 48 years old and white, holds one of the highestpaying jobs in the hosiery mill on Trinity Street. He has been a knitter for six years and earns up to $120 a week.

title: Mild Quake Shakes Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (UPI)  A mild earthquake jolted northern Japan today.

title: Brief Blackout in the Bronx
description: About 1,200 customers of the Consolidated Edison Company were affected by a brief black out yesterday afternoon in the primarily residential northeast ern Bronx, a company spokes man said. The blackout began at 4:10 P.M. with the short circuit of an underground feedercable in the Orchard Beach section. Power was re stored to all customers by 5:45 P.M., the spokesman said.

title: Borg and Gerulaitis Gain: Quarterfinals in Florida
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dee. 26 (Reuters)Bjorn Borg of Swe den and Vitus Gerulaitis of New York, the two topseeded. players in the boys' 18and. under division, led the advance to the quarter finals todayy in the Orange Bowl international junior tennis tournament.

title: Notes on People
description: Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba made one of his rare, as far as is known, toboggan rides. It happened in the snows of Gander, Newfound land, while the plane taking the Premier home from Mos cow was refueling. The Pre mier laughed as he fell off the toboggan. And, judging from photographs of the event, some of those in the area of the fall laughed, too. There was no indication whether Mr. Castro had any snow fun in Moscow, which he had just visited for the second time in 1972.

title: Blazers Rout Saints, 62
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 26 (AP) Danny Lawson got three goals and Andre LaCroix had one and three assists as the Philadelphia Blazers routed the Minnesota Fighting Saints, 62, tonight.

title: Transport Plane Prototypes Authorized by Air Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) Air Force Secretary Robert C. Seamans authorized the Boeing Company and McDonnell Doug las Corporation today to begin building competitive prototypes of a short takeoff transport plane that Could eventually re place the workhorse C130 troop and cargo carrier.

title: MORE BIG BANKS LIFT PRIME RATE
description: Many of the nation's largest banks, as had been anticipated, acted yesterday to increase their prime, or minimum, terest rates on business loans to 6 per cent from 5 per cent.

title: UNIFORM PRICE PLAN IS SET BY A G.E. UNIT
description: The General Electric Com pany announced yesterday that its audio electronics prod ucts department would intro duce a new uniform price plan for the sale of the department's products to all customers, be ginning Jan. 1.

title: Medical College Seeks Links in Westchester
description: VALHALLA, N. Y., Dec. 26 New York Medical College, which brought its first class of students to its new Westchester County campus here this year, is now working to establish for mal ties with the county's 13 community hospitals.

title: Doctor Opposes Tattoos
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 26 (AP) A Navy doctor who wants to do away with tattoos, Capt. William Carson, head of derma tology at San Diego Naval Hos pital, says that needle work is not only painful and hard to remove but also medically dan gerous. He says that tattoos can turn into a major allergic infection or bring on the risk of hepatitis from the needles.

title: Japan's Steel Exports Rose 18% for November
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (AP) Japan's steel exports in No vember totaled 2,017,000 met ric tons, up 18 per cent from October and 0.1 per cent above a year earlier, the Japan Iron and Steel Federation said today.

title: MONEY MARKETS ENTER DOLDRUMS A Few Rates Creep Higher Calm Seen Continuing
description: Credit Markets

title: DROP IN CRIME LAID TO A DRUG PROGRAM
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (UPI)A consultant concern says that a study it did of a drug reha bilitation program of the De troit Recorder's Court has pro duced statistical evidence show ing that such programs reduce crime. It estimated there was a drop of 5,181 in drugrelated arrests in Detroit in 1971.

title: RCA Says PostComputer Profit Is Up
description: The RCA Corporation will have record sales for 1972 and earnings of more than $2 a share, Robert W. Sarnoff, chair man and chief executive of ficer, said yesterday in a year end statement.

title: Halle and Filor Merge
description: Halle & Stieglitz, Inc., and Filer; Bullard & Smyth, two member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, said their pre viously announced merger had become effective yesterday. They said the merged house was called Halle & Stieglitz, Filor Bullard Inc. and would have 18 domestic offices and three Eu ropean offices.

title: Robert Park Weds Sharon Collins
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Miss Sharon Alden Collins and Robert E. Park were mar ried here yesterday afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church, Lafayette Square, by the Rev. John C. Harper, the rector.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ATLANTIC BEACH, L. I., Dec. 26The remains of an 11,000gallon oil spill into Reynolds Channel were expect ed to dissipate tonight through wind, rain and tides, a Coast Guard spokesman said today. The spill, described as light heating oil, had occurred yes terday when a 240foot oil barge rammed the Atlantic Beach bridge.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The State Department said today that Australia's decision to revalue its currency is a constructive move to adjust her trade and payment imbalances.

title: COLONELS DOWN PACERS, 129120
description: LOUISVILLE, Dec. 26 (UPI) Dan Issel scored a season high of 38 points for the Ken tucky Colonels tonight as they withstood a 23point outburst by George McGinnis in the fi nal quarter to post their 14th triumph in their last 15 games, a 129120 victory over the In diana Pacers.

title: Jury Begins Investigation Into Drug Losses by Police
