description: A grand jury began taking testimony yesterday in the re cently disclosed theft of 300 pounds of heroin and cocaine from the Police Department, and a judge threatened Police Commissioner Patrick V. Mur phy and two of his aides with contempt for refusing to coop erate with the jury.

title: Wings Tie Penguins, 11
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (UPI) Nick Libett's goal with 6:22 to play gave the Detroit Red Wings a 11 tie with the Pitts burgh Penguins tonight.

title: NEW U.S. BOMBING ASSAILED BY HANOI
description: PARIS, Dec. 26North Viet nam denounced today the re sumption of American bombing of Hanoi but indicated it was willing to resume negotiation if the attacks halted.

title: TRUMAN, 33D PRESIDENT IS DEAD; SERVED IN TIME OF FIRST ABOMB, MARSHALL PLAN, NATO AND KOREA
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 26 Harry S. Truman, the 33d President of the United States, died this morning. He was 88 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: Ask a top creative man at an ad agency about develop ing trends in his area of the business and more likely than not he'll talk about Govern ment regulation and its effects.

title: KARL F. ZEISLER
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. 26 (AP)Karl F. Zeisler, a retired University of Michigan journal ism professor and former managing editor of The Evening News, Monroe, Mich., died of a heart attack Saturday at his home here. He was 69 years old.

title: Bula Is 45 Favorite Today In Irish Sweepstakes Race
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 26 (AP)Bula an Englishbred jumper, was rated a 45 favorite to win the Irish Sweepstakes hurdle race tomorrow.

title: Nonfinancial Corporations Increase. Working Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  Working capital of nonfinancial corporations rose $3.9billion in the third quarter to a total of $219billion, the Securities and Exchange Commission reported today.

title: WHEAT FUTURES UP IN ACTIVE DAY
description: Wheat and potatoes forged ahead in active futures trading yesterday for entirely different reasons.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: SOMERVILLE, Dec. 26 On the desk of Lawrence G. Kersta sits a small statue of Don Quixote. It symbolizes a 10year controversy that the scientist weathered to have his system of identificationvoice prints  begin to win broad acceptance by both the scien tific and legal professions.

title: Furniture Store in Queens Agrees to Heed Complaints
description: Michaels Furniture, a store at 6510 Myrtle Avenue, Glendale Queens, signed a 17point as surance of discontinuance yes terday with the city's Depart ment of Consumer Affairs in which it promised to pay more heed to complaints of damaged or delayed merchandise.

title: Man of Independence
description: Harry S. Truman waged the last fight of his long life with the same courage and stamina that never failed him during nearly eight taxing years as President of the United States. Thrust into the highest office by the death of Franklin D. Roosevelt, this unassuming, smalltown politician drew on hidden reserves of those qualities, along with decisiveness and rocklike integrity, to meet with credit the staggering challenges of a momentous era in history and vindicate democracy's faith in the common man.

title: 10 on Radio Staff in Protest
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 26 (AP)Ten employes of radio station WIFI walked off their jobs today to protest what they termed the station's lack of sensitivity to community prob lems and the lack of equal job opportunity for blacks and women.

title: CANADA G.M., FORD PLAN PRICE FREEZES
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 26 (UPI)In dustry, Trade and Commerce Minister Alastair Gillespie an nounced today that General Motors of Canada and the Ford Motor Company of Canada had agreed to freeze prices for 1973 model cars at current levels.

title: Dean Acheson Article Recalls Vigorous and Decisive Leader
description: This appraisal of former President Harry S. Truman was written for Life maga zine by the late Dean Ache son in 1964 and was twice updated, the last time in 1970. It was made available to The New York Times by Life, whose final issue went to press before Mr. Truman's death.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The 75th anniversary of the birth of the Russian film master Sergei Eisenstein will be commemorated by a series of screenings and lectures co sponsored by Anthology Film Archives and the cinema studies department of New York University. The three week film retrospective be gins Jan. 23 at archives head quarters, 425 Lafayette Street. During the same period, sem inars and lectures will be held at N.Y.U.... The River Niger, the play by Joseph A. Walker being presented at the Negro Ensemble Com pany's St. Mark's Playhouse, has had its run extended from Dec. 31 to Feb. 4.... Mrs. Sean O'Casey, widow of the Irish dramatist, will come from Dublin to attend the opening of the Lincoln Cen ter Repertory Theater's pro duction of The Plough and the Stars at the Vivian Beaumont Theater on Jan. 4. Previews will begin on Satur day. The production, staged by Dan Sullivan, will run through Feb. 10.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Books of The Times
description: THE MAILING OF A PSYCHIATRIST. By David S. Viscott; M.D. 410 pages. Arbor House. $8.95.

title: Macurdy Steps In As Mephistopheles To Shine in Faust
description: For seven seasons at the Metropolitan Opera, John Ma curdy has been a standby for the role of Mephistopheles in Gounod's Faust, and waiting patiently for someone to ask him to sing it. On Christmas night, the call finally came: Ceasare Siepi was suddenly in disposed, and on a few hours' notice, Mr. Macurdy not only saved the day but also stole the show.

title: Soviet Ending Income Tax for Low Paid
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26The So viet Government, apparently in a New Year gesture, an nounced today that personal income taxes in the lowest brackets would be gradually reduced as the minimum wage is being raised to the equiva lent of $85 a month.

title: Saudi Pipeline Start Set
description: TULSA, Okla., Dec. 26 (AP) Construction on a major pipeline complex in Saudi Ara bia will begin next month, the Williams Brothers International Corporation announced today. The Tulsa company is build ing it for the Arabian Ameri can Oil Company. The project calls for about 450 kilometers of pipeline ranging from eight to 48 inches. Construction is due to be finished next Octo ber, the company said.

title: Study Finds Incomes More Unequal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26A changing population and changing industrial structure are producing a persistent trend toward inequality in the distribution of income among wage and salary earners in the United States, a study pub lished by the Labor Department has found.

title: Navy Buys $1.7Million in Stock Of Ailing Defense Plant on L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 26 The Navy has purchased all 17,414 shares of preferred stock in the Gap Instrument Corpora tion here as a means of helping the company, which has been experiencing heavy cost over runs. This has made the De partment of Defense the largest single stockholder in the com pany.

title: Freedom of the Press in the United States
description: The media is at a time when it has a great number of crises and it needs public support. I think it deserves it. I think that doesn't preclude a contin ual selfexamination by the media, selfexamination of thought process by the American public, becauselike the adversary relationship between government and the press, which, I think, is healthy and necessaryso certainly is an adversary relationship in some ways between the public and the press.

title: Guard Records Burned
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 26 (AP)A fire today heavily dam aged the California Military De partment headquarters on the fifth floor of the state Depart ment of Motor Vehicles build ing. Officials said personnel rec ords for all 27,000 active mem bers of the state Air and Army National Guards were destroyed. Lieut. Col. Andrew Wolf spokes man for the military depart ment, said the personnel records could be duplicated by individ ual guard units, however.

title: Jury Begins Investigation Into Drug Losses by Police
description: A grand jury began taking testimony yesterday in the re cently disclosed theft of 300 pounds of heroin and cocaine from the Police Department, and a judge threatened Police Commissioner Patrick V. Mur phy and two of his aides with contempt for refusing to coop erate with the jury.

title: Price Agency Acts On Soybeans' Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)  The Price Commission today suspended the volatile pric ing rule for the country's 18 largest soybean processing companies, saying prices have risen too far too rapidly.

title: Israel Announces Raid By Planes Into Syria
description: TEL AVIV, Wednesday, Dec. 27 (UPI)Israel announced that her warplanes raided Arab guerrilla bases in Syria today in their first cross frontier strikes in five weeks.

title: Yankelovich Adds Facility
description: A new simulated testmarket facility to study consumer re actions to new products has been opened by Daniel Yankelo vich, Inc., a leading marketing and social research organization. Located at 360 Sylvan Avenue, Englewod Cliffs, N.J., the facil ity has been designed to accom modate the expanding business at the company's previous cen ter in Montclair, N.J.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 26Gov ernor Cahill signed a bill today extending Newark's special taxing authority for a year. The bill, sponsored by Assemblyman George C. Rich ardson, Democrat of Essex, continues until Jan. 1, 1974, the special city taxing pow ers authorized in 1970.

title: Air Taxi Rules Tightened
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)Reacting to a series of accidents, the National Trans portation Safety Board an nounced today more stringent safety requirements for oper ators of air taxis.

title: Fear Has Left Haiti's Streets, And There Are Changes in the Air
description: PORT  AU  PRINCE, Haiti, Dec. 15  In a fashionable neighborhood called Canap Vert, next to a school called the Peter Pan Kindergarten, a big Buick sits in its garage. No one has driven it for a month and a layer of white dust cov ers its hood.

title: Huff to Start for East
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 26 (AP)  Gary Huff of Florida State was named today the East's starting quarterback for Saturday's Shrine football game, but the assignment for the West was left open between Ty Paine of Washington State and George Amundson of Iowa State.

title: Tug of War Strains West Side Housing
description: An empty brickstrewn lot on the Upper West Side, first scheduled for middleincome housing and now slated for low income housing, has become the symbol of controversy be tween groups in the neighbor hood that are dedicated to preserving the ethnic and eco nomic mix in the area but that cannot agree on how to do it.

title: Mao 79 Years Old; Birthday, as Usual, Passes Unobserved
description: PEKING, Dec. 26 (Reuters) Chairman Mao Tsetung was 79 years old today, but as usual there was no sign of any public celebration of his birth day.

title: Wanted: Doctors, Dentists, LawyersMen Need Not Apply
description: If you can find me a good woman dentist, let me know  and I also have somebody who needs a good woman bonesurgeon, said Kris Glen, on the phone, mak ing the urgent halfconspira torial inquiry that is now familiar among members of the women's movement.

title: Massachusetts U. Accepts Rejected Graduate. Student
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 26 (AP)The University of Massa chusetts reversed itself today and agreed to accept a 28 yearold black student into the Graduate School of Education next month.

title: South Carolina Beats Villanova in Festival
description: South Carolina used poise and discipline, while Michigan depended on physical strength last night, as both teams gained the semifinal round of the Hol iday Festival college basketball tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: GEN. C. L. BISSELL, AVIATOR, IS DEED
description: Maj. General Clayton L. Bis sell, a World War I ace who was aviation officer on Gen. Joseph W. Stilwell's staff in China early in World War II and then commanded the 10th Air Force from New Delhi, died Sunday in the Veterans Ad ministration Hospital in Mur freesboro, Tenn. He was 76 years bid and lived in Signal Mountain, Tenn.

title: Mourning in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 26 (UPI) Acting Gov. T. Clark Hull to day proclaimed Thursday a day of public mourning and prayer in Connecticut. He ordered banks closed.

title: Boggs Memorial Planned In New Orleans on Jan. 4
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 26 (AP)  Plans were announced today for a Jan. 4 memorial mass and public tribute for Hale Boggs, the House majority leader, who was lost Oct. 16 on a flight from Anchorage to Juneau, Alaska.

title: Flight From Hanoi Canceled
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 26 A. flight to and from Hanoi scheduled today by the three nation International Control Commission was canceled at the last moment because of a radio communication from the con trol tower at Hanoi's Gia Lam Airport, saying it would be un safe to land.

title: Rockets Top Suns, 113110
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 26 (AP)  Otto Moore sank a pressure free throw with six seconds left today to clinch a 113110 National Basketball Association victory for the Houston Rockets over the Phoenix Suns.

title: Ships and Planes Search Pacific for Missing Vessel
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Dec. 26 (UPI)Ships and planes inten sified a search 800 miles south of Kodiak today for a 570foot cargo ship that vanished in the stormy North Pacific Sunday with a crew of 33. Canadian and United States Coast Guard vessels and planes were par ticipating along with three mer chant ships.

title: Cowens Excels as Celtics. Defeat Knicks, 115106
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26The Bos ton Celtics have compiled the best record in the National Bas ketball Association this season and tonight they gave the New York Knicks and a capacity crowd of 15,320 at Boston Gar den a thumping demonstration of how they have done it.

title: Retailers Expect 10% Gain in Christmas Sales
description: While yesterday's shoppers at the big New York stores were taking advantage of the post  Christmas sales and thinner crowds, retail execu tives spent much of the day counting up the results of their December efforts.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Ac tors Equity of Australia has announced a union ban on foreign performers in this country, with exceptions for international stars, cultural attractions and others whose appearance clearly would not take work from Austral ians.

title: Science at Sea
description: One hundred years ago this month, HMS Challenger set sail from Portsmouth, England, on the world's first voyage devoted to purely scientific exploration of the seas. The science of oceanography has made incredible strides since then, especially now when new technology enables man to probe the deepest ocean floor.

title: MACARIO GARCIA, 52, A WORLD WAR II HERO
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Macario Garcia, who received the Medal of Honor for his ac tions in World War II, died Sunday night after an auto ac cident. He was 52 years old.

title: Bulls Rout Kings, 117103
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (AP) The Chicago Bulls put on a blistering offensive and defen sive show tonight to coast to a 117103 decision over the Kan sas CityOmaha Kings.

title: Hearing Scheduled On Stock Proposal Of MOPAC Road
description: Federal District Judge Ed ward Weinfeld will hold a hear ing here Jan. 25 on the fairness of a proposed recapitalization plan, under which the Missouri Pacific Railroad would issue 1.8 million shares of a new $5 cumulative, convertible preferred stock and 635,696 shares of a new common stock.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 26A boxer who won all his fights back in the nineteentwenties still works out daily in a gym nasium, but today 63year old Joe Brown is sculpturing instead of boxing. He is head of Princeton University's sculpture department, and his works adorn public and private buildings in this country and elsewhere.

title: Dorsey Named Publisher Of Rochester Newspapers
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 26 (AP) Eugene C. Dorsey was ap pointed publisher of The Rochester TimesUnion and The Democrat and Chronicle today. He succeeds Paul Miller, chairman and chief executive of the Gannett Company, which owns both newspapers as well as 51 others in 16 states.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: People and Business
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank is sending Alfred R. Went worth, a topranking inter national specialist, overseas to be the bank's man in Mos cow. He will head the first United States representative bank office in the Soviet Union in more than 50 years. The Soviet Union last month gave Chase permission to establish an office in Moscow.

title: National Day of Mourning Proclaimed by President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 President Nixon today declared Thursday a national day of mourning for former President Harry S. Truman and made plans to pay his personal re spects tomorrow in Independ ence, Mo.

title: Dr. Lester Plum, Economist And Investment Aide, Dies
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 26 Dr. Lester V. Plum, an econ omist and retired investment officer with Brown Brothers Harriman, investment bankers, died yesterday in the Merwick unit of Princeton Medical Cen ter. He was 66 years old and lived at 24 Murray Place.

title: U.S. SAYS BOMBING IS BACK AT LEVEL PRECEDING PAUSE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 27With its 36hour pause in the bombing of North Vietnam ended, the United States command said yesterday that the planes were once again operating as they had last week, when the raids were the heaviest of the war.

title: Aeros Tie Nationals, 33
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 26 (AP)  Keke Mortson's fifth goal of the World Hockey Association cam paign with 5 minutes left in the third period tonight enabled the Houston Aeros to tie the Ottawa Nationals, 33.

title: People in Sports: Skorich Stays
description: Receiving praise as if his Browns were still in the run ning for the Super Bowl crown, Coach Nick Skorich was signed yesterday to threeyear contract extend ing through the 1975 National Football League season.

title: Divestiture Order to GeorgiaPacific Is Made Final
description: Merger News

title: Lefkowitz Obtains Writ on Stock Sale
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yester day that he had obtained an order in State Supreme Court requiring a Tennessee land com pany to repay $1million in stock it had sold earlier this year to a Wall Street broker dealer.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Jim Hall and Carl Haas have had second thoughts about running a Lola on the Championship Trail of the United States Auto Club and have switched to the $535,000 L&M Championship series of nine road races for Formula 5000 cars. The driver about to be signed up is Brian Red man, the English man who finished fourth in the 1972 standings after winning the Riv erside race on Sept. 24.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARIS Not even the Kissingers of this world are entirely sure just who are full members of their club. Thus I have been told at various times by one or another of this select estab lishment that Frau Katharina Focke, charming expert on Western Europe, is really Chancellor Brandt's Kissinger or that Robert Temple Armstrong, principal private secretary to the Prime Minister, is really Mr. Heath's Kis singer. In neither case is this correct.

title: Turkish Military Court Sentences ExLaw Dean
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 26  A military tribunal here has sen tenced the former dean of Ankara University's law school, who has been defense counsel of several prominent Turkish intellectuals, to six years and four months in jail.

title: U.S. TO SPEED PAYING OF IMPORT CLAIMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reu ters)The Treasury said today that United States customs regulations had been amended to permit prompt payment of drawback claims.

title: Issues in the L.I.R.R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and 12 unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, elec trical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: And This Should Outrage the Conscience of All Americans
description: WASHINGTONIn recent weeks President Nixon has had another op portunity to end the Indochina tragedy and accomplish the return of our pris oners of war  on a basis which would have had the support and praise of all Americans. But events suggest a return to the same old war. For we cannot read about the heavy bombing, the new targets, and the unprece dented loss of American pilots and planes, without a deep and despairing sense that peace is not at hand.

title: Rosewall Is Upset by an Obscure German
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 26 (AP)  National tennis heroes, Ken Rosewall, Mal An derson and Colin Dibley were secondround casualties today as the troubled Australian open suffered a further loss of draw ing power.

title: Men's Ski Team in TuneUp
description: KINGFIELD, Me., Dec. 26 (AP)  Nine members of the United States men's ski team arrived at Sugarloaf Mountain today to begin a week's tune up for a series of World Cup and Europa races in Europe early next month.

title: IRT Trains Still Slowed By Rupture of a Steampipe
description: IRT subway trains of the BroadwaySeventh Avenue line were still running at reduced speeds between 116th and 181st Streets yesterday as workmen repaired electrical feeder lines that apparently were burned out by a Consolidated Edison Company steampipe.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PATERSON, Dec. 26  A grand jury investigation into the operation of government in Passaic, particularly the ac tions of the Zoning and Plan ning Boards there, will start next month.

title: SINYAVSKY REPORTED TO SEEK AN EXIT VISA
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26Andrei D. Sinyaysky, the Soviet liter ary critic and author convicted of illegally publishing works abroad, has asked permission to leave for an indefinite stay in France, usually reliable sources reported today.

title: Robert Adrian Scott Dies; Film WriterProducer, 61
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 26 (AP) Robert Adrian Scott, a film writerproducer who served a year in prison for refusing to testify before the House Un American Activities Committee, died yesterday at his home in suburban Sherman Oaks. He was 61 years old and recently had undergone surgery for cancer.

title: CITY RELIEF CLERK ACCUSED OF FRAUD
description: A senior clerk at a city wel fare center was arrested yes terday and charged with having fraudulently received $14,000 in welfare payments over the last five years while holding a vari ety of government jobs.

title: Appraisal of the Arts
description: The second half of an as sessment of the year in art and culture by nine critics for The New York Times ap pears on Page 29.

title: East German Flees to West
description: BONN, Dec. 26 (Reuters)A young East German smashed through three roadblocks in private car today and escaped to West Germany, the Bavarian Interior Ministry in Munich said. The escape occurred at the Hirschberg crossing point near Hof, on the main Berlin Munich road. The ministry's announcement said that the man was a 19yearold elec trician. He was not identified by name.

title: Eason Oil to Help Explore Dutch Zone of North Sea
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 26 (Reuters)The Eason Oil Com pany said today it is a member of a group of four companies that has been awarded an ex ploration license in the Dutch sector of the North Sea.

title: JOSEPH F. RYAN
description: TOTOWA, N. J., Dec. 26  Joseph F. Ryan, superintendent of writs in the Passaic County Prosecutor's office, and a for mer Democratic Mayor of this community, died last evening at his home, apparently of a heart ailment. He was 59 years old.

title: Cannibalism After Air Crash Reported
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 26 (AP)Official sources said to day that some survivors of a plane crash at 12,000 feet in the Andes told of having eaten parts of the bodies of dead companions to keep from starv ing in an ordeal of more than two months.

title: Administration Weighs Energy Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) President Nixon's forthcom ing message on energy may propose measures to pass along steep price increases on natural gas to large industrial users, says Kenneth Lay, executive di rector of the Interior Depart ment's new energy board.

title: Study Finds Incomes More Unequal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26A changing population and a changing industrial structure are producing a persistent trend toward inequality in the distribution of income among wage and salary earners in the United States, a study pub lished by the Labor Department has found.

title: Tug of War Strains West Side Housing
description: An empty brickstrewn lot on the Upper West Side, first scheduled for middleincome housing and now slated for low income housing, has become the symbol of controversy be tween groups in the neighbor hood that are dedicated to preserving the ethnic and eco nomic mix in the area but that cannot agree on how to do it.

title: Strike of PATH on Jan. 3 Voted by Carmen's Union
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 26The Brotherhood of Railway Carmen voted tonight to strike the Port Authority Trans Hudson transit line at 12:01 A.M. on Jan. 3 if a new contract has not been signed by then.

title: Young Socialists Open Parley; To Weigh New Politics Split
description: Five days of debates and re ports by Socialist party lead ers, focusing on their split with the new politics wing of the Democratic party and their recently str??ngthened. alliance with organized labor, began last night when the Young People's socialist League vened its national conven tion here.

title: State and City to Mourn
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay yesterday de clared a 30day period of mourning for New York State and New York City and ordered flags flown at halfstaff for that period.

title: Paper States Howard Hughes Departed Nicaragua for Florida
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 26 (AP)  The Miami News said today that Howard Hughes flew to Fort Lauder dale in his private jet Sunday after spending a night in his limousine outside an earth quakebattered hotel in Mana gua, Nicaragua.

title: Bombing and the Outlook for Business
description: Economic Analysis

title: Great Lakes Dikes Slated
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (AP) The United States Almy Corps of Engineers announced today a dikebuilding program de signed to project lowlying areas along the shores of the Great Lakes. The program was precipitated by the autumn flooding along Lake Erie in Michigan and Ohio.

title: Combs Paces Stars
description: SALT LAKE. CITY, Dec. 26 (AP)The Utah Stars, behind the longrange bombing of Glen Combs, ran up a 14point lead in the first ?? held off a late Memphis rally and downed the Tams, 119112, tonight.

title: School Board Intends to Offer to Buy Up Scribner's Contract
description: The Board of Education was drafting a letter yesterday that it intends to send to School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner, outlining a proposal to buy up his contract.

title: Finding of Quake Fault at Atomic Plant Site Disputed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Findings by a Gov ernment survey of an active earthquake fault on the pro posed site for the nation's larg est nuclear power plant were disputed today by the power company planning the $830 million facility.

title: U.S. SAYS BOMBING IS BACK AT LEVEL PRECEDING PAUSE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 27With its 36hour pause in the bombing of North Vietnam ended, the United States command said yesterday that the planes were once again operating as they had last week, when the raids were the heaviest of the war.

title: Critics at a Times Roundtable Say New York Is the Place for Trends in Arts
description: As far as new art is concerned, as far as new esthetic ideas are con cerned, as far as young artists and composers hungry for an audience are concerned, New York remains the place, and there is nothing that comes even close.

title: CITY AIDES TO LOSE APPROVAL POWER ON NEW BUILDING
description: In a Major move aimed at reducing graftinducing situa tions in the construction in dustry, the city will shift au thority for initial building ap proval next month from its 75 plan examiners to individual owners, architects and engi neers.

title: Raid on Hanoi Called Heaviest in War
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse) American bombers tonight con ducted the most violent air at tack on Hanoi since the begin ning of the war.

title: Nolan Says Cowboys Can Win It All
description: About Pro Football

title: Nolan, 49ers' Coach, Contends Dallas Club Should W in It All
description: ing attack hardly compares to Washington's.

title: Reuben B. Robertson, 93, Dies, ExHead of Champion Paper
description: ASHEVILLE, N. C., Dec. 26 Reuben B. Robertson, former president and chairman of the board of the Champion Paper & Fibre Company, now Cham pion International, died today at his home, Hopemont, on Town Mountain Road. He was 93 years old.

title: U.S. Calls Raids Major Effort
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26A Pentagon spokesman said today the air war against Hanoi and Haiphong had resumed and continues to be a very major effort.

title: FUNDS CANCELED ON CONSERVATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) The Nixon Administration ended two popular conservation programs last Friday without advance warning. The programs were established by Congress and would have distributed more than $200 million a year in rural areas.

title: GRAND JURY GETS POLICE SHOOTING
description: A grand jury here began an investigation yesterday of the holdup shooting of a patrolman a case that has stirred con troversy because of the release of the suspect in $500 cash bail.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26Japan's balanceofpayments surplus totaled $672million in November, a decline from $935 million in the previous month, the Finance Ministry and the Bank of Japan announced jointly today.

title: CONSTANTINE BASTIAS
description: ATHENS, Dec. 26 (AP)  Constantine Bastias, a journal ist, writer and historian, died today of heart failure. He was 71 years old.

title: Gratton's Goal Decides
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 26 (AP)  JeanGuy Gratton's closein goal midway In the third period tonight carried the West Divisionleading Winnipeg Jets to a hardearned 32 victory over the lastplace Chicago Cou gars.

title: Israel and Greece Hail Truman as Ally
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 26The Par iament in Jerusalem interrupted its session today upon learning of the death of President Tru man and rose in tribute to him.

title: Quake Impairs Alaska Base
description: PALMER, Alaska, Dec. 26 (AP)A moderate earthquake centered 30 miles southeast, of Adak Island caused minor dam age today at the Adak naval base. No injuries were reported.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reuters)The Tariff Com mission said today that color TV picture tubes imported from Japan were not injuring American companies and should not become subject to special dumping duties. The commissioners' vote was unanimous.

title: Canadian Ketch Hits Whale But Leads in Aussie Race
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 26 (AP)  The Canadian 72foot ketch, Graybeard, and Ted Turner's 68foot sloop, Ameri can Eagle, led a bunched fleet today 12 hours after the start of the 630mile yacht race from Sydney to Hobart, Tasmania.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26President Nixon has sent the bombers over North Vietnam again, but it is hard to see how this air war can go on for long at the present rate.

title: Canadiens Down Blues, 41
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 26 (UPI) Jacques Lemaire, leading the National Hockey League in goals, scored his 28th and 29th of the season tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to 41 victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Science Talks Open in Capital; A. A. A.S. Scored by Dissidents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  The nation's largest annual sci ence conference opened today amid a torrent of words and a ripple of protest.

title: Authors Decry Snags in Marketing
description: Alvin Toffler, the author of Future Shock, says he is shocked at how had it is for the average writer to get his books into the hands of readers. George Plimpton, the author of Paper Lion, thinks some publishers tend to be paper tigers when it comes to marketing books. And Samm Sinclair Baker, coauthor of The Doctor's Quick Weight Loss Diet, says that unless a book is a best seller, the author's fi nancial pickings are likely to be slim.

title: Latin Aid Bank Says Fund For Soft Loans Increased
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26The Inter  American Development Bank announced today that the United States and other mem ber countries have made suffi cient pledges of funds to make effective a $1.5billion increase in the bank's soft loan Fund for Special Operations.

title: Peronist Leader Wounded, Apparently in a New Split
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 26 (AP) Gunshots today wounded a Peronist leader who is a candi date for deputy governor of Buenos Aires Province in the March 11 general election.

title: Psychiatrist Testifies That Deep Throat Could Be Harmful to a Normal Man by Clouding Female Sexuality
description: A 71yearold psychiatrist testified in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday that the hard core pornographic film Deep Throat could be harmful to a normal man because it could blind him to the true nature of female sexuality.

title: Schedule for Funeral
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 26Following is the approxi mate schedule of funeral pro ceedings here for former Presi dent Harry S. Truman. The times are central standard.

title: Appraisal of the Arts
description: The second half of an as sessment of the year in art and culture by nine critics for The New York Times ap pears on Page 29.

title: Aid From 23 Countries
description: GENEVA, Dec. 26  Twenty three national Red Cross so cieties have responded so far to appeals for aid for Nicara guans with relief supplies, doctors and disaster experts, the League of Red Cross Sobi eties said tonight.

title: Bullets Down Braves, 121104
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 26 (UPI)  The Baltimore Bullets, getting balanced scoring from six men, posted a 121104 victory over the Buffalo Braves tonight be fore 7,261 in Memorial Audi. torium.

title: Dow Average Rises 2.49; Skyline Off by 14 Points
description: Skyline Corporation, a for mer glamour favorite on Wall Street, plunged 14 points to 32 in a reaction to lower quarterly earnings yesterday while stock prices generally edged up.

title: Wedding of Dr. Judith Cohen To Budd Levinson Held Here
description: Dr. Judith S. Cohen was married here yesterday after noon to Budd Levinson of East Hampton, L.I., and New York. Justice Owen McGivern of the State Supreme Court Appellate Division performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's brother and sister inlaw, Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Ochs Sulzberger.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JAPANESE TIE SET BY MERRILL LYNCH
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc. and the Nomura Securities Company announced yesterday that they would of fer the first mutual fund es tablished in the United States expressly for sale in the Japa nese capital market.

title: SWEDISH COMMENT BRINGS U.S. PROTEST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reu ters)The United States has strongly protested to Sweden over Premier Olof Palme's statement Saturday comparing the United States bombing of Hanoi to Nazi massacres in World War II, a State Depart ment spokesman said today. The Swedish Ambassador, Hu bert de Besche, was called to the department Saturday by Acting Secretary of State U. Alexis Johnson and was given the oral protest.

title: Congress Urged to Act on L.I.R.R. Strike
description: Leaders of the Freight Users Association of Long Island, re porting that the 27dayold strike against the Long Island Rail Road had caused severe economic losses, announced plans yesterday to organize a coalition to seek action by Con gress to settle the dispute.

title: Memphis State Triumphs
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 26 (AP)  Larry Finch scored a career high 35 points tonight to pace the Memphis State Tigers to a 9664 basketball victory over Cornell University.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The naming of jurors for the 1973 National Book Awards has been completed with the announcement of panels selected to judge en tries in the sciences, transla tion and fiction. A prize of $1,000 will be presented in each of 10 categories on April 12 at Alice Tully Hall. Panels for the seven other categories were announced previously.

title: Stage: Actors Louder Than Words
description: The Little Theater of the Deaf, the children's theater division of David Hays' Na tional Theater of the Deaf, acts not with spoken words but with word pictures. As Richard Casselman, the only performer who speaks in the current show, said yesterday (at the first performance in the company's special one week engagement at the American Place Theater) the actors use hands, faces and bodies, pantomime, facial expressions, signs and voice. Even without Mr. Cassel man's helpful translation, they communicate with ex uberance and sensitivity.

title: Cavaliers Beat Hawks, 11596
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Austin Carr tossed in 26 points and Lenny Wilkens added 24 tonight as the Cleve land Cavaliers snapped a nine game losing streak by rolling to a 11596 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Waldorf Is Setting for Cornelia Cotillion
description: Twelve young women were presented to the Right Rev. Jonathan Goodhue Sherman, Episcopal Bishop of Long Is land, yesterday at the Cathe dral of the Incarnation in Garden City, L. I. After the presentation a reception and dinner and the 12th Cornelia Cotillion took place in the Grand Ballroom of the Wal dorfAstoria.

title: Dance: Balinese Fire at City Center
description: It has been 20 years since a group of dancers and musi cians from Bali first came to tile United Statesa time span obviously not long enough for intercultural tol erance to mature. At last night's opening of the Dancers of Bali and Gamelan of Sebatu at the City Center, certain members of the public made their getaway at inter mission. This was a pity, for the second half of the pro gram by that disciplined and fine group was the best.

title: Soviet Merchant Fleet 5th in World, Ahead of U.S.
description: Port Notes

title: New Dominican Police Chief
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, Dec. 26 (UPI) President Joaquin Balaguer re placed his national police chief, Brig. Gen. Neit Nivar Seijas, to day. Col. Jos Ernesto Brea was named to the post. The Presi dent's press office said General Nivar Seijas would be named to an administrative job this week.

title: Historic Structures Termed in Danger By Preservationist
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) James Biddle does not like to see America's history paved over.

title: Federal Employes Will Face a Check On Output of Work
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 The Civil Service Commission will embark early next year on a major program to develop a new system to measure the productivity and effectiveness of each Federal employe.

title: Marcos Goes to Mindanao
description: MANILA, Dec. 26 (AP) president Ferdinand E. Marcos sailed tonight for troubled areas in southern Mindanao Island to make a personal as sessment of the situation in the predominantly Moslem region. This was his first trip out of Manila since he imposed mar tial law Sept. 22.

title: Penn Central Train Derails
description: RUSSELL, Mass., Dec. 26 (AP)Six cars of a Penn Cent ral freight train bound from Mechanicville, N.Y., to Spring field derailed today and one of the cars, a tanker contain ing vinyl chloride, went into the Westfield River, the state police said. No one was re ported injured.

title: Court Ends HighRise Ban On 2 Queens Housing Units
description: An appeals court yesterday cleared the way for the re sumption of construction of a controversial Lefrak highrise middleincome housing project in Forest HillsKew Gardens, Queens.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 26 (AP) Wisconsin  Milwaukee, sparked by Harold Lee, held off a secondhalf surge and downed Long Island lIniver sity, 8069, tonight in a non conference college basketball game.

title: Chemical Fumes Kill Worker And Hurt 2 Others Critically
description: LANSDOWNE, Pa., Dec. 26 (UPI)One worker was killed and at least two were critically injured today when chemical fumes spread through the Advance Specialty Company plant here.

title: AbdulJabbar Scores 43 But Pistons Stop Bucks
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (AP)Stu Lantz scored 8 of his 37 points in the closing minutes tonight as the Detroit Pistons beat the Milwaukee Bucks, 112105, in a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Navy Buys $1.7Million in Stock Of Ailing Defense Plant on L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 26 The Navy has purchased all 17,414 shares of preferred stock in the Gap Instrument Corpora tion here as a means of helping the company, which has been experiencing heavy cost over runs. This has made the De partment of Defense the largest single stockholder in the com pany.

title: DA NANG BASE AREA IS HIT BY 35 ROCKETS
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, Dec. 27 (UPI)Communist gunners fired 35 rockets into the Ameri canVietnamese air base at Da Nang and surrounding civilian areas just before dawn Monday. One American was slightly wounded and two Vietnamese civilians were killed. Five Amer ican helicopters were damaged or destroyed at the base, which is 370 miles north of Saigon. The attack was the first against the base since Dec. 3.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Central Railroad Study Set

title: CITY AIDES TO LOSE APPROVAL POWER ON NEW BUILDING
description: In a major move aimed at reducing graftinducing situa tions in the construction in dustry, the city will shift au thority for initial building ap proval next month from its 75 plan examiners to individual owners, architects and engi neers.

title: $3Million in U.S. Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) The United States is provid ing $3million in relief supplies and other aid to Nicaragua, the Agency for International De velopment said today.

title: TV: Flirtations With Reality ... in Various Aspects
description: One way to monitor tele vision's flirtations with real ity is to keep track of viewer protests. Not all of them come from cranks.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  The Interstate Commerce Commission tentatively approved today truck freightrate increases of 1 to 3 per cent, subject to appeals that must be filed within a week.

title: LongTime Contributors Help Neediest
description: Four contributors to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday con tinued their long records of giving to the appeal.

title: FOES OF CHARTER HEARD IN MAMA
description: MANILA, Dec. 26A Jesuit priest and a Senator; using the period of free debate authorized by President Ferdinand E. Mar cos under his martiallaw pow ers, raised objections today to the new constitution to be put up for ratification by the voters.

title: 6 ARE NAMED TO PICK 73 NIEMAN FELLOWS
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 26 (AP)  Three newspapermen and three officers of Harvard University will serve on the committee to select Nieman fellows in journalism for the next academic year, Harvard announced today.

title: Lyle Fighter of Year
description: DENVER, Dec. 26 (UPI) The undefeated heavyweight, Ron Lyle, fourth in the World Boxing Association ratings, was named today outstanding fight er of the year by the W.B.A.

title: HARRY S. TRUMAN: DECISIVE PRESIDENT
description: AT 7:09 P.M. on April 12, 1945, Harry t S. Truman, the Vice President of the United States, was elevated by the sud den death of Franklin D. Roosevelt to the Presidency of the United States. He lai:ked a month of being 61 years old, and he had been Vice President for only 83 days when Chief Justice Harlan F. Stone administered the oath in the White House Cabinet Room.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: What to Do?
description: America's bombs sear through North Vietnam's cities and countryside again, perhaps even touching some of the camps where a tragically increasing company of American war prisoners sit helplessly. After a brief obeisance to Christmas, the spirit of war has reemerged untempered. Does the muted popular outcry against the renewed massive bombardments indicate that the Admin istration's grievous policy is having a grievous conse quence here at home: the apathetic withdrawal of con cerned citizens and their representatives in Congress into a mood of hopelessness and resignation? It needn't and mustn't be.

title: GRAND JURY GETS POLICE SHOOTING
description: A grand jury here began an investigation yesterday of the holdup shooting of a patrolman a case that has stirred con troversy because of the release of the suspect in $500 cash bail.

title: TANKER SPILLS OIL IN SOUND ACCIDENT
description: OLD SAYBROOK, Conn., Dec. 26 (AP)An estimated 12,000 gallons of No. 6 heavy, grade fuel oil was spilled into Long Island Sound early today when a tanker barge ran aground on a breakwater at the mouth of the Connecticut River, the Coast Guard said.

title: Net Up 16% at Beatrice Foods on 15% Rise in Sales
Bengalis Burn U.S. Office To Protest Vietnam Bombing
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Dec. 26 (AP)  Students protesting against the bombing of North Vietnam set fire today to the United States Information Cen ter at Rajashahi, 90 miles north west of here, and caused con siderable damage.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 26  The last ladies' day at Liberty Bell Race Track will take place Thursday, it was announced today by the Eagle Downs executive vice presi dent, J. Thomas O'Brien. For the last time women will be admitted upon payment only of a service charge.

title: 19 Dead in BusTruck Collision On Narrow Span in New Mexico
description: FORT SUMNER, N. M., Dec. 26 (AP)At least 19 persons were reported killed today when a bus carrying a church youth group collided with a truck car rying a load of cattle on a nar row bridge, the state police said.

title: SIX ARE WOUNDED IN ULSTER ATTACKS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, (AP)At least six persons were wounded today in an explosion and several shootings that shat tered an uneasy Christmas truce declared by the Irish Republican Army.

title: MRS. JAMES S. ALLEN
description: Mrs. Isabelle Auerbach Allen, educational director of Interna tional Publishers for the last 10 years, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 63 years old and lived at 235 West 71st Street.

title: Greeks Recall Truman Aid
description: ATHENS, Dec. 26  Many Greeks regarded President Truman as the savior of their country because of the massive United States aid that in 1947 enabled Greece to defeat an insurgent Communist attempt to seize power. United States aid that in 1947 enabled Greece to defeat an insurgent Communist attempt to seize power.

title: RALLY BY CANUCKS TOPS SEALS BY 43
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Dec. 26 (AP)Don Tanna hill's third goal of the game in the first minute of the final period today lifted the Van couver Canucks to a 4.3 Na tional Hockey League victory over the California Golden Seals.

title: The S in H.S.T. Stood For No Actual Name
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 26 (AP)Harry S. Truman had no middle name, and it caused a good deal of confu sion. He signed his full name with a continuous stroke that allowed no use of a period after the S, and it was com monly assumed he preferred it that way.

title: The Glorious Comeback of 1948
description: A GONE GOOSE was how Clare Boothe Luce described Harry S. Truman in 1948. With that Repub lican assessment of the President's chances for election on his own, many Democrats agreedFrank Hague of Jersey City and Mayor William O'Dwyer of New York among them. Truman had his own views.

title: DROUGHT MAY SPUR INDIAN GRAIN IMPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI)  India's 1972 drought could force her to increase grain im posts to as high as 185 million bushels, or nearly five million tons for the 197273 marketing year, Agriculture Department officials reported today.

title: By Arthur Schlesinger Jr.
description: The question we are considering to day is the record of our present Gov ernment in balancing rival claims of secrecy and disclosure. No one can doubt the sedulous concern with which the Administration has striven to pre serve secrecy. The issue is whether it has fulfilled the correlative obligation to assure the flow of information es sential to democratic decision. I do not think it has fulfilled, or even under stood, this obligation.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 26Gover nor Cahill today signed a pack age of seven bills designed to eliminate possible equalprotec tion problems in New Jersey's no fault automobile insurance lao, which becomes effective Monday.

title: Philadelphia Policeman Slain
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 26 (AP)A Philadelphia policeman was found shot to death here today, and an intensive search for the killer was begun. Police officials believe that the victim, Thomas Fitzgerald, 28 years old, may have surprised safe crackers as they fled a restau rant.

title: National Day of Mourning Proclaimed by President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 President Nixon today declared Thursday a national day of mourning for former President Harry S. Truman and made plans to pay his personal re spects tomorrow in Independ ence, Mo.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The division of power between the executive and the legislative branches of our Government has come in for a good deal of critical discussion. This has been particularly so during the second half of the first Nixon Admin istration. Whenever the balance of power swings to the side of the execu tive branch, the anguished cries in crease.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Leone Criticizes Estimate Board

title: $98,000 Mercantile Seat
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (AP)A membership in the Chicago Mercantile Exchange today sold for a record $98,000, Everette B. Harris, president, announced. The largest previous seat sale was for $94,500 on June 9.

title: Amex and OTC Prices Off; MobileHome Shares Decline
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market dropped yesterday after having shown some improvement on Friday for the first time in five days.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: PATH Strike Next Week Voted

title: From a Small Portuguese Prison Come Rugs Sold Throughout the World
description: LISBONPortugal's only prison for women has also become one of the country's most successful manufactur ing centers. The major prod uct is rugs, with the demand for them so high that the prison has a threeyear back log of orders and will not accept new ones for another two years.

title: White House Is Silent
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 26 (AP)The White House maintained silence on the re sumption of bombing attacks on North Vietnam today fol lowing the vain wait by Presi dent Nixon for a peace signal from Hanoi.

title: School Board Plans Offer To Buy Scribner Contract
description: The Board of Education was drafting a letter yesterday that it intends to send to School Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner, outlining a proposal to buy up his contract. A board member, who declined to be identified, said that there had been no dissent at a meeting Friday at which the five members decided to offer to pay Dr. Scribner for the remaining six months of his threeyear contract and re lieve him of his $53,000ayear post.

title: Venerable Georgetown Is Threatened By High Store Rents and High Risers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  Georgetown has survived. many cultural invasions since Capt. John Smith first set. eyes on the spot while sail ing up the Potomac River in 1608. Today the once placid community with its colonial village air is locked in a de termined battle against its own popularity.

title: N.C. Aggies and Grambling Bow at Garden
description: Grambling and North Caro lina A. and T., the first two, predominantly black schools to be invited to the Eastern Col lege Athletic Conference's Holi day Festival, were ousted in special preliminary round games by St. John's and Man hattan, respectively, before a sparse crowd of 5,515 at Madi son Square Garden yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, (AP)Ap pioximately 100 works of art from Brazil's, colonial period, the 17th and 18th centuries, are being seen outside that country for the first time in an exhibition at the Renwick Gallery.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 26 (UPI)The Soviet Union's allstar hockey team opened a series in the United States with a 94 victory over the Seattle Totems of the Western Hockey League last night before a crowd of more than 12,000. The Soviet stars will play in the World Cup tour nament opening tomorrow in Colorado Springs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Small Lobster Tails at Issue
description: Lobster eaters are savoring them as a sweet, tender deli cacy, but conservation offi cials are concerned that the small lobster tails that have been appearing with increas ing frequency in markets are a threat to the crop and prob ably illegal.

title: President's Proclamation
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 26Following is the text of a proclamation by President Nixon on the death former President Harry S. Truman:

title: Equity Financing
description: American Bancshares Inc. said yesterday it had filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with proposed public offering of 300,000 common shares to be made through an underwriting group man aged by Walston & Co. The company is a sixbank Florida holding company operating in southeastern Florida and in the St. PetersburghClearwater area. The company's stock closed unchanged on the overthecounter market at 29 bid, 30 asked.

title: Controller's Report on Public Authorities Points Up Their Hazy Legal Status
description: News Analysis

title: S.E.C. Proposes New Rule On Insiders' Fund Trading
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed today a new code of ethics to govern trading in securities by persons with access to information on prospective trades by mutual funds.

title: Home Again To Independence
description: THE pomp of the Presidency, the in cessant blaring of Hail to the Chief, the constant pressure at the center of attention left remarkably few imprints on Harry S. Truman. He escaped, he once said, acquiring an importance complex; so when he returned to his 14room Victorian home in Independence, Mo., to live until his death, he was still a man of simple tastes and uninflated ambitions. He was prepared to make an easy transition to private life.

title: FOOD CONCERNS FINED $9,735 IN NOVEMBER
description: The State Department of Agriculture and Markets re ported yesterday that 136 cases of marketing and food viola tions throughout the state in November had been settled, with payments amounting to $9,735 in civil compromise penalties.

title: SAILOR TELLS INQUIRY BLACKS BEAT WHITE
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 26 (AP) A sailor testified today that he and three other white crewmen of the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk had watched a group of eight to 15 blacks beat a white.

title: J.C. Penney to Omit FireRetardant Tag On Mattress Pads
description: The Federal Trade Commis sion's New York office an nounced yesterday that J. C. Penney Company had agreed to end what the commission called exaggerated claims for flameretardant mattress pads.

title: HARVARD TO BEGIN STUDY ON SMOKING
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Harvard Medical School is starting a fiveyear investiga tion, sponsored by eight to bacco companies, on the rela tionship between tobacco smok ing and lung and heart disease, the school announced today.

title: Chile Gets $9Million Credit
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (AP)Japan will extend $9million in credit to Chile to help Chile improve her international balance of payments and stabilize her economy, the Japanese Foreign Ministry said today. Credits from the Japan ImportExport Bank are to be used for the purchase of materials and serv ices, and are to be repaid over a 10year period after a grace period of five years at an in terest rate of 5.5 per cent a year.

title: JIMMY PATTON, 39; EXSTAR OF GIANTS
description: VILLA RICA, Ga., Dec. 26 (AP)  Former New York Giants, defensive football star Jimmy Patton was killed in traffic accident last week, the Georgia State Patrol reported today. He was 39 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SWITZERLAND, Zurich, Dec. 26 (UPI)Fritz Chervet of Switzerland retained his European flyweight boxing crown today with a unanimous 15round decision over John McChiskey of Scotland. The victory raised Chervet's record to 45 victories against five losses and two draws. On March 3 Chervet will defent his title again against Fernando Atzori of Italy, the former champion.

title: For Spare Time at Home
description: The only time Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Raupp have second thoughts about the newest furnishings in their basement when, at 1:30 in the morning, their son Bruce, 19, sets up the pins and goes to work to better his bowling score.

title: ROBERT GORE DEAD; PUBLISHER WAS 86
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 26 (AP)Robert H. Gore Sr., a newspaper publisher, who became Governor of Puerto Rico, died here today. He was $6 years old.

title: Bridge:
description: Should one ever pass a Stayman request for a major suit? Or pass when partner makes an SOS redouble beg ging for another contract? The answer should perhaps be that of the captain in H.M.S. Pinafore when asked whether he ever swore, or was ever sick at sea: What never? Well, hardly ever.

title: Advertising:
description: During the last 10 years at McCaffrey & McCall, Michael J. Manning, as senior vice presidentfinance, has seen the billings grow from $11 million to $56million and the agency go public. That should be reason enough to make him vice chairman of the agency, and that's just what has happened.

title: Effects of Early Deprivation On Children Found Reversible
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  A noted student of human psy chological development had a word of good cheer today for those who fear that early de privation may doom children to lifelong intellectual inferiority.

title: Repeal of Jury Exemption For Women Is Advocated
description: Herman B. Glaser, a trial lawyer and chairman of the New York Council for Civic Affairs, called yesterday for an end to what he called the archaic, antiquated and dis criminatory provision in state law that exempts women from jury service.

title: Fund Aids Child Program
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The Commonwealth Fund of New York has awarded the Chil dren's Hospital Medical Center a threeyear grant of $317,300 to help train a new type of specialist in child development. The grant, in addition to a parallel grant earlier in the year from the Carnegie Corpo ration of New York, will be used to finance development of a training program for pediatri cians and child psychiatrists for leadership positions in aca demic institutions.

title: STORE CLOSINGS SET BY FEDERAL'S CHAIN
description: Federal's, Inc., a department store chain with offices in De troit, said yesterday it would close two Federal stores in Lansing and Kalamazoo, Mich., and two Kobacker stores in Buffalo.

title: Gabby Hartnett, By Day and Night
description: Sports of The Times

title: Leone Urges Board of Estimate To Add One Meeting a Month
description: Borough President Sebastian Leone of Brooklyn, upset at the Board of Estimate's taking up new items for consideration at the last minute, urged yester day that the board meet at least three times a month. It now meets the second and fourth Thursday of every month.

title: Italian ValueAdded Tax Due Monday
description: ROME, Dec. 27Italians, who are all for taxes as long as they don't have to pay them, are uneasily awaiting a fiscal shock next week that will be felt by everyone.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 27 (Reu ters)About 100 demonstra tors gathered outside the United States Embassy here today to protest the resumed American bombing of North Vietnam.

title: Gen. Boyan Bulgaranov, 76, Of Bulgarian Politburo, Dies
description: VIENNA Dec. 27 (Reuters) Gen. Boyan Bulgaranov, a member of the Bulgarian Com munist party's Politburo since 1957, died yesterday at the age of 76, BTA, the official Bul garian News Agency, reported today.

title: Young Socialists Defeat Motion Favoring Recognition of Cuba
description: A motion favoring United States recognition of the Castro regime stirred the most debate yesterday at the national con vention of the Young People's Socialist. League.

title: Convict Linked to Radicals Admits Killing Prison Guard
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Dec. 27 (AP)Ronald W. Beaty, who escaped last October in an ambush that left one of his Chino prison guards dead and the other wounded, pleaded guilty today to murder.

title: LEONARD WILLIAMS, MAURITIUS GOVERNOR
description: LONDON, Dec. 27Sir Leo nard Williams, Governor Gen eral of Mauritius and a former general secretary of the British Labor party, died in a hospital at Port Louis, Mauritius, today, after having suffered a heart attack a week ago. He was 68 years old.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 27The New Jersey tax system that gives farmers a propertytax, break to help preserve agricul ture and open space was de clared a costly failure today by an independent research or ganization.

title: TECHNICIANS AT C.B.S. VOTING ON CONTRACT
description: Members of the Columbia Broadcasting System's striking technicians' union will com plete their vote today on a new contract proposal designed to end the strike against C. B S. that began Nov. 3.

title: GRAY STARS BEAT BLUE ELEVEN, 2716
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 27 (AP)Don Strock of Virginia Tech, who gained more yard age than any other college back this year, led the South all stars to a 2715 victory tonight in the annual BlueGray football game. But he had a lot of help from the defense.

title: County Judges Praise Truman in Resolution
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 27 (UPI)The three judges of the Jackson County Court, an administrative body, passed a resolution yesterday praising former President Harry S. Truman as a man who did his best and his best was greatness.

title: LEFRAK DECISION TO BE APPEALED
description: Two community groups in the Forest HillsKew Gardens section of Queens said yester day that they were still deter mined to stop a 415unit Lef rak middleincome housing project from being built in their community. An appeals court ruling on Tuesday allowed the $13million development to go ahead.

title: St. Peter's Walloped
description: MACON, Ga., Dec. 27  Louisiana Tech, the nation's fifthranked smallcollege team, outscored St. Peter's, 54 to 24, in the second half and went on to a 9062 victory in the opening round of the Bear tournament tonight. Mercer which has captured its own tournament two years in a row, knocked off Arkansas State, 86 79, in the second game.

title: Theater Purlie Begins Limited Run
description: The musical Purlie, based on Ossie Davis's play Purlie Victorious, closed last year after giving 688

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)The State Department announced today the signing of nevi bilateral agreements with Portugal limiting textile imports to the United States from Macao, the Portuguese enclave on the mainland of China. The agreements will extend for five years begin ning Jan. 1.

title: SOME PRICE REINS LOOSENED BY U.S.
description: Price Changes

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Houseman Ranked No. 1 In 35 HardCourt Tennis
description: For the third straight year, Evelyn Houseman of Sepulveda, Calif., has been ranked first in women's 35 singles by the United States Lawn Tennis As sociation. Miss Houseman won the women's 35 hardcourt championships at Las Vegas last October. In women's 35 doubles, Charlene Grafton of Pensacola, Fla., and Gloria Payne of Macon, Ga., combine for the top ranking for 1972.

title: U.S. LISTS TARGETS OF HEAVY ATTACKS IN NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 28  The United States military com mand, breaking a nineday si lence on damage inflicted in the intensive American air attacks against North Vietnam, listed nearly three dozen airfields, rail yards, power plants, supply depots and communications centers yesterday among the facilities that have been bombed.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: CLINTON, N. Y., Dec. 27 (AP)  Oswego State scored three goals tonight to tie Colby College, 7  7, in the opening game of the Hamilton College holiday hockey tournament.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Order Returning to QuakeDevastated Managua as Troops Patrol Streets
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 27A semblance of order was restored today to this turbulent capital five days after an earth quake destroyed most of the downtown area.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES HIGHER AT CLOSE
description: An unexpectedly large amount of soybeans still to be harvested had a firming effect on already high futures prices yesterday. The January deliv ery beans closed at $4.16 bushel up from $4.14.

title: AUSTRALIA HALTS SAIGON ARMS AID
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 27 Australia stopped military aid to South Vietnam today, ending the last vestige of this country's controversial partici pation in the Vietnam war.

title: Police Kill 2 in Rampage By Separatists in India
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 27 (UPI) The police fired on a rampag ing mob in Anantapur city in the southern state of Andhra Pradesh today, killing at least two persons, the Press Trust of India reported.

title: JAMES G. AFFLECK JR. OF MILBANK, TWEED
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla., Dec. 27James G. Affleck Jr., a senior partner in the New York law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, died last evening at his home here. He was 80 years old.

title: Orioles to Start Feb. 23
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 27 (AP) The Baltimore Orioles an nounced today that spring training would open in Miami Feb. 23 for pitchers and catch ers, with the remainder of the squad reporting Feb. 28.

title: S.E.C. Suspends I.F.D.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced in Washington yesterday that it was suspending for six months the brokerdealer registration of I.F.D., Inc., a New York securi ties firm, for securitieslaw violations. The S.E.C. also tem porarily barred the firm's president, Andrew Wormser, and a salesman, Manuel Posy, from associating with any brokerdealer.

title: Rockets Down Lakers
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)  Don Smith hit 8 quick points late in the first quarter tonight to give the Houston Rockets an early 14  point lead and send them on their way to a 136104 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Seven Soviet Jewish Activists Say Harassment Has Increased
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27Seven Jewish activists in Moscow charged today that Soviet au thorities had stepped up harass ment of Jewish activists at a time when Western public opinion was diverted by the Christmas holidays.

title: The Final Knapp Report Is 3d Official Statement
description: The final report of the Knapp Commission is its third official statement.

title: Blue Cross Asks 9% Rise; Plans to Broaden Benefits
description: Blue Cross of Greater New York announced yesterday that it would seek an average in crease of 9.3 per cent in hospi tal insurance rates for commu nityrated subscribers in the 17 lower counties of the state, to go into effect next April 1.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fire Flares on Freighter Again

title: Pro Golf Rookie Awards Go To Watkins, Miss Bourassa
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 27 Lanny Watkins, a 23yearold Virginian, and Jocelyne Bourassa, a 25yearold Ca nadian were named the profes sional golf tour rookies of the year today by Golf Digest magazine.

title: He's Mr. Cairn to Those Who Know
description: News of Dogs

title: City College Upsets Scranton
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Dec. 27 City College moved into the final round of the University of Scranton Pennsylvania invi tation tournament tonight by up setting the host team, 7364. The Beavers were in command of Scranton from the outset, open ing up a 3222 lead with four minutes remaining in the first half. A Scranton rally narrowed the lead to 3430 at halftime.

title: DeJordy Sent to Minors
description: DETROIT, Dec. 27 (UPI) Denis DeJordy, the goalie ac quired by the Detroit Red Wings in an expensive trade that sent Arnie Brown, a defenseman, to the New York Islanders, was demoted today to a minor league after giving up an average of 5.19 goals a game. The Red Wings said DeJordy had cleared waivers and would report to the Na tional Hockey League club's Fort Worth Wings of the Cen tral Hockey League.

title: TV: Reliving Truman Era in WellDone Specials
description: Obviously prepared well in advance, television managed to provide generally impres sive recapitulations of the life and times of former President Harry S. Truman. Specials were presented on both the network and local levels, ranging from the entire To day Show yesterday morn ing on the National Broad casting Company to Merle Miller's TVproducer recollec tions on Channel 13 Tuesday evening.

title: 152 SHOT VICTOR IN IRISH SWEEPS
description: LEOPARDSTOWN, Ifeland, Dec. 27 (AP)Captain Christy, an Irish horse and a 152 shot, ran away with the Sweeps Hurdle today and sent 14 lucky Irish sweepstake ticketholders around the world on a surprise trip to easy street.

title: Messing Up a Mess ...
description: The theft of huge quantities of heroin and cocaine from the Police Department needs no embroidery of offi cial confusion to make it a disastrous blow to public confidence in the integrity of lawenforcement in this city. The damage already done makes it imperative that there be an immediate end to the disgraceful battle between prosecutors over who is to investigate and act against the perpetrators of this incredible series breaches of official trust.

title: NEWCOMBE GAINS AT AUSTRALIA NET
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 27 (AP)  Secondseeded John Newcombe of Australia ad vanced to the quarterfinals of the $53,300 Australian open ennis clvmpionships today as upsets continued to eliminate seeded players.

title: ICB REORGANIZING, PLANS STOCK SPLIT
description: The ICB Corporation, the parent company of the $162 million International City Bank & Trust Company in New Or leans, has announced plans for a corporate reorganization, as well as a fiveforfour stock split. The company's shares are traded on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Graybeard Leading Eagle In SydneytoHobart Sail
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 27 (AP)  The Canadian ketch Graybeard led the United States sloop American Eagle today by about three miles at the head of the fleet in the Sydneyto Hobart race as the contestants sailed into Bass Straits, 250 miles south of Sydney.

title: Big Board Seeks to Widen Its Regional Representation
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced a plan yesterday to provide for more regional representation and to encourage more use and dis semination of marketing tech niques in the securities industry.

title: KNAPP PANEL SAYS WALSH AND OTHERS IGNORED TIPS BY U.S. ON POLICE CRIMES
description: The Knapp Commission as serts in its final report that high New York police officials ignored Federal information that some of their men were suspected murderers, extortion ists and heroin dealers.

title: Judge Allows Penn Central To Defer Wage Increases
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Penn Central Rail road, stating that it faced a difficult cash position in the first quarter of next year, won court approval today to defer for three months about $5.1 million in contract wage in creases for 44,000 of its em ployes. The increases were scheduled to go into effect next Monday.

title: Harvard Sextet Trounces Michigan, 84, in Tourney
description: DETROIT, Dec. 27 (AP) Harvard, ranked No. 2 in the country, scored three goals in each of the first two periods and two goals in the final to night to coast to an 84 victory over Michigan in the Great Lakes invitation hockey tour nament.

title: Chess: Milquetoast's Metamorphosis, Or Domesticity Triumphant
description: When. Tigran Petrosian nonchalantly tossed off his remark, Grandmasters Etre not gladiators, the chess world was scandalized. True, there are more than a few who are content to, demon strate a bloodless technical proficiency, but not one of that crowd had, eve? had the nerve to say so publicly. Of course, no one ever had bet ter reason than Petrosian; he was simply trying to justify his own languorous style of play.

title: ...the No. 1 Priority
description: Of more immediate and direct concern to New Yorkers, and not essentially different in concept, is the generally commendable preliminary plan of the Adirondack Park Agency for limiting the uses and development of private ly held: lands within the boundaries of that invaluable segment of the state. This report, just released, comple ments the Agency's plan for stateowned lands which has already been approved by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Justice Stevens Defends Bail in Shooting
description: Presiding Justice Harold A. Stevens of the Appellate Divi sion, First Department, yester day attributed the widespread reaction against a judge's $500 cash bail that freed a suspect in the shooting of a policeman to an emotional outburst and general misunderstanding of the bail process.

title: St. John's, Manhattan Win at Garden
description: St. John's and Manhattan ad vanced to the semifinal round of the Holiday Festival basket ball tournament yesterday in similar fashion, free throws in the last halfminute deciding the games.

title: Mrs. Rines Married to L. H. Clark
description: FALMOUTH, Me., Dec. 27  Mrs. Anne Randolph Mc Connell Rines of Falmouth, widow of William H. Rines, was married here at noon to day to Lincoln Harold Clark of Old Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Malcolm Sawtelle per formed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of St. Mary the Virgin.

title: Nixon Invites Trumans to the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  After President Nixon returned here today from Independence, Mo., it was disclosed that he had extended a personal invita tion to the Truman family to come to Washington for a me morial service Jan. 5.

title: Rockets' Long Breaks Thumb
description: DENVER, Dec. 27 (AP)  Willie Long, the 6foot8inch forward for the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball As sociation, broke his right thumb last night in a fight during a game with San Diego and will be sidelined for up to six weeks. Long fought with the Q's for ward, Simmie Hill.

title: President Inaugurated in Seoul To New Term With New Power
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 271 Park Chung Hee, the former army general who has ruled South Korea since 1961, was inaugurated today as President for six more years with much broader power.

title: Justice Stevens Defends Bail in Shooting
description: Presiding Justice Harold A. Stevens of the Appellate Divi sion, First Department, yester day attributed the widespread reaction against a judge's $500 cash bail that freed a suspect in the shooting of a policeman to an emotional outburst and general misunderstanding of the bail process.

title: Unger Paces Blues' Victory
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (AP)  Garry Unger scored two goals and picked up three assists to night to pace the St. Louis Blues to a 53 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: Tale of How Luscious Pastry Was Born in an Englewood Kitchen
description: The discovery of a new dish, wrote BrillatSavarin, does more for human happi ness than the discovery of a star.

title: U.N. Help for Nicaragua Will Stress Rehabilitation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 27The United Nations and its affiliated agencies moved ahead today with emer gency aid for Nicaragua, but they planned to concentrate their efforts on longrange re habilitation and reconstruction programs.

title: New Korvettes Management Sets Changes
description: Korvettes Department Stores, the pioneer discounter that has had several managements in its dramatic and tempestuous 25yearhistory, has another new one.

title: ALLIED PLANE KILLS 9 IN A BOMBING ERROR
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 27 (AP)  A South Viet namese F5 fighterbomber ac cidentally dropped a bomb in village 20 miles northeast of Saigon today, killing nine ci vilians and wounding 10, re ports from the area said. Six homes were reported destroyed.

title: U.S. to Seek Clarification
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27. (Reu ters)  State Department offi cials were taken by surprise to day by the Australian Govern ment's decision to halt military aid to South Vietnam.

title: TAX SELLING LIFTS VOLUME ON AMEX
description: Trading volume on the Amer ican Stock Exchange rose sharply yesterday as a result of yearend tax selling. At the close, trades totaled 6,031,000 shares compared with 3,726,000 the day before.

title: A Night in Court With Judge Wright: Compassion Governs Bair Decisions
description: Dispensing with the usual ritual, Judge Bruce M. Wright strode briskly into Night Court, declaring, Remain seated, court is in session, come to order, and quickly took his seat at the bench.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Ohio Edison Company plans a $35million preferred stock sale in March, according to Victor Owoc, vice president. The utility also plans to sell about 2.5million shares of common in the middle of next year and another $60million to $75million will be raised next year by selling bonds.

title: City Will Train the Unskilled for Employment in Public Service
description: Admitting failure in current efforts to provide jobs for the unskilled, the city's Human Re sources Administrator, Jule M. Sugarman, announced yester day a new organization and shift in the policy of the city's jobtraining programs.

title: 3 GET JAIL TERMS IN PIERRE HOLDUP
description: The three men charged with stealing $3million in jewels and cash from the Pierre Hotel last winter were sentenced yes terday to varying prison terms of one to seven years.

title: N. MEXICO STATE TOPS PRINCETON
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27 (UPI)John Williamson scored 21 of his 27 points in the second half today as New Mexico State rallied for 6156 victory over Princeton in the second game of the Quaker City basketball tournament.

title: Sports News Briefs
