description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The Federal Price Commis sioner, acting on complaints of exorbitant prices from football fans, is investigating the prides charged for tickets to National Football League playoff and Super Bowl games, a spokesman disclosed today.

title: Israeli Cabinet Informed
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 27  Premier Golda Meir advised the Cabinet on Sunday that she would attend the meeting of the Socialist International in Paris in January.

title: FOLLOWUP URGED ON BRAIN INJURIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27A hijacker who reportedly killed an airline copilot and unsuc cessfully sought to dive a fully loaded plane into the sea was found, after subsequent suicide and autopsy, to have suffered severe brain damage 11 years earlier, according to a physician consulted on the case.

title: KNAPP PANEL SAYS WALSH AND OTHERS IGNORED TIPS BY U.S. ON POLICE CRIMES
description: The Knapp Commission as serts in its final report that high New York police officials ignored Federal information that some of their men were suspected murderers, extortion ists and heroin dealers.

title: SHOP TALK
description: There's a lot of Chinese inspired jewelry around these days but some of the most authentic designs come from the fertile mind of KaiYin Lo, a young Hong Kong career woman who has achieved success in several fields.

title: Tie Set by Texaco Unit And Leadership Housing
description: Merger News

title: Blue Cross Asks 9% Rise; Plans to Broaden Benefits
description: Blue Cross of Greater New York announced yesterday that it would seek an average in crease of 9.3 per cent in hospi tal insurance rates for commu nityrated subscribers in the 17 lower counties of the state, to go into effect next April 1.

title: 100BED HOSPITAL SENT TO MANAGUA
description: Seventyfour physicians, nurses and other health work ers flew from New York to earthquakestricken Managua yesterday with a 100bed port able hospital and other equip ment and supplies as the plight of the homeless and bereaved residents of Nicaragua's capi tal city touched the hearts of New Yorkers and other Ameri cans.

title: Poles List 4th Bomb Death
description: WARSAW, Dec. 27 (AP) A fourth Polish seaman has died in a Haiphong hospital as a result of injuries suffered in a United States air strike last week, the official Polish press agency said today. The Polish Government reported earlier that three Poles had been killed when their cargo ship, the Jo seph Conrad, was struck and sunk.

title: Post Wins 7th in Row
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 27 (AP)C. W. Post ran oft its seventh straight victory a 6760 decision over Mon mouth tonight in the opening game of the Montclair State tournament.

title: CABBY IS INDICTED IN 3 QUEENS RAPES
description: The indictment of a 20year old driver of a gypsy cab in three crises of rape and one of reckless endangerment in which a 17yearold college student lookalike had origin ally been suspected was an nounced yesterday by Thomas J. Mackell, the Queens District Attorney.

title: Hunter Sparks Q's
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 27 (AP)  Withstanding an 18point splurge by Les Hunter in the fourth quarter, San Diego's Conquistadors defeated the Memphis Tams, 106102, to night.

title: Market Place: Skyline Is Still Under Pressure
description: The Skyline Corporation, the institutional favorite that took a beating in Tuesday's stock market following a negative earnings report that halted trading last Friday, was under pressure again yesterday.

title: Age Limit on Judges Urged
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 27 (AP)Legislation aimed to force the retirement of all judges in Rhode Island at the age of 70 years is being drawn up by Senator Joseph Rodgers new chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee. The measure, disclosed by the Providence Democrat yester day, would apparently compel the retirement of Chief Justice Thomas H. Roberts of the State Supreme Court, who will be 71 on Jan. 4.

title: France is Unhappy About Trip To Paris Planned by Mrs. Meir
description: PARIS, Dec. 27Premier Golda Meir is planning a trip to Paris next month, making the French Government more unhappy than usual about Israel and Israelis.

title: ... Confusion Over Bail
description: Just to round out the dismaying picture of muddled lawenforcement here, the police are at war with a judge in a case that highlights the utter lack of consistency surrounding the fixing of bail for persons accused violent crimes.

title: L.I.R.R. Strike Depleting Lumber and Food Stocks
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 27 A survey of some concerns af fected by the Long Island Rail Road's shutdown of freight op erations disclosed today that inventories were being deplet ed, employes had been laid off and some businesses were con cerned about curtailment or suspension of activities if the 28day strike was prolonged much further.

title: JOHN P. SOULE
description: John P. Soule, an executive in the climatecontrol division of the Singer Company in Rutherford, N.J., died Tuesday at the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 53 years old and lived on Stonebridge Road in Montclair, N.J.

title: Amex Quotes Ride on Infrared Beam
description: The Amex is now using an infrared transmission device to carry information concerning transactions from the roof above the exchange floor on Trinity Place to its computer complex two blocks away at 90 West Street.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Doesn't anyone have a kind word to say for snow mobiles?

title: Rose Bowl Wins First Lady
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 27 Mrs. Pat Nixon, a 1937 gradu ate of the University of South ern California, said today she would participate in the Tour nament of Roses parade and attend the Rose Bowl football game, in which her alma mater meets Ohio State on New Year's Day.

title: Two Disaster Areas Named
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) The Small Business Adminis tration today designed as disas ter areas Knox County, Tenn., and Smyth, Va., both of which were damaged by floodwater on Dec. 17. The designation opened the way to rehabilita tion loans.

title: Follmer Wins Titus Trophy
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 27 (AP) George Follmer of Arcadia, Calif., who won driving cham pionships on two autoracing circuits this year, was named the winner today of the Jerry Titus Trophy for 1972. The trophy is in honor of Titus, who was fatally injured in a TransAm race three years ago.

title: MOURNING DAY GIVES 300 DRAFT REPRIEVE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) About 300 young men will escape the draft, at least tem porarily, because of former President Harry S. Truman's death and the day of mourning declared by President Nixon, draft officials said today.

title: CONTRACT SIGNED BY CABBIES UNION
description: A contract covering 30,000 members of the Taxi Drivers Union was signed yesterday af ter more than two years of ne gotiation, but it was not ex pected to have any immediate impact on the taxi business or its passengers.

title: Books of The Times
description: NIGHT. By Edna O'Brien. 179 Pages. Knopf. $5.95.

title: Trade Optimism Voiced
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  George P. Shultz, Secretary of the Treasury, said today he thought the Adminis tration would be able to work out a mutually agreeable sched ule with the House Ways and Means Committee for consider ation of the Administration's trade package.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SCOTCH PLAINS, N. J., Dec. 27 (AP)The Scotch Plains YMCA bettered the world record for the 100mile marathon swim today, knocking more than an hour off the previous record it set last year. Ten youths ranging in age from 15 to 19 swam the 100mile distance in 38 hours 37 minutes 21.8 seconds, each swimming 10 onemile laps.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Whitney Biennial, a massive survey of contempo rary art, will open next month in three stages at the Whit ney Museum of American Art, 945 Madison Avenue at 75th Street. The Biennial compris ing both painting and sculp ture, replaces the museum's Annual, which presented the two media in alternate years. The show will occupy all five floors of the Whitney.

title: Cambridge Fire Kills 2
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 27 (AP)Two persons perished this morning and several fire fighters were injured in a fire that swept a sixfamily wooden house in East Cambridge, a fire department spokesman said. Officials identified the victims as brothers, 62yearold Charles and 64yearold Joseph Travis.

title: Hufnagel One of 3 Named E.C.A.C. Players of Year
description: John Hufnagel, Penn State quarterback, in Division I Phil Pope, Middlebury running back, and Joe Carbone, Delaware de fensiye end, who share the honors in Division II, and Bob Olender, Franklin and Marshall quarterback, in Division III, have been named the players of the year in the Eastern Col lege Athletic Conference.

title: Prof. Haakon Hamre, 58, Authority on Nordic Dialects
description: Professor Hamre, a 20year member of the University of California faculty here, taught Norwegian and Old Icelandic.

title: New Suffolk LandBuying Policy Urged
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 27 Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein said today that the county's purchase of land for all park and public uses should be done by a new agency or individual. Under the present system, existing coun ty agencies have varying juris diction.

title: FOOD PLACES LISTED AFTER CITY CHECKS
description: Eleven restaurants and other foodhandling establishments are on the Health Department's latest list of places charged with serious health code viola tions.

title: Cepeda Cut by Oakland A's Along With Horlen, Brown
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 27 (UPI)  The champion Oakland A's reduced their 40man roster by three players today, handing Orlando Cepeda, Larry Brown and Joe florlen their uncondi tional releases.

title: Cougars Defeat Pacers
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 27 (AP) The Carolina Cougars with stood a secondhalf rally tonight and beat the Indiana Pacers, 122114, in an American Basket ball Association game.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27  The State Department of Translior tation is planning to make pub lic in the next few weeks its proposal for a $100million, 7.6 milelong freeway that would be 10 lanes wide in some places to replace the badly con gested Route 19 between the Pulaski Skyway and the ap proaches to the George Wash ington Bridge.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PARAMUS, Dec. 27Nick Carrelle is twothirds of the way through a $6,000 gamble, and so far he's winning.

title: Awards for Excellence Set For Teachers at State U.
description: ALBANY, Dec. 27 (UPI) The State University of New York is establishing a program of financial awards for excel lence in undergraduate teach ing.

title: HAWKS BEAT 76ERS IN FINAL SECOND
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 27 (UPI) Don May's 20foot jump shot with one second remaining to night gave the Atlanta Hawks a 121120 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Rockets' Long Breaks Thumb
description: DENVER, Dec. 27 (AP) Willie Long, the 6foot8inch forward for the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball As sociation, broke his right thumb last night in a fight during a game with San Diego and will be sidelined for up to six weeks. Long fought with the Q's for ward, Simmie Hill.

title: Laird, in a Shift, Says Navy Will Keep Puerto Rico Range
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that the United States Navy would re tain its controversial naval and airgunnery training range on Culebra Island off Puerto Rico until at least 1985, despite an earlier commitment to move it by June, 1975.

title: Truman Is Recalled Here for Warmth And Simplicity That Had Wide Appeal
description: While those who served Harry S. Truman in high office gathered at Independence, Mo., yesterday to pay him final trib ute, New Yorkers from hum bler walks of life remembered him fondly as a man of warmth and simplicity.

title: A Judge for F.T. C. Dismisses Charges Of False Bakery Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (Reu ters)A Federal Trade Com mission judge, in an initial decision, dismissed today com mission charges that the I.T.T. Continental Baling Company had falsely advertised its Won der. Bread and Hostess Snack Cakes.

title: Nadjari Is Weighing Legal Action to Halt Jury's Investigation of Narcotics Thefts From the Police
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the spe cial state prosecutor named to investigate corruption in the criminal justice system here, said yesterday that he was speculating about legal ac tion to prevent Frank J. Rogers, a special assistant district at terney, from conducting his own investigation of the theft of narcotics from the Police De partment.

title: $108MILLION IS BID AT FANNY MAY SALE
description: WASHINGTON, De. 27 (Reuters)  The Federal Na tional Mortgage Association said today it had received 140 bidstotalling $108.7million at its auction of four month com mitments to purchase Govern ment backed home mortgages yesterday.

title: Cosmos No. 541
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27 (AP)The Soviet Union launched today, another cosmos satellite, the 541st in the series. The Soviet news agency, Tass, said the sa tellite was orbiting the earth every 90.3 minutes with a high point of 230 miles and a low of 150 miles.

title: NADJARI WEIGHING DRUGCASE ACTION
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the spe cial state prosecutor named to investigate corruption in the criminal justice system here, said yesterday that he was speculating about legal ac tion to prevent Frank J. Rogers, a special assistant district at torney, from conducting his own investigation of the theft of narcotics from the Police Department.

title: Uses of the Land...
description: John R. Quarles Jr., general counsel to the Environ mental Protection Agency, recently contrasted Federal activity to combat air and water pollution with the almost total ineffectiveness of government at all levels to cope with the protection of land. Mr. Quarles spoke eloquently and to the point about the disappear ance of shore lines, the filling of wetlands, the flooding of mountain valleys and intrusions on the wilderness. He paid his doubtful respects to stream channelization projects as well, and to the enormous pressure for development that threatens what remains of open space across the country.

title: $1MILLION SUIT FILED TO BAR FRAZIER BOUT
description: Richard Fulton, a New York lecture agent for Muhammad Ali, has filed a $1million dam age suit requesting a court injunction to stop the Joe FrazierGeorge Foreman heavy weight title bout, scheduled for Jan. 22 in Kingston, Jamaica.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Changes Urged In LI. Land Deals

title: Zenith Offers New TV Unit
description: The Zenith Radio Corpora tion said yesterday it would introduce the first commercial use of magnetic power regula tion in a color television re ceiver. The unit will make pos sible the reception even during electric brownouts.

title: Acupuncture Clinic, Shut Here, Opens Up Again in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27A New York City acupuncture clinic, closed last month by New York State Authorities because its Chinese praction ers were not licensed physi cians, reopened here today with some of its former New York patients following it to Wash ington.

title: Rev. Samuel Kidd Dies at 58; Lutheran Council Member
description: The Rev. Dr. Samuel E. Kidd, for the last three years a mem ber of the executive council of the Lutheran Church in Amer ica, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Lansing, Mich. He was 58 years old.

title: ISRAELI JETS RAID SYRIAN POSITIONS
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 27Israeli jet fighters attacked positions inside Syria today for the first time in five weeks, a military spokesman announced.

title: MRS. WILSON, WIDOW OF EXDEFENSE CHIEF
description: DETROIT, Dec. 27 (AP)  Mrs. Jessie Curtis Wilson, widow of Charles E. Wilson, the for mer president of the General Motors Corporation and Secre tary of Defense under President Eisenhower, died today at her home in nearby Bloomfield Hills. She was 82 years old.

title: A Sweet Pitcher Was Bob Lemon
description: Sports of The Times

title: Common Man Wins Praise of Neighbors
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 27Harold Bowman, his eyes squinting in the bright sun light reflecting off the white washed porch of his house, looked out over Maple Street and pointed.

title: Cougars in Deal With Oilers
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (AP)The Chicago Cougars of the World Hockey Association traded Ber nie Blanchette to the Atlanta Oilers today for Jim Benzelock.

title: TAKING OVER 10 NASSAU BUS LINES
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 27 Creation of a Metropolitan Transportation Authority sub sidiary to take over the opera tions by April 1 of 10 private bui companies in Nassau, Coun ty was announced today by County Executive Ralph G. Caso and Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the M.T.A.

title: LameDuck Cabinet
description: WASHINGTONIn 1966 I started the environmental fight against the S.S.T. from within the Johnson Admin istration. After a confrontation, this seeming disobedience was tolerated by the President and his aides on the basis that I was only doing my job by publicly raising the farreaching side issues associated with this project As I watched President Nixon shape his new Cabinet in recent weeks, I have wondered whether he will abide such creative dissent in his second term.

title: Dr. Abraham I. Hochberger, Anesthesiologist, Dies at 50
description: Dr. Abraham I. Hochberger, an associate attending anesthe siologist at Mount Sinai Hospi tal and an associate clinical professor at its medical school, died of cancer in the hospital Tuesday. He was 50 years old and lived at 21 Ridge Street, Tuckahoe, N. Y.

title: Penguins Tie Lead, 33
description: TORONTO, Dec. 27, (UPI)  Ron Schock's goal with 5 min utes 40 seconds to play lifted the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 33 tie tonight with the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: DeJordy Sent to Minors
description: DETROIT, Dec. 27, (UPI) Denis DeJordy, the goalie ac quired by the Detroit Red Wings in an expensive trade that sent Arnie Brbwn, a defenseman, to the New York Islanders, was demoted today to a minor league after giving up an average of 5.19 goals a game. The Red Wings said DeJordy had cleared waivers and would report to the Na tional Hockey League club's Fort Worth Wings of the Cen tral Hockey League.

title: Blast Kills Man on L.I.
description: CENTERPORT, L. I., Dec. 27 (AP)  An explosion and fire wrecked a pizza parlor here where three Brooklyn men were working at 2:35 A.M. today, kill ing one of them and critically injuring the other two. The Suf folk County police said the three men frequently worked late at the ShotJoJots pizza parlor and sometimes stayed in Cen terport overnight.

title: U.S. Red Cross Allocation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)  The American Red Cross said today it had allocated $25,000 more for Nicaraguan relief, bringing to $50,000 the amount it has made available to the stricken area.

title: Sabres Subdue Rangers Again
description: A welldisciplined Buffalo Sabres hockey team took ad vantage of the unaccustomed disorganization of the New York Rangers last night and routed the home club, 41, at Madison Square Garden. It was the third time in their three meetings this season that the Sabres, an expansion team, now in its third year in the National Hockey League, beat the Rangers.

title: U.C.L.A., ST. LOUIS GAIN SOCCER FINAL
description: MIAMI, Dec. 27 (AP) U..L.A. defeated Cornell and St. Louis beat Howard in sud dendeath overtime tonight to advance to the final of the Na tional Collegiate Athletic Asso ciation soccer tournament.

title: Joseph C. Grew Weds Mrs. Jones
description: EXETER, N.H., Dec. 27 Mrs. Sarah Winslow Loomis Jones, widow of Patrick S. Jones, was married here to day to Joseph Clark Grew, assistant headmaster of St. Mark's School in Southbor ough, Mass. The Episcopal ceremony in the Phillips Ex eter Church was performed by the Rev. Edward S. Glea son, headmaster of the Noble and Greenough School and former minister of the Phil lips Exeter Academy.

title: OTB Office Opens Today
description: A new branch office in Man hattan will be opened today by. the New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation. The office will be located at 588 Broad way and Prince Street and will be managed by Harry Chin.

title: Plane Hits Wires
description: GOODING, Idaho, Dec. 27 (AP)A light plane became tangled in power lines at the west end of the Gooding air port last night, cutting off power to the town and doing $10,000 damage to the plane. The pilot, John It Shaw, 42 years old, of Boise, was un injured.

title: 2 Die in Fire in Port Chester Rooming House
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 27Two men died here early this morning in a fire that de stroyed a rooming house.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: A persistent fire in a cargo of matches aboard the Norwegian freighter Ross Sea broke out again yesterday morning when the ship was in its berth in Port Elizabeth. Coast Guard units and the Port Elizabeth Fire Department smothered the blaze in carbon dioxide foam and sealed the compartment to contain the fire.

title: 1st Annual Farewell From P.D.Q. Each Attracts the Young
description: The First Annual Farewell Concert of the music of P.D.Q. Bach was held at Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday night, and it seemed a good time for the farewells to set inat least for some listeners.

title: 2 Critics Here Focus on Films As Language Conference Opens
description: They live by the word and they vie by the wordin de bates that proceed as if time limits were unspeakable ob scenities, in seminars that pursue elusive truth beyond the bounds of reason.

title: Bridge:
description: There lit a strong tempta tion for a defender who has no significant cards to fall asleep, planning to stir him self on the next deal when he may have something more interesting to look at. But sometimes the sleeper can get a rude awakening, as on the diagramed deal report ed by the French player writer, JeanPaul Meyer.

title: Disaster Loans to Farmers Cut Off by White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) The Nixon Administration to day ordered the Farmers Home Administration not to make further emergency loans to farmers in disaster areas where storms and other bad weather have caused severe losses in crops, livestock and other property.

title: Two Seconds to Make 1972 the Longest Year
description: Nineteen seventytwo will be the longest year thus far in the history of recorded timethe longest by all of two seconds.

title: Olinkraft Sets Rises
description: Olinkraft, Inc., a subsidiary of the Olin Corporation, an nounced yesterday price in creases for unbleached kraft linerboard and semichemical corrugatirlg medium, beginning with shipments Jan. 1.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y. (AP) The new Center for Music, Drama and Art here will hold its gala premiere tomorrow The center, begun more than two years ago, is described by its spokesman as a three part module for the art school, gallery, concert hall and theater and is the first of its kind in the Adirondack region.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Dec. 27 (AP)  A screened thirdperiod powerplay goal enabled Czechoslovakia to beat the United States, 32, last night in a fiercely played opening game of the second annual. World Cup hockey tournament.

title: Lester Pearson Dies at 75; Led Canada, Won a Nobel
description: OTTAWA, Thursday, Dec. 28 Lester B. Pearson, former Prime Minister of Canada and a Nobel Peace Prize winner, died late last night of cancer at his home in Rockcliffe, an Ottawa suburb. He was 75 years old. Dr. P. M. Burton, his physician, attributed death to cancer of the liver.

title: The Longest War
description: WASHINGTONOne of the primary reasons this tragic war continues is because a majority of the Congress has consistently refused to confront the executive branch with obvious in consistencies in its various statements about Vietnam.

title: Rice Prices Action
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)  The Administration acted today to thwart further increases in rice prices at home and abroad by putting a ceiling on prices of export shipments under the Food for Peace pro gram.

title: Soviet Harassment Increased at Christmastime, 7 Jewish Activists Charge
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27Seven Jewish activists in Moscow charged today that Soviet au thorities bad stepped up harass ment of Jewish activists at a time when Western public opinion was diverted by the Christmas holidays.

title: Nets' Mahoney on Waivers
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 27 (AP)The New York Nets of the American Basketball Asso ciation placed a guard, Brian Mahoney, formerly of Manhat tan College, on waivers today, reducing their roster to 11 play ers. Mahoney played in seven games and scored 22 points.

title: Columbia Relays Canceled
description: The Columbia Relays, sched uled to be held at the Edgar Mason Air Dome at Baker Field yesterday, were canceled be cause of the incompleteness of the facilities within the Dome.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Radio City Music Hall turned a stately 40 yesterday and, despite such troubles as an occasional labor dispute, fewer family films and de clining evening attendance, the house seems still to be as lively as its famous Rock ettes. There was no public observance, of the anniver sary, but the Music Hall's employes celebrated quietly at a party last night.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: ?? I hope last 35 years were as wonderful for you as fur me. Paul.Advt.

title: TAX ASSESSMENTS TERMED SUSPECT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  A Washingtonbased taxresearch team and two citizens' groups in Pennsylvania have asked that state's Attorney General to investigate suspect property tax assessments that allegedly resulted in special benefits to major property owners in a county near Pittsburgh.

title: Nixon Aide Says Easing Of Profits Curb Is Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The Nixon Administration is likely to ease soon what businessmen consider, a major burden imposed on them by the price controls program, a highranking official of the Cost of Living Council said today.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The late Harry S. Truman, who was anything but a crybaby like the pres ent incumbent of the White House, is famous for having said that if you can't stand the heat, you better get out of the kitchen. He also observed, almost jovially, that whenever the press quits abusing me, I know I'm in the wrong pew. That was in the middle of the 1948 campaign and Mr. Truman knew better than most that while the editorial writers and column ists were mostly against him, the frontpage headlines that reflected his give 'em hell style were working for him.

title: New York Resort Offers Guaranteed Ski Course
description: News of Skiing

title: Scientists Protest Ouster Of Health Institutes' Head
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)About 1,000 Govern ment scientists have sent a letter to President Nixon pro testing the unprecedented, forced resignation of Dr. Rob ert Q. Marston as director of the National Institutes of Health, a spokesman said today.

title: Filion Captures Four More
description: WINDSOR, Ontario, Dec. 27. (AP)Herve Filion, world rec ordholding sulky driver from Angers, Quebec, closed in on his goal of 650 victories for the year last night as he registered four victories at Windsor Race way. His total was increased to 592.

title: Speak Up, Mr. President
description: Despite the communiqu tardily issued in Saigon yes terday, the Nixon Administration continues to evade the toughest and most pertinent questions about the mas sive new United States air assault against North Vietnam.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: PAY GAP WIDENS BETWEEN SEXES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Salaries of women workers are not only lower than those of men, but the gap between them is widening as well, the head of the Labor Depart ment's Women's Bureau warn ed today.

title: Witness in Kitty Hawk Hearing Charges That Whites Beat Black Officer in October Rioting on Carrier
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 27  A black crewman of the aircraft carrier Kitty. Hawk testified at a Navy hearing today that he had seen white sailors knock down and beat the ship's executive officer during racial rioting aboard the carrier off the coast of Vietnam.

title: Truman's Body Lies in State in His Library
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 27 With military pomp, the body of Harry S. Truman was borne under the mournful gaze of friends today to the library that houses the personal pa pers and mementos that he accumulated as the 33d Presi dent of the United States.

title: VATICAN DENIES POPE SENT PLEA TO NIXON
description: ROME, Dec. 27Two leading Italian newspapers  Corriere Della Sera of Milan and Il Mes saggero of Romesaid today that Pope Paul VI was under stood to have sent a personal letter to President Nixon urging him to end the United States air strikes in North Vietnam.

title: JERSEY ENDS FIGHT ON CENTRAL RUNS
description: NEWARK, Dec. 27  The state apparently cleared the way today for the Central Rail road of New Jersey to elimi nate passenger service for 15, 000 daily commuters after Jan. 21.

title: INFRINGEMENT LAID TO BAUSCH & LOMB
description: The National Patent Develop ment Corporation's subsidiary Hydron Europe, Inc., said yes terday that the Czechoslovakia Academy of Science, licensor of patents covering soft contact lenses to which Hydron Europe has exclusive rights in Western Europe, has commenced legal action in France against Bausch & Lomb, Inc.

title: STANDBY CONTROLS PROPOSED BY PANEL
description: Standby controls to contend with trouble spots in the economy were recommended yesterday by the Business Roundtable.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Rockets Rally to Win
description: DENVER, Dec. 27 (AP)The Denver Rockets rallied from a 6 point fourth period deficit to night and topped the Virginia Squires, 115113.

title: Music
description: In the 20 years since the Modern Jazz Quartet was organizedit has survived the description modern jazz, which went out just about the time the term beatnik was coming init has continued to play music that is no less modern nor more modern than when it began. It has also set an al most unapproachable record for group stability (no per sonnel changes in the last 17 years) and, instead of de scending into the stagnation that so often affects jazz groups once they have passed their initial success, the quar tet has not only remained fresh and vital but has also continued to grow musically through the years.

title: Cougars Defeat Pacers
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 27 (AP) The Carolina Cougars with stood a secondhalf rally tonight and beat the Indiana Pacers, 122114, in an American Basket ball Association game.

title: Peak Imports Push Deficit to Highest Level Since April
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Record imports sent the balanceoftrade deficit soaring to $559.2million last, month the biggest gap between the cost of imports and exports since last April, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Bruins Down Flames, 31, On SecondPeriod Surge
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 27 (AP) The Boston Bruins erupted for three secondperiod goals by Wayne Cashman, Fred Stan field and Johnny Bucyk to down the Atlanta Flames, 31, tonight in a National Hockey League contest.

title: Varied Contributors Help the Neediest
description: AHarvard student, a teen ager, a couple of youngsters aged 7 and 11, two public school groups and a group of fashion executives were among the contributors re corded yesterday by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Penguins Tie Leafs 33
description: TORONTO, Dec. 27, (UPI)  Ron Schock's goal with 5 min utes 40 seconds to play lifted the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 33 tie tonight with the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: Advertising: Agency Forms an EthicalPharmaceutical Unit
description: The ShallerRubin Compa ny, which has doubled its ethicalpharmaceutical busi ness over the last two years, has spun off those billings into, a subsidiary corporation with the likely name of ShallerRubin Medical Adver tising.

title: Deep Throat Theater Closed for Being Unlicensed
description: The film Deep Throat was closed by the police last night, not on obscenity charges  on which a trial is to resume today in Criminal Courtbut on the ground that the theater was unlicensed.

title: DOW STOCK INDEX GAINS 0.98 POINT
description: Bluechip and glamour issues moved higher yesterday in a stock market buffetedby year end tax selling. The DowJones industrial average added 0.98 point to 1,007.68.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: VIENNA, Dec. 27 (Reuters) Demonstrators today daubed the entrance of a branch of the Bank of America here with red paint, protesting United States air raids on North Vietnam.

title: OneThird of Army In Cambodia Found To Be Nonexistent
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 27The Cambodian Gov ernment acknowledged today that, because of corruption by military commanders and other irregularities, it has at times paid salaries to as many as 100,000 nonexistent soldiers.

title: Nets Lose, 105101, as Colonels Rally
description: LOUISVILLE, Dec. 27Dan Issel's 34 points helped the Kentucky Colonels turn back the New York Nets, 105101, tonight, after they had trailed by 4 points at halftime.

title: Jean Garrigue, Poet, Dies at 59; Taught and Lectured Widely
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27  Jean Garrigue, the poet, died of Hodgkins Disease today in Massachusetts General Hospi tal. She was 59 years old, and had made her home in Man hattan during a wideranging career as lecturer and poetin residence at many college cam puses.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Community Service Society Calls for Reorganization and Modernization of City Housing Inspections
description: A drastic reorganization and modernization of the city's housing inspection services was called for yesterday by the Community Service Society.

title: 4 Americans Known Dead
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) The State Department said today that four Americans were known to have been killed in the earthquake in Nicaragua.

title: Shop With Vintage Records Is Closing
description: It's a shabby, musty little shop in midtown Manhattan. But it's also the world's largest establishment selling old and rare phonograph records. Now, after 26 years, Jack Meltzer is packing up his 1906 Gems of the Sunshine Girls and his Carusos, and closing his Merit Record Shop.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 3  No Title
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Dec. 27 (UPI)Students protesting the United States bombing of North Vietnam set fire to the United States Information Serv ice office and library in Raj shahi, 100 miles northwest of Dacca, it was reported today.

title: Indicators Available for November Show Advance of 1.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The index of lead ing indicators rose 1.9 per cent in November to 150.4 per cent, the Commerce Department re ported today.

title: Too Young to Walk, but Not Too Young to Do Exercises
description: Lily Fertik yawned, puckered up her mouth and frowned on the idea of being an airplane. Just a few minutes before, she had been nestled in a sling carrier, close to her mother and sound asleep. And now there was this young woman in a purple body suit and tights coaxing her awake and asking her to do pushups andsomersaults, and it took a little while for Lily to get into the spirit of things.

title: Jacksonville Wins Tourney
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 27 (AP)  The Jacksonville Dolphins won the Gator Bowl basketball tournament tonight in an 8471 rout of young and overmatched Rutgers.

title: HENRY LEIGH HUNT
description: PARIS, Dec. 27Henry Leigh Hunt, who led a widely traveled life as engineer, banker and real estate promoter, died last Thursday at the age of 86.

title: North Stars Top Canadiens
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 27 (AP)  Dennis Hextall, a slickpassing Minnesota center, set up two secondperiod goals tonight and Cesare Maniago kicked out 35 shots as the Min nesota North Stars defeated the Montreal Canadiens, 32.

title: N.Y.A.C. Wins in Water Polo
description: SAN JUAN, Dec. 27 (AP) The New York Athletic Club won its two opening matches today in the first round of the national water polo champion ship. The topseeded N.Y.A.C. team beat the University of Minnesota, 191, and the Puerto Rican B team, 173.

title: Alexander's Cleared in Dispute Over Opening Sunday for the Ill
description: Alexander's department stores was vindicated yesterday in its dispute with the city over issuance of a summons early this month when its Bronx store was opened specially on a Sunday to permit holiday season shopping by the ill and disabled.

title: City Hall Service Today
description: Mayor Lindsay will preside at a memorial service for former President Truman at 1 P.M. today at City Hall.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: STEEL PRODUCTION OFF 1.3% FOR WEEK
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday totaled 2,686,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute report ed yesterday.

title: Nixon Aide Says Easing Of Profits Curb Is Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The Nixon Administration likely to ease soon what businessmen consider a major burden imposed on them by the price controls program, highranking official of the Cost of Living Council said today.

title: ISRAEL'S EMBASSY SEIZED IN BANGKOK
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Thurs day, Dec. 28Four armed men with submachine guns and wearing white ties and tails seized the Israeli Embassy to day and demanded the release of Black September terrorists held in. Israel, the police said.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 27 Members of the dental, medical land surgical staff of the Jersey City Medical Center have joined Local 428 of the Nursing Home and Hospital Workers Union.

title: Finley Antitrust Award Brings $231,600 More
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 27 (AP)  Charles O. Finley, owner of the Oakland A's, won an award of $231,600 in attorneys' fees from a ball park concessionaire today in United States District Court.

title: Hanoi Rejects U.S. Invitation For Technical Talks in Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. 27North Viet nam refused to sit down with the United States today to dis cuss technical details of ceasefire agreement.

title: 1,101 Women Appointed As Postmasters in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The United States Postal Service an nounced today that 1,101 wom en had been appointed post masters by Postmaster General E. T. Klassen so far in 1972, al most half the year's total of 2,407.

title: Stars Share Esprit of Sunshine Boys
description: If Jack Albertson and Sam Levene were not busy every night in Neil Simon's new comedy The Sunshine Boys, they could easily do a two man vaudeville act at the old Palace.

title: Gibson White Is Dead at 57; Trainer of Standardbreds
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 27 (UPI)  Gibson White, trainer and breeder of standardbred horses, died today. He was 57 years old and had suffered heart attack last week.

title: Barber Is Named Captain Of Hunter College Quintet
description: Frank Barber, who was last season's cocaptain along with the nowinjured Reggie Speights, has been named cap tain of Hunter College's bas ketball team.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 27 (UPI)  The top four seeded players won quarterfinal matches today in the Orange Bowl junior international ten nis tournament.

title: Truman's Body Lies in State in His Library
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 27 With military pomp, the body of Harry S. Truman was borne under the mournful gaze of friends today to the library that houses the personal pa pers and mementos that he accumulated as the 33d Presi dent of the United States.

title: People and Business
description: For Goldman, Sachs & Co., the investment banking house, yesterday was a day for the announcement of new gen eral partners. Seven men were admitted to the part nership, effective Jan. 1, bringing the total to 50.

title: After 500 Years, Now the Year of Copernicus
description: Nineteen Seventythree is the year of Nicholas Coper nicus.

title: S.M.U. Coach Retains Aide
description: DALLAS, Dec. 27 (AP) Southern Methodist's assistant coach, Dudley Parker, the No. 1 man under Hayden Fry, who was dismissed, will be retained by the new head coach, Dave Smith, the college announced today.

title: Steelers Get Harvard's Vote for No. 1
description: WASHINGTPN, Dec. 27A Harvard professor of statis tics who is also an armchair quarterback outlined today a new method of ranking pro fetsional football teams that found the Miami Dolphins not to be the best club.

title: Allen Helps Landry Pick Quarterback
description: Tom Landry, the coach of the Dallas Cowboys, will name his quarterback today for the National Conference championship game. If it's not Roger Staubach, the Washington Redskins will be surprised.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PAHAQUARRY TOWNSHIP, Dec. 26  This 20squaremile rural community, tucked be tween the banks of the Dela ware River and the crest of the Kittatinny mountain range, has been one of the early casualties in the Federal Government's de sign for the Tocks Island Dam and National Recreation Area.

title: Navy Halts Promotions Of Officers Until June
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Navy said today that it had reluctantly frozen the promotion of of ficers until June because of a budget squeeze and that a similar, but less sweeping, freeze was in effect for en listed personnel.

title: Lindsay Urges Court Plan That Would Cut Grand Jury Use and Increase Appointment of Judge
description: Abolition of the grand jury system in the stateusing grand juries only in capital of fense cases and for investiga tions  and the selection of judges by appointment instead of election, were proposed yes terday by Mayor Lindsay in a sweeping court reform package for the next session of the State Legislature.

title: Markets Closed Today In Tribute to Truman
description: All commodity exchanges, in addition to securities ex changes, will be closed today in tribute to former President Harry S Truman, who died Tuesday. The International Business Machines Corporation said that all of its offices in this country would be closed today.

title: Blood Inventory Down
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)The blood collection program in Massachusetts, hard hit be cause of the recent flu season, reported today that the inven tory across the state was down to less than 200 pints. A spokesman for the program said bloodmobiles did not op erate during the holidays.

title: U.S. LISTS TARGETS OF HEAVY ATTACKS IN NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 28  The United States military com mand, breaking a nineday si lence on damage inflicted in the intensive American air attacks against North Vietnam, listed nearly three dozen airfields, rail yards, power plants, supply depots and communications centers yesterday among the facilities that have been bombed.

title: HAWKS BEAT 76ERS IN FINAL SECOND
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 17 (UPI) Don May's 20foot jump shot with one second remaining to night gave the Atlanta Hawks a 121120 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: GANNETT IS TESTING LASER IN PRINT USE
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 27 (UPI)  The Gannett Co., Inc., the publishing company, confirmed today that it is participating in the research and develop ment of a new system that could produce printing plates through multiple laser beam ap plications.

title: Personal Finance: Futures Options
description: Investors who might better be called speculators appar ently have withdrawn many millions of dollars from the stock market in recent months for investment in commodity futures contracts.

title: Great Western United Reports Deficit for Quarter
State Ends Fight on Jersey Central Commuter Runs
description: NEWARK, Dec. 27  The state apparently cleared the way today for the Central Rail road of New Jersey to elimi nate passenger service for 15, 000 daily commuters after Jan. 21.

title: Iona Tops New Hampshire
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Dec. 27 Ray Hyland of Iona scored 17 points and pulled down 15 re bounds tonight to lead the Gaels to a 5547 victory over the University of New Hamp shire.

title: More U.A.L. Suits Filed; $10Million Damages Sought
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (AP) Seven more suits seeking a total of $10million in damages were filed today against United Air Lines as a result of. the Chicago crash in which 45 persons were killed on Dec. 8.

title: Two Catholic Aides Defend Cannibalism In Chilean Air Crash
description: Two spokesmen for the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York said yesterday that the survivors of a plane crash in the Chilean Andes two months ago acted justifiably when they ate parts of bodies of dead companions to keep from starving to death.

title: Wilson Condemns Bombing
description: TEL AVIV, Israel, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Harold Wilson, the leader of Britain's opposition Labor party, tonight condemned the American bombing of North Vietnam. Mr. Wilson is on a visit here.

title: City's Employment Chief
description: Woman in the News

title: Visitors in Hanoi See Craters Where 10,000 Lived
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)In the northern Hanoi district of An Duong, between the Red River and Lake Tay, an old metal drum is jammed in some rubble beside a hole 25 feet in diameter and six feet deep.

title: YUGOSLAVS FACE ECONOMIC CURBS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 27  Yugoslavia today is in the grim situation of a family that has bought a new house, a new car, new furniture and a lifetime course of dance instruction  all on credit.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed today that its tenderoffer rule be amended to bar any payment of special inducements' any tendering shareholders.

title: New Jerry Quarry Set For Garden Bout Jan. 5
description: Teddy Brenner, the boxing matchmaker at Madison Square Garden, promised yesterday that 1973 would be a Year of New Faces, al though the first face to ap pear Jan. 5 will be a familiar onethat of Jerry Quarry. But his outlook is new.

title: After 500 Years, Now the Year of Copernicus
description: Nineteen Seventythree is the year of Nicholas Coper nicus.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27I am an American. Some of my favorite things are football, youth, cars and alcohol.

title: U.S. INSTALLATIONS TARGET IN PROTESTS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 27Yugoslays angered by Unit ed States bombing of North Vietnam smeared red paint on the American Consulate in Zagreb last night and staged protest demonstrations outside the building today.

title: OneThird of Army In Cambodia Found To Be Nonexistent
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 27The Cambodian Gov ernment acknowledged today that, because of corruption by military commanders and other irregularities, it has at. times paid salaries to as many as 100,000 nonexistent soldiers.

title: Jersey Plans a Meadowlands Freeway
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27  The State Department of Transpor tation is planning to make pub lic in the next few weeks its proposal for a $100million, 7.6 milelong freeway that would be 10 lanes wide in some places to replace the badly con gested Route 19 between the Pulaski Skyway and the ap proaches to the George Wash ington Bridge.

title: TRUCE IN ULSTER ENDS IN VIOLENCE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 27 (UPI)British troops killed one gunman and wound ed another tonight in Strabane on the Irish Republic border, the army announced.

title: One Killed and 3 Wounded In London Bank Robbery
description: LONDON, Dec. 27 (Reuters) A bank robber was killed and another was wounded today during a gun battle with a po lice constable in one of Lon don's busiest shopping streets.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Another work by Brian Friel, the Irish author of Philadelphia Here I Come and other plays seen here, is scheduled to open March 21 at an asyetunannounced Off Broadway theater. The drama, entitled Crystal and Fox, concerns a troupe of traveling Irish entertainers. It will star King Donovan as Fox, their witty, charming and compulsive actormana ger.who is obsessed with dis solving the company and go ing it alone. The 10character play, directed by Patrick Con lon and produced by Sheila Conlon goes into rehearsal Feb. 19 and will play a week and a half of previews before opening.

title: To Senegalese Writer, Worker Is Hero
description: Sixteen years ago, Ousmane Sembene of Senegal opened a creative chapter in his life by writing Le Docker Noir, a novel drawn from his days as a cargo handler and union organizer on the docks of Marseilles, France.

title: Report Says Police Corruption in 1971 Involved Well Over Half on the Force
description: The Knapp Commission's assertion that corruption was a disease that in 1971 af fected well over half of New York's policemen contradicts the statements by countless politicians and law enforcement officials that the overwhelming majority of all policemen are honest.

title: Israeli Planes Attack Positions in Syria
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 27Israeli jet fighters attacked positions inside Syria today for the first tithe in five weeks, a military spokesman announced.

title: People in Sports: Rookie Award to Harris
description: There was only one defec tor in the army of sports writers who voted Franco Harris of Pittsburgh as United Press International's rookie of the year In the American Football Conference yester day. The 6foot2inch, 230 pound running back out of Penn State, who led the Steelers to their first division title ever, received 38 of 39 votes, with Otis Sistrunk, Oakland's defensive tackle, receiving the other.

title: On Resuming the Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Army Lays Intricate Plans For a Presidential Funeral
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 27Several years ago, at the delicate urgings of his family and closest friends, an aging Harry S. Truman began to give some serious thought to his last rites and precisely how he would prefer that they be con ducted.

title: J. DOYLE DEWITT, 70; LED INSURANCE FIRM
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 27 J. Doyle DeWitt, a director and former board chairman of the Travelers Corporation, died today in Panama while on cruise. He was 70 years old and lived at 40 Mallard Drive, Farmington, and in Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Business Briefs
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Westinghouse Elec tric Corporation announced today it had been awarded a $60million contract for two 985,000kilowatt turbine gen erators to be installed in a nuclear power plant to be built in Taiwan.

title: Cambodians Are Bitter
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 27 (UPI)  Highranking officers within the Cambodian Defense Ministry reacted bitter ly today to the news that Aus tralia was abandoning plans to provide training in Australia for members of the Cambodian armed forces.

title: POWER TRIUMPHS IN 2MILE RELAY
description: Matt Centrowitz led Power Memorial High to victor yes terday in the twomile relay, the feature event of the Catho lic High Schools Athletic Asso ciation relay carnival at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Notes on People
description: Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire recluse, went into seclusion in a London hotel after fleeing earthquakeray aged Managua, Nicaragua, where he had been living in seclusion in a hotel. British television reporters tracked Mr. Hughes to the Inn on the Park, but burly guards in the corridors outside his suite preserved his privacy. Mr. Hughes, who was 67 years old on Sunday, the day after the earthquake struck, was apparently unharmed.

title: Text of U.S. Communique Listing Targetg of Raids in North Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 27Following is the text of a communique issued to day by the United States mili tary command, listing targets of American air raids in North Vietnam between Dec. 18 and Dec. 25 and assessing damage:

title: Hearing Set on Back Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) Joseph Mohbat, a press aide in Senator George McGovern's Presidential campaign, said to day that his demand for $1,730 in back pay had not been met and that his case would go to a pretrial hearing next month. Mr. Mohbat said that two other campaign staffers, Susan Davis and Julie Schleisinger, had been paid in compliance with an order from the District of Columbia Minimum Wage Board but that he had not.

title: Courthouse Fire in Capital Damages Boyle Documents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) A Christmas Day fire in a small file room of the United States District Courthouse here damaged documents connected with the trial of the former United Mine Workers president, W. A. Boyle, court officials say.

title: Gas Stations Told to Offer A LeadFree Fuel by 1974
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 The Environmental Protection Agency issued today a regula tion requiring that one grade of leadfree gasoline be made generally available through but the country by July, 1974. William D. Ruckelshaus, the agency administrator, told a news conference that the effec tive date of the regulation was limed to coincide with the ap pearance of 1975model auto mobiles, which are expected to be equipped with pollution control devices that are made inoperable by leaded fuels.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Cahill signed into law yesterday two bills implementing the $650million bistate rail masstransporta tion program to be developed by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. The Governor said he hoped the New York Legislature will give quick approval to its version of the bills when it reconvenes Wednesday, that construction can begin during 1973.

title: J. E. Nicholson Weds Miss Simson
description: WESTON, Conn., Dec. 28  At Emmanuel Episcopal Church here this afternoon Miss Deborah Gale Simson, a student at Bowdoin College, was married to James Edwin Nicholson, a senior at Bow doin. The Rev. Richard Cluett performed the ceremony, as sisted by the Rev. George Laedlein.

title: SOVIET SETS AMNESTY FOR SOME PRISONERS
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28  The Soviet Union proclaimed an amnesty today for some cate gories of prisoners in honor of the 50th anniversary of the formation of this country as a federated state.

title: COURT OF APPEALS BACKS DISTRICTING
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28The state's highest court today unanimous ly upheld the Legislature's plan for reapportioning itself, saying that it had the principle of equal population uppermost in mind and had achieved a dis tricting plan in substantial con formity with it.

title: Joint Funeral for 12
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec 28 (AP) Sorrowing families plan a joint funeral for 12 of the 19 Woodlawn Baptist Church members who were killed in a New Mexico bus crash Tues day night while on their way to a religious retreat. The church secretary said that serv ices would be held at 2 P.M. Saturday in Austin's munici pal auditorium.

title: Defense Appointee Is Sued for Libel In Business Dispute
description: DALLAS, Dec. 28 (UPI)  William P. Clements, President Nixon's choice for Deputy Sec retary of Defense, is being sued for libel by an Argentine busi nessman who helped the Texas oilman's company, Sedco, Inc., set up one of the largest oil drilling contracts.

title: The New Chief at Brookhaven George Hoagland Vineyard Jr.
description: Man in the News

title: Books of The Times
description: LEARNING FROM LAS VEGAS. By Robert Venturi, Denise Scott Brown, and Steven Izenour. Illustrated. 188 pages. The M.I.T. Press. $25.

title: Gerualitis Advances to Final In Orange Bowl Junior Net
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 28 (UPI)Topseeded Bjorn Borg of Sweden defeated Belus Praj oux of Chile today to advance to the final of the Orange Bowl junior tennis tourney against, Vitas Gerualitis of Howard Beach, Queens.

title: HOUSING PROJECT GETS U.S. PRIORITY
description: The 5,000family develop ment under construction on Welfare Island by the, State Urban Development Corpora tion has been designated a new community by the Fed eral Government, thus giving the development priority in ob taining Federal grants ear marked for community facili ties.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 28  The Bronze Shields, an organization of black policemen, and 11 per sons will file suit in Federal Court tomorrow charging that blacks and Hispanic men are discriminated against by the Newark Police Department.

title: SABRES TROUNCE BLACK HAWKS, 82
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 28 (AP)  Gerry Meehan scored three of Buffalo's five thirdperiod goals as the Sabres routed the Chi cago Black Hawks, 82, tonight and remained undefeated at home.

title: Suspect in Kidnapping Sought In the Killing of Two Policemen
description: One of three armed men and a woman who escaped from Brooklyn bar with $30 yester day after kidnapping the bar tender is believed to be a man being sought in connection with the ambush murder of two policemen in the East Village early this year.

title: TaxiAd Hearing Scheduled
description: The city's Taxi and Limou sine Commission will hold a public hearing on Jan. 5 onpro posals that taxicabs should be allowed to carry advertising outside. The hearing is sched uled for 10:30 A.M. at 270 Broadway, sixth floor, Room G.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NO. 12 PARUN TOPS NO. 4 METREVELI
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 28 (UPI)Onny Parun of New Zealand upset Alex Metreveli of the Soviet Union in five sets today in the quarterfinals of the $50,000 Australian Open tennis championships at Koo yong. The scores were 64, 36, 63, 67, 63.

title: Orange Moon Soil Looks Duller Now, Astronaut Asserts
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 28 (UPI) The first scientist to land on the moon studied the most fantastic collection of rocks gathered by Apollo astronauts yesterday and said the orange soil did not look as bright as it had when he kicked it around on the moon.

title: New Year's Gift Offers Hope to Neediest
description: A New Year's card enclos ing a $100bill came to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday. It was signed, simply, Michael and Family.

title: Bookstalls Sprout at Language Parley
description: At the meeting of the Mod em Language Association here this year, the most popular piece of writing is the order form.

title: Stanford Tops Navy
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 28 (UPI) Stanford earned a shot at the Old Dominion tournament title by sinking Navy, 6761, tonight. Navy lost the ball out of bounds while trailing, 6561, with eight seconds to go and watched Stanford put the game out of reach with two free throws. Rich Kelley had 17 points for Stanford.

title: STATE SENATE SET TO CUT COMMITTEES
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28A special committee named by Senator Warren M. Anderson, the Bing hamton Republican who is the new Senate majority leader, will recommend that the num ber of permanent Senate com mittees be reduced from 31 to 24.

title: Cincinnati Fire Kills 2
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 28 (UPI) Two girls trapped in a burn ing threestory apartment build ing died yesterday. Three women, one clutching a 10 monthold baby in her arms, jumped to safety. The bodies of Annetta McCall, 5, and Theresa Samuels. 13, were found on an unburned mat tress in a top floor apartment. They died of suffocation, fire officials said. Three other chil dren were found safe in a closet in another apartment.

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, Dec. 28 (UPI)Britain during 1973 will have the lowest rate of economic growth and the highest inflation of any European country, the European business magazine Vision said today. According to forecasts: in its issue pre pared for January:

title: Taiwan Pulls Out of Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 28 (Reuters) Nationalist China closed its diplomatic missions in Japan today after 20 years of opera tion, following Japanese recog nition of Peking last September.

title: Only 3 of 420 Prisoners Missing After Furloughs
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 28 (AP)  Only three of 420 inmates of Connecticut's jails and prisons released on furloughs during the Christmas holidays failed to return, the state Department of Correction reported today.

title: Sniffles? Flu Virus Takes Toll
description: Sniffles, coughing, a sore throat, a headache, muscle aches, a fever and a rundown feeling can beas they are for thousands of people in 14 states  symptoms of the London flu. Or the symp toms can be caused by any one of a wide variety of viruses whose only connec tion with the flu is that their victims think they are suf fering from it.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 28  The State Transportation Depart ment announced plans today for emergency commuter serv ice to midtown and downtown New York City if the PATH transit system is shut down by a strike scheduled to begin Wednesday.

title: Judges Bar a Curb in U.S. Aid To Student Who Protested War
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28  A threejudge Federal panel here has ruled that a law suspending Federal scholarship funds for students convicted of serious crimes is invalid because it is vague and overbroad.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place: Using Arbitrage During Mergers
description: Mention the word arbi trage and the sophisticated small trader may say: For get it, commissions will more than wipe out my profits.

title: Opera
description: Back in 1965, the Metro politan Opera revived in a new production Tchaikov sky's Pique Dame, given in English under the title Queen of Spades. It was much admired and lasted in to a second season. On Wednesday night, the work was brought back into the repertory, but this time it was sung in the original Rus sian. The performance had a new leading soprano and tenor, Raina Kabaivanska as Lisa and Nicolai Gedda as Gherman, and the conductor, Kazimierz Kord, was making his debut with the company.

title: NIXON CRITIC GETS A REBUFF BY NAVY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Navy's outspoken cost cutter, Gordon Rule, was turned aside yesterday when he tried to pro test personally to Navy Secre tary John W. Warner about his transfer to a minor job.

title: DR. MANUEL GOTTLIEB
description: Dr. Manuel Gottlieb, a New York dental surgeon and an in ternational dental educator, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital, after a long illness. He was 62 years old and lived at Knoll Road, Sands Point, L. I.

title: Dr. Harold Francis McNiece, ExSt. John's Law Dean, Dies
description: Dr, Harold Francis McNiece, professor and former dean of St, John's University Law School, who had served on sev eral legislative committees, died Wednesday in Brooklyn Hospi tal.

title: A REORGANIZATION OF RELIEF URGED
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28  A tem poary state commission today recommended that the massive and unmanageable State De partment of Social Services and its local counterparts through out the state be abolished.

title: Clemson Triumphs, 8061
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Dec. 28 (UPI)Van Gregg's 21 points in the first half paced Clemson to a 9point halftime lead and the Tigers went on to an 8065 vic tory over Pepperdine tonight in the opening round of the 14th annual Poinsettia Classic. Gregg led both teams in scoring with 25 points.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: REMEMBER THE NEEDIEST!

title: Detente on Dr. Scribner
description: The disagreements between the Board of Education and Chancellor Harvey Scribner, with all their high fallout of public recrimination, have been largely over issues of protocol rather than substance. Under such circum stances, the board's reported intent to buy up the remaining six months of Dr. Scribner's contract takes on the appearance, perhaps unjustly, of vindictiveness. Far from being unprepared to continue to carry out his duties, the chancellor has publicly enumerated a long list of items on his agenda for action before June 30.

title: Many Truman Rites Held In the Metropolitan Area
description: New York officials in the Federal, state and city govern ments yesterday honored Harry S. Truman at services in City Hall Plaza as, in Mayor Lind say's words, a President who was both a leader and a lesson for all of us.

title: Doctors Seek Keys to Body's Defenses
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28It was a little thing, presumably harmless; a few drops of red pigment from guinea pig blood injected into the skin. Yet, in just 16 minutes, the healthy young woman who received it was dead.

title: Rae of U.S.C. Is Honored
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 28 (UPI)Mike Rae, quarterback of topranked Southern Califor nia, was named today winner of the Glenn (Pop) Warner Me morial Award, given annually to the most valuable senior col lege football player on the West Coast.

title: Nadjari Subpoenas Files Of the Knapp Commission
description: The state's anticorruption prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, yesterday subpoenaed the files and other investigative rnateri als of the Knapp Commission.

title: People and Business
description: W. Willard Wirtz, Secre tary of Labor in the Kennedy and Johnson Administrations, has resigned as one of the four trustees of the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company. His resignation, effective next Sunday, was accepted by. Judge John P. Fullarn, who is overseeing the activities of the railroad.

title: Key British Laborite Bids Heath Speak Up Against U.S. Bombing
description: LONDON, Dec. 28The gen eral public restraint shown by top British politicians toward the American bombardment of North Vietnam ended today with a bitter attack by the most restrained of the Labor party's leaders, Roy Jenkins.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SADAT URGES EGYPT TO GIRD FOR FIGHTING
description: CAIRO, Dec. 28 (Reuters) President Anwar elSadat said tonight that he had called on his Government to prepare for a possible outbreak of fighting with Israel.

title: Finnish Parties Protest
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 28  Finland recognized North Vietnam today and eight of her nine political parties called on the United States to stop the bombing and to sign a peace treaty. Vietnam today and eight of her nine political parties called on the United States to stop the bombing and to sign a peace treaty.

title: BORGWARNER GETS SOVIET PUMP ORDER
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28 (Reuters) The BorgWarner Corporation said today it had received a $6million order from the Soviet Union for oil well producing pumps.

title: The Way of Men With Computers
description: Sports of The Times

title: Whose Watchdog?
description: The State Commission of Investigation has been a dili gent crusader for clean government in the fourteen years since its creation. It added to that record of accomplish ment this week with a devastating report on the fleecing of the city of Albany as a result of the suffocating grip maintained by the local Democratic political machine on every aspect of municipal government.

title: 16 Nations Express Concern
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 28Yugoslavia and 15 Asian and African countries in a statement today expressed deep concern over the re sumption of American bombing of North Vietnam and the in terruption of the peace negotia tions in Paris.

title: Garrigue Service Feb. 3
description: A memorial service for Jean Garrigue, the poet who died Wednesday, will be held at St. Luke's Chapel (Episcopal), 487 Hudson Street, at Grove Street,) at 2 P.M. on Saturday, Feb. 3.

title: Goals for U.S. Urged On Weather Control
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 28 Mindful of the possibility that sooner or later human activity may alter the world's climate in an irreversible and catas trophic manner, a panel of the National Academy of Science has recommended a broad effort to learn, by 1980, the factors controlling such change.

title: C.C.N.Y. Vanquished
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Dec. 28 (AP)William and Mary led alrhost from the start tonight and defeated City College of New York, 6953, to capture the University of Scranton tournament. Mike Arizin, son of the former pro basketball star, Paul Arizin, led the W. and M. attack with 28 points and was voted the tourney's most valuable player. Otis Loyd was C.C.N.Y.'s high scorer with only 10 points.

title: DR. JACOB A. RUBIN, ACTIVE IN ZIONISM
description: Dr. Jacob A. Rubin, director of the Jewish National Fund Foundation of Greater New York, the landdevelopment arm of the World Zionist Organ ization in Israel, and author of several books on Israel, died yesterday morning of a heart attack at University Hospital. His age was 62. He lived at 124 West 93d Street.

title: Cambodian Confession
description: As the aerial blitz against North Vietnam continues in full fury, the American people have been treated another sordid glimpse of what they are getting for the continuing high investment in lives, money and national honor throughout Indochina.

title: Chou Says U.S.China Relations Are Imperiled by the Bombings
description: PEKING, Dec. 28 Premier Chou Enlai asked an Ameri can correspondent here tonight to let the American people know that the renewed bomb ing of North Vietnam would have an adverse effect on Chi na's relations with the United States.

title: No Comment by Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28A Defense Department spokesman had no immediate comment to day on reports of additional ci vilian casualties from the bomb ing of North Vietnam. He re ferred instead to earlier state ments at Pentagon briefings.

title: Charles Lantz Marries Miss Lekisch
description: Miss Jacqueline C. Lekisch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. K. Peter Lekisch of New York, was married here last eve ning to Charles J. Lantz, son of. Mr. and Mrs. James A. Lantz of Lancaster, Ohio. Rabbi Bernhard N. Cohn per formed the ceremony at the Carlton House.

title: Unexpected Holiday Leaves Wall Street Subdued
description: The national day of mourn ing observance of President Harry S. Truman's funeral yes terday found Wall Street silent and subdued.

title: Composure Displayed By Widow
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28At 1:30 this afternoon, walking slowly, carrying a cane but not using it for assistance and staring straight ahead, the 87yearold widow of Harry S. Truman emerged from the side door of her twostory white frame house today to attend her husband's funeral.

title: Cheap Bic Pen Made Baron Bich Wealthy
description: PARIS, Dec. 28One of the dreams of Baron Marcel Bich is to capture the Amer ica's Cup, the yachting trophy that has been held for more than a century by the United States. In the 1970 race, sail ing his sloop France, he suf fered an ignominious defeat when he became lost in the fog off Newport, R. I.

title: Nixon Goes to Camp David
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28, (AP) President and Mrs. Nixon left the White House by heli copter today for their moun tain retreat at Camp David near Thurmont, Md. The White House said they were accompanied only a secretary and it was not known how long they would stay there.

title: BULLETS SUBDUE HAWKS, 112 TO 111
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 28 (UPI) Baltimore rode a hot streak by Mike Riordan to a 112111 vic tory over Atlanta tonight to maintain first place in the Na tional Basketball Association's Central Division.

title: Advertising:
description: In 1933, Hugo Gernsback, who has been called the father of modern science fic tion, started a mdnthly maga zine called Sexology, which was devoted to frank and authoritative sex guidance.

title: Chou Says U.S.China Relations Are Imperiled by the Bombings
description: PEKING, Dec. 28 Premier Chou Enlai asked an Ameri can correspondent here tonight to let the American people know that the renewed bomb ing of North Vietnam would have an adverse effect on Chi na's relations with the United States.

title: Talk by a Masonic Leader and Prayer at the Funeral
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28  Following are remarks by W. Hugh McLaughlin, Grand Master of Missouri Masons, who spoke today at the beginning of the funeral service for former President Harry S. Truman, and a prayer by the Rev. H. M. Hunt at the service:

title: De Paul Routs L.I.U.
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28 (AP) Running up its biggest point total of the season, De Paul University trounced Long Is land, 9361, tonight. The vic tory was the sixth in eight games for the Blue Demons. Long Island dropped its sixth game in 10.

title: Hanoi Pressing Its Charge That U.S. Snagged Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 North Vietnam has undertaken an effort to convince Ameri cans and others that the Viet nam negotiations broke down in Paris not because of its re calcitrance, as charged by Washington, but because the United States made new de mands that reopened the entire scope of the negotiations.

title: CITY IS SHIFTING HOUSING PRIORITY
description: In a radical change in hous ing policy, the city has decid ed that the Municipal Loan Pro gram will be used to try to save neighborhoods in transition tiori rather than badly deterio rated housing in the slums.

title: People in Sports: Mays Is Not a Quitter
description: Willie Mays gave the New York Mets the good news yesterday. The center fielder, acquired last May from San Francisco, told a West Coast reporter yesterday that he is eager to start his 21st year in the major leagues next spring.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Jazz: Southern Style
description: For followers of tradition al jazz, New York is a pretty barren town. And for those traditionalists who prefer the New Orleansbased music of King Oliver, the early Louis Armstrong small groups and Jelly Roll Morton rather than the Chicago style associated with Eddie Condon, it is even more so.

title: Melville's Fans Trace His Footsteps
description: The good ship Wavertree rolled ever so gently in the cool breeze, and Prof. Hey ward Ehrlich planted his brogans firmly on her deck as he pointed off to port.

title: Business Briefs
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 28 (UPI)The steel industry should continue its upward swing in 1973 with a record shipment of 96 to 100 million tons, W. B. Boyer, president of the Republic Steel Corporation, said in a statement today.

title: Chou Says U.S.China Relations Are Imperiled by the Bombings
description: PEKING, Dec. 28 Premier Chou Enlai asked an Ameri can correspondent here tonight to let the American people know that the renewed bomb ing of North Vietnam would have an adverse effect on Chi na's relations with the United States.

title: Louisville Routs Fordham; Host Hawaii Reaches Final
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 28 (AP) Tom Henderson and Melton Werts scored 20 points each as the University of Hawaii de feated Colorado State, 8875, after Louisville crushed Ford ham, 10073, last night in the opening round of the ninth Rainbow Basketball Classic.

title: SPIRIT OF RAGTIME ELUDES PERFORMERS
description: The concert at Philharmonic Ball on Wednesday night was called A Ragtime Christmas, but the authentic spirit of rag time surfaced rarely in the mishmash of offerings.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The New York Knicker bocker drum and bugle corps, a 110member marching band from the Bronx, has been chosen to represent New York State in President Nixon's inaugural parade in Washington on Jan. 20. It's the first time since the turn of the century that a pagean try group from New York City has been invited as the State's representative in the quadrennial parade, and the Knickerbockers were selected over 100 other musical units. Traditionally known as The Pride of New York, the Knickerbockers are cospon sored by the Bronx Council on the Arts, the New York Yankees and the Knicker bocker Federal Savings and Loan Association.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The necessary technical equipment finally secured, the postponed debut of Pierre Boulez's ... explosante/ fixe... will take place, at Alice Tully Hall the night of Jan. 5. It will be repeated the following Sunday after noon.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 28  The black sponsors of a controver sial apartment house being built in the predominantly white North Ward here said to day that they did not want any help from the Students for a Democratic Society.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 28  Gov ernor Cahill today signed two bills approving a $650million masstransportation construc tion program by the Port Au thority of New York and New Jersey, and he urged the New York Legislature to approve identical legislation quickly.

title: To Tell The Truth
description: OAKLAND HILLS, Mich.Ours is still a democratic republic. The people still have the power. Nothing moves not on Capitol Hill and not here in Detroitexcept by the will and vote of the American people. The individual Americanwhether we call him voter, or customer, or readeris still the sovereign we must serve.

title: NADJARI IS GIVEN DRUGTHEFT CASE
description: Governor Rockefeller yester day issued an executive Order intended to give Maurice H. Nadjari, the special anticorrup tion prosecutor he appointed, sole authority to investigate the theft of narcotics from the Police Department.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The death of Harry Truman dramatizes the im mense changes that have taken place in the style and conduct of the United States Government during the past generation.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmos phere, service and decor (four triangles to none.)

title: 4 Debutantes Honored At Metropolitan Club
description: The Misses Jeanne Ruf fin Hook, Christina Maria Chaves, Deborah Fabian Gin ley and Margarett Carole Russell were honored last night at the eighth annual debutante ball given by the Metropolitan Club for young women related to members.

title: Soviet Media Are Critical
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28The of ficial Soviet media are main taining a drumfire of criticism against the heavy air assaults on North Vietnam. The theme is broken campaign promises to American voters over the war in Indochina.

title: South Vietnamese Training Post Near Da Nang Is Hit by Rockets
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Dec. 29 (UPI)Enemy gun ners fired 12 122mm. rockets, into a South Vietnamese train ing center on the edge of Da Nang yesterday afternoon, kill ing 3 persons and wounding 13 others.

title: We Must Tell the President
description: WASHINGTONCan we scientists meet in Washington and ignore the fact that our national Administration is launching from this city the Most massive air attacks in history? It is launching those attacks against con centrated centers of civilian popula tion, while blandly announcing lists of military targets that under these cir cumstances insult the intelligence of every thinking person. North Vietnam hardly contains military targets; and a B52 bombing pattern one and one half miles long by onehalf mile broad, dropped, from an altitude of 30,000 feet, cannot pick out targets.
