Yet such bombings are now crisscrossing some of the most densely populated cities in the world, in an unprecedented orgy of killing and destruction that hor rifies people everywhereas Guer nica, Coventry and Dresden once hor rified them. And all in our name.

title: A Priest and 2 Boys At End of Long Line
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28 (AP)A Catholic priest from Chicago who was ac companying two boys from Columbia, Mo., was the last person in the long line ad mitted to the lying in state of former President Harry S. Truman today.

title: Panel Rejects Rise In Military Pension
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  A House Armed Services subcom mittee, warning that any in crease in military retirement pay could lead to a tax in, crease, has unanimously urged resection of a Senatepassed proposal that would provide raises of up to 40 per cent for retired officers and increases for retired enlisted men.

title: 2 More B52's Downed,
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 29  The United States military command re ported the loss of two more B52 bombers yesterday as the air attack on North Vietnam that began 12 days ago con tinued without letup.

title: Stars Rout Nets, 12890; Carter Is Banished Early
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 28 With George Carter, their top scorer, ejected on two tech nicals in the first quarter, the New York Nets were no match for the Utah Stars and were practically blown off the court, 12890, in an American Basket ball Association game tonight.

title: ExS.B.A. Aide Indicted
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 28 (UPI) Robert L. Mallette, a former loan officer for the Small Busi ness Association, was charged yesterday with soliciting and accepting bribes in connection with about $1million in S.B.A. loans. Three other persons were also named in the 42count Federal grand jury indictment. The alleged offenses occurred in 1970 and involved about 10 loans.

title: Alcoa Is Increasing Prices For Its Seamless Tubing
description: The Aluminum Company of America announced yesterday that it would increase prices on coiled drawn seamless alumi num tubing by 1 to 2 cents a pound, effective Monday.

title: Prices of Treasury Bonds Decline in, Light Trading
description: Credit Markets

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Hog Quarantine to Be Lifted Tuesday

title: Boycott in Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 28 (UPI)  The Seamen's Union of Australia today announced a boycott against all United States shipping in Australian ports as a protest against American bombing of North Vi etnam.

title: Archaeologists Hear the Details Of Dig That Was Like Macy's
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 It, looked like Macy's, said Iris C. Love, describing the vast assortment of Greek and Roman terra cotta bowls, laimps and vases taken from a huge cistern that was discovered last sum mer at Cnidus, Turkey.

title: Protests of Inequity Pour In On U.S. Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Treasury Department has been swamped by complaints from local governments charging that revenuesharing funds have been disbursed in an arbitrary and discriminatory manner.

title: Sacred Heart Ace Gets 50
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 28 (AP)  Ray Vyzas scored a recordbreaking 50 points to night to spark Sacred Heart to a 11783 victory over previously undefeated Brandeis in a semi final of the Sacred Heart Uni versity tournament. Tufts upset Bridegport, 8581, in the other semifinal.

title: Amtrak Plans Turbine Service Along 2 Routes in the Midwest
description: Highspeed turbinepowered passenger trains will be put in service next summer along two heavily populated Midwest cor ridorsChicago to Milwaukee and Chicago to St. Louis.

title: Chou Says U.S.China Relations Are Imperiled by the Bombings
description: PEKING, Dec. 28 Premier Chou Enlai asked an Ameri can correspondent here tonight to let the American people know that the renewed bomb ing of North Vietnam would have an adverse effect on Chi na's relations with the United States.

title: Vienna Choir Boys Excel At Philharmonic Concert
description: The Vienna Choir Boys have been coming here for so long that one is tempted to believe they followed in the wake of Columbus. After all, the boys' organization dates to 1498. The supply of excellent ensembles doesn't dry up, and yesterday afternoon's concert in Philhar monic Hall by the latest visit ing group was a model of disciplined singing. It was the first of seven appearances in the hall this weekend.

title: PATERNO WOOING SUGAR BOWL FANS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28  Joe Paterno has been taking his Penn State football teams to bowl games so regularly that he has developed a wonderful routine aimed at adding the bowl city's neutral fans to the usually outnumbered Penn State cheering section.

title: UTILITY COMPANY POSTS RISE IN NET
description: Northeast Utilities, a holding company whose principal sub sidaries are Western Massachu setts Electric, Connecticut Light and Power and Hartford Elec tric Light Company, reported yesterday sharply higher rev enues and earnings for the 12 months ended with November.

title: 250 Funeral Guests Include Politicians And Close Friends
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28 (UPI)The guest list for the funeral of Harry S. Truman included about 250 persons movie stars, Senators, close friends and family, old political allies and fellow soldiers, and his house painter and barber.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: RED CROSS SUSPENDS SOME SAIGON VISITS
description: GENEVA, Dec. 28The Inter national Committee of the Red Cross has suspended indefinite ly the visits it had been making to political prisoners in South Vietnam.

title: Looters to Be Shot
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  Troops pa trolled this earthquakebattered city today with orders to shoot looters, gangs of whom have been prowling the ruins and hauling away items ringing from food to refrigerators and stoves.

title: 68% of Catholic Women Ignore Birth Control Rule, Study Shows
description: A dramatic change has taken place in the birth control practices of Roman Catholic women in the United States, with more than twothirds of married Catholics now using contraceptive methods disap proved by the church, the latest findings of the 1970 National Fertility Study show.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 28 (AP)The Westernowned Iraq Petroleum Company announced today that it would abstain temporarily from legal action against the Iraqi Government because of progress in efforts to settle a dispute arising from Iraq's takeover of the company's assets there.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Best of Life, a portrait of an era and a magazine, will be recorded in permanent form in a book to be published next spring by TimeLife Books. Follow ing the publication this week of the final issue of Life magazine, a group of its editors, headed by David Scherman, will study more than 1,800 issues of the magazine to select photo graphs and articles that best illustrate its contributions to journalism. The book, to be priced at $19.95, will cele brate the magazine's out standing photographs and photo essays, its photographic inventions, its science and nature photographs and its portraits, of the famous and notsofamous.

title: Roanoke Tops Delaware
description: SALEM, Va., Dec. 28 (AP) Roanoke's defending National Collegiate Athletic Association college division champions led virtually all the way tonight in whipping Delaware, 9885, in the Roanoke invitation tourna ment. The Maroons (71) will play American University to morrow night in the final. American posted a 9884 victory over Appalachian State.

title: Dissident Voices Heard At Economic Conference
description: TORONTO, Dec. 28 About 8,000 economists attending the annual conference of the Allied Social Science Research Coun cil in Toronto this week are hearing considerably more about the cause of blacks, wo men and radical economists than about Nixon's economic policy or problems in tradi tional economic theory.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: CAPE MAY, Dec. 28 (AP) A 44yearold Trenton man was killed in his car today during a shootout with the police near the entrance to this resort city. The police said that the man, John W. Polite, had been slain by two Patrolmen after he opened fire on them from his car parked in the right lane of Sunset Boulevard.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: SOMERVILLE, N. J., Dec. 28from a series of black tieathome gatherings in stately Princeton homes to the hubbub of Good Time Charley's dimly lighted Kingston public house, Jer seyans will welcome the New Year according to the dic tates of taste and purse.

title: He Banishes Books and Toothbrushes in Quest for Perfect Order
description: Valerian Stux Rybar's autobiography runs to 1,300 impressive red and brown leather volumes, each with its cover imprinted in gold, and they are stacked floortoceiling in the mirrored hallway of his New York apartment. Everybody notices them. Some guests even grab for the racier titlessuch tomes as Only Love One, Only Love Two, Elsa Maxwell Discovers Me or L Sell Myself.

title: Newsmen in Hanoi Visit Street of Ruins
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 28One of Hanoi's most animated and colorful, streets, Kham Thien, is a mass ruins and a scene of desolation and mourning today in the wake of the latest series of American air raids.

title: C.B.S. Strike Ends as Technicians Accept Contract
description: The eightweekold techni cians' strike against the Co lumbia Broadcasting System ended yesterday when union members voted narrowly to accept a new contract offer under which they agreed to yield substantially on such key issues as automation and jurisdiction over new and evolving electronic devices.

title: Doctors Seek Keys to Body's Defenses
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28It was a little thing, presumably harmless; a few drops of red pigment from guinea pig blood injected into the skin. Yet, in just 16 minutes, the healthy young woman who received it was dead.

title: MICHAEL REPLACED ON PLANNING UNIT
description: Ivan Michael, a Harlem law yer who voted against several administration proposals during his 40 months as a member of the City Planning Commission, will not be reappointed by Mayor Lindsay. He was the first black member of the com mission.

title: Jabbar: 44 Points, 28 Rebounds
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 28 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks behind Kareem AbdulJabbar broke away in the third period and routed the Detroit Pistons to night, 11591.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Burlington Weighs Center
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 28 (UPI) Burlington Northern, Inc., said today it was considering con struction of a Pacific center near the Seattle waterfront to house regional headquarters and provide space for other companies Involved in inter national commerce. The pro posal called for two 16story towers with streetlevel retail and service shops. The com pany applied to the city for a zoning change from a manu facturing to a commercial designation for the twoblock, 1.6acre site.

title: LA SALE DEFEATS N. MEXICO STATE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (AP)Jim Crawford sank 11 straight shots as La Salle built a 19point lead, held off a New Mexico State rally and defeat ed the Aggies, 7670, tonight in a Quaker City tournament semifinal.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 28  New Jersey's method for marking automobile license platesthree letters of the alphabet followed by three numbersis nearing the end of the alphabet.

title: THROAT CLOSING UPSET BY COURT
description: A Federal District Court judge issued a temporary re straining order yesterday pro hibiting the Police Department from using city license regula tions to interfere with the thea ter where the hardcore porno graphic film Deep Throat is being shown.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Scribner Asks $2.5Billion

title: NEW THIEU DECREE CURBS OPPOSITION
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 28Acting on the last day be fore the expiration of his spe cial decree powers, President Nguyen Van Thieu last night quietly signed a law that South Vietnamese political leaders say will eliminate virtually all political parties except Mr. Thieu's new Democratic party.

title: CHOU CROUTE TAKES SANTA ANITA SPRINT
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 28 (UPI)Chou Croute, who was named the outstanding Sprinter of 1972 yesterday, scored an impressive victory today in the $35,700 Las Flores Handicap at Santa Anita Park.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Dec. 28 (AP)Czechoslovakia scored its second victory in the World Cup hockey tourna ment last night with a 5.1 decision over Canada. Czecho slavakia plays the Soviet Union tomorrow night in the final game of the Colorado Springs series. Saturday night the roundrobin tournament moves to Bloomington, Minn., with the Russians playing Canada.

title: Advertising:
description: Clyne Maxon, Inc., has ap pointed two new executive vice presidentsReginald H. Satterwhite, 39yearold di rector of marketing and ac count services, and Daniel J. Connolly, 41, director of financial services.

title: Nonexpectations Of a Negotiated Peace
description: WASHINGTONIf confusion has been the chronic state of the American public mind during most of the Viet nam conflict, there is little to suggest that its terminal phase will be a period of enlightened understanding. Since Oct. 26 when we first became aware of the sudden hope in the Paris negotia tions our understanding of the situa tion has become increasingly clouded by veiled or inadequate official state ments supplemented by endless media speculations.

title: Yonkers to Offer $1Million in '73 For Stakes Races
description: YONKERS, Dec. 28  A $1 million program of stakes and special events will be held next year at Yonkers Raceway, which opens the harness racing season in New York next Wednesday, Jan. 3.

title: City Shifts Housing Loans To Aid Transition Areas
description: In a radical change in hous ing policy, the city has decided that the Municipal Loan Pro gram will be used to try to save neighborhoods in transi tion rather than badly deterio rated housing in the slums.

title: Stanford Tops Navy
description: NOFOLK, Va., Dec. 28 (UPI) Stanford earned a shot at the Old Dominion tournament title by sinking Navy, 6761, tonight. Navy lost the ball out of bounds while trailing, 6561, with eight seconds to go and watched Stanford put the game out of reach with two free throws. Rich Kelley had 17 points for Stanford.

title: Louis Albrecht Weds Mrs. Leslie C. Cox
description: ROANOKE, Va., Dec. 28 Mrs. Leslie Carson Cox was married at her home here to day to Louis Albrecht of Al tavista. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Wil liam Kilns, minister of the Second Presbyterian Church.

title: Chief Cashier Slain in St. Regis; Dismissed Assistant Surrenders
description: The chief cashier of the St. RegisSheraton Hotel was killed by a shotgun blast in the chest in the fashionable midtown ho tel yesterday by a man the police identified as an assistant cashier who was discharged last week.

title: Knicks Stroll Past Braves, 107 to 86
description: I almost fell asleep  and I was playing, said Walt Frazier, who found time be tween nods to score 19 points and help the Knicks defeat the Buffalo Braves, 10786, yester day afternoon at Madison Square Garden.

title: Dairy Industry Gifts to Nixon Campaign Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  Dairy funds and other special interest groups donated thou sands of dollars for the reelec tion of President Nixon in a blackout period when campaign contributions were not made public just before the Nov. 7 election.

title: Stockton Advances
description: MANHASSET, L.I., Dec. 28 Topseeded Dick Stockton of Port Washington, L.I., advanced to the second round of the first Long Island men's holiday invi tation event at Ferris Tennis to day by defeating Roth Rebhuhn, also of Port Washington, 62, 61. Secondseeded Pete Fish bach and thirdseeded King Van Nostrand lost their matches by default to Ed Bertram and Sam Schwartz, respectively.

title: Hill Has Hand, or Foot, In Most Cowboy Plays
description: About Pro Football

title: BRIMMER RENEWS ATTACK ON BANKS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  Andrew F. Brimmer, a member of the Federal Reserve Board, supplied new evidence today to support his contention that the nation's banks, particularly the biggest banks, can and do main tain their lending to business during periods of monetary re straint, while cutting back on other loans and investments.

title: Ronan and L.I.R.R. Union Chief Hold an Exploratory Meeting
description: The top negotiators for the Long Island Rail Road and 12 striking unions met yesterday for exploratory discussions, but reported later that they were still far apart.

title: Screen: Visual Alchemy, Program of Six Experimental Short Films, Starts Run Here
description: Visual Alchemy is the collective title for the Whit ney Museum's new show of six short, mostly abstract films, three of which are so good that to call them avant garde would be to discredit their vitality and originality.

title: Panel Rejects Rise In Military Pension
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  A House Armed Services subcom mittee, warning that any in crease in military retirement pay could lead to a tax in crease, has unanimously urged rejection of a Senatepassed proposal that would provide raises of up to 40 per cent for retired officers and increases for retired enlisted men.

title: ISRAELI EMBASSY IN BANGKOK HELD BY ARABS 19 HOURS
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Friday, Dec. 29Four Palestinian guer rillas seized the Israeli Embassy yesterday and held six hostages for nearly 19 hours. But they freed the hostages this morn ing and flew to Cairo with the Egyptian Ambassador and two high Thai officials with them to guarantee their safety.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI)The nation's railroads' rate of return, for the year ending Sept. 30, was 2.57 per cent, still well below, the 6 per cent rate on net investment, the Interstate Commerce Commission says, the railroads must achieve in order to maintain needed services; This figure is up slightly from 2.49 per cent in 1971.

title: Cougars Trounce Pacers
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Dec. 28 (AP) The Carolina Cougars picked up their fifth straight victory tonight and handed the Indiana Pacers their fifth straight loss, 120106.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: DETROIT (UPI)  When Wamba, a series of five photographs depicting a se quence of a man pulling down his undershorts, went on exhibition at the Detroit Institute of Arts, patrons complained and the pictures were removed. As a result, some artists are threatening to remove their exhibitions from the institute.

title: Whatever Play Cowboys Use, Hill Often Has Hand or Foot in It
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Oklahoma Stays Unbeaten
description: KANSAS CYTY, Dec. 28 (UPI) Unbeaten Ordahoma reeled off 9 straight points in the last 1:42 of overtime to whip Okla homa State, 6962, tonight in the first round of the Big Eight tournament.

title: Three Represent New Breed of Judges
description: Mayor Lindsay, who has been a critic of the caliber and pro fessionalism of the judiciary here, put the emphasis on youth, legal experience and familiarity with the courts in his appointment of three new Criminal Court judges yester day.

title: Mrs. Truman Will Get A Pension of $20,000
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28 (UPI)Mrs. Harry S. Til man, 87 years old, the widow of the former President, will receive an annual pension of $20,000 and Secret Service protection for the remainder of her life.

title: Nixon Sells Land Near Florida Home To a Yonkers Man
description: President Nixon has sold two plots of waterfront land on Key Biscayne, the Florida resort he frequently visits, to a Yonkers lawyer for $150,000.

title: Irish Alps Blanketed With Snow
description: News of Skiing

title: DOMINICK MILONE JR.
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Dec. 28Dominick Milone Jr., vice president and a director of Dominick Milone, Inc., a con struction company founded by his late father in 1898, died to day of cancer in Mercy Hos pital. He was 52 years old and lived at 36 Merrick Road.

title: Wagner Loses by 8273
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 28 (AP)Bob LaVigne scored 20 points to lead Amherst to an 8273 victory over Wagner to day in the consolation round of the Sacred Heart University tournament.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 28 (AP)Ernie (Indian Red) Lopez of Los Angeles gained a second shot at the world welterweight title with the announcement today that Jos Napoles of Mexico will defend against him on Feb. 28 the Forum.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISHenry, the protoKissinger, came to his job with an analytical brain, a brilliant reputation as a Hat yard professor and considerable polit ical experience. He worked for a while with President Kennedy but quit be cause he, disagreed over General de Gaulle. Then he became Nelson Rocke feller's foreign policy expert. Ikacke feller recommended him to President Nixon.

title: Books of The Times
description: SHERIDAN. The Track of a Comet. By Made leine Bingham. 382 pages. St. Martin's. $12.50

title: Financial Accord Is Set by Seeburg And Commonwealth
description: Merger News

title: SUSPECT INDICTED IN CAFE SHOOTING
description: A Queens man whose release in $500 bail in connection with the holdupshooting of a patrol man and a restaurant patron stirred a controversy was in dicted yesterday by a grand jury investigating the crimes.

title: St. John's Victor; Manhattan Loses
description: St. John's used a dramatic basket with two seconds left and South Carolina used poise, patience and a tough zone de fense to gain the final round of the Holiday Festival basket ball tournament last night.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LONDON, Dec. 28 (UPI)A British company is scheduled to make 1,000 dry freight con tainers for the Soviet Union's Merchant Marine, Sea Contain ers, Ltd., said today.

title: Ellen Hirsch Bride of D. B. Brounstein
description: ALPINE, N. J., Dec. 28 Miss Ellen Sara, Hirsch and Donald Bruce Brounstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Brounstein of Murray Hill, were married here this eve ning. Rabbi William Horn performed the ceremony at the Tamcrest Country Club.

title: Tribute Is Paid to Pearson As Canada Plans Ceremony
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 28  Cana dians mourned today the death of former Prime Minister Lester Bowles Pearson, who died of cancer late Wednesday at his home in Rockcliffe, a suburb.

title: NEW THIEU DECREE CURBS OPPOSITION
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 28Acting on the last day be fore the expiration of his spe cial decree powers, President Nguyen Van Thieu last night quietly signed a law that South Vietnamese political leaders say will eliminate virtually all political parties except Mr. Thieu's new Democratic party.

title: Bridge:
description: Team games scored by in ternational match points, whether knockout matches or the Swiss variety, are com mon ground for two groups of players: those whose normal activity is the match point pair game normal in duplicate clubs and those who prefer the rubberbridge table.

title: Alabama End Doubtful
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Dec. 28 (AP)Coach Paul (Bear) Bry ant said today that Warren Dyar, firststring tight end, probably would miss Alabama's Cotton Bowl game New Year's Day with Texas because of an injury. Fourthranked Alabama went over its game plan and had a good workout today, Bryant said.

title: Death With Dignity
description: Harry S. Truman's monthlong final illness illustrated both the gains and the problems arising from medical advances. Using drugs and all the other tools of science, doctors were able to help the 88yearold former Presi dent survive for weeks in his terminal ailment despite lung congestion, heart irregularity, kidney failure, mal functioning of the digestive system and assorted other woes resulting from old age. But in his last days, death's victory was certain; Mr. Truman was in a coma much the time; there was no positive quality to such life remained; and for his loved ones there was the drawn out agony of waiting for the inevitable.

title: STAUBACH NAMED COWBOY STARTER
description: DALLAS, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Coach Tom Landry, moved by a gamesaving performance that kept Dallas's Super Bowl hopes alive last week, today named Roger Staubach to start at quarterback for the Cowboys Sunday against the Washington Redskins in the National Foot ball Conference championship game.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The Super Bowl champions will earn a total of $23,500 a man, according to Commissioner Pete Rozelle's office.

title: Gerualitis Advances to Final In Orange Bowl Junior Net
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 28 (UPI)Topseeded Bjorn Borg of Sweden defeated Belus Praj oux of Chile today to advance to the final of the Orange Bowl junior tennis tourney against Vitas Gerualitis of Howard Beach, Queens.

title: Frazier Says Plans Include Ali Rematch
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec: 28 (AP)Joe Frazier, the world heavyweight boxing cham pion, said today he planned two or three more fights before retiring from the ring to devote his time to his singing career and working with youth.

title: RESEARCH CHIEF TO QUIT PENTAGON
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 28  The chief of research for the armed forces over the last sev en years is leaving his job.

title: PROXMIRE FEARS SST REVIVAL BID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 With most of official Washing ton in a state of inactivity, Senator William Proxmire be gan this week marshalling forces against a possible re vival of plans to develop an American supersonic transport plane.

title: Record Output Is Estimated for Nation
description: The total output of goods and services in the American econ omy rose by a record $33bil lion in the fourth quarter of 1972, Chase Econometric Asso ciates said yesterday.

title: DRUGTHEFT CASE GIVEN TO NADJARI
description: Governor Rockefeller yester day issued an executive order intended to give Maurice H. Nadjari, the special anticorrup tion prosecutor he appointed, sole authority to investigate the theft of narcotics from the Police Department.

title: DEFENSE APPOINTEE NAMED IN LIBEL SUIT
description: DALLAS, Dec. 28 (UPI) William P. Clements, President Nixon's choice for Deputy Sec retary of Defense, is being sued for libel by an Argentine busi nessman who helped the Texas mailman's company, Sedco, Inc., set up one of the largest oil drilling contracts.

title: 3d Body Found in Rubble After Fire in Port Chester
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 28 (UPI)The body of a wo man was found in the rubble of a rooming house here this afternoon, bringing the number of victims of yesterday's fire to three, the police reported. The badly burned body was tentatively identified as that of Ruth Alley.

title: FALSE FALSE ARREST OF 4 LAID TO DETECTIVE
description: A detective with 12 years in the police Department was in dicted yesterday in what the District Attorney said was a case in which he had knowing ly arrested tour innocent men. The detective was immediately suspended.

title: Small, LooselyKnit Group
description: Fewer than 300 fervent young Palestinians are thought to make up the Black September terrorist group, which Arab and Israeli officials say is a branch of the more con ventional Al Fatah commando group. Its latest exploit was the seizure of the Israeli Embassy in Bangkok.

title: SCIENTISTS ASSAIL BOMBING POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 Dissidents within the scientific community tried to mount a massive protest against Ameri can bombing of North Vietnam today, but found little support.

title: 7 LATIN BANDS PLAY ACADEMY OF MUSIC
description: New Yorkbased Latin music of a pronounced Puerto Rican flavor took over the Academy of Music for two fourhour shows Wednesday night. Latin music is probably still best known in a dance context, and indeed the percussive, synco pated rhythms that underlay all seven acts had isolated couples dancing happily at the back of the hall early yesterday morn ing.

title: Eagles and the Law
description: Normally a law is assumed to be constitutional until the courts specifically rule otherwise. In the case of the disgusting killing of hundreds of golden eagles in Colorado and Wyoming last year, the prosecution and the courts themselves seem bent on avoiding a constitu tional test, preferring to make their doubts on the subject a pretext for increasing leniency.

title: Israeli Cabinet Acts
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 28The Israeli Cabinet convened an emergency session in Tel Aviv today shortly after the first re ports were received of the Arab guerrilla takeover of the Israeli Embassy in Bangkok.

title: Clemson Triumphs, 8061
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Dec. 28 (UPI)Van Gregg's 21 points in the first half paced Clemson to a 9point halftime lead and the Tigers went on to an 8065 vic tory over Pepperdine tonight in the opening round of the 14th annual Poinsettia Classic. Gregg led both teams in scoring with 25 points.

title: Webster Scores 2 As Whalers Beat Nordiques, 5 to 3
description: QUEBEC CITY, Dec. 28 (UPI) Tom Webster scored two goals and Terry Cafferey had three assists tonight to lead the New England Whalers to a 53 victory over the Quebec Nordiques in a World Hockey Association game.

title: U.S. Plans Reforms on Labels And Additives of Frankfurters
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI) Bowing to consumer pressure and a court order, the Department of Agriculture has announced plans for a second major round of reforms in the labeling and content of hot dogs.

title: The Brezhnev Style
description: News Analysis

title: ISRAELI EMBASSY IN BANGKOK HELD BY ARABS 19 HOURS
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Friday, Dec. 29Four Palestinian guer rillas seized the Israeli Embassy yesterday and held six hostages for nearly 19 hours. They then freed the hostages this morn ing and flew to Cairo with the Egyptian Ambassador and two high Thai officials to guarantee their safety.

title: Penn Central Serves Notice It Will Reduce Train Crews
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (Reuters)The Penn Central Transportation Company said today that it would promulgate a new rule on Jan. 12 reducing train crews from a conductor and two brakemen to a con ductor and one brakeman.

title: Newsmen in Hanoi Visit Street of Ruins
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 28One of Hanoi's most animated and colorful streets, Kham Thien, is a mass ruins and a scene of desolation and mourning today in the wake of the latest, series of American air raids.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: The Thrill of a Bow Hunt
description: In this backtonature age, when young people would rather pick berries and walk in the wonderment of Big Sur than write theses and organic food is taking over pantry shelves, there is little surprise in the boom in bow hunting.

title: Louisville Routs Fordham; Host Hawaii Reaches Final
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 28 (AP) Tom Henderson and Melton Werts scored 20 points each as the University of Hawaii de feated Colorado State, 8875, after Louisville crushed Ford ham, 10073, last night in the opening round of the ninth Rainbow Basketball Classic.

title: Rizzo Suggests Austerity For Philadelphia Schools
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (AP)Mayor Frank L. Rizzo has suggested that the city's schools need to adopt a strict austerity program in order to survive its current financial crisis.

title: Detroit Mayor Won't Run Again; WhiteBlack Contest Is Expected
description: DETROIT, Dec. 28Detroit's Mayor, Roman S. Gribbs, said today that he would not run for reelection next year. The decision is expected to produce another whiteversusblack contest for the Mayor's office.

title: In Nicaraguan Refugee Town, Thousands Wait Uncertainly for Aid
description: MASAYA, Nicaragua, Dec., 28 Nearly every other house here has a red flag hanging out the door to signify that there are earthquake refugees who need help.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: Organized five years ago, the New Jersey Dog Federa tion is the largest and the bellwether of the state groups. From a nucleus of a halfdozen organizations, the N.J.D.F. has mushroomed to 56 member clubs.

title: RICHARD J. LAVOIE
description: Richard J. Lavoie, director of security and safety for the International Telephone and relegraph Corporation, died Wednesday. Mr. Lavoie, who was 56 years old, lived in Kin nelon, N. J.

title: Books of The Times
description: LEARNING FROM LAS VEGAS. By Robert Venturi, Denise Scott Brown, and Steven Izenour. Mustarded. 188 pages. The M.I.T. Press. $25.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Truman Buried in Presidential Library Courtyard
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28  Harry S. Truman, 33d President of the United States, was buried today in the dark soil of his beloved Missouri.

title: Where You Dine Like a Czar
description: Restaurants reviewed on gv this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and d cor (four triangles to none).

title: Notes on People
description: Apparently because there have been public aemonstra tions in Yugoslav cities pro testing the resumption of the United States bombing of North Vietnam, intense secur ity measures were in effect as Mrs. Edward F. Cox, the former Tricia Nixon, and her husband arrived by plane in Belgrade. Several American Embassy cars were waiting at the airport as the couple arrived and were taken to their official host, Ambassa dor Malcolm Toon. Because of the security consideration, the Coxes' sightseeing in Bel grade is expected to be minimal.

title: Mrs. Collins Endorsed
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28 (AP) Cardiss W. Collins, 45 years old, has received the endorse ment of the Cook County Democratic organization to suc ceed her husband, George W. Collins, as United States Rep resentative from Illinois, Sev enth District. Mr. Collins was one of 45 persons killed Dec. 8 in a United Air Lines crash near Midway Airport. A specie, primary for filling the vacancy created by his death has been set for April 17, with the elec tion scheduled for June 5.

title: Donohue Earnings Topped U.S.A.C. Drivers in 1972
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 28 (UPI)Mark Donohue, the In dianapolis 500 champion, led the United States Auto Club drivers in earnings for 1972. Donohue finished with $244, 748, all in the championship division, according to U.S.A.C. figures released today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SUIT AGAINST CASEY ORDERED BY JUDGE
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28 (AP)A Federal judge has or dered a $1.5million damage suit filed against Under Secre tar of Statedesignate William J. Casey and others.

title: At Laurel, Dandy Sandy Sells Tickets by the Fistful
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 28  When Desmond Sandford Hawley asks a horse to run, an enthusiasm approaching religious fervor grips the longhaired Canadian jockey's followers.

title: 2 More B52's Downed, Bringing the Total to 14
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 29  The United States military command re ported the loss of two more B52 bombers yesterday as the air attack on North Vietnam that began 12 days ago con tinued without letup.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Dec. 21 (AP)American Eagle, skippered by Ted Turner of Atlanta, appeared certain today of finishing first in the 630mile SydneytoHobart yacht race.

title: 3 Criminal Court Judges Are Appointed by Lindsay
description: Exercising one of the most powerfuland pleasingpre rogatives of his office, Mayor Lindsay yesterday appointed three new judges to the Crim inal Court and three judges to fill oneyear vacancies on the Civil Court.

title: Situation Called Chaotic
description: GENEVA, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Lack of transportation to dis tribute relief food supplies to earthquake victims in Nicara gua has led to a chaotic sit uation, the International Red Cross said today.

title: Hotel Described as Den of Vice Agrees to Clean Up Premises
description: The management of the Uni versity Hotel, formerly the Broadway Central, has consen ted to a court order Calling for immediate steps to eliminate crime, clean up garbage in adjacent yards and run, a de cent hostel.

title: Man Who Was Held 21 Years Without a Trial Is Freed at 88
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y. Dec. 28 (AP)  Eightyeightyear old Alfred Curt von Wolfers dorf was released yesterday from Binghamton State Hos pital after spending 21 years in mental institutions be cause of a murder he was not convicted of and he says he did not commit.

title: Cougars Down Blazers
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28 (AP) Rosaire Paiement scored two goals and Bob Sicinski added another and picked up three assists as the Chicago Cougars beat the Philadelphia Blazers, 63, tonight. The victory was the fifth straight at home for the Cougars.

title: Contract Talks Extended
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 28 (UPI) Union pressmen at the three daily newspapers here agreed today to extend contract talks beyond the Jan. 1 expiration date. Robert Stallings, president of Pressmen's Local 31, said negotiations with the News American and the two Sun papers were going more smoothly than three years ago, when the union eventually struck for 74 days.

title: Survivors of Andes Air Crash Admit Dead Saved Their Lives
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 28 (UPI)Survivors of an air crash who spent 10 weeks in the snowcovered Andes in Chile admitted on their home coming here tonight that they had eaten the flesh of their dead comrades to stay alive.

title: LEZHNEV DISPLAYS SUBTLETY ON CELLO
description: Before defecting to the United States in 1969, Vsevolod Lezh nev played with the Moscow State Symphony as assistant principal cellist, a post that he currently holds with the Pitts burgh Symphony. Wednesday night Mr. Lezhnev appeared as a solo artist in Carnegie Recital Hall, performing sonatas by Barber and Rachmaninoff and Bach's Unaccompanied Suite No. 1.

title: NEW CURES SOUGHT BY GENE THERAPY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 More than half a dozenscien tific teams have begun re search directed ultimately to ward cures of some important but now incurable hereditary diseases by correcting the pa tient's genetic defect.

title: Jahn N Heiskell Is Dead at 100; Oldest Active Newsman in U.S.
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 28 (AP)  John Netherland Heis kell, editor of The Arkansas Gazette since 1902 and the old est active newspaper editor in the United States, died here today in St. Vincent Infirmary. He celebrated his 100th birth day Nov. 2 with a reception at tended by hundreds of friends and journalistic figures.

title: Dairy Industry Gifts to Nixon Campaign Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  Dairy funds and other special interest groups donated thou sands of dollars for the reelec tion of President Nixon in blackout period, when campaign contributions were not made public just before the Nov. 7 election.

title: SUSPECT INDICTED IN CAFE SHOOTING
description: A Queens man whose release in $500 bail in connection with the holdupshooting of a patrol man and a restaurant patron stirred a controversy was in dicted yesterday by a grand jury investigating the crimes.

title: Hanover Bank Joins Plan To Assist Rumanian Trade
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company yesterday an nounced plans to participate in a new banking venture in Lon don involving Barclays Bank International and the Rumanian Bank for Foreign Trade.

title: Bay State Health Post Filled
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)Dr. Endre, K. Brunner of Rutland was named Director of Hos pitals for the Massachusetts Department of Public Health. The Public Health Commission er William J. Bicknell, said yesterday that Dr. Brunner, now superintendent of the department's Rutland Heights Hospital, would direct the seven chronic disease hospitals the agency operates.

title: Nadjari Subpoenas Files Of the Knapp Commission
description: The state's anticorruption prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, yesterday subpoenaed the files and other investigative materi als of the Knapp Commission.

title: DRIVE ON REBELS BEGUN BY MANILA
description: MANILA, Dec. 28 (UPI) Troops struck today against what the Government called rebel strongholds in the south em Philippines. The armed forces commander, Gen. Romeo C. Espino, said they killed 40 insurgents in an attack on a secret training camp on the island of Mindanao.

title: Squires Beat Chaps
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 28 (AP) Julius Erving poured in 17 points in the third period to night to help the Virginia Squires to a 124117 American Basketball Association victory over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: Wedding Held For Mrs. Prado And Diplomat
description: Mrs. Natalie Kitchin Prado, widow of Manuel I. Prado, was married in Our Lady Queen of Peace Roman Cath olic Church here yesterday afternoon to Leslie Boas, who retired recently as British, Ambassador to Santo Do mingo. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Ed ward P. Brogan and wit nessed by the bride's chil dren, Manuel A. Prado, Mi guel I. Prado and the Misses Nina and Talia Prado. They were the only guests present.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JOHNNY ZANO
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28 (AP) John Provenzano, a clarinet ist known as Johnny Zeno when he helped bring the jazz sound to Chicago in the early years of the 20th century, died Tuesday. He was 75 years old.

title: MOVIE BY BUNUEL VOTED BEST OF '72
description: The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie, Lius Bunuel's surreal satirical dissection of bourgeois society, has been voted the best movie of 197 by The National Society of Film Critics in its sixth annual poll. The group, which comprises critics from 23 magazines and newspapers, also named the Spanishborn movie maker as the year's top director for his work on Bourgeoisie.

title: Ham Dish With Vegetables
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an aster isk are followed by a recipe.

title: U.S. SPENDING GAP WIDENS OVERSEAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  American corpora tions spent $754million more overseas in the third quarter of 1972 than foreign companies spent here, the Commerce De partment said today.

title: Poland Curbs Buying in East Germany
description: WARSAW, Dec. 28The Po lish shopping spree in East Ger many is all but over. New customs regulations published today for the new year mark the virtual end of an experimental open border policy.

title: Divine Miss M. Is Set for a Tacky Gala
description: HOLLYWOOD, Calif.The Divine Miss M., as she calls herself, has been described as a funky blend of Mae West, Edith Piaf, Lotte Lenya and Sophie Tucker. On her first cabaret date here, a sellout week at the Troubadour, she established a personality that shines with the grandes dames of the music halls.

title: Truman Buried in Presidential Library Courtyard
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28  Harry S. Truman, 33d President of the United States, was buried today in the dark soil of his beloved Missouri.

title: Chief Cashier Slain in St. Regis; Dismissed Assistant Surrenders
description: The chief cashier of the St. RegisSheraton Hotel was killed by a shotgun blast in the chest in the fashionable midtown ho tel yesterday by a man the police identified as an assistant cashier who was discharged last week.

title: 2 KILLED BY BOMB IN IRISH REPUBLIC
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 28A 15 yearold girl and a middleaged man were killed and three per sons seriously injured by a car bomb explosion in a small town near the border with Northern Ireland late tonight. A second such explosion in another small border town in the Irish repub lic caused extensive damage, but no fatalities.

title: Hanoi Reports Successes
description: PARIS, Dec. 28  North Vietnam said in a statement is sued here today that its air defenses had accounted for a third of all the B52's mobilized for the current bombing at tacks.

title: BERNARD GRUN DIES; CZECH COMPOSER, 71
description: LONDON, Dec. 28 (AP)  Bernard Grun, Czech composer author and conductor, died af ter a heart attack, his London agents announced today. He was 71 years old.

title: PATERNO WOOING SUGAR BOWL FANS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Deg. 28  Joe. Paterno has been taking his Penn State football teams to bowl games so regularly that he has developed a wonderful routine aimed at adding the bowl city's neutral fans to the usually outnumbered Penn State cheering section.

title: LA SALLE DEFEATS N. MEXICO STATE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28, (AP)Jim Crawford sank 11 straight shots as La Salle built a 19point lead, held off a New Mexico State rally and defeat ed the Aggies, 7670, tonight in a Quaker City tournament semifinal.

title: Barry Sparks Warriors
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 28 (AP)Rick Barry scored 30 points in the second and third quarters to pace the Golden State Warriors to a 118105 vic tory over the Cleveland Cava liers tonight. Barry finished with 35 points although playing only 30 minutes.

title: Book Mart's Founder Toasted at 85
description: The Gotham Book Mart, the scene of parties for such diverse groups as the Andy Warhol, underground movie crowd, the James Joyce So ciety and the friends of Dame Edith and Sir Osbert Sitwell, honored its founder yesterday afternoon at a gathering laden with a half century of New York literary memories.

title: Names of Bearers
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 28Following are the names of military service personnel who toolz part in the funeral and interment services for former President Harry S. Truman at the Truman Li brary today:

title: Bank Sues Big Campaign Donor For Not Paying $200,000 Loan
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 29 (AP)The National Bank of Washington is suing Walter T. Duncan for nonpayment of a $200,000 loan that he took out two days before donating an identical amount to Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's cam paign for the Democratic Presi dential nomination.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, Dec. 29 (AP)More automobiles and trucks were built in the United States and Canada this year than ever before, Ward's Automotive Reports said today. The industry statistical service estimated 12.8 million vehicles were assembled in the two countries, surpassing the pre vious record of 12 million set last year.

title: Borg Beats Gerualitis
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 29 (UPI) Bjorn Borg of Sweden won the Orange Bowl international junior tennis title, beating Vitas Gerualitis of New York, 75, 62, 61, today. Borg won four straight games in the first two sets to take command.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 29 (Reuters)Five of tomorrow's Eng lish Football (Soccer) League games were called off because of the influenza epidemic, bringing to 14 the number games postponed this season. Included in the postponements were two First Division matches, Leeds United at West Bromwich Albion and Everton at Manchester United.

title: Thailand Delivers 4 Gunmen to Egypt
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29Four Arab guerrillas who burst into the Israeli Embassy in Bangkok and held six of its officials hostage for 19 hours arrived here amid tight security meas ures today. The four immedi ately were driven to an undis closed location.

title: Travelers From Many States Visit Truman's Grave
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 29  People from many states turned off the superhighways today to pay short visits at the grave of Harry S. Truman in the courtyard of the former President's library.

title: COLORADO CHOICE TO BEAT AUBURN
description: AUBURNThe sixthranked college football team in the nation will play in its fifth Gator Bowl game today at Jacksonville, Fla., against 13th ranked Colorado, with defense and a pair of deceptive run ning attacks the trademarks of both teams.

title: A Fifth Body ls Recovered In Port Chester Fire Ruins
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 29 (AP)  Firemen recovered another body in, the rubble of a burnedout rooming house here today, bringing to five the death toll hi a Wednesday morning fire.

title: Unsworn Representatives Are on the Job
description: Notes on Metropolitan Congressmen

title: AMERICANS LEAVE HANOI FOR CANTON
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 29 (Agence FrancePresse) The singer Joan Baez and three. other Americans left today aboard a Cantonbound Chinese airliner after having been de layed in Hanoi by the bombing.

title: Canteen Sale Also Set
description: The Canteen Corporation and Avis, Inc., filed registration statements yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Com mission on behalf of the Inter national Telephone and Tele graph Corporation in compli ance with the conglomerate's antitrust settlement with the Justice Department.

title: LUND HELPS AEROS TOP WHALERS, 42
description: BOSTON, Dec. 29 (AP)Larry Lund scored two goals, his ninth and 10th of the World Hockey Association season, as the Ho??ton Aeros defeated the New England Whalers, 42, to night and extended their un beaten streak to six games.

title: FORD PLANS PLANT ON COAST OF SPAIN
description: MADRID, Dec. 29 (UPI)The Fdrd Motor Company has ap plied for Spanish Government permission to set up a plant producing 240,000 vehicles a year on the Spanish east coast, an Industry Ministry spokesman said today.

title: MORE IN CONGRESS DECRY THE RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Unrest is growing in Congress, among both Democrats and Re publicans over the heavy bomb ing of North Vietnamese cities.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 29  A labor contract negotiating com mittee of five physicians and a dentist was chosen by the pro fessional staff of the Jersey City Medical Center here this evening to represent it in bar gaining sessions expected to be conducted with the board of managers of the 650bed insti tution.

title: Art: Paintings From 19thCentury America
description: Pending the first explosion of new shows at the end of next week, most of the gal leries are carrying over the group shows that went up before Christmas as sam plings of their stables. There are a couple of 19thcentury American painting exhibi tions, however, that are worth putting on your list, Faces and Places: Chang ing Images of 19thCentury America, which closes at the end of next week at Hirschl & Adler, 21 East 67th Street, and a group of still lifes at Noah Goldowsky, 1078 Madison Aveune at 81st Street, which runs through January.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DO NOT FORGET THE NEEDIEST!

title: STATE SENATE SET TO CUT COMMITTEES
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29A special committee named by Senator Warren M. Anderson, the Bing hamton Republican who is the new Senate majority leader, will recommend that the num ber of permanent Senate com mittees be reduced from 31 to 24.

title: Market Place: Potential Peril Seen for Levitz
description: Will. Levitz Furniture profit niargins rise to normal levels for the fourth quarter of this fiscal year, bringing the results Wall Street hopes for from this toteityourself furniture retailer?

title: Blackout Foe Loses His Bid To Rebut Rozelle on C.B.S.
description: Robin Ficker, the Maryland lawyer who lost his lawsuit to abolish the National Football League's rule banning tele vision coverage of home games, lost a bid yesterday to go on television tomorrow during the DallasWashington game and challenge the N.F.L. on its policy.

title: McMillen Cut
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 29 (AP)Highranked Maryland ran its unbeaten streak to six games by crushing Georgia Tech, 9055, and favored Syra cuse overcame a 13point defi cit to edge Bowling Green, 7473, tonight in the Maryland invitation tournament.

title: Blackout Foe Loses His Bid To Rebut Rozelle on C.B.S.
description: Robin Ficker, the Maryland lawyer who lost his lawsuit to abolish the National Football League's rule banning tele vision coverage of home games, las a bid yesterday to go on television tomorrow during the DallasWashington game and challenge the N.F.L. on its policy.

title: Morrall Puts Expert in a Predicament
description: Fan: Whom do you like in Sunday's game, Pittsburgh or Miami?

title: Suffolk Arrests 13 Linked To 2 Mob Gambling Rings
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 29Thirteen men described by law enforcement officials as top organizedcrime figures, including a former examiner for the New York State Tax Commission, were arrested today in connection with two $3millionayear bookmaking rings. The rings were also said to have served as the layoff organizations for the operations of the Carlo Gam bino crime family. Commission, were arrested today in connection with two $3millionayear bookmaking rings. The rings were also said to have served as the layoff organizations for the operations of the Carlo Gam bino crime family.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Winged Fairway, $7.20, Wins
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 29 (UPI)  Joseph E. Cranmer's Vinged Fairway, led five rivals from the start to score a 1 length victory today in the Kutztown purse at Liberty Bell. The 3yearold Maryland bred colt, ridden by Frank Lo vato, covered the six furlongs in 1:12 2/5 and returned $7.20, $3:60 and $3 for $2 across the board. Bay Charmer was sec ond, a neck ahead of Moon Eagle.

title: Leafs Down Penguins, 40
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29 (UPI) Ron Low and Jacques Plante shared their second shutout of the season tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs skated to a 40 victory, over the Pitts burgh Penguins in a National Hockey League game.

title: FARM PRICES UP 5% IN DUMBER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) Farm prices, led by gains for wheat, cattle and hogs, rose 5 per cent in December and averaged 18 per cent more than a year ago, the Depart ment of Agriculture said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To The Editor:

title: New Year's Nightmare
description: This year began with exceptional promise as President Nixon prepared daring new initiatives in American foreign policy, including most notably his plans for a historic visit to Communist China.

title: Adm. Paul Fleming Dugan, Commander of Doyen, Dies
description: Rear Adm. Paul Fleming Dugan, who commanded the Doyen, an attack transport, in the Pacific in World War II, died of a heart attack Wednes day in San Diego Calif. He was 71 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29 (AP)  The University Southern California's sailing team won the 11th annual Intercollegiate Sugar Bowl Regatta on Lake Pontchartrain today. The Merchant Marine Academy of Kings Point was second in the twoday event.

title: KNICKS WIN, 9994, IN SPITE OF LANIER
TWO GROUPS EXCEL IN MUSEUM CONCERT
description: The Janus Chorale and the American Brass Quintet joined forces Wednesday evening for a delightful Christmas concert at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The program, mostly baroque, fell into two halves (although from a thematic standpoint the first half leaked over into the first two pieces after the intermission).

title: Crawford C. Martin, 56; Texas Attorney General
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 29 (AP) Attorney General Crawford C. Martin died of a heart attack today. He was 56 years old.

title: Plea in Miner's Case Denied
description: ERIE, Pa., Dec. 29 (UPI) Judge Edward Carney of Erie County denied a petition today to have an indictment dropped against William A. Prater, United Mine Workers of Amer ica official who is charged with murder in the 1969 killings of Joseph A. Yablonski, his wife and daughter after Mr. Ya blonski lost a union presiden tial election.

title: Volcanic Indications In Moon Soil Unclear
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) Scientists studying the rocks brought back by the Apollo 17 astronauts said to day that they were unable to determine whether the orange soil found on the lunar surface proved the ex istence of lunar volcanic activity.

title: Colonels Rout Chaps
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 29 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels, led by Dan Issel, routed the Dallas Chapparrals, 131104, tonight in preparation for an American Basketball Associa tion showdown with the Caro lina Cougars tomorrow night.

title: Mount Olive Bank Robbed
description: MOUNT OLIVE, Dec. 29 (UPI)A masked man with an automatic pistol robbed the American National Bank and Trust Company here today of $30,000, the police said. They said the suspect, brandishing the gun, entered the bank on Route 46 at about 5:35 P.M. and left minutes later with the cash. No injuries were reported.

title: ST. LOUIS WINS N.C.A.A. SOCCER
description: MIAMI Dec. 29 (AP)Mike Seerey scored two goals within 61 seconds to ice a 42 victory for St. Louis over the Univer sity of California, Los Angeles, tonight at the Orange Bowl in the final of the National Col legiate soccer tournament.

title: Ministry to the Dying, a Heartfelt Turn in Theology
description: Addressing 200 clergymen, social workers, psychiatrists and other members of the medical profession at River side Church recently, Flor ence Wald suddenly broke down and wept.

title: WINE TALK
description: The French champagne growers have your interests at heart this holiday week end. While they hope you are consuming their product with gusto, they do not want you to suffer grievous bodily harm in the process. So, fly ing in the face of tradition, they advise that corks not be popped in greeting the New Year.

title: Thailand Delivers 4 Gunmen to Egypt
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29Four Arab guerrillas who burst into the Israeli Embassy in Bangkok and held six of its officials hostage for 19 hours arrived here amid tight security meas ures today. The four immedi ately were driven to an undis closed location.

title: Ministry to the Dying, a Heartfelt Turn in Theology
description: Addressing 200 clergymen, social workers, psychiatrists and other members of the medical profession at River Side Church recently, Flor ence Wald suddenly broke down and wept.

title: Books of The Times
description: MURDER WITHOUT ICING. By Emma Lathen. 236 pages. Simon and. Schuster. $5.95.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: LONG BRANCH, N.J., Dec. 29 (AP)Mayor Henry H. Ciofi suggested today that state leg islation be introduced to pro vide $1.4million to keep the Central Railroad of New Jer sey passenger service going to at least June.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Rise in Milk Prices Forecast

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)The Price Commission reported today that representatives of the National Soybean Processors Association have conferred with price officials concerning the commission's crackdown on the country's 18 largest soybean processing firms.

title: MRS. ERVA THORP
description: Mrs. Erva Hartwell Boulon Thorp, a writer on food, died Wednesday in Knud Hansen Memorial Hospital in Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas. She was 78 years old and had lived on St. John since 1928.

title: Tax Authority Proposal
description: TORONTO, Dec. 29 (Reuters) The former chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, Dr. Paul W. McCrack en, said today some kind of executive authority should be given to the President to change taxes.

title: Etruscan Women Had Women's Lib
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 29  How women achieved libera tion in the ancient Etruscan world is not yet clear to schol ars, but, as art and literature disclose, it was a woman's world as much as a man's, un like Greece and other lands.

title: P.S C. Grants Con Edison 110Million Rate Increase
description: The Public Service Commis sion yesterday granted the Consolidated Edison Company of New York an emergency increase in its electric, gas and steam rates that would increase the utility's annual revenue by $110million.

title: Court Voids Ohio Tax Credits on Nonpublic Schools
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 29 An. Ohio law permitting state and local tax credits for par ents of nonpublic schoolchildren was struck down as unconsti tutional today by a threejudge Federal Court panel.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: WASHINGTONThe B52 satura tion bombing of Hanoi is one of the greatest atrocities of our time, and one which, like Guernica or Coventry, is symbolic of a new age of technol ogical destruction.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: New York's offtrack horse players will be able to start the New Year fresh next Monday with a full card of thoroughbred action at Laurel Race Course in the afternoon and an evening harnessracing program at Monticello Race way. OTB shops will be open all day.

title: ACCORD REACHED ON TEACHER AIDES
description: A new contract covering 9,300 paraprofessional class room aides was tentatively agreed upon yesterday by the Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 29  The city's budget gap for next year the difference between pro jected spending and revenues has been whittled to about $10 million and will mean a real estate tax increase of 80 to 85 points, Finance Director J. Anton Jungherr said today.

title: Attacks in Laos Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 29 Heavy Communist attacks were reported today against two important positions of the Laotian Government, one of them athwart the only road be tween Vientiane and the royal capital of Luang Prabang.

title: RISE IS REPORTED IN MONEY SUPPLY
description: The Federal Reserve System closed its books on 1972 yes terday with the nation's money supply expanding at a rate sub stantially faster than most econ omists believe is appropriate to they current economic boom.

title: Lakers Check Archibald
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 (AP) Wilt Chamberlain grabbed 26 rebounds as the Los Angeles Lakers trampled the Kansas CityOmaha Kings, 12192, to night. The N.B.A. scoring leader, Nate Archibald of the Kings, was held to 21 points and six assists. Chamberlain blocked numerous shots and clogged the middle.

title: Palme Would Debate Nixon
description: LONDON, Dec. 29  The Swedish Premier, Olof Palme, said tonight that he was ready at any time to have a public discussion with President Nixon on the principles of democ racy.

title: C. W. Post Wins Final
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 29A 3point play by Ron Rutledge with 65 seconds left gave C. W. Post its eighth straight victory as the Pioneers edged the host team, 6159, in the final round of the Montclair State College tournament to night. In the consolation round, Monmouth downed Fairleigh Dickinson of Madison, 10181.

title: Australian Boycott Grows
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 29 (UPI)Two more maritime unions joined the Australian Seamen's Union today in refus ing to handle American ships in Australian ports as a protest against United States bombing of North Vietnam.

title: Fordham Triumphs
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 29 (AP) Hotshooting Ken Charles led the way with 22 points as Fordham defeated Colorado State, 8569, today in a con solation game of the Rainbow Classic.

title: CourtMartial Opens for First of 21 Blackson Carrier
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 29  The first of 21 black sailors to be brought to trial for the mid October racial riot aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk went before a special court martial today at the naval law center here.

title: MILTON L. KAPLAN, 52; LED KING FEATURES
description: Milton L. Kaplan, president and general manager of King Features Syndicate since 1968, died yesterday at the Windham (N.Y.) Ski Club, apparently of a heart attack. He was 52 years old and lived in Windham and in Yonkers.

title: Democratic Bloc to Seek End To Appointment of House Whip
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Democratic reformers have mouned what could be a suc cessful drive to make the Demo cratic whip, the party's No. 3 leadership post in the House, an elective job.

title: Music: Folk and Rock
description: Folk Variations at Carnegie Hall Wednesday fell neatly into two parts. The concert's first half had Dave Van Ronk and Tim Hardin giving a backward glance at the old Greenwich Village coffee house folk scene, just after the songsofsocial signifi cance period.

title: Bloc to Seek an End to Appointment of House Whip
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Democratic reformers have mounted what could be a suc cessful drive to make the Demo cratic whip, the party's No. 3 leadership post in the House, an elective job.

title: Pearson of Canada
description: It was part of the accepted lore about Canada's Lester B. Pearson that he was a firstrate diplomat who had considerable impact on his world and time, but a fumbling politician who left no comparable record of achievement in homefront affairs. This assessment was badly out of joint, as even a casual examination of Mr. Pearson's four decades as diplomat, Foreign Min ister and Prime Minister demonstrates.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (Reuters)The Federal Power Commission said today it will allow pipeline companies to continue during 1973 to make advance payments to gas producers as part of its program to encourage exploration for new gas reserves.

title: Federal Mediator Confers With L.I.R.R. Chiefs
description: A Federal mediator, Alfred Della Corte, conferred yester day with negotiators for the Long Island Rail Road in a new attempt to find a solution to the 30dayold strike.

title: EDWIN W. LEISHMAN, BASEBALL OFFICIAL
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 29 (AP) Edwin W. Leishman, general manager of the San Diego Padres and a longtime execu tive in baseball's minor leagues, died yesterday of cancer. He was 62 years old.

title: Thais Are Pleased
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 29News papers and Thai Government officials congratulated them selves today on their success in avoiding any misfortune in yesterday's seizure of the Is raeli Embassy by four Arab terrorists. They awaited the re turn of two Thai Cabinet offi cials who escorted them to Cairo.

title: Survey Warns of Laser Perils In Science Classes at Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) Lasers, those concentrated beams of light used in science, medicine, war and space, are being demonstrated in high school and college science classes without adequate safe ty precautions, a report on a sevenstate survey said today.

title: Freed Hostage Jubilant
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 29 (AP)Ruth Hadass, one of the hostages held by the Arab guerrillas in the Israeli Em bassy, clutched a wine glass and danced today as she shouted in Hebrew, I didn't know it was so good to be alive.

title: Pasco Gets Properties
description: Merger News

title: Industrial Changes Seen
description: TORONTO, Dec. 29 (Cana dian Press)About half of all economic output now is directed powerful corporations that can and do override the dictates of the freemarket economy, Dr. John Kenneth Galbraith said to night.

title: MRS. CHARLES GILBERT
description: NORWICH, Conn., Dec. 29 Mrs. Helen Greenman Lee Gil bert, national president of the American Legion Auxiliary in 194445, died Wednesday at W. W. Backus Hospital here. She was 80 years.

title: Saigon Aide Says the Bombing Will Force Hanoi to Negotiate
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 29South Vietnam's Foreign Minister, Tran Van Lam, said tonight that he believed the United States bombing of North Vietnam would force Hanoi's leaders to accept serious nego tiations.

title: MIGRANTS' RIGHTS DEMANDED IN SUIT
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 29  The State of New Jersey and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico were accused today in a suit filed in Federal District Court here of deliberately failing to protect the rights of migrant farm laborers throughout the state.

title: PROTESTERS SCORE COOKE ON BOMBING
description: A group of antiwar activists led by the Rev. Daniel Berri gan handed out bloodstained leaflets on the steps of St. Patricks Cathedral yesterday to protest what they called a sad and strange silence on the part of Cardinal Cooke re garding the renewed bombing of North Vietnam.

title: NEWHOUSE LOSES DENVER SUIT ROUND
description: DENVER, Dec. 29 (AP) Samuel I. Newhouse and the Herald Company of New York lost a court round today in the fouryearold legal battle for control of The Denver Post.

title: N.C. State Routs W. Va., 4913, As Freshman Quarterback Stars
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 29 (UPI) With a freshman quarterback, Dave Buckey, at the controls, North Carolina State crushed West Virginia, 4913, tonight in the Peach Bowl.

title: Mills Sees Antiwar Action
description: SEARCY, Ark., Dec. 29 (AP) Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, predicts that the House will ap prove an endthewar resolution next year.

title: People and Business
description: There will be a lot of noise tomorrow night when the New Year's Eve celebrations get under way. But probably no one will be celebrating more than Nicholas Magliato.

title: ,JOHN W. BISHOP
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Dec. 29 John W. Bishop, chief project engineer for Pope, Evans & Robbins, New York consulting engineers, and developer of a pollutionfree coalburning sys tem for boilers, died today in Washington, after suffering a stroke. He was 52 years old and lived here.

title: American U. Wins Tourney
description: SALEM, Va., Dec. 29 (AP) American University's Eagles defeated Roanoke's host Ma roons, 8576, for the champ ship of the Roanoke invitation tournament tonight. Roanoke, the National Collegiate Athletic Association college division champion, led until midway the second half. American went ahead for good, 6967, with minutes left.

title: St. John's, South Carolina In Festival Finale Today
description: Frank McGuire of South Carolina, the only major col lege basketball coach to win more than 100 games at three different schools, has never won against St. John's.

title: DR. LOUIS H. NAYLOR
description: HARTFORD, Conn., Dec. 29 (AP)Dr. Louis H. Naylor, pro fessor emeritus and former chairman of the Trinity College modernlanguages department, died yesterday. He was 76 years old.

title: The War Is Suddenly Grim for the B52 Fliers on Guam
description: ANDERSEN AIR FORCE BASE, Guam, Dec. 29  The flight crew are different now, said the young Air Force ser geant, a ground crewman. Be fore, when they came back, they were always clowning around. Now they're shaken. They just get out of the plane and into the bus and go to the debriefing.

title: Soviet Indicates It May Waive Emigration Tax for Pensioners
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29Boris T. Shumilin, Deputy Minister of the Interior, announced today that Soviet authorities were prepared to waive the educa tion tax for pensioners who wanted to emigrate and to re duce the taxes for others on a sliding scale, depending on the number of years they had worked after graduation.

title: Data on Tax Sharing Published; City to Challenge U.S. Figures
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The Treasury Department pub for the first time today. the population, income and tax data on which it based its Fed eral revenuesharing allocations end announced that state, coun ty and local governments had until Feb. 12 to challenge its figures.

title: Managuans Tell How the Quake Stirred Hughes From His Haven
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 29 (AP)The earthquake that devastated Nicaragua's capital early last Saturday morning caught Howard R. Hughes in his tightly guarded half of the seventh floor of the Interconti nental Hotel, where the elusive billionaire had been staying in seclusion since August.

title: Brezhnev Visit Reported Off
description: LONDON, Dec. 29The Evening News of London re ported today from Moscow that Mr. Brezhnev had post poned a planned visit to the United States next spring be cause of the delay in a Vietnam settlement.

title: Happy End in Bangkok
description: What started with the potential of another' bloody tragedy on the model of the Munich massacre of Israeli Olympic athletes ended happily in Bangkok yesterday. The Thai Government, with the invaluable assistance of the Egyptian Ambassador, persuaded four Arab terrorists to release their Israeli prisoners and fly to Cairo.

title: Seaman Is Trailed To a Heroin Cache Stored in Brooklyn
description: The Christmas Eve surveil lance of a Danish seaman's movements from A Brooklyn pier to a girlfriend's anartment, where 18.7 pounds of heroin had allegedly been stored since April, has led to the arrest here of the Dane and the owner of a Philadelphia ChineseAmer ican restaurant.

title: Stocks and Volume Up
description: Stock prices rose sharply yesterday as volume on the New York Stock Exchange amounted to 27.55 million shares, marking the third heaviest trading day in his tory. The DowJones indus trial average rose 12.34 to 1,020.02. Yearend investment demand in quality issues was the main factor in the surge.

title: American Exchange's Index Adds 0.18728 Issues Up, 318 Off
description: With trading activity hitting a record pace for the year, prices rose ysterday on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Trial on Coast Resumes in a Test Of Public School TaxFinancing
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 Trial of the case of Serrano v. Priest, the outcome of whick could lead to revision of public school financing systems, refi sumed in Los Angeles today.

title: Instead of Ending on Scrap Heap, This Furniture Began There
description: All that scrap wood, those old newspapers and card board boxes we throw out today may be back tomor row in the guise of some very sophisticated furnish ings, sporting fancy price tags.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES UP 10C A BUSHEL
description: In a short, preholiday trad ing session, soybean futures jumped the daily 10 centa bushel limit yesterday in the case of the three nearby deliv ery months  January, March and May  on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Sharon Walsh Upset
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Af rica, Dec. 29 (Reuters)Top seeded Sharon Walsh of San Rafael, Calif., was upset by 16 yearold Linky Boshoff of South Africa, 57, 53, 62, in the semi finals of the Eastern Province Sugar Circuit tennis champion ships today.

title: Behavior in Throat Termed Normal
description: A New York psychiatrist testified yesterday that the va riety of sex acts shown in the hardcore pornographic film Deep Throat were all well within the bounds of normal behavoir and that viewing, them would lighten the load of guilt and shame often asso ciated with sex.

title: AIRLINER CRASHES INTO EVERGLADES WITH 167 ABOARD
description: MIAMI, Saturday, Dec. 30 An Eastern Airlines jet carry ing 167 persons crashed in the swampy Everglades just before midnight last night while ap proaching Miami International Airport.

title: Ulster Guerrilla Killed, Arms Seized
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, Dec. 30 (AP)British troops struck hard at guerrillas in Northern Ireland yesterday, killing a gunman, seizing two large arms caches and rounding up a houseful of suspected of ficers of the Irish Republican Army.

title: Cuba and Hijacking and You
description: STANFORD, Calif.On Nov. 25 the United States and Cuba began nego tiations on an antihijacking pact in Havana. Press coverage of the talks and their possible significance has been extensive but often superficial, leading to an uncritical enthusiasm for the anticipated pact and to wishful think ing and overly optimistic speculation on an easing of tensions between the U.S. and Cuba in the near future.

title: City to Shut Dirty 73d St. Incinerator
description: The Sanitation Department's incinerator at 73d Street and the East River, which was op ened just 15 years ago as one of the most modern facilities that technology could offer, is being shut down because it pollutes the air too much.

title: Mrs. Binh Speaks in Peking Dispatch of The Times, London
description: PEKING, Dec. 29  Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, the Vietcong's Foreign Minister, told 10,000 Chinese here today that the United States was trying to split the Vietnamese people from China and other Commu nist countries.

title: Reagan Signs Pay Law
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 29 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan signed today legislation grant ing California's lawmakers a 10 per cent raise to $21,120 a year and authorizing him to raise the pay of his own staff. The measure, fashioned with out public hearings in the dy ing hours of the 1972 session of the Legislature, increases legislative pay effective Dec. 2, 1974, after the next general election.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 29One symptom of the state of our civilization is the loss of confidence in reason. Mysticism and antiintellectualism flourish. R. D. Laing, the Savonarolapsychiatrist, says our society is so terrible that schizophrenia is an appropriate reac tion.

title: American Eagle Finishes First In SydneyHobart Ocean Race
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 29  The Americanowned yacht American Eagle was first to finish this afternoon in the 630mile SydneyHobart ocean race, beating a Canadian yacht, Graybeard, over, the line by 15 minutes 16 seconds.

title: Union Chief Urges Congress to End WagePrice Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29A former labor member of the Pay Board charged today that the wageandprice  controls program was a hoax and called on Congress to kill the program instead of extending it.

title: NEWCOMBE GAINS AUSSIE SEMIFINAL
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 29 (AP)  John Newcombe gained the semifinals of the $53,300 Australian open tennis championships, the only major title he has not won, with a 64, 76, 63 victory today over Bob Carmichael, an Australian living in France.

title: Culebra Is Angered by Navy Decision on Gunnery
description: CULEBRA, P.R., Dec 29Re actions of the 1,000 inhabitants of the little island of Culebra ranged from anger to disillu sionment, despair and a sense of betrayal to the news that the Navy plans to continue using Culebra for air gunnery and naval target practice until 1985 or later, despite a previous agreement to leave the island in 1975.

title: Food Drive in New York
description: Mayor Lindsay issued an ap peal yesterday to New Yorkers to donate canned and powdered food for the victims of the earthquake in Managua during a daylong collection drive to day.

title: NADJARI, ROGERS NEAR AGREEMENT
description: The state's special anticor ruption prosecutor and the city's special narcotics prose cutor, who had been wrangling for a week over jurisdiction in the Police Department narcot icstheft case, moved toward tentative rapprochement yes terday.

title: Sinn Fein Leader Arrested
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 29Ruairi O'Bradaigh, president of Sinn Fein, political arm of the Irish Republican Army, was arrested tonight on a Dublin street.

title: Entire Families Work on Saris, But They Still Live in Poverty
description: BENARES, IndiaThe chil dren of the weavers of this ancient Hindu city have no time to play. They do not go to school. All day, often far into the night, they sit at the family looms assisting, the elders in weaving exquisitely patterned silk saris.

title: Friday Nights a Roadhouse in the Rural West
description: DATIL, N. M.  Ninety miles away at the Adobe Ranch, Tom Wagner, Catron County's livestock inspector, finished the day's work about dusk, then clambered into his car and headed here.

title: Schumann Indicates Paris Is Trying to Renew Talks
description: PARIS, Dec. 29  Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann in dicated today that France was trying to get negotiations be. tween the United States and North Vietnam going again.

title: PEARSON'S BURIAL SET FOR TOMORROW
