description: OTTAWA, Dec. 29Lester B. Pearson, former Prime Minister of Canada who died of cancer Wednesday, will be buried Sun day afternoon in a small, 100 yearold country cemetery that he and two friends selected as last resting places 30 years ago.

title: Rail TonMileage Gains 5.6% From YearAgo Level
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads was at an all time high for any year, with the final week still not reported.

title: U.S., Criticized on Raids, Rebuffs Sweden on Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The United States, irritated by a statement by Premier Olof Palme of Sweden comparing the bombing of North Viet nam to Nazi massacres of World War II, has asked Stockholm not to send a new ambassador to Washington.

title: 2 Scuba Divers Drown
description: LIVE OAK, Fla., Dec. 29 (UPI)A young man and wom and drowned yesterday while scuba diving in underwater caves off Peacock Slough. A Suwannee County sheriff's of fice spokesman identified the victims as Anmarie Weber, 18 years old, of Staples, Minn., and Keith A. Becker, 21, of Lin ton, N. D. They were with eight other divers from the Minnesota School of Diving.

title: SEAMAN IS SEIZED WITH DRUG CACHE
description: The Christmas Eve surveil lance of the Danish seaman's movements from a Brooklyn pier to a girlfriend's apartment, where 18.7 pounds of heroin had allegedly been stored since April, has led to the arrest hereof the Dane and the owner of a Philadelphia ChineseAmeri can restaurant.

title: Nixon Counterrevolution
description: It is the paradox of the Presidency that outsiders see it as the nation's most powerful office while successive incumbents complain of frustration and a recurrent sense of powerlessness over departmental programs and bureaucracies. President Nixon's appointments and administrative rearrangements in the weeks since his reelection are in part a response to this chronic institu tional problem of effective Presidential control within the executive branch.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 29Arthuri, H. West, president of the New Jersey Farm Bureau, today de fended New Jersey's system of preferential tax treatment for farmers, which was called a costly failure earlier this week by an independent research organization.

title: Shula May Use Griese
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29 (UPI)Coach Don Shula said tonight that Bob Griese might see considerable action at quarterback Sunday when the undefeated Miami Dolphins nieet the Pittsburgh Steelers.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four tri angles to none).

title: Car Plates for 1973 Are In, But SEX and SIN Are Out
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29  Start ing Monday, New York au tomobiles will begin to dis play their new golden li cense plates with three num bers and three letters in blue.

title: Release Ended a Vigil for Mrs. Meir
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 29Short ly before 2 A.M. today, Pre mier Golda Meir sat in her office in Tel Aviv talking by telephone with Rehavam Amir, the Israeli Ambassador in Bangkok.

title: State's Take $10.6Million
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29 (AP)  State tax officials reported to day that 54 days of harness racing at Roosevelt Raceway this year produced $10.6million in parimutuel revenue for the state.

title: Port Notes
description: The Port of New York rolled out the red carpet 154 times in 1972 for new, mer chant ships from foreign ports making their debuts here.

title: Mooney Program Includes 2 Dances By Phoebe Neville
description: Two of the works presented by the Elina Mooney Dance Company Thursday night at the Cubiculo were choreographed by Phoebe Neville and two were by Miss Mooney. Miss Neville is certainly the one more in terested in communicating with her audience.

title: W, E. HUTTON SETS, COMMODITY ROLE
description: W. E. Hutton & Co., a lead, ing investment house, an notanced yesterday that it was entering the commodity fif tures business through the purr chase of a seat on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, one of the nation's major commodities markets.

title: Big OilField Power Unit Opened by Soviet Union
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29The So viet Union today opened the first major electric power sta tion in its West Siberian oil fields, which are viewed by Moscow's planners as an im portant future source of energy supplies.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (Reuters)Imports of refined gold bullion to the United States in November were 644,804 troy ounces, valued at $41.8million, the Commerce Depart ment reported today. This represented an increase from October when imports totaled 444,905 troy ounces, valued at $28.9million.

title: JUDGE M. EDWARD VIOLA
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 29 (AP)Judge M. Edward Viola, who retired Dec. 1 as presiding justice of Cambridge District Court, died yesterday in a Fort Lauderdale, Fla., hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Oklahoma Wishbone No Snap for Penn State
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29 Penn State will have a big defensive problem when it faces Oklahoma's wishbone offense in the Sugar Bowl football game Sunday night. Although defense has been a large part of the Nittany Lion's success in recent years, Oklahoma presents a most difficult task, accord ing to Coach Joe Paterno.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ALCOA TO ACTIVATE SMELTING CAPACITY
description: Citing a better inventory demand balance for primary aluminum, the Aluminum Com pany of America announced yesterday that it would acti vate idle smelting capacity early next month.

title: 1976 COMMISSION SCORED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 House investigators charged to day that the American Revolu tion Bicentennial Commission was hampered by poor morale, lack of understanding of pur pose and an unworkable struc ture and had failed to formu late a proper observance of the nation's 200th anniversary.

title: Friday Night Is a Roadhouse in the Rural West
description: DATIL, N. M.  Ninety miles away at the Adobe Ranch, Tom Wagner, Catron County's livestock inspector, finished the day's work about dusk, then clambered into his car and headed here.

title: COWBOYS' FRITSCH CONFIDENT: KICKER
description: DALLAS, Dec. 29 (AP)Na tional Football League coaches Will tell you that it takes a good kicking game to get into the playoffs, which may be one reason the defending Super Bowl champion Dallas Cowboys are still kicking.

title: A PATROLMAN SAVES MAN UNDER IND TRAIN
description: Crawling underneath a sub way car, a transit patrolman saved a mans life yesterday by applying improvised tourniquets to his legs after three subway cars had rolled over the vic tim's feet, the Transit Police re ported.

title: S.E.C. Censures Kidder Peabody
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Securities and Ex change Commission issued an order today censuring the New York City brokerage firm of Kidder Peabody & Co., Inc. for alleged failure to supervise its representatives to prevent violations of the antifraud pro visions of the securities laws.

title: Acute Blood Shortage Is Reported Here
description: Citing an acute shortage of blood, the Greater New York Blood Program has appealed to doctors in the metropolitan area to postpone all but urgent surgery.

title: Black Alumni of City College Found Better Paid Than White
description: A study released by the City College of New York indicates that its black graduates are earning more money on average than their white counterparts.

title: ChainStore Sales Rose By 12% for November
description: November chainstore and cataloguehouse sales rose by 12 per cent from the correspond ing month of 1971, a survey of leading retail organizations showed yesterday. The gain was slightly below the 12.2 pert cent increase in November, 1971.

title: SAMUEL RATENSKY OF HOUSING UNIT
description: Samuel Ratensky, a city planner who served the New York City and state govern ments for 25 years and took a major part in the West Side Urban Renewal Area Project, died Thursday of a brain tu mor in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 7 Washington Square North.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: BRANCHBURG TOWNSHIP, Dec. 29 (AP)The president of Somerset County College called on the Somerset County Free holders today to appoint an independent factfinding com mittee to determine ii political pressures were brought on the college's board of trustees to force his dismissal.

title: Interstate Stores Sales Up
description: Interstate Stores, Ind., New York, reported yesterday a 6.6 per cent rise in sales in the four weeks ended Dec. 24 to $134.8million from $126.5mil lion. Sales in 47 weeks were down 1.3 per cent to $658.3 million from $666.7million in the like period the year before.

title: TAMPA HOLDS OFF KENT STATE BY 2118
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 29 (AP) The quarterbacks, Buddy Car ter and Fred Solomon, led Tampa to a 210 halftime lead tonight and the Spartans held, on to win, 2118, after Kent State mounted a fourthquarter, rally in the Tangerine Bowl. The margin of victory was three missed conversion at tempts by Kent State, the Mid American Conference Cham pion. Herb Page missed two kicks and Greg Kokal failed on run.

title: Bridge: Suit Change Poses Problem After NoTrump Response
description: A frequent problem arising in standard bidding concerns the change of suit by the opener after one notrump response. The opener an nounces an unbalanced, hand, but his strength remains ob scure. He might have as little as 10 or 11, or as much as 17 or even 18. A jump shift to the threelevel, guaran teeing a game, would need at least 19 points or abnormal distribution.

title: People in Sports: Filion Set for 20 Drives Today
description: A pony express relay of 20 horses will tarry the mail for Herve Filion today and tonight at Monticello Race way as harness racing's lead ing driver attempts to reach the singleseason mark of 600 winners. The Canadian is set to drive in 10 races during the doubleheader's 2:30 mat inee and 10 more tonight.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Delaware, natitonal college division champion, and runnerup Louisiana Tech were named yesterday the 1972 corecipients of the National Football Hall of Fame's annual John F. Kennedy Award.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MICHIGAN WARNED ON SCHOOL FUNDS
description: DETROIT, Dec. 29  Michi gan's Supreme Court today warned the state Legislature that the distribution of money for public schools must be fair er than in the past.

title: Guam: Holiday Island With a CloseUp View of War
description: AGANA, Guam, Dec. 29If ever there was an island with a split personality, Guam is it. The southern threequarters of the 212squaremile island blazes in the tropical sun. The northern quarter, at Andersen Air Base here, it frenzied and tense during the current heavy bombing of North Vietnam.

title: Burns Sees Peril If Inflation Grows
description: TORONTO, Dec. 29Econ omists wrestled here with new definition for the mar keting and legal use of heroin but agreed they did not have enough facts.

title: Daily News Rejects Staff Members' Ad On Vietnam Peace
description: The Daily News has rejected an advertisement paid for and signed by 151 of its editorial employes that calls on President Nixon to make peace in South east Asia without further delay.

title: Whaler Aide to Help Raiders
description: BOSTON, Dec. 29 (AP)The New England Whalers of the World Hockey Association an nounced today the resignation of John Coburn Jr., as execu tive vice president and treas urer. Coburn will work tem porarily with the New York Raiders as a W.H.A. representa tive until the club gets new ownership.

title: Medical Supplies Requested
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 29The Nicaraguan Minis try of Health has advised the United Nations that antibiotics and other medical supplies are urgently needed in the earth quakestricken country.

title: 7 Redskins Ill With Flu; Alien Calls Drill Lousy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29Flu disrupted the Washington Red skins' preparations today for their National Conference championship game with the Dallas Cowboys here Sunday.

title: LOAN RATES CLIMB FOR RURAL POWER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) The Nixon Administration, in another cut in the Federal budget, ordered today a halt to lowcost direct loans by the Rural. Electrification Adminis tration.

title: On Poland's Baltic Coast, the Gloom of Winter Hangs Over Resorts
description: The Talk of Szczecin

title: Liam Clancy Pats Warmth and Cheer In His Solo Singing
description: Liam Clancy, one of the vig orously Irish Clancy Brothers, is on his own this week and next at Kenny's Castaways, 211 East 84th Street. Wearing a brown corduroy cap, a mus tache and a gray turtleneck sweater and strumming a gui tar, he has managed to get away from the visual image of the Clancy Brothers as an en semble, with their clean visages and white fisherman's  knit sweaters. But in his warm, au dienceinvolving projection, he is still very much a Clancy.

title: 2 Armed Robbers Routed by Woman At a Beauty Salon
description: A sharp tongue drove two armed bandits out of the Enrico Caruso beauty salon at 110 East 55th Street yesterday morning.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 29John L. Redden, the outgoing Newark Police Director, said today that the tragedy of the Kawaida Towers housing controversy was further racial polarization of this city.

title: Dying and Living Casualties
description: PITTSBURGHThe war in Vietnam drags on and now it is becoming clear why 50,000. Americans died there. They died because they were duped, or because they were drugged, or because they were unlucky. Their dying had no point, and their perish ing had no meaning.

title: BRUINS WIN, 20; TAKE FIRST PLACE
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 29 (AP)Eddie Johnston, sup ported by goals by Bobby Orr and Mike Walton, stifled the Minnesota North Stars, 20, to night as the Boston Bruins climbed into first place in the National Hockey League's East Division.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 29Gov ernor Cahill today signed into law two bills designed to aid the state's ailing bus lines by subsidizing student fares, elim inating certain taxes and re ducing registration fees.

title: The War Is Suddenly Grim for the B52 Fliers on Guam
description: ANDERSEN AIR FORCE BASE, Guam, Dec. 29  The flight crews are different now, said the young Air Force ser geant, a ground crewman. Be fore, when they came back, they were always clowning around. Now they're shaken. They just get out of the plane and into the bus and go to the debriefing.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: YONKERS, Dec. 29There will be no quiniella wager ing at Yonkers Raceway when harness racing returns the metropolitan area next Wednesday, as had been previously announced.

title: Europeans Protesting
description: LONDON, Dec. 29 (AP) Anxiety is increasing among European governments over the United States bombing of North Vietnam, and there were mounting protests today at official level.

title: A Suit Seeks to Save Delacorte Fountain
description: The Dell Publishing Company Foundation filed a $1million damage suit yesterday against the city, the State Urban De velopment Corporation and the Welfare Island Development Corporation to prohibit the dem olition of the Delacorte Foun tah on the southern tip of Wel fare Island.

title: Stocks and Volume Up
description: Stock prices rose sharply yesterday as volume on the New York Stock Exchange amounted to 27.55 million shares, marking the third heaviest trading day in his tory. The DowJones indus trial average rose 12.34 to 1,020.02. Yearend investment demand in quality issues was the main factor. Details, Page 26.

title: Notes on People
description: Ambassador Walter H. An nenberg will continue to serve as President Nixon's man at the Court of St. James's. Nixon Administration offi dais said that Mr. Annenberg had submitted a pro foma resignation as Ambassador to Britain, but that the Presi dent had rejected it.

title: B. Z. Goldberg, Columnist, Dies; Wrote for Yiddish Papers Here
description: B. Z. Goldberg, a writer, jour nalist and columnist for more than 50 years for The Day Jewish Morning Journal, which was the largest Yiddishlan guage daily newspaper in the United States until it ended publication a year ago, died after a heart attack yesterday in a hospital in Tel Aviv. He was 78 years old and lived here at 375 Riverside Drive.

title: Suspect in Bail Controversy Is Arrested
description: The Queens man who was released in $500 cash bail last week in connection with a holdupshooting in an East Side restaurant was arrested yester day on a 19count indictment charging him with robbery and the attempted murder of four policemen.

title: It's the Season Never to Be Nasty
description: Sports of The Times

title: AIRPORTS EXPECT DELAY ON GUARDS
description: Many  probably most  United States airports will be unable to meet the Nixon Ad ministration's Feb. 6 deadline for posting of armed local of ficers at the airports to help curb hijackings, the executive dnrector of the Airport Oper ators Council  International says.

title: Behavior in Throat Termed Normal
description: A New York psychiatrist testified yesterday that the va riety of sex acts shown in the hardcore pornographic film Deep Throat were all well within the bounds of normal behavior and that viewing them would lighten the load of guilt and shame often asso ciated with sex.

title: 13 ARRESTED ON L.I. AS MOB GAMBLERS
description: HAPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 29 Thirteen men described by law enforcement officials as top organizedcrime figures, in cluding a former examiner for the New York State Tax Com mission, were arrested today in connection with two $3million ayear bookmaking rings.

title: Kidnapping Suspect Suicide
description: PETERBORO, N. H., Dec. 29 (AP)The police say a man who shot himself to death Wednesday night in Peterboro when stopped by the police for a traffic violation has been identified as the man sought in an alleged kidnapping. The po lice in Marlboro, Mass., said yesterday that Stephen James Joyce, 20 years old, of Marl boro, had been identified through photographs by Mrs. Richard H. Gravel of North boro, Mass., the woman he was alleged to have kidnapped and later released unharmed.

title: Connecticut Expecting $100Million From OTB
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 29 (AP) William J. Wade, director of the Offtrack Betting Division of the Connecticut Gaming Commission, said today the commission expected that when the off track betting program gets under way the amount wagered in a year would approach $100million. The program is expected to gear up next year.

title: GOLDEN SEALS TOP ISLANDERS, 5 TO 2
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 29 (AP)In a game between the National Hockey League's divi sion cellardwellers, the Cali fornia Golden Seals, posted a 52 victory over the New York Islanders tonight.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: P.S.C.Grants Con Edison 110Million Rate Increase
description: The Public Service Commission yesterday granted the Consolidated Edison Company of New York an emergency increase in its electric, gas and steam rates that would increase the utility's annual revenue by $110million.

title: U.S. SAYS CAMBODIA IS CORRECTING GRAFT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) The State Department said today that Cambodia was work ing to correct the corruption that allowed the payment of millions of dollars to military commanders as wages for non existent soldiers.

title: Car Plates for 1973 Are In, But SEX and SIN Are Out
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29  Start ing Monday, New York au tomobiles will begin to dis play their new golden li cense plates with three num bers and three letters in blue.

title: 1976 COMMISSION SCORED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  House investigators charged to day that the American Revolu tion Bicentennial Commission was hampered by poor morale, lack of understanding of pur pose and an unworkable struc ture and had failed to formu late a proper observance of the nation's 200th anniversary.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ROSELLE, N. J., Dec. 29After a long delay, the brand new Garden State Colonials finally got their brand new uniforms early last month. There was only one prob lemthe lettering on the green and gold outfits said Golden State Colonials.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The Appellate Division of Superior. Court ruled Trenton yesterday that hidden pitfalls in insurance policies could not be used to deny consumers protection when they needed it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Delmarva Gives Gulf Unit Order for AtomPower Plant
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 29 (Reuters)The Delmarva Power and Light Company said today it plans to build a nuclear power plant costing an esti mated $680million on an 1,800 acre site 15 miles south of here.

title: Dow Average Climbs 12.34 in 3d Largest Volume on Record
description: Reinvestment buying that centered in quality issues sent the stock market sharply high er yesterday in the finaland busiest  session of 1972. As taxselling pressures eased, money flowed into new equity investments.

title: Bradshaw's Hospital Nights Preparing Him for Dolphins
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29 For the second straight day, Terry Bradshaw left his black and gold football uniform in the locker room at Three Rivers Stadium today for a white gown and a hot tub at Divine Providence Hospital.

title: Curci Names Narduzzi Aide
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 29 (UPI)Fran Curci, the Univer sity of Kentucky head football coach, hired Bill Narduzzi, his first assistant, today. Narduzzi, 36 years old, who was Curci's linebacker coach at the Univer sity of Miami, will be Ken tucky's new defensive coordi nator.

title: Equity Financing
description: Travelodge International Inc. yesterday said it had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 336,749 common shares on behalf of three share holders. The holders are Trust Houses International Ltd., Travelodge Australia Ltd. and the Schroder Capital Corporation. The filing covers all of the trust and Schroder shares and all except 20,000 of Travelodge Australia's shares. The company's shares were down  at 14 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Reagan Bars Marijuana Bill
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 29 (AP)  Gov. Ronald Reagan vetoed today legislation that would have reduced the pen alty for firsttime possession of marijuana, making it a mis demeanor. The Republican Gov ernor said in his veto message that California's marijuana law was one of the best in the nation because it gave the courts flexibility. The new measure would have allowed a maximum penalty on first con victions of a year in jail and a $500 fine. Current law al lows a maximum penalty of two to 20 years in state prison.

title: Miss Ladd Wed to Dr. M. J. Levith
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Dec. 29  Miss Christina Ladd, a graduate of Skidmore Col lege, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Murray. J. Levith, an assistant profes sor of English at Skidmore.

title: 12 From L.I. Presented At the Regina Cotillion
description: At the 15th annual Regina Cotillion held in the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza last night, 12 young women from Long Island were presented to the Most Rev. Walter P. Kellenberg, Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rockville Centre. Proceeds went to the Bishop's Fund for Children.

title: LOSS OF 15TH B52 IN RAIDS ON NORTH ANNOUNCED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Dec. 30The loss of another B52 heavy bomber and three smaller aircraft was an nounced by the United States command yesterday.

title: QUAKE PREDICTOR ADMITS MISTAKE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 29 (UPI)A recluse who touched off anxiety throughout the San Francisco Bay area when he predicted that a big earthquake would occur on Jan. 4 said to day that he was fall wrong.

title: Irving Trust Prime at 6%
description: The Irving Trust Company, as expected, yesterday in creased its floating prime in terest rate on business loans to 6 per cent from 5 per cent.

title: Allied Stores Stresses Consolidation
description: To save time for manage ment and yourself, please give your excuses by num ber. The list covers most situations:

title: Marchetti v. United States
description: The ray of hope of reassertion and protection of our rights of free speech and presswhich many had when the Supreme Court ruled against restrain ing publication of the Pentagon Papers has faded.

title: Bronx Priest Transferred as Parishioners Protest
description: Yesterday was the Rev. Mario Zicarelli's last day in the Belmont section of the Bronx a parish in which he has spent the last 14 years of his priest hood.

title: City Bustling for 1972's Last Hurrah
description: Signs of preparation for the New Year were all over town yesterday.

title: Bucks Defeat Rockets
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 29 (AP) Behind the shooting of Lucius Allen, the Milwaukee Bucks rallied early in the third period to take a lead they never relin quished as they downed the Houston Rockets, 114101,

title: LOSS OF 15TH B52 IN RAIDS ON NORTH ANNOUNCED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Dec. 30The loss of another B52 heavy bomber and three smaller aircraft was an nounced by the United States command yesterday.

title: Mike Quarry to Box White
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Dec. 29 (AP)Mike Quarry, the North American light  heavy  weight boxing champion and Ray (Windmill) White, the Califor nia 175pound champion, have signed to meet Jan. 29 at the Anaheim Convention Center in a 12round bout with both titles at stake.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: ROLEX CHRONOMETERS, Hardy, Accurate, Superb eye appeal. Famous, LEWIS & SON, 2 Cortlandt St. Worth 41087Advt.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $2.1billion, up 30 per cent from the year earlier $1.6 billion. Total retail store sales were about $12.7billion, up 26 per cent from the year earlier $10.06billion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Flag Burned in Auckland
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 29 (AP)Demonstrators in Wellington today burned United States flag that had been flying at half staff in tribute to former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29 (Reu ters)The Westinghouse Elec tric Corporation said the Carolina Power and Light Com pany has ordered power plants worth $78million expected to start operation in mid1974. Westinghouse said the gas turbine electric generating sys tems will provide 630,000 kilo watts.

title: People in Sports: Filion Set for 20 Drives Today
description: A pony express relay mail of 20 horses will carry the mail for Nerve Filion today and tonight at. Monticello Race way as harness racing's lead ing driver attempts, to reach the singleseason mark of 600 winners. The Canadian is set to drive in 10 races during the doubleheader's 2:30 mat inee and 10 more tonight.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 (UPI)The Glen Campbell Los Angeles open, first tour event of the new year, has drawn 56 of the top 60 money winners of 1972, including Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer and Lee Trevino.

title: U.C.L.A. CAPTURES 52D ROW, 8572
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29 (AP) Big Bill Walton and Univer sity of California, Los Angeles, racehorse attack overwhelmed Drake in the second half to night as the defending national champions posted their 52d straight triumph, an 8572 vic tory in the opening round of the Sugar Bowl basketball tour nament.

title: 5 ACCUSED HERE OF A KIDNAPPING
description: Four men and a woman are being held and the police are seeking a fifth man in what they describe as a gang involved in the kidnapping of a constructioncompany executive last Columbus Day.

title: Hermitage Museum Finds Crowds Too Much of a Good Thing
description: LENINGRAD Like the Prado in Madrid, the Louvre in Paris and the Metropoli tan in New York, Russia's renowned Hermitage Museum is bedeviled by overpopular ity. And some of its most ardent Soviet admirers are advocating that it sharply raise fees, limit the length of visits or restrict the number of visitors to save itself from the crush of an enthusiastic public.

title: Republican Group in Appeal
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Dec. 29 (UPI)A liberal Republican or ganization has asked President Nixon to order an immediate halt to the bombing of North Vietnam.

title: WaterMain Break Floods Tracks of 6th Avenue Line
description: A break in a water main under 39th Street and the Avenue of the Americas shortly before noon yester day flooded the pavement and disrupted subway serv ice on the local tracks of the Sixth Avenue line of the IND for about 45 minutes.

title: U.S., Criticized on Raids, Rebuffs Sweden on Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The United States, irritated by a statement by Premier Olof Palme of Sweden comparing the bombing of North Viet nam toNazi massacres of World War II, has asked Stockholm not to send a new ambassador to Washington.

title: Sales of NoLoad Funds, Top CashIns in 2 Months
description: Sales of noload fund shares exceeded redemptions in Octo ber, the NoLoad Mutual Fund Association, Inc. reported yes terday.

title: Hershey Bars Will Shrink
description: Beginning Monday, a 10cent Hershey chocolate bar will still be a. 10cent Hershey chocolate bar, but its size and weight'will be smaller.

title: Acute Blood Shortage Is Reported Here
description: Citing an acute shortage of blood, the Greater New York Blood Program has appealed to doctors in the metropolitan area to postpone all but urgent surgery.

title: London Neighbor Leaves
description: LONDON, Dec. 29 (AP) Bernard Cowan, a Canadian businessman, said upon check ing out of the Inn on the Park today that while he was Howard R. Hughes's only neigh bor on the hotel's top floor, two pheasants he had shot on a hunting trip and hung up on his balcony had disappeared.

title: Prosecutor Nadjari's Chief Aide
description: Man in the News

title: CELTICS DEFEATED BY BULLS, 10699
description: BOSTON, Dec. 29 (AP)Bob Love scored 41 points, includ ing 21 in the third period, and the Chicago Bulls rallied to up set Boston, 10699, today. It was the Celtics' sixth National Basketball Association defeat this season.

title: MORE IN CORM DECRY THE RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Unrest is growing in Congress among both Democrats and Re publicans over the heavy bomb ing of North Vietnamese cities.

title: Judge Bars Job Safety Law Extension
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) A Federal judge in validated today a Labor Department di rective giving states six more months to develop job safety programs that meet Federal standards.

title: COLORADO CHOICE TO BEAT AUBURN
description: Auburn, the sixthranked college football team in the nation, will play in its fifth Gator Bowl game today at Jacksonville, Fla., against 13th ranked Colorado, with defense and a pair of deceptive run ning attacks the trademarks of both teams.

title: Crusaders Top Nordiques
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 29 (UPI) The Cleveland Crusaders, with Paul Andrea scoring two goals, ran their winning streak to four games tonight with a 53 vic tory over the Quebec Nordiques. The victory gave the Crusaders a 3point lead over thirdplace New York and moved them to within 2 points of Eastern Div isionleading New England.

title: NETS WIN, 114104, IN EXTRA PERIOD
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 29Johnny Roche and Johnny Baum got hot in overtime tonight to spark the New York Nets to a 114104 victory over the San Diego Con quistadors tonight. The Nets snapped a fivegame losing streak.

title: Humphrey Urges Halt
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 29 (UPI) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, said to day that the bombing of North Vietnam should be stopped no matter what the difficulties.

title: Aid to Weapon Detection
description: Patents of the Week

title: Report of Bombing Revised
description: Agence FrancePresse in a re port yesterday afternoon from Hanoi quoted North Vietnamese medical sources as having said that a second hospital in Hanoi the Mai Huong Hospitalhad been hit by American bombs in raids on Thursday. However, upon investigation, the French news agency reported last night that the hospital had been nar rowly missed in the bombing.

title: Highway Salting Assailed in Massachusetts Report
description: BOSTON, Dec. 29 (AP)The continued spreading of salt on Massachusetts highways at the present rate is dangerous to the environment and may also be economically wasteful, a report issued yesterday by a Special Commission on Salt Contamination of Water Sup plies said.

title: SCIENTISTS REBUT CURRENT BELIEFS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Nature does not always know best and science can form good base for social value judg ments, two eminent scientists said today in disputing two wide spread current beliefs.

title: Reserve Chief Says Action Is Essential
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that the nation's economic future may be, ad: versely affected for a long time to come if inflation worsens again next year.

title: Antiques: Restorer of Clocks Adds to What's Ticking at Museum
description: Ironic though it may seem in this age of tickless, tock less, handless, faceless clocks, Henry F. Wolcott's idea for a bangup way to usher in the New Year would be to have all the several hundred clocks in his charge wound and striking.

title: 4 FLEE RIKERS IS.; 2 STILL AT LARGE
description: Four inmates escaped from the Rikers Island Adolescent Remand Shelter early last night by crawling through an air shaft. Two were quickly recap tured, prison officials said, but two others were still being sought early this morning.

title: Soviet Indicates It May Waive Emigration Tax for Pensioners
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29Boris T. Shumilin, Deputy Minister of the Interior, announced today that Soviet authorities were prepared to waive the educa tion tax for pensioners who wanted to emigrate and to re duce the taxes for others on a sliding scale, depending on the number of years they had worked after graduation.

title: Dr. Maxwell I. Littman Is Dead; Headed Microbiology Research
description: Dr. Maxwell I. Littman, asso ciate chief of staff for research and education at the Veter ans Administration Hospital in Brooklyn, died of a heart ail ment at the Englewood (N.J.) Hospital on Monday. He was 58 years old and lived in Dem arest, N. J.

title: VOTE SET IN ALASKA FOR SEAT IN HOUSE
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 29Gov. William A. Egan declared Alas ka's onlyHouse seat vacant to day and ordered a special election March 6 to replace Representative Nick Begich, a Democrat, who has been miss ing since Oct. 16.

title: Moscow and Hanoi Leaders Confer on the Bombing
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29  Soviet and North Vietnamese leaders conferred here today in two separate meetings as the Krem lin appeared to be weighing its, next possible move to counter act the renewal of intense American bombing of North Vietnam.

title: British Treasury Bill Rates Show Declines in Week
description: LONDON, Dec. 29 (Reuters) The average rate at today's tender of British Treasury bills fell to 8.3088 per cent from 8.4356 last week. This week's E120million offer of 91day bills met, applications of 450, 665,000.

title: Blue Cross Rate Hike
description: On the basis of Labor Department statistics, the health field has been an area of conspicuous success for the Nixon Administration's antiinflation controls. The over all rate of increase in the cost of medical care has been slowed materially since August 1971. That background makes particularly startling the application by Blue Cross in the New York area for a second substantial rate increase in less than a year.

title: U.S. Court Voids Ohio Tax Credits On Private Tuition
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 29 An Ohio law permitting state and local tax credits for par ents of nonpublic schoolchildren was struck down as unconsti tutional today by a threejudge Federal Court panel.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly compet itive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Clearing Ruins of Managua Expected to Take 8 Months
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 29Demolition experts said to day that it would take eight months to a year to clear away the wreckage from last week's devastating earthquake here.

title: Defense Excels in Gator Bowl
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 30  Auburn converted turnovers into an early lead and struck again on Mike Fuller's 22yard touch down pass to Rob Spivey as the Tigers posted a 243 upset over Colorado today in the Gator Bowl game.

title: MR. BRICKS IMAGE, HONESTOUS SCORE
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30 (AP)  Mr. Bricks Image and Honestous won divisions of the $20,000 added Miss Florida Handicap at Calder Race Course today. Mr. Bricks Image gained her vic tory on a disqualificaticin after finishing second to First Bloom.

title: Mayor Flying to Puerto Rico
description: Mayor Lindsay will fly to Puerto Rico tomorrow to attend the inauguration on Tuesday of Gov. Rafael Hernandez Colon, City Hall announced yes terday. He is scheduled to re turn to the city on Tuesday. The mayor will be accompanied by a delegation that will in clude his major Puerto Rican appointees, who were said to be traveling at their own ex pense.

title: U.C.L.A. A GAINS 53D, DEFEATING ILLINOIS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 30 The University of California, Los Angeles, is just seven games short of the collegiate basketball record of 60 straight victories after defeating Illinois, 7164, in the final of the Sugar Bowl tournament today.

title: The World
description: The atmosphere of high tension recalled the horror of the Palestinian guerrilla attack on the Israeli Olympic team in Munich last September.

title: WALL STREET
description: Clear signs are crop ping up that Wall Street will make its first significant sales pitch in Japan, where play ing the stock market is al most a national pastime.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: OMAHA, Dec. 30 (AP) Creighton blew a 13point lead midway in the second half to day then found the range again in the final three minutes to defeat Ohio State, 7971.

title: News of the Rialto
description: AT 37, a goateed, burly man named Joseph A. Walker may be the most interesting playwright to emerge on the black theater scene in recent years. In his highly praised new play, The River Niger, Walker brings such passionate dialogue and intense conflict to his drama of Harlem family that there are standing ovations from the audience every night. Originally supposed to end its limited engagement tonight, the Negro Ensem ble Company production has been ex tended through Feb. 4 at the St. Marks Playhouse.

title: Jailing Rule Eased
description: COLUMBUS, Ga. Dec. 30 (AP)  A police regulation re quiring that persons arrested on drinking charges be held in jail at least four hours has been modified to give the jailer the option of doing so after a judge ordered the release of a woman who challenged the practice.

title: FourAlarm Fire Destroys A Supermarket in Queens
description: A smokey fouralarm fire destroys a Waldbaum's super market in the Bayside section of Queens last night before it was brought under control at about 10 P.M. There were no injuries.

title: World News Briefs
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 30A kidnapped Italian business ex ecutive, Vicenzo Russo, has been freed, a spokesman for his company said today.

title: Texas Tech Loses, 3228
description: EL PASO, Dec. 30Nick Vidnovic, the North Carolina quarterback, threw a 13yard touchdown pass to Ted Leverenz with one minute left to play today and gave the Tar Heels a 3228 victory over Texas Tech in the 38th Sun Bowl, a game markedby a controversial un sportsmanlike conduct pen alty that cost the Red Raiders a touchdown.

title: Jersey Bridal for Linda Sullivan
description: Miss Maureen Katherine O'Sullivan, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Ward D. O'Sullivan of Rosemont, Pa., was married here yesterday afternoon to William Kevin Booher, son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Boo her of New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: SUBWAY WORKERS ARE SUSPENDED
description: Two Transit Authority car in spectors who took movies that they say show transit employes sleeping, drinking and playing cards instead of inspecting subway cars have been sus pended on charges of miscon duct.

title: Hughes Pension Bill Debated
description: TRENTONShould an ex Governor who reportedly makes more than $100,000 a year be entitled to a pension equaling half his yearly sal ary as chief executive? Some members of the State Legis lature think the idea is out rageous, and are balking at approving 0391 that is de signed primarily to benefit former Gov. Richard J. Hughes, a Democrat.

title: Bradshaw, the Steelers' Quarterback, Said to Be Ready to Play
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30Rain and wind, factors that can mess up a football game were fore cast for tomorrow's American Conference championship game Between the Pittsburgh Steelers and the Miami Dolphins at !lime Rivers Stadium. The stadium, however, has an all Weather synthetic turf of Tar ten composition rated as good that will largely neutral ize the rain.

title: Medicine
description: Until a decade ago, death at an early ageafter great suffering and disabilitywas the inevitable fate of most hemophiliacs. Then medication was developed capable of stopping, even preventing, the bleeding that is the central symptom of the inherited disease.

title: BIG SPORTS ARENA IS NIGERIA'S PRIDE
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 25 With great pageantry and pride, Nigerians opened their $20million, 50,000seat Nation al Sports Stadium here recent ly.

title: Oklahoma TwoTouchdown Favorite in Sugar Bowl
Shorter Reviews
description: Four decades ago Dale Rex Coman, a research physician, wrote The Technique of Post mortem Examination. This book reflects the other side of his interests  life in fields, swamps, woods and marshes. In 35 short essays he chronicles, month by month for the good part of a year, what happened to him on walks and canoe trips that ranged from the rocky forested wilderness of Maine to the salt marshes and pine barrens of southern New Jersey. Dr. Coman wants not only to share his good days with readers but to invite them to escape the boredom and de spair of so much of present so ciety through the enjoyment of the peace and beauty of na ture. Freshly and lyrically he celebrates what is here and re grets what is gone: Things change. New highways appear . . . forests evaporate and be come developments . . . pizza parlors and hamburger joints sully an old crossroad . . . [you] wish you were somewhere else. One wishes his essays were longer, also, since he seems to be an interesting man, that he had told more about his own life. The text is illustrated with 25 of Dr. Coman's pencil sketches; they're the work of an amateur  that is, an en thusiast.

title: The Price of Leadership
description: Earlier in this expiring year President Nixon made a significant distinction between his freedom of action in foreign and in domestic affairs. In the field of foreign policy, he said, a President can act, and he should act and he should lead and, generally speaking, he can carry the country with him . . . but in the field of domestic policy, it is a very, very different matter. Here a President can propose, and then Congress does what it pleases.

title: Nationals Halt Cougars
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30 (AP)  Second  period goals by Brian Conacher, Gavin Kirk and Steve King paced the Ottawa Nationals to a 42 victory over Chicago tonight, snapping the Cougars' fivegame home win ning streak.

title: Knicks' Basket at Buzzer Topples Bullets, 100 to 98
description: The Knicks continued their deadly pattern of victories at home last nighttheir 21st success in 22 games at Madison Square Gardenbut threw in a couple of melodramatic wrin kles to entertain the capacity crowd of 19,694.

title: NAGRIN DANCERS IN 5 PREMIERES
description: Suspicion of delusional self involvement steals irresistibly over me when dancers seem to be enjoying one another's pres ence more than the audience does. Daniel Nagrin's The Workshop was ripe with such personal indulgence Friday eve ning at 550 Broadway.

title: Military Confirms End of Raids in North
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Dec. 31The United States command confirmed to day that American bombing of the heavily populated region of North Vietnam above the 20th Parallelincluding the cities of Hanoi and Haiphonegstopped yesterday morning Saigon time.

title: Barbara Reed London Bride
description: Miss Barbara Reed, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Stephen Reed of New York, was married in London yes terday to Paul Trevor Mason, son of Group Capt. J. Kenyon Mason, R.A.F., and Mrs. Mason of Aylesbury Buck inghamshire, England. The ceremony was performed at the Farm Street Roman Cath olic Church by the Rev. Fran cis Morrall.

title: Miss Rogers To david Elebash
description: WESTON, Mass., Dec. 30 The marriage of Miss Marianne Eavenson Rogers daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clayton T. Rogers Jr., to David Hunley Elebash, son of the Right Rev. Hunley A. Elebash, Episcopal Bishop of North Carolina, and Mrs. Ele bash of Kinston, N.C., took place here this afternoon.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: STOCK MARKETS closed Thursday Ina national day of mourning for Harry S. Truman. . . . Friday's volume on the New York Stock Exchange Soared to 27.55million shares, third largest in history. . . . Atlantic Richfield sold its Rocky Mountain and Midcontinent properties to Pasco, Inc., for $68million under a divestiture order.

title: The World
description: MANILA The coconutfringed is lands that dot the Sulu Sea in the southernmost part of the Philippines emerged last week as a new focus of problems for the martiallaw Gov ernment of President Ferdinand E. Marcos  and for the Filipino people.

title: Cool Cotton Bowl Forecast
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30 (AP)The National Weather Service fore cast tonight partly cloudy and cool weather for the Cotton Bowl football game here New Year's Day. It said the tempera ture would be about 50 degrees for the contest between Ala bama and Texas.

title: World Jewry Put at 14.2 Million, With Almost 50 Per Cent in U.S.
description: The world Jewish population at the end of 1971 was estimat ed at 14,236,000, an increase of 285,000 over the previous year, according to the newly (published 1972 edition of the American Jewish Year Book.

title: Concerts Keeping Symphony on Go
description: NEWARKThe New Jer sey Symphony may not be the greatest orchestra of its type in the country, but it is certainly among the most eager to bring music to everybody's doorstep.

title: Richard M. Gelb Becomes Fiance Of Miss Kleven
description: HAVERHILL, Mass., Dec. 30Mr. and Mrs. Louis Kleven of Haverhill and Sara sota, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gail Kleven, to Richard Mark Gelb, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold S. Gelb of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Son to the R. U. Levines
description: A son was born to Maj. Richard U. Levine, Medical Corps, U. S. A., and Mrs. Levine of Fort Lee, N. J., on Dec. 1 at the Harkness Pavi lion, ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. The child has been named Peter Thomas. Major Levine is stationed at Fort Monmouth, N. J.

title: ISRAELI JETS RAID SYRIAN ARMY BASE
description: TEL AVIV, Sunday, Dec. 31 Syria shelled Israeli settle ments in occupied territory yesterday, and Israeli planes retaliated with their second at tack in four days, bombing an army camp north of Damascus.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: A great public debate is raging today on the pros and cons of including corporate earnings forecasts in Secu rities and Exchange Commis skin filings and in company announcements to the public.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: A HOTEL MAID, 33, FOUND MURDERED
description: A Thai woman working as a maid in a midtown hotel that has many single and welfare tenants was found dead yester day afternoon in the room of a tenant who is being sought for questioning by the police.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market rang out 1972 with bells sounding happily along Wall Street on Friday.

title: U.S. Sailor Slain in London
description: LONDON, Dec. 30 (Reuters) A 21yearold sailor on the staff of the United States Em bassy was stabbed to death to day in a fight outside a fash ionable London discotheque.

title: WEAF, 7:007:15 Ow wah, ow wah, ow wah
description: A few weeks ago, when I read of the death in Chicago, at the age of 82of Charles Correll, I found myself struck by an obscure and unex pected sense of loss. I can't honestly say that my feeling was one of grief, or even of sorrow; it was instead that vaguely unsettling emotion that one experiences upon learning of the death of a passing acquaintance whom one hasn't seen or heard from in years. Or particularly thought about, either. Correll, of course, was Andy of Amos n Andy, which was the most popular radio pro gram of all time. And I'm one of that generation of Americans who are today in their late 30's and 40's and who grew up listening to the radio the same way that children now come of age with their eyeballs stuck to TV sets. In the white clapboard house where I spent most of my child hood, on a maplelined street in a far northern suburb of New York, the floormodel Philco radio in the living room was always tuned in each week day evening at 7 o'clock to station WEAF for Amos n Andy. The strains on an organ of The Perfect Song, the soft, Southernaccented voice of the program's announcer, Bill Hay, saying, Here they ah, Amos n Andy, and then a 15minute episode in the financially embarrassed lives of Amos, Andy and a score of other characters, par ticularly including my favorite, George (Kingfish) Stevens, a hopelessly inept confidence man whose credit rating, I recall, was Triple Z: Be careful when he cash.

title: American Eagle Sweeps Honors In Aussie Event
description: HOBART, Australia, Dec. 30 (Reuters)American Eagle scored a sweep today in the 1640mile, SydneytoHobart yacht race.

title: Liquori Will Run Jan. 12: First Race in 11 Months
description: After an 11month competi tive absence, Marty Liguori will make another major attempt to resume his track and field ca reer next month in what could become the sport's most cru cial and Controversial year.

title: Miss Young, Jonland Win Skating Titles in Milwaukee
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 30 (AP) United States Olympic speed skating teammates, Gary Jon land and Shelia Young, won two races apiece today to take senior mens and women's titles, respectively, in the twoday United States International Skating Association holiday meet.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Sports of The Times

title: Leafs Beat Blues, 54
description: TORONTO, Dec. 30 (UPI) Dave Keon's 16th goal of the season at 8 minutes 34 seconds of the third period proved de cisive as the Toronto Maple Leafs edged the St. Louis Blues, 54, tonight.

title: Jersey Bridal for Linde Sullivan
description: BASKING RIDGE, N.J., Dec. 30Miss Linda Elizabeth Sullivan and Stuart Alan Grossman, who are in their final year of medical school at the University of Rochester School of Medicine and Dentistry, were married here this afternoon in the Preshyterian Church by the Rev. William H. Felmeth.

title: Miss Holmes Married
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 30Miss Alexandra Jean Holmes, daughter of Burton H. Holmes, executive editor of Progressive Architecture magazine, and Mrs. Holmes of Stamford, was married here this afternoon to Gary Ernest Ford of Tiffin, Ohio, in the chapel of the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Donald F. Campbell. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. William McKelvey of Findlay. Ohio, and Robert Ford of Toledo, Ohio.

title: The Last Word
description: Nineteenfortytwo, the war was on, colleges were losing students by the battalion. Only the halt and freshmen abounded, and the freshmen took them selves quite seriously. The war they knew in their fantasies was the Great War, and they saw themselves as the new American equivalent of the sons of the English aristocracy in 1914. They would go when called, perhaps they would die, but first they must have truth and beauty. Remembering the gentleness and forbearance of the faculty at my own school, Columbia, I think the teachers shared that image of us. At any rate, we got away with a lot.

title: Vietnam
description: SAIGONAir raid sirens scream day and night. The earth trembles with the violence of an earthquake, and whole sections of the city crumble in a roar of flames and flying jagged steel. For the first time in the war the people seem afraid.

title: At 86, Black Resentful of Army Action in Texas Raid
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 27 Nowadays, said Dorsie W. Willis, I just sit and eat and think.

title: Power Plant Shut Down
description: VERNON, Vt., Dec. 30 (UPI) The Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Corporation plant shut down for a few days because of electrical problems, it was announced this week. Another round of hearings on the per manent licensing of the $217 million plant is scheduled for next month.

title: New & Novel
description: This kinky fable by Tom MaIlin, an adventurous English playwright, is alleged by the publisher to parallel the 12 stations on the road to Gol gotha. Hmnun. The protagonist is a nun named Dodeca, who keeps running into a worker priest named Hedron. Another hmmm. Mr. Mallin favors a present tense, cinematographic style, and gets in some heavy symbolism by jump cutting from things like a toilet bowl to a bishop's ring, and back again. Hmmm No. 3. You want my opinion, this is misan thropy masquerading as moral ity. Dodeca is expelled from her convent by a peculiar ab bess who likes to strangle small birds, and is sent on her way naked, with an expulsion ritual that comes closer to Story of O than the Good Book. Also unfrocked are two nuns named Daara and Sibbecao who are never heard from again. Do deca, however, is fated to dram atize her author's interest in scatology and the sadomaso scene. A dodecahedron is a fig ure with 12 facets. In this Dodecahedron, I can find only one.

title: The Sunrise Highway Is Ready to Greet 1973
description: Sometime in the wee hours tomorrow some welljuiced reveler will try to pull the sword from the stone in front of the Prince and the Pauper, a castlelike knightspot in or near Babylon.

title: ROCKETS CRUSH NETS BY 13698
description: DENVER, Dec. 30The New York Nets, who had won only once in 17 previous visits to Denver in their American Bas ketball Association existence, were thrashed, 13698, by the Rockets tonight.

title: Fog in London Strands Thousands at Airports
description: LONDON, Dec. 30 (UPI) Thousands of passengers were stranded at London airports by heavy fog last night.

title: Letter to the Editor 4  No Title
description: The bombing goes on, and where is the peace movement? Where are the demonstrations, marches and strikes? In November 1969 a quarter to half amillion Americans, mostly young, marched past the White House to the Washington Monument and declared by this solemn and peaceful assembly that they would take no part in the destruction of Vietnam. It made a dif ference.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: UNION, Conn., Dec. 30 (AP) A Brooklyn man was killed this afternoon when the car he was driving skidded along ice coated Route 15 into a stopped truck, the state police said. They identified the man as Paul S. Franklin, 50 years old. They said his car hit a truck that had stopped in the slow lane of the fourlane highway.

title: A Limited Partner Charges N.F.L. Raiders With Fraud
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 30 (AP)Louis F. Barroero, a lim ited partner in the Oakland Raiders football team, has filed suit against the club charging he was defrauded of his right ful share of ownership.

title: Kentucky Holds Off Notre Dame, 6563
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 30 (AP)Jim Andrews poured in 23 points but it was the Kentucky defense that earned the Wildcats a 6563 victory over Notre Dame tonight.

title: SENATORS REVISE BILL ON NOFAULT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  Senate advocates of a Federal nofault automobile insurance law have revised their bill to conform in many respects with a recently drafted model state law.

title: Schmidt, East German, Wins Opening FourHill Ski Jump
description: OBERSTDORF, West Ger many, Dec. 30 (AP)  Rainer Schmidt led an East German 1, 2, 3 sweep today in the open ing event of the FourHill ski jumping tournament.

title: Americans, Spent More Money And More Time Just Playing
description: Americans with increasing amounts of leisure sought pleasure in jogging, boating, tennis, skiing, golf, cycling, snorkeling, snowmibiling, rid ing, bowling, camping, pool, chess, backgammon and just plain relaxing in record num bars in 1972.

title: Joseph Cornell, Sculptor, Dies; Noted for His Work With Boxes
description: Joseph Cornell, the shy, re clusive sculptor who won fame for his poetic constructions in small boxes and for his col lages, died Friday of a heart at tack at his home in Flushing, Queens. He was 69 years old.

title: Kennel Is Full Already For Westminster Show
description: The limit of 3,000 dogs was reached Thursday for the 97th annual Westminster Kennel Club show, scheduled for Madison, Square Garden on Feb. 12 and 13. This was eight days earlier than the official closing date.

title: University of Chicago Team Wins Chess Championship
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 30 (AP)The University of Chica go team won the 197273 Pan American Intercollegiate Chess Championship today after five days of competition involving more than 100 teams.

title: 1% Pay Rise for Horsemen
description: WINDSOR, Ontario, Dec. 30 (AP)Horsemen at Windsor Raceway have ratified a four year contract calling for a 1 per cent salary increase over the span of the agreement.

title: Letter to the Editor 8  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 3  No Title
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 30 (AP)Long Beach State, getting a 34poitn performance from its allAmerican, Ed Ratleff, de feated Brigham Young, 10189, for the AllCollege tournament championship tonight. Ratleff, voted the tourney's most valu able player, scored 26 in the first half.

title: Wanted: $1.5Million for America's Cup Defense
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 30Before anybody sails an inch in defense of the America's Cup, somebody must raise $1.5million for anew yacht and the enorm ous accompanying expenses. That's why J. Burr (Joe) Bertram Jr. of Greenwich, Conn. and F, Briggs Dalzell, of New York, comanagers of the Courageous Syndicate, are devoting two weeks to fundraising in the plush yachting centers of Southern Florida.

title: West Paterson Sisters Get Into Jazz Act
description: WEST PATERSON  The rising tide of jazz in north ern New. Jersey has picked up two unexpected, but de termined, supporters in Viola Los and Lottie Ralicki, the owners and chief bartenders of a tavern called Three Sisters.

title: DEFERMENT LOSERS MAY ESCAPE DRAFT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird's decision to draft no men in February may mean that thousands of men who lost deferments late in 1972 will es cape callup. They are vulnera ble for the draft during the first three months of 1973:

title: Kerr Wins at Lake Placid In CrossCountry Skiing
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Dec. 30This Adirondack Mountain resort's winter competitive sea son began on a surprising note today when Randy Kerr, an ambitious 23yearold cam paigner from Auburn, Me., won the annual New Year's 15 kilometer crosscountry ski race in a light snowfall.

title: Stars Top Conquistadors
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 30 (UPI) Jimmy Jones scored 27 points and Gerald Govan grabbed 25 rebounds to pace the Western Divisionleading Utah Stars to a 11189 victory over the San Diego Conquistadors tonight.

title: Woman Is Shot In the Eye Looking Through Peephole
description: A 22yearold Brooklyn wom an was shot in the eye last night as she looked through the peephole of her apartment door, the police reported. The injury left her paralyzed on the left side, according to a spokesman at Kings County Hospital, where the woman also faced loss of her right eye.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: With negotiations for new labor contracts starting in the dress industry, the gar ment trades are due for an other profit squeeze in the months ahead.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: A citizen of Rochester, N. Y., once wrote a book about the city called Smugtown, U. S. A. Henry Clune is different. For 56 years he turned out a popu lar column for the Rochester Democrat and Chronicle; here, in a vigorous style that belies his octogenarian status and avoids the clichs of booster ism, he makes it clear that all his life he has been head over heels in love with his home town. He recalls the halcyon days of the city, when the schools and restaurants and theaters were good, before the heart of Rochester was con verted into arteries for motor traffic and before the explosion of race riots.

title: The World
description: MANAGUA, NicaraguaIn 1885, Managua, a former Indian village on whose site the Spanish conquistadores founded a city, was leveled by an earthquake. Its inhabitants buried their dead and rebuilt their houses and resumed their lives.

title: Would you believe there's news in knits?
Food: New Year's Game Plan
description: RIDGEWOOD  Both his home in Ridgewood and his office in Manhattan reflect Franc Ricciardi's consuming interest in African biggame hunting and in shooting doves in Mexico, pigeons in the Dominican Republic, quail in South Carolina and pheas ants in Czechoslovakia.

title: A Fresh Nationalism Is Sweeping Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 30 From the trafficchoked cities along the shore to the vast open spaces of the Outback, where cattlemen casually fly their own planes 100 miles or more for a drink with the nearest neighbor, there is a feeling that Australia has turned a corner.

title: Paper Criticizes Service
description: ROME, Dec. 30 (AP)A Rome newspaper criticized Pope Paul VI this week for holding, Christ mas Eve mass in a tunnel under construction north of Home. It said that he had forced at least 1,000 officials, policemen and other persons to spend the holy night working in the cold away from home.

title: Liguori in Coast Meet
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30 (UPI) Marty Liguori, the world's top miler in 1971 who missed the 1972 Olympic year with a foot injury, will compete in the Sunkist invitation indoor track meet Jan. 20. The former Villa nova ace was unbeaten in the mile in 1971, a year in which he turned in a time of 3 minutes 54.6 seconds for the mile and defeated Jim Ryun in a mem rable shutdown match at Phil adelphia.

title: Merrick 2Mile Victor
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30 (AP)  Dave Merrick captured the Uni versity of Chicago Track Club twomile run today by 60 yards in 9 minutes 18 seconds.

title: Transcript of White House News Conference on the Bombing Halt
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)Following is the text of the White House news conference today at which Gerald L. Warren, a deputy Presidential press secretary, announced an end to the bombing of the HanoiHai phong area and a renewal of the private Paris peace talks:

title: COURT BARS CLAIM FOR ATTICA VICTIM
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 30The Ap pellate Division of State Su preme Court has dismissed a $2.9million claim for the death of a prison clerk during the 1971 riot at the State Correc tional Facility at Attica, but a lawyer said that the decision would be appealed to the State Court of Appeals.

title: Maryland Sets Back Syracuse In Own Tourney Final, 9076
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec, 30 (AP)Tom McMillen, who had missed a game because of (sore ankle scored 32 points and (grabbed 13 rebounds leading Maryland to 9076 victory over Syracuse in the final of the Maryland invitation basketball tournament tonight.

title: New Man Is the Hero On Leningrad Stages
description: LENINGRAD  Despite per sistent pressures for ideological orthodoxy and limits on tive leeway, several Leningrad theater directors are now ing a handful of Soviet that dare to find fault with manners and mores of the viet Establishment.

title: ANCIENT TITLE WINS COAST DASH EASILY
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 30 (UPI)Ancient Title stamped himself as the top 2yearold in the West today by racing to an easy victory in the 33d running of the $61,175 California Breed ers' Champion Stakes at Santa Anita.

title: Miss Holahan Wed To D. R. Warakas
description: NORWOOD, N.J., Dec 30 Miss Susan Elizabeth Hola han, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William L. Holahan, was married here this morning in the Immaculate Conception Roman Catholic Church to Daniel Robert Warakas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Warakas of Saddle Brook. The Rev. Gerald Heinon per formed the ceremony and cel ebrated the nuptial mass.

title: News of the Rialto
description: IN Neil Simon's The Sunshine Boys one of the first things you're likely to notice as you watch an ancient Jack Albertson flapping about in houseslippers, dipping his teabag to the rhythm of a TV tea commercial and then returning to the latest episode of a portentously hushed daytime serial called Storm Warning, is that the noisy but faded bathrobe he is wearing almost exactly matches the slipcover of the armchair he is sitting in. In fact, when he sinks into it, nearly everything but his fluffy head disappears.

title: Gains Forecast In L.I. Economy
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  The economic outlook for Nassau an Suffolk counties in 1973 appears to he good, accord ing to a yearend report by the Franklin National Bank. However, the bank said that there were some problems ahead.

title: Education
description: John, tell us exactly why you want to join Operation Turn On.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Construction has begun on a $1.4million parking garage for the staffs of the New York Medical CollegeFlower and Fifth Avenue Hospitals. The 350car garage will be on the northwest corner of 105th Street and Madison Avenue.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30Following is a list of persons aboard the Eastern Airlines jetliner that crashed in the Everglades, as released by the airline and hospitals today:

title: Herman and Rasmussen To Preview Super Bowl
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Dec. 30 A miniOlympic exhibition along with a preview of the 1973 Super Bowl by two former participants, Dave Herman and Randy Rasmussen of the New York Jets, will be held next Saturday at Kutscher's Country Club.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: World News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 30 Israel's Ambassador to Thai land, Rehaveam Amir, told to day how Thai officials estab lished a hot line between Bang kok and Israel Thursday and early Friday while the lives of six. Israelis held hostage here by Palestinian guerrillas hung in the balance.

title: A Heroine of Gotham
description: A shopkeeper who today is cele brating her 85th birthday, whose formal education ended with the fifth grade, is presenting her papers to New York University.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: ROME, Dec. 30Hundreds of airmail letters from the Unit ed States were found opened and looted in Naples yesterday, the Naples daily, Il Mattino, re ported today.

title: Treat on EpiphanyPound Cake
description: Since the 17th Century pound cake has been tradi tional fare at this time of year. For some, the wide variety of pound cakes pro duced by Entenmann's Bak eries will be the best way to join in this tradtion, but for those who prefer to bake their own cakes, two recipes one for traditional pound cake eaters and the other for the more unorthodox, are offered below.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: The New York Times should have known better, or at least thought twice before publishing the sour grapes about mutual funds by Ger aid Jeremias in Robert Metz's Dec. 3 Wall Street column about mutual funds [Losing Faith in the Funds].

title: Socialist Party Now the Social Democrats, U.S.A.
description: The members of the old So cialist party of Eugene V. Debs and Norman Thomas voted, yes terday to drop the word party and to become instead the Social, Democrats, U. S. A.

title: New Data Is Issued on Housing in Brooklyn
description: More than twothirds of all the housing units in Brooklyn were built before 1940, and only 10 per cent of them during the nineteen sixties, the Census Bureau has reported.

title: Gimeno Captures Final
description: VALENCIA, Spain, Dec. 30 (AP)  Andres Gimeno won the final of an international tennis tournament here today by beating a fellow Spaniard, Jose Herrera, 119, 62, 64.

title: Premier of Sweden Says He'll Continue To Criticize the U.S.
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 30 (UPI) Premier Olof Palme said to day that President Nixon's de cision not to accept a new Swedish Ambassador to Wash ington would not stop him from criticizing the Vietnam war.

title: Davidson Captures Final
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 30 (UPI)Davidson battled to a 6663 victory tonight over. Cin cinnati to capture the cham pionship of the Charlotte's tournament.

title: Chavez Now Poised For BoycottStrike Of Teamster Work
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 30 (AP)  Armed with a Califor nia Supreme Court ruling, Cesar Chavez, leader of the United Farm Workers Union, Is poised for a possible boycottstrike against 45 California lettuce belt employers with field hands under contract with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Society
description: Because work is central to the lives of so many Americans, either the absence of work or employment in meaningless work is creating an in creasingly intolerable situation. The human costs of this state of affairs are manifested in worker alienation, alcoholism, drug addiction and other symptoms of poor mental health... A great part of the staggering nation al bill in the areas of crime and de linquency, mental and physical health, manpower and welfare are generated in our national policies and attitudes toward work.

title: AN END TO IMPASSE ON L.I.R.R. SOUGHT
description: With no settlement of the monthlong Long Island Rail road strike in sight, mediators in the dispute are trying to work out an arbitration formu la that would be acceptable to the 5,000 nonoperating employ es who walked out.

title: A Happy New Year
description: HAPPY New Year greet ing postage stamps are traditional in the Far East, where China (Taiwan), Japan, Korea (Seoul), and other stampis suing entities have provided special adhesivesand, at times, postal cardsfor use by their citizens in sending Happy New Year messages to friends.

title: 2 Groups Bid Labor Department Ban 10 Chemicals From the Workplace
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  A health advocate group and a labor union asked the Govern ment today to ban from the workplace 10 chemicals that are suspected of causing cancer.

title: Enjoy! Enjoy!
description: Many rude things have been said about Jewish foodthat it is the major cause of heartburn in the New York area, that, after eating it, you get hungry 72 hours later and so on. These slurs most often come out of the mouths of people stuffing them selves with Jewish food. Like certain novelists, Philip Roth chief among them, these Jewish gourmands poke fun at Jewish tradition while reveling in it. Roth himself, in Portnoy's Complaint, used food as one of the central metaphors of Alex Portnoy's youth. This was a tribute to the power of the Jewish culinary tradition to inspire joy and awe. Alice Peerce, the wife of the tenor, Jan Peerce, is a repository of this tradition. Her recipes for the two dishes outlined on this page are essentially orthodox, but she has cleverly altered their presentation for the cocktail era. The kugel, cooked in a muffin tin, can be passed as finger food. And so can her rich, healthy knishes, which are precut be fore baking and come out bitesize (well, big bitesize) and delicious. They can be frozen. And little boys who eat them will grow up to be Sandy Koufax.

title: Imperatives for the West
description: The United States and its Atlantic allies have main tained basic unity through the first round of preparatory talks for the projected European security conference. They have won support from some neutral delegations for their insistence on a detailed conference agenda that will Include specific measures for easing tensions and promoting EastWest cooperation. They have em phasized such measures as the freer flow of peoples information and Ideas.

title: Philip Berrigan Resumes Clerical Duties in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Rev. Philip F. Berrigan has returned to clerical duties in Baltimore after spending nearly three years in prison for anti war activities.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Jas Patterson is a 25year old driver in a hurry but he is not rushing blindly or driving disconnected, the phrase he learned in Englandjust to keep mov ing. Patterson is following a thoughtful game plan, which he discussed during a holiday visit with his family in Long Island. On Tues day he will re turn to London to start work on his racing pro grant for 1973, which will emphasize Formula Atlantic, a popular and growing type in England, and some more of the Formula Ford in which he specialized in 1972.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30 (UPI)Loot ers were taking watches, rings and wallets from bodies around the splintered Eastern Airlines TriStar in the Everglades today, according to rescuers.

title: When a spaceman says Ahh
description: The astronauts were probably the most pampered patients in medical history. Here, from a book written by the first astronauts and the editors of Life, We Seven, is an account of the final preflight physical of Alan B. Shepard Jr. on the morning that he was scheduled to go on the nation's first manned space mission, May 2, 1961:

title: Whimsey Reigns in Brooklyn Museum Show
description: There are weddings and weddings, but surely one of the best and most fun was the wedding between the Rag Doll and the Broom Handle.

title: Rough Ride on Israeli Buses
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 30 (AP) The Statistics Bureau has an nounced that during 1971 four of every 10 buses in Israel, at least one time each, either hit something or otherwise jolted passengers badly enough to injure some of them.

title: Employment Falls in City For 3d Consecutive Year
description: Employment in New York City has declined for the third consecutive year, although the decrease was less than that in 1971, the Fedetal Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yes terday.

title: News of the Camera World
description: ANEW brand of pocket camera that takes the same 110 film car tridges used by the recently introduced Kodak Pocket Instamatics has now been put on the market by the GAF Corporation. Called the GAF 220, the camera is similar in design and size to the Kodak models, including the same easyloading fea tures. Shutter speed is nor mally 1/100th of a second, except when flash is being used. When a Magicube (this type requires no battery) is inserted, the speed is auto matically reset to 1/40th of a second to insure accurate synchronization. Finished with a black and woodgrain plastic surface, the 220 is priced at $29.95 and weighs about five ounces. Other features include a wrist strap for easy carrying, a bright optical viewfinder, a glass shield to protect the lens and a shutter release positioned where it can be easily pressed without interfering with a steady grip or caus ing camera movement.

title: Fewer Americans
description: At a time when glad tidings are in exceedingly short supply there are grounds for universal rejoicingboth in this country and abroadover the latest population projections of the United States Census Bureau. A steep decline in fertility rates has caused the bureau to reduce substantially its estimate of the American population in the year 2000 from a previous range of 271 to 322 million to a current projection of 251 to 300 million. The present population is 209.3 million, compared with 140 million at the end of World War II.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 30 (AP)Seventhranked Missouri, regaining its composure just inthe nick of time, cut down 16thranked Kansas State, 82 72, tonight to win the Big Eight Conference preseason tourna ment for the second consecu tive year.

title: CRUSADERS GAIN IN OVERTIME, 43
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 30 (AP) Paul Andrea scored during scramble in front of the Hous ton net at 6 minutes 6 seconds in the overtime period to give the Cleveland Crusaders a 43 victory over the Aeros in World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: Coliseum. In Nassau Is Aiming At Families
description: UNIONDALE, L.I.  What was predicted to become the Disneyland of Nassau County  the Nassau Vet, erans Memorial Coliseum expects to play host to pri marily family events in 1973. And as if to forecast the future, the current pro duction, which ends its run tomorrow, Disney on Pa rade, is indeed a family type musical extravaganza.

title: Soldiers for God Battle Against Drugs
description: The foot soldiers of Teen Challenge, an international organization that began and grew up in Brooklyn, patrol the frontiers of social dissolu tion daily.

title: COURT BARS CLAIM FOR ATTICA VICTIM
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 30The Ap pellate Division of State Su preme Court has dismissed $2.9million claim for the death of a prison clerk during the 1971 riot at the State Correc tional Facility at Attica, but a lawyer said that the decision would be appealed to the State Court of Appeals.

title: 31 FOR SCHAEFFER
description: St. John's defeated South Carolina, 8679, yesterday in the final of the Holiday Festival basketball tournament at Mad ison Square Garden.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30The crash of an Eastern Airlines Lock heed 1011 jet airliner last night raised seemingly contra dictory questions about the safety of the new generation of widebody commercial jets.

title: S. P. Dorman to Marry Miss Geri S. Bergman
description: YONKERS, Dec. 30  The engagement of Miss Geri Sue Bergman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mendel Bergman, to Steven P. Dorman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor Dorman of Fairlawn, N. J., has been announced by the future bride's parents. A summer wedding is planned.

title: 8,500 AIRCRAFT LOST BY U.S. IN INDOCHINA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)  The United States has lost shore than 8,500 planes and helicopters in the Southeast Asian war since 1961, Pentagon figures show. The value of these craft is estimated at $10.5 billion.

title: The Longest L.I.R.R. Strike: Still Rolling
description: The Long Island Rail Road strike now in its 31st day has become the longest shutdown in the railroad's his tory.

title: Biblical Artifacts In Nassau Show
