description: Few areas of the ancient, weed approach or have the lure of the land of the Bible the theme of an exhibition at the Garvies Point Museum in Glen Cove.

title: World News Briefs
description: MANILA, Dec. 30  After more than a month of fighting, the Philippine armed forces have captured a major Moslem stronghold on Sibalo Hill in southern Sulu Province, the mil itary said today.

title: Full Head of Steam for '73 Economy
description: The United States economy is racing forward into 1973 under a full head of steam.

title: Peter S. Mantius, Laura Gaebelein Married on L. I.
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Dec. 30Miss Laura Louise Gaebe lein and Peter Stuyvesant Mantius were married here this afternoon in the chapel of the Stony Brook School. The bride's grandfather, the Rev. Dr. Frank E. Gaebelein, headmaster emeritus of the school, performed the Epis copal ceremony assisted by the school's chaplain, the Rev. Peter Haile.

title: FEW SPECTATORS AT MAGEE'S TRIAL
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 30 Paises to the trial are handed out et a glass enclosure in San Francisco's Hall of Justice that bears a jaunty red, white and blue sign saying, Department 21ituchell Magee Trial, but there are few takers.

title: Detroit Wins Motor City Title
description: DETROIT, Dec. 30 (AP)  Owen Wells paced a second half comeback by the Univer sity of Detroit and led the Titans to a 7559 victory over Massachusetts tonight for theirfirst Motor City tournament title since 1968.

title: Boys' Home Is 10 Years Old
description: NEWARK  St. Timothy's House is planning to cele brate its 10th birthday in January, thus marking the completion of a decade that its director terms unique in the treatment of New Jersey youth problems.

title: A Flutist With Good Friends
description: FOR Paul Dunkel the new year will really begin a week from tonight, when he will give the first of three flute programs in Carnegie Recital Hall. It is a project dear to his heart on which he has been working for some time, since the spring of 1971. It has in volved raising financial support, commis sioning a number of works and rounding up the players to help him perform them.

title: Youth Is Accused in Killing Of Brooklyn Man in Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 30 (AP) The Buffalo police late Friday accused a teenager of stran gling a college student as the student was packing to go to his home in Brooklyn.

title: 3 Dodge Heirs Are Denied Equal Shares of the Estate
description: DETROIT, Dec. 30 (AP)A judge has ruled that three of Anna Thompson Dodge's seven grandchildren are not entitled to equal shares of the estate of more than $11million left by the widow of the auto pioneer Horace E. Dodge.

title: Mercer Inmates Have Angels in Wings
description: PRINCETON  A desperate plea, for help last summer from an inmate at the Mer cer County Workhouse was brushed off by the people to whom it was addressed. But it was answered in Septem ber by a church group here, and it has led the group, the Social Concerns Committee of the Unitarian Church, into a project of befriending se lected released prisoners.

title: Young Brooklyn Audience Cast in Opera
description: Some lastminute innovations in a special Christmas perform ance of Hansel and Gretel proved an instant success last week before an audience of nearly 1,500 children in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: AROUND THE
description: The live Christmas tree should be planted outdoors this weekend. The shorter the tite indoors, the better for the tree.

title: Recordings
description: SOMEWHERE tonight, certainly in Vienna where. New Year's Eve would be unthinkable without it, the fizzy tunes of Johann Strauss's Die Fleder maus will usher in 1973 with undiluted optimism Happy is the man who can forget the inevitable, as Al fred sings before putting the make on. Rosalinde in Act I. The Metropolitan Opera will not be offering its elderly production this evening (last year's smash hit, La Fille du Regiment, does the current New Year's honors, and ru mor has it that Joan Suther land has something special up her sleeve for Marie's Lesson Scene). But anyone feeling cheated could do worse than sample Angel's bright new recording of the operetta (SBLX 3790, two disks) at some point before midnight.

title: Miss Stack Is Wed To T. R. Kennedy
description: SPARTANBURG, S. C., Dec. 30In Trinity United Methodist Church here at noon today, Miss Geraldine Stack, daughter of Mrs. Van Scyoc Stack and Dr. David Rodney Stack Jr., both of Spartanburg, became the bride of Thomas Robertson Kennedy.

title: Critic's ChoiceTen Best Films of '72
description: BY definition the 10 best of any thing have little relation to the rest of the things in their class the best being made irrevocably different by their quality. In 1972 that was especially true of films, which were mostly less than exciting, sometimes for such long periods, as in the late sum mer, that one longed to write about the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, or about pieeating contests, or about almost anything that had to do with what we approximately call life. There were occasionally things like What's Up, Doc?, Fritz The Cat, The Candidate, Pocket Money, Super Fly, Gumshoe and Sleuth, films that were either fun, or easy to take, or ambitious in unusual ways, which restored some promise to general moviegoing without being strong enough to compete with the 10 best (read often favorite) films of the year, with the 10

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Consumer borrowing, which always rises sharply during the month of Decem ber, was up again on sched ule this year, contributing to the record or nearrecord volume of Christmas sales that have been reported.

title: U.S.Backed Student Loans To Be Bigger But Stricter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) College students will be able to float bigger Government backed loans after Feb. 1, but they will have to swear the money is only for schooling and not things like cars, stereos or other noneducational items.

title: PLAN TO DUMP ACID AT SEA IS DROPPED
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 30 (UPI)  The American Cyanamid Cor poration has announced that hew technological advances have enabled it to discontinue plans to dump millions of pounds of acid, wastes into the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Penguins, Wings Tie 22
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30 (UPI) airell MacDonald's power play goal in the second period gave the Pittsburgh Penguins a 22 tie with the Detroit Red Wings tonight.

title: Roy O'Connor Marries Miss Susan Engelhard
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J., Dec. 30Miss Susan Engel bard, daughter of Mrs. Charles W. Engelhard and the late Mr. Engelhard, the industrialist, was married here this afternoon to Roy Sayles O'Connor, son of Dr. Raymond Z. O'Connor, chair man of the history depart ment at the University of Miami, and Mrs. O'Connor.

title: IN THE NATION
description: DURHAM, N. C.Dr. Martin Groder is a young psychiatrist for the Federal Bureau of Prisons. Contrary to much contemporary thought, he believes in the possibility of rehabilitating pris oners because, he says, I've done it.

title: Whooping Crane Loss Is Severest in Years
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30A number of whooping cranes have failed to return to their wintering grounds in Texas, according to American and Ca nadian wildlife officials.

title: Who's Responsible for What's on the Air?
description: IN this calm during the holidays, we in Washington are thinking ahead to 1973; among other things, planning our testimony before Congressional com mittees. For my part, I am particularly concerned about testimony on broadcast license renewal legislation.

title: Photography
description: BURK UZZLE's work has undergone dramatic changes in the four years which lie be tween the opening show of the Witkin Galleryin which he was one of five exhibitors and his current show there.

title: The Nation
description: Those who would eliminate corrup tion from government usually rely on two strategies: root out the corrupt individuals and relax the laws and regulations that are so difficult to obey that they induce businessmen and oth ers to pay bribes.

title: Crete Artifacts Termed Egyptian Loot
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30 Robbers of Egyptian tombs, op erating in the 15th and 16th centuries B.C., became unwill irlg suppliers of looted art ob jects to contemporary Minoan Crete, mainland Greece and other lands trading with Egypt, an archeologist maintained to day.

title: Big 6 Mayors Planning a Drive To Get State Aid for City Police
description: The Mayors of the state's six biggest cities are organizing a drive to persuade the state to make substantial contribu tions to support the police forces of the cities.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N.J., Dec. 30 (AP)Volkswagen of America says it is raising the price of its various automobile models an average of $50 be ginning Jan. 1. The increase will push the cost of a stand ard Beetle above $2,000.

title: G.O.P. Delegate Allocation In '76 Challenged by Ripon
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30 (UPI)The Ripon Society, a liberal Repub lican organization, announced, yesterday a court challenge to the delegate allocation formula for the 1976 Republican Na tional Convention.

title: Hawks Down Braves
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Atlanta Hawks held off the Buffalo Braves, 120110, tonight to move into a virtual tie for first place in the Central Divi sion. The Hawks' victory, cou pled with Baltimore's 10098 loss to the New York Knicks, caused a virtual tie with Atlan ta 4 perdentage points behind Baltimore.

title: Italian Accused of Bombing Freed After 3 Years in Jail
description: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 30 (Reu ters)Pietro Valpreda, a leftist accused of committing Italy's Worst postwar bombing, flew here to stay with relatives early today, his first day of freedom after more than three years in jail awaiting trial.

title: The man who could give of himself
description: Infuriating F.D.R.! Charging about Europe having a grand time watching World War I, he could observe cas ually that the Astors had let their tennis building be turned into a hos pital of 1,100 beds, not much more than a quarter full just now but of course will be again when another batch comes over. . . .[They] have turned an Italian Garden into a really perfect little cemetery for the over seas men who die in hospital. Un feeling Franklin! When Eleanor final ly broke clown under the domination of her motherinlaw, Looking down upon his sobbing wife, he blandly pretended utter bewilderment. He told her gently that she must have gone insane but that the insanity was doubtless temporary. She would soon recover. He then left her alone to do so. Reckless Roosevelt! Like Toad in The Wind in the Willows, he dashed from project to project while various Mr. Badgers (Josephus Daniels, Louis Howe) struggled to him from disaster.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: HE danced at the edge of the abyss, or so it seemed when the scene was telescoped by binoculars. He leaped from stone to stone, high er and higher, behind him nothing except the clouds that boiled up from the valley deep below. Already above the treeline, he cliinbed farther, his blond hair thrash ing around his head in the wind as his spare, vulnerable body challenged the boulders.

title: Art
description: EACH year a few art books get delayed en route and straggle into the office too late for consideration in the pre Christmas sweepstakes. I want to give this year's late corners  as of tomorrow, make that last year's  a little space here.

title: R. S. Aldrich Jr., Law Student, Marries Isabel Tweedy Potter
description: Miss Isabel Tweedy Potter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Sturgis Potter of 1 East End Avenue, was mar ried at noon yesterday to Richard Steere Aldrich Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Aldrich, also of New York and Non quitt, Mass.

title: The Pharaoh and the Pyramid
description: A great deal of interest exists these days about the problem of downgrad ing the vast amounts of secret material in the possession of the Government. A recently discovered manuscript, of uncertain authenticity, reveals the problems of an unidentified Pharaoh, which seem remarkably similar to those of the President.

title: Mexican Farmers Say Johnson Holds a Ranch There Illegally
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 30The Mexican Government is investi gating a charge that former President Lyndon B. Johnson is surreptitiously and illegally holding 108,724 acres of ranch land in the border state of Chihuahua.

title: Policy Station Aiding Arts
description: A 19thcentury threestory police precinct stationhouse in a highcrime area of the Crown HeightsBedford Stuy vesant section of Brooklyn is becoming a home for a group of artists, poets and sculptors.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: HEATH WELCOMES VIETNAM MOVES
description: LONDON, Dec. 30Prime Minister Heath today warmly welcomed the announcement in Washington that the bombing of North Vietnam would be halted and peace talks in Paris resumed.

title: Pacers End Loss Streak
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec: 30 (AP)  The Indiana Pacers broke a fivegame losing string with a hardfought 109101 vic tory over the Dallas Chaparrals tonight.

title: The Nation
description: Adversity continued to ride with New York's harried railroad com muters last week: One strike con tinued, another was threatened and there was the likelihood that one rail road would end its commuter service altogether.

title: Letter to the Editor 9  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: FRANCO'S ARMY IN PEACE OFFER
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30Fran co's Army serenaded the Miami Dolphins here today and hand ed out hundreds of safe con duct passes assuring the Dol phins of a safe return to Miami.

title: Headliners
description: The new year will be a little late this year. By two seconds. In order to synchronize our clocks with the exact rotation time of the earth, the world's chronometrists added one second to the clock on June 30 and will add another today. It all provides official scientific support for a wide spread private conclusionthat 1972 has been the longest year in history.

title: Suzanne Hruby Is Wed Here
description: Miss Suzanne Gwen Hruby and David West Goodrich, who met in the Soviet Union where they were studying at the University of Leningrad, were married here yesterday afternoon in St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University. The bride's father, the Rev. Blah oslav Hruby, a United Presbyterian clergyman and editor of Religion in Commu nist Dominated Areas, a jour nal, performed the ceremony.

title: CANUCKS SUBDUE ISLANDERS 5 TO 2
description: VANCOUVER, British Co lumbia, Dec. 30 (AP)Bobby Schmautz turned, in his second fourgoal game of the season tonight and led the Vancouver Canucks to a 5.2 National Hockey League victory over the New York Islanders.

title: The man who wanted to live forever
description: I do not know whether Walter Langer has ever thought of himself as a psychohistorian, but he is one nonetheless. What is more, he was performing psychohistorical investi gation way back in 1943. His conclu sions at the time, now published in The Mind of Adolf Hitler, give us much to think about  concerning Hitler and the whole Nazi experience on the one hand, and the psychohis torical enterprise on the other.

title: Buildings Nourish A Love Affair With the City
description: The end crowns the work, said the Latin inscription over a drawing celebrating the completion of the Brooklyn Bridge. Fifteen years later, in 1898, came the political unification of the city, making 1973 a 75th anniversary and a time for a backward glance at some landmarks and history that inspire one citizen saffection for the city.

title: Connecticut's Gains In Economy Linked To Defense Outlays
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 30Con necticut's economy is improv ing, but only because defense expenditures are increasing, the state's new Council of Econo mic Advisers reported this week. Its report, the first to be issued by the council, is a re view of the years since World War II.

title: Cougars Conquer Colonels
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Dec. 30 (AP)The Carolina Cougars protected their Eastern Division leadr tonight with a 10491 vic tory over the secondplace Kentucky Colonels before record crowd of 14,126.

title: Education
description: In the wake of the 1970 campus disturbances at Kent State Univer sity and Jackson State College, the American Association of University Professors appointed a committee to study the relationship between lawenforcement agencies and col leges. Last week, the committee is sued a report warning that colleges better make some changes if they want to preserve their freedom.

title: No Argentine Death Penalty
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 30 (Reuters)President Alejandro Lanusse of Argentina has abolished the death penalty, re introduced in June, 1970, by former President Juan Ongania.

title: Lincoln Center Featttres Staten Island
description: Everyone always thinks we Staten Islanders live in some backward country. We're al ways being dominated by the Bronx or Brooklyn. But we're finally into something big. Now we're in Lincoln Center.

title: OnceDestitute Brazil Fishing Village Is Scoring Gains in Development Test
description: O COQUEIRO, BrazilThe pride of this destitute fishing village on the northeast coast of Brazil is the new meeting house designed and built by the villagers.

title: Miss Weiss Fiancee of J. M. Reiss
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y. Dec. 30Mr. and Mrs. Don ald G. Weiss have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jacque line Mara Weiss, to Judson Michael Reiss, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Reiss of Ossin ing.

title: Miss Merrick To Be Bride
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., Dec. 30Mr. and Mrs. Herbert DuPuy Merrick of Lloyd Neck have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Deborah Haines Merrick, to George Truett Tate, son of Dr. Elizabeth Krebs, a su perintendent of schools in Tucson, Ariz., and John Ev erett Tate Jr. of Lincoln, Neb. A summer wedding is planned.

title: The Talk of Bayonne
description: BAYONNE  There is a sameness to the streets and houses in this city that belies the continuing efforts of the 72,500, residents to remain modern in dress, The three major concerns  transporta tion, environment and hous ing  reflect the desire of residents for recognition, despite the fact that they feel isolat ed. Physically, Bayonne may well be isolated from the rest of Hudson County. A peninsula, it has Newark Bay to the west, the Kill van Kull to the south and the Upper New York Harbor to the east. It'is nar row and completely urban, although new one and two family houses are being built where tenements stood a few years ago. The stores on Broadway are busy, and the city's economy appears to be booming.

title: Steeler Defense NoName II
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30 John Dockery, the exJet de fensive back, was talking about his own situation, but he easily could have been describing the Steeler defense of which he now is a mem ber.

title: Miss Spaeth Has Nuptials
description: FAIRWAY, Kan., Dec. 30 Miss Maria Spaeth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Linden Spaeth of Shawnee Mission, was married here at noon to day to Thomas Aquinas Mur phy Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Murphy of New York and Bloomfield Hills, Mich. The Rev. John Schwind, cousin of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony in St. Agnes Roman Catholic Church.

title: Old Year, New Year
description: The old year fades. Tomorrow starts all over again with a new page, a whole new calendar of the year. Inevitably, there is the temptation to draw a tally line; but this is no more an ending than is a sunset. Another sunrise brings another day, another year. And yester day, last year, the past, hands on its clutter of un finished business. He who would add up totals cannot tally the first column before new figures are added to the list.

title: ACTION IS SUDDEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The White House announced today that President Nixon had or dered a halt to the bombing of North Vietnam above the 20th Parallel and that Henry A. Kissinger would resume nego tiations for a Vietnam settle ment with Le Duc Tho in Paris on Jan. 8.

title: A's Reliever Wins Award
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (UPI) Rollie Fingers, the star reliever for the Oakland A's, was named today winner of the World Series Award presented by the Houston baseball writers. The righthander appeared in six of the seven games and posted 1.74 earnedrun average, win one game and losing one.

title: Solar Eclipse on June 30
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 30 (Reuters)  An eclipse of the sun lasting seven minutes will be observ able from South America next June 30, scientific sources said here.

title: 2 More Hit, but Brown and Kilmer Recover for. Battle With Cowboys
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  The, effect ofthe flu on several members of the Washington Redskins and the performance of Roger Staubach and Bob Lilly for the Dallas Cowboys loomed as the essential ele ments of tomorrow's National Conference football champion ship game.

title: NOISE CURB BRINGS A HOUSING GRANT
description: A Federal assistance grant of $10.3million was approved for the Two Bridges publichousing project on the Lower East Sidel after the developers agreed yes terday to reduce noise in the area.

title: Centers Will Recycle L.I. Christmas Trees
description: ROSLYN, L. I.A proces sion of treetopped automo biles will wind toward two town depots next Saturday in a drivein recycling project that has as its object the transformation of this win ter's Christmas trees into next spring's mulch.

title: L.I. Post Office That Isn't
description: DIX HILLS, L. I.  Town maps from 100 years ago in dicate the proposed location of a post office in this roll ing, sylvan patch of expen sive real estate called Dix Hills. Other maps since then have been dotted with other proposed sitesbut there is still no post office.

title: STUDY PANEL SCORES U.S. WELFARE LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Present welfare laws are so complex and irrational that they encourage mistakes and cheating and prevent system atic detection, the chairman of a Congressional study subcom mittee said today.

title: News of Dogs
description: Spartiel fanciers from coast to coast will be here next Saturday and Sunday for the 56th national specialty and obedience trial of the Ameri can Spaniel Club, to be held at the Statler Hilton Hotel. The event has drawn a rec ord 505 dogs, 54 more than last January.

title: In the Mailbox
description: In recent years I have be come nauseous by what I see taking place in college athletics. There is no relationship what soever between amateur ath letes and those who compete for the majority of colleges. Colleges dip into junior high schools in order to create Varsity teams for six or more years hence. I have far more respect for the accomplish ments of Nat Holman, who created championship teams and outstanding players out of inexperienced material. This is entirely different from U.C.L.A. basketball, which has been rep resented by professional teams for a long time.

title: HANOI'S REACTION
description: PARIS, Dec. 30North Viet nam sought tonight to dispel the idea that it had yielded to military pressure in agreeing to further peace talks with the United States.

title: Overseas Chinese Named by Taiwan To the Legislature
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 30 President Chiang Kaishek has appointed 20 overseas Chinese, three of them from the United States, to serve as members of Nationalist China's legislative bodies.

title: Stockton Turns Back Brent In Tennis Final, 76, 62
description: MANHASSET, Dec. 30 Dick Stockton, the No. 1 player in the East and No. 4 in the nation, won the first invitation indoor tournament at Ferris Tennis here today with a 76, 62 victory over Rod Brent in the final.

title: Uganda Acts to Curb Press
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Dec. 30 (AP)  President Idi Amin has signed a decree empowering the Government to ban any newspaper for a specified or indefinite period.

title: Senators Express Pleasure
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Senator Charles H. Percy, Republican of Illinois, said to day that the first order of bus iness when peace talks resume in Paris should be the estab lishment of an inplace cease fire and agreement on ex change of prisoners, as the de tails of a total settlement are worked out.

title: The man who got on with everybody
description: Some of the more wistful and in quiring readers of the memoirs of Lester Pearson will be the Cabinet of Pierre Trudeau, who are still per plexed at the setback they suffered in the Canadian Federal elections in October. How did the previous Lib eral Government manage to survive better than they? How did Trudeau's predecessor as Prime Minister man age to belie, by his achievements in three different careers, the dictum he often quoted, that Nice guys fin ish last?

title: EAST WINS, 9 TO 3, IN SHRINE GAME
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 30 An East team, featuring a pow erful ground attack spearhead ed by Otis Armstrong of Pur due, beat the West, 93, today in the 48th annual EastWest Shrine football game. It was the first East victory In five years.

title: Son to Mrs. Coglianese
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Robert Coglianese of Searingtown, L. I., on Dec. 15 in Maimonides Hospital in Brooklyn. The child has been named Adam Scott.

title: COLUMBIA SUBDUES T.C.U. QUINTET, 7461
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 30 (AP)Bill Evans hit 11 of 16 fieldgoal attempts and scored 25 points today to lead Colum bia to a 7461 victory over Texas Christian for seventh place in the Far West Basket ball Classic in Memorial Coli seum.

title: Letter to the Editor 3  No Title
description: During the recently completed Presi dential campaign, and indeed during the spring primaries, I made innumer able speeches and gave many inter views on behalf of my fatherinlaw, George McGovern, It was not the standard, stereotyped standin cam paigning which has typified the fam ily participation in national politics rather, my wife and I went out each and every day with a simple and short message for our audiences: Lives hung in the balance in this election. People, both Vietnamese and Americans, were going to live or die depending on the outcome of the Presidential election. We stressed that George McGovern's election to the Presidency would save lives because of his pledges to stop the bombing and end the war, whereas Mr. Nixon, with, his decadeslong sup port of the Vietnamese conflict and prosecution of the war while in office, could not and should not be trusted to truly end the war.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISFeasibility studies have been authorized by the National Executive Council of Thailand to ascertain the possibilities and cost of constructing a wide sealevel canal across the Kra Isthmus in the southern part of the country, near the Malaysian border, with the idea of opening a short ship ping route between the Indian Ocean and the South China Sea.

title: Jurisdiction of Offshore Islands Disputed by Papua New Guinea
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 30 Papua New Guinea, an Aus tralianadministered territory soon to be independent, already has a boundary dispute, though flan sovereignty is still two or three years away.

title: Here's Why the Wizard of Odds Prefers to Be Just Plain Joe
description: For $15, an insecure horse player can start the. New Year fresh with a modest handicapping device known as the Miracle System.

title: Tennessee Holds Off L.S.U. For 2417 Blue bonnet Victory
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (AP)  Condredge Holloway, a quarter back who passed up a $90,000 pro baseball contract to paly football, scored two touchdowns and passed for another in the first half to lead 11thranked Tennessee to a 2417 victory over 10thranked Louisana State in the 14th annual AstorBlue bonnet Bowl tonight.

title: More on the Bombing
description: The current American bombing of North Vietnam has destroyed any chance for an end to the war in the foreseeable future. The most important goal for the National Liberation Front and Hanoi has always been to dis engage America from the war per manently. In the recent history of the conflict this has meant, essentially, to remove American air power.

title: Slow Gains Made In Ownership Drive
description: A state effort to help stabilize resi dential neighborhoods in the city through housing rehabilitation has made a cautious start.

title: Nuptials on L.I. for Pamela Nevard
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Dec. 30 Miss Pamela Nevard, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Jacques M. Nevard, was married here this afternoon to W. Bruce Phillips, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur W. Phillips of Setau ket. The ceremony was per formed at the home of the bride's parents by Judge Patricia Collins of the Nassau County District Court.

title: New & Novel; The Sailor And the Fox
description: The Sailor and the Fox is a fourfisted tour de force in which two Bermudian heavy weights beat each other silly. Between punches, Mr. Burland thumbnails a sketch of each fighter. Sailor Saltus, 48, ex champ of the British Mediter ranean fleet, out of retirement to underwrite his mother's op eration. Phineas Fox, 27, boxing nonpareil and champion Casa nova. Phineas is black; Sailor is white; and as the bout pro gresses amid an ambience of brutality and side bets, Mr. Burland elaborates on the class of the contestants and the shabbiness of the contest. Enough blood is spilled and leather thrown to demonstrate that prizefighting can be injuri ous to your health.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: A hot rumor found its way here the other day. The ru mor was that because Har per's magazine was off in ad pages for the year seri ous consideration was being given to merging it with Atlantic.

title: News of the Rialto
description: DOWN in Pompano Beach, with the Florida sun overhead and a view of the Atlantic from his window, author Jerome Weidman is thinking about Shubert Alley.

title: Housing Dispute In North Bergen
description: NORTH BERGEN  While developers await the first spring thaws to begin a $100 million, 1,800unit luxury apartment complex on the township's Hudson River bank, a small but growing coalition is fighting it for educational, financial and esthetic reasons.

title: Change at U.S. Tokyo Helm
description: TOKYO, Dec. 30 (UPI)Rear Adm. William Haley Rogers will succeed Rear Adm. Julian T. Burke Jr. as commander of United States naval forces in Japan on Jan. 9, the Navy has announced. Admiral Rogers, who has been commander of cruiser destroyer Flotilla 11 of the Seventh Fleet, will be based at Yokosuka, southwest of Tokyo. Admiral Burke will become commander of the service forces of the Atlantic Fleet at Norfolk, Va.

title: Edward Gorey: Had the Vapours Lately?
description: ALIKING for the art of Edward Gorey is, prob ably, an acquired taste. Mr. Gorey is a profes sional illustrator and story teller of unspecified age, whose albums of illustrated gothic tales and nonsense al phabets first began appear ing in the early fifties. Since that time, he has developed a small and devoted follow ing. One of his earliest fans was the late Edmund Wilson who wrote, I believe, the first important critical notice of Gorey's work in The New Yorker in 1959. Gorey has also illustrated the works of other writers  notably Dickens and Edward Lear and his cartoons and illus trations have appeared, pe riodically, in The New York Times, Esquire and Holiday.

title: Sports of The Times
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  He'll be returning kickoffs tomorrow for the Washington Redskins and if Larry Brown aggravates his ailing leg, he will be used as a running back. His name is Herb Mul Key, with a hyphen as in semipro, which he was a year ago. Maybe you've never heard of him. But he has done what thou sands like to think they could do, make in the National Football League without any col lege experience in a try out. He's really the N.F.L. player of the year be cause nobody else in the league has come as far in 1972from $25 a game for the West Side Packers in an Atlanta sandlot league to an opportunity for a $25,000 Super Bowl bonanza if the Redskins defeat the Dallas Cowboys in the N.F.C. championship game. And he did it on a team whose coach, George Allen, abhors rookies because of the mistakes they might make.

title: Letter to the Editor 6  No Title
description: There have been many profound and even remarkable analyses of Her man Melville's great American classic Moby Dick. But perhaps the most remarkable interpretation is being rendered by the most outstanding Quaker of our time, that unseemly Captain Ahab, President Nixon.

title: Easy Does It for Wooden and U.C.L.A.
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 30 John Wooden made the trip to the Suger Bowl bas ketball tournament with his undefeeted University of Cal ifornia, Los Angeles, basket ball team this weekend. But the Bruins' coach remained under doctor's orders to re frain from any activity other than supervising game ac tion from the bench.

title: Mauro Fancelli Weds Julie Ansley Jenkins
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Dec. 30 Miss Julie Ansley Jenkins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Washington Jenkins, was married here this eve ning in the First United Methodist Church to Mauro Adolfo Dino Fancelli, son of Mrs. Faliero Fancelli of Flor ence, Italy, and the Late Mr. Fancelli, The Rev. David Horton performed the cere mony.

title: Pope Paul Reported Slightly Ill With the Flu and Taking Rest
description: ROME, Dec. 30The Vatican announced today that Pope Paul VI was suffering from a slight case of influenza and needed some days of rest.

title: $10,000 for a House Near the City? Ha!
description: We knew we couldn't spend more than $10,000, and we wanted a coun try place no more than 125 miles from Manhattan. We soon realized that we were asking for the impossible. One barn, a great buy at $7,500, was in such poor condition that the agent started to talk about how much one can get for old barn boardsWorth the price just to be able to tear it down and sell if off board by board. This may have been true, but we were not looking for a board business.

title: 66 Debutantes Presented At the International Ball
description: The International Debu tante Ball, held at the. Wal dorfastoria's Grand Ball room last night, might now be considered to have adult status. The event dates to 1954, making it the same age as most of the 66 debutantes presented under its auspices this year.

title: Saxbe Hails Announcement
description: MECHANICSBURG, Ohio, Dec. 30 (AP)Senator William B. Saxbe, Republican of Ohio, who had earlier sharply criticized the renewed bombing of North Vietnam, today welcomed the announcement that it had been halted.

title: Be a Good Beaver
description: My strongest impression of 1972 was an encounter with a beaver who barred my way and began to weep. I don't know about beavers, but ours have two darkred front teeth. I wish the beavers of all countries well and a Happy New Year.

title: Four More Papers Closed By Cambodian Government
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 30 (Reuters)Four more Cambodian newspapers were closed this week for publishing articles considered detrimental to national security.

title: A HOTEL MAID, 33, FOUND MURDERED
description: A Thai woman working as a maid in a midtown hotel that has many single and welfare tenants was found dead yester day afternoon in the room of a tenant who is being sought for questioning by the police.

title: MICHAEL UNFAZED BY LINDSAY SNUB
description: Ivan Michael, the City Plan ning Commissioner who is be ing dropped by Mayor Lindsay, had opposed the administra tion's plans to permit some highrise residences on the East Side and to cut back the Forest Hills public housing project.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 30 (UPI) Michigan State, paced by Mike Robinson, tonight beat Arizona State, 8374, for the championihip of the 10th annu al Kodak tournament.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 30 (UPI)  Mike Norwood arid Aaron Cov ington led a balanced scoring attack with 17 points apiece to night as Canisius scored a 90 79 victory over Murray State for the championship in the 19th annual Queen City tourna ment.

title: Indira Gandhi is sort of the de Gaulle of India
description: NEW DELHI. Twentyfive years ago, India be came free of the British. This year has been declared the Year of the Jubilee. I looked forward to its celebrations, because the Indians shared one thing with their exmasters; they were very good at organizing processions. In fact, I think they were rather better at it; the British had their Royal Family, but the Indians had painted elephants. So I expected pageantry, but, as it turned out, there was none. No parades, no fireworks, no banquets. There was nothing but a few speeches by politi cians, all of a depressing tone. There were articles in the newspapers, which were even more gloomy. Ironically, the one topic of conversation in this Jubilee Year of Freedom has been how soon the Indians are going to lose it.

title: To Our Readers
description: Because of changes in pro duction schedules for the holiday weekend, the Week in Review (Section 4) was printed early. As a result, it was not possible to include news or editorial comment on the Vietnam bombing halt ordered yesterday by President Nixon.

title: Nails Fall, Tires Flatten
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Dec. 30 (AP)  Seventeen automo biles had four flat tires apiece at a downtown St. Petersburg intersection one day this week. The police said a keg of roofing nails had dropped from a truck and scattered across the pave ment. Traffic was tied up for more than 30 minutes.

title: 89 Die, 80 Survive and 8 Are Missing In Florida Crash of Jet From New York
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30  Eighty men, women and children were rescued in the predawn dark ness of the Florida Everglades today after a jumbo jetliner from New York with 177 per sons aboard crashed late last night while on an approach to Miami International Airport.

title: Shorter Banking His Marathon Gold
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30 (UPI)  Frank Shorter, the winner of the marathon at the Olympics in Munich, isn't taking any chances with his gold medal. The 24yearold law student has it tucked away in, a bank vault in Kan sas, the home state of his wife's parents.

title: New & Novel
description: Beneath the streets of Des Moines, Iowa, there lies a pur gatory where the residents sub sist on heroin and human flesh. Above the street level, things aren't much better, if the lives of these Iowans are an index. Mr. Rhodes has a painterly eye for minutiae and a folk lorist's way with an anecdote. But he puts the reader on shamelessly with one Ozified vignette after another, until the book dissolves into wisps of self indulgent whimsy.

title: Talking to the Driver: The Documents of 20th Century Art
description: When I came toward you, Matisse, the crowd was looking at you and laughing, but you were smiling back. People saw a monster where, in fact, there stood a miracle. So wrote the poet Guillaume Apollinaire in 1907. Monster or miracle, or even a hoaxto provoke such violent and contradictory reactions was the fate of almost all the schools of modern art. Even in quarters where it has been most sympathetically received, there lingers the notion that it is a hermetic form, a sort of rebus that has to be deciphered before it can be enjoyed. Mounds of exegesis have hardly clarified the situation; some times, it seems, one can no longer see the view for all the signposts pointing to it. Under such circum stances many artists have felt eager or obliged to render an account of themselves in words, sometimes dis pelling and sometimes adding to all the confusion.

title: Letter to the Editor 2  No Title
description: Since the recent breakdown in the Paris peace negotiations, I have heard the United States Government vilified by many individuals and publications. Even people who are seemingly loyal to our country go as far as to call its President a fascist or even a monster. Their theory is that Messrs. Nixon and Kissinger purposely set up and then sabotaged the peace talks as a hoax perpetrated against the American peo ple to gain votes last November.

title: Robert Santora Weds Carol Machcinski
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 30 Christ Episcopal Church was the setting here this after noon for the marriage of Miss Carol Gay Machcinski to Robert Mark Santora.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: California Is Using Taped Interviews As News Releases
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 30 (AP)For decades, the pub lic information officer's best friend was his mimeograph ma chine, but now California offi cials are taking to the air waves with taperecorded radio news releases.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The marriage of George Meredith and Mary Ellen Pea cock, daughter of the poet novelist Thomas Love Peacock, endured eight years. Everyone who knew them was aware that for at least half that time they were miserable. In 1857 she eloped with the minor painter Henry Wallis. Four years later she died. Meredith hardly spoke of her again; in all his 2,600 letters she is scarcely referred to. Biographers of Meredith have followed his exam ple, either because they were relatives of the man or lacked material. Now, in this curiously titled volume, comes Diane Johnson, an English professor at the University of California, to champion Mary as a new a modernVictorian heroine, a liberated woman, a trage dienne before (or after) her time.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The cap ital is buzzing these days with rumors about a split between President Nixon and his security adviser Henry Kissin ger over the terms of a ceasefire in Vietnam, but as usual in this gossipy town, the facts are less dramatic than the rumors.

title: Historical Group Records And ReflectsTurmoils of Society
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29 Last night, as the bawdy old French Quarter warmed up for the Mad revelry of this Sugar Bowl weekend, more than 4,000 members of the American His torical Association were gather ing in the ballroom of a local hotel to hear their president's annualmeeting address.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The last of President Nixon's Christmas turkey was eaten today by the Chief Execu tive and his family in the form of a tired thin soup. With its going, this columnist is free at last to report de tails of his exclusive interview with the turkey as it awaited the honor of becoming Presidential alimentation.

title: KNAPP CONCLUSION WARILY OPTIMISTIC
description: The Knapp Commission has expressed guarded optimism about the chances that the cor ruption it said infected the Po lice Department in 1971 can be considerably reduced.

title: Letter to the Editor 7  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: TWIXT CAPTURES LAUREL FEATURE
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 30Mrs. John M. Franklin's Twixt won the $23,850 E. Taylor Chewning Handicap at Laurel Race Course today after a stretch duel with Far Fetched. But a good share of the honors on this gloomy day went to Sandy Hawley, North America's leading jockey in 1972.

title: Jersey Bell Granted Rate Rise; State Senator Assails Timing
description: NEWARK, Dec. 30 (AP)The State Public Utility, Commission granted the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company a $55.2 million rate increase yesterday.

title: Travel Notes: Caution, Smoking Is Hazardous to Passenger's Comfort
description: LAARY GOODMAN of Phoenix, Ariz., had an unpleasant experience on an airplane earlier this Year, and he wrote the Civil Aeronautics Board about it. In part his letter said: I consider it an infringement of my personal freedom and a detriment to my health to be a captive audience 40,000 feet up in the blue sky and have some inconsiderate bastard puffing and blowing [smoke] around me.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: THIS is the story of a journey that carried people across more than miles or days. It begins in the late 1930's when I left the city where, I was born, Prague, in the company of my mother. It continues this year, when my own son slept in Prague in the same room as his father and his father's father. The ending can't be toldbe cause there is none.

title: Mate Legislators Face the Happy Prospect of a Budget Surplus When Session Opens
description: The state's 210 lawmakers face a significant budget sur plus for the first time in sev eral years when they gather Wednesday in Albany to con vene the state's 196th regular legislative session.

title: Nixon's AllStar Economic Team
description: As President Nixon knows himself, the selection of an allstar team is a highly per sonal matter, be it baseball, football or eco nomic gamesmanship. Others are sure to quibble at the choice. But in the spirit of this long, footballsaturated weekend, it seems appropriate to spotlight the team that will tackle the economic problems of 1973.

title: Steven Dean to Wed Sally Rising
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I., Dec. 30 The engagement of Miss Sally Isbrandtsen Rising to Steven Lance Dean has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Albert E. Rising Jr. of Glen Head and Brightwaters, par ents of the prospective bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John A. Dean of Colton, N.X. A summer wedding is planned.

title: Early Ticket Requests
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 30 (Cana dian Press)The 1976 Summer Olympics are three and a half years away, but the Montreal Olympic organizing committee already has received 25,000 re quests for about 150,000 tick ets to the Games. Gilles Martin, deputy information officer for the committee, said the re quests were being filed in order of reception. The Olympics will be held from July 17 through Aug. 1, 1976.

title: Babich Going to Jersey
description: Larry Babich, who developed New York Tech into a winner in the metropolitan area, has been named head baseball coach at Jersey City State Col lege. Babich succeeds Gene Bacha, who resigned after five years. Babich has compiled an 8865 wonlost record in seven years at the Old Westbury, L. I. school.

title: Vietnam
description: WASHINGTONA veteran member of Congress summed up the dominant mood: I can't remember a more depressing holiday season. I was so sure we'd have peace by now that it never seemed possible that instead of peace we'd be bombing the hell out of North Vietnam.

title: Shelley Serota Engaged
description: NORTH CALDWELL, N. J., Dec. 30The engagement of Miss Shelley Bachrach Serota to Steven Barry Yablon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leon M. Yablon of Jersey City, has been announced by her par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Norman F. Serota. The wedding is planned for May.

title: Survivors of Crash Recall Crunch
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30The ap proach to Miami International Airport was thoroughly rou tine. The Fasten Seat Belts light hashed on, then the No Smoking sign and then the rumble and thump of the landing gear going down.

title: Home Improvement
description: A NEW type of floor tile recently introduced has two features frequently desired by homeown ers: First, it is a doit yourself inaterial that comes in stand and 12x12inch squares with a pressuresensitive adhesive on the back so that all the installer need do is peel off the protective paper back ing, then press the individual tiles in place. Second, it has a specially coated highgloss surface that never needs waxing and keeps its shine in definitely (in fact, most house hold floor waxes actually won't stick to it).

title: Frederick Law Olmsted, creator of The Central Park, never said anything about tennis courts, Shakespeare, zoos or ghastly statues of Alice in Wonderland
description: In the first half of the 19th century, there was no interest in America in building large parks. There was simply no need for them. Most of the people lived in the country and even for those who lived at the heart of the growing cities, the country side was within easy walking distance of everyone, even dwellers in the greatest cities. True, some propagandizing had begun, at least for reserving land before it was all occupied by buildings of the expanding metropolises. But more often parks were regarded as European fripperies, too aristo cratic, too artistic to be respected by the populace. Indeed, by the eighteenfifties, when talk of Central Park was very much in the air in New York, the need for it becoming increasingly manifest, one commentator insisted that it was an unrepublican waste of money . . . only the rich would use it; or, if the poor used it, they would quickly destroy its beauty.

title: Alida Howard Plans Bridal
description: BLAIRSTOWN, N. J., Dec. 30Miss Alida Babcock How ard and Edward George Mar cel Woods plan to be married next June at the Blair Acad emy, where the future bride's father, James M. Howard Jr., is headmaster.

title: World News Briefs
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30Between 400 and 500 students demonstrated on the Cairo University campus today against the arrest of some of their colleagues, in formed sources said.

title: Letter to the Editor 5  No Title
description: As one who is as fervent as The Times, in wishing for an end to the war in Vietnam, I feel compelled to differ with your editorial charge of Dec. 19. that Dr. Kissinger and the President were either deceptive or naive in holding out the prospect of an imminent peace.

title: Science Association Assails Continued U.S. War Role
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) The American Association for the Advancement of Scence, tke world's largest science organi zation, declared today that it condemns continued Ameri can participation in the war in Vietnam.

title: Susan Haselton Becomes Bride Of T. R. Barr
description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 30 The Noroton Presbyterian Church, here, was the setting this afternoon for the mar riage of Miss Susan Lizabeth Haselton to Thomas Ramsey Barr, son of Col. Thomas J. Barr, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Barr of Fairfax, Va.

title: Oregon Mental Health Aide To Head Alcoholism Council
description: The appointment of George C. Dimas as executive director of the National Council on Al coholism was announced yes terday by John K. MacIver, the council chairman of the board. Mr. Dimas succeeds William W. Moore, Jr., who resigned last month to become executive di rector of the American Heart Association.

title: Fassbender Wins
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa, Dec. 30 (Reuters) Jur gen Fassbender of West Ger many beat topseeded Bob Hewitt of South Africa, 64, 64, today to take the men's singles title in the Eastern Province tennis champion ships.

title: History as geography, economics, folkloreas everything that touches the lives of men
description: French history has been the most exciting, the most original and the most satisfying history written over the last half century. The great fig ures of the twenties and thirties whose first work had appeared be fore World War I  Marc Bloch, Georges Lefebvre, Lucien Febvre are all dead: Bloch, let it never be for gotten, shot as a hostage in World War II, an enormity as monstrous as would have been the killing of Beethoven or a Michelangelo. These were the great figures in the found ing of what became the most excit ing of all historical publications in the 20's, 30's and 40's, Les Annales.

title: Will man ever live in space? (If so, woman will live there too)
description: HOUSTON. According to a story occasionally heard in NASA circles, several astronauts were being suited up one day for a lengthy stay in one of the space agency's test chambers, where one can undergo the wild stresses of outer space with out leaving earth. The fitting process in those days consisted of being shoved into an undergarment of thick perforated rubber followed by several layers of nylon and rubber and then, among other things, sinking into heavy shoes that faintly resembled an old prisoner's iron boots. In the midst of some of these preparations an enterprising reporter rushed up to one of the astronauts with a microphone in his hand.

title: NEWCOMBE, PARUN GAIN TENNIS FINAL
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 30 (AP)John Newcombe, a threetime Wimbledon cham pion, moved into the men's singles final of the Australian open tennis championships today with a 76, 64, 62 vic tory over Patrick Proisy of France.

title: SWEET PUSS TAKES NEW HOPE STAKES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30  Rallying from last place in a 10horse field, Sweet Puss scored a halflength victory to day in the $28,500 New Hope Stakes for 2yearold fillies at Liberty Bell.

title: The Shirelles Sing Soldier Boy In a Rock Revival at the Garden
description: The Shirelles, a girls singing group, recorded Soldier Boy the lyric deals with promises of undying love to the soldier far from homein 1962. They brought down a crescendo of applause with it again on Fri day at Madison Square Garden when they formed part of one of Richard Nader's smooth running Rock Revival shows.

title: MEMORIALS HELP NEEDIEST CASES
description: Many contributors to the New York Times Neediest Cas es Fund specify that their gifts be recordedin memory of loved onesusually in the name of de ceased parents, children or oth er close relatives, and frequent ly in the name of wellknown people.

title: The Nation
description: On the day after Franklin Roo sevelt's death in April, 1945, the shaken new President, Harry Tru man, said to a group of reporters, If you fellows know how to pray, pray for me now. The plea was typical of the plainspoken, essen tially modest man who occupied the White House during, eight tumult uous years in the nation's history, and who died last week in Kansas City at the age of 88.

title: DR. ALBERT CINELLI; LED SPECIALIST PLAN
description: Dr. Albert A. Cinelli, founder and director of the Medical and Surgical Specialists Plan of New York, died at Roosevelt Hos pital on Thursday. He was 72 years old and lived at 1021 Park Avenue.

title: Texas A.&M. Picks Powell
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30 (AP)Dee Powell, Texas A. and M. defen sive football coach for the last eight years, joined the Southern Methodist University staff to day. Powell will be in charge of the defensive line.

title: Not Even in the Game, He's Hors de Combat
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (UPI) Dave Sommerville, a red shirted wide receiver for Ten nessee, was injured without getting on the field tonight in the AstroBluebonnet Bowl game.

title: YOUNG SOCIALISTS SUPPORT MEANY
description: Young Socialists, in a conven tion with few bluecollar dele gates, hitched their political wagon more firmly last week to 78yearold George Meany, president of the American Fed eration of LaborCongress of Industrial Organizations and called on the, Democratic party to come home to the main stream of the labor movement.

title: Miss Catherine M. Middleton Is Wed to Martin D. Middleton
description: SOUTH NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 30  Miss Catherine Mary Middleton and Martin David Middleton, who are first cousins, were married here this afternoon in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. Francis A. Campagnone.

title: St. Joseph's Wins Quaker City
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30 (AP) Pat McFarland and Mike Ban torn sparked a secondhalf surge as St. Joseph's romped over La Salle tonight, 7752, in the final of the Quaker City tourna ment at the Palestra.

title: Spring Forecast: A Ruffle Here, a Flower There
description: With most women running around these days in sweaters and pants, realistic designers aren't too confident of in troducing drastic changes in clothing habits by spring Oh, they hope to gain some adherents to skirts. And there are those who favor shirt waist dresses and chemises. But the prevailing feeling is still casual during the day, and most designers aren't fighting it too hard.

title: FILION REACHES 600VICTORY MARK
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Dec. 30 Herv Filion became the first driver in harness racing history to win 600 races in a year when he captured the ninth race of the 10race afternoon program at Monticello Raceway today. It was the third of his four vic tories this afternoon.

title: U.S. USE OF PORT IN GREECE ATTACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Two House Foreign Affairs subcommittees state that a decision to use Greece as a home base for the United States Sixth Fleet at this time is a serious mistake and a dis service to our own democratic traditions.

title: Language Parley: Some Exclamation Points
description: Silence often seems to be the most eloquent expression of Americans caught in the cross fire of a foreign lan guage.

title: Rider Tops Trenton State
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Mike Baggett's 20 points led Rider to a 6951 victory over Trenton State and third place in the Governor's Classic to night.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: If history never repeats, it does seem to move in cycles. For Matthew Josephson, the pop art and theatrical hap penings of the sixties were muffled echoes of dada and surrealism, whose birth he recorded in Paris in the early twenties, and the recent tri bulations of Wall Street also gave him a sensation of deja vu.

title: Student Is Fiance Of Sheila Brophy
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Dec. 30 Mr. and Mrs. James D. Brophy Jr. of Harrison and Southampton, L. I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sheila Brophy, to Steven William Peiffer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jacob Wilbur Peiffer of South ampton. The wedding will take place in June.

title: Changes In Transit Angering 2 Boroughs
description: The Borough Presidents of Brooklyn and Queens have accused the New York City Transit Authority of delib erately bypassing the Mayor, the Board of Estimate and the public in making changes in the subway and bus sys tems in those boroughs.

title: New Mexico Crash Stirs Bid for Inquiry On Roads Agency
description: ROSWELL, N.M., Dec. 30 Bipartisan, support for a legis lative investigation of the New Mexico. State Highway Com mission has developed follow ing the deaths Tuesday night of 19 members of a Texas church group in a bustruck collision on a narrow bridge that had long been declared unsafe by highway officials.

title: Alice Reed Affianced
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Dec. 30 The engagement of Miss Alice Beth Reed, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter E. Reed of Elizabeth, to James Ed ward Tulin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marshall Tulin of Hew lett, L. I., has been an nounced by the future bride's parents,

title: Response to Blood Appeal Here Is Termed Slow, but Improving
description: The Greater New York Blood Program reported yesterday that the response to its appeal for blood donations to alleviate an acute shortage in the metro politan area was slow, but im proved as the day wore on.

title: Bulls Topple Bucks
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30 (AP)  Holding Kareem AbdulJabbar to 5 points in the second bait, the Chicago Bulls scored a 99 92 triumph over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight and moved with in three games of the Midwest Division leaders.

title: 2 Promoted at Newsday
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Dec. 30 Martin Schram has been named as Newsday's new Washington bureau chief, re placing Russell Sackett, who will become the newspaper's national correspondent. Mr. Schram, who is 30 years old, has been a Newsday Washing ton correspondent since June. 1967.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: BARCO BUSINESS EQUIPMENT STORES WISH YOU A VERY HAPPY HOLIDAY SEASON AND A HAPPY NEW YEAR. Advt.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. NIXON HEADS MOSTADMIRED LIST
description: The Gallup Poll reported in Princeton, N. J., yesterday that Mrs. Richard M. Nixon headed a list of women most admired by the American people, mark ing the first time she had won top honors since President Nix on took office in 1969.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Color It Nature
description: Another year.

title: Pet Cemetery BoomA Token of Owners Devotion
description: When Misha died in 1968 at the age of 14, Mrs. Marie Mondry of Northfield, Ill., spent about $900 on his fu neral, including coffin, vault, a bronzeinscribed granite memorial and an evergreen tree.

title: Officer Weds Miss Owen
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 30 Miss Elizabeth Gibson Dobie Owen, daughter of Mrs. John Jerauld Owen of North Haven and of the late Richard Magruder Dobie, a freelance writer of Norfolk, Va., was married here this afternoon to Lieut. Edward Spence Rogerson, U.S.N.R., son of Mr. and Mrs. John Edward Rogerson of Milton, Mass.

title: LOUIS WAYLANDSMITH
description: Louis WaylandSmith, who retired in 1955 as chairman of the board of Oneida, Ltd., sil versmiths, died last Sunday at the Mansion House in Kenwood, N. Y., where he had been a longtime resident. He was 91 years old.

title: Pop
description: IT Is, in a sense, unfortu nate that one who has spent a lifetime ob serving the fine points or social neatness and pre cision, as Sir Noel Coward has, should have an autum nal splurge of attention visitea on hint at a less than choice moment. Sir Noel has just turned 73 which is not a neatly rounded lifeterm when a man's career can be properly celebrated, such as 70 or 75 or the 90 that Eubie Mike will reach in February. Tigre is something awkward and out of joint about a cele bration at 73. But, willynilly, that is when it has happened to Sir Noel and he will, one trusts, accept it in good grace.

title: The Nation
description: For many years, politicians and po licemen repeatedly have assured the public that police corruption simply was a problem of the occasional rot ten apple in the barrel. But the final report of the Knapp Commission, re leased last week, suggests that this aged clich, worn smooth with con stant usage, will have to be discarded: It's the barrel that's rotten.

title: $25,000 Tourney to Draw Top Women Tennis Players
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 30 (UPI)Most of the big names in women's tennis are expected to participate in the first an nual Commerce Union tourney scheduled for Centennial Park Tennis Center Aug. 612.

title: Hospital Near Completion
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I.  The Nassau County Medical Center's new 19story Dy namic Care building, which will contain 771 beds as a replacement for Meadow brook Hospital, is nearing completion and is expected to open in late spring or early summer.

title: Lora Engelmann Is Bride
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 30 Miss Lora Lee Englemann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William G. Engelmann of Belle Mead, was married here this afternoon to Gordon Clif ton Strauss, son of Dr. Clifton J. Strauss, a pediatrician, and Mrs. Strauss of Summit. The Protestant ceremony was per formed in the Princeton Uni versity Chapel by the Rev. Robert Gustafson.

title: L. I. Klein to Wed Miss Ellen Grant
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Dec. 30 Mr. and Mrs. Marvin L. Grant have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Ellen Marjorie Grant, to Lawrence I. Klein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morton Klein of Margate, N.J. The wedding is planned for April 28.

title: Nurses' Lib Is Getting A Foothold On Island
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I.  Is there such a thing as nurses' lib? Most people think it's a huge laugh, said Dr. June Rothberg, laughing a bit her self, but there most assured ly is.

title: Coins
description: THE Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind can not live in his cradle forever. These words of Konstantin E. Tsiolkovsky, Russian space pioneer, early in the nineteen hundreds best describe what motivates men of science to explore the unknown  the jungles, the seas and now  other planets.

title: THOMAS C. CARTER
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Dec. 30 Thomas C. Carter, who re tired in 1961 as a vice president of the General Bronze Corpora tion, Garden City, L.I., died to day in Lawrence Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 811 Palmer Road.

title: Duke Defeats Harvard
description: DURHAM, N. C. Dec. 30 (AP) Kevin Billerman, a sopho more, paced Duke to a 10276 victory over Harvard tonight, snapping a twogame losing streak for the Blue Devils. Both teams now have 54 records.

title: Hanoi Said to Have Left Its Units In South Unguided for 2 Months
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 30  American intelli gence officials say that Hanoi has not transmitted its regu lar policy directions to Commu nist forces in South Vietnam for almost two months, appar ently because of the confusion over the Paris peace talks.

title: Report From Sanaa Tells Of New Yemini Cabinet
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 30 (Reuters)A new Cabinet was formed in the Yemen Arab Re public today under Abdullah alHagri, a member of the pres idential council.

title: Gardens
description: RARE is the gardener who will not react with pardonable pride to a compliment on the neat appearance of his plants and the beauty of his flowers. For every gardener knows that perfection is not just happenstance but the result of loving tending and lots of good hard work. Heavy spading, constant watering, frequent spraying, continuous transplanting, inevitable fer tilizing, raking, weeding and trimming are perpetual chores.

title: Lunar Load Signs won't Always Be in English
description: UP to now, the men on the moon have all been Americans, who have spoken about global brotherhood and planted the United States flag. But what if the fashion changed? Peter Ustinov, the man of many parts, pulled himselves to gether and reflected on this possibility.

title: Bridge
description: Imagine a bridge game in which the lighting, heating and ventilation are uniformly good; in which everyone is neatly dressed; in which the standard of play is uniformly high; and in which no player ever curses his partner, oppo nents, or his own bad luck.

title: CONNECTICUT GETS SCHOOLFUND PLAN
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 30  Wealthy towns in Connecticut will be required to help pay poorer towns' school costs under sweeping changes the Gover nor's Commission on Tax Re form is proposing in the way property is assessed and taxed and in the way the revenue is spent.

title: Henry S. Burden Fiance Of Elizabeth B. Weekes
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Dec. 30Mr. and Mrs. Townsend Underhill Weekes have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Blanchard Weekes, to Henry Sheedy Burden, son of I. Townsend Burden Jr. of Locust Valley and the late Mrs. Burden. A May wedding is planned.

title: Music
description: On April 19, Leopold Stokowski celebrated his 90th birthday. An interviewer asked him a ques tion: Maestro, is it music that keeps your batteries charged? Answer: I don't have batteries. I have other things. Stokowski then delivered him self of some gnomic utterances: Ani mals have birthdays. Trees have birth days. So human beings have them also, like trees.

title: Letter to the Editor 10  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: MANAGUA PARTIES RESUME POLITICS
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 30Life began to return to normal in this earthquake stricken capital today as the Conservatives and Liberals re slimed party disputes that have characterized political life in this country for more than a century.

title: Stamps
description: COLLECTORS of United States stamps were given a prolific and costly Christmas pres ent last week. Postmaster General E. T. Klassen, re peating some previously stated 1973 plans, indicated that the United States Postal Service, seemingly, is seeking to overcome its deficit by reaching into the purses of stamp collectors with $1 coil stamps, and 80cent strips of stamps. Shades of the Trucial States!

title: Africa Group Sets Meeting
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 30 (Agence FrancePresse) The next ministerial meeting of the Organization of African Unity is to take place in Addis Ababa from Feb. 5 to 10, it has been announced here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Without fanfare, the Bruckner bottleneck in the Bronx will become the completed Bruckner Interchange Tuesday at 10 A.M., when three southbound lanes of the Bruckner Expressway, each a halfmile long, will be opened to traffic. The $68million project, built with 90 per cent Federal funds and 10 per cent state funds, will link the New England Thruway with the Bruckner Expressway and the Triborough Bridge.

title: The World
description: Mrs. Nicole Mercier is a liberal, 28 yearold French high school teacher of philosophy. She is among a large number of younger teachers who be lieve that French education is too rigid and who have been seeking ways of involving students snore actively. She sees nothing wrong with teaching sex education in schools.

title: Battle, Tennessee Pilot, Is Given Extended Pact
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Dr. Edward J. Boling, the University of Tennessee pres ident, announced today the extension of football Coach Bill Battle's contract for five years through 1977.

title: Miss Bernadette Kelly Wed To Bernard Francis Denoyer
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Dec. 30  Miss Bernadette Mau reen Kelly and Bernard Francis Denoyer were mar ried here this evening. The Rev. James Halligan per formed the ceremony in St. Augustine's Roman Catholic Church. The nuptial mass was concelebrated by the bride's cousin, the Rev. Paul Maher, and the Rev. Oliver Nickerson.

title: New & Novel
description: The Betty Tree is what some male chauvinist pig might call a woman's novel. My consciousness has thankfully been raised to too high an alti tude for such classifications; so let's just say this is a rather melancholy family history in which everyone has a perfectly lousy time. The flower of the Betty Tree is Hartley Lansing, voted Most Beautiful senior in the class of 1942 at Mascou tin (Iowa) High. (If you don't know what a Betty Tree is, you can find out from Mrs. Ryan.) But Hartley is not content with smalltown popularity, small town beaux and smalltown aristocracy. (Dad is the local M. D.) She allows herself to be seduced by a viper in Navy clothing who is shipped into her orbit as a flying instructor for the nearby primarytraining school, And thereby she re leases from the Lansing cup board all of the family skele tons who have been noisily rat tling around since the novel's beginning. In the arboretum of chronicles of small town sin, The Betty Tree is just a sapling.

title: Casting a Shadow
description: THE last day of the year is tradition ally an occasion for celebration and merriment, and no doubt there is much to be grateful for in the art events of 1972. Artists still pursue their difficult calling with an undiminished persistence and courage, even though the odds against all but a very small number ever winning a reasonable recognition of their labors remain as high as ever. The galleries, despite inflation, depression, and the fickle gyrations of taste, still offer us an endless round of exhibitions, and an astonishing number of these are still worth one's time and attention. (If the professional critic is inclined at times to take these exhibitions for granted, he has only to think of what his colleagues in other fields the theater, say, or movies are obliged to spend much of their time looking at; the art critic can at least be grateful that he is still functioning in an area where serious standards have not been completely atrophied.)

title: Cutting Opera Down to SizeFor Television
description: PETER HERMAN ADLER, age 73, made his Met ropolitan Opera debut in September conduct ing a supercharged rendition of Verdi's A Masked Ball. His stick  waving received raves from the critics and at least as many bravos from the audience as were showered on Martina Arroyo, Placido Domingo and Sher rill Milnes. It was touching to see a man of Adler's years having such a successful, if belated, debut. It was also surprising that the Met should have called upon him solely in the capacity of maestro when he has made his mark primarily as a mu sic and artistic director of opera for television. Adler's pioneering efforts  through the NBC Opera and current ly the NET Opera Theater have been responsible for what little opera there has been on the tube.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: The police continued their search yesterday for two young inmates who escaped Friday from the Adolescent Remand Shelter on Rikers Island.

title: Horse Show News
description: The Ox Ridge Hunt Club in Darien, Conn., has changed its winter indoor show form at and will conduct two one day events and one twoday show this season.

title: New & Novel
description: Historical mysteries turn up every once in a while. Indeed, in recent years Peter Lovesey has been having somc success with his detective stories that take place in Victorian London. Now comes what may be the start of a new series. J. G. Jeffreys's THE THIEFTAKER (Walker, $4.95) is placed in the England of 1798, and the hero of the book is a Bow Street Runner. In those days. Bow Street Runners were sent out to solve crimes or appre hend criminals. Hence the title of the bcok, The Thieftaker.

title: St. John's Captures Final in Basketball
description: St. John's won the Holiday Festival basketball tourna ment at Madison Square Gar den yesterday by upsetting South Carolina, 8679.

title: News of Boating
description: The New York Yacht Club reelected officers, released its race report of last sum mer's cruise and announced a 1973 cruise itinerary that includes ports of Maine dur ing a flurry of business ac tivity recently.

title: SOVIET TOPS CANADA IN WORLD CUP, 123
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 30 (AP)The Soviet Union de feated Canada, 123, tonight for its second straight victory in the second annual World Cup hockey tournament.

title: Mrs. Gillen Reweds
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. 3., Dec. 30  The marriage of Mrs. Ellen Williams Tavis Gillen of Bloomfield and Stamford, Conn., to Ross E. Rowland, an assistant vice president of the real estate firm of Louis Schlesinger Company in Clif ton, took place here today in the Congregational Church. The Rev. Dr. Joseph H. Stein performed the ceremony. The bride's two previous mar riages ended in divorce. She is a former concert pianist. The bridegroom's first mar riage also ended in divorce.

title: COURNOYER GIVES CANADIENS 11 TIE
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 30 (UPI) Yvan Cournoyer and Reynald Comeail scored firstperiod goals tonight as the Montreal Cana diens and Atlanta Flames bat tied to a 11 tie.

title: Television
description: IN TRYING to pinpoint the best and the worst of the year for television, the individual, any individual, is at an awesome disadvan tage. The enormous amount of material devoured on the screen in the course of 52 weeks dictates selectivity. No one is able to see it all. Only a raving masochist would want to see it all.

title: Bartholomew and Coneys Capture Lead in Regatta
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Dec. 30Randy Bartholomew of the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club and Matt Coneys of the Port Washington Yacht Club, the cohost clubs, advanced in defense of their class titles to day at the start of the 42d annual frostbite regatta on Manhasset Bay.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTONWith al most no public notice, and unavoidably so, a debate of great importance is taking place within the Nixon Ad ministration.

title: Law
description: There on the movie screen, in vivid color, before a darkened roomful of middlingaged men: halfclad bodies, naked bodies, fellatio, cunnilingus. Minutes on end and closeup; deep breathing over the loudspeakers; sex without love. In short, a classic case of obscenity.

title: The Nation
description: Some were chorusing, I told you so. Some were shocked. Still others were playing ostrichwithheadin sand. Albany taxpayers were reacting last week to a charge by the State Commission of Investigation that the city's Democratic political machine was exerting paralyzing control over virtually every aspect of their lives.

title: Montclair Area Churches Ring in the New Year Together
description: MONTCLAIRIn place of the customary individual Sunday worship, seven churches representing five denominations will usher out the old year and ring in the new by holding their first community service.

title: Peter Busch Orthwein Marries Susan M. Haas, 1968 Debutante
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 30 In Christ and Holy Trinity Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Susan Mars ton Haas, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George C. Haas Jr. of Weston, became the bride of Peter Busch Orthwein, son of Mrs. David Metcalfe and Adolphus B. Orthwein, both of St. Louis. The Rev. George R. Laediein and the Rev. Dana Kennedy officiated.

title: the traveler's world
description: THE heartthrobbing saga of the air lines continues to leap from the peak of one fare crisis to the depths of another soapopera dis aster, and those, masochists among us who persist in following these devious doings are right back where we were six weeks ago, six months ago, a full year ago.

title: City Council Meeting Scheduled Wednesday
description: The City Council will meet only on Wednesday this week.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: THERE will be a tinge of sadness in the toasts raised by many businessmen, economists and investors as they celebrate the approach of 1973 tonight. They have enjoyed a remarkably good year, but they are sorry to see it end and they have great fore bodings over what may be in store in the months ahead.

title: NECKSCRER REJECTS TEST HOLES IN PARK
description: A request to drill three new 18inch holes in Central Park in connection with the con struction of the new subway lines at the southern end of the park has been rejected by Parks Commissioner August Heckscher.

title: South Korean Law Sets Up A New 219Man Assembly
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 30 (AP)  President Park Chung Hee today promulgated, a new parliamentary election law that calls for a unicameral 219mem ber National Assembly, with 73 members appointed by the President and 146 elected.

title: Providence Six Wins, 85
description: TROY, N. Y., Dec. 30 (AP) Providence College scored three times in the first period and five more in the second in beat ing Carleton College of Ottawas 85, tonight in the consolation game of the R.P.I. hockey tour nament.

title: A HOTEL MID, 33, FOUND MURDERED
description: A Thai woman working as al maid in a midtown hotel that has many single and welfare tenants was found dead yester day afternoon in the room of a tenant who is being sought for questioning by the police.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: Quadruplets were born yesterday at New York Hos pital, but, at the parents' re quest, the hospital declined to release any further infor mation.

title: ANTIGONE TAKES HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: NORTH SALEM, N. Y., Dec. 30Frank Chapot of the United States Equestrian Team piloted Four Seasons Farms' Antigone to the limit jumper champion ship and Jim Arnott rode Prim rose Farms' Platitude to the regular working hunter title to day at the conclusion of the, twoday The Hill Horse Show.

title: Movies
description: SHE Is one of those incredible slimbutbos omy women, with long light brown hair, WASPy blue eyes and a lady like way of speaking that makes the occasional four letter words that tumble from her lips sound strictly Main Line. Some movie critics have said she reminds them of a wellbred socialite, a youthful Laraine Day. But because of her somewhat radical past political activities, her hus band of three months, George C. Scott, calls her his collec tivist, and she, in turn, calls him Old R. and I. (for Rigid and Inflexible).

title: SAMUEL KOENIG, SOCIOLOGIST, DIES
